qewA4-9V-hoGVdIQv_BI-g.text: WOW!!!!  Arizona already has the best Mexican food around, but this place is truly a gem.  All the sauces are homemade and present a wide spectrum of flavors.  My favorite unique items from the salsa bar were the peanut salsa (spicy, most likely has habaneros in it), pecan salsa (similar but very mild with interesting flavor), strawberry salsa, and jicama salsa.  Everything was incredibly fresh.  After sampling everything from our group, I would recommend getting one of their mole dishes (the mole is stellar) or the mahi mahi fish tacos.  Also, their house made guacamole was amazing; very unique and chunky with lots of different veggies in it.  I will be back again and again.

4LoAyEPZ7dumUlyfV49aNQ.text: Walk in and the waiter insisted on the wait being over 45 min and that we had to wait outside. Then we where seated but the same waiter gave us attitude and very poor customer service waited over 15 minutes for a server to come up to us to ask for our order but we weren't ready and the serve never came back after waiting serval minutes ( 20 minutes) paid for our drink and left very disappointed at the service we where looking forward to trying it for the first time it was very upsetting the way we where treated so poorly.

1_-JztiSLlEkvV4J1rNQsQ.text: Slow service, but we'll worth the wait! El pastor street tacos are AMAZING!! Salsa bar is also very good with some really unique salsas. Rice and beans are nothing to brag about.

xQt88twQRaFalbQAOZ8Wcg.text: Great food. Had the Gaucho Taco which was good. However the breakfast I had with Spanish sausage was really really good. The Chipotle salsa was one of the best salsas I ever had. Highly recommend it.

dD3Ewu4OFq1fy3EUeIlNfQ.text: I absolutely love this restaurant! The food is delicious!  I've tried several of their different gourmet tacos,  and they do not disappoint!! If you're looking for variety,  great prices,  and good food, don't miss this place!

hUtbXVgedLUViBswstXQ6Q.text: First i wanted a quesadilla and they didnt have any cheese and then the waitress skiped our table and gave food to 2 other tables that got there after us.. never going back..

B2Pxk4MRlQfQtBT79lfc_Q.text: Chips were stale. Service was slow and in frequent. I got the 3 street taco entree. Cochinita Pibil, Al Pastor and Carne Asada were 3 out of 5. Beans weren't hot.

Q5lsxXB5KDn0msqf8yUhnw.text: Saw this restaurant on Dinners, Drive-ins and Dives tv show...went down the next day and had lunch with my son and future daughter in law...OMG! This is what I have been waiting for since we move to Arizona 11 years ago...Let me describe the food...no wait...I can't except to say that layers of complex and subtle flavors is unique in every dish. I had tacos...These are the real deal tacos and they do not skimp on the meat! My son is a fine dining head chef and has taught me how to taste and eat really good food. This place is all of that and more...We ordered the Al Pastor Quesa to share...my sone that is without doubt the finest and most complete Quesa he has ever had in his mouth...It was to die for.  I had the El Gaucho Taco...trust me...order this! it was huge and complex...I was tasting new flavors every bite...I also got the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco...pulled pork with a hint of some spice that drove us all crazy tying to identify it...I will be back for both for sure. I waited a long time to find this place...you simply must try it...you will never go back to your heavy, greasy stand-by. I wish they had 10 starts to award. this place rocks in a way your mouth will now best!

d4YU64KzydmgUbZ4KvJF7A.text: I discovered this place on a whim when we were driving around central Phoenix a few weeks ago. It had a cool Dia de los Muertos skull on the sign and I thought someone had told me about it so we stopped in for a weekend lunch.   Our server was super nice and explained about their awesome salsa bar as everyone else here has commented on. I loved the chipotle tomatillo salsa, while my husband preferred the pico de gallo and my daughter (who is 2) could not get enough of the creamy cilantro one. I had the Condesa special tacos which were awesome, especially when topped with some of that chipotle tomatillo salsa.   What was really outstanding though was the horchata. So outstanding that after finishing mine in the restaurant, I ordered another one to go. It's not like any horchata that I've ever had before as it was kind of light brown in color and had lots of chopped up fruit and nuts in it. I would go back just for the horchata!

8jfNhrs8DZmWPXhdWL0YFw.text: OH....MY....JESUS. Ya'll mind if I praise God real quick?! This food is amazing!!!! Literally in shock of how amazing everything tastes! The best Mexican food I've ever had!!!

joECENQzI8XNGSd5Ebcvww.text: Damn this place is GOOD. A family friend discovered it right after it opened, and I am always down to go there.  Parking is a SOB, look for street parking because the lot in front of the place is always packed.   Lunch time is out of control packed and the dining area is TINY so come at odd times for your best bet and shortest wait. Love the decor tho. Old school, giant wooden tables/chairs, giant local art.   20 salsas to choose from, ranging from pica de gallo to pistachio, you'll always find new ones to try. Tacos are quite good. Maybe a little pricey, but it's worth it. I always try something different because it's guaranteed to be tasty.

Vn5OvyqqnUKl1lCDh-3PwQ.text: Love this place. It is always crowded but we go early to avoid the wait. Street tacos with fresh ingredients and so many options!!! Everything is yummy here. I also love the salsa bar and like to have several different salsa to go with the complimentary chips.

AorIuOzfzpjJZ1e9WRPhPw.text: It was okay, I'm not sure if it was the style, but the beef was chewy and the shrimp seemed overcooked as well. Horchata is definitely recommended!

A2wZXTk5sxgrjnBAxvC4wQ.text: La Condesa not only has two of my favorite tacos The Baja Sur Shark Taco, and The Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Taco but the hole in the wall feeling you can't get a chain place.   The seating is community style with large tables and smaller ones. It's a little tight space wise but it works for the style of the restaurant. Prices are reasonable, food quality is great, and they have one of the best if not the best salsa bars I've ever experienced. There's also a full bar for those that drink.  This place is awesome and I love that I can support local business while getting my grub on!

GnCQ2nc6761XvTxj7YO7Cw.text: Thee best tacos and salsa bar in Phoenix, hands down. Service, not so much. I went about an hour before they closed one night, completely full house cleard out about 30 min before closing. With 30 min till closing they started cleaning up, turned off music and brought us the check. Kinda irritating to feel kicked out after I spent money at your establishment....but ill just have to go earlier I guess.

uuARb1vhMg5QdJVwObO_5A.text: Oh my the namesake taco was fantastic!   Salsa bar was good but the tacos and the burro's are no joke either!  Worth the wait!

GhwL_EWqPUCk6fhfJKz27Q.text: Phoenix has so many great destinations for Mexican food, but I have to say, La Santisima is amazing and authentic.  The salsa bar is stunning with as many as 12 varieties from which to choose.  The promptness of service at the lunch hour could be improved, but it is a small spot with limited seating.  About to go there for the third time...I think I'm hooked.

tV2RHPRtsWffsU4K65_oEg.text: Best tacos in Phoenix, hands-down.  They have a great salsa bar, and delicious mole.  A great place to bring visitors from out of town.

HAbOkdzTOAAFRDPd-zjTFQ.text: The Cabo shrimp tacos were amazing.  The shrimp is fried in beer batter.  It was crisp and delicious.  They have a Salsa bar of over 15 different homemade salsas to choose from. The pico de gallo was my favorite. Everything was fresh and well prepared.  There isn't a lot of room inside, so call ahead if you have a big group.

YUJE0FNlwOQwoR34BP5vsg.text: Heaven,  the way Mexican food should be! Dogfish tacos are the bomb! Salsa and guacamole are great too.  If you want True tacos this place is a must.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Heavenly

NU3zhiAbi6eWFRYo4VKtCA.text: If you don't get the horchata then you are making the biggest mistake of your life....   There are something's in life where you overlook the bad because the good outweighs it. Not gonna lie, the location and atmosphere is maybe a 3/5. But Dan says good tacos are always in the most ghetto areas so we had high hopes. The place was full when we arrived and filled with an assortment of people. It was promising.   This place did not disappoint. I had the sorano arrachero taco plate (or whatever... Something like that) and Dan got the carne asada street tacos. Right when I bit into it I knew..... This was going to be a good meal. Dan is a taco snob and gave the street tacos 10 stars. Very rare.   My tacos made me forget that our table was wobbly and that it was hard to find this place at night.  Just go and eat the tacos.... Just do it.   Food 5/5  Atmosphere 4/5  Overall 5/5

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Get this... Now.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Extra rice no beans... Because I&#39;m asian.

gagT8OZUyZsyx69nRYxz2w.text: This is a cool little place! I thought the day of the dead type decor was cool. I also appreciate their salsa bar! It's a serve yourself and had lots of choices. Free chips were served per usual, and the bar pared with these. The menu is HUGE, lots and lots of choices. It's a little confusing but the server was helpful and could answer all our questions. I ordered a burrito enchilada style. It was good, just too much rice for me. The overall attentiveness of the server held this place back, we were not greeted or served in an acceptable amount of time, and we did not get a single refill. We were a group of about 8, glad there was not automatic large gratuity.

RmGx9EGFYHMSGSSfPIDlHg.text: La santisima a popular restaurant for a lot of folks for me mediocre unflavored food I can't imagine how people fool by the salsa bar it's not even real salsa I just going to mention the avocado salsa green coloring milk with some hot flavor come on santisima you can do better spend a few dollars into it and you'll have a better results on salsas also buy gloves for your cooking guy it is nasty to see how they handle the food with bare hands and touching other parts of their body please buy gloves to them and last very expensive for that nasty food that you offer never never come back

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4wJ5SeETXNhjND2vXYEuWg.text: This place was difficult to find because it was night time and I believe their sign is suited more for the daylight. It is a small restaurant with some very authentic details, which were really cool. The door is the old Mexico style (very popular in New Mexico) and the bar is really beautiful carved wood. They restroom in the back have awesome art on them, and the door for the mens bathroom is labeled "Santos" with a painting of El Santo on it. (Old time famous Mexican wrestler my father looked up to and actually my Grandfather had the pleasure of wrestling many years ago.) This was very cool for us.   The food is really REALLY good! I loved my tacos! I tried the Chicken Mole, and mine was some sort of slow roasted pork with a hint of sweet. (I can't remember the name, but it was toward the bottom of the menu.)   The people were nice, but we waited a very long time for our food. My biggest turn off was that it felt a little TOO authentic when our food came to us on real traditional Mexican pottery style plates. They seemed to be very old terra-cotta with the paint chipping off the rim of mine. I couldn't help but feel that they might not be lead free. Don't get me wrong, I still enjoyed my food 100% but I think it would be a little better if they upgraded to some ceramic.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Santos bathroom. SUPER COOL! This man (my dad) loved El Santo as a kid!!

N4yj690wMDmhcZ1lG8Q7VQ.text: I've technically been to La Santisima twice, but have only eaten here once. I'm so disappointed because I live nearby and wanted this to become one of my regular spots.  Tonight the restaurant had a disappointing mix-up with me. I ordered pick-up from them using yelp. I waited 15 minutes then drove the 3 minutes it takes to get there from my house. The place was packed, and there were people waiting outside as well (on a Monday night at 8pm). I tried to get someone--anyone's--attention, to no avail. The staff do not seem friendly and will ignore you and try not to make eye contact with you, even when they are just standing there. I decided to ditch the crowd and wait in my car, refreshing my order status on the yelp app; even after 25 minutes they still hadn't confirmed my order. Soon I got a call from yelp concerned that they hadn't confirmed my order.   I finally mustered the courage to go back in and push through the waiting area to speak with a staff member. They gave me a dirty look but I had to ask why they hadn't confirmed my order after such a long time. They quite nonchalantly explained to me that their yelp interface doesn't work. I told them I had prepaid and they said they couldn't do anything for me refund-wise; they didn't even think to ask if I wanted to re-order the meal I had pre-ordered via yelp. They were happy to take my money but not find out how to give me the food I had paid for. All the while, the staff member was more intent on doing something with the cashier computer than giving good customer service and talking to me.   Previously, I have ordered the gandhi tacos. They were really rather pricey for some pretty basic ingredients and flavors.   I hear this place has a great reputation; I am very frustrated by the terrible service offered. Also, if you know the yelp interface is broken, why not contact yelp to make sure no one pays for something that they inevitably will not receive? Thankfully, yelp is issuing me a refund (unfortunately I have to wait a couple days for processing). La Santisima did not own up to its mistake and made no apologies. Very unprofessional and very frustrating.

RWg_1vPuFdvkRXrUsyLqBw.text: Delicious vegan tacos. Lots of vegan/vegetarian options. The salsa bar has lots of variety. The staff are friendly and the place looks really cool. The plates are earthenware and look cool too

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan tacos!

KV-HpG9fSpFXfsBhWxzRCQ.text: Was looking for vegetarian options and was pleasantly surprised with what I got!    Salsa bar had a lot of choices, the tomatillos green salsa was so good.   Only thing that would change this score to a 5 star is if the waitress paid a little more attention, she constantly mixed up mine and my friends orders. And if they had nicer menus, the ones provided were falling apart.

AsrA-bGOBf7526j49bKEow.text: Really great Mexican food in Phoenix.  I highly recommend that you visit.  Everything I tried was fantastic.  We shared the Queso dip with Chorizo (which came with thin "tortillas", which felt very traditional).  The 1/2 order of guacamole we shared was extremely tasty.  They throw in some dried cranberries to liven up the flavor and texture profile.  Per other Yelp reviewers' recommendations, we shared the giant horchata; 1/3 of an order was the perfect amount for me, and their twist of it with fruit bits was a nice departure from the traditional horchata.    I ended up getting the gourmet Mayan Pibil taco and one of the food truck style tacos (but can't remember which protein).  They were both fantastic, and the perfect amount of food.  I really enjoyed the expansive salsa bar with over a dozen varieties of salsa.  It was fun to try most of them.  My girlfriend ordered the Quesa which was ginormous; with the chips and queso that we shared, she barely touched the quesa, it was so big, but it looked delicious.  I'd definitely come back to visit next time I'm in Phoenix.  I'm confident they won't disappoint!

kZFmSxNU_HTBPFHo2mip8w.text: Delicious street tacos. Chicken asado was very tasty. The salsa bar was fun to try the different kinds.  Servers/ staff was polite and helpful.

8UhHJsP6fUFOLrFuhEZ4mA.text: Came as a recommendation by a friend that visited here when he was in Phoenix. I also had to come because there was HAPPY HOUR and UNLIMITED SALSA.  TINGA STREET TACO ($1.25) - wasn't too spicy - very well marinated - I originally only ordered 1 but couldn't resist and ordered another one soon after I finished the first one!  CARNE ASADA STREET TACO ($1.25) - meat was relatively tender - good but definitely preferred the Tinga Street Taco more  MARGARITA ($3) - not too strong that it tasted like alcohol but there was definitely alcohol in there. - good drink to help celebrate the beginning of the weekend.   HORCHATA ($3.99) - VERY GOOD - different from any horchata I had before; it had dices of cantaloupe, honeydew, and strawberry - super large thirst quencher  UNLIMITED SALSA BAR - any salsa from strawberry, cilantro, pecan, or pico de gallo - I almost tried everything because well I've never been to a place with so much variety - it also helped that I had unlimited chips so I just kept trying  SERVICE: nothing too special. Staff members were friendly and refilled my water appropriately.  ENVIRONMENT: a bit hidden in a not so great part of Phoenix. There is the large signage that you know it's not the wrong place. The place doesn't get too busy which was good.  Overall, great place for tacos. I can't compare it to other places in Phoenix but I did enjoy my visit. They are a bit different than the tacos I have in LA Taco Trucks mainly because I get different kinds. The price is reasonable and well UNLIMITED SALSA BAR! Also try the horchata...it's so refreshing!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour menu. Monday to Friday 3-6pm

r6EPTyy9w4gw3nH7ezEHhw.text: Uusual selection of tacos, excellent condiment bar - at least ten different salsas - and some funky modern Mexican art. Worth the occasional wait.

mF_mcPSfh-oGhNhWCYbELg.text: Wow! I am truly amazed by this place and it is now one of my favorite places. It is small so not recommended for big groups but the food is OUTSTANDING. I had the Pacific white fish tacos with rice and beans Amazing  My boyfriend and son had the carne Asada style burrito and a rice and beans burrito both said thy were amazing. The guacamole was delish and the horchata was really good. My boyfriend even said it tasted like Christmas lol  This place is really good and I was very impressed service was good can't wait to come back again

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QiTqh7lBKhXIeUsXBCKNNg.text: They seemed to fix the sewage smell but the salsa is still better at the Glendale location.

cnRx7PWdg16UnAgg0tlYeA.text: First time coming here! It sounds like they expanded a few months ago to accommodate for the traffic they were getting. There was constant people coming in and out even with the odd time we were there. Even though they were busy the service was fast and friendly.  They had tons of different Taco options. They had a good variety of vegan, vegetarian, seafood and a salsa bar to woo any salsa lover. I got the 3 street Taco plater the flavor was good only complaint was that some of the meat was dried out which I had to pick out. My husband got some seafood Tacos that he picked here and there. Overall it was a fun experience but I think there are better restaurants to try.  Environment B Service B Food C  Location D

KpRMPxiqyJ-ZEcMHoeBv2w.text: I had to update my review because they have updated their food and service, and they are now back on my list of favorite Mexican restaurants. If you're willing to venture to the vegetarian side the cauliflower tacos are outstanding! Plus the horchata and salsa bar are just as good as Day 1.

wNVG692jZ4TGdjvzPCM_ZA.text: Hello this was rated Top Mexican by Guy F. Need I say more. It's got a feeling not vibe with a traditional Mexican menus. If you like the day of the dead - the s place is all about that and what drew my husband and I to this place. The strawberry Mango Salsa is so addictive! They have about 10 different salsas to choose from - you can't go wrong.  Tacos are awesome - burritos are big enough for 2 hungry people!

M0a4SoCJDEBSiFhMOfKgQQ.text: Nice place decor. Presentation is nice and ordering process is different.   You grab a menu take a set if you need a moment like I did as a first timer and when your ready you order at the counter and pay which is good to get it done and not have to wait for your bill when your finished eating.   The girl next to me had a quesadilla and looked good so I decided to try it. It's called la quencha and food presentation was nice topped with cotija cheese, red onions and avocado and green sauce but I did not expect the tortilla to be as thick as it was. It reminded me of a quesadilla chimichanga. I was full fast and the flavor was ok. I think for me next time I will try one of the specialty tacos.   They have a nice salsa bar with a variety selection .   Overall it was a nice experience and a nice first try

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La quench

Jdez6XuAhoWXDLzzXGuLHg.text: Incredible food. The kind of place you go to on repeat while visiting Phoenix. They have an incredible salsa bar! I ordered the Oaxacan Black Mole Quesa- it was unreal. The outside was perfectly crisp and the chicken, slow marinated in mole sauce, was life changing. Their margaritas are massive so you really only need 1. I got the spicy marg!! DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!

7TOjXGpiTwPCF5P2txGDpA.text: First off this is a Oaxaca style type of "Mexican" food. Get similar with the style.   My friend and I do taco Tuesday every week and we have seen great reviews about La Santisima. So glad we decided to give this place a shot.   We started with agua de Horchata. It was so sweet (good sweet) & different from a typical Horchata; which had strawberries and almonds mixed in. Our appetizer was Queso Fundido with chorizo. The queso is a Oaxaxa cheese, which is very thick and comes on a very hot plate with flour tortillas. We really enjoyed the cheese. Yum!  The gourmet tacos section had a variety of tacos at 3.99 each (which is on the pricey side for me) and street tacos for 2.55 each. Because we like to live on the edge we decided to go gourmet this evening. The best deal is just to get the plate for 8.95 which includes 2 tacos (same tacos) with rice and beans. I ordered the Wild Tiger Shrimp, which was breaded topped with cabbage and some type of lime sour cream on corn tortillas. It was really good once we topped out tacos with salsa. The salsa bar must of had about 12 different salsas. Guacamole was pretty spicy, more spicy than most of the salsas on the bar. The beans were amazing! Who would say that about beans, but yes I did.   Over all we loved this spot. Not sure if they have happy hour or a taco Tuesday special. The waitress did not mention any specials. I'll sure to be back.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild Tiger Shrimp Tacos, Baja Shark Tacos and Queso Fundido with Chorizo

rVbEcL4s0uyRfAHU47QyNg.text: You know you are the right place when the abuela's are waiting for a table and the drinks taste like the Mexican Rivera. Bonus points for vegan and veggie option that taste great!

5kffbeWDvqMdFDqIvG1hug.text: The praise here is warranted. This is the best Mecican food possibly in the world.   Service and ambience are awesome.  You can tell that the salsa bar is clearly insane. I actually wasn't a huge fan of any, but I combined the peanut with some other chipotle salsa and the tomatillo with another green salsa and made two amazing new salsas.  The food is indescribable. You can only understand if you eat it. I've had the carne, pibil, pastor, and mole tacos. The only one I didn't like was mole but it's an acquired taste and I think if you like mole you'll love it. The beans are also super flavorful and the rice is pretty good. It's closer to an Asian fried rice than the Mexican rice I've had, but I'm not complaining!   The horchata was also like nothing I've ever had. It had cantaloupe, pecans, And strawberries and somehow it still worked out?? You have to have it if you come here.  I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place except that I wish they delivered to where I live (NY) hahaha

HP3AItMXSExsuiSb9SMQYQ.text: First of all, salsa bar is HUGE. So many different types from pico de gallo to spicy chipotle to strawberry salsa. They have at least 10 different types.   The food was really great! I got the al pastor street tacos plate and the tacos were amazing. The beans were also surprisingly really great as well. The tacos had the perfect amount of sauce, salsa, and spiciness.   The service here is also really great. It's a small place so the service is very fast. We got seated right away and got chips and drinks out within a couple minutes. The location is a little weird, and it doesn't look like much from the outside but the inside is very well decorated and put together. All in all very nice place, and I would highly recommend to anyone in the Phoenix area! I wish they had one in Tucson as well. If they did I'd be there all the time!

oIlGyiZt8sIycewcpHo5Xw.text: I've also been to the Glendale location but this was our first experience with La Santisima. My wife and I just can't get over the food and salsa bar here! So many amazing flavors of salsas to choose from. My favorite salsas here were the Guacamole salsa (has some heat) and Mexicana salsa (salsa Mexicana, lots of lime flavor).  I had the Dogfish Shark taco based on reviews, as well as the filet mignon taco. I wasn't overly impressed with the shark taco, there weren't any flavors that distinguished it from just a regular fish taco. However the filet mignon taco was incredible. The beef was cooked medium and tender, and the dressing/fixings was an avocado salsa with cranberries. It was delicious. There was way too much food to fit onto the tortilla (a good problem to have) so the tip is to eat a lot of the filling, then try to roll it up as a taco. The one sad thing to note was that they ran out of grapefruit juice so the house margarita wasn't as good as I've had it previously. But you definitely need to get the house margarita, it's so good. Plus it's only $5 during happy hour!  Had to ask for a water refill since the server wasn't paying much attention to our water status. That's the only constructive feedback I have.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet mural painted on the men&#39;s bathroom door.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So many salsas to choose from! Also shown is the house margarita.

RMbhZeCIq3FQ3PyRT4GOOg.text: There's a reason this place was on the TV show Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. The al pastor fried quesadilla was amazing, and there is a salsa bar with many options which you can serve yourself. The quesadillas are not typical, see attached photo. There aren't that many seats, so you may experience a wait at busy times. It's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You may have to park around the corner
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dia de los Muertos decor
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful decor

mBJ3npn7XOD0BPxbVjiwnA.text: Really liked this place.  Came here due to the other Yelpers and it didn't disappoint.  Had their signature non alcoholic drink and it was delicious.  Couldn't believe the amount of salsa's.  Hard to pick my favorite but I truly enjoyed them all.  If you are in the area, definitely stop in.  Not a big place at all, and the area isn't the best, but worth the trip!  You can tell it is very well cared for and the food is made fresh and with a ton of love.

TwzmhHW6mNaj5d_MKgz6lA.text: Waited 20 mim, to get water and no service.  Its ok your not the only place that serves Mexican

Ctn-FIj0c1dcQZ7TOD9_nA.text: This definitely takes the cake for one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Phoenix. The diverse salsa bar and extensive menu allow for a lot of taste-testing, and the restaurant seems to be known for its many vegetarian options. I ordered the tacos al pastor, and they were some of the best I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-CZ0KMK7hju_Gawms7b8MQ.text: There are a number of Mexican food restaurants in the area, but this is probably the best one. Great fish tacos and plenty of salsa to choose from.

101vopBVsdoFAmpCjLY9Lw.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix, hands down!! An amazing variety of different salsas and they have a very unique horchata with fruits and nuts!! Come here, you won't regret it!! The only bad thing I can say about this place is limited seating, but it's worth the wait :)

cIXN9B7m7jO9Uq0tCmyEFA.text: Mole. That's all I have to say.  If you can eat anything containing the above listed ingredient at this restaurant, I highly recommend it. You will send your taste buds on a journey not unlike the opening credits of "The Great Space Coaster". Yes...I know...that dates me.  But seriously? This place is one of the best holes-in-the-wall in the downtown area. A wide array of menu items including burros, tacos, and house specialties will not disappoint. And then there's the salsa bar - which is regularly replenished - and is yours for the taking. No waiting around for someone to bring you more salsa. YOU are the salsa master. There are always at least 12-15 different and wonderful choices.   Their berry and nut topped Horchata is a delightful surprise that easily shareable. Though I'd rather have one all to myself. 'Cause I'm a greedy bastard.  I've never seen anyone seated at the bar, but with it's rich woodwork and veritable smorgasbord of tequilas, I'm half tempted to walk one day in with a 10-gallon cowboy hat, chaps, and plop down to have a couple shots of reposed...while turning my head slowly to give various people in the tiny but functional dining room the ol' stink eye. It's the only way I'll ever feel tough.  So my verdict? Go here. And eat. You won't be sorry. Todo bien.

rj72IlV8fNO19upNuNvzzQ.text: Probably the BEST tacos I have ever had.  Impressive selection of salsas. Lot's of character.  Awesome staff.

1eEUDQ_98hKsquwYD6daMQ.text: Gonna keep it short(ish) and simple today.  Arrived at 6PM on a Sunday, and to say that parking is extremely limited is an understatement.  The restaurant itself is small, which explains why there weren't too many parking spots.  It was a 45 minute wait for a table for two so we ordered takeout instead.  A little crammed and loud with people talking over one another, but it was actually pretty cozy.  The staff were really nice, pleasant, and efficient even with the crowd and gave us little lids for the salsa, along with our horchata, after we placed our order.  Fast forward through standing around awkwardly in what felt like everyone's way for 20 minutes in the restaurant, we had our burros in hand - an Al Pastor burro and La Santisima burro (chicken).  The burros are pretty sizable and scrumptious.  The salsa bar is probably what sets this place apart from the rest.  It's fun and most of them have a little kick to it, so have a glass of water nearby.  I loved their horchata, it's a little sweeter than other horchatas, has more cinnamon, and the fruits (strawberries) are a great touch.  Definitely will be back, probably for takeout.

18XLuA_BvGwqehbD353w9g.text: First off, amazing salsa bar. Flavored I've never even seen and not sure if authentic, but great nontheless. If it weren't for Yelp, I know I would have never walked in. Wasn't necessary in a great location, but I'm so glad I went in regardless.  This place is pretty small but people popping in and out in a Saturday afternoon. Definitely a good sign but again I kinda want to keep it as my own secret place.  Got a their Cabo Shark taco and it was absolutely amazing. Also tried a bite from one of their shrimp tacos. Again amazing. Definitely coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iSJaRXKmxHZal_mRlYdLSg.text: Worth any wait,  ours was minimal.  Horchata and salsa bar were great highlights!   Loved the decor and character of the place.  Dia del morte all about including cool mosaic tile art. We walked right up past the bar to look up menus and wait on a table.  No tables available.  I was directed to use the men's room.  Which was decorated yet cluttered with a music stand,  stool,  and supplies.  I couldn't open the slider lock easily and had feared they'd have to break the door down but I got lucky and got out.   By the time I got out,  only a few minutes,  my friend was seated.  Tunes were good,  Even when I couldn't understand the music I was grooving.   Menu was a bit overwhelming with so many choices.  Got the best horchata ever with strawberries, cantaloupe, and pecans.  It was mammoth.   Settled in on a fish taco and Mahi Mahi,  both grilled.  They were hot to handle,  and a bit over filled.  Nice because good value,  but the bottom tortillas were soggy.   Only got two bites of this delishness in,  because I filled up on chips and fun salsas from the salsa bar.  The horchata contributed too.   The peanut salsa was the hottest,  and the salsa de albor was my first experience with this fruity hot Mexican Chile.  The jicama was nice and refreshing and cooling but very hard to get on the chip as by its nature wasn't saucy.  However the cilantro was too soupy so I could only pour it on.  The pecan wasn't spicy like the peanut and was therefore nice against the heat as well.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish and Mahi Mahi grilled tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omg!  Best horchata ever!  With strawberries, cantaloupe, and pecans!

OKujSR99fKW6y9tEBLluuw.text: Literally,  the BEST burrito we have ever had! The La Santisima burrito with chicken was absolutely incredible. You come for the food, not the service. They are a little slow, but the food is great! Completely worth it !   The mushroom quesadilla was also great!   Small restaurant,  self serve salsa bar.   10 tables and a bar.   Highly recommended!

rXaqp5T7z_3UIh64r1EyvQ.text: Driving from Palm Desert to Albuquerque and wanted some awesome tacos. Came here after the great reviews on Yelp (Thanks, Yelpers!) and it was FANTASTIC.  My husband had the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco Plate. Tender and moist meat, he ate it with the Salsa Pecan from the Salsa Bar. The rice was OUTSTANDING. And the House Margarita was one of the best he ever had.  I had the El Gaucho Taco and a Carne Asada taco ala carte. Both ON POINT. And the horchata? ENORMOUS. The melon, berries and pecan at the bottom were such a treat at the end of a satisfying beverage.  I read some complaints about service. This place is small and every table was taken when we arrived. The two wait staff people were great. They were busy, the restaurant was full, and they were sharp. If you are in a hurry, don't come here. If you aren't and you are willing to stand at the bar with a drink and wait (which we did), it is ABSOLUTELY WORTH IT.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Asada taco and El Gaucho taco!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco Plate.

z22zpjeBCavvpesNAHvUcg.text: The food is amazing. I would give it 4-5 stars, however,  this restaurant is barely concerned with a positive customer experience.   A decision should be made if this is a full service restaurant or a cash and carry establishment. There is little to no regard for patrons entering the front door. Be prepared to be treated as an afterthought as they either do not have enough staff or are too busy playing multiple roles. It appears that take out orders are the priority.  The salsa bar is great. It also serves as a distraction from the fact the service is slow and food order/delivery is 30 minutes away. Make sure you order drinks, food,etc. all at once. My experience was "piece ordering" compounding the wait.   Overall, I will return for the food.. Take out only

4zlPxDp5iPe1xdBaEIE_2w.text: Now we're talking! There is a reason this place gets rave reviews and multiple "Best of" awards. This authentic Mexican food, no Tex-Mex here. Incredible offerings and a blending of flavors you'll be hard-pressed to find elsewhere.  We've been to both locations, but for whatever reason, prefer the 16th Street location over the Glendale location. Same food, same wonderful service - just personal preference.  Tacos: Al Pastor, Carne Asada, Oaxacan Black Mole, Chicken Asado. All excellent, super flavorful, seasonings not overpowering and well presented. The mole is probably the best I've ever tasted. Hint of cinnamon/spices, chocolate & chilies. Just the right blending of flavors to bring you back for more. Looking for something out of the box? Try the Arabe Burro. Al Pastor pork with hummus lettuce, cucumber and even some Tzatziki! Very refreshing. They also offer quite a number of vegetarian offerings.  La Santisima also boasts a homemade salsa bar unlike any you've seen. This really gives the customer the opportunity to try flavors and you just may find you've discovered a new favorite! The salsa made with peanuts is very good - really! And don't forget the adult beverage - the hand made house margarita is very good, too!  Restaurant is very unpretentious. Small in size. Glendale location has parking in the rear, street parking in Phoenix.  Neither location is close by our neighborhood, but worth the drive for great food.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 16th Street location
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al Pastor, Carne Asada and Chicken Asado tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Incredible salsa bar!

F-iHacn39serEqZ1G7Rmug.text: The sauces.  Wow.  Go here and have some tacos and chips and beer and salsa.   Enjoy.    Repeat.  The salsas.  Did I mention the salsa bar.  Not like anything else  And order the daring tacos.   Not the stuff you can get anywhere.  ----- Second review eating in  Fantastic.  And all those salsas.  Got the burrito this time and it's just as good.  You really can't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrito and salsas
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadilla
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The street tacos

CeLCAv8xCx8nJVO8ALulCA.text: Not my favorite. Service was ridiculously slow, couldn't get water (I think every cup in the restaurant was dry), it took over an hour to get a burrito and 3 tacos. The burrito was decent, the shrimp and Al pastor taco are good but not to the point where I would return. The fastest service we received was when we asked for our check.

2UPQquXfhbNpphnoxkmx7w.text: Talk about a salsa selection! Don't even get me started about their Horchata!  I take my friends from out of town to this place. Try it. You will not be disappointed!!

jKoHAH9mDJoqw3NESf9FWw.text: Driving down the rough streets of north phoenix, I have never really taken the time to look at the many restaurants that adorn the streets. I thought north phoenix was really only pawn shops, tire shops, and smoke shops, but my gf had heard of this place so we made a special journey out to La Condesa. After checking to make sure our doors were locked 4 times, we entered this "gourmet" taco shop...and boom all my misconceptions were erased.  This place is extremely clean and friendly. The tacos I ordered were overflowing with flavor and ingredients. I was thoroughly filled after two tacos.  I had the Shrimp tacos - not the cabo ones, i think they were simply grilled and guess what? that's right, no diarrhea afterwards. Also had the the sonoran carne asada tacos....which were arrachera steak marinated with fresh garlic & olive oil, charbroiled with mesquite charcoal. The tacos were amazing and the salsa bar was mind blowing. The yhave about 12 salsas to try from and I had to try them all. My personal favorites were the cilantro, chipotle and the surprisingly  yummy peanut salsa.  I REALLY wanted the horchata, but they had just run out..i won't ding them for running out because we did come in 5 minutes before closing. Can't wait to go back here, you gotta give this place a try.

5PjwgAIQDeTeLrvoJT1yfg.text: The food is excellent; great flavor (Aztec tinga chicken taco, Tlaloc cactus taco, La Sanitsima specialties taco with chicken). The salsa bar was great. The ambiance was fun. The waitstaff were friendly and helpful. The chairs scraping on the floor were annoying. The pink mold in the water container was vomitus.   I would give the food 4.5-5 stars. Because of the water issue I am bumping it down. That is just gross.   If you are gluten free, be careful: they use soy sauce in their cactus tacos. (Our waitress was apologetic and made me something else.)  All-in-all, we would come back and just order something bottled and skip the water.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tlaloc cactus taco &amp; La Sanitisma veggie taco
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aztec tinga tacos with rice &amp; beans

eRURqNWhZgCwalYrStdxTQ.text: Honestly, if you like Mexican/Latin American food, eat here. The food is great!! I didn't care too much for the salsas because most were too spicy for me or just not to my liking...but I'll give them a pass-who needs salsa when the food is that good! The restaurant is small, and can be uncomfortable when full. But the place does have character, and our server was more than wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My wonderful burrito filled with beef, avocado and chimmichuri sauce!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and salsas

OIgOlki9HgjCBa6tzLIGIA.text: I've had nothing but good experiences with the food at La Santisima, and minor frustrations with a particular attendant can be easily overlooked when the cuisine was that good.   My real love for this venue is from their simple, lovely drinks--including the best horchata I've had in Phoenix.  Chopped fruit and walnuts? Are you kidding me? Delicious.

6lFKtut4p1TD-vcbDndawg.text: I'm convinced this place has THE best margaritas in Phoenix. I came here with some coworkers for happy hour once and discovered their amazing grapefruit margaritas. Then a few weeks later I went back for dinner and got their veggie quesadilla which was insanely good. Actually, it got really busy while we were there and our orders got misplaced so we waited about 30 minutes to get our food. We weren't in any sort of rush, so it was fine, but the server actually comped our meals which was unexpected, but totally awesome.  Be warned this place is TINY so if you've got a big group, prepare to wait. But trust me it's worth it. They also have a salsa bar in the back - my favorite was the pecan. Amazing.

WEkJorsi4DlCGRu8U8CdhA.text: This place is simply the best. This is my favorite Mexican food in Phoenix. I have sent MANY people here and every single person has been amazed. I moved to Seattle and boy do I miss this place. The service, atmosphere, and most importantly the food is GREAT. It is all fresh and I don't know who is back there making this heavenly food but they definitely know what they are doing!   The salsa bar is huge and all of them are amazing. I can't wait to visit Phoenix so I can go again. They used to be call La Condessa.. not sure why the changed their name but who cares as long as they still have those amazing tacos, amazing burritos and that amazing salsa bar.    Side note: I am a vegetarian and have had no problem with the selection of vegetarian food. Definitely worth it.

dCZhC7B1OekQfbUyxrE-Ww.text: Food - OK. Had cochinita pibil tacos with beans and rice. I found bone and thhe flavor wasn't all that great. Husband had a quesadilla - way too greasy. Napkins couldn't soak up the grease fast enough. Salsas available, because some were empty were quite tasty. Ambient- sound bounced of the walls and couldn't really have a talk with out contributing to the already loud room. Lighting not great. Beautiful mexican culture inspired art. Loved it. Service- not good. Sat us down and then disappeared had to stop them and ask any of the employees to put in our order, refills, and our check. The worst part was... there wasn't that many people. Other- loved there terra cota plates. Cups were paper cups, and they had nice silver wear. Couldn't figure out whether it was nice dinner restaurant or just a dive.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos cochinito pibil.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadilla Arachera con queso Güaxaca. Looks good, but really greasy.

jVKEA1bsfSljBTvVcMloQg.text: Ordered Uber eats from these guys today and mannn their tacos are bomb!

TE1CtuYsvUKBPZlV03H9WQ.text: Really disappointed with this place. Some friends and I sat at the bar tonight and were there for 15 minutes with no acknowledgment what so ever. No menus. They didn't bus the bar for us. We were passed by several times with no eye contact. I've been here before and the food is great but the service is terrible. We had to walk out 15-20 minutes after sitting down. Sad because I really love the food here but this makes us not want to come back

oQmiuoEkQLUNgHZF02u51g.text: BEST TACOS EVER!  Gourmet tacos are fantastic but these are the best of the best.  The al pastor tacos as well as the al pastor quesa are amazing.  The pork is marinated and has great flavor, the inclusion of pineapple adds sweetness which works great with the savory flavor of the pork.  My personal favorite is the chicken mole which is not for everyone but I love it.  The mole sauce has great depth of flavor.  It is made from unsweetend cocoa and chiles.  Unusual but delicious!    The salsa bar has a great selection.  I recommend the chipotle salsa with its smoky flavor.  The tomotillo and guacamole are excellent.

Pggsb282DmhoHFxs1DXIrg.text: The food was amazing, and so many choices. I had a al pastor street taco which is probably one of the best ones I've ever had. I also had the pacific white fish taco, two big pieces of fried fish, very crispy and tasty, and my friend and I shared the poblana quesa quesadilla, very untraditional but so good. You get chips when you sit down and theres a self serve salsa bar with a big variety of all kinds of salsas. Limited seating but we got a table right away. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al pastor taco, fish taco plate, poblana quesa

3pb_L1wc3DgdnJ1u_kK2Xg.text: This place is the best. I'm addicted to their El Pastor burrito. So many flavors and they're all amazing! It gets really busy at lunch so plan ahead or call in your order.

jjU_zUIvqZjbGGKV-Qd1MQ.text: Excellent food, service is okay, well worth giving this place a try!

DdQ3-arWdhQLbLsGbYoF_g.text: If you LOVE Salsa then this is your place. Great Mexican food. Best hole in the wall ever. 16 different Salsas...so your going to find a few FAVORITES!!!!! Great place to go with friends.  I am sure it will become a favorite meeting place.

hmG7QS86-E22IkX5oXw33g.text: I tried this joint simply because of the great reviews on yelp. I was not disappointed. There is an awesome salsa bar. The service was great. The staff was helpful and friendly. The food alone was worth the trip, but there was just so many wonderful elements. I had a steak and bean burro. The steak was seasoned perfectly and had a nice crust of season on it. The horchata is seriously the best I've ever had. I can't wait to take everyone I know to this great spot. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chile en Nogada Burro

6xen7Qjr3_VTzVJboYe6Zg.text: First time here and it was very good!  The many different salsas at the salsa bar are very good.  My husband had their version of a "torta" I would recommend sticking with the tacos. The steak and white fish tacos are amazing!    Only bad thing is it not very big and tables are close to each other.  Service was slow but the food made up for that. I would definitely return!

X2kBVFw2CJQmRfP577MtPA.text: The tacos here are delicious!! They have a great salsa bar also. It's not a huge place, so  just be aware of that in terms of time, they aren't in a hurry but def take care of you. Very flavorful food!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2yZao2tqw3HdnCn1VZYtbg.text: Got to come here for the salsa bar.  Awesome.  Good prices for food items too.  The service is also excellent.  The server even game my daughter a complimentary horchata.  If La Santisima was within an hour from my home I would go there every week.

Hu2qyCFtGRAtXv54YDAxEg.text: Oh. My. God.  Best taco I have ever eaten in my entire life. No lie. My husband and friend said the same thing when they took their first bites.  The salsa bar is great, too, but OMG those tacos.......

HRPKh99uEHLsPj-8eMKBzw.text: Burritos. In a town where you eat Mexican for all three meals, it takes a lot to stand out. This place has an amazing mariachi burrito. It's traditional and tastes like someone's Grandma made it. Delicious.  Loved the selection of salsa, too, but the tortilla chips treated store bought. Oh well, a minor flaw in an otherwise stellar experience.   Another plus was that the waitress was all dolled up in a Dia de la Muerto get up. She matched the art on the wall, which was very cool.

uDTV5RB1geuGN0-iaPoV-Q.text: This is a taco of a different color!! Barbacoa, tongue, carne asada, even potato and chorizo tacos. They are as varied as your imagination. They have several different quesadillas as well. This is the type of food you will find in Mexico City. No Taco Bell mush here! They also feature a super salsa bar with (I thing I counted right)12 different types of salsas! The guacamole salsa is spicy to watch out. They have a cilantro pecan salsa which I found surprisingly tasty. You must get several to find your personal favorite. They have expanded from a living room sized dining to the next door pad. This is very helpful as we had to wait outside on 16th street sidewalk one night, but it was worth it. Try it, you will like it.

ShmD8087XXJHrKP-M6R6eg.text: I love this place! They have the most flavorful Mexican food in Phoenix. They use fresh ingredients and their dishes combine a lot of different flavors and textures---it's real cooking, not just the monotone "spicy pile of beef and cheese" dishes we have everywhere else. Their salsa bar also has creative, delicious salsas. The people are friendly. The prices are good, not super cheap, but around $12 for lunch and more than worth it. They expanded into a second big room. It used to be a bad place for lunch because everything was so packed together, but now there's no reason not to go. Well, except for the parking, but just find something on a side street and walk half a block.

voVFR1tmYD0cAKYch670Bg.text: Great  salsa bar Gaucho taco and burrito are the best And the Mahi Mahi  Horchata is also pretty good Definitly coming back

zfeI8aurIz2xIRpGg9pX5Q.text: Great salsa bar (at least twelve different kinds, loved the spicy peanut).  Got a la carte tacos on the waitress' recommendation and they did not disappoint.  Favorite was the chicken mole taco, the sauce was so good, smoky without being bitter.  Cabo Tiger Shrimp was pretty awesome, battered shrimp.  Carne asada was good, but the others were better.  Great service too and loved the decor.

nawy4H85w5Xt2f75K6WOGA.text: Freaking fantastic breakfast. Seriously do not underestimate Mexican breakfast!! Get the chilequiles with green sauce and steak arachera tooooo diiieeee forrrrrr

Ly4Ke4s2SOpiMj35heRflA.text: Really amazing tacos!! They are much bigger than we anticipated so keep that in mind when ordering, I definitely recommend the queso dip with chorizo and you can't miss the refried beans, they are truly delicious!

zhlWLg4VmCODU3iFVC_Ssg.text: While my friends and I were in Phoenix and in search of a lunch place, we found this place on diners, drive-ins and dives. We came here on a Tuesday and arrived a little after it opened. You order at the counter and then find a seat.   We ordered an assortment of tacos. A unique option that they offer is to order a protein taco. Instead of the tortilla, it was replaced with an egg. It was delicious, but filled us up quickly. If you go this route, consider ordering a taco or two less than you normally would. Not sure how many eggs they use per taco but it's probably between 1 and 2. I don't think this extra protein option widely advertised. My friend found this option somewhere on the menu, and we didn't know about it until he received his order. We were perplexed by what he ordered because he was the one who was enthusiast about tacos, and it didn't look anything like a traditional taco. Great option if you would like to go with the no carb option. I've never seen this at any other Mexican restaurant before.   Our favorites were the Sonoran carne Asada taco and the shrimp tacos! They also offer a salsa bar and complimentary chips while you wait for your food. Fast service and delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa bar! They offer a basket of complimentary Chips. If you need a refill, they charge extra.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Protein taco!

tqjzF2pdzqMyq_qtEzyURw.text: Ok. Salsa bar was fire. Almost had too many options. Had a little anxiety not being able to try all of them! Tacos were fantastic! Pork, slow cooked beef, carne, chicken tinga etc. I'm pretty sure I just ate nine tacos and loved all of them. We will be back anytime we are in the area.

idoAejG-jjv-l3cVJsjMhg.text: After sampling five tacos, I'll jump on the La Santisima train. A lot of other people have already been riding it with the four and a half star rating in 1.3 K reviews. The street tacos, the service, and the salsa bar were the standouts for us.  We had no wait when we entered on a Friday at 1:30 and were seated at the two top right by the bar. We were served by I believe one of the owners or managers and he took great care of us also answering questions and offering suggestions. The tacos are divided into a "gourmet" and "street" section, priced at $3.99/$2.25 respectively. If you don't want your protein in a taco, they also serve burros, quesadillas, and lonches. If I had my dirty menu police badge on, I would have cited them for one count as there was a couple splotches of salsa verde on my menu.  We upgraded to two combos for a buck and change so we could have some beans and rice. And of course we sampled plenty of salsas while eating our chips. I enjoyed all three of the street tacos we ordered. The shark taco was overcooked and the corners were tough. The black mole was different with a deeper flavor with bitter notes and very mild sweetness. For two combo plates with 5 tacos, $20 was an affordable price. I'll definitely see what else they have to offer on the next train stop.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu topped with some dried salsa verde
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oaxacan black mole taco and Baja Sur shark taco
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street plate- carne asada, chicken asado, tinga

e276VuL1HMRBnzz0yrTCug.text: Great service and salsa but bar missed the mark on taco quality. The "specialty" tacos are more expensive $5-7 per taco on their Taco Platter and were pretty average when it came to flavor. Or the tacos had too many toppings/seasonings which made the tastes kind of mesh together. We paid $40 for two Taco platter with the specialty tacos which for such a casual atmosphere is wayyy too much per plate.

8DSGH1Ke8wOdj1kIXGjO1g.text: Great place to have some real Mexican food !!! Fresh food and tasty with a large menu variety of authentic food .Highly recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

U3mhR50pDTZgxGzrZMORHw.text: Love love love their salsa darThey have the Best salsa I ever had. There is Salsa Mexicana, a classic Red, White, and Green medley of Smoky Green Chiles, White Onions, Tomatoes, Peanut Pecan Cilantro Tapatio and Strawberry.....Creamy spicy and fruity spicy   I wish I could go there every weekends but too far from Portland

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2vRCwKL1gqNY1H-GTmFXrg.text: First .. $14 for one burrito (smh)  Second .. Had NO clue this place was featured on Food Network / DDD.   Third .. Gave away the other half (more like 2/3) of my burrito n I hope this was just an off kitchen day  Sooooo being on Food Network elevated my expectations when I saw the sign inside after I ordered .. The salsa bar is definitely nice but means nothing if they're not all on point. I'd rather have 2-4 really good salsas vs 12-14 mediocre ones. Much better tacos, salsas/salsa bars out there (Ta'Carbon or Tacos Sahuaro) than here. The staff is friendly, the space is small but soon expanding I believe. The burro (La Santisima) w arrachera (carne asada) was disappointing; everythg just seemed muddled as far as flavor, it was one note. The spinach came through n the carne was nothing different than what u may find at filibertos. A return is still up in the air.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La Santísima burro

083zOYQm0VPCNmjqZZpChA.text: This placed was awesome,  courteous personnel. I got the Mexic Mignon. It was almost too spicy for new but I'm a wuss when it comes to spicy. Still in that end it was awesome for that we had

7r5btQeofevXd3vsPMqbRQ.text: My favorite taco place in Phoenix! Some people complain about the prices but I'm from the east coast where the prices are similar and the tacos aren't even on the same planet as these.  You can definitely get buy with three tacos, four if you're super hungry like I always am and feast in all the deliciousness! The salsa bar is fantastic here as well as the guacamole.   Ignore the fact that they've been on Food Network and have gotten a bit more touristy; the food is still legit and isn't that all that matters? So stop by, have a margarita and chow down on some delicious tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All the tacos!

c_bGupKtLm5KMcE6fC9Bkg.text: I thought I reviewed this spot already, but I obviously didn't. I came here  about 4 years ago when it had a different name (la Condesa) and it was my first time coming back since. I came here a month ago with some friends and we drove separately. Some of them got there first which was good because they were able to snag us a table for 6 in this small restaurant. Since it was a Friday night, it was busier than usual and several parties had to wait or go elsewhere.   Their menu has a lot of options even for vegetarians, which is nice. I ordered a taco plate with three different kinds: aguacate, la santisima veggie, and the cactus one. I did like them, but I would've enjoyed them better if they were served in flour tortillas rather than corn. I'm not a corn tortilla fan. The salsa bar is fun to try, I got the strawberry one to balance out the spicier ones like chipotle. The beans were tasty too.   Service was good and we got our food in a timely manner. I just wish they had more space and alternate choices for tortillas.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco plate: aguacate, la santísima Veggie, and the cactus one
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mixing salsas and chips

yGGjDyvi281LL_nEuBXLFw.text: Wow this place is so good! My first time here with my fiance & it was amazing! Food was so good & on point. I got the AL pastor burro & probably the best one I've ever had! I will definitely be back soon!

0xg502ZS4DDzH2xRVMh2zg.text: I have seen this place all the time from my drive to home from work. I am 100% satisfied. The food is very good and the service offered by Sanna was excellent, she knows the menu and gave good suggestions. This is a hidden jewel in a very challenging neighborhood. I am so excited to come back again, my favorite tacos for now. Michelda was very well balanced. The tacos were very tasty and my burrito was so good. I was trilled to know that Guy Fieri was here and according to Sanna they get more visitors from out of twin than locals.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wRIZm3FpfoaGnrwhKVatsQ.text: When they call La Santisima a gourmet taco cafe, they're not kidding- there are so many different types of tacos on the menu, it's overwhelming and difficult to decide what to order! Add in the massive salsa bar and I was a fan before I even tried a bite.  This place is tiny, so go off normal dining hours or expect a wait. We lucked out and got seats at the bar, and ended up getting to try an extra margarita that was accidentally made for a large party. While you wait for your order, cozy up to the salsa bar, where they have ten different options ranging from mild to mouth-on-fire. The strawberry one was my favorite, but the tomatillo was really good too.  We ended up trying five different tacos, and they were all good in their own ways- this is a place to skip the generic fried fish tacos and go for the stuff that's really out there, like chicken mole and things you have difficulty pronouncing correctly. Will be coming back next time I'm in town to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Plate with white fish,  barbacoa, and.. Azteca?
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mahi and mole
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita

fXWEk4Uvmu6yhVc9qeCPJQ.text: A great joint.  Their food is delicious, but a little overpriced.  If you're looking for good food and not on a budget, this is /the/ taco place that I'd recommend.  As soon as the servers actually got to us, it was smooth sailing.  I am not happy with how long that took, though.

ZrrIXXzngnMfjTNTghNhSA.text: This place is delicious as well as being a fun place to go out with friends. Currently my favorite Mexican food in the city. It's D.F. Style food, so it's a little different from most of what we're used to in Phoenix. Everything I've had has been excellent and   I'm excited to try more of the menu. Definitely recommended.

q25u60Znb6343Mb1Od0aDg.text: I came here to eat with my co-workers at lunch time and it was packed!!!!! This was obviously a great sign, but know it's packed during the lunch hour.   The place is small but seats quite a few people. You may also sit by the bar to eat (which is what we did since we didn't want to have to wait forever to eat).   I had 3 carne asada tacos with rice and beans. The meat was well seasoned and they double up on tortillas so they def won't fall apart.   The highlight for me was the salsa bar. Omg it was yummy! They have your traditional salsas, like salsa verde, salsa bandera etc, but also have very inventive yet delicious spins on the ordinary, like their salsa siete chiles (7 types of roasted chiles with red onion and it was super chunky) or another salsa made with a base of chopped radish.    It was great that they also gave us a basket of super crispy chips to enjoy with all the salsas.   The ONLY thing that I did not like was that I saw drinks poured at the bar and the bar tender grabbed the fruit out of the open bin with his bare hands. I had a bottled drink, but would have not asked for a drink if the bar were the only option. Just to be clear, the kitchen staff had gloves and you could see into the kitchen, which was organized and clean.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Looks great!

ii0ZCaubbe4-BoDrXfhzCQ.text: Love, love, loved the specialty tacos (steak)... WOW & my husband got the three tacos, chorizo, chicken & beef tacos. INSANELY de-lish

qzUJfcp7r6ml8YMgBSnuBg.text: Delicious Food and I'm a harsh critic since I only love authentic Mexican food! The fresh waters are to die for!! But the great music and amazing art to top it off to make this a great choice to eat!!! Oh and more choices it salsas you can imagine and they are all finger licking good!!!

BWQDQ8g8_5WY4mwnMcJlrw.text: The menu looks better than how the food taste. I think the food is good but nothing great. Kind of bland, I had 3 different tacos and none of them stuck out to me as amazing. The fish taco was really basic. The salsa bar is ok, even though it has more of a variety than most they are not that good. I tried all of them and most were pretty bland maybe one was spicy. I'd say the spiciest one was maybe a little hotter than siracha. I've only been once so they could have been out of something. The rice and beans are decent, better than most chain Mexican spots. The horchata was the best part, we may go back just for a couple horchatas to go. Overall I think most will like it, I had high expectations considering a close friend was telling me to go and the menu looks great.

inI2zs-hqVd0S63v8qHNIA.text: Excellent street and gourmet tacos.  The salsa bar changes and is fun to try the different flavors

9vUEUl7BEyRSTqVMUVjHag.text: My boss bought the office lunch today, and la Santisima was the chosen place. I ordered the La Condesa Veggie Quesa. The portion is huge! It was pretty tasty. But I wish there had been far more veggies. I regret not asking for a side of salsa.  While a deep fried quesadilla is a novel idea, it was just too heavy and greasy. We ordered take out so had I known it was fried, I would have picked something else.  I'll definitely give it another try since all my co-workers loved their tacos and burros.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Its massive!!!

BOpSn-oVc_Zqjw3Ch7rTDQ.text: Great decor, nice place. Food was okay but my perfectly made  spicy michelada made up for it. Defiantly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

f6Nf8vHF2fHGF3EFdHicQg.text: What else can I really say about this place?  1. Their service is good 2. Food is great, super fresh & has various varieties.  3. The Salsa Bar is to die for!  4. They give warm chips right when u sit on the table  5. Small & very intimate   It also made me feel better that this place had a lot of credentials on their wall from being the best of Phoenix to one of the neighborhood gems!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nmt-fMM1nvHzfm-dqQUi8Q.text: This place never disappoints. From the service, to the atmosphere, to the chips and the amazing salsa bar, this is the best Mexican place in the valley. There are many vegan options and the flavor profiles are amazing. Don't miss this place!

HW3OIWaAu8o_UpoL8homxw.text: Tacos so good I could weep.  The salsa bar is worth several visits and don't forget to visit with your carry out too.  The pork dishes were melt in your mouth.  The decor was fresh and lively.  This is a very family friendly place.  The pibil is worth it's weight in gold.

invzhljS3k0jZuIYNjBHjQ.text: Had the poblano quesa.  Wife ordered the arachera tacos and chicken taco. I also had the best margarita I've had in a long time. Loved the food def recommend. I swear my mom was cooking

KASCf9KelWv_w_WXr21T2w.text: I came here on a Saturday for brunch around 11am and were seated in the front room which is kind of dark. I saw the main room on the way to the bathroom & asked to be moved because it's so much brighter & nicer in there. Not sure why we weren't set there to begin with considering it wasn't super busy at the time.  La Santisima's main room is decorated with Dia De Los Muertos inspired artwork -- pretty cool! There's also a salsa bar that has a great variety of sauces! I tried them all & my favorite was a smokey, spicy salsa roja; it was hot but not over-powering & still had fresh acidity which I love.  Their taco trios have a lot of different protein options - I chose their Mayan Cochinita Pibil, Sonoran Carne Asada, & Aztec Tinga. So unique & delicious in their own ways but my favorite was definitely the Tinga.   Chilaquiles in roja & verde salsas with scrambled eggs were so tasty with generous portions.  My dining companion said it reminded him of his grandmother's chilaquiles which seems a pretty strong endorsement! Next time, I'd probably opt for an over-medium egg to add some yummy yolkiness.  Overall -- a great experience with tasty, authentic food, & lots of variety! Definitely would recommend :)

yt8ZwmQUxfcaH8-xYomP2Q.text: This place is top notch! The margaritas are always super flavorful and I always have to go for the baby shark and shrimp tacos. 10/10 I recommend this place to everyone I can.

GxNnJvsu_MkhM5XkBNU8yQ.text: Great mexican place with some amazingly good tasting tacos. love their salsa bar. Love the new expansion they did, as it helped with the wait times. decor is a bit esoteric, but the food is great. can be a bit slow when busy, but worth the wait. Was visiting from Seattle and would surely stop again when in the area. very close to the airport.

SzLKZHXNwrAwYZc5lwgKlg.text: Tacos are awesome and the salsa bar is worth the visit. Went for taco Tuesday, but they have a limited selection of which tacos you can get on special so be sure to ask. Nevertheless, it's a good spot.

YDfU4YP6CgMxkLkFAxXgEg.text: Hands down the best Mexican food that I've ever eaten.  Fresh & very flavorful.  Saw the restaurant on Diners, Drive-ins, & Dives & have been going there ever since.  The salsa bar is one of a kind.  They expanded the establishment which is now doubled in size.  Shortly after the remodel the prices dramatically increased.  Now I go on special occasions & not every Friday.  Still worth the money.

Hv5f1xVJYwe1xfJ3VSPKLw.text: Authentic?  First, we were hoping the tortilla were homemade (likely not).  I ordered a pork/tomato/onion "not a" torta, and it was most certainly a sandwich with mustard and mayonnaise??  That didn't seem authentic.  But I ate the thing- it was good.  But I would get tacos or a burrito next time... if there is one.  DUN DUN DUNN!  MILEY, WHAT'S GOOD? The salsa bar is great... though the best ones ("guacamole") were empty the Friday lunch hour I went.  Chunky pico is good.  Strawberry salsa?  Um ok.  Peanut salsa.  Sure.  Cilantro salsa- tasted more like bell pepper to me.  Hit and miss, but fun to try them all regardless.    DRINKS? Skinny margarita so watery my wife switched the beer. But the iced tea is good and comes in a big 32 ounce cup so you don't have to bother anyone for refills.  And you get your own water bottle.   Kinda of a fun, dark, (maybe too) little dive w/ good service.  Would be greater if they could extend the bar to more than three seats.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Adios mios!  Mustard on the torta?!?

KG6v6vx2ml7qaN9N_YMt_Q.text: We were visiting from Seattle and were excited for some great Mexican food and based on the reviews La Santisima seem to be the spot. Our visit started with us waiting for about 5 minutes to be seated in a restaurant with only three tables being served. The service continued to be slow and not very interested in our experience. We started with two margaritas and when I finished mine I wasn't offered another. Once the food arrived it was very authentic but wasn't fabulous.

ZntxicVHZDtbXMaJl4uKGA.text: The best Mexican food I've ever had. The street tacos are the best. Good friendly service too. Small though so hard with big groups.

UNQ7OHP1btpygzxXJg8mjg.text: A good friend refered me to this restaurant as we were on a Taco shop kick for the month. i had no idea tacos could be so amazing. The salsa bar is out of this world.

Fg16lIUPJ9Vk8VWGYBn1JQ.text: Oh man, this was a good dinner! There were rumors about La Condesa: awesome salsa bar, tasty cheap tacos...I am glad to say that both of those rumors are TRUE!  I had a chicken mole taco which had just a couple too many red onions on it (which were easily dispatched). The mole was rubbed into the chicken rather than glooped on top, so the fragrant smokiness really soaked into the chicken. I liked this taco even better with a spoonful of the juicy strawberry salsa on top.  I also sampled the carne asada burro. Simple handmade flour tortilla (I could eat them plain for days), filled with black beans and beef. The meat had a deep flavor and was slow-cooked tender. Again, a dollop from the large assortment of salsas, this time the creamy cilantro, made good taste great.  My calabacitas were grilled just right: nice char marks, but with some body still left to the slices.   La Condesa only loses a point because the chips could have been better (fresher) and the parking in front is rather harrowing. Otherwise, it is going in the regular rotation. I hope they have t-shirts sometime soon with some of the amazing artwork!

rIQfZFyr9_9eTHADaaOMRg.text: My only complaint was the guacamole was not how I typically prefer it. Otherwise, this was delicious food and we loved all the salsa choices! There were so many and each one was delicious.

qnKsuJ_yvN-MCaJ_O_wVLA.text: This place is awesome. Wife had the shrimp - I had the Cochinita. Both effing delicious and reasonably-priced. And after reading some reviews, I'm really excited to go back tomorrow and try their horchata. The chips were a little salty for my liking, but the salsas we tried (especially the watermelon) were great. Cool art on the walls.  Seriously - La Condesa is the real deal.

fVtqCrAmjVV8AOBZ11F21A.text: I love this place!!  As other reviewers have pointed out, the salsa bar is insane.  Do yourself a favor and sample each variety.  They're not labeled to indicate how spicy they are, so be forewarned.  The cochinita, gaucho, dogfish, and shrimp tacos are my favorite.

Z3GRwNaHMPpbeb_cwYIlHQ.text: Great food, Really bad service!  Best recommendation order to go!  BTW they charge you the extra chips!

I9cnCgh9ZDnK6EHX3YG97A.text: A quaint lil' taco shoppe, with an assortment of DEEE-LISH salsas, my favie is Peanut Salsa and Orange Salsa.... and a menu paralleling Al Varado Street, Downtown LA... and HORCHATA to make your eyelashes curl!   LEmmmmmE just say.... it's YUMM-4-DAYS......

gH5dXIXR5EWzHWq74bI5OQ.text: We got there...there was a wait...it was so crowded that some people had to stand to eat their food and it was soooo damn worth it.  From the folk Mexican art depicting Santo and Freda Kahlo's uni-brow to the leather and rough wood La Condesa is as much a treat to the eyes as to the nose and mouth.  We are so used to fiery Tex-Mex here in Arizona that it is hard to believe that there is another side to good Mexican food....a delicacy of flavor that counts on subtle textures and refreshing herbs and vegetables to cool our palates and the heat of Southwest days.  I tried every one of the salsas available on Saturday and I can still taste the peanut salsa while I dream of the strawberry salsa (and the cilantro cream salsa and the chipotle...you get the picture).  We split the dogfish and carne asada tacos along with a mahi burrito and were too stuffed to make our way any farther down the menu, guaranteeing we'll be back for more.  Any complaints? Only the smallest of one....I actually prefer water to soft drinks with my meals and appreciate a reasonably sized cup (I promise I won't steal the Coke). I was given an 8oz styro cup filled with ice, necessitating several trips to the counter to ask for more. Totally rediculous since the soft drink dispenser is behind the counter and I couldn't rip them off if I wanted to ;-) ....and yet another styro cup waiting over a thousand years to biodegrade in a landfill.  La Condesa is what a good taqueria should be, just make sure to weedle a paper cup out of the cashier if you quieres agua.

1fRRuzi3rS-wlhmRJWtzQw.text: This was a great find! We enjoyed the homemade horchata which was bursting with flavors like cinnamon, nutmeg, fruit and nuts.  Equally as delish was the guacamole. This is not your typical guacamole. It was more chopped than mashed and had dried cranberries in it. Very tasty. I had the cabo tacos and the beer batter was too thick for my liking, but my fiance ordered a chicken taco and it was much better. When I come back again, I will try non-beer battered tacos!

O_5EMxtqtbMg8CRZUPyZyw.text: A total hole in the wall, but so good!  Tons of different salsas to choose from.

2GohP0uqKWWhBUX7sNfz7Q.text: Great tacos... its a small place. But the food is great. Careful with the salsas, some are super hot!

Irr9S0xlRcCdBDT6tTboXQ.text: Slow service. Waited 15 minutes without just a bowl of chips and no order taken. One server on a Sunday wasn't a good idea. Headed elsewhere.

1km_nq_NUOhSOtxih6DyYA.text: I'm updating and improving the review.  According to the proprietor, the cause of my last bad experience is gone, so I decided to return with some coworkers today. I was offered a free meal, but I declined it.  The service was much improved, efficient even. The food is very tasty. It is a taco experience that is quite a bit better than most Phoenix locations. A lot of their food tends to be on the spicy side, but not all. The house-made beverages (horchata and jamaica) are very good. The guac is chunky and very citrusy, which I approve of. Do not hesitate to check this place out, but be forewarned that parking can be challenging and the location is small and crowded.
