Nonetheless it has one-of-a-kind ambiance and outstanding Mexican food and drink.

erw1hD8i1ePHIOv0isNdMw.text: Fellow Yelpian reviews finally got me to visit this place to try it out. I am going to keep this short and to the point.... the food was yummie.... the salsa choices were very good and I now love the strawberry salsa..... the price was fair.... the service was ok!!...  The only thing I did not like was the portions were a bit on the small side.... the pulled pork is yummie/messy.... the dogfish shark tacos were yummie.... the art was interesting... the place was clean....  Summary... I will visit it again but I did not think it was out of this world great..... but over-all a good exp....

zjJuJHyXIHipczo9m_jkrQ.text: The best part of this place is the salsa bar and chips!  There were 15 different salsas to try and you can make a meal out of that!  The beef street tacos were yummy along with the rice.  The horchata was very tasty and unique with the fruit!  Go early because there was a line out the door, but it is worth the wait.

McJWeepkQqabijwhWzznSg.text: If this place only served chips and their salsa bar, I would still give it 5 stars!  As a salsa and hot sauce (they're different, people!) fanatic, I tend to judge Mexican food joints based on their quality of salsa - and La Condesa ranks high!  Last time I was there, I counted 10 different salsas and 2 or 3 different condiments (limes, onions, etc.).  They offer a wide range of salsas from their exotic strawberry salsa, to spicy chipotle, or creamy cilantro.  It looks a little silly with 8 little cups on salsa at your table, but you have to try them all!   The horchata here is also 5-star material.  Don't be a cheapskate - shell out the $4 for it! Its giant, it will make you happy. And, when you're done with it you can eat the fruit and nuts - the drink keeps on giving!   I have been here twice and have only eaten the veggie tacos, 2 of them are enough to fill me up and they are very delicious!  I must say I am not a huge fan of their rice and beans, which seem a bit bland to me.  But, the tacos, salsa and drinks all make up for some plain 'ol rice!   I was very  happy to see a decent sized crowd here on my most recent visit and that La Condesa is applying for a liquor license.  This place needs to stick around for awhile!

Azs_m8C-Fqn9USY2nvFJFg.text: Just had lunch there and as for being a major taco fan i have had better(Los Angeles Tacos still rule) , but overall its pretty good compare to other places near by. I had the Argentine Style which thats were my dad is from.. was not as great the meat needed seasoning and the chimichuri was bland , not to mention a little cheap on putting the sauce on , so i had to ask for more. But the one that got me was the shark tacos , now thats a taco ! Just wish the would recomend the sauces/ salsa to put on it that would help bring out more flavor. They have so many salsas I WANTED TO TRY ALL OF THEM !  Great place for a good lunch and awsome concept ! if you have'nt tried it , you must go once its a fine meal for $10. Happy hour prices seem to be reasonable also. I will be back again i must say and will ask more questions about the sauces.

ZUSxoCwczuZthdsdzNoIbw.text: I've been here a few times and I loved it! I love their shrimp tacos and they have a salsa bar with a variety to choose from. Their displayed art work is beautiful and compliments the type of food they serve really nicely.

tL5PO4cBDLyRR1yUGSPbjw.text: I was in Phoenix on a one day business trip and found this place on yelp. I'm glad I did. The restaurant is small at first but has a variety of home made salsas at the salsa bar. I didn't get a chance to try them all but the ones I had were very good. They have really good service with a friendly server and prompt service. I had the mahi fish taco which was grilled and I also had the chicken taco. Both were excellent with the rice and beans. They give you soft drinks in a to go cup so that was convenient to take with me in the 100 degree weather.   The food was really good and was better than similar tacos in CA. I'm glad I chose this place for my one meal in AZ before my flight home! One more thing the price was very reasonable and the location was only a couple miles from the Sky Harbor rental car center. Will go back if I'm in AZ.

9jpZZzH_B0Dx7EVeudhXmg.text: Really delicious tacos, and the salsa bar as about a dozen varieties, all unique and tasty (including strawberry?! Trust me--just try it)... This is a mainstay in the neighborhood for a reason.

jRSMIcQQiD47rHAO2UoMTQ.text: I was very disappointed by my last 2 visits here. On one visit I was served cold beans and rice, like from the fridge cold. It took almost 20 minutes to get new beans and rice, and they were still barely warm. No apology, no nothing.  Went again to get my favorite chicken mole tacos, and they were barely warm. My husband had their marinated shredded pork in a burrito and got sick after taking the first bite. This must be an acquired taste, it was gross, really gross. Then I found what looked like a gray slimy booger in my rice. When I pointed it out to the server he took my plate away and came back saying it was an onion!! No way was that an onion, or even a close relative of an onion. No apology, no asking if i want something else, he just came over, slammed the bill down and said we didn't charge you for your food, so don't worry about it, and walked away.   I know mistakes happen, but own up to it, and at least TRY to make the customer feel good about the situation.

V7Xni-UuvLav43FtpRBoTw.text: great food, fun environment and of course salsa bar.  as authentic as it gets and a great taco stop for taco fans.

Y0SMflaYD537wnmm3H0mpg.text: This is the real deal.  If you are looking for a small hole in the wall joint that serves clean, delicious, authentic tacos, this is where you want to go. It costs $5 for two a la carte large tacos served on fresh corn tortillas that are filling.  There are a variety of choices, you cannot go wrong. The meats are all prepared with strong spices, and cooked appropriately without being dry. The seafood is well seasoned, and kept moist after preparation and frying. Best of all, there is a salsa bar with over 10 different types of fresh salsas to accompany your dishes.  My only gripe is that there aren't additional "authentic" cuts of meat like lingua or tripe. But still, everything done here is done exceptionally well.

W2cZvySvPYUP_OKVvXgSXQ.text: Met up a few friend here for brunch, this place in chill, nice and up beat. Art work inside of ten restaurant and on the walls outside were great.

yt7CLRc1GhZAjlfWnA_uaw.text: Best fish taco I've had so far. On that scale I give it a well deserved 5 stars. I also had the pork and chicken street tacos, I would probably only order the fish taco next time.  Authentic. Great choice of house made salsas.

USOMRLyXiqYNaozxqsDvhA.text: Went to La Condesa this past week, WOW!!!  Loved it!  Great atmosphere, cool hole in the wall type feel with excellent food and outstanding service.  Between a family of 4, we had street tacos, quesadilla , and the pork burrito with some great seasoning ( can't remember the name of it).  All of it was super tasty.  Don't forget to try all the salsas, each one of them offer a great addition to the food provided.  Finally I leave with this.... My kids asked if the restaurant had churros, so I asked and they mentioned they recently took them off the menu.  Waiter very nicely apologized and said sorry we don't have them anymore.  2 mins later the guy came back as we were signing our bill and told me he could make them for us.  They had the ingredients.  Within 5 mins my two kids had not only churros, but churros with strawberries, chocolate, Carmel and pecans on the plate.  Well presented and very delicious!! To top it all off I asked them to provide me a new bill for the dessert and he said its on the house.  There not on the menu, no need to charge u.  :) :).  Please don't use this against;).  What a fantastic experience!!  10 stars!!

wvNCEkbRPlib-4WsljAd5Q.text: This place had an awesome selection and different from the Mexican food/tacos that I'm used to. I'd say a must try if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. These were REALLY good!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Asada and Mahi taco. These were just ok for me
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Guac had to be my favorite thing

IbheWjlHykk9kr5ytgi3nw.text: Great place, great Flavours - 7 chili, cilantro and strawberry salsa are must try.  In my first visit, I tried chicken tinga and a burro, the meat was well cooked and juicy.   Place was small, but nice ambience.   The neighborhood was litle shady but  the quality of food defeats all those negative factors.   Definitely recommended.  Ps - the place is open late till 11pm, even though yelp hours shows 9pm.

nkUXSLUP8DxT5jwmXeVaPg.text: Best Cadillac margarita I've had in all of Phoenix. The place would be dazzling with a patio and more seating, but even without I'm sold on the food and definitely the drinks. I had the Santisima special quesadilla, which should not be named something so bland and unremarkable as a quesadilla; it was the demi-god of quesadillas, more of an empanada, the hercules of Mexican food; it could beat up your dad is what I'm saying, unless your dad is really old then it would help him out of his chair and bring all the salsa options to the table to give his old bones some rest.

ViTwa1oexHhwA9eL8zcRrA.text: She is sweet, spicy, smooth, and exotic.  But don't talk about her like that, because she is La Santisima, and that means saintly, perv.  To her 16 salsas, I'm forever faithful. I can't even bring myself to eat a shrimp burrito or dogfish shark taco* from anywhere else.**   I swear, I'm a one-burrito woman. Let La Santisima show you the light.  *No dogs/fish were harmed in the making of this taco.  **dogfish shark tacos aren't available anywhere else around here, anyway.

VgIONNZDv_f-2e7ENprnPQ.text: Delicious food, I love the salsa bar. I haven't counted exactly how many salsas they offer, but certainly at least a couple dozen of them. And they're all great. Their margaritas are huge and definitely do the job, and the food very flavorful, though it does take some time to come out. The dining room is small and this place is popular, so do be prepared to wait. I've seen the line wrap clear around the building. Parking can also be a challenge.

V7dSNoP2k9yabSL0LYE1Mg.text: Stopped in to have dinner for my brothers birthday.  Our party was a bit too large for the small dinning area, there was 8 in our group.  However, after a short wait they were able to accommodate us.    Everything I tasted was great, the only thing holding me back from giving a five star review is the small dining area.  I had two tacos and rice and beans.  The cochinita pibil taco was very good but the star of the show was the Aztec tinga.  So flavorful, so fat, so hot!  Man, good thing I had a horchata to cool the flames.  The horchata was very good but around halfway through it became nearly impossible to drink through the straw because of the fruit and nuts.  It was no big deal though.  All in all it was a great meal at a very reasonable price.

0Bm0g-LWRnAirYedCfqCZQ.text: MUST go! So glad I found this place on Yelp, otherwise I would've never spotted it just driving by. The La Santisma veggie tacos are amazing! I tried the veggie tacos with the cactus too- also good but I preferred the others. Service was friendly and the food came out fast. Check out the salsa bar for a plethora of yummy salsa options. Can't wait to go back!

6VhUIosVGbOdHacauMolOQ.text: Great food, ambience and service! Can't go wrong with the Al pastor.

hL6YOPXPSVvxLR6AzjLizw.text: Oh my god their salsas and margaritas! They're priced very reasonably. They have a killer selection of all kinds of fancy tacos that are very exciting. The staff is great, attentive but not pushy, knowledgeable about the menu. The decor is pretty too, I liked their posters on the wall. Clean, good food, many options, great service. No complaints!

Mb-6ZspYjctSeJWmKtjkvg.text: Truly an amazing Mexican restaurant! The salsa bar is the winning touch with over 12 different unique salsa for every taste. First time here so I had to try the tacos. The chicken and steak were marinated wonderfully and the flavors combine well. It was definitely worth it. They have great vegetarian/vegan options too! Cannot wait to come back and try the other options on the menu.

XRGiBp7y8dTupbCnB2ZSug.text: I love this place! The service is quick and friendly and the food is great! There are more than enough vegetarian options and too much good salsa to try! My favorite was the cilantro and the pecan dressing. They are so fresh and the food didn't take long to come at all. I will definitely visit again next time I'm in Phoenix

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesa

hvv9kMyVY1hCtM8R-CApuQ.text: This is my first time in Phoenix and decided to try this place this evening due to all the yelper reviews. I was not disappointed. The salsa Bar had many different flavors of salsas-- yum!!! I was really pleased.  So many varieties and all complimented our meals very well. I got the al pastor bowl (perfect low carb option) and I was absolutely delicious! The kids had a chicken quesadilla and they were very happy. If I'm ever up this way I just may come here again. We had a wait for 30 minutes to get a table and we also had to wait 30 minutes for the food to come. It is fine except for little kids having to wait was not easy.

2PKFHAdnzB4NGRvAR7GE-g.text: You may need several visits to try all of their different gourmet tacos.  If you are indecisive about choosing among multiple great menu items like I do just get the 3-taco sampler (comes with beans & rice) and whatever three tacos jump out at you.  Then go back again and try different ones.  We got the chicken tinga, cochinita pibil (done right), Oaxacan mole negro (a flavor explosion), 2 Andalusias (chorizo and potato - hard to find a better combination), and chile en nogada (a chile stuffed with fruits, nuts and meat, topped with a sweet, creamy sauce - very different).  All were great.  Each taco has a double corn tortilla and is a pretty good size but not enormous.  I was stuffed.  Some of the more gourmet tacos are a small upcharge, but for 50 cents or a dollar per taco go ahead and splurge! The help-yourself salsa bar had about a dozen different house-made salsas including pico de gallo, peanut, pecan, cilantro, guacamole, and many more.  My two favorites: chile de Arbol (smoky & a little spicy) and seven chiles (mild, chunky chiles and charred red onion). Horchata: is a large 32 oz and has strawberries & almonds to make it more festive than your normal horchata. Because this place advertises itself for "gourmet tacos" we didn't even look much at the rest of the large menu. A lot of people around us ordered burritos. Location: the few parking spots out front on the main street were full so we parked down the side street, slightly nervous about the loudly-arguing people across the street, then the crazy-talking-out-loud-to-herself person with the shopping cart on the corner.  But the food was worth it and our rental car was still there and intact when we returned. Customers included a combination of locals and tourists.  We had a twenty minute wait for a table of two around 6:30 on a Saturday night.  It was well worth the wait.  Will make it a point to try this one again when we're back in Phoenix.

KQl9v-LO-oT8b4E0O7XLWw.text: THE GOOD: cilantro crema salsa is still divine. salsa bar is still fun. drinky drink bar has been opened and liquor license granted since my initial 4-star review.  THE BAD: la condesa has gone well downhill in terms of food quality since i visited years ago. the crispy, delicious shrimp tacos i raved about previously are no longer the same menu item. they've replaced the large, succulent shrimp with smaller specimens that were decidedly not tasty or even beer battered. service still spotty.  THE UGLY: the food doesn't taste like there is a thoughtful process in its creation any more. have they changed owners? everything we ordered here was run-of-the-mill, not ravingly good as we'd experienced previously. the fish in their tacos was fishy, which is never a sign of freshness.  so disappointed because a meal here used to be worth a special trip.

JUmPYtldCCCsm0TqzS42Ww.text: This place is amazing, once again, this place rocks. Today I had the Quezadilla with Argentine beef and chimichurri sauce, fresh avocados, just to die for!!! I would ditch any overprice mexican restaurant for the oportunity to eat here, they kick butt!!  If you like the gourmet food from Cancun, then you will not be desapointed!!!

6fCprb_Lsq2suN1Qs04rbA.text: Do like to try new salsas? Do you love Mexican food?? Well then this restaurant is the store for you. I came upon this hidden gem by mistake, what drew me in was the nice piece of art of a lady on the front of the restaurant. Walking in it's very small but, don't let that discourage you from eating there. Starting of they have different types of salsas the peanut salsa, pecan salsa, and many more. First I thought ewww peanut and pecan salsa?? I was so wrong don't judge a book by it's cover the salsas where delicious! I ordered the shark tacos omg they where yummy I was licking my fingers lol and didn't care who saw I was happy enjoying my plate. With the plate came beans and rice, the rice was moist and soft. One thing have to applaud is the lady that was our server I totally should of asked for her name she needs to be recognized on top of being a friendly employee she also has integrity. Let me explain, so I basically ate and left on my way home I was looking for my most precious thing ugh oh my cell phone where is it?? We all know that scary sad feeling. To make things short I went back to the restaurant and who was there at the cashier greeting me with a smile and raising my phone up high the wonderful employee! So YES I totally recommend going here the restaurant, the employees, and even the food totally 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All sorts of different salsas
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baka shark tacos

66kBSSDYX2lM0GtWbPNhmg.text: La Condesa is an amazing little spot that has more than food, but charm as well. I really enjoyed the way that the restaurant was decorated; it definitely creates its own vibe, and it's not painted with a lot of loud colors (there are a ton of pictures of the decor if you look at the pictures). It's very classy to say the least.  The salsa bar is the first thing that I have to mention. It was overflowing with variety and flavor. Every time that I thought I'd found one that I liked, I tried another and pushed the previous aside. My girlfriend and I managed to polish of two baskets of chips without a problem or remorse because we had to try every salsa. The tamatillo and cilantro were two of my favorites in the mix.   We also ordered the Mayan Conchinita Pibil tacos and the Aztec Tinga tacos. I'm usually hesitant about chicken on tacos because I usually always have bad experiences, but not here! The tinga taco was great. The meat was tender and well marinated - I could taste the sauce in every bite. The conchinita though is what really won me over. The pork was so good! Imagine the tenderness and juiciness or your favorite BBQ pork sandwich, but replace the flavor with a bevy of delicious Mexican spices and we'll pretty much be on the same level.  I'm pretty baffled that I didn't see a lot of my Yelp friends raving about this place. As a result, I will send this review out to you all (go try it =) ). This is a great little place that isn't pricey yet brings great flavor. The next time I got there I will be getting a quesa, no question, and hopefully I will be going back very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mayan Conchinita

AhDpGcbVZyOSHsK7dCyBjA.text: There really are few words to describe how perfect the food is, how delectable the salas are, how great the waitstaff is, and how awesome the vibe is. Sufficeth to say, we come here at least twice a month (we have to hold ourselves back!).  Since my husband's from SoCal and I'm a born and bred Austinite, we both grew up eating delicious Mexican food. But I have to say that La Condesa truly beats out even my favorite spots in San Diego or Austin (sorry, hometown! you still have the best migas!). They are truly Taco Royalty.  Our favorite tacos: Mayan Cochinita Pibil, Arrachera (carne asada), the El Guacho, and the shark taco. Also, you must try their margaritas and horchata!

3I40QgyuhBFMY6xNyRGJEg.text: Whhat? I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. It is by far, one of my favorite taco shops in all of Phoenix. Authentic. Quality. Delicious.   When you first come in you get chips and can start experiencing the amazing salsa bar. Each flavor isn't just thrown together, but put together with thought and care. I have favorites, but they are all pretty tasty.  Follow that up with some amazing food (I personally love the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco plate with double rice). Then you can wash it down with a, not-so-traditional, but in a good way Horchata.   They will then drop the bill off and you will be pleasantly surprised that you had such an delicious, fresh meal for such a reasonable price.

nn205cC4sTOBaLYhb1cJYA.text: Huge and delicious Horchata! Strawberry salsa! Shrimp taco!  Those are what I had at my first visit. First it a little bit hard to find the place because we did not know exactly where this place is located at. Once we stepped inside, the artwork on the wall blew us away.   We started off with the chips and 10 different kinds of Salsa. This is the incredible ideas since none of us love the same kinds of Salsa. I loved Strawberry one. My husband loved 7 chilies. Others also love different kinds, such as green chili and jicama.  Then our meals arrived shortly after. A basket full of tacos, rice and bean. They are all delicious and I have never had the shrimp tacos this good before.  I am glad that La Condesa is not to far from where we live. It is our new spot to go get some delicious food.

-EqDe4VnMumsuGrXeovp2w.text: I really want to give them five stars. I love: the art, the atmosphere, the super friendly servers.   I think I would have loved many of the salsas, but they ran out of cups & had small plates to put the salsas on instead. Dude, it's really hard to dunk a tortilla chip into a plate of salsa. I tried the cilantro & the tomatillo & both were great, but couldn't muster the effort trying to scrape another flavor off the bottom of a plate.  The Mayan pork taco was damn near perfect, but I thought the chicken mole was a little too much on the sweet side.

epPQXalU6Q-ceUHpcnnCqQ.text: Salsa Bar, Mole Quesadilla, Chochinita Pibil, Tacos Al Pastor and Sonora Arrechera Tacos where really tasty and perfectly balanced. I loved every single bit. I cleaned the plate like never before my family did 2. Great horchata and decor of the restaurant, can't wait to comeback for more!!

ap9wKT0sfHCOyUyD7n2m9g.text: Great food and salsa bar. Get there early or late for lunch. I've been there five times had different items each time and loved them. Mole is awesome.

VoZF1omUqLJ7o7BwgNfZIg.text: The salsa bar is the reason to go. They also have a full bar with a bunch of tequila options as well. The restaurant is kind of dark and small but I'm kind of into that so I liked it. They are vegetarian as well as vegan friendly, limited options but still always appreciated.

ykUAnxoEFNAMluUdtyyIiQ.text: This place is great... Thanks yelp for this place in town for a convention. Needed to find a lace with margaritas and tacos. Both exceeded expectations. Best place in phx that I have tried so far.

0o7_U-OUV4Y2riOFm9eEjw.text: Tiiiiiiny little place, but with very cool decor[ artists exhibiting their paintings], day of the dead theme.Not that it -matters-, because with the food that is served here, it could be all paper plates and plastic cups and I do not think anyone would -care-. We came here on a sunday evening, with a -very- hyperactive 5 year old in tow-as the restaurant itself is -very- small, even the smallest sounds he made felt like they would bring on an avalanche- or maybe I was just self conscious, as no one seemed to mind. The staff were very attentive and kind, the food arrived super quickly. And now onto the food-O M G I had the Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken tacos- they were incredible.Rich, thick, delicious, amazingggggggly good. My son had Mayan Cochinita Pibil tacos[banana leaf roasted pork shoulder], and though usually I do not like pork, but from what I had of his, was delicious. Husband had Aztec Tinga[shredded chicken] bowl, with a fresh tortilla the size of a UFO saucer. There is a salsa bar with about 12-16 different, freshly made salsa;from pico de gallo to more exotic offerings such as strawberry salsa[the bomb], creamy cilantro salsa, creamy cashew .etc etc.All were super fresh and very tasty. We will definitely be back-the mole sauce alone was worth the drive!

qIUl3AULSwZCWRY6H030kQ.text: Love love love.  Favorite thing on the menu is the gaucho burro - it's so good I don't waiver from that.  The salsa bar is an obvious plus too.

7npdYDvG6GQ9SKPfF_hG1g.text: Tacos were amazing.  Period. Very tasty and flavorful. The refried beans were house made and delicious. This review is not for the drinks. My margarita was ok. And for the price of $8 it was meh. Next time I'll have a $5 Mexican beer and I'll know what I'm getting. The Service was great and they made the most of the small space and were flipping tables as fast as they could. The salsa bar had an array of about 15 flavors ranging from super spicy to very mild. I'll be back for more tacos soon.

4yyaitIRw7gQY1ToMYM1_Q.text: Definitely one of favorite restaurants ever. Everything from their margaritas to their burritos to their salsa is so awesome. Their speciality burrito is my favorite.

GkyPt8c5ADFiVNQ8WDwvfQ.text: What is there to say about La Condesa? It's simply amazing.   I'll admit, we found this place searching for more of a day-to-day, less expensive version of Barrio Cafe. We found that and more. In our one month since we've moved to Phoenix, we've eaten here three times. By far the best item we've had is the fried quesadilla with mole chicken. Oh, and the horchata. Best. Horchata. Ever. It's not your typical horchata, so watch out. Mole poblano tacos are also heaven, as is the cochinita pibil. Salsa bar is to die for.   I love the hole in the wall vibe. Only bad moment was that I got trapped in the bathroom, but that was my fault. I swear the door opens out, not in. This place is super casual. Plastic cups and nothing fancy, but the vibe is uber awesome. It is very small, and seating can be limited, but it always seems to work out. I don't recommend this place for very large groups.   We'll be back, about once a week.

Uro108fHpBdZiUF8OI3rYg.text: Ok so my friend hyped this place up pretty high. "Best tacos ever". I thought, yea right. But he wasn't kidding. Awesome salsa bar. Vegetarian options. Only drawback is the seating (our table was uneven/wobbly and it was a bit crowded- close together tables and pretty much full)

JQfKSFb0F_0LiDVkstvGxA.text: The service was a little bit slow but worth the wait after visiting here from the East Coast it was great to get some real authentic Mexican food I had the shark tacos & recommend to everyone

YTSc15lWybkZr5CgptIF9A.text: Loved the salsa bar - we went with another couple and we ate 3 baskets of chips because we had so much fun sampling all the salsas. My wife and I shared the burrito and she wasn't even able to finish half of a burrito - great serving sizes. The only downside was the place was packed and nowhere to wait for a table inside. Looking forward to going back though!

StMMkXFuQjtgmd6jptICWg.text: If the food and salsa weren't off the hook incredible, I would have given just 1 star.  Apparently I went to LCGTS on a really bad night.  But they pulled off a tasty miracle.  My pal and I went to LCGTS on our way to see Cheech and Chong at the Dodge Theater.  So we were up for some good Mexican food munchies.  We walk in and there is a line... okay no big deal.  BUT there were no forks (we had to eat with spoons and fingers).  There were no napkins, and the salsa bar was bone dry.  I mean the salsa trays looked like they had been licked clean by a starving dog.  They were able to replenish the salsa but they completely ran out of forks.  We got no chips and no drinks.  We had to beg the poor, nice girl who was completely stressed out.  They were a tad understaffed.  It was a "trip".    But somehow they managed to bring out my dish.... a Chicken Mole burrito and a Carne Asada Steak taco.  OMG were they amazing.  The flavors of those dishes and the flavors of the AMAZING salsa were just super.  The meat in that taco was cooked to perfection.  Crusty bits of steak that had a crunchy sear but were still very tender on the inside.  I didn't mind not having a fork.  While we were there, they LOCKED the door, just like Cheech Marin did in the Vampire den in "From Dusk till Dawn".  We were locked in as prisoners.  Apparently they were closing down at 6:45 p.m. due to being understaffed and not having forks or more salsa.  Luckily, my buddy and I were the last people to be served.  I will definitely go back.

iZyeOM6auPYVbsgZNIyy3w.text: I enjoy both authentic Mexican tacos and excellent variations of the originals. The restaurant offers both. The simple and delicious street style tacos are as good as the ones cooked on the carts on the side of the streets in Mexico. The shrimp taco was also divine. The salsa bar was a treat. The chips were just ok.

XgbQ8Hp4yR_LDYhth-PXkA.text: I keep coming back because the I simply love their tacos. I'm pescatarian (seafood only, no other meat), but I've shared meals here with vegetarians  and my dining guests always say they plan to come back. I love the veggie taco and the vegan option, and usually pair one of them with either a shrimp or mahi mahi. Always delicious (and, of course, the salsa bar if great!)

YTimG7CqxidDMU62gnS8pA.text: I am beyond picky when it comes to Mexican food, having grown up in Phoenix. I eat here weekly since I work down the street. The meats are seasoned perfectly, the salsa bar is amazing (try the creamy cilantro), everything including the guac is fresh and the price is right. Waitstaff is very pleasant. Eat here.

9yyKtZy5yLuhGCDnQMPikw.text: I love this place. It is small, casual, great food, they have Victoria beer, margaritas are just okay, salsa bar is really great, prices and portion sizes are more than reasonable. I definitely recommend this place.

UxK6tptaZK_btdjeHKplEg.text: Ok, some of the salsa sound a little strange. Try them. They are awesome. Mole tacos are delicious, so are the dog fish ones. The burros are huge. Great service, even when busy. The horchata is a nice way to finish a meal.

7kKzZU1suR_IW7TpM6CpTQ.text: I ordered the el pastor and carne asada tacos, and they were great. The wife got the shrimp tacos. They had great flavor, but the shrimp was a little small with a lot of batter. Unfortunately the batter became a little soggy and diminished the great plate. Overall, good food. The freshly made horchata was the most amazing drink I have had in years.....a must have every single visit. The dinning room area is really small, few seats which means it fills up fast. Service was mediocre, not a very personable experience.

gPxfn91NnLDy39563_BmFQ.text: The Mayan Cochinita Pibil tacos are AMAZING. These tacos have really impressed me. The horchata is also a great treat. They add strawberry, melon and nuts. I'm not vegetarian but i try not to eat so much meat and their veggie tacos are sooo good. Cheese, peppers, onions and mushrooms. My mouth is watering just thinking about them. I took away 1 star because sometimes the service is very slow, although i will say the last time i went they seemed to be working on it.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

p2GMcLJ3rpvnlaz7Vso_UQ.text: Oh My Goodness!! Husband is Mexican - we're from Chicago - have NEVER had such fabulous food outside of Mexico City! Were there on vaca and went one night - loved the tacos (the Tinga chicken was SOOOO tasty!) and the salsas are so fun and interesting and tasty!  Had to go back one more time before we left and ordered the DEEP FRIED QUESADILLAS!!! O.M.G. pas deaux - it was AH MAY ZING!!! One of the best fried foods I have ever tasted - and the cheese, and the chicken tinga..... mmmmmmm -   Booking another flight to Phoenix as I write this....

pbgPIeZJ5q40agb_w45lSg.text: Been here twice now. Think I have sampled a bit of everything. Tried three different kind of tacos (chicken, beef, and fish), a burro (carne asada), and a quesadilla (ground beef). Everything was really good.   The quesadilla is quite a bit different then other quesadillas I have had. Much thicker. More like a stuffed gordita. Was really good.  Small place. No wait was I was there, but I can easily see there being one. Salsa bar is fantastic.

c47MbpGfLhdOw96xywVycQ.text: The food was very good and very fresh.  Trying out the different salsas was cool - I have never eaten anywhere that had that.  The price was right!  I had a huge meal, beer and horchata for $20.  That said, the food did not blow my mind. 4 stars seems about right.

0uUWFl1bHHfn4L9R-t8Aqg.text: Such a cute, unique place. All of the tacos are amazing (pulled pork, carne asada, grilled shrimp), carne asada burro is also very different & delicious!!!   Looks shady from the outside, but that's what makes it even better, & a great find.

gjYzNZsaldx__-DhSvVDng.text: Chicken Mole taco and Salsa Bar to D-I-E for...just sayin! sick happy!

BTFffTjqbhUDlnJ94OZ6gw.text: have been here several times - love it.  authentic, good food always. their salsa bar rocks the house, great variety and savory choices.  had dark mole egg dish with black beans  LOVED IT

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. yummy salsas
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. great choices
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. dark mole with eggs - SO TASTY

agByuHJPU-J-sWO94aJF2g.text: Had lunch with a friend of mine after dress shopping and this is officially one of my best taco spots in town. I've struggled in finding an authentic taco place in Phoenix since I moved from Mexico (ironic, considering the amount of Mexicans living here), but I found it! The salsa bar is my favorite part, but try the shrimp tacos, the gaucho taco and the maya taco, you won't regret it. No sour cream or cheddar cheese non-sense here! Pure authentic Mexican fare (I lived in Mexico for 27 years, I know what I'm talking about!) Make sure you're here early, lunch time is packed, but is totally worth the wait.  Tip: It's easier to park around the corner.

-HwrFQL8yL347sgCVUdbzQ.text: Mixed feelings about this place - the food was great, the salsa bar awesome, and the service really bad.  I really like the filling choices,  especially in a taco.  Their quesadillas are like a thick fry bread, I though they we're too greasy but everyone else raved.  Leave extra time to check out, it took longer than the meal.

Rbx3q_U8PitTapxcAtVyWA.text: Well... couldn't help it... gotta bump this up to a perfect five stars after our last visit. Our first visit we tried every taco on the menu... this time we tried a quesadilla, an Oaxacan Black Mole Burro, and for good measure a regular old bean burrito because we wanted to try their beans. On top of that I just had to get another 'Dogfish Shark' taco because it was my favorite, and instead of the Horchata we tried their Jamaica drink...mmm.   The quesadilla was very different, made with a really thick corn tortilla with sour cream drizzled all over it... damn good. Perfect to tear pieces off of and dip in the different salsas. The two burros we tried were equally tasty... and just like last time the chips were spot on. What's not to love about this place? It's just one of those 'easy to fall in love with' little holes in the wall.   I think I'd give just about anything for them to start selling their salsa's to-go... especially after our last visit and finally being able to try the much talked about strawberry salsa; it really is as good as everyone says it is... heaven in a sauce basically. Whoever the mad scientist is behind these salsas really deserves a pat on the back, because I'm hooked.   From what I've been hearing this place is slowly starting to get busier and busier... it puts a smile on my face to see good food and good businesses succeed based on word of mouth. In my ideal world there'd be a La Condessa on every other corner, instead of a Taco Bell... eh, baby steps I guess. 5/5.

n3AzVaQBObmOBsj5wb84DA.text: My definition of Central Phoenix ended at around the 12ths on both sides, but this place and Urban Beans have taught me the folly of my ways.  Condessa is a simple and beautiful spot, serving a different, more expansive menu than most of the other Mexican restaurants I've been sampling.  First impressions won me over on first step in, I am in love with the Dios los Muertos art aesthetic and they have some beautiful works adorning their walls and doors.  The self-described gourmet menu was enticing, many selections I've never seen in person, only read about in my food travel readings, so I was intrigued.  I really wish I was more hungry, I settled on the Queso which was recommended by my server.  The food takes a bit of time to prepare, but that does give you time to enjoy the salsa bar, which this day included 10 varieties including strawberry, chipolte, a creamy cilantro, guac, pico, can't remember them all.  When my Queso came I was a bit shocked by it's size and relativity to fry-bread, not that this is a bad thing.  The pork inside was unbelievable, comparable in portion size and taste to that of much more expensive places.  Fried cheesy porky goodness, topped with rotating different salsas, each bite was another slice of heaven.  My gripes:  I have much respect for the work they put in to make this food outstanding, but they are shooting themselves in the foot with the plastic silverware,  cheap baskets and togo cups.  I know doing dishes is annoying, but you need to match your great food with great accoutrement.  After writing this, I'm going back today.  Yum.

RwzcEajVh4I6iqI8sA-9rw.text: The Countess, she is beautiful, she is talented, she is delightful and she is bountiful, she is saucy (in the "salsa" sense of the word, not the "descarado" sense of the word:)...she's also cheap:) But then again, so am I:) It's Taco Tuesday (as I write this...who knows when I'll finish it and post it...maybe next Taco Tuesday...maybe not:) But today, I needed to retox after my run along the mighty Scottsdale River (or the Crosscut Canal as the flatlanders refer to it:) I was going to wander over to Cien Agave, when my buddy called and said he'd gotten done with an open heart surgery early (usually, that's a very bad sign, but not today...he said everything went "swimmingly":) but after 12 hours of holding someone's life in his hands, he too was in need of a retox:) We agreed that it was time to go see The Countess:) I've seen a bunch of glowing reviews on good ol' Yelp and as I always do when I read the praise heaped on a particular place by my Yelp brethren and sistren, I thought "I'll be the judge of that!":) Not that I don't trust the reviews...I do, or I wouldn't have jumped in the rig, pulled the belts tight and lit the turbocharger in order to get my retox going:) No..."trust, but verify"...those words were given to all of us during an episode of Death Valley Days by a nearly washed up actor (whose name escapes me at the moment)... tinyurl.com/yfg9e39 Well, it's all True enough...the black mole chicken is subtle but spicy...the cochinita is saucy and inviting...the dog shark taco may be made with the only fish that travels well to the desert (no, don't get too excited...not the best fish taco I ever had...but very good:) And more than enough to eat from an inexpensive platter of softball sized tacos (I know, I called The Countess "cheap" a few paragraphs ago, but what I meant was a solid value:)...Two big, round, tumescent taco's with rice and frijoles'...$7.59, USD:) And plenty of salsa...oh yes...lots and lots of salsa...saucy, saucy salsa:) None of the legendary "strawberry salsa" today (probably like the Yeti...plenty of sightings, but no actual evidence:)...but I didn't care...they still had a dozen salsas to choose from:) And all the salsas seemed to complement my taco's...how is it even possible that Peanut Salsa and Smokey Chipotle Salsa BOTH taste exquisite with the moles and the pork shoulder? I don't know...I asked my buddy...he's a trained physician and he didn't know either (so what good is he?...unless I need a heart transplant and then, you know...he's a god:) As I contemplated all of the fresh and interesting selections available at the salsa bar, I thought to myself "well, it's a bar, why don't I just pull up a chair and make a day of it?" :-) After The Countess herself came out and asked me to please eat at my own table and quit embarrassing myself and my lunch buddies, I remembered that this kind of thing is what got me banned from the Top of the Mark in San Francisco (although I will tell you what I told the SFPD...having a Caviar Bar with bar stools in close proximity is just asking for it:) We finished our delightful lunch without further incident and agreed that this place should be much closer to our respective homes and open 24/7 so we can walk over and grab a burro or a platter of tacos whenever we feel like it...which would be pretty much every day, for at least 2 meals:) Do you think The Countess will go for that?

Aax2E0CRNTWmE5kwwhdYUg.text: Wow...this place really knocked my socks off.  This is exactly what Phoenix needs, a cool place to eat great Sonoran/Mexican food.  The owners sure had a nice vision and succeded in creating a great spot for the neighborhood.  The tacos and quesadilla I've had here was nothing less than spectacular.  Having lots of flavor and not skimping on the portions. The salsa bar is quite fun as well with many different and uniques choices to choose from.  Never seen so many salsas offered anywhere else and I'm sure I will make it through all of them with my many visits to follow.  Keeping the flavor of the area being on the edge of a very artsy neighborhood the decor is amazing.  Vibrant paintings all around and murals on the bathroom doors definitely makes this place stand out with style.  This place is a must see for anyone who likes great food and culture.  Take a deep breath before you walk in and inhale an experience I am sure you will remember.

lRYsIHPI5Ub5942AE-sgjg.text: It says something when I've gone to this place 3 times in two weeks. It's a gem. The tacos are amazing. I love the fish tacos but the salsa bar is a huge plus. They have something for everyone and everything is delicious. Everyone I've taking there has enjoyed their meal.

-VhL5jq_-41JFVGXXxMlpg.text: Kool small joint, reminds me of the Mission District in my old San Fran hood.  Authentic street food. Cheap prices, strong salty Patron Margaritas. Insane horchata in  a huge glass ?40 oz???   Ridiculous slow service on Saturday nights.  Chips not salted but thats ok because of the kick ass salsa collection.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dia de something!?!

zV1kicaPXv2cWH7lNf_9yQ.text: Oh Food Network, how you have let me down. Honestly, I should have known better because Guy Fieri seems to always think everything that goes into his mouth in his show Diners Drive-Ins and Dives is "dynamite." Seriously, I mean, has he ever said anything negative? I've been to many restaurants he had endorsed on his show and have generally been disappointed... La Santisima would be on that list as well. I can't just blame Guy though, because Yelp also has raving reviews for it. Perculiar...  I came here an hour before closing time on a Wednesday. No wait. We were given a complimentary basket of freshly fried tortilla chips. I was impressed when I was told by the waitress of their selection of 18 sauces at the sauce station. Who doesn't love sauce?! Unfortunately I tried nearly half of them and none of them really stood out. For my meal, I decided to order the tacos since that is what they are known for. I got three a la carte gourmet tacos which were $3.99 a piece: pacific white fish taco, aztec tinga taco, and el gaucho taco. They all tasted just okay which was a disappointment because from all the reviews I was expecting some sort of out-of-body experience when, in fact, I've had way better tacos just about everywhere else. I had a taste of my husband's chicken quesadilla (I think the La Santisima Specialities Quesa) which I thought was actually better than the tacos. Still not awesome, but better. The crust was thick which is unlike any quesadillas I've had before. The quesadilla comes in a rather large portion and is very hearty.   Overall, this place is definitely overhyped. I rather have Taco Bell.

RpXZlqUGmhpd0rHYmNe_nQ.text: It was ok but not great. We are use to authentic not Tex Mex or Southwest or whatever most places here in AZ are making. It seems so strange to be so close to Mexico but not be able to find really good Mexican food. Tacos are small. Salsa bar sounded good but mostly weird stuff like strawberry salsa. Parking is impossible. No pork green chili?! What the hell is green sauce? Yuck

jJQW-yYP9pwwnEgC9KyTrQ.text: I was not impressed with this place even though it received good reviews from a local news source. The staff was not very friendly and the food was ok.  The price was steep compared to other local mexican food restaurants.  I had to eat the chips with no salsa since they were out.

I98dg3oZZj92KX9Fk4oYtg.text: Yes. Just yes. If you go, do the carne asada tacos. They were delicious and very decently priced. The beans tasted like homemade, honest to goodness refried beans. The salsas were all really interesting and the chips were nice and crunchy. I will definitely return!  Edit: went back a second time with my husband's family and even though there was 6 of us, we were treated very well by staff and I'm assuming owner. Great experience once again!!!

udQV3dpNwQNXzSDPCmfoCA.text: Came across this place on yelp and needed to fill up after our flight in. The food was beyond my expectations; I ordered the mole burro and it was amazing. The mole was the best I'd ever had - chocolatey, nutty and savory/sweet. The accompanying rice was a standout for me too. We ordered the caramel flan and that was amazing too. Go here.

QnJh8lZtQVZAQSBGfkG6NQ.text: Ate here with my wife several times, and have brought friends. The good is always great. I love the gaucho tacos (I order them every time), but honestly everything is good. The salsa bar is also a lot of fun. I plan to keep coming back!

vB0xY4Y1FoAKE1qjEDC9ig.text: Holy cow!!  Easy the best taco joint I've been to in AZ.  Unbelievable variety.  Shark, marlin, mole, al pastor, grilled cactus, million-hour slow roasted pork shoulder, on and on.  Three of us tried about 10, and every one was incredible.  As good as the tacos were, I would go back and eat nothing but the chips and salsa bar.  The salsa variety was amazing.  Never had anything like it.  And to top it off, they have a specialty horchata with strawberries, cantaloupe, pecans and who knows what else.  Not a huge horchata fan, but this was magic.  Can't wait to go back!!!

EbfGORYwFpeA3ZOideUXFg.text: Salsa Bar is still on point. I feel like with the expansion its not as cozy and the music did not match the restaurant any more. Food was still great and the Horchata is still MVP. Service was still great, I just personally enjoyed the place when it was smaller. The air conditioning was a bit to cold even though it was 115 out! All in all not a bad place to grab a bite.

2QdMGBluopEh76fIqmIjcg.text: I was looking for a quick street taco fix and what I found was La Santisima.  Calling it a gourmet taco shop is fitting and more importantly the price was right!  The list of Mexican restaurants and taco shops is endless in Phoenix and while I can't possibly try them all, I have at least found one I thoroughly enjoy.  From the quality of meat, to the portions, to the highly touted salsa bar, this place delivers on all levels!  I started with a half order of guacamole to compliment my assortment of chosen salsas.  Their guac tends toward the chunky side mixed with red onion, tomato, mango, and cilantro.  The chips were disappointing, but they served their purpose of sampling salsas and the guac.  I also heard great things about the horchata, which I can never pass up when available.  First of all, it comes in a massive 32 oz cup.  I would definitely share this with somebody else next time.  It's also loaded with strawberries and mangos, which I initially thought seemed unnecessary, but provided a unique twist.  The fruit proved difficult to fit through the straw, so maybe I'll order without in the future.  I ordered 3 of the gourmet tacos - El Gaucho Taco, Baja Sur Shark Taco, and Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco. All were $3.99 and excellent and I would say the Cochonita Pibil was the best I tried!  It went really well with the salsa cilantro, a cream based cilantro salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Clockwise from left: El Gaucho Taco, Baja Sur Shark Taco, and Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco. All were $3.99 and excellent!!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and half order of guac. The guac was great but the chips were just ok.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Storefront

bbPRpgmMBnxDnTWzFi9iPg.text: This is one of the best (if not the best) places for tacos in the Phoenix area. We've tried several different tacos and quesadillas and everything has been delicious. It's also the closest I've seen to authentic Mexican in Phoenix. The variety of salsas makes it fun to eat these dishes.

uXMUYEZUsZV_3oPv3G3WoQ.text: Every once in a while yelp is just flat out wrong and that is the case with la santisima taco shop.  Every review makes you think it will be amazing, but the reality is that the food is ok, but there are much better places to eat in Phoenix.    So what is wrong with this place?  First off, what the heck kind of quesadilla are the making?  I am still not sure.  Why fry a tortilla and throw some cheese in the middle, it just doesn't make any sense to me.  I love quesadillas, but this one was not good.  Second, the "carne asada" was not good.   It just didn't have much flavor.  The only burrito that I liked was the shrimp burrito, although I didn't realize that it had mushrooms in it, which was disappointing.   The salsa bar is very good.  The tortilla chips are ok.  The location leaves a little bit to be desired and so does the food.    I am sure many will go to this place based on yelp, but I was not impressed.

omnjB5bC3Zgh7X5Qhn4jFQ.text: I've been coming to La Santisima for 8 years. The service has always been slow but the food was always hot and spot on.  Recently they switched management and now the food is going downhill. The tacos are smaller, salsa bar is always half full and quality is poor. My go to taco is the Mexi Mignon. It's a grilled piece of filet mignon with a homemade slaw and fried cheese. This taco is out of this world good. However, my last visit they used chopped steak, no slaw, different sauce and fried cheese. This is a $10 taco. I will not be coming back until they bring the quality of their food back. Shame on the owners for cutting corners on what was the best taco place in  AZ.

AxBNBJ3OvyDMO61VeCFmDA.text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! Everything here is fabulous. The drinks the food and the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VbjOyKNYNehWDTpoYY0zRQ.text: A hidden gem down the street from my work. The salsa bar is ON POINT! So delish! And the Ghandi burrito (ironically with chicken added) is very fresh and so yummy. I definitely recommend going here. The service is sometimes slow at the high times, so try to avoid that if possible. They have doubled their business side, which has definitely helped.  Don't miss out!

qv1RlGAm6z7t89DHGE8Naw.text: I'm in town from a place where we don't have Mexican food (how could I live in such a place?). We went to three taco shops in three days. This was the best - rich flavors and tortillas which held up to salsa!! My friend had a Norteno green chile burro - she couldn't stop talking about it, either. I can't wait to go back on my next visit to AZ!

VTvISn7x7Nh_ACi7Gzw29g.text: We came here randomly on our house hunting trip to Phoenix and have been going back ever since. Their food is excellent as is their salsa bar. We alway take out of town guests and it remains our go to for great, affordable, and authentic Mexican food!

9Ts_hLJTL9D61QdTpMiH1A.text: My boyfriend and I are here visiting in AZ for the holiday weekend and we found this AWESOME place!!!! So stoked when we walked in and saw Guy Fierri's photo Nd signature. The place did not disappoint (although I'll admit we did question it at first because of the way it looked on the outside and the area...) The meat and salsas from the salsa bar were D E L I C I O U S !!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

O8LhbJ8k8rsgaDeAsKd9Bw.text: My grand finally in Scottsdale came the evening I went to La Santisima.   I wanted to some good Mexican food before I left the west coast,  so I looked this place up and based on the Yelp reviews I made the journey.   It was about a 35 minute drive from my hotel in Scottsdale,  but well worth the trip.     The place isn't that big,  but it's very clean and pretty traditional.   The whole time I was there I heard bob Marley playing.   It was odd,  but cool at the same time since I expected mariachi music playing.   Anyhow,  me and my friends placed our orders and came to the salsa bar.   This had to have had the most variety in salsa that I've seen.   Tasted a few salsas for my chips and ordered a few alcoholic drinks which were fantastic.   I tried the peach margarita and my friend had the strawberry one.   The food was also delicious!  I had the asada burrito smothered and my friend had the chicken quesadilla.    The quesadilla is pretty stuffed and filling.   I would definitely come back and have lunch or dinner here in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WC9uiWZ2sKmdH8HtRd0Nkw.text: First thing, the food is freaking good. I never thought refried beans could actually be delicious and the margaritas were super flavorful. We had 4 different tacos and all of them were outstanding.   One giant negative.....the lighting. They have 4 light bulbs lighting the whole restaurant. They have this great salsa bar that is their calling card and you literally can not see what you are selecting. They also have a beautiful, ornate, hand carved bar that is completely dark.   The service is outstanding and the clientele is a great mix, from hipster to subarban.

mqBI5Lfm-hkvd3fADQvSRA.text: My wife and I found this place when our friends moved to the area. We love it! It's small and a little cramped but the people who run the place ( I believe it's family-owned) are always pleasant to us. Being Caucasian, this isn't always the case when we go into other Mexican restaurants. I love El Goucho Burro. The salsa bar is fantastic. I like that they bring you a glass bottle (about a liter) of water at the beginning of the meal. My wife is pregnant so we usually go a little early so we don't have to worry about seating but when normal dinner hours role around the place gets pretty packed. Great food - my mouth is watering as I write this.   The could probably splurge to fix their front door. It does slam when people go in and out.

KhFopEx2_pEMge9dGS2GkA.text: What a great find. Lots of salsas you never have seen before. Lots of menu choices & the margaritas are excellent. A great lesson to not judge a book by its cover! If you want a change to the traditional tex-mex, this is the place. It's also near the airport, so it was great to get something quick, delicious, and convenient.

IG1vDNE2JFsYpxC59GFVHA.text: It's nice and spicy with hand-hewn wood decor and interesting recipes and salsas, but after two visits I have to say it's just not all that fabulous.  The tortillas are factory, not freshly made.  The salsa bar has a lot of options, but nothing on the bar stood out as much better than anything you'd find on Baja Fresh's salsa bar.  Service was confusing and wait staff was confused. Transition from counter service to table service after the lunch hour wasn't handled well. I was seated and given a menu but no one took my order, so I ordered and paid at the counter. Then at the end of the meal, other waiters kept asking if I wanted to pay my check.  La Condesa is good enough, but I'm not impressed.

ereuVwt-6dn4tU2zTdw_3A.text: Stopped in for lunch. Had the dark mole shrimp tacos. Delicious, with a great salsa bar. I like the atmosphere of a small place with good tacos.

_40VryFC8GlorRiQyWqBmw.text: I want to say don't go here... Why? Because my wife and I loved it so much on our first visit to La Condesa that we selfishly want to keep it a secret from others.  The food was really good and such a unique sampling of traditional Mexican food dishes, with a twist.  The mole was to die for and the shark tacos were amazing.  The rice is also so tasty and I am not usually a rice kind of guy.  I always forgo ordering the traditional side of rice & beans and initially I did the same on our visit.  But my wife ordered the rice with her meal and after seeing and tasting hers, I actually added that to my order even though we already had received our food.  Everyone has already mentioned the amazing salsa bar so I won't repeat the accolades other than to say what a journey of amazing and unique concoctions, coupled with a few of the standard salsas.  Have to recommend the cilantro salsa if you go and be prepared to order more chips if you want to take the salsa adventure and try them all!!!  Gets pretty packed during the standard rush hour periods but worth the wait and if you plan accordingly (noon or early dinner meal), you can avoid the surge.  Definitely one of my favorite taco places in Phoenix.  Ray

5q98MW_5hZE-mrRelxwvWA.text: Solid offerings and an excellent salsa bar make this dive taco bar one of the places you must visit in Phoenix.  I haven't frequented other taco bars in the area so I can't comment on how it stacks up.  However, I think if you are charging higher prices for tacos they should include the rice and beans if you order two, or be packed to the brim with filling.  I must admit I was a bit jealous when my brother got his pibil taco, as this seemed to be one of the more filled-tacos on the menu.  The shark was outstanding and had great flavor.  Seating is at a premium so be careful with larger groups. You may just want to get them togo, sit on the curb outside and have yourself an authentic Mexican experience. I'll definitely visit again next time I'm in the area.  I could see myself pouring that Cilantro salsa on some fries to make for an excellent side dish.

CbMa_tV9FS00dnzkFcCssQ.text: Amazing Mexican food really good place. Service was very good all the staff is very nice. I would definitely come back and recommend this place! Five stars!!

-mpmOY3926jS1ZWQ6O62ug.text: Wow this place deserves the great reviews, I'm from out of town and was visiting this week. La Condesa is close to the airport so allow yourself an extra hour and go try it.   I had the shark taco and the cochonita pork taco. Excellent! The pork had a strong tangy flavor to it, the pickled onions on top kind of had a strange taste. The shark was beer battered and very tender crispy on the outside. Great tastes on both.   The salsa bar is impressive with done really unique styles of salsa, some even have pecan flavor in them! What?  I also had a Horchata which is a sweet rice milk, you can get it plain or with pecans and fruit, impressive! But if you get the one with the pecans in it don't try to drink it with a straw!  I wish we had a place as great as this where I live, I'd eat there weekly. Lots of creative items.

vXCmvFKarVIQRPsJaP2n9w.text: what a disappointment! i've had this place bookmarked for a looooong time, so i was excited when i finally convinced a large group of my friends to dine here.  the salsa bar did not disappoint, so i had higher expectations for the food. my fave salsas were the peanut, the mexicana, and the pibil something or other. the strawberry one tasted like... crushed strawberries. surprise?   i had the 2 taco plate (~$10).... i had one la condesa special w/ shrimp (spinach, cheese, onions, peppers.... other things?) and one chicken mole. the chicken was tasty, and the tacos are pretty decently portioned.... it was a good thing the shrimp was smothered in cheese because it was SUPER overcooked. you get a teeny portion of rice and beans on the side.  husband got a burrito and taco plate (~$13)... the burrito was the much-hyped cochinita pibil, and the taco was the el gaucho (skirt steak w/ avo and chimichurri). eh. the cochinita pibil was ok, but not "melt-in-your-mouth".... and i dunno if beans were the right accompaniment for it. the skirt steak was TOUGH and dry... and there was hardly any chimichurri (if any?) to redeem it.  this combo only comes w/ some calabacitas (squash), no rice.  our table's consensus was that the majority of the meat was dry/overcooked. there was definitely some pleasing flavors, but were made unenjoyable by overcooked, dry meat.   perhaps it was because we were a large party (9) and it was busy (fri night)... but the service was kinda spotty. they were kind enough to split our bill for us, which was great. it is a very small place, so i wouldn't recommend going in a group larger than 4, maybe 6.  i might be willing to give this place a go again... but for the high prices and based on my lackluster experience, i'm sadly placing la condesa in my "phoenix over-hyped" list.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Millions of salsas!!!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La condesa special and chicken mole taco plate

v3G4t36vO4dpsZ_ySFFISA.text: HANDS DOWN THE BEST TACOS IN PHOENIX.  They have ruined any other taco shop for me.  Dont think abt it twice and go.

KJPhKQ7J3c_5QYeU4-Mtag.text: Small place. Great tasty food. Reasonable prices. Will definitely come back for the shrimp tacos!

bqqOQf8c2OLXyi4y2HB_iQ.text: Good tacos. Pricey. They think they can charge it because of the marketing and tons of sauces, I guess.

Rc4a_Ng7TcX-GLJEYRGsfA.text: Love this place! Great atmosphere, excellent variety of salsas, amazing horchata and the tacos are fabulous! We came from south Gilbert for no other reason than to come here. It's definitely worth the trip!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa bar

bm3F480Dnp0DiwJjuF734g.text: Absolutely phenomenal. I can't say enough about this GOURMET taco restaurant. Granted, this menu has more than tacos but you need to look no further than those filthy goooooood tacos. I have came here a few time with several different groups, not once did the sitting render tasteless. I've ordered almost every taco and each is extraordinary within itself. I am a Carne Asada enthusiast! With that said this dandy delight of a taco magician has various types of steak cooked various ways, all producing the bountiful bliss of juicy satisfaction. The salsa bar is a blessing in itself, so many varieties you don't run across at any other taco restaurant. The reviews speak for them self... Get here!

YAwalg__6WmXEytuReopOA.text: Not sure if I agree about them having the best salsa in PHX but everything was pretty good and there were many salas to chose from. If your in the area I would definitely recommend it but, not really worth a long drive.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Art work out front

zerQ2tf11OWAoqOEUJ4C5Q.text: Ooooh, more of a 4.5 rating.  So many wonderful things to say about this place. Thank goodness for living social deals that introduce me to new favorites!  Unassuming from outside. It is located in a run down strip mall with limited parking. But once you go through those doors you are transported to a dia de los muertos paradise. Really cool decor with awesome art on the walls. Love the bathroom doors!  Service was warm, informative, and attentive.   Salsa bar. Wow, what can I say? I consider myself an expert on Mexican food, as a Mexican-American myself and a native of Arizona. But I have never seen these sort of salsas in my life! Peanut salsa? Strawberry salsa? Yum.   My husband had the dogfish shark taco dinner and I had the veggie taco dinner. Yummmmm. Hubby loved his tacos and I had the BEST veggie tacos of my life. The cheese in the tacos is delicious. The beans and rice were great too.   I had their house margarita which was so different and refreshing. It had a hint of grapefruit juice which I loved.  My only (very minor) complaints? They charge for chips. Only a couple bucks but I wish I was warned before I saw it on the receipt.   Also, I saw a tiny bit of unidentifiable meat in my taco. It must have gotten mixed in accidentally on the grill. Hey, it happens, but it can really unnerve a vegetarian.  Love this place. We will definitely be back, preferably during happy hour when I can knock back a couple of their margaritas at a discounted price. :)

Dm-zVgjN1I4Gf4VoHMxnUg.text: I'd recommend this place a million times over! I had to knock a star off for the waiting, though. It can be over an hour long at peak times, but the food is well worth it.

EamG6llxPQ3HT6v4XmEKaA.text: Everything was terrific! The salsa bar had huge variety. Had the Condesa Mahi Mahi tacos, and the veggies were fresh and perfectly cooked. We had a huge party, 8 moms and 10 kids under the age of 5. (We had just toured Stuffington Bear Factory and we are a very rowdy hungry crew). They treated us wonderfully and service was exceptional. All the moms raved about the food. Next time we visit we need to leave the kids at home ;-)

KJrnC4R17570i4g5u0k9PA.text: Absolutely delicious and unique tacos. I would highly recommend this place. Great salsa bar, secluded atmosphere. I take friends here from out of town to give them a real taste of Mexican food!

i5_A7-JoyuedhlHI9w5ALA.text: Loved our experience last night for dinner. We wanted a no frills Mexican restaurant, just good food. This place was perfect. Frieda, our server, was excellent. She was helpful and pleasant, look for her.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. He needs no introduction.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our delicious tacos.

QpQBmo8nu_JPOcaPF0LTzA.text: I came here with friends on a Saturday afternoon during a visit to Phoenix. There's a very authentic vibe to this place. Inside, it's very colorful. Although this place is simple and casual, I was a little surprised at the condition of their menus. They're quite literally falling apart and have holes in them...probably something they should work on replacing. We started off with guacamole and chips (around $10) which was medium sized and delicious. My vegetarian friends ordered burritos which were literally the largest burritos I've ever seen. How does one person eat the whole thing?? Needless to say they were only able to eat half of it. I ordered 3 different tacos ($3.99 each). All three of these were pretty good, but not the best tacos I've had. I thought the tortilla (I think it was corn tortilla?) was pretty thick which I didn't like. The tacos weren't as flavorful as I had hoped. Tacos were also quite filling and I was really full from eating 3 of them. Overall the main thing about this place is that portions are HUGE and you should consider sharing.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos

qx3hUiBuH2vF8aioZTaTkw.text: This is my second time here hoping i would have a different experience here and NOPE HORRIBLE SERVICE. Where is a manager making sure everything is on point? I walk in the door me and my husband are just standing there for a while no one acts like they see us but they do. We sit down for almost 20 minutes w/out a waitress or nothing. We walked out the door after that and that's where I'm leaving my business. TRAIN YOUR EMPLOYEES BECAUSE THE CUSTOMER SERVICE IS HORRIBLE!

nZ78IdeRU28QSfO8QpwJ1w.text: My boyfriend and I popped in here for a quick lunch bite after a long morning of traveling. I ordered the veggie taco and the Cabo shrimp taco. Both of them were fantastic and the tortillas were perfect. My boyfriend ordered the Azteca burrito and had wonderful things to say as well.  My only gripes about the whole experience would be that the salsa bar was a bit understocked and the service could have been a bit better.

h6Ol39mDCcRrZepfjo3VxA.text: The food was really good! I had the trio of tacos, the best one was the chicken mole. They had really good guacamole and the salsa bar had a bunch of options it was really good! Definitely recommend!

1JWdtH9hfXVvFmg8o4nC3g.text: Damn this place was GREAT. They have incredible variety in their tacos. Everything was super delicious. They have a salsa bar with many different options of flavors. It seems super authentic and chill/low key. If I'm back in the area, I'd totally return!

FaB7-rRtXUFU1irAQX6M9Q.text: Delicious. Came to La sabtisima after seeing the 2k+ reviews. Stopped in for a quick bite and was swoon immediately by their Guacamole. If you go, it is a must. They add cranberries which add a perfect bit of sweetness to counter the slight spicy. I got the street taco combo. I ordered the three options to the right, chilango Suadro,al pastor and chicken asada. They all came with a good amount of meat to taco ratio and all had a different sauce. I could have ate 20 of each! They are the street size so about two/three bites. For my hubs, If he was there, 1.5 bites. However came with side of refried beans and rice with a bit of corn. My entire meal was 8.99. They had a salsa bar which lots of options. Service was nice and extremely friendly. This spot was also on drivers, dived and dine. ( whatever it was called) we had no idea until we got there. Yum

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EQ2pEwPVral65cA5KS6gVw.text: 3 Stars for the worst service at times. No adult management whatsoever here and Flagstaff ...  5 Stars for the Food.. dipping sauces are amazing.. Love the shrimp, beef or carnitas burritos are out of this world.. But once again the staff has a terrible attitude. I will be eating there soon and if the service improves I will gladly update my review.

SqQnC8WwT_FLFvwej8YIaw.text: This place was excellent, muy caliente! The best I've had in the Mexican American south, central, to north of Arizona! My boy Jesus you a bad mofo also 5-star service (server) for you my brotha. I'll be back again!

60vTIhroqPXnW-27Qe7DAA.text: Love it. Love it. Love it. They have the best burros I've found. Try the black mole enchilada style. You won't regret it. Note that I very rarely eat left overs, but their food is delicious left over...I even eat it straight from the fridge it's that good. Try their salsa bar, their queso, and leave happy and full.

8LviUcg4QN5tHpbYIFI_4Q.text: Great small venue. Food/tacos are very tasty and big for your order.  Have a full menu with tons of options. Their salsa bar is very robust. Bathrooms could be a bit cleaner and music would compliment the venue very well. All staff were very polite and professional

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great tasting and looking taco options!

I3ZYBwu0F76oga6PJTXxdw.text: My second favorite place to get some Mexican food their style is just so unique and the flavors mix very nicely, order  anything with molee you wont regret it

7UkmWTmEMTwN-d_bfQuJ0w.text: When we first walked in it was very crowded which hopefully means the food is good. We all the menu is way to complicated and very fine print so it makes it very hard to choose something. Simply the menu and people will appreciate it. The salsa bar was a hot mess and way to many to choose from which is actually a good thing because more than half had nothing. I was with a party of 5 and after sitting down I was not sure if I wanted to stay after viewing the menu. We are all happy we did as the food was great. We ordered 2 orders of the pacific fish tacos which were awesome, street tacos but don't order the tinga as is was way over seasoned but the asada was bomb, mariachi loco burrito was awesome and kids quesadilla which was good but missing something. Over all very good place to eat and priced correctly except for the plain quesadilla.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos platter

eVLb_OMrTd_-_ezKSK7BfA.text: Mexican food (specifically, tacos) are my favorite thing to eat. This restaurant did not disappoint! Firstly, their taco menu is VERY EXTENSIVE and creative! I have never seen a Baby Shark Taco on any menu before and they were the first. My brothers, who are just as adventurous with food as I am, REALLY liked the Baby Shark Taco and the Mincon Taco. Secondly, as a person with Gluten Sensitivities, I know that corn tortillas are safe. But La Santisima took the time to mark everything on their menu that is gluten free. Made my life easy! And the Quesas are gluten free! Lastly, our server was very patient with us (we had a party of 13) and explained to us some of the accolades La Santisima had just received (Best Salsa and Best Horchata). Since we had come from out of town (California), the server took her time explaining the menu (Quesas, Lonches) to us and checked on us frequently. We have all been to Arizona before (Tempe) and hadn't received the best customer service. But La Santisima was great!! Not a bad experience at all!! I am DEFINITELY bookmarking this place so I can come back and try more tacos and indulge in the salsas and 32oz Horchata.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Argentine Quesa
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mole Taco (top) and Smoked Marlin Taco (bottom)
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sign for La Santisima

QlFhw5o9tTBau7L59thbNA.text: My boyfriend and I visited recently because we both wanted some good authentic Mexican food. It was my first visit but he's been many times before.   Even on a Monday at 130, which we thought would be after the lunch rush, we still had about a 20 minute wait. And then when we were seated, we waited another 15ish minutes just for someone to wait on us - no water or drinks in that entire period. However, we made about 3 trips up to the salsa bar, almost just to pass time, but also because he is addicted to the peanut sauce.  But luckily it was all uphill from there. Once our server did come to us, we placed our order right away. I got an orange Margarita (funky, but good) and he got the gigantic horchata, which was sweet, but just not really for me.  I decided on the street taco plate - 1 chicken, 1 carne asada, and 1 chilango, plus rice and beans. My boyfriend got a chicken quesadilla.  For street style tacos, it was definitely a good amount of food. And his quesadilla was gigantic. But oozing with cheese, so we knew it was going to be good.  It was my only meal of the day, but we both finished our plates and didn't have a single regret in the world after that.  It's worth the wait and you get a good amount of food for the price you pay.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

D-v3fnePTAtfB2JfC8r7Mw.text: 5 stars for food, 3 stars for service and drinks.   The food here was fantastic, and reasonably priced.  All of our tacos were delicious and to die for! The salsa bar is really cool as well and has a lot of great different salsas you can try!   It took forever to be seated! And there were so many open tables! It took us about 20 minutes to finally get our seat and probably another five for someone to come up to our table. After that, our waitress was pretty attentive until she brought the bill. After that... We waited and waited forever for her to come pick it up so we could pay and leave.  Margaritas were a big bummer too. I originally ordered the grapefruit one as our waitress told us it was fresh squeezed, and it was sooooo sweet! To the point where I couldn't even drink it... almost like artificial sweetener. Our waitress realized that I didn't like it, and asked if she could bring me some limes to hopefully cut some of the sweetness. I took her up on the offer, but unfortunately limes did not help at all. After that, she suggested I replace it with their classic margarita. She brought it to me and took the original one off the bill which was really kind. However, the original margarita wasn't that great either. Definitely didn't have the extreme sweetness, but did not taste fresh and I did not enjoy it. Coming back here, I would definitely just stick to beer.

3ERolEpU-8bMw7djHosnHg.text: We are talking about "one of" the best Mexican restaurants in Phoenix according to the internet, a city with a huge Hispanic population. With high expectations, La Santisima was the first restaurant I visited after I landed.  Saw some reviews saying that the wait is usually insane, so I went for a late lunch at around 2:30pm, and it was pretty empty. There were still parties leaving and coming. The inside has beautiful art, and great Mexican restaurant vibe. My server handed me the menus and came back shortly for my drinks along with some nachos. There was a whole list of margaritas to choose from, so I asked him to bring me the best seller.   Near the back of the restaurant is a sauce/dip station where you can go customize your own personal dip for nachos according to your preference, or you can get each sauce individually. There were at least 14 different ones to choose from, and I never tried most of them!  Server came back with my margarita, and helped me finalize my main, something that he said he loves as well.
