That's great, now my expectation is even higher.   The margarita is B O M B. The first sip made me go whoa and my super cool server chuckled. He came over and told me he has made at least 5 of them today!   Food came faster than I expected, in under 10 minutes. It looked massive, could probably feed 2. At that point I was close to drooling and the excitement on my face probably gave it away - my server asked if I wanted a picture with the food!! LOL how awesome is that. Took pictures with the food and I dived in.   First bite and I was in heaven.....  This is what I call perfect Mexican food. The green sauce was perfection, I could literally eat anything with it. Rice and meat were cooked just right, and I ate about a quarter of the food in less than 2 minutes. My server checked up on me while I was in the middle of stuffing my face, and he mentioned that I came on a good day. Usually theres a line up throughout the day.  I was only able to finish half of my food, really want to go back and try the Quesa that my server was raving about!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oIavmDmwgETJuYsVS6cHXA.text: This place is adorned with some cool art. Artist like Ricardo Ramos have a piece of two on display. Even the entrance is incredible.  They call themselves a gourmet taco shop but I believe they fall short.  I ordered a Cabo shrimp taco, Baja sur dogfish shark taco, and Mayan cochinito pibil. The beer battered shrimp and shark were tasteless and lukewarm. Perhaps some better seasoning would have helped. The service is slower then most places like this, so lunch can be a challenge. The pibil was the only consolation in an otherwise mediocre experience.  The reason to go would be for the art and I hear the Quesa is ok.(Cheese). Not sure I'm heading back anytime soon. There are better taco shops in the area for sure!

pSy5SDs7uOnP7zhWaGGqSg.text: Lately I have been on a mission to find a second favorite Taco spot after 2 of my co-workers quickly denounced Ritos! And had me try Taco Mich...... which I thought was just "ok". Yelpers and a different co-worker didn't disappoint this time. The shark taco was delicious and flavorful with the jicama salsa, although a bit greasy. The salsa bar and variations tastes WAY better than it looks. All super flavorful. The carne asada Taco was meaty. I will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shark and carne asada Taco&#39;s
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

E_i-P-ddda9giClltf4m7w.text: I came here by recommendation from a friend and I couldn't have been more satisfied!! First off, it happened to be Taco Tuesday when I went so that meant $2 for all street tacos. Secondly, they have an unlimited salsa bar with ALL kinds of salsa (everything from traditional salsas like pico de gallo to interesting dips like peanut butter salsa). Thirdly, to top it off, margaritas are $4 all-day everyday...whaaaat?? These deals are almost too good to be True.  My boyfriend and I decided to order and share all five street tacos plus the "gourmet" baby shark taco. Each taco packed bold flavors in it - the al pastor was possibly the best spicy pork taco I've had (loved the pineapple bits in the avocado salsa!), the brisket in the chilango suadero was incredibly juicy, and the chicken tinga with pickled onions made a perfect combo. The star of the show though were the shark tacos. The fried fish had a light crispy beer batter, and each bite had delicious, tender, flaky baby shark in it. So good.  The only taco I probably wouldn't order again was the chicken asado. Not that it tasted bad by any means, but after eating all the other tacos, the flavors in this one were rather underwhelming.  Good service and great food. Absolutely will be back next time I'm visiting Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips with your choice of unlimited salsa from the bar!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House margaritas
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Left to right, top to bottom: carne arrachera, al pastor, chicken asado, tinga, baja sur baby shark, chilango suadero

FujktqFAJMVH6TDKnjPNDg.text: Quaint restaurant with diverse menu. Awesome salsa bar, I could get the chips and salsa all night. Ordered margaritas for the table. Fun art and decor definitely recommend!

Cm8G9sHX92KmqqLoOWjguw.text: We got there for an early dinner.  Place didn't look that busy when we arrived.  They took about five minutes to great and another five to sit us.  I was not impressed by the way place look.  Floors were dirty with food.  But then I saw waiter cleaning tabla and dumping crumbs on floor.   After we sat down waiter left and didn't come back to take our drink order for a long time.  We almost got up and left because of how long they took to take our orders.  We had the al Pastor mahi fish and mole tacos.  They were super good!! I also had a michelada and it was delicious!! Food wise I give them Five stars.  But service and cleanliness I give them two stars.   Next time I'll give the one in Glendale a chance. Hoping food is as good as here but with better service and a more clean environment.
