Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Michelada with extra lime. It&#39;s super delicious!! Buenísima I&#39;ll come back just for this!!!

d06Z1pmaWtlMitDCSYI_aQ.text: La Santisima is a taco oriented Mexican restaurant located in a blue collar neighborhood of Phoenix, which offers an impressive happy hour menu and a delicious variety of tacos.  I ate dinner at La Santisima on a Thursday. I arrived around five and was seated quickly. I did not receive any service quickly though. The restaurant was clearly understaffed. It took a long time to get a drink, a bowl of chips, and my ultimately my check. It was never clear who my server was either.  The food was excellent, but the service was overwhelmed. I would try La Santisima again, but hopefully the service will be better next time.

d5S0OukyLqnX0mPgvmg12A.text: Outstanding food.  Very creative and unique ingredients.  Worth the hype.  Would prefer if they had table service during lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VGXdRfGpW-eZNag-RYPeLA.text: Me and my family will never be back. The place was full of flies. My husband's food had a bug in it and the waitress acted like that wasn't a big deal and like it was a part of the meal

LqvZb8g9P0QII5aSp47CCA.text: Taco Tuesday !! Omg perfect .. Have the street tacos if you can't decide .. I had the cochinita pibil, al pastor and carne asada..   Loaded up at the salsa bar.. They have so many options and all were delicious.. Tried for the first time the strawberry salsa, which I drank like a shooter (yum!) and the jicama salsa was really good, you could eat this like a side salad, nice crunch!!   Jamaica was served in a huge to go cup.. Thumbs up..  Get here early this place has a small dining area and it fills up fast !! Worth the wait though!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Diners, drive ins and dives signed poster
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa bar options, chips and giant Jamaica
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street tacos.. Al pastor, carne asada &amp; cochinita pibil

n0Z-YNnJTCJcVUg3I8EApA.text: Amazing food! You cannot beat their salsa bar! But their wait staff is the worst part of this place. Honestly, every time I've gone here, I've had to wait about an hour after ordering to get my food. The taste is great but honestly it's a waste of time  to wait so long for the food.

VXdr_XKzKTFulabl5yY5oQ.text: Four stars for the tacos and salsa. Three stars for everything else.   Coming here on a Tuesday night, it was packed. Oddly enough, there was a whole other room that seemed like a "group table" room, even though there was room for other people. I got seated fairly quickly since I was solo, but a group of four literally sat at the waiting area the entire time I was dining. I started off with their horchatas. I didnt like the fact that they only serve a 32 oz but I went with what they had. The horchata came off more like water than rice milk. They add alot of fresh fruit, which is great, but is hard to drink with skinny straws. Many of times the straw got clogged. Id recommend packing a boba tea straw. The flavor was mostly cinnamon, lacking a cream flavor.   The chips are nothing special, but that salsa was something special. Not only do they have a wide variety of great flavors, but its all self serve! It was hard not to devour all the chips with that salsa.   Service wise, it was lagging. The waiter didnt bring me water until 20 minutes after I sat down. At the time, i wa swell, hydrated, so I wasnt evem mad about it. I will say that I had to flag down the waiter everytime I needed something.   I ordered the Santisima Taco and the Gaucho Quesidilla. the taco was superb. Great ingredients, great tortilla, and the shrimp was a nice addition! The salsa only made it better. The quesidilla was not exactly what I was expecting. They deep fry the thing, but its more like corn masa than flour. Its not bursting with flavor, but its decent. The ingredients inside of course were really good. the avocado and cheese they had on top of the quesadilla only enhanced the meal.   I would be curious to try their Gaucho as a burrito. i wouldnt mind coming back here again, but I really hope they get better service. I know I wont be ordering that horchata!

P-8ocXfdfcawjLYBGAF5Aw.text: Probably some of the best tacos I've had in Phoenix (i was spoiled living in San Diego). I ordered the 3 Al Pastor street tacos with rice and beans, for my daughter we got the Pollo asada tacos with rice and beans and she sure enjoyed it! Normally she is very picky about onions but she sure enjoyed them from here. They have a large selection of salsas to choose from but there were only a couple that I was fond of, a lot of them seemed to have some weird mixtures but to each their own  I would recommend this place if you're looking for tacos here in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nEKowC8YfWKAi-Hhfpy_VQ.text: I had this restaurant bookmarked for a while after seeing it on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. We were attending a show in Downtown Phoenix, so we went by La Santisima before that. It was around 6-ish in the evening when we arrived and there were only 1 or 2 small tables open, so we were seated immediately. Getting to the table was kind of like walking through a maze since the restaurant is small and crowded.  It was very obvious that they were super busy and there were only 2 people taking orders, delivering food, etc. It took a while for them to take our orders and then even longer to bring us chips to snack on & our drinks. When they did, however, we were more than happy to wait for our food as we were were enjoying all the different salsas with the chips!  The salsa bar they have is very unique. They had very flavorful salsas that I've never had before. My favorite was the peanut one. It was kind of thick and creamy with a bit of spice. Other salsas that both me and my boyfriend liked were the pecan salsa, the salsa roja, the guacamole, etc. There were a total of maybe 10 or 12 different ones, all that tasted great with the chips and also on our tacos. I'd come back here just because of the salsa bar!  As far as our food goes, I ordered the Tinga taco and the Cabo Shrimp taco plate with rice and beans. My boyfriend ordered the La Santisima Speciality tacos with chicken. Both the tacos I ordered were completely different from each other. The Tinga taco tasted good as it was served but I thought that the shrimp taco needed a couple of salsas to enhanced the flavor of the breaded shrimp. The La Santisima Speciality tacos were much like the Tinga taco in that there were a bunch of different toppings on them, so they tasted great as served. My boyfriend couldn't help but to add the delicious salsas on them anyways, however!  Next time, we come in, I'd probably skip both the rice & beans and instead order one more taco! It's not that the rice & beans weren't good, it was just that the tacos were SO GOOD! It's great that everything that can be ordered a la carte or as a meal. Some tacos are bit more expensive than other ones, but the whole menu seemed fairly reasonably priced.  Overall, like I've said, the food was great but the service is where there could be some improvement. We'd recommend this restaurant to others!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetarian taco &amp; Tinga taco.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Mole taco &amp; Fish taco.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

J7TI42x17q4F0bY3SQbf6A.text: Terrific! We always take out of towners here to have a good experience with great food. Even our Pennsylvania relatives that think taco bell is exotic have LOVED this place. And those of us that cringe at that comparison love La Santisima as well. The salsa bar has such a great variety of sauces that it alone is worth the trip. The horchata is decent (I've had far better) but every item I've tasted on the menu has been amazing. Pricey - but amazing. Worth the time and money!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7-x9FKgIa56Y8SxP6tCvbg.text: All of these years I've been living downtown just down the street from here and I haven't been until today. Everything here is amazing. Amazing. Amazing. Except the service. In their defense, the restaurant does warn you that the dining area has recently expanded and they are relying on a small kitchen. Too bad our food and drinks were out right on time. Our server was hard to find and not very friendly. That's a shame.   Now that we've gotten that bad stuff out of the way let's talk about the fun stuff. First, the salsa bar. Oooo girl. There's something like 15 salsas and sauces here. They're all amazing but I'd recommend the pecan salsa. You do get a free bowl of chips, but it is 2.70 for another one. A little disappointed about that since there's so much salsa to try but that's okay.   Second, dranks! We ordered the blue devil margarita, which was full of fruit and sweetness almost like an amazing marg-sangria hybrid. My table also got a huge michelada and some other regular margaritas. All were absolutely delish.   Last, but not least, those tacos tho!!! There are just too many to list here but out table ordered some of the best looking ones, mahi al pastor, baby shark, tiger shrimp, battered and fried avocado, cauliflower, and Barbacoa. The Barbacoa was certainly the least exotic but my favorite. The tortilla was softly fried and just tooooo good. The vegetarian and vegan choices were numerous if that's your kind of thing. Much appreciated to see a restaurant that serves lots of options for those with dietary restrictions other than just another damn salad!   Get here now because you are missing one of Phoenix's greatest hits!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ES7Z2Q--3ieZbqcaOaoE5A.text: Sometimes you drive by a place for quite a while until you finally try it and once you try it, you wonder why in the world you did not try it before because you were missing out big time! This is one of those places! Parking can be dicey at times and first appearance is not an indication to the inside! Once you walk in the door, you notice how clean it is and smell great food! The service is helpful in answering questions. The salsa is great! They have a huge selection of salsa, and even a few I would have never imagined! I have tried probably 3/4 of the salsa flavors and have not been dissappointed yet, which is a huge thing as I love salsa, but it has to be good! Now for the main course- I have tried 90% of their tacos and they are all fantastic! Their burrito's are great too, but pretty hard hitting because they will bring you to uncomfortable full, but soooo good! Great place! Highly recommended!

AN5Z38zQTnqROgtztW8-5w.text: We came here twice on our visit to Arizona- the tacos are that good! Huge selection of very tasty tacos, awesome service at a more than fair price. They also have a huge salsa bar with a flavor for everybody. This place was great!!

pLMI_KaoKaNXXeOTfgAP4g.text: First time here and I was not impressed despite all the amazing things I have heard. The tacos meat (tried 3 different ones) lacked flavor. My first order they brought out had a hair on it. The waitress took my order back, but it put a dent in the experience.  The salsa bar was good. The interior was clean and has amazing art work. I might come back to try a margarita.

mnc-nPQy-2mP_kGV3UDTOQ.text: This was my second time in and it seems to be pretty authentic. I like the impressive salsa bar as well as the chips. The first time in I tried the tiger shrimp, white fish, and steak street tacos and the second time I had the green chili pork burrito. The shrimp had a bit too much breading on it for me, the fish was fine, the steak was my favorite. The green chili pork burrito was good but not the best I have had by far. My husband tried the al pastor, carne asada, and steak tacos and enjoyed his but was not overwhelmed. The drinks are decent size but overall the food and drinks are pretty pricey. With so many good Mexican restaurants in Central Phoenix, La Santisma would not be my top choice but it would be a good place to bring an out of town guest looking for some authentic Mexican flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chi chi frappe
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita

SmqnOLLYn7qkfB0CoDlqAg.text: I was brought here by a local. I have to say, wow. This is the kind of place I've been craving in Phoenix. There is a large variety of tacos and I struggled to make it through four. I just wanted to try them all!   I highly recommend this place. The mahi taco at the bottom of the menu is to die for. The shrimp one with like hibiscus was also good.   We all ordered margaritas and they were fantastic.   Service was slow but very friendly. They expanded and it seems they just don't have the staff to keep up. We weren't bored or in any rush so there wasn't any issue.   I unfortunately won't be spending much more time in phoenix, but when I do, I'll be hanging at this place.

SPFMHmV7Vnse9-qmXWfiUg.text: Really really bad experience, waited 40 minutes to get 2 cold pancakes and a a cold burrito, the pancakes supposley comes with whipped cream and strawberries, this is what we got, $7.95 for two cold pancakes

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9_G2DKX0EtzGcwMqLPbpvA.text: This place is my absolute favorite taco restaurant in Arizona. The tacos are quite large, stuffed with delicious meats and other toppings. Usually I am full with just 2 of their tacos. The variety of salsas at the salsa bar make for a great combination for both tacos and chips. The horchata is also a huge size and very delicious. The fruit added in the horchata makes it a special drink compared to most other horchatas.

4l4TpA53EyCZ7wcMR1wu2g.text: First timer and heard great reviews about this spot so it was only fitting to bring my nephew vision from NY. For starters the Paloma drinks were probably the best I have had from any location, the freshness of the fruits mixed with the tequila was tasty! Now the salsa bar was a surprise but a good one with the vast selection of salsas ! The pork burrito was phenomenal, must say the flavor can't describe but the picture I post can speak for itself ! I will be back very soon to try out the tacos !

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Paloma
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork burrito

X4-G7ToR6wpgkG1Ar5EEYQ.text: The food was amazing and the salsa had a lot of verity. They have a peanut salsa that had a lot of spice and a great after taste that I highly recommend. The only problem was I had to wait 40 mins for my food but the salsa filled my time waiting.

NWsHqfBVmGHG-RVfZmKMXw.text: Great food. I had the smoked Marlin burrito and the La Samita taco with shrimp.  The waiter was pretty awesome, he brought us samples of the different meats to make our ordering process much simpler. The salsas were great. The tomatia salsa was my favorite. The strawberry salsa was surprisingly good as well.   All in all a great experience for $20 with tip. The burrito was enough to eat without the taco but the two together we're very filling.

koT59C5UcOuzuZwptlLK8w.text: I've have now experienced the best steak taco in my lifetime!!! Hats off to you folks!! I will Def be back!!

jzLL5NUSM2cGQarSgGd7Sw.text: Great food! Reminded me of my time in Oaxaca! Wish they had silverware because the plastic ware made cutting the Quesa tough lol but so small in the grand scheme of a great restaurant!

QApxXfFArg1cndWMn2-NOg.text: Horrible experience ordered a Vegan Salad and was given a salad with meat. Customer service is horrible

nARHar9wQxhu-uLH3LijBA.text: This is a great little hole-in-the-wall mexican joint. Overall I'd say while service can be a bit iffy, the food is great and reasonably priced.  Chips and salsa is one of my fave foods, and it's complimentary here. The self-serve salsa bar in the back is extensive, with about 8-12 different salsas at a time. I've been here twice and my favorites are their jicama salsa, pico de gallo, and chipotle. I wish the salsa cups were larger, but that's a minor peeve ... and let's face it, I'm not someone who's ashamed to go up to the salsa bar 5 times. (Given the rate at which I inhale chips, I probably need to fit in some excercise laps to the salsa bar anyway.)  On my most recent visit (around 5:30pm on a Thursday) we ordered standard margaritas. I wasn't super impressed with them (and think they were just made from a mix), but when I got the bill and saw they were only $3 each, I wasn't too upset. They did have a proper drink menu, so next time I'm here I may try one of their other cocktails.  Just as a menu tip for if you're debating between tacos, the "street tacos" near the bottom of the menu are smaller (~4") than the "gourmet" ones listed at the top (~5").  I've gotten both kinds and prefer the smaller street tacos, but maybe I'm just biased toward miniature foods. The first time I visited I also ordered rice and beans, which were better than I've had at most places, though I'm not a huge fan of rice & beans in general.  I love mole and they have mole tacos and other mole dishes which I would LOVE to try, but alas thanks to my nut allergy I can't ... I'll have to live vicariously through my fellow Yelpers' reviews & photos on that one!

Lurk4HUIjUoL7mbWu1iZYA.text: I wanted to like this place ... I wanted to for it 5 stars but I can't. First off it's cramped and while it's possible to look past it if it was slightly cramped this place was trying to be the poster child for cramped. Don't come with a party of more than 2 for that's not gonna happen. Dropped a star for the cramp factor  Another star goes for the restrooms.. Let's just say it's best to avoid it all together for there is no coming back once you go in... Now that the negatives are out the door the food was good. By good I mean they have a real unique selection of salsas and the tacos are good too but really the seating takes away from the experience ... For me it did .. Your mileage may wary ..happy yelping

9Fxxlc01cR7dPI_9uq5Rmg.text: I have been there three times. They have a really interesting menu and a nice salsa bar. Unfortunately, they don't have great service and their food is hit and miss. I had some of the best tacos ever during one visit, but the two subsequent visits were less that good.

DWOXDl7k43IZrs6llWlrYg.text: Parking is horrible.  There were two groups ahead of us . Plenty of tables open waiting  to  be cleaned.  It took about 20 minutes to get seated. There is a salsa bar  but several were almost out. Guacamole  was entering. Quite different we did like it. Our meal did take  about 30 minutes.  Their was no napkins or silver were. The tacos were good . We did like rice and beans. Service again was a little slow

vNib6cLH3lXvp3ut6IDWbA.text: Was staying downtown Phoenix so grabbed hotel bike.. easy ride.  Once "we" figured where to lock the bike all was great. The decor is nothing fancy but for me that added to its credibility.  Staff was friendly n helpful w my menu Qs.  The chips were served w/o salsa as I was informed "the 12 variety salsa bar is in next room, help yourself...".  I order a burrito 1 of 3 the staff recommended.  I got thru half.  Food was hot n very flavorful.  Seemed a favorite of locals as guests were plentiful.  Went to another yelp Mexican establishment earlier in week n while it was fine, Santi's was excellent.  Still trying to see if have time to stop for a go meal on way to airport.   For this guy on a Thursday it was a 5* !!!  Well done.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La pastoral burrito (sp?)

tQaj6cg54Tiauuvpwwdi9g.text: I've been coming here for years for the food. It's awesome. The service might be the worst of any restaurant I've ever been to though. Saturday night, 8pm. The restaurant is 40% full with 15 people standing by the bar waiting for a table for 20 minutes. Their famous salsa bar is half empty and has been for 30 minutes. Not one person working there is hustling. I ask who the manager is. Oh, they're at the other store. No owner or manager on on your busiest night at dinner rush? Whoever runs the show here is leaving a lot of money on the table and regularly disappointing your patrons.

yT-FYj74o0cKWHvkWXP5gQ.text: I understand that Saturdays are busy, and more bc I know the food is good but it is really disappointing and disheartening that I sit for 40 minutes and no one comes to take our order yet everyone that came after had already had theirs taken. Also waiting until the hour and our drinks weren't even at the table. The service needs 100% improvement. It would have been alleviated if someone at least came to acknowledge that we were patiently waiting instead of passing by. Or when they finally took our order an hour later, could you at least apologize for the wait??!

SNlKYwNM0PdvGrUWzhr97w.text: I was looking forward to trying this place and was disappointed. Apparently they have recently expanded and could definitely not keep up with the demand. My husband and I ordered two margaritas after we finally got greeted by our server. The margaritas took about 15 minutes to reach us. Food took a very long time also, the servers were doing what they could but they are definitely understaffed. If you are going to expand your location you should also hire more employees to keep up with the demand.

LC_wAwbyCRy_yqBFNn12yA.text: Went to La Santisima for lunch on Cinco de Mayo with some colleagues. The restaurant is on the smaller side, and you order your food and pay at the register, and then find a table.  The restaurant has a salsa bar with a lot of good options. I had the guacamole and pico, both were excellent. Would have been nice if they replaced the chips on our table - having four of us the first basket didn't last long. I had chicken tacos for my meal, which were also good. The tacos were a lighter Mexican meal, which wasn't a bad thing for lunch time. Rice and beans both good.  Prices were reasonable. Overall would recommend.

Nw-iugSSqW08wjhrEisozg.text: Had another awesome experience here at La Santisma last night. Although they were super busy, they managed to serve us promptly and the street tacos were great. I couldn't believe their house margarita was so tasty (and just $6.) Only bad part was I found out which salsa is the hottest for me (the peanut lit my mouth on fire) but all were delicious.

OKh947nspmGjYWuLK4XLPw.text: Not a fan. We waited 15 minutes for a table when the place was practically empty. They sat us next to the hot window (triple-digit hot day) when there was plenty of open tables all over the restaurant. The guacamole was weird (cranberries in guac?) and I hate those salsa bars that give you those tiny plastic containers that are too small for you to dip your chips into. The margaritas and tacos were good though. Just a warning...don't get the three taco plate...it's too much food. One taco was enough with the beans and rice.

4o0lrQ0IUQN5g4EOad62gw.text: If you're in the area and are looking for a refreshing drink this place is a must. Literally the best horchata I've ever had!

qXgxY5EqEa7OL7Nd9vKWiA.text: Once again, Yelp did not disappoint.  My brother ~ who lived in San Antonio ~ and is addicted to good Mexican Food came to visit.  With the pressure of finding a great place, I turned to Yelp.  Excellent selection!!! So many yummy salsas and the Tacos were quite good.  Not as amazing as Barrio Queen but definitely yummy.  The Margaritas were beyond divine tho ...as was the fried Quesadilla and I am not s fan of rice and beans, but these were exceptional.

qPrPrY4eJ3imlUCT6SY6HA.text: Oh where to start. So often places are over rated, but not the case here. We've been many times. This is probably my favorite Mexican food in Phoenix. My reasons for this statement? 1) best burrito I've ever eaten (I only wish I could recall the name; it was a special I think). I've had many of the tacos from fish to shrimp to beef to shark and all are good. 2) salsa bar. So many choices! All delicious. Seriously see the pics this is not your average salsa bar. 3) Quesadillas- a unique take on this dish that seriously takes it to the next level. You will not regret ordering any of these! Tip: Come in early or late to beat the rush. The space is small and can fill up quickly. Service is typically good.

79Z-afyEmj_aGQ_G92niDg.text: I was excited to try this restaurant because of the other great reviews that others had written. The restaurant is fairly small, but definitely authentically Mexican.   When my party and I first sat down, we were given a bowl of fresh tortilla chips, and were encouraged to try a variety of salsas at the salsa bar. The salsas were interesting to taste, and helped make this restaurant unique from others that I have tried.  I ordered the tamarind soda, which was nothing special, and honestly just tasted like normal soda. Although the restaurant is well-known for their tacos, I decided to order the Al Pastor burro (burrito) which contained pork, guacamole, pineapple salsa and lettuce. The burrito tasted flavorful, fresh and delicious. I would definitely come back for another round.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al Pastor Burrito

XkCmil4Xi0ZlXaZ3RFDHWw.text: I was in town from Texas. We know Mexican food and I can say this place is amazing!!!   The salsa and chips are great! Good service!!!   I had the smoked Marlin quesadilla!! First it tastes amazing!! Not like any I have had before! Great flavor profiles and the guacamole on top was second to none!   I highly recommend this place!

GsZOdFKcjlDgB0z53my0oQ.text: Top Mexican food in Phx Try the peanut butter salsa.

bIDAI_xTH50fPT6O-EXDqw.text: Amazing tacos, especially the street tacos. But the bell of the restaurant is the mole- Yummy - as good as mole from Oaxaca! The salsa bar is to die for, you got to try them all.

W2-fhwT_1s6jG0IB3tcVBA.text: The bomb! Huge selection of Sala on the salsa bar, fresh and cool. Some really different and imaginative. The pork was almost like a BBQ, delish The margaritas were delicious and very tasty! I will be back

_aWFRPSSmsp_mNGkw8LUWw.text: Best Salsa bar in the valley!  Very creative and delicious.  Just thinking about you guys makes my mouth water.

ltlyMv4l_vn5vBy93hfAPQ.text: This place was good!  I ordered 4 tacos to-go: dogfish shark taco, carne asada taco, cochinita pibil taco, and the chicken mole taco.  The shark taco was outstanding, it was not too greasy and topped with cabbage and crema.  The carne asada was some of the best I have had.  It was juicy and seasoned perfectly.  The chicken mole had great flavor and was very rich.  I wasn't too crazy about the cochinita pibil but that is most likely just a matter of taste, nothing was wrong with it.  The salsa bar is very overwhelming with close to one million different selections.    By the way, parking is a nightmare.

4GmJR6nPuU2vMNDU27FOBg.text: Great Asada tacos and a great selection of Mexican beers. They even have Mexican coke in 500ml bottles! Small restaurant but worth the trip!

9rR5EW74VDAjShVsGdmSsQ.text: Excellent menu, chefs, and service ..... just a bit inconsistent sometimes especially at the Glendale store.

1WpATcvXiZ31xT979qFqLw.text: I first saw Guy Fieri's visit on TV. I have Family in Phoenix so I said I had to try it out on my next visit. I was just there with my Family this past weekend. I was blown away by the decor and delicious food. It was everything that Guy Fieri said on his show and more!! I can't wait to go back to Phoenix so I can eat there again!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I loved the decor!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sonoran Arrechera Burrito
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

b9uWPLTVbhQ1f-0805F5Bw.text: I have only been here for brunch, but can't wait to try lunch or dinner on for size!  We were the first table in on Sunday and were greeted right away by our server and felt at home with its cozy interior.  It's a small place but has lots of character with the heavy solid wood and wrought iron furniture.  Love the Dia de Los Muertos art and heavy wood bar with cowhide bar stools and authentic Mexican glassware.  We sampled quite a few of the salsas at the salsa bar and there is a little something for everyone including those that can't take a lot of spice.  This is a big plus for us since our family has spice tolerances from 1 to 10+.  What was on our menu? we tried the divorced eggs (which I added avacado), black mole chilaquiles with chicken, and an egg scramble with side of bacon; all of which were served with black beans.... Delicious and full of flavor! I'll have to post the brunch menu next time since it is not currently on their website.  Each of us would order the same thing again, but so want to try the other items of delicousness on their menu.  I guess we will have to make La Condesa a staple on our restaurant list!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa seven chiles and salsa chipotle
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior panorama dos....

nk0abk4JKKRZzt-7QFlzWA.text: I ordered a steak burrito and really liked it. The quality of the ingredients were very good. The salsa bar has a large variety of different salsa's. I am docking two stars for service. I asked the cashier for a couple extra lids for salsa and she said that "it's three per order".  I told her I needed more salsa and if I had to pay so be it.  I really hate when places do that. That kind of thing makes me not want to go back.  Then after that incident, I had ordered to go and while I was waiting this man kept calling the to go order for  "ranchero burrito" and I didn't pick it up because I ordered a steak burrito. A few minutes later he asked me what I ordered and when I told him, he said "that's the order I've been calling!" How am I supposed to know my order was called a ranchero burrito when the menu doesn't even call it that?!   Service is important to me when I go out to eat, as good as the food was, I probably won't be returning for this reason.

PJihVealszb8jO17A9wnaQ.text: 5 stars because every time I have been here I have not been disappointed! We always come here after picking up/dropping off at the airport since its ohh ~9 minutes away! Really great spot too if you're coming for lunch. Service is really fast.   Food taste delicious. Salsa bar is huge!  Huge fan of the el gaucho and the la santiama tacos. The mahi mahi here is also beyond delicious. I've always found that 2 tacos al la carte is perfectly fulfilling but my brother loves their burritos!

Fk4PO_LVbQSkrz09sUBnaw.text: Truly delicious gourmet mexican food.  Don't miss the house guacamole with mangos and raisins and the burrito El pastor.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool store front
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos El pastor
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enjoying a bowl of the most amazing guacamole I&#39;ve ever had with Parker in Phoenix, AZ.

buoF06fgpJjG4CR6MGUPhw.text: Absolutely delicious.  This small place doesn't have a lot of adequate seating but it has an amazing salsa bar.  Let's get something straight.  A salsa bar consists of more than the standard 3 to 4 salsas.  This place had about 20.  You can tell that some of them were experiments that went well like Peanut salsa and I believe there was a curry salsa.  There were so many.    We ordered the famous baja sur dogfish shark taco, an El Gaucho burrito and an El Gaucho quesadilla.  I am not a big fan of quesadillas because of the flour tortilla and there is usually not a good filling.  This one was deep fried goodness.  Oh man, it was so good that I could only get down half of it.  The filling was steak, cucumber and just hell goodness.  My husband's burrito had majority of the same filing as mine with a little tweaking.  He enjoyed it a lot.  The fish taco was really good as well.  I only had one bite because I was aggressively attacking my quesadilla and fighting off the stares of people watching me enjoy.  With all that being said, customer service is once again an issue.  The small place was pretty packed.  Only one small table was open right by the door.  This table had to be misplacement because who would want to sit by the door and every time someone opens the door, they get smacked in the back of the head?  Our waiter was so non-existent that a waitress would come over to only end up doing the same thing.  Sigh.  The food was so good; I couldn't even dock any points for that.  Be aware that the first bowl of chips is free.  The second bowl is about $2 more.  The chips are good and hot so, I willingly gave over my money for an extra bowl.

Zrw3r4INw97MC3nfgbiDiA.text: This place is really cool and unique. First the salsa bar is insane with like 12 different salsas. From sweet to mild to hot. The food is amazing I told the server that whatever they would order is what I want. I got this quesadilla empanada thing that was out of this world. Very small restaurant and the bar is like 3 seats but loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing

snQQsLja1AOjpz9_59xHlA.text: Best horchata EVER!  The salsa bar is great, they have a huge variety to try.  The shark dog fish tacos are great...a MUST try.  The place is somewhat small, but if you come at the right time there is no wait.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing horchata

iXgQzwpRjjujy2zhnf-Ciw.text: Salsa bar is so great, so many selections. Only issue is that if you come towards the end of lunch a lot is empty and both times I've been here I haven't been able to find someone to refill. But the food is really really good and while the prices are a little high, the quality of the food reflects this.

uUkrAat-OTne-k2p2AxO0A.text: In a single word this place is... AWESOME!  We were up in Phoenix on Wednesday afternoon and stumble upon this little gem right at the end of happy hour. Their happy hour tacos are delicious, especially the tinga tacos. SO GOOD.  Helping ourselves to the fresh salsa bar was a blast. There are so many unique and yummy flavors up there. I think we tried 12 different salsa and absolutely loved four of them. (Not to say that we didn't like the other flavors.)   We then went on to order the the shark, the mahi mahi, the mole and the pibil pork shoulder tacos. I can't say enough about these. The mole was tasty and rich. The pibil pork shoulder was sooooo good. The meat in that one had so much flavor and was just perfect. The shark taco was more like a shark taco with a LARGE side of more delicious shark. Seriously, too much shark for one taco. (Not that such a thing is a bad thing!) The mahi mahi taco was more like a scrumptious mahi mahi pizza. The portions for these tacos are more than enough to keep get you full by the end of the night!  I really liked every little taste that this place offered up. Why isn't this a five star review? Honestly, the service isn't the greatest. It isn't bad service, it just isn't five star service. Seriously, I would over look this little point time and time again if I lived close to this place. The food is AWESOME. Seriously. Check this place out and you will leave full and happy!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two Tinga tacos and two Carne Asada tacos.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shark, Mahi Mahi, Chicken Mole and Pibil tacos. Delicious!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

p3anLLSjoLzu7EJGwyx4xg.text: Love this place- only wish we didn't have to wait outside to get in!! That beau g said it's worth the wait!  We got tacos but saw some quesadillas that looked amazing- next time!

5Oaq2gMnpvuqLjui8s5jwg.text: This is by far the best Mexican food I've ever had! Al Pastor is amazing and all the salsas in the salsa bar taste great! Get the Cadillac Margarita, super good on the rocks.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ld5IE9Z_kHcmV_p_-XyTLA.text: Tasty food, great horchata. But, the waitresses seemed stressed out. Nonetheless, I will be back. Really enjoyed the food. Great cheat meal.

bRCZok-rl3s7saXVvFnX1Q.text: Salsa bar is amazing! I had the pork and it was also perfectly cooked! The service was excellent, it was 5 stars all day. I liked this place a lot.

9I9T0Bl8wHT5O0Wr8sDaiQ.text: Salsa bar is HUGE but not maintained.  I sampled 5 tacos. None were that great. I was disappointed by this place. Service was 4/5. They really need to clean the place and the salad bar more often.

OTBSSrrFBaRhh7koL2nvDg.text: One of my favorite taco spots . Huge variety of tacos from shark to filet mignon. Love that they always have so many salsas to choose from . They have created a small but comfortable environment . Service is decent and the wait times are usually pretty long. Overall really good Mexican food would recommend .

LM4nvFGCiGqsXR8T7WOaOw.text: One of my favorite places to get real Mexican food for good prices. They dont take reservations so keep that in mind. The service is great. The salsa is great

j8XXrGM9BQzP3TO25yE9UA.text: The fish burrito here is my favorite and don't forget to try the horchata--best I've had! They load it with extra cinnamon, pecans, cantaloupe and strawberries.   The salsa bar is amazing and the quesadillas are deep fried--yum!

NHVLIv-qxooNcypZliEKVA.text: OMG! La Condesa, I love you!   If you drive too fast down 16th on your way downtown, you just might miss this little, neighborhood taco joint...and it will be your loss.   La Condesa is a delightful little 10-12 seat restaurant with seating also available at the bar. The wait staff are courteous, helpful and knowlegable about the food. There is a salsa bar with no less than 15 freshly made salsas.. everything from your standard pico de gallo to a strawberry jalapeno and a spicy chipotle peanut. We've been here a few times and have not been disappointed. Try the Sonoran Carne Asada Arrachera steak marinated with Mexican herbs, fresh garlic & olive oil, charbroiled with mesquite charcoal or the Mayan Cochinita Roasted Pork Shoulder Taco with marinated onions and salsa habanera. If you order the "taco plate" for a few dollars more, you can get sides of their slow cooked beans and rice.  This is a place nice enough to take your mom and trendy (and inexpensive) enough to take your out of town hipster friends.   Total neighborhood foodie heaven on a budget.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside of La Condesa

LVSgH3oKaEuZDKyuKmkeNw.text: Omg I love this place! They have the best tacos and salsa bar. Oh and the humongous horchata is to die for!

aFvay61QR0hRlw0pekH5HQ.text: The burrito with chicken in mole was superb. I look forward to a return visit.

75snLciAR3cnsY3ydiM8Pw.text: I have to admit that it is a great restaurant. Its service attitude is not only very friendly,the taste of food is also very delicious. The environment is so clean that I have a warm feeling. I recommend you go but DON'T be too late because it might take you some time to line up.

oru6WY1O40cv5sMsj58U6g.text: I had a pastor street taco and it was damaging! Very tasty! I also ordered a steak quesadilla but it was nothing like the quesadilla I know...it looked like a calzone...the dough tasted a little weird but the filling was delish!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak Quesadilla

KAkGhh0VVXS6lXtWUf9-5w.text: BEST chips and salsa in town!! I usually get the 2 taco place with rice and beans. DELICIOUS!!!

XFnIkkuIru3okE8gmRaOmQ.text: I can't say enough good about this place.  I found it on Yelp as we were on our way home from the airport.  I am vegetarian, and good Mexican vegetarian food is hard to find.  I must say this place is a treasure.  I had the potato/nopalito taco and a black bean taco with mango salsa.  Both of them were the best I have ever had.  I would definitely go here again.  There is an amazing salsa bar with all kinds of delicious salsas.  Definitely a keeper.

Dom1UV4jaLVx1plHd9aEJw.text: I ordered La Condesa shrimp burrito and it was delicious. The salsa bar was okay at best, the salsa was similar in flavors despite their various options and it felt like it wasn't fresh. The service was terrible and slow. It took an hour to get my food and my waiter only spoke to us when I ordered my food and to drop it off. I had to get out of my chair and look for my server to get the check. Not impressed with this place. Will not be going back.

L3Tjl65KtHYEB83KYgoxTA.text: Love LaSantisma starting with the amazing ceramic tile sculpture over their sign to their mmm Margueritas, their food in general, and best of all, their guacamole often made with mangoes.

zblog10cV6CDPbD7rsHirQ.text: YOU MUST GO HERE. The salsa bar was so good! I kept getting up to try pretty much every one, and refilled on the strawberry salsa! My waiter helped me pick a combo if three different tacos and I really appreciated it because they were so good! Don't be deterred from the image of this place, its local, its homey and probably one of the best mexican restaurants I have been to - and I am from Texas!

SB8w-FIHWgA6zofQ9rF2tQ.text: In our search for a more authentic Mexico City style taco, we came across this restaurant.  I'm happy to report that the tacos here are about as authentic as one can hope to find north of the border.  The Horchatas are fun and tasty as well.  I enjoyed the food and the small dank dining space brought back memories of the small eateries way down south.  So why only 3 stars?  The price is not right.  For a family of four (with two kids), we walked out with a bill of $55.  All we ordered was one round of tacos and some Horchatas.  Ouch.  Down in the DF, one can find better quality and quantity at a full-service sit down restaurant for 1/3 that price.  Maybe I'm looking for something that doesn't exist in Phoenix and I should just be happy to have this food at any price (or perhaps I just paid the "Guy Fieri tax").  No... I'll keep searching.

7ePm6basf2EkL91hTrNo_Q.text: Restaurant..... You had one job to do, in fact it's your only job to cook proper fully cooked meat, and how hard can that possibly be!! Apparently beyond the capabilities of the staff. If I had wanted dried out tasteless chicken with the consistency of a rubber ball I really would have asked. But that's what I got.   anyway, Smokey (my cat) liked it but he's not much of a connoisseur so that's not much of a recommendation.

SL_5_xkJDJCwqD8vkxQ0Rw.text: We have been to Santisima several times. The food is very good and the salsa bar not only adds, but makes it fun, too. Drinks were tasty, and service is good. One point to improve would be that we almost always have a long wait for our food. Given that it's tiny, there might not be much to do about that...Maybe expand?

o-WGwakarMDjD0KgmEETxQ.text: This is a place where the hype exceeds the capability of the restaurant.   There's nothing wrong with this place. It's just not exceptional, great or even noteworthy.   When you throw in their exorbitant prices of 3.99 for a single taco, you realize that you're getting hosed.   The salsa bar itself is good. The serving cups are too small so as to adequately support the dipping of the chip. Speaking of which, the chips are too thin and cold.   The food itself is good quality. The shark taco was crunchy and tasty, the pork shoulder taco interesting and flavorful. Sadly neither was worth the 4 buck price.

n1gSm8EduwHnNuN0qB8JcQ.text: It was good but they only serve tacos, quesadillas, and burritos.  I did go with the fish tacos and they were very good.  My son had a steak burrito and was disappointed because it had beans in it.  He  considers beans a cheap filler to provide less meat and he said the beans ruined the flavor in his opinion.

QkZ7wjOEn8TT4V38-W0mWQ.text: Yummy deliciouuuuus mole!  A bit too pricey for Tacos/Mexican food.  Place is VERY small.  Salsa selection is very interesting, lots of different ones, some that I had NEVER seen in my life, and I am Mexican.  I will definitely try their quesadillas if I decide to give them another chance.

RJxtP9R6SN7klcudCusGxw.text: Maintain low expectations for service, wait times, and general common sense. But damn is the food ever worth such trauma.

1x7wdaXDR_o6mnCzGZw5xA.text: Oh man, I need to go here more often! So delicious and that salsa bar! Heaven. Go early because this cute little restaurant is tiny and there is not a lot of seating. Have the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco- You're welcome!

hSe52NoYnBdtQY9sHDNlOQ.text: Love the strawberry salsa here.  My only complaint is that they do not take Amex!  4th star is only because they didn't accept my Amex. The salsa bar and taco selection are incredible .

7IPYAWk9kOf-cWOamFxZEw.text: Outside appearances, ho hum. Inside, interesting, but not spectacular. But the food, ...what a surprise!! Now THATs the secret of these two places. The food is Oahacan-leaning and terrific, and a large range of salsas to try.  Not at all your traditional southwestern fare.  Been to both places, and will continue to do so from time to time.

r6k2ZIf0I6RC9T_VGqXblQ.text: Excellent stop for tacos and salsa's. Food is incredible - however I only gave one star due to price- probably because of the popularity and demand it is not necessarily cheap and there is no kids menu. But it truly excellent food and worth it. It could be inexpensive if you only by one or two tacos a la carte. I didn't experience too long of a wait on my visit.

lM1EyYnY9ZKuhIJdicZQfQ.text: I've been here many times. It is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Arizona in my opinion.    PROS: Delicious, authentic food, fresh ingredients, unique menu options, amazing salsa bar, perhaps the best Horchata in the state, delicious margaritas (and I usually don't like margaritas), good portion sizes for the price, nice atmosphere with the rustic bar, Mexican art, and light background music.  CONS: The place is very small and definitely gets crowded because the food is so good. When it is busy, the staff have a hard time keeping up so service can be slow and you may even feel like you are being ignored. Parking is the worst.  OVERALL: One of my absolute favorite restaurants. It's a great place to take a friend or someone visiting in town who wants a taste of authentic Mexican food and a high quality restaurant that Phoenix offers.

miTY4ConkgKxxIfOKm4s7Q.text: I read alot of reviews and had very high expectations of this place. The food was good but nothing that made me say "WOW". Out of the 4 tacos that I tried, the CABO shrimp taco was the best and would return for it.  The salsas and chips are a good way to down down some beers before your meal. I'd say give La Santisima a try and make your own decision.

Qa9EZ2XRQ0iZrZq6PY5gDg.text: The wide variety of tacos here are the perfect vehicle for the inventive salsas! Would recommend to people who like eating at good restaurants.

R86VxzH74OZFFEm6gs6neg.text: Great place! Reasonable price with delicious food and friendly service. The cafe were cute and sweet, and the shop inside was beautiful and interesting.

MONA5i_A9Dc_vwyc9Cl67g.text: Best Mexican food. Their margaritas are also amazing. Be prepared to wait, however it's well worth the time.

9o_GvipfRAkdl4oE-OpDnQ.text: This little place was recommended by my brother, we went on a Sunday and it was super busy we waited about 20 min to be seated which was not that bad.  The food was amazing and the salsa bar is kept fresh! Cant wait to go back. I had a quesadilla with mushrooms and an horchata. It's probably one of the best horchata's I've had! Must try this little place in Phoenix you won't regret it!

OgNUf0gVlvrxiY3Erl_V0A.text: My favorite thing about this place is the fact that you have more than the usual carne asada, al pastor, and (insert third typical meat), instead you have a variety of different tacos, some which I've never heard of but all very delicious. Alongside this, you also have many salsas to choose from, ranging from not so spicy to spicy. I definitely plan on going back soon.

3ZQDftWpIR4gD0JdPBehPg.text: Breakfast was amazing! The salsa bar is the best in town! Friendly staff. Would strongly recommend it to friends and family.

5jPqdxVKGJbme4DMETjabQ.text: This is one of the best mexican restaurant that I know of. I was visiting Phoenix for a week. I had bookmarked this place because lots of "vegetarians go nuts for it".  On the first night in Phoenix, my friend and I drove here for dinner at 8 PM. Neighbourhood is very quite/rundown/sketchy. However, the restaurant was fully packed. Just when we entered through the door, everyone looked at us. May be this is what people in Phoenix do. It felt a little weird as if we were crashing someone's party. We were seated at a table just emptied by someone else. That table was not very clean.  We got a basket of chips and started getting salsas. I was in salsa heaven. I like spicy food. This place serves it very well. We ended up ordering their La Santisima burritos and quesos. Another order of chips. Decided to come back again before we go back from Phoenix. I liked the burrito better than the queso.  I don't want to spend more time in Phoenix. However, this will be go to spot for one meal when I am there. Definitely worth the wait and experience. Price is very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9LRvMVIq1Y8H6mhQ21jK-w.text: We came here for dinner because of the great reviews and awards. Maybe we caught them on an off night but the food was cold and the pork taco was so tough you could barely chew it. The service was also slow and sporadic. Very disappointed

LzQKatHR0wqs1i4uRUoclg.text: For our Sunday lunch we were in the mood for some truly authentic tacos and thought we'd give this place a try.  Location & Aesthetics - located on N 16th Street in Phoenix which I noticed can be a little busy with traffic even though it was Sunday. Parking is a little poor (-1) with a few stalls located outside the restaurant, and some of these parking spots are shared with another business on the corner.   I did notice some other available parking in the vicinity but believed they were for other businesses. Unfortunately N 16th Street was busy, at the time of our visit, so you can't really stop alongside the parking spots to wait for someone to leave as that might cause some traffic on the busy street.  Thankfully there's a side street on the right that you can turn into to turn around. The facade of the restaurant cannot be missed with its brightly green colored painting and large saint figure adorning the front of the restaurant.   Another drawback the restaurant had going for it, in my opinion, is the small interior size (-1).   As soon as you open the door, you will immediately notice how small it is as you will see diners siting at their tables right at the door as you enter.  I can see this could be a little bothersome if you've been seated close to the front door, and with it opening and closing, doesn't bode well for a nice dining experience for some. There is a bench outside of the restaurant for you to wait for seating if the inside is full, and with no real shade and I didn't see any misters, that can be uncomfortable, I guess, during the summer months.  Menus - provided to us as soon as we were shown where to sit and were pretty self-explanatory.     Service - We were warmly greeted by staff upon entering.  It might've been nice if we were asked if we've been here before but no problem as any questions we had, was answered promptly.  Food - Once seated, you are provided with a bowl of tortilla chips, and there's an available salsa bar with a large variety of salsa dips to choose from.  The dips all sit on ice being chilled and have varying degrees of hotness.  From the 5-6 dips that I chose from, they all tasted freshly made and was enough to open the appetite. Prior to ordering, I was in the mood for some libations and ordered myself a mojito which in my opinion was perfectly concocted as you could taste the lime juice (tasted fresh), rum, right amount of sugar, and contained enough leaves of mint. For food, I ordered the -- Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, and the Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Shark Taco with a side of rice and beans.   All three tacos tasted absolutely great and delicious.  There were all flavorful, seasoned well, fresh, not too spicy, and cooked just right.  Definitely a place I wouldn't mind returning to.

5HrdO2865bvnV_Bd5jlaVw.text: I love this place!  We have been several times and it never disappoints.  Great food and the salsa bar is fantastic.  It can get pretty busy so sometimes you have to wait for a table but they are always moving fast and it is always worth the wait!

gTP34NKlpcvc8oVgTnC1Rg.text: Eh. Food was very average and service was pretty bad- we were shortchanged and forgotten about for a solid amount of time. Got 3 tacos and a burrito. Burrito was mostly rice and the taco meat was very dry except for the fish. Overall a very overhyped place. If you're looking for tacos Mucha Lucha is 1000x better.

9oAWLfJgcEmWz-LQKXg3DQ.text: I have tried La Santisima only once and I am already anxious for Round #2! You know when the line is out the door that is the food is delicious. Every meal that was brought out, I wanted to try!!   For my meal, I stuck with all tacos and tried the Carne Asada, Al Pastor and the Baha Fish Taco. They were all so flavorful with their own distinct tastes. All the salsas were different and I believe we tried all of them. They do have a pretty full bar so if you are in the mood, you can try it out. Many people were ordering the Horchata which I made the mistake of not ordering, so this will on Round #2's menu. I did stick with a Mexican Coke and it hit the spot!  I was very intrigued by the artwork, it made me feel like I was somewhere else outside of Phoenix. As I said, I cannot wait to return :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak quesadilla! Huge!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos upon tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Variety of salsas!!

s0Q8d1HrgBIiHJPiFKXtmQ.text: What a great tasting Mexican joint. Went on Taco Tuesday. So I decided on the 3 taco  plate with beans and rice. The beans and rice were the standard issue sides. But the tacos!!!! I opted for the brisket taco, carne taco and pollo. (Chicken) All three were great. They give you the standard chips when you sit down to snack on. Nice thing is there is a salsa bar too!!! Our server was great, smile from ear to ear. I definitely recommend giving them a try. You will not be disappointed!!! Oh, and look for the famous guy on the wall!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8IzXtpyANfHQwWuDY-bwGA.text: One word.....amazing!!!  I have gluten allergies and can eat here without becoming sick.  Thank you.

OzsrNvYY_GFQpoZHYIL3NQ.text: Not that this place needs another raving review but it's just so good I have to review it. We tried numerous different tacos and all of them were very good. My favorite was just the plain old carne asada. Perfectly cooked meat and delicious flavor. The salsa bar is awesome too with a lot of different choices. It's a long drive for us but we will definitely be back.

fqvj8ikRGxFyBf2sJtnPig.text: I sure would love to give this place 5 stars. I promise myself Im coming back so perhaps you may see an update.  I have been hearing about this place even before I saw it on Triple D and I am not quite sure why yesterday was my first visit, I will tell you it wont be my last.  The menu is massive and somewhat confusing it's very wordy with such authenticity that it was just overwhelming. But it is primarily composed of appetizers, Lonchas, (sandwiches) Tacos, Burritos, and quesadillas. thousands of words filled that menu of 100 choices. I snagged a paper menu on my way out and will be ready next time.  Once sat we were greeted with a welcome, and some chips and directed to the salsa bar. Now The salsa bar has a reputation, and I feel it didnt live up to the hype. 4 of the 10 bowls were empty and it wasn't neat and fresh looking. I did try many of what was available  and they were great, if not super spicy!!!!! Strawberry salsa was a stretch but it wasn't bad, and the pico was good, just a basic pico, chipotle was tasty and there was another that was pureed and very hot that's was my favorite. The creamy cilantro could be epic, but some one thinned it out to the consistency of milk, if it was more of a creama I would still be there.  I ordered a burrito because I couldn't comprehend all of the taco choices, upgrades and extra charges for this and that. Tacos range from 4 to 10 dollars ea ala-cart. My choice of the Norteno with green chili was a hit. so very good with a great combo of moist roasted pork, rice, chile, sour cream and cheese. I didn't opt for the enchilada style $5 upgrade because I am fussy about enchilada sauce. I realize now I could have trusted this kitchen. I was a bit surprised to find my plate unadorned with anything but a fair size burro cut in 2. after a few bites all was forgiven.  My buddy loved his street tacos I tasted his beans they were amazing but the rice! The Rice was simply perfection, served on the side and just a little off white. There was something in that recipe caused those flavors to soar!!!! Most Cravable menu item.  It's a cool dining room with lots of quality art covering all of the wall space, along the walls were long naugahyde covered banquettes and loud chairs that sqauwked if you moved the feet across the floor. Felt pads are greatly needed for the chairs.  Restrooms were a mess and poorly stocked, and I could go on and on about that but it doesn't seem to do much good, owners and managers just don't seem to care about them any more, and that was the missing star in this review.

GhsWRtJtrxpbMqUvHr-KXw.text: Great food delicious salsas made fresh almost daily. Unfortunately terrible employer whom the owner doesn't want to pay for my days worked, just putting the word out hoping he will pay im not asking for extras im only asking for what is fair and that is the hours I worked and the tips i recieved from all the generous customers, Christmas is just around the corner and im really hoping to get my full paycheck so i can buy my kids some gifts. I have reported him to the Department of Labor,I also posted on FB which to my surprise several people have come out to say the owner Felipe owes them hours worked as well. I hope the owner realizes what he's doing is wrong and touches his heart to pay me what is fair. Like i said in the beginning food is great and i do recommend it, just not as an employer.

xOREoym8-BVHGC4XXROrWg.text: The food is delicious! I judge every Mexican food restaurant against Red Iguana in Salt Lake City. This is the first one that has even come close, in fact it might even be on par! Salsa bar, margs and sopa Azteca were simply amazing. I will be back.

zUPsntdSg2s_FzQmu_MYHg.text: Very good!  Enjoyed the salsa bar. Service was excellent. Met old friends. Kids enjoyed their tacos. Margaritas were tasty. I'd come back. Only in town visiting. But there are so many new places to try it's hard to keep going back over and over.

lN7Y3RVP-4IkYJCjZKiDIg.text: Great food, I had to wait for my friends to arrive and the waiter was super patient and helpful. The salsa bar was great with lots of options. Also tons of gluten friendly options. The dishes are unique and very tasty I had the mole and loved it. If you want to try something different give La Santisima a try!

fjqGanBYgATZatJ1TqQh_Q.text: Honestly, the best burrito I've ever had. Not to be drama-lama but I think of it often. LONG and LOVINGLY. 4real. I had the Sonora Carne Asada Burro (definitely not the most adventurous but the most classic). It was HUGE and honey I ate it all. Full of tastiness.   Small intimate restaurant kind of off the beaten path. My friend took me here and she loves the tacos. Next time I'm back I'll have to try them- but my burrito was so good I will probably just get it again.  Salsas GALORE at the salsa bar. I'm a woman who loves options and boy do they have salsa/sauce options!   Service was good. No complaints.

XEY_FtTvSbHLuk9kjHR3Yg.text: I love the food here, but service is at best two stars.  The wait staff tends to gather around the bar and chit chat, instead of checking on patrons.  During our last dinner, we were lucky to get one refill and at no point did the waitress check on us after the food was delivered. I actually had to leave the table and go looking for her so we can get the check. The kitchen as always is very slow, so plan on waiting for at least 30 min, even if your order is a simple burrito. The guac is very good for the first few bites, but then you discover that the bottom half of your $10 guac is nothing but onions and tomatoes.  So I am paying $10 for a few slivers of cut up avocado and the rest is the free salsa that's sitting on the salsa bar?  Again food is excellent, but they really need to make sure that the rest of the place comes together.  I am willing to drive out here and search for parking, but more visits with bad service and I will not be coming back.

RQQOsSqi93O2H80E5RWW1Q.text: I personally was not impressed at all based on the reviews we expected fresh delicious tacos but as I hate to post low reviews it really wasn't

e52t6OC0qCJqKephENIagw.text: Thanks Yelpers!  We were in town Sunday - trying to find something new and close by.  Yelp provided the answer - over 1,300 reviews with a score of 4 1/2 stars ... gotta do it.  SO GLAD WE DID.  5 of us showed up for some Gourmet Taco's.  A bit of a wait - but not bad.  Not a lot of room to sit/wait inside - and it could be a hot wait on the sidewalk out front on a summer day - but - once we were inside and seated...Happiness ensued.  A pretty comprehensive menu - various taco preparations - from a traditional Barbacoa (Mariachi), Chicken Tinga, a Sonoran Arrachera steak, to my choice - the Sonora Carne Asada Burro.  Wonderful!  Very flavorful, tender and moist meat.  My dining companions had a variety of taco's and quesadillas, and everyone was completely satisfied.  Lots of wow's every time someone tried something new.  The salsa bar was great - only complaint - I like to really dip my chips, and the small cups provided just enough room to put the tip in, and just enough for a taste.  They were all very tasty - some much more hot than others.  Loved the sweet/slightly hot fresh mango salsa.  I could eat just a bowl of that and be happy!  Too full for deserts.  Well be back again for sure!  Enjoy!

3-AqMxvQBUdn1V0G8oUcjw.text: I'll make this quick: the food is phenomenal. No, seriously. Every flavor is on point. Tacos; perfect amount of meat to tortilla ratio. Queso fundido; real cheese, real hot, real good. And their specialty, the Quesas; a fantastic crunchy but "doughy" masa filled with excellent ingredients. Like a big fried empanada made with masa, but much tastier.   So why am I giving this a 4 out of 5? Well... simple; service. The young staff seems overwhelmed and not very knowledgeable. There is a sense of chaos, which is typical in this current "hip" culture of food dining nowadays. But there is chaos and organized chaos. This is not the latter. While friendly, they really need to get their act together cause I came back for the food alone just two days later.   Delicious place....

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Day of the Dead well represented
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesa and Tinga Chicken and grilled chicken Tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cochinita Pibil and Oaxaca Cheese Quesa

at8Oe2tD-nqx0cDznmHCSg.text: We had the mix and match taco plate. I had the Jamaican Rose Shrimp Taco, the La Santisima Specialty with Shrimp, and the Tamarindo Mahi Mahi tacos. They were very inviting. The chef infused so many ingredients to ensure that when you took a bite into the taco all the flavors burst beautifully onto your pallet. I also particularly liked the texture of the tortillas used to wrap the creative goodness of the tacos. My wife and I also shared the poblano queso. It was also rich with a vastness of melted cheese and poblanos that tasted as if they were dried weeks ago and aged perfectly. We will definitely be back....numerous times!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best Tacos in PHX

cLmI_oJbsbAiNPiGm1C2jw.text: My absolute favorite mexican restaurant in AZ. I have recommended this place to everyone! Their horchata is so unique a delicious, its huge and comes with strawberries and walnuts, I order it every time and their shrimp tacos, so yummy! I used to live in Queen Creek and I would drive the hr drive just to eat here!

hvuLe-BGuY64q780amylfQ.text: This small restaurant is amazing! The food is wonderful would highly recommend this place. Its not super fancy but the food all but makes up for it. The El Gatcho is the way to go!~

miv2Lt5kHY-puzH0KduxRg.text: By far my favorite Mexican restaurant in AZ. The flavors are authentic and the customer service is always great. Love their salsa bar and margaritas! If you're in town and looking for great Mexican food, this is the spot!

KtpsHMLzVba9NSU-XKXuug.text: Overall, a great experience.   Friendly customer service. The server talked to us for a good while, telling us the whole Guy Fieri story.   Good food. I ordered my usual Carne Asada burrito. No complaints there.  Fantastic salsa. Yes, a whole stand with several different and innovative salsas to choose from. From strawberry to peanut butter to mango, that really was the highlight of our visit.  I recommend this place to all Mexican food lovers.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa heaven.

U0rUTXlu2zYiVF1NyrvAog.text: Need to come for the vibe. The food was good, great portions so you will be full. Great flavor a lottle something for all

dj3pJUmHBCjltHyLyQWb6w.text: Update: Went back this last Friday night. Food was incredible, as always. We got the queso fundido, chicken tinga quesa, and the Sonoran arrachera burro. All fantastic. However, the service, as always, was awful. Our server didn't do a bad job, but the host was horrific. It was like she had never been in a restaurant before. There was a wait and she never took anybody's name down and didn't quote any wait times. We walked in, noted a couple groups waiting, and the host looked at us and said "we don't have any tables" ... ... Yeah no kidding. We know. My wife made a face and said "... yeah... we'll wait..?" Awful, unorganized mess. They obviously didn't train this host whatsoever.  Once we got sat, our server took over, did a good job, and the food was great.

tX8s5toVwglBYTyoVH7JGw.text: Love the unique flavors and quality ingredients. I tried the Glendale location years ago but today was my first time at the original. I had the pick 3 mix and match and every taco I had was great. The waiter also suggested the guacamole as it was just voted best in Phoenix and it was definitely the best guacamole I've ever had. Still wish a half order wasn't 7 dollars but hey you're paying for quality. Would definitely recommend to anyone wanting some good quality food in a super fun atmosphere.

RDFb3tZwuArGXkICEiCGQg.text: When we are in the mood for mole tacos, this is where we end up... on top of that my wife loves their protein style tacos (think instead of a tortilla, fried cheese... says it's amazing).  We have been coming here when it was small and I mean small. When there was actually seats at the bar. Now they have expanded and the place is always packed.  You will fall in love with all the salsa they make homemade... there is such an arrangement and you really can't go wrong with any you choose.  I normally get a beer here, but the last time I grabbed a margarita and for me not being a sweet drink guy, this wasn't at all and was extremely good... especially for the price!  The artwork is also really amazing... overall great service (always) and amazing food. Highly recommend a stop!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GVBK_c4ECugG2HiuWx9p4Q.text: Probably the best Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. Was blown away by this place! The Mole burrito is phenomenal and All the food we had was very authentic and delicious.  Pro Tip- Visit the salsa bar and try them all, but in particular the light green sauce which has a real kick to it!  Know that this place is always busy so expect a wait, but know that it is well worth it to stick around!

GtoLuv_au03B4hB4PKoj1Q.text: Very unique and very tasty.  Try the quesadillas on the back of the menu to share. Can't go wrong with the rest.

poBcEL68brpXfGxQ5HxtZQ.text: We were looking for something different and we found it.  While trying to decide where to have a weekly lunch with family this week.  I searched tacos on yelp and La Santisma come up.  We went yesterday and it was good.   I ordered three tacos.  One beef, one pork and one chicken.  The meal came with rice and beans too.  The beef taco was good.  The pork taco was excellent.  The chicken was okay.  Some will like it but it did not appeal to me.  The rice and beans were good.  They brought chips out.  We enjoyed the salsa bar too.  I liked the chipotle sauce the best.  The flavours were great.    Next time we come back I will try a couple of other things on the menu.  I might go with a burrito next time.   Great place if you are looking for something unique.  I will be back to try some other stuff.

D_oGnd_k7u4Atsf4n8Ys8Q.text: Amazing experience! Loved their unique gastro tacos.  Gluten free friendly - they have GF on the menu for all their allergy friendly items.  Solid house margarita on the rocks. I got the andalucia taco, pork tapatio taco, and the Azteca tinga taco.  *Loved* the andalucia taco: chorizo & potatoes is an amazing combination. The azteca taco was a very delicious & unique chicken taco.

vgHpRcIJ1w4SqBRsshxl8A.text: This place makes me sad that I don't live in Phoenix to eat it everyday of the week. The horchata was INSANELY good, it had fruits and pecan, which I never knew I needed in my horchata but now will want it served that way. We had the baby shark taco - it was unlike any taco I've had before - to inform you shark tastes like if fish and chicken had a baby.  Their quesadilla is not the "traditional" quesadilla and instead was a fried oogy gooey amazingness with Oaxaca cheese which is basically Mexican mozzarella. Did I mention the huge salsa bar? You can try all kinds of tasty salsas and other sauces. Be careful though if you're not a spicy person, read the name thoroughly so you don't accidentally inhale what seemed like normal salsa and the heat sneaks up.  If you're in the city you HAVE to try this place, we were here for a week eating Mexican food everyday and this was our favorite by far.

VvjTieQlxUnQb4WIj9gYxQ.text: Amazing food, service and surprisingly very tasty veggie/GF options! Will definitely come back!

Ss1jZeu_zD5R0ejoX-uQVQ.text: Fresh Horchata made with fruit and pecans, SO refreshing and delicious- come in a large size so you can easily share!   Served right away with chips and an all you can eat salsa bar! The pico is always my favorite because it's so fresh and usually has a kick from the jalapeno which I love- but I usually get a small side of every single thing from the salsa bar! Yummmmm! (By seriously, make sure you get the pico)   I ordered the street taco plate with rice and beans. I tried the chilango suardero, chicken asado and carne arrachero. My favorite was probably the chilango suardero and my least favorite was the carne arrachero (mostly because it had a strong chipotle taste which I didn't care for). The chicken was really good too!! If you like a lot of flavor then def go with the chilango! Although I may be biased because I poured mounds of salsa and pico all over my tacos!   The rice and beans were good too, but I was sooooo full from the tacos that I didn't eat more than a bite.

rwNiZHQ6eb0e9vZCxIWQrQ.text: Decided to try a new place for dinner, was not impressed by any means. Gourmet taco shop? Was not worth the money or the time. Everything was some mixture of street tacos and new fusion flavors. I had a hard time finding something i would eat. I  finally chose to chicken taco combo, it was nothing to right home about, they were rather bland even with lime and cabbage. The rice and beans were flavorless. There was a salsa bar with several different salsas, all with different ingredients, it was like  they were trying to hard, none of them were not really to my liking, i would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for real street tacos. This was just not the place for me personally i don't think pineapple belong on tacos.

l11arDZy9KNJkhYLcEXq2Q.text: Driving through to Texas and stopped because of the great reviews and vegetarian options... did not disappoint! The meat eaters, my husband and in-laws liked it too.  I tried the street tacos, 3 different to try out. Had the Santisima veggie, Cauliflower pastor and Ghandi Vegan... the first was my favorite! If I'm back this way again, will be stopping by!

LZBDKxpV0E08JuUum2bA-w.text: Great tacos, service could be improved.    I've been here a few times and the most recent visit was severely lacking.  I'm not sure if they were understaffed, inattentive, or just didn't care.  This was a departure from the previous times I've been in.    Take a peak at the average rating over the past few months, and you will see I am not alone.    Tip to diners:  make sure you sit in the main dining room, away from the entry / bar.  We sat in the auxiliary / entryway dining room and were all but forgotten during our visit.    I am looking forward to coming back, but I really hope it's a better experience than this last time.

pmAQ1vIYhLcntKA3OCfpFw.text: My husband and I stopped by on a Sunday for a late lunch and the restaurant was probably half full. I ordered one of the burrito plates and he got a taco plate. We got a horchata to share. All together this would set you back about $40.00-$45.00 before tip. I consider it a little steep considering the sides were pretty much refried beans and a clump of rice (a colorless platter lacking guac, lettuce, and sour cream). But I'll have to admit that the burro was large and delicious. Taste was on par with a top ranked authentic Mexican restaurant that I used to frequent before I moved to Phoenix. They give you tortilla chips when you first sit down and there is a bar of various salsas in the back corner. I like how the waitresses make sure you are taken care of, but are not intrusive by checking on you too often. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting because the food truly is delicious.

Rq63pJuVOZaa1TrLx-Um1A.text: The staff is lovely at this funky Phoenix taqueria. I love the idea of the salsa bar and the margaritas are really good. I also like the bright decor. But somehow it felt like a mix between a filthy dive bar and a white people's mexican restaurant if you know what I mean? It just seemed really dirty and a bit cheesy. To me, it is a bit too expensive to feel like the tables are grimy. Don't get me wrong, I love grubby places but this just didnt have the right combo. It needs a deep clean.  The tacos were ok, and the beans and rice were very very very tasty!  Again, the staff was absolutely charming and I did enjoy myself. But personally I probably wouldnt return. There are better tacos elsewhere I think.

5-M6x36l7QNBzYJdLVcIqg.text: I was there for the weekend and had never been to Phoenix. I opened up my Yelp app and this place looked interesting. Since it was a new place for me I decided to order several items so that I could try different flavors. To begin, I ordered the shrimp queso which had a nice, smooth taste to it. I loved it. For my main course I ordered 4 different tacos and the very first thing my eyes saw on the plate were a long piece of hair! Yuckkk! I got up and went to look for the waitress, the manager, someone I could talk to about this and everyone seemed so busy so I went to the register and told the cashier what I had discovered. At that point, she called the manager over and he apologized and asked if he could get me a new set of tacos but I advised him that I was too grossed out to keep eating. I asked for my check which they ended up charging me for the queso and my drink and I left, adding this restaurant to my "never return" list. Sorry but it is what it is and your cooks and even waitresses should be more attentive.

JqYADNIXEL-V3xXfVyUjJg.text: Another restaurant featured on Triple D and Guy Fiery that absolutely didn't disappoint. This was our second restaurant visit for dinner in Phoenix and it was a great selection of tacos. We really enjoyed the ambiance of the place and they have nice pictures and paintings. The service was quick and the quality was great. Definitely a must visit when you're in Phoenix. Here's my Video Review if La Santisima youtu.be/4dvFSwqrwCw

Q_FWgXzRyyrA3Ng2IyxYKQ.text: I don't even know where to start...the salsa bar was huge! Full of fresh choices, but my favorite was the jicama and cilantro salsa. It was refreshing with a crunch! I ordered the horchata and I've never seen it served with fruits and pecans before but it was delicious! For my main course I ordered the burrito with Argentinian steak and I could stop eating it.
