I had a food coma after.   The staff, especially our server, were all very attentive. Our server had answers for all our menu questions and her recommendations did not disappoint! We will definitely return when we are in Phoenix :)

oybJHyKiEHLYscSKyc7Ifg.text: Finding a unique Mexican restaurant is oddly hard in Arizona so when I stumbled upon this gem, I fell inlove! They have expanded their place since I first started going, which is nice since theres usually always a line. The staff are quick and to the point, so don't go there expecting to be catered to. but the food... sooooo good!   Only minor complaint is the salsa bar has small cups, which can be inconvenient when trying to dip your chips.

aYjCcIH9xI_YdcgiPkM2Gw.text: Pretty good food.  Kind of hard to order if you've never been there before, maybe check it out on line first.  The salsa bar had a lot of tasty options.

r2PAXhAG8VV4HjbACvuOLA.text: My wife brought me here for my birthday last year I'm going to tell her to bring me again just because the food is great

aPe4ZLsMTzK4oTwZKv1O8g.text: I'm obsessed with this place's Horchata! The salsa bar is great, the tacos are incredible. I love the cute small atmosphere. Great vibes, great food, what else could you ask for? Definitely going back over and over.

383W2m4m81BYAbYuPpAnsw.text: Saw this restaurant on diners, drive-ins and dives and am so glad we stopped here! We are in town for 2 days from Miami, on our way to Sedona! Service is amazing, food is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! Great place! Horchata is the best I've ever had!

9TM-0YAba8OlKfKjHOzrDQ.text: Really good street tacos, the spicy chicken and spicy pork were awesome! Def a True az Mexican taco shop! Will be back again for sure!

XjlKVCDH1vLQVVfHyH6ARg.text: Well reviewed for good reason. Tons of options and cheap margaritas on Tuesday!  If I lived in Arizona I'd for sure be back.

gDoVH9ZnX3pfUG5bRkvYCg.text: This restaurant is schizophrenic.  The front of the house is a nightmare: incredibly slow, somewhat aloof service, small plastic cups of water that don't get refilled, restroom issues (the men's was closed and the women's was dirty which is unacceptable at all public establishments but especially in a restaurant).  When we sat down there were chips on the table but no napkins; those didn't arrive until dinner so I went into the restroom and grabbed some paper towels.  Speaking of salsa, the restaurant has a salsa bar with at least a dozen different types to choose from -- great idea in theory, but unfortunately about half of the containers were empty and they were not refilled the entire time we were there.    However...I gave this place 3 stars because the food is indeed delicious.  My husband and I ended up ordering the same thing -- a "street taco" plate with 3 different tacos, rice, and beans.  The al pastor, chicken mole, and pork pibil tacos are fabulous, with complex flavors that explode in your mouth. The food is high quality, fresh, and incredibly tasty. I would have liked to tell you about the guacamole, but at 8:00 p.m. they were out of it.  We noticed that they offer take out service and I would recommend that as the sole way to get food from La Santisima.  In addition to the lousy, indifferent service the restaurant is tiny, crowded, and doesn't have much atmosphere.  They really should expand to a larger space where they can better meet the demand that's been generated from all the favorable press and their admittedly delicious Mexican fare.

8eqRtQzgwIzUFsqZzHN7Zw.text: Delicious! The quesadillas are a must have. Loved the salsas, had many to pick from. Highly recommend this yummy place.

GnqT6z_5CHHdupi7SebfWA.text: I went here to use a Groupon a couple weeks ago (can't believe I forgot to review it!). We got there fairly early and the place was empty. I found that to be kind of awkward. Anyway, The BF and I both got taco plates. I got the pork and the gaucho tacos. The pork was alright, very tender and the flavor was decent - a little sweet a little spicy, but the gaucho was pretty not good. There was something incredibly sweet about it...I did not like it at all, and I love chimichurri sauce. Their salsa bar is fabulous! I liked the pecan salsa and the tomatillo. I thought the strawberry salsa was odd...not my cup of tea. The salsa was the best part of the meal. I also had the horchata.....I did not care for it. The fruit and nuts in it did not add to the flavor and it was served luke warm...not so good. I do not know that I would go back.

vmKJtjMbltLZJecH73vrfQ.text: Of the countless Mexican restaurants in Phoenix, it's hard to find one with an authenticity to it that brings back memories of Mexico City. Fortunately, La Condesa, an excellent taco shop in an unlikely location, succeeds. The first time I went there, I wasn't quite sure what to expect, as I had been recommended numerous times by family members and friends.   What I noticed immediately was the eclectic selection of homemade salsas. From smoky peanut sauce to deliciously sweet avocado salsa, Condesa has just about everything a chips & salsa lover could imagine. As for the chips themselves, they're actually warm and delicious even when not dipped in one of the many salsas offered. Condesa makes you believe that the chips are being made in the kitchen right before they bring them to your table, even if this isn't the case.  The restaurant's atmosphere perfectly matches the food, with excellent music playing at all times and fascinating art adorning every wall of the room. Based mostly off of classic Mexican art and architecture, La Condesa is beautiful to look at it if you decide to dine alone. Even if you are with friends or family, the many art pieces hung around the room will surely spark a conversation; they're all gorgeous and full of Mexican history.  For the main course, I had a Veggie Burrito with a side of rice and refried beans. Just about everything was absolutely delicious, and pouring a little bit of salsa on it made it even tastier. The beans weren't very full of flavor but were definitely enjoyable especially when eaten with the rice and burrito.   Since my first visit, I've tried a variety of foods at Condesa but my favorite so far has to be the Shark Meat Burrito. Before trying it there I had never eaten shark meat before and always wondered what it could taste like. To my surprise, it was actually delicious and made for the perfect filling to an already delicious burrito filled with mushrooms, spinach, melted cheese, and garlic.  To drink I only had a pink lemonade, but the person I came with had Condesa's famous Horchata. While I'm used to the delicious and legendary Horchata from Mexico, I did enjoy the Horchata at Condesa, even if it wasn't as perfect as some of the more authentic renditions that I've tried over the past couple of years.   The fountain drinks are served in large cups, the kinds that you see in gas stations directly off the freeway, complete with a plastic lid and straw. Of course, the presentation wasn't anything fancy, but the cup is so large that needing a refill is unlikely, something I enjoyed (especially when the place is extremely busy, making it near impossible to get speedy service).  This brings me to my final, and only entirely negative, point. Where Condesa is lacking is in the service. While all the servers are very nice and accommodating, the food has a tendency to take a while to get to the table, especially if the restaurant is busy. With room for about 20 or 30 people at the very most, Condesa is a small restaurant, one that operates with a maximum wait staff of about three at all times.   The best advice I can give you is to take your trip to Condesa before the lunch rush, or before the dinner rush. The enjoyable experience of the food and atmosphere will be quickly deflated once the restaurant reaches 65% capacity or more. The tables are far too close together and eavesdropping on another group's dinner conversation is entirely unavoidable. It's best to not come with massive groups, as the restaurant prides itself on its intimacy.   Anyone looking to try authentic Mexican food should come to Condesa immediately. While I'm one to enjoy places like Filiberto's almost any day of the week, the experience you'll have at Condesa is one that few other restaurants in Phoenix can offer. The prices aren't extremely high, and the food is worth every penny.

1NIhlV0CgevH29qTggQM-Q.text: My co-worker walked in from lunch the other day with their horchata and I liked the bit I had so much I demanded to know where it was from. It took a bit for me to get used to the sheer number of salsas they had available, but once I got comfortable trying things (I was afraid I might burn my tongue off accidentally) I was hooked!   I'd recommend the peanut salsa to anyone. It was some seriously good sauce.

leWGR1mi2n7jAVnTRvf3Fg.text: You'll want to legalize immigration, for sure, once you try this food and salsas. The salsa bar brings strawberry, pecan, cilantro and other 8 or so collection of salsas to be savored with your basket of chips.  An array of hotness, so sweet, yes!  This food will make you question what the heck was that other Mexican food you once thought to be delicious.  This is True Mexico City cuisine.   I've been to Mexico City and have tasted el sabor verdadero, now here in Phoenix, is a family owned restaurant that brings this authentic Mexican flavor to you and yours and you will say thank you its here.  Provecho!  Keep up the good work to be great Condesa!  Gracias.

4AHvYxucOp5RKIphyCue0g.text: Best tacos I have ever had ! I recommend the mole poblano tacos their Michelada and horchata I have never had tacos as good as these and their salsa bar is the best the almond salsa was my favorite the service was great it's a little small restaurant but worth waiting

Fx5L8CEvfsz9Zfcb8vpKpg.text: Food and drinks were amazing..I enjoyed the black mole` taco.  The salsa bar had a variety of flavors and spices...The guacamole was rediculously hot, but yummy!  The service was a little rough, it was very busy and i think they were understaffed.  They forgot to set our table and once served did not come around often to check on us.  If you dont mind waiting and sub par service come check this place out...The good food definitely outweighs the bad service.

zj_Uio5_ZM5WtJJmV9GTjQ.text: My friend took me here for lunch.  I had read about the salsa bar and so was looking forward to trying as many salsas as possible.  The server let us try 3 of the taco fillings before we chose.  We then had the chicken, the pork, the Gaucho and the shrimp and shared them - all were very good.  We tried all the hot salsas (no strawberry for us!) and they were decent (not Mrs. Renfro's Ghost Pepper Salsa hot, but decent enough).  The prices were very reasonable and I would for sure go back if I was in Phoenix again.

Gpm_PwzYrGhm2GqruokxDQ.text: This is by far the best place in phoenix for Mexican food. they have yummy chocolate tacos too! Their variety of sauces was unlimited. The ambiance was perfect for Halloween :)

c3Z-VosqJOiYruMCUY2MFg.text: Yes!! Go here! Order anything and it will be delicious. Guacamole and horchata are highlights!

RBv8vCn_bvD24-_YQS4zWQ.text: Best al pastor street tacos in the U.S. I visit Mexico City 5 times a year and this is the only place that come close to a real street taco. The gourmet ones are good for gringos but not this gringo. Try the Jamaica and horchata waters. Don't forget about there happy hour deals. The service is mostly bad, they have one good server, but the food is worth it. Come with an open mind and don't come if your used to be pampered.

8SW6N4GkTwljbwJDK4UTdQ.text: OMG this place is simply amazing. Delicious gourmet shrimp & fish tacos and the best salsa bar in town. I've been here a dozen times and I've yet to sample all of them (mostly because the "salsa cilantro" is ridiculous). It gets a little crazy during lunch time. The only knock on this place is the side of rice amount (the amount of beans is good - not fan of beans though) you get when you spend the extra $1 and get the taco "plate." But you can always get a street taco for $1.25 MORE you would spend other wise on the "plate"... If you're not a fan of beans.

kZR0XKFXqusCi88SCS3Z0Q.text: I like their tacos and their salsa bar. I like the people who work here.  I do not like the neighborhood, to be perfectly honest. I also don't like eating with a bunch of flies in a too warm restaurant.  Maybe I just came on an off day, but eating at La Condesa was just not pleasant for me, regardless of the company I kept.    The abundance of flies in the restaurant made it difficult for me to enjoy my meal to the fullest.  It also made it hard for me to concentrate on the otherwise stimulating conversation I was having.  I had to swat flies the entire time.  Maybe it is because they leave the front door wide open?  The flies can't resist such delicious food?  I'm no snob and the food really was good.  I just can't see myself going to La Condesa again in its current location.  UPDATE: Okay, maybe I AM a snob.

-O68I9DlfWKGYm92JY60UA.text: Well, living downtown teaches you a few things and one is that if a restaurant is in a sketchy area, it must be DELICIOUS! I take people here for lunch and always recommend the black mole chicken taco.  They first read the ingredient and make a face (the word chocolate throws them off).  Everyone loves it after eating it! They end up ordering more tacos and horchata to go!  The veggie taco is my other favorite. Don't expect nice tables, decor and easy parking - you might have to drive around the corner to park in front of a chained linked house with weed grown up to the roof but the food is worth a try.

Um2x5SILs6RxCZH-TNNHOA.text: Things Evolve over time, so has La Condesa, There now is a big fancy bar and a somewhat different menu.  What really matters is that the flavor, ans salsas are still here.  I had a burrito with Mahi Mahi in it, it came loaded with spinach, mushrooms, cheese and rice. The cheese was a bit much but was still great at 10.59 with tax it should be.  What really mad it great was the salsas. Everything from a peanut salsa, to a strawberry to many of the classic favorites. I really enjoyed the roasted peepers and onions salsa.  Yes the inside is small and the parking is suicidal when you leave, but if you need a flavor shot give this place a try.

unULA4bfIGXvc43pjRcSSg.text: Everyone loves the salsa bar, but I find it mediocre. Sure it has more salsas than most places, with a wider variety -- but it's just not what I expect from salsa. It's fun to try, but it's not something I would do it again.   With the above average prices, and the mediocre salsa bar, it's definitely 3 stars for me.

y1wTLVnPCY6_JsfgDCz67Q.text: This place has really really really (did I say enough really)good Mexican food. The only negative I have for this place is their location. 16 different kinds of salsa`s kinda makes it up for it though.  They have strawberry salsa, pecan salsa and the list keeps on going.  I tried their mole chicken tacos, they are hands down one of the best I have had. If you are big foodie like me and follow Dinner Drives and Dives this place was featured there. The food will not disappoint you here.   Must try this joint.

ERA23AUhUoY22S76_9xLBQ.text: Don't miss out on this place! The food is delicious and authentic, and the atmosphere is hip and comfortable. Their salsa bar is awesome!

XI8GMMfenNOMnILfbhr-VA.text: Good tacos that are large in portions and progressive on taste (not your typical sauces)  with an even better salsa bar.    Reminds me of a high end mexican place with the prices to match.   As a result, I would highly recommend you to visit this place for the food.

ccMesQWNNQGpxoWvUMrRKg.text: Very different from your average Mexican cuisine. Everything we ordered was yummy. Love everything from their house made salsas to their artwork. Thanks for your warm customer service!

0gNW6991yfyNiJ4j-ChJqg.text: We were hesitant... Rolled up after dark ... Tired from a lengthy road trip... Exterior was scary.  Interior was delicious.  So glad we were brave enough to walk in.  Amazing menu... Delicious gourmet salsa bar.  Great margarita.  The salsa Fresca with strawberries was incredible... Seating is a little tight, but so glad we discovered this Guy-Fieri-approved 'dive.'  We'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The approachable price tag.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The satisfaction.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Le menu

h65OIpulMwGuMiFx0KdH_w.text: I was craving tacos and so glad I came here. Food is very well priced and service was so friendly. They were very patient with my mom who can be slow to order and very picky so I really appreciated their taking the time to explain the menu and make recommendations. The salsa bar is unbelievable, like 12 different kinds to try. I got street tacos and they were very filling and tasty. The space is small and it's in an area that could use some love but I say have the proper expectations and you won't be disappointed. Finally, the art will catch your eye from the old timey wooden doors to the luchador decor in the bathrooms to the day of the dead altar. My favorite was the painting over the salsa bar.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos in counter clockwise order: al pastor, cochinita pibil, and carne asada.

dUiuX7IaqlenX4KzEa9P7A.text: horrible..... I went to la santisima on a friday after lunch time. it was not crowded but we still had to wait for a table, we got a table and the service was horrible, soda was flat, they sold my husband coke in a bottle and didnt even ask if we wanted fountain soda or that mexican bot tle soda. taco bar was in Tupper ware and no big deal on flavors, my tacos carne asada was saltyyyy couldn't eat that sh.... husband burrito was salty and full of beans mind full that it was carne asada burrito. I would not go back or recomend to friends. need to get a bigger location and get rid of the dusty xmas tree and junk around it or take time to dust and clean.

-VnZNSHSAwxPJW0Wfi75sg.text: The food is some of the best Mexican food in Arizona.  The service is terrible though.  They have recently expanded their seating, which is great, but it doesn't seem that they have expanded their Kitchen capacity.  The wait staff is not very friendly.  Not unfriendly, but they don't add anything to the dining experience.  Food takes a long time, usually 30+ minutes to get your food.  This makes it hard to take our kids here, as they find it hard to wait for their food that long.  We go here a lot, because the food is amazing, but that is the only reason.  If they had the service aspect of dining, it would be one of the best restaurants in the state.

swHEMDQ3h6FECpoO_NxEKg.text: Great place, if you're looking for excellent unique Mexican food rather than the plain old run of the mill rice and beans being served every half mile in Phoenix. My wife and I love new and unique, we had one look at their salsa bar (all made from scratch) and had to try them all. The tortillas alone are fantastic, but then filled with shredded chicken, mole, shrimp, roasted peppers, fried cheese, cochinita, all blended with traditional spices and cook to delicious Mexican perfection and add to that the accompaniment of ALL THOSE SALSAS! The decor is beautiful, it has a very rustic cantina feel to it, with some amazing artwork on the walls. Over all the only disappointing thing is that we didn't discover this place sooner.

JO6DAEzl58x8zveZzoe6jg.text: I recently enjoyed delicious beef and chicken tacos as well as the plentiful salsa bar at La Santisima. The establishment is small and the service proved acceptable. If I lived in the area, I'd likely explore their menu on a more regular basis.

q3mvUN-fl09CxNrjak-o8Q.text: This place was amazing! The only downfalls would be the parking situation and the service is freaking SLOW. We came on a Saturday a little before 5:30 pm and a 10 minute wait. We ordered 2 margaritas as soon as we sat down and didn't get them until maybe 30 minutes later after flagging our waitress down. Pretty sure she forgot, but still c*mon. They were pretty dang good too. I love the complimentary salsa bar and the variety of flavors! Salsas definitely can make or break the meal and you have so many to choose from! The chips were fresh and tasty. 1st basket is complimentary but I think like $3 for more as it states on the menu. The fried fish taco was fabulous, light and crispy! The refried beans were creamy and smooth. Rice was simple, so it was a refreshing change from other restaurants. The whole dining experience  took 2 hours! So it's definitely a place you need to go to when you have the time to spend. We had time to look at the menu and decide what we were getting before we sat down, so we weren't taking our sweet time or anything.  The line was out the door at 6 pm and the service is on the slower side, do be ready for the wait. However, I was impressed with the food and will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rQnSRA4j9GkgNDtdYf1syQ.text: Best burrito I've had in a long long time. At least two of the salsas are worth the price of admission alone and the horchata is world class with fresh fruit.

J8n0YsFbtpeflfaj87ODAg.text: Great tacos and the salsa bar is a must try! Would not recommend for groups larger than 2-3 as the dining room is tiny. It feels a lot like all your aunts, uncles, and cousins jammed into grandmas kitchen.

9AIJRF9_rDyd6Pf2x06zLQ.text: Fresh chips and salsa with a temporary unidentified object in my "margarita tamarindo".  Our waitress graciously explained that this was a tamarindo in my drink, which gave the margarita flavor. I have been driving past this restaurant for years, admiring the beautiful sugar skull mosaic glistening in the Phoenix sun as I drove by.  Well tonight was the night. I pulled into one of the limited parking spaces located directly on 16th street, momentarily pondering how I will pull out later, but consumed with curiosity as to what was behind the big wooden door. I apprehensively opened the door, and was pleasantly surprised with what I found. A quaint mom and pop restaurant with a True southwest feel and experience. With the likes of a visit from Guy Ferari (?) And Best of New Times awards plastered on the menu, I was feeling pretty proud of my mystery choice.  My sister and I ordered and split the bean and Oaxaan cheese burro, mole chicken taco, an the al pastor tacos.  All were excelente!! Ok, thats enough for now as I am feeling the nice mellow effects of my magnefico tamarindo slowly wear off.  We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The mysterious tamarindo in my margarita
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicio!!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dFpKb7OsnLbqNs08XNw8nw.text: the staff  is very friendly, this food is fantastic and the salsa bar is amazing. Ever since the expansion seating is a lot easier

FcfAIkUd6AW81E5NzwNaJw.text: I was incredibly impressed with the food. So much so that I probably will be back. Unfortunately the service. The waitress was the only one, so I was forgiving when it took her a while to take our drink order. At least the bus boy had given us water. By the time she came around we were ready to order as well. It didn't take too long before our order was out but it was missing a few things. My boyfriend had asked for his burrito enchilada style and it was not. He was also missing the rice he ordered. Since we had never been there before I ordered 4 different tacos to see which one I liked the most. Our waitress only brought 3. We told her our issues and she went to fix them right away. I was almost done before my boyfriend's burrito came back with sauce. When she finally brought the 4th taco it was the wrong one. By then I gave up and just took what she had given me. I was just super disappointed that the service didn't match the food. Hopefully next time will be better.

cmn1Cp8whL6wO_mYbsxyag.text: Oh my god, these tacos are the real deal. The mole was incredible!! And I would come back just to eat at the salsa bar! This isn't just any taco shop, these are truly gourmet. I would bring any foodie here.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Too to bottom, I got the mole, the pibil, and el gaucho.  So good!

k-Zf50QvaBOiy6fC8QBnVg.text: This is the second time my family has eaten here! It's a GREAT hole in the wall restaurant! The tacos were AMAZING!!  My husband had the burrito and said the pork was incredible!! We'll be back!!

usHYV2hn0n4JXEpYB3h0rw.text: Delicious!!! First time there and I had the Oaxacan Mole Quesadilla and my friend had the Pastor quesadilla and they were both delicious!!! I also recommend the margaritas! They had orange and grapefruit juice!

y_Jm-xLRYeyBjySp6d3Dew.text: Nice place very small but great food.  However it is always packed so you may have to wait a bit to get a seat.  But it is packed for a reason

G9eAsniZeNWp7tjWjzv9Dg.text: It is all about the salsa bar.  I've eaten their tacos many times, both at the restaurant and to go.  Food is fresh and tastier than many of the other mexican eateries close by.  It isn't cheap by any means, but the salsa bar has so many choices (delicious each one) that more than makes up for the slightly higher cost.  And the choices don't just range from pico de gallo to hot to hotter.  Some are tart, some are creamy, some are smoky and hit the back of your throat, some are hot on the front end, etc.  Just go and taste it for yourself  Because I live close by, I prefer to take my tacos home because the space is very small and (because the food is so good) it can get quite cramped in no time.  (And when the unfortunate circumstance of someone bringing in a baby happens, there really isn't any way to pretend you aren't in hell no matter how much Yoda you think you can channel.)  But get there early and down a few of their happy hour margaritas you might not care about the space.    If anyone knows of another place with a salsa bar even half as good as La Condesa's, please let me know.

mGMMmWN3lpYABVXPY5hw3g.text: The best - Salsas, Flavors, Fast Service.  Most excellent.

ozIGHRxDH__8GU_B1hGDxg.text: Amazing food. The menu offers many more interesting choices than I am used to from the other local Mexican restaurants, and they're absolutely delicious   The service was solid.  The extensive salsa bar is worth the trip alone.  They have Anchor Steam Beer for $3.00 during happy hour (Try it, you'll like it)  Beautiful artwork on the walls, and a very laid back, non pretentious, but still classy, environment.

p1jImb2gmoRkZRI3rbDIhA.text: always crowded, which leads to slow service, but the food is awesome.  The salsas are quite interesting and I try a new one every time.

fDgHB-ZE-ryxk3qsPoXvPA.text: Unbelievable tacos... Some of the best I have ever tasted.  I recommend the pork and carbs asada.   Service and employees were friendly.   Highly recommend

V_37NnBDn6LplfKv63k0FQ.text: This place is amazing; really everything on the menu is good. My favorites are the Cabo shrimp Tacos ( peanut salsa is a must for these) and the Chilaquiles (breakfast).  The quesadillas are also out of this world. The only downside is the dining room is very small and it tends to get busy.

SM3PSqqG4Sor87YfdNwDlg.text: My favorite place to take people for tacos. Great vegetarian options as well as great variety of traditional and contemporary Mexican food. It's small inside but the service is quick.

YCfHLFWuCrgtjpxrwM9j5A.text: Authentic Mexican food made with quality ingredients in a comfortable setting. Salsa bar has great variety from the usual to ones with strawberry. Munch on salsa and chips while they make your food which does take a little time as it's cooked to order. I like my food spicy but like to counter it with their horchata which is chock full of fruit and pecans. My favorites are the chicken mole and grilled veggie tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken mole and veggie taco plate with rice and beans

D7pvMyGJwrvzQ7GueVmpBQ.text: I was realllllly craving horchata and was phyched to be in the area, so I did a quick run in to go order at lunch time on a week day.  I was impressed with how they handled the crowd, they had a flow.  I also ordered some al pastor tacos, while waiting I filled some to go cup from their salsa bar, then waited at the bar. They gave me water and were very friendly even while busy as can be.  When I left and dug in to my al pastor I was sooooo impressed.  It was tied with the best I have ever had.  So amazing! Street tacos are the way to go!  I won't wait so long to come back next time!

Tn2ufKo5Gj7lPM3qgoQilA.text: Fun little restUrant! I like the food. Nice salsa bar!! Try the quesa!!!! I love the arrecha with pabolano peppers!!!!

662ZbXwsVH4O90djEQnE8w.text: Short and sweet....AMAZING. Creative taco and salsa combinations but more importantly....BEST HORCHATA IN THE STATE OF ARIZONA!!!!!!!!

UPVeyqie4aU_hkfFyZ3aOw.text: A huge selection of gourmet and street tacos.  The variety of fish options appeared to be a huge hit with other options, but we particularly enjoyed the cochinita and carne asada tacos. Decent prices, and fun to try the different salsas from their large salsa stand. Beware it gets quite busy during Saturday lunch, and the seating is a small area. Prepare for a short wait during peak hours or go during off hours. We will probably be back again.

7O2mNEiShhDH24RExEQ8xg.text: Salsa bar is second to none.  They must have 20+- Salsa's to choose from.  The food is quite good as well.  That being said, and it just may have been an isolated incident, but our car window was broken out while dining.  We informed the workers and they did not seem surprised.  My guess is this has happened before and will happen again.  If I go back, it will not be in my car.

MjXAonQV4zapMTZNtMd-ug.text: The only words that can express how great this Mexican place are...OMG yummy!  Once you dine at La Santisima you will be hooked for life!  Try to get there before 11:30am or after the lunch crowd 2:00pm or you might have a challenge getting a table.

8d6ltWsEQ1IneEDBxHNZXA.text: Believe the hype, yo. (And order the mole.)

11zyf3QFk6EeYM8CIdjJng.text: Delicious margaritas, excellent salsa bar, local business.....the trifecta of restaurants.  I like that it is small inside and eclectic.  The guacamole is amazing as are the white fish tacos.  Really, you can't go wrong.  Close your eyes and point to a menu item....it will be awesome whatever comes out of the kitchen.

zKFR8FP0Ewh9rjEw82GJkA.text: Today we had a meal par excellence at Condesa!  My sister and Mom raved about the restaurant and I was excited to go.  I noticed some of the prior reviews had so-so service but my experience was very good. Our party of 5 was seated promptly and chips and drinks brought out pretty quick. The salsas were great but I liked the pecan salsa the best. My wife had chicken mole tacos which were tasty and even the beans have that authentic mex taste that is hard to find. Quesadillas were interesting and almost pastry-like in presentation, I had the Argentine beef w Chimichurri sauce and it was awesome. A overall great experience and we shall return. Oh and margaritas were NOT from crappy sweet mix. Fresh lime juice and authentic!!

8wXMgW-c_GcTM-LY6_to9w.text: Been here twice now and I am in love with this place. The food is amazing and the salsa bar is sooooo good.

J7qTNqjDLNqNcp3wPzLajg.text: I always bring friends and family here to have good real Mexican tacos. They always  want to come back here. The horchata tastes the way my mom and grandma make it.

WCCnOXrBVwznctVu9dPA5w.text: Excellent !!! looked up the place before our trip to Colorado, decided to stop in Phoenix for dinner.  We had a 30 min wait, but it was so well worth it, the food was amazing!!.. the owner was very kind and started us on drinks while we waited for a table.  The staff is very courteous, the food is phenomenal.. the price is a little up there, but then again it's not your local Taco shop, this is definitely gourmet tacos at it's best.  I loved their Shrimp tacos!! and of course their cochinita pibil quezadillas were lickity good.. everything on the menu looks very very good.

i-kW7rEFWBRhdTg1VTzZZA.text: Stunning variety of fresh salsas that cover the spectrum from salsa fresco to a cabbage salsa (the night that we were there) and it is my understanding that the salsas are created daily and vary from day to day.  While the salsa selection is incredible, I was encouraged to order an Aztec Tinga Taco. While I enjoy slathering salsa on virtually any Mexican food offering, I found that the Aztec Tinga Taco was so perfectly seasoned that it require no additional seasoning. Perfect.  Can't wait to go back again.

PaSMbzAZQDA1Ifq6-5avDg.text: I came here because my coworkers were all talking about how good this place was. I also heard that they had shark tacos that my bf really wanted to try. The place is super small and kind of divey. They have a salsa bar for you to enjoy when you first sit down. The strawberry salsa was my favorite. Sweet but a little bit spicy. They definitely get you on the chips though because there are no free refills like most other places. Another basket of chips is almost $3. I got the chicken mole quesadilla. Their quesadillas are definitely not like your typical quesadilla. It's almost like a deep fried calzone. The portion is huge though, I could only eat half of it. My bf got one shark taco to try and it was kind of disappointing. It tasted like cod and there wasn't very much flavoring. The taco just came with a tiny bit of lettuce and some green sauce. We got the guacamole and it was delicious. They put raisins and some other fruit in it. At first it sounds strange but trust me, it's so good. Wish we saved some chips to eat with it since we ate most of it with the salsa. The service is friendly and the food came out pretty quick. I'm glad we tried it out but don't know if I would be dying to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Mole Quesadilla

fN7xQB27MZZzWMC-6thtbw.text: On the rare occasion when I write a review, it's either about service, food, or both. Having been a server for 3 years, I'm very understanding and knowledgeable about the difficulties and disasters that can occur while serving. My experience at La Santisima was severely impacted by the understaffing. There was one woman on the floor and one bartender. Their roles included greeting guests, seating guests, getting water/drinks, making drinks, running food, taking orders, bussing tables, resetting tables, taking to go orders, packing up to go orders, and checking people out. I came the day after Christmas at 2pm, and every seat out of the 40 seats available at this restaurant were occupied. Not only is this impossible for two people to manage this type of volume on their own, but guest service several suffers because of it. My sister and I opted to just order to go, rather than sitting and adding another table to their load. After we ordered, We were directed to the extensive salsa bar, which would have been awesome, if half the salsa containers weren't already empty. I mean who has time to restock the salsa bar with sooooooo many other tasks to do, but as a guest it's disappointing.  The food we got to go was great! Hopefully they can get some more staff to make the whole experience more enjoyable for the guest and less stressful for those currently employed.

t9V4jWwPhC8VDELDCgJFHQ.text: Other than the fact that I should have brushed up on my Rosetta Stone Spanish Edition before trying to find La Condessa I can honestly say I haven't had better tacos in PHX.  The place is a little hard to find if it's your first time so after multiple turn arounds and a stop at the Panaderia to ask for directions my colleague and I arrived at taco bliss.   The meal starts off with an endless bowl of fresh tortilla chips and a salsa bar that would make Bobby Flay  jealous. They had some of the best homemade salsas with a large variety. From your classic Pico De Gallo to a Creamy Cilantro salsa.   I ordered the two taco platter with a tinga taco and a carne asada Taco. These were both great. The carne asada was a little dry for my taste but with the assist of the homemade salsa's it was a perfect combo. The tinga taco was a perfect combination of slowly cooked shredded chicken and seasoning. My colleague got a carne asada burrito and a tinga taco and was satisfied by both.   In short if I am looking for a great taco for a good price I am going back to La Condesa.

kND54j8CBOVBpsXsOxzorQ.text: The things I like best about La Condesa (other than the decor - I love the imagery of Dia de los Muertos and Catrina):   their delicious homemade horchata, garnished authentically with bits of melon and pecans;  their many unusual varieties of homemade salsas (jicama, peanut, pecan, berry, every type of chile/tomato combination... All of them tasty); and their thick-rolled, flavorful quesas.  In the land of a thousand Mexican restaurants, they bring a fresh spin to the cuisine and the food is awesome.   Totally worth bumping elbows with one's fellow patrons a bit in the tight dining room.

ySsbh6eX-hCZ84WH2cjx7w.text: Long wait, but VERY worth it. Chicken mole was divine, a wide range of fantastic salsas, excellent house margarita. The absolute best Mexican food I've ever had. yum!

jW_g51R7Eb5TWvmADKh2Vw.text: I love this place. Very welcoming staff and authentic food. Every time friends visit from out of state, this is always a dinner spot request. The name change has in no way changed the flavor. Thanks.

vu003QBeqo9Kz9g_vG7i3A.text: OMG! Second time I've been here and will try to go everytime I'm in Phoenix! Most incredible flavors, fresh, wonderful salsa bar - can't say enough about this little place that you could miss if you simply driving up or down 16th St.  Don't miss it!!

zZcKcHDxjoyHW6eqHLpJng.text: This place was a 3 until I ate there again this week....and subsequently had one of the best quesadilla's EVER! I had previously only eaten the cochinita taco which is good, but not out of this world. From now on everything I eat at this place will be in "quesa" form...   This was unlike any quesadilla I've ever had. The tortilla was thick and crunchy and soft all at the same time and had a taste of sweetness to it. Oh man, Delicioso! The chicken tinga was a perfect compliment as well.   The salsa bar is kind of BS, as there are only a couple of salsas worth your time. The peanut salsa? Give me a break, terrible! But the mexicana salsa is one of the greatest things ever.   This is a "fine dining" type Mexican place that will knock your socks off and run you about 10 bucks. Check it out if you're in the area, it is definitely worth your time!

2i6-v1Wld9nCUyB1UMZN0w.text: Incredible!  It's not too often a native Arizonan, raised on mexican fare, finds a new mexican restaurant this good.  I'd put it up against any, in CA, AZ or TX.  Their Quesadillas are the best!  And we really enjoyed the salsa bar - wow!  That's a lot of different kinds of salsas!  We're definitely coming back to this place.

DMnJVL8ehYI8u22ta9us3Q.text: What a great, quaint place!  The salsa bar is amazing!  We have not been disappointed anytime that we have visited.  The food is always delicious.   The seating is limited, so I would avoid the prime meal times.

4pZbx1OtXyEn2LlRxkQsjg.text: On an extremely hot June day,  I was in the mood for Horchata and had read about La Condesa's with the Fruit and nut pieces.   I enjoyed my drink sitting at the empty Bar area while I waited for my To Go.   Its worth just going for the Horchata.   I ordered One Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco as my Appetizer which was lightly battered and fried perfecty in obviously clean oil.    My Entree was the Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken Quesa.  The 2 Quesas were crispy, pastry like and filled with Mole Chicken.  Oaxaca cheese was sprinkled on top and was a nice compliment .   Although, The Mole was just a tad bit too sweet, for me, I am looking forward to trying the other Quesas on the menu.   I was not familiar with "Quesa's" prior to my visit.

A_q1J24NLXI0y3RnW4ACUw.text: Amazing place wish i lived in Phx so i could have this EVERYDAY!

zjGMg9KmHlox_Ca97fgBmA.text: The tacos are excellent and the salsa bar is fabulous.  Need to continue to go and the staff is friendly and helpful.

rh_M0kOxurp9tLCZlD08_Q.text: The art work is groovy.  The guacamole salsa has a nice sweet touch too it.  Delicious! Great atmosphere & nice people.  What more could you ask for.

grp6yGRol0O4YpqpVxSV1g.text: Fantastic tacos! The best I have had in the US. The salsa bar is awesome. Definitely will be back. Get there early as it gets super busy and the inside is on the small side.

Dgrc5WlgbniF5JIYpoT0sQ.text: My friends love this place (seriously one of them has gone there like 10 times within a few months) and I have to say, it was pretty good. I love their salsas. There is this one, I can't remember the name of it, but it was so delicious.  If I remember correctly, The peanut one was not tasty at all. Their tacos was unique and tasty. I also got a burrito, it was good too. It is a little pricey, $$ for sure.

JOMz_Ppqkfzf_VTL89Dajg.text: I hate to write this review, but what happened on July 21st, 2012 at lunch has made absolutely sure I will never eat here again.  We went in for lunch, and it all went wrong on so many levels.  1. It took them almost 20 minutes to get us chips and drinks. 2. It took another 20 to get our order. 3. Then just as our food was coming out, they had the audacity to ask us to MOVE TO ANOTHER TABLE AS OUR FOOD CAME OUT! 4. We had the Lonches, and the bread was so stale that you couldn't eat it.  I have never, ever had this happen anywhere in the world. Its considered sacrosanct in the world of food service that once a customer is seated, barring an emergency, that you don't move the patrons. Yet, a group of 8 land roving manatees with bad prison tattoos garnered enough respect in this place to get the manager to force us to move.  Now if you do fuck up this badly during a service, you comp the meal and you apologize. This is scripture when it comes to food service, and you don't defy this logic.  Yet, no apology, no offer to make it right, no nada.  I will never go back to La Condesa. We've been eating here loyally for two years, bringing in others to eat there, going out of our way to vouch for this place. Things have changed, and not for the better.   I suggest you skip this place at all costs. Just not worth the BS and rude treatment to even risk it.

4Ux7Vy7eO-Vig-VLms-jBQ.text: At first I thought I was in a nursery, every table in these cramped quarters had an infant (with strollers and baby seats) crying and whining. I hate our society now that this is acceptable behavior of bringing your crying baby to restaurants ...how about taking that kid outside for a stroll like a responsible adult than totally ignore them and put us through this stressful situation (you're just waiting for me to snap RIGHT?)  Well back to the review... Food was fresh, unique, authentic. Plus, Plus, Plus. Salsa's were plenty, yes tried them all. But I'm a foodie and I need flavor, though I thought it's a bit on the bland side for my taste, I'll instead rave about them being unique and not your 'ordinary' mex-restaurant. The night we went, there was a line and busy, and they do treat you as family/friends (another Plus) but maybe too crowded. We had the center table and everyone, servers and patrons jammed right in there.  I ordered up the Sonora Carne Asada Burrito (it says: A char-broiled mesquite Arrachera steak with homemade beans) unsure what Arrachera Steak is but gobbled it up with extra salsa from the buffet. Jodi had the Fish Tacos and well... they smelled fishy. Not the best either one of us ever had ...but was now check off our bucket list. Mission complete

y6wA9mgR-Zq7kVHP6Qp6Cw.text: Oh the HORROR!!   I can here on a lunch date with my husband and two year old. We had an hour since it was on my husbands lunch break, and decided on this place because I was craving some "street tacos", and the reviews/pictures looked awesome.... oh how I was wrong!!  Seems easier to number all the issues we had!  1. We walk in at 12:10 to a nearly empty restaurant, I first try to use the bathroom, and the light wasn't working... that should have been my first clue.  2. We sit down and a few minutes later the place is packed, but for some reason everyone has been help except us!?!  3. Finally someone comes to help, I ordered the horchata since it was mentioned so frequently in the reviews, my husband ordered a Sierra Mist (remember it came in a to-go cup with a lid)  The horchata was bizarra, and $4 4. My 2 year old daughter grabs the free chips.. and I see MOLD on it, then realize the whole basket is full of moldy chips!! No wonder they are free! 5. A different waiter finally shows up since the other waitress was busy taking care of the customers that came AFTER us... I ordered the Sonora Arrachera Taco, and told them about the MOLDY chips, he apologized and took the chips away.  The original waitress came back, apologized for the chips, and said she would comp the drinks, I returned the horchata, and got a Sierra Mist as well (also came in a to-go cup, there's a reason I am mentioning this) 6. After 20 min and being there for 40 and food had not arrived I asked for it to-go. about 5 min later it came along with the bill that only included the food.  By this point I was annoyed but probably wouldn't have given it 1 star, so we leave with to-go cups in hand along with food. I dropped my husband off at work, then drove home. When I got home I ate 1 taco which was pretty good, the meat was flavorful and tender, I only wished I had some of that salsa to add to it. Then I got a text from my husband.....  7. My husband asks "is your Sierra Mist BROWN??? I  open the lid and sure enough it looks like dirty water!!!  Seconds later the entire meal... is in the trash! VOMIT!   I gave this place more chances then I ever give a place. WILL NOT BE GOING BACK!

J4cIy3vGL7l4eaD8NQW0AA.text: i have been to this place a few times now.. in the beginning it was amazing but last time i was a little disappointed.  the salsa bar has lots of great flavors, but the best was the guacamole which used to be free.  now they charge $3.75 for a tiny container..!  the quesa (although tasty) can be VERY greasy.. took it to go last time and it was literally swimming in the container by the time i got it home.  the art on the walls and bathroom doors is lovely and tricks me into liking the place more than i would otherwise, i think.  not bad.. but not good.

8Ww2qTaOmvMvQvhbghpKBQ.text: Had the gourmet tacos and a quesadillas, tgey were both delicious. Love the salsa bar, never had peanut or pecan salsa before but really enjoyed them. The house margarita was great. Only downside was we waited for our food a bit long cause we went during lunch hour.

W-ANXVvNDdLIJv5QGDsGLw.text: Dear 16th Street,  Please continue to bring it!  Just yesterday a colleague at school told me he thought Barrio Cafe's food was diminishing in oomph.   I disagreed, but that evening, I just so happened to bike over to La Condesa to try out this new gourmet taco place on 16th.  The cursive red neon sign, that word "gourmet" and the dozens of Yelp endorsements ushered us in on a Tuesday night.  Warm walls. Original paintings. Furnishings from Bellas Artes de Mexico.  The most substantial wooden tables and chairs in central Phoenix.  When we had opportunity in our conversation to "knock on wood," we felt a bit shamed by the feebleness of our gesture and the robustness of the table.  Order at the counter from a cheerful and demure young lady, whose accent we could not place.  I linger on the ambiance because others have noted the stellar food.  Your food food for thought:  Come for the two taco meal (with beans & rice (with corn!)), and stay for the fresh and diverse salsa bar.  This isn't Baja Fresh.  This is Condesa cuisine.  Think jicama and orange salsa.  Think peanut salsa. And the creamiest, zingiest cilantro creme salsa!  I must disagree with Lali about the beans: America's Tacos' are more memorable, but you are still right, Lali, on a technicality -- the beans at America's are not pinto...It's a secret. Not really. Ask them.

34cE9z-_8n9mpxg5yOIaPQ.text: Two things you must have: the Cabo shrimp tacos, and the cilantro "salsa" (it's at the salsa bar, but it's dairy-based, creamy, and delicious). I went with a vegan and even they found something to eat that was reaaaaally good (vegetable burrito). Some of the salsas were really spicy, but all of them were awesome. Decor is great (chairs are a little heavy and make a crapton of noise if you move them, but I don't really think that's a dealbreaker, come on now), and yes, it's in a bad area (really guys, let's keep posting about locking our cars. Shouldn't you do that everywhere anyway? Most of the people I know who have had their cars stolen had them stolen from outside their houses, or at work, in BETTER neighborhoods than this. Get. Over. It), but overall it was fantastic, servers were attentive and very nice, and the food was YUM and at a good price.

WGhs4yDAGBBaiFMiaiPrXw.text: We drive across the valley to eat here.  Very good food.  Simple, warm tasty and friendly people.  Good work!!

A9KaoVuiNedOyXB-KZc9sQ.text: Some of the best Shrimp tacos I've ever had. Beer battered, everything made fresh. Great authentic Mexican vibe, lot's of Dia De Los Muertos related art throughout. An extensive salsa bar with many clever flavors, many more than most places. Cilantro lime cream sauce, pecan salsa, seven pepper salsa... etc. You get the picture. This place deserves all the hype. Really nice service, very original ideas and flavors like you will taste no where else. Go check this place out for yourself. I personally will now be a regular here.

DMP3u7KeZDDdL99yPrYOag.text: It is interesting that the bust of a tattooed woman above this restaurant specializing in tacos should have such a strong Aztec feel to it since, according to Wikipedia the Spanish conquistadors were the first Europeans to enjoy tacos and incidentally wiped out the Aztecs. I guess that means cultures may come and go but tacos, they are forever, and thank goodness because this place, one heck of an bargain for such a great foodie experience.  The restaurant, if you don't know what you are looking for, can be easy to drive past so have you smartphone out with the map function on Yelp to make sure you don't miss it. Once I arrived, as it was just me, I sat at the bar instead of taking up a whole table. After ordering my drink, which comes in a take-out cup (and I ordered iced-tea, not the famous Horchata which seems well worth trying) you get a basket of tips and then you can go hit the salsa bar which has at least a dozen different types of salsa. I was partial to the peanut salsa, sort of feels like a Thai/Mexico crossover though the pecan salsa, which creamy, was somewhat bland.  I did especially like the 7 pepper salsa, a mix of roasted green peppers, slivers of garlic and olive oil, from what I could tell and their more traditional red salsas seemed quite good.  I had the two taco special, which is about $10 and comes with a small side order of rice (fluffy white rice with corn in it, nothing special) and a small container of re-fried pinto beans, also nothing special but they look nice on the taco plate. For the two tacos I ordered, and this is a mouthful, the "Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco" and some sort of grilled steak taco..both came made with two corn tortillas instead of one and the nice thing, they were not overly soft but had a dry feel to them that kept them from getting soggy from any juices from the taco fillings.  The grilled steak taco had some sort of lime based topping that was really good and both tacos were quite substantive. The Cochinita taco was made with pork shoulder roasted with some sort of red spice and what tasted like orange juice and topped with pickled onion and it was also quite delicious. I did like adding some spicy salsa to that one to kick up the heat a bit.  The menu online is rather limited compared to what they offer now but for a meal that was $13 with a drink and tax, it was a great food experience. If this place was up in Scottsdale instead off of McDowell and 16th St (by the way, easy to get there on the 202, just get off on 24th, go to McDowell, drive to 16th Street and turn. I plan to take some co-workers from the office here next Friday so I can share the experience.  Oh, by the way, found t his place because it was listed as one of the best new 25 restaurants in Phoenix in Phoenix magazine, and they were spot on. Next time I have to try the Horchata which is enhanced with pecans and fresh fruit. Bottom line, worth you time to go here! :-)  Bit of an add on - went back this Friday and boy, even at about 11:30 it was packed. I tried the Horchata this time and the best I've had - I like the pieces of pecan and diced fruit they mix in with it. I also had the steak taco, I guess it is the Condessa taco, that has the spice and olive oil mix on it and it was wonderful, especially with the oil based salsa that tastes like it is made with oil, dried crushed papers and salt, excellent, and I also ordered the grilled squash which, while not amazing, is a nice addition to the meal. I have decided, now that I've eaten there a second time, that I like the grilled steak tacos but the pulled meat, both the chicken and the pork, nothing special, and the side of rice this time, really clumpy and overly sticky, not like what I had last time so I'll give it four stars but need to do something a bit more special with the rice and beans to get a five.

j6pnRfEMhL5sICdjvrtHOg.text: So good! So good. A must try taco shop if you are in Phoenix. I ordered 3 different tacos and was able to turn them into 6 since they put a lot of fillings and 2 corn tortillas. The mole is so delish and you gotta order this taco. I ordered the steak and it was good too, but my fave...the carnitas taco. The pork is so tender and flavorful! I also love all the salsas! I just wish they didn't run out of some of them...there were so many to choose from it was hard to decide what to try so I relied an a regular to steer me in the right direction. The margarita was ok, but I would definitely go back for the mole and the carnitas!

tMSZwLx_KeZ4HlBPbFIHpQ.text: Dogfish tacos: legit. 8 out of 10. (FYI - Dogfish are little sharks.)  Shrimp tacos: also legit. Also 8 out of 10.  Carne asada tacos: Dry, and I didn't pick up on much seasoning. 5 out of 10. My points of comparison here are Aqui Con El Nene in Tucson, and El Guero Canelo, also in Tucson. They're much better at carne asada tacos. Also, America's Taco Shop is far better with this, which is their specialty.  The homemade salsas are awesome. In particular, I was blown away by the salsa cilantro, and the strawberry salsa. Yes, they have strawberry salsa.

HEUsZfp280_35EM4Wt6vYA.text: Went to the symphony during the mid part of the day and happened to run into La Condesa based on a Yelp review. This place is very tasty. Their salsas are exceptionally good and a must if you make a visit. Their drinks are good as well. All items served are unique in preparation and taste. We had the taco's gaucho, quesadilla and some orchata. The food was excellent and the service was friendly and attentive. Overall this place great for a mid day lunch of evening meal.

jeR-T2g0p6gfupLy8rGVPg.text: Loved this place! I asked the cashier to order me her favorite thing and it was absolutely delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wow, unreal!

BiznrhZmgE4EXnG3NDrRxQ.text: Omg! The specialties tacos were to die for!  I want to try everything on the menu! The prices are just right, you are paying for quality food!  The Chile Verde burrito is big enough for 2! Very tasty! Lots of art to admire as well!

u73tWn4uCerV3wJ_w-6fWA.text: Place is a bit overrated.   Good salsa bar but tortillas for the tacos were pretty average and the meat on the arrachera tacos not particularly tender.  The fish tacos were very good.

28an8wWe7SJmepgZj6USyg.text: Great mexican food.  Favorite part was the salsa bar

sERlvup61xaUYpnglyFQFA.text: We finally had an opportunity to check out La Condesa and it lived up to all the great reviews we had read.  We overordered as we wanted to try several things.  The salsa bar was fun.  It was nice to try a few different flavors.  My daughter who doesn't like spice really enjoyed the peanut salsa.  The tomatillo was exceptional as well.    I did not think the guacamole was well executed.   There were onions, tomatos, pineapple and cilantro but it was more pico-ish than guacamole-like.  And where was the avocado?  For $3.95 the portion was relatively small.  I would definitely pass on this in the future.      For main courses, we had the mole chicken quesa and an assortment of tacos.    The mole was exceptional and wasn't at all bitter.  The quesa itself was flaky, crisp and delicious.   If you are a mole fan, this is a must try.  For tacos, we had the baja shrimp, slow cooked pork and carne asada.  The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the breading light and didn't overwhelm the flavors.  I loved the pork which was moist, flavorful and satisfying.  The carne asada was very good though pretty typical street taco fare.     I will definitely dine here again.   The setting matched the food... casual, comfortable but not your typical mexican fare.  It's definitely a step above.

S8wDtdA95I4T71-13E7guA.text: The street tacos were delicious and we had fun sampling the different types of salsa. This food has f-l-a-v-o-r.... there is definitely a  reason this place is busy!!

OuknrHhOXWyKeZ-DzEVCrA.text: With 234 reviews (and counting) there's no need for me to go into great detail. I'll just add to the weighted score. This place lives up to the hype, so get at it!

YbqIFZcTykG48iaLVTCPTw.text: Walking into this small restaurant, i could image I was in a nice part of Mexico City.  Showing up with my customary crew of three little boys, you can imagine some people would be annoyed, but our hostess greeted us kindly and found us the space to sit down. They didn't mind at all that we had to park the stroller at the small bar. The boys were hungry monsters and we got baskets of chips right away. I found several lovely non spicy salsas for the boys, including a pecan salsa, cilantro salsa, and strawberry salsa. We ordered a mole taco, shark taco, and pibil taco with a side of rice and beans to share among us. It was plenty for two adults, two little ones and a very picky 8 yr old who just ate chips. Each taco was awesome.each was  Realy  unique in flavors. The beans and rice were both boring and bland. All salsas were delicious. It almost didnt m atter what we ate because it was all so delish. The decor was very appealing, although the walls were pretty dirty. The service was good, the music good and rather loud, which helped to drown out the baby pulverizing chips with his fists. This is not wat I would categorize as a good place to take kids, but even so, they were tolerated, and I am just not going to miss trying a place like this because I have my kids with me.  The only drawback for me was that this is a SMALL place, and it was hot and airless inside. I don't know if the air conditioning was broken, but just a room fan would have helped a lot. We were sweating by the end of the meal, and not from the pico de gallo. I hope they get that worked out before summer melts the asphalt.

GV2m2bpLB7dGBcc6jcMkPw.text: Delicious Mexican food with flavor! The mango margarita on the rocks was fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mango Margarita

UWKgREFsPqBe0YMJvmEErQ.text: The chile en nogada taco is unforgettably amazing.  The salsa bar is delicious.  The mole was underwhelming.

B2NAp2tGXI7_x7kjpudv3A.text: Warning : this place WILL knock your socks off so either wear flip flops or proceed cautiously with your toes curled.   Really can't go wrong with any of their tacos. Probably my favorite is the LA Santissima specialty taco with the toasted cheese on top. The shrimp taco is also really good.   Their burritos are delicious. Salsa bar has huge selection and some very unique flavors. Beans and rice are also top quality. Prepare to leave absolutely stuffed because good luck holding yourself back from eating their generous portions. And after it's all said and done make sure you try their horchata (perfect end to a fantastic meal!)

prj2w28qdC0QDWU5LRw4DA.text: we had to wait over 1/2 hour to get a table, The food was good but the service was awful. I'm not sure it was worth it...

HaygEhhmSrhlO6ETGUn_AQ.text: The package is beautiful and the gift is thoughtful . The giant quesadilla is awesome to look at as it sits down in front of you but lack the big punch you would expect the dough lacks flavor . The salsa bar is large and has unusual salsas that are all good in there own way. The sandwiches are great the bread top notch. Hands down the tacos or at least the fillings are very very good wish they took the time to made a hand made tortilla to support the amazing fillings .

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa bar with 16 different salsas all very good .

-cJsdUpS4GrRq01ulYmICg.text: Very good. But packed during lunch. Messy tables are unsightly, and the wait is long. The food is awesome, though my order wasn't entirely correct, I ordered shrimp mole taco's and received chicken. Though was charged for shrimp (I think).  Service is friendly, and being such a small place I think they try very hard to deal with the lunch rush, but seem slightly understaffed.  I will go back as they have a great and varied menu and an awesome salsa bar. I just would probably wait until a non-peak time.

X2ehkU3jb481u9fFUsvCIg.text: As you read this review, please keep in mind I am a conservative mother of two small children.  This place is so effing good.  Since moving to Phoenix two months ago, I have been in search of a down and dirty taco place, but one that didn't leave me feeling like I had just eaten a corn tortilla full of grease. This is that place. Authentic Mexican food with a gourmet twist. So so yummy.  I ordered the el gaucho steak taco and the cabo shrimp taco. Add in a $2 Negra Modelo, and life was good. If we didn't have two kids in tow, my husband and I could have kept ordering tacos and beer.   Be prepared to go early, and the place is small...so seating is limited. Not good for large groups.   Such a great place. If you aren't happy with your order here, then that just might be a personal problem. And I can't help you with that.

RKgJlv41natquRjfqCnYyA.text: So I went to lunch here on a Friday and the place was full, but then again it isn't all that big. The interior is fairly nice for a Mexican food joint and what first caught my eye was the salsa bar. At least 10 different kind of salsas for the taking. This is a good omen. Gourmet Taco's feels incredibly insincere. It is like when MacDonald's have "a la carte" on the to of their back lit wall menu. It becomes a joke.   I had the shrimp tacos that comes when ordering some cheesy slur that most surely contains the words 'baja' or 'cabo' or something silly to that nature. I also ordered the horchata to go with my lunch. The order is two decently filled tacos with both double corn tortillas. The shrimp wasn't the long monster that I expected but instead three minor in each taco. This was OK. Then it was filled with some kind of cabbagy mass that was completely raw and tasteless - but would look good on a  picture. This was not OK - tasteless filler is pointless. The horchata was tasty, but way too much ice in the glass. The salsa bar did not disappoint - they have hot and mild and spicy and seasonal, in this case some strawberry salsa that was strangely tangy. But I love the variety.   I liked the food. Not all of our party did enjoy their meal, but I did. But it is too pricey for Mexican food.. because it isn't that spectacular at all. The price would be the discouragement for me, when it comes to my return factor. I have had better tacos for cheaper. that is the bottom line - but it wasn't bad. Not at all.   In summary; meal was good but too expensive.

GMrCeL0-oCsJS1V_97u5ew.text: This is probably one of the worst Mexican experiences I've had thus far. I hate to say it but I will most likely never come back. I ordered a steak burrito and it tasted like dog food. My friends ordered soft tacos and they were not a fan of their meals either. By the looks of other reviews this place is supposed to be amazing. I would like to give it another shot but I felt sick to my stomach walking out of there after eating and that's saying a lot because I love all types of food. The only reason this is getting 2 stars is because the chips and salsa bar was bomb!!!

YMYJ7pZ-jau56QmYYUXVIQ.text: This place is delicious. The Sur Baja Shark taco and The Gaucho taco are the bomb. Plus the Pecan Salsa with the Strawberry Salsa are amazing. Also they make their margaritas with tequila not the margarita mix. We will be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margaritas!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Gaucho and Shark Tacos

hhl0unBOBThgWNPm2nhbwg.text: This was a little hole in the wall spot, looked sketchy. The insides not much better but has some nice art. The food was great! A fresh salsa bar with flavored like cilantro and strawberry salsa. I had a type of corn quesadilla with steak and Mexican cheeses, all GF. It was thick and puffy, tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UabTMoatPkuxfNftc_O_JQ.text: Great but overpriced, maybe for a good reason. I'd say some of the best taco's in Glendale, but they are kinda stingy with salsa to go. Paid $100 for 7 and the kid only offered us 4 salsa's to go. If I wanted more, I had to pay extra. At least 2-3 per person, jeeze (Trust me, they are tiny) Would have given you guys 5 stars if you weren't so stingy.   Also, bring back the strawberry spicy salsa, why remove your best?

Oqv4ySCCvNxkz7jLerSLcQ.text: Came here with my cousin for some HH.  We in total had 4 margs ($3 on happy hour, can't beat that). And they were actually really good!  We both also had the Al Pastor burro which was good portioned and delicious.  Our server was friendly, however, the petite lady with dark hair when we entered was NOT. Dunno what her problem was. We "may" be back, but hopefully not when she's there. We got such a snotty vibe- and its not a good look. Maybe cause we're cute girls & she's a hater?  When we walked in, no one presented themselves as a hostess so I ask snotty do we seat ourselves? NO response. Ignored. Lol! Ok, so we just sat ourselves.   I agree with other reviews, that we just sat there with no water, a basket of chips, and no service for like 10-12 minutes with workers wondering around knowing that we were sitting there. We had never been here before, so we didn't know about getting our own salsas until we were sitting for 10 mins and finally were able to ask. Even a "thank you!" on our part to snotty woman was ignored.. Ok lol. Just cause foods good doesn't mean you should lack in service.... And your SERVICE is what I will be telling people about if they ask about your restaurant.

KaBJeZYDwd4ni-YXWGzQNw.text: Embarrassingly upset that I lived in the Phoenix area for a few years and had never tried this dive. Heresy. I am ashamed.  I am bitter.  But when i think about the food I suddenly feel better, willing to let bygones be bygones.  It has some simply amazing street tacos and probably the best salsa bar I have ever encountered.   Easy to miss (when driving and also after not eating there for a few days), so prepare! If only their cool Dia de Los Muertos t-shirts came in big guys sizes.  I would've bought the pink one, even.

WitJV1a2UOUvtM798FRAow.text: I went there for the first time with family and friends last Saturday. We all got something different and delicious. The salsa bar was really fun to explore and we ended up sampling all the different salsas. The guacamole was delicious and chunky and you could see all the fresh ingredients - no fillers here.   There were so many different burritos and tacos to try and you could even make things into bowls. While not everyone in our party was a vegetarian, we had two and I'm vegan. They had multiple menu items for both, which was amazing and extremely rare for an authentic Mexican restaurant. I tried the cauliflower taco and Gandhi taco (black beans and more) and they were delicious!  We'll be back again to continue exploring the menu.

AgaJNrzeIk2NebjyCZk77Q.text: Definitely best gourmet taco place.  We tried street tacos plate and o.m.g., super good.  Thump up for salsa bar with variety of salsa choices. Some are very interesting combination.  House special horchata, one size only,  but worth to try.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I&#39;m not a fan of bean lol

I3HZvEn5yZur9DqzdNnXFg.text: Amazing margaritas. Very strong. Probably 2-4 shots in each but so smooth you can't taste it. Food was good, nothing too special but decent, as well but best value margaritas I've ever had.

EPVbGHSOFKPpOHr1NRPtzw.text: My burrito tonight was not the same as the many I have had before here. It was mostly rice not meat, so disappointed. Please go back to your roots or you will lose your loyal customers!

PF4h_-tTof35Sh1DaYLabg.text: The food is amazing, the salsa bar is awesome!  The seating situation however is a bit cramped.  The staff are friendly, and the food is definitely worth going for, but maybe consider getting it to go, or go on off hours.  The lunch rush is hard!

FVp1slFy-PsabX9Zk5DbYQ.text: Fantastic.  The real-deal.  Each dish was prepared flawlessly, huge portions and the BEST salsa bar on the planet.  Initially - ordering at the counter was a bit of a turn-off (we almost walked out) but we were very happy we stayed.

KBznIOcw5VWrryTbeAy5vw.text: This place rocks! Best tacos (or at least, most nuanced and carefully crafted flavors in a taco) I've ever had, anywhere. I tried them all - the Chile en Nogada, Santisima Specialty, and Nueva Espana were my personal favorites but you really can't go wrong. The salsa bar is also incredible - at least a dozen salsas including basics like Chile de Arbol and tomatillo; and other specialties like pecan salsa. All were outstanding! Prices are affordable considering what you're getting (with few exceptions the tacos are $4-5 each, fairly large). I did not try any of the non-taco items. Note: I tried taking a few home, but they did not re-warm very well, so best to just stuff it in while it's fresh. This will definitely be a do-again next time I'm in town!

kMAG5QAQNCYM84LnCdpr3Q.text: I was so looking forward to some great Mexican food in Arizona. The stellar yelp reviews and visit by Guy Fieri made me think that this was just the place. Unfortunately, I was disappointed.  The restaurant is incredibly small. You have to try to snag a table, which makes lingering not an option. Plus, it makes it feel a little bit like people are watching you eat.  I ordered the Tinga Chicken Burrito. I was disappointed to find the chicken to be all dark and lacking flavor. The burrito had no cheese or spice. It was an okay burrito, but it was heavy and certainly not one I would crave.  Overall, I wouldn't come back.

RAaFWRh0RnHmw4YFV-GcGw.text: So recent trip to Phoenix and I was craving Mexican food.  Turned to YELP and they pointed us towards this little gem.  Uber took us out there....ummmm a kind of sketchy area but what the heck.  Put our name in and waited about 45 minutes to get seated (place is small). Once seated we ordered margaritas and had chips with the amazing salsa bar!  There have to be 30 salsas freshly prepared.....from mild to OMG that's hot.  My favorite was the Pecano......sooo yummy.           Ordered food and I chose the Mole (Black Oaxacan Mole) in burrito form.   I will say that was a damn good Mole.....probably in my top 2 that I have had.  Burrito was big and I love that they make the tortilla crispy by flattening the burrito on the flat top.  Wow soooo good. Came with rice and beans.  A wonderful plate for sure.           So if you go it's tiny.....there will be a wait BUT it is sooooo worth it.  I'm from San Diego so I do know great Mexican food and this was GREAT.  Inexpensive as well.  Give them a shot.....you won't be disappointed.

Skqc09zwnS7VOsXzYngaOg.text: Love this neighborhood place!! Food and drinks are amazing !!  Customer Service is fantastic!! I love the salsa bar!!!

JyIucunLxTleBj38A_VhLA.text: I have heard so many great things about this place (It was on Diner's Drive-Ins & Dives!) and we finally decided to get our taco-loving booties over there to try it! Ohhh my goodness, I am so happy that we did!!   They have the most amazing fresh salsa bar with at least 10 different salsas made daily. Being a sauce lover, this was a complete dream come True. I recommend getting the two taco plate with rice and beans. I got the Aztec Tinga Taco (Shredded Chicken, Tomato, Onion & Aztec chipotle sauce) and it was SO juicy with the perfect combination of spices. I also got a Carne Asada taco that was delish! The restaurant is small and I hear it gets busy so I would recommend dining here during off days/times. We went on a Thursday night at 7:30 PM and it was perfect!!! We will for sure be back, i've been daydreaming of their fabulous salsa bar ever since we left!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Just a few of their amazing homemade salsas!!

YJYwFUV-vsfMklVypkIdcw.text: Poor remodel and updates to their menu. They increased capacity but staff is at a loss to manage it. Food and service drastically decompensated

y89EkuXxGpXUk6_7RFkPPw.text: If I could give this place 10 stars, I would. This place has the best tacos that I've ever had in my whole entire life, ever (seriously, they're THAT good). I also love that they have a variety of self-serve salsas, so you can try as many as you'd like. The place isn't huge, so it can get get packed pretty easily. It doesn't look like much outside, but that's okay because all of the magic happens inside. You should definitely check this place out!

I3I6HuwDlog3mWiQ09tnHQ.text: I'm going to give this restaurant three stars because I love this place to death! However, our trip today was a nightmare. We arrived around 5pm, with a steady but not busy crowd. It took several minutes for the staff to seat us, which I found odd. The host gave us water and chips right away and stated the server would be with us shortly. Then fifteen minutes passed by and nothing. No acknowledgement, no I'll be right with guys, and no would you guys like anything else to drink. My wife and I decided to get up and leave the establishment. As we left, the same host that greeted us said thank you and have a great day. Didn't even think twice that we left so quickly! I really really hope this place turns it around because it's my go to spot for Mexican food.

ksjiG3taeDwTxm7vClMMxQ.text: As someone who's travels to Southern California a few times a year, I sort of know my Mexican food especially as it comes to street tacos and such.  I do admit this place has more protein for your tacos than any other Mexican restaurant I've been in.  It can also be overwhelming the number of choices but at $3.99-$6.50 for a single taco, the prices are pretty high so I had some high expectations.  What I can say is that the al pastor tacos were dry, in fact tasted like tree bark in terms of texture.  The braised pork was good though but the tortas were very interesting, it came out on a toasted French baguette.  It was decent but I had to put quite a bit of salsa in it to moisten it up due to it again being very dry.  Imagine dry meat on a toasted French baguette.  What I believe does set this place apart is their amazing salsa bar, it's self serve and unlimited.  You get your first bowl of chips on the house, refills are $2.70.  The other thing that stood out was the horchata, it had fresh ground cinnamon, some oats and bits of strawberries on the bottom.  It was very interesting, but nonetheless, was very good.  We also had a strawberry margarita, tasted more like sugar water with a half shot of a tequila and very very sweet.  I believe the strawberry margarita was $9.00, so it was a little high.  If I ever go back, I think I'll stick with the horchata instead of their margaritas.    They said an hour wait for two, we waited outside for 30 minutes and was called, so at least that's nice.  A tip is to write your name, party size and phone number on the waiting list, they will call you when your table is ready.  And no waiting inside either, all waiting is outside.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eP586nP3_uRhBSaLmuxidQ.text: Go here for happy hour. They have the best highest quality street tacos from all these different regions in mexico and other countries. They are delicious and the star of the show. The place is a little run down and can get hot during the summer when the sun is shining in there. The drinks are ok but not much for beer, so go with the margs or a coke. They have tons of salsas, so that's cool, but I don't like the chips. The servers seem a little lackadaisical. The parking here can get annoying, only a few spots, but totally worth checking out because the tacos are the bomb.

Lyzz6vnU8EcC2NzLUIdniw.text: Very solid taqueria in Phoenix. I had an assortment of tacos, all flavorful and well done. They have a large salsa bar and the friendly staff. The place has a kind of hole in the wall feel with some nice artwork. They also have liquor/beer. I would definitely return.

rZtOedd2jQ89a0y-dHvDGQ.text: Absolutely amazing tacos here.  The best part is that you can order tacos a la carte, so you can try several types in one meal.  There is an option to do a taco llate, two tacos with a small side of rice and beans.  I'd skip this option.  The sides were quite small.  If you're hungry go for another taco or perhaps a side of chips and explore the free salsa bar.  You must order at the register.  You are given a number so they can bring out your food.  This is all fine and dandy until you have to find a table.  La Santisima is quite small and has very few tables inside.  We had to stand, basically hovering over people who were eating, and leap at the first table to open up.
