I'd say it would be obvious to follow etiquette and let those who ordered before you grab a table first, but we all know not everyone is that poliet.    They do offer to-go orders if you don't want to wait for a table. I'd also recommend that La Santisima invest I outdoor seating to aleviate some of the indoor congestion.  I'll keep my fingers crossed for my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco plate
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

p9k_j9fHYu5tnkWj3UhAmw.text: I came because of the ratings.  I made a stop in Phoenix prior to Sedona.    We had breakfast tacos and breakfast burrito with yellow rice and black beans refrito.  The agua de Jamaica was perfect!  Chilled and not so sweet!!!    The decoration is so colorful.  I saw many locals here too.

3BBy_e18_1UmpR7IfsOr2Q.text: This place is a must try if you're local or visiting. They have great food and an awesome salsa bar with a bunch of interesting choices!

1LLDXzaFrNUx_9YY-Qpi_A.text: This place is really wonderful They have several options for vegans. And the salsa bar is great. I mean theirs so many different salsas to choose from and its all self serve take as much as you need or want.  The only thing missing at La Santisima is fresh hand made tortillas. That would make this place even better.  The inside is very nice. Rustic wooden tables and seats Mexican made. And lots of Mexican art and cultural motifs on the walls. Theirs a bar too.  Its more dimly lit so it gives the cozy feel Waiters and waitresses are all friendly and attentive. Nice place for lunch or dinner and conversation no need to feel rushed.

SIk9G44uGXl8dEN2c-7lcg.text: Hands down best food I've ever had in a while....their flavor on everything is very different (in a good way)..i highly recommend this place

TbJFsfUXqD7nLhXGe9WVZw.text: I only gave it three stars because I feel the food didn't really exceed my expectations and the service was a real buzzkill. My friends and I went on a Tuesday night, the night before Halloween. There was a line but it moved fairly quickly so that was okay. We were informed there was a shortage of menus so we had to share. That was fine too, but they definitely need to get that issue addressed in future, especially if they have large parties coming in. The salsa bar was good, but underwhelming. A lot of it were just average; some tasted like each other and many didn't have standout flavors like I was expecting. And the spicy one was not very spicy at all, haha! I presume this is because of the clientele though. I was born and raised in Asia, so I love all my sauces with lots of kick! Ok, down to the food: I got the 3 street taco mix-and-match bowl with beans and rice: carne arrachera taco, chilango suadero taco, and al pastor taco. Tbh, I couldn't tell which was which, but one of them was super dry and I needed to load up heaps of salsa to make it good. I couldn't even tell which one was the spicy pork. That being said, the other two tacos were good. The rice and beans were the standout parts of my meal, in my opinion. The beans and rice tasted fresh and wonderfully home-made. Final thoughts: the tacos were fairly decent, wasn't too much to shout about especially considering this place's past accolades, but the beans and rice were fantastic. I would come here again to try their burros, which were served to others around us and looked delicious! I had a sip of my friend's horchata, and it was yummy! The menu is pretty extensive so points for that one as well. That being said though, the service here was kinda bad; they were clearly understaffed so I hope they fix that, along with their lack of menus, in future ! :)

KUZBcQcyJzYM47Xmjw66hA.text: Authentic, great flavors, and amazing service. DDD TV segment inspired our first visit. Had mole burrito which did not disappoint. Wife had a specialty drink - much too sweet. Fresh salsa bar fresh with a variety of unique options. Will return for sure however not a Saturday evening. - exceptionally loud.

wTq5y6bwb5sxUBhlrOxo3Q.text: This was my first time here and I'm not impressed. The rice and beans on my plate are ice cold, my partners dish was ice cold; it's like cold meat on this plate. Very disappointed will never come back. Nasty first impression

FcaRPS9WHMNvrwc1_qT3wg.text: I was craving nopales so I searched for nopales. Not only did La Santisima have them they cooked them to perfection. I can't recall the name of the taco I had but they're in the veggie section. The salsas are tasty, the service is friendly and the tacos are bomb. You can't go wrong with this place.

eFEnjpLdNPRtBPOHBJOjLA.text: Oh wow!!! This place was amazing. The staff was very understaffed even though there were only about 9 tables but you could tell the waiter was trying very hard. We started out with a strawberry marg, which was okay, the lime one was much better. Excuse me while I write the rest of the review... I can't remember each plates name... We got the steak quesadilla stuffed with avocado, peppers, onions, etc... I thought to myself this might be my favorite thing I've ever had... We then ordered 4 tacos to split. I wasn't the biggest fan of any of them besides the white fish! The shark, and steak tacos were very good but the quesadilla you couldn't be satisfied with tacos... Last final thing.... We ordered the burrito to split (yes we took half of it home). We got the steak burrito stuffed with all the good stuff! WOW - I thought okay this might be better than the quesadilla but close call. Must try place in AZ.

KWvV076-izCb2vfU-yU4tA.text: Awesome quaint taco shop with excellent food that has real flavor.  The staff is warm and are a treat!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Xv3msKEkrKkVKRtAibIhIA.text: I love it here. It is the place that I take out of town visitors. I love the salsa bar. It is small and often you have to wait but I think that the food makes up for those things.

8uidMvH1LTsZ89Pw1VcZ9A.text: Let me start by saying that I absolutely love Mexican food (so I believe I have good taste)  and these tacos were literally the best I've ever had !   So many salsas at the salsa bar, which is like candy land for someone like me! I had the chicken taco and a shrimp taco (with beer batter) and my sister had the cactus tacos. We born enjoyed our meals quite a bit although my sister liked the cactus tacos from two hippies beach house better (she's vegetarian).   They were so good you must try!!! I am very picky about Mexican food and only enjoy authentic flavors. The beans were underwhelming , but it's a taco shop, so this rating is based on tacos. Will def be going back the next time I visit Arizona!

uVR2KvpMtL98CmWxvW7UDQ.text: Nothing even close in Denver.  I may move to Phoenix over these tacos.  And the service, hilarious and amazing. Highly recommended!  Pretty sweet artwork as well, and top notch salsa. You will not go wrong with this place.

-CMMnn1G5VxaiKEZEJHrAw.text: By far the best mexican food I've found in Phoenix, and trust me, I've eaten at almost all of them :)  I tend to get their street tacos with either pastor or carne asada, but everything is good here.  They have an awesome little salsa bar with like 10 different kinds of salsa.  I live in Anthem and we drive out of our way 30+ minutes to eat here it's that good!

1c5QjrrvFtmwGRujuutRCw.text: Pros: Full bar, salsa bar  Cons: No bartender, watery salsas, poor service.  We visited this shop for a weekend lunch.  We were starving and didn't have a lot of time, so we opted to quickly sit at the bar.  We waited 5 minutes, and a server brought us chips.  We then went and picked out a few salsas from the salsa bar.  Out of the 4 salsas I tried, I liked none of them.  They were very thin and watery, and the plastic containers are smaller than the chips - so you can only dip the corner of a chip (but the salsa won't stick), and you can't pour the salsa onto a chip (because it will run off).  The only chips that sort of work are the 'defective' folded ones. I have no idea why everyone raves about the salsa bar, perhaps for the novelty of it, but chips don't work as a salsa-delivery vehicle for watery salsa.  After 10 minutes, we still did not have water, and 15 minutes into us sitting there, we apologized and left.  Their tacos may well be amazing, but we didn't have time to sit around.  Waiting for 15 minutes (literally) with no water delivery during an AZ summer should be criminal.  There appeared to only be 2 servers for the entire restaurant, and no bartender, and they clearly couldn't handle a lunchtime rush by themselves.  Luckily, there are many other excellent taco shops in the area.

htZTYKsogV65KHfR7BW7YQ.text: My husband and I stopped by on Sunday for lunch. We were both blown away by the quality of the food. My husband ordered the carne asada street tacos.... He ate everything and loved it. I ordered the Gandhi vegan burro with red enchilada sauce over it. I highly recommend it to anyone. It was huge so I had to take half home. However, it was so delicious I ended up eating the remainder several hours later for dinner. The house margarita is definitely worth the order as well. Mixed perfectly! We were both truly blown away- well for two gringos born and raised in AZ who've had our fair share of trips to numerous cities in Mexico. This place is small- roughly 32 people can dine in. While we were there there was not one empty table. I'm glad we stopped in- we will be back.

_Hw5EnlVBkXTTs6KSKKZLg.text: We were in Arizona for five days, including Sedona and the Grand Canyon, and we ended up coming here twice.  Don't miss: salsa mexicana, tomatillo salsa, rice & beans, el pastor street taco, chicken mole street taco, and cochinita pibil street taco.

LAsbfLW6t3khtP1n41pXSw.text: YUM! Great salsa bar with lots of fun and innovative options. Only problem is you eat so many chips to try out all the salsas- it's hard to remember to leave room for the great tacos.

hX2xpF4ZtsQHLKnhtMlpbg.text: Wonderfully different tacos and probably the best beans and rice ever. There were so many things to choose from, but I thought a place that bills itself as 'gourmet tacos' should get a chance to live up to its name--and it did. I chose the 3 taco platter so I could sample different ones. Each was unique and tasty. The barbacoa was probably my favorite. There is very little parking and there was a line inside but it was worth the wait. Baskets of chips and orders were going out of the kitchen every few seconds. We got there a little before noon and I don't know if it was because they were so busy, but every table was cleared and cleaned within minutes, or less, of being vacated. My husband, who spends a lot of time traveling, kept raving about how good his was.

NtxUFcvsLR-7FLA70ZQzgg.text: Had a wonderful lunch yesterday. My daughter who works at a hospital nearby took us to this small restaurant with great quality food. Try several different sauces that are available to choose from a "sauce bar".  I highly recommend the quesadilla which is more like what I call a Mexican calzone. You may have to wait for a table, but it is well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and green chile burrito with a great salsa.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mole tacos.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al pastor quesadilla. Another &#34;Mexican calzone. A spicy pork onion and pineapple.

8MZOsQJ3Ntf2-pWJ7LP7UQ.text: Damn, you want some awesome tacos, burros, quesadillas, or tortas?! This is your place! Ever since Guy Fieri stepped foot in this place, it gets really busy now. It's a small place, so expect a wait unless you go during off times (avoid lunch and dinner). The salsa bar is incredible, so many different variety of salsas from cilantro, pecan, to a delicious jicama or a bomb pico de gallo. The quesadillas aren't your typical ones, they fry them entirely that it almost looks like a empanada/quesadilla hybrid but they're so good! It's True about what they say about the horchata, it's the best I've tasted. They put pecans and chopped fruit in the horchata giving it some extra flavor a but its so delicious. My favorite tacos are the Shark tacos! Try them! Only reason why I give them 4 stars is because the service is alright. Sometimes they are not staffed adequately and it takes forever to get your order in, other than that, it's a great Mexican food joint!

1jjvSNVuNypXWHgVy9-VlQ.text: Very nice atmosphere. There is a good selection of coffee and pastries. The drinks are made pretty fast, even when it is crowded. There is plenty of space to sit and enjoy your beverage. Many people go to work on their computers or study. It is a fairly loud environment, so if you're looking for a quiet library setting you won't find that here.

dIE5n-atoHGtNq74WM7vhQ.text: The food here was absolutely amazing, and the Horchata was delicious!  The only complaint I have is that the service was super mediocre. The waitress never came back to refill our waters, and we would have to waive her down to get a refill on any of our other drinks, and she did not seem to know how to split a check (it took her almost a half an hour to get our checks to us after we told her we were ready).  We were also told that there was no guacamole, only to see a couple seated next to our table (seated after us and ordered after us) served guacamole about 20 minutes after we had ordered.  When we inquired about it, the waitress rudely told us "oh I guess they made extra there might be a little left".   Despite the service, I would definitely recommend this place.

4OtSY66kmmYU9-HlZfBEmw.text: The salsa bar is great. Try the strawberry salsa. Had the street tacos. Very tasty with the variety of salsas you can try with them.

wN3Pd2AfyduRz2JiK9j08g.text: Unique, great Mexican food. Certainly not your typical, heavy tacos. The smoked marlin taco is amaz.

mq2_krUeNM1K1R8amV6hGg.text: We were so impressed with this place and so surprised we had never heard of it!  Salsa: There are something like 20 different salsa to choose from in their salsa bar but our favorite was the salsa mexicana which was nice and garlicky with chopped cilantro. You scoop the salsas into little plastic containers similar to what you'd find in a taqueria but this is definitely a cloth napkin type of place. Luckily, there are free chips with which to try the many salsa so you can pick your favorite before you food arrives.   Food: So fresh, warm, and just plain delicious. We split the Santo Plato and Traditional Quesa. The Santo Plato comes with your choice of burro and taco with a side of calabacitas. We chose the fish taco which conveniently came with two pieces of fish and two tortillas so it was like having two tacos! It was traditional fried fish "Baja" style but it was light and crispy instead of greasy and came with a savory white sauce. The La Condesa Veggie burro was filled white Mexican-style rice (but not that orangish "Mexican rice" you see at fast food joints), Oaxaca cheese, mushrooms, spinach, poblano pepper, onions and fresh garlic. The burro is grilled after its assembled which enhanced the mouth feel. Crispy outside, soft inside. The calabacitas were just grilled green Mexican squash, nothing special. The Traditional Quesa was unlike anything I'd ever seen. They're made with a THICK, dense corn tortilla, stuffed with Oaxaca cheese, and then grilled for a nice crunch. These bad boys are HUGE and have so much cheese which made me relieved to be sharing. You have to eat it with a fork and knife but it was amazing with different salsa varieties drizzled on top.   Drinks: Try the Horchata! Best we've ever had. They put real fruit and pecans in it. There was some sort of strawberry syrup in the bottom but it was not overly sweet. The serving size is 32oz which was a lot bigger than we were expecting. We didn't get any alcohol but I overheard the guy next to us tell the waitress his margarita was amazing.   Atmosphere: Be prepared because this place it TINY! We got there at the right time because when we were leaving all of the 10 or so tables were full. People didn't have room to wait and some turned around and left as soon as they came in and saw how crowded it was. There is an itty bitty bar that a few people chose to wait at. The decor is cute but the custom made chairs were a bit fragile as I had to switch mine out due to the bottom falling out.   Overall: We know Mexican food and this may be the best we've ever had. We'll have to go back for a few more visits to be sure but for now we certainly left smacking our lips with the delicious flavors we had just tasted on our lips and on our minds.

fMuladdo4n6FRqwvmwOM6g.text: The food was amazing! We loved the salsa bar. I can't remember the names of the dishes we had, but everything was delicious. We will be going back for sure!

Fs4NimFPkeEeQtz-Y7zKhA.text: I have been waiting to write this review until I was really inspired, because I wanted to do this place justice.   Sitting at a coffee shop, a little wired, listening to some amazing Explosions in the Sky in my headphones, I finally feel I'm ready.   The bad: North of McDowell. I mean, this place is supa close to me, so I'm happy, but I really wish this place had a sexy downtown location because it is so freaking good it would blow up if more people were near it. I feel the location, although keeps it a hidden gem, also repells people from going, although let me be the one to tell you, it shouldn't! You NEED to go here if you are chippy and salsa person. Bottom line. Not optional. The absolute BEST in Phoenix metro ever. If you disagree, hit me up and I will pay for your meal. I'm not kidding. I believe in it that much.   The good: The Salsa bar. Jesus Christ himself would call this Salsa bar a miracle. From reds, to greens, to peanut, to hot, to mild, chunky and smooth they have everything, hand made from scratch and incredible. The flavors actually rotate so some times you'll go and get a new treat to try. Most of them are inspired by regions of the world and have salsa flares about them. I can't stop, thinking about it now. I may leave this coffee shop and go there for lunch today now...   The gourmet tacos. Incredible, large chuncks of savor steak, giant shrimp (yah I know that makes no sense), and great corn tortillas make this no flour boy a very very happy camper.   Obviously you'll need to choose the right salsa to add on top of your already incredibly delicious taco, but choose wisely. The flavors are already perfect.   I hope this review has done it justice. It's incredible and needs to be in your rotation. Especially if like taking your friends out to new places they have never been before.

BJsstXM8xBAA6bBeA2Ndmg.text: The first thing that stands out to me about this place is the amazing salsa bar. Extensive, diverse, intense, and delicious. Second, their heavenly horchata. Just perfect, and the trimmings they throw in it (crush nuts, various fruit cuts) makes it all the more amazing. Third, their godly baja shark and cabo shrimp tacos. Have gone with friends many times and I can ever get myself to stray from my mainstays here. There are days when they're slammed and the quality of service drops, which is why they get a 4 instead of a five, but the food and the taste never fails. Also, cool little side note if you're a football fan, and or Patriots fans, Julian Edelman and his squad dine there each time life brings them to PHX.

frcqDa80yiZmdjQ4elySDA.text: My fav taco shop for the people who know what a real taco is. Their salsa bar is excellent and their margaritas are doing God's work.

MM_ovK7CwySBw0xsvFIaGw.text: If you want a selection of gourmet tacos this is your spot. They are certainly not the run of the mill cheap tacos. Best to order them as a plate. Some are amazing, some not so much. Mostly just a preference thing. The salsa bar is great, but again many are good and some are just odd. Again probably just a preference things. The house margaritas were ok. Not very strong. I'll stick with a beer. I will be back for sure.

4JYOV0_Tga3Mf1NRV3_3UQ.text: One of the best taco shops in the Phoenix area. They also have a comprehensive salsa bar that will satisfy any and all tastes. You have to try their tacos for your first trip. However, a sneaky good pick is also their burritos.

ruNO1fnKD466XYaX670j3Q.text: Just the best. I've watched this place grow over the years from a tiny hole-in-the-wall to a larger place, and their growth speaks to their amazing quality and diverse salsa bar! They also have some of the ONLY horchata I like, it's the creamiest-dreamiest.

2uPAxKyRJpfvUMi3p7S1Xw.text: My favorite place for upscale tacos! I love the salsa bar and the fact that the difference in salsas is amazing at changing the flavors of the tacos. You can mix and match until you find your favorite. I like mixing the Pecan Salsa and the Chipotle salsa together and putting it an the shrimp & carne asada tacos!

mN2y1lFJjYMO826OONXozw.text: Seriously the best Mexican food in Phoenix. The wait staff is friendly and the food is beyond delicious. This is now in the regular rotation of restaurants we visit.

gKwMPlGGANhtCEX1f7K7iw.text: Loved the salsa bar the most! Hubs got el pastor burrito and I had a vegan taco trio. Not amazing but not bad either! Salsa bar was delish tho

XLc8jnyYOH_MNbsm-Q3cRQ.text: So Sunday rolls around, and I'm hungover and day dreaming of someone to drop off a wheel chair for me to get around my house in the most lazy way possible. Then I see La Santisima on TV and I freaked out, and realized they're open on Sundays.  I managed to shower and get dressed in record time to make it there by noon. They tell me it's a 40 minute wait, and my stomach plays a symphony of sounds only okay in a hospital to be heard, I say "that's perfectly fine" and then go drunk sweat outside in the sun. 40 minutes went by and I prayed the tacos would be amazing and worth the wait.  We got seated inside and helped ourself to every single salsa at the salsa bar. There were a few that lit my threat on fire, but,  whatever, alls fair in love and salsa with this gringo.  I got the three taco plate with the mariachi loco, Cabo shrimp, and chicken tinga as well as a half order of the guacamole. I LOVED the guacamole, the tinga, and the mariachi... I felt the Cabo shrimp could've used something. But one thing that kind of was lacking was the service, not that I minded. I was content with my horchata to nurse my hangover. But our server forgot about our guacamole and I think the table next to us may have gotten the wrong order (the owner corrected it). I'll let it slide because they are crazy busy at all times.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Three taco plate is the way to be for me!

RJNS_TTeMAD2H7kQ7q-Txg.text: Decided to stop by as we made our way though Phoenix along our road trip. Was very excited and had my hopes up for a delicious Mexican meal. Decided on their taco combination plate which is a order of 3 tacos along with beans and rice. Salsa bar was pretty good as we're their chips. Unfortunately their rice was awful, was overcooked and microwaved to a large glob of paste. Honestly it was unappetizing to have it on my plate as it made me think that the rest of the meal was also microwaved. Made a comment to the waiter as I felt it could be a point of improvement. He received the criticism well.   Don't think this restaurant is deserving of a four star based on my experience.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gross unappetizing rice glob served with your meal. Possibly the easiest  Latin dish to make, destroyed after a encounter with a microwave

oFABmF83KOf1EBAXEMv6xg.text: First, let me begin this review by saying I'm giving you my honest assessment on my personal experience! This is not a five star establishment! The service was good and the staff was friendly.  I dined with a party of five.  We each ordered the taco plate ($14) and Margarita's ($9).  The drinks came back and they were not premium.  Definitely not made individually at a bar because they don't have one. The drinks were from a pitcher or a pre mix?  The plates came back lingeringly!  The beans and rice was not hot!  The shrimp, fish were battered and fried, than placed in a corn tortilla and buried under shredded lettuce and sauce.  The presentation was nice! However, the tacos were not crisp, but soggy.  The over all atmosphere was dark!  The lighting is poor!  The woman's bathroom is in the middle of the restaurant! Hard not to see the coming and going of the patrons!  One bright spot is the salsa bar!  They gave us 2 baskets of corn chips and we delighted over the various salsa's. The restaurant was full and had a continuous flow.  I'm sure the "diners and dive" episode from 4 years ago help considerably to the restaurant success.  I'm not certain if the expansion of the business since the episode aired is the culprit of my poor experience?  The location downtown did provide diversity and interesting patrons.  However, for the price of our tab ($138) I'm expecting more!

iJHcAJ-oJjhjpQS4I6QGRg.text: Food: for this place being featured on a TV show, I wasn't overly impressed. It's good, but not life changing. Salsa bar is decent. I'm always up for trying new things, so I'm hoping to one day find that dish that I cant resist, but it just hasn't happened for me. Seems a bit overpriced.   Drinks: Best thing about this place, IMO. Prices are decent, sizes are good, and they all (or at least the ones I've had) taste fresh.   Staff: Friendly, but never had a server that makes me feel like they are happy to have me as a guest. Everyone I have had seems to be just going through the motions and doesn't really want to be there. I've worked in the restaurant industry for 10+ years - you're not only a server, but a performer. You gotta put a little effort in making the guests feel welcomed.   Environment: Salsa bar can get a little messy (to be expected), but otherwise the restaurant is clean. Lots of cool artwork to admire.

z-zR1mY7hYY8AO5nCoh0jQ.text: I really like this place. The Glendale location is good as well. They have options for meat eaters and vegans alike. The best part is they have an entire salsa bar. They bring you a basket of chips when you first arrive and then you can go to the salsa bar and pick whatever you want. Staff is always friendly as well.

j6_C6FlHON7gCHA17dMWQA.text: Food was good. Wait sucked. On Sunday afternoon, wait to get table 25 mins, wait to order 15 mins and wait for food to show up another 30-35 mins. Had to ask for water 3 different times and still didn't show up. Food is good but service needs big time help.

ZI2wZmBfTALkUj3t34wZ1w.text: This place has been bookmarked for well over a year. I finally got to try them out recently, and on Taco Tuesday, no less!  I love that they allow you to mix and match different tacos to create your own taco plate.  I ordered the following 3 tacos:  Tlaloc (grilled cactus, caramelized onion, garlic, jalapenos; I omitted the additional options for this taco -tomato, mushrooms, and queso fresco)  Guisado Tenoch (Grilled Cactus, Potato, Guajillo & red salsa; I omitted the mushrooms and queso fresco)  Mexica Ahuacatl (Beer Battered Avocado, cabbage, salsa jicama; I omitted the pico de gallo and the salsa cilantro, the latter of which contains dairy)  The Guisado Tenoch & Mexica Ahuacatl were by far my favorites.  The Guisado is terrifically tantalizing to the tastebuds and needed no extra salsas.  The Ahuacatl was equally delicious once I added some Strawberry Salsa. (It's delicious alone, just a little dry w/o the salsa.)  I wasn't a fan of the flavors in the Tlaloc, which were too tart and robust to my liking. Just a personal preference.   I ordered my plate with rice and black beans, and I mixed them together.  The flavor of the beans was delightful; they were seasoned perfectly, and not too salty.  (It's my understanding that the refried beans contain dairy, so vegans should stick to the black beans.)  Another shining star here is the unlimited salsa bar, which features about a dozen different salsas.  The salsa ingredients are not listed, but after spotting a particularly milky looking one, I inquired and discovered that there are a few salsas which do contain dairy, including the pecan salsa and cilantro salsa.  I have since been informed that the following salsas are all vegan: salsa 7 chiles, arbol, cabo, chipotle, sesame, peanut, strawberry, pico de gallo, jicama, cruda, tomatillo, rabano, and the Mexicana. The guacamole is also confirmed as vegan.  The strawberry salsa became an unexpected favorite, winning me over with its refreshingly sweet and spicy flavors.   The service was great and I absolutely adore the wall art.  The only thing I do not like is that the bathroom is in the dining area and several people kept leaving the door open... The salsa bar is right outside that door. As an OCD germaphobe, I was terribly bothered by this.  Aside from that, I love this taqueria and cannot wait to return and try the rest of their vegan menu.

j5ZeayjrNzsDTdn647Qtfg.text: Honestly, not the greatest.  The amazing "salsa bar" they talk about is like day old salsa sitting in small containers. They give you these super small cups to put them in and if you're thinking you can dip your chips in them think again.   The fried fish tacos were actually pretty decent, but my bf said they tasted fishy. He got a burrito, and it had the strangest floral taste to it. I think they were just trying too hard to make it something more than it needed to be.   We rarely don't like Mexican food... it's hard to mess this food group up. Maybe we ordered the wrong thing, but the salsa bar def needs some TLC.

SMyWQ7U4am5o4b60SCE9DA.text: This place was a little on the pricey hipster side  for me. I had the baby shark and shrimp tacos and thought they were just ok. I may have missed it on the description and didn't realize both would be battered and fried. My preference is grilled. Service was good but the salsa bar badly needed re-filling and nobody did that the whole time my family and I ate. I'm still willing to come back. The place has a nice vibe.

EmwxdTAFZIUiwDGOQs0uwg.text: With all the great places to get tacos in Phoenix -La Santisima is a must visit. Be prepared to fight for limited street parking or save yourself a headache and park in the neighborhood behind the restaurant. This former hole in the wall, now full blown restaurant offers a wide selection of gourmet and street tacos. Their salsa bar is first class and will please every taste. Customer service is a bit slow ( I guess due to the high demand?!) the meals are always hot and correct! The ambience along with the diverse food flavors makes you feel just like in Mexico.

cGezilqJkrZ2Bx9thsJ75A.text: Our favorite place for Mexican food! You can't go wrong with a tamarindo Margarita and barbacoa tacos. As a native from Guadalajara, their barbacoa tacos are the most authentic I have tried in Phoenix. Definitely a favorite.

JVZWhmcAjqltCnfAZW-7fw.text: Lived up to its rave reviews!  Love vegetarian options and rice and beans were some of the best we've had, so perfect in flavor and texture.  Great vibe, great service and a hell-yeah salsa bar to boot.

Atu9b3_yO_CwNl8Hu1U9ww.text: This place is one of the best experiences in the city! They opened up years ago under a different name without a liquor license but with the same sexy, sexy salsa bar. They got awards a few years in a row from The New Times seven or eight years ago when they were new. (That's actually how my college friends and I found about about them in the first place.) I think they've had to go through some phases with the salsa bar-everyone used to come in and just take twenty salsas home, so they went from limiting how many salsa containers you could get to how many lids you could get to at least limit take-home, and recently i've seen them just allow you to grab as much as you want again because no one has the time anymore to take ten-there are too many people crowded around you! If there's one thing that's constantly changed over the years I've been going here, it's that every year that goes by this place gets more crowded. One day, they'll need a bigger restaurant. Until then, I'm sure they'll continue to add gorgeous decorations like the fly paintings and the beautiful bar. OK: on to the food!  I've noticed a few expansions in the menu in recent years, but I'm going to stick to describing the basics here because they're what make this place so good. (Well... basic foods done impressively well, and intriguingly not-basic salsas.) The menu is great here because they have regionally themed dishes for various mexican states-not all 31, just a handful, but each one is starkly different, comes with different toppings and it's possible to have each meat various ways. basically you can get your meats as tacos, burros or as a quesadilla. You're going to have to just think about it before ordering-they'll make you whatever you want, but some combinations are better than others. For instance, a Mole burrito is baller, having Cochinita Pibil is just brain-melting in a quesadilla, and I could eat their fried shark tacos any day of the week. (The steak is good every way.) Don't blame the restaurant if your Mole quesadilla doesn't make a lot of sense, haha-they'll give it to you the way you ask for it. Just pay attention to the toppings when you're picking your mode of dinner. You won't regret it. I seem to have mentioned the best things in my personal opinion already... the cochinita pibil is perfect and I only know one other restaurant in AZ that makes it right, and it's much more of a fine dining place than la santisima here, so I give them a lot of points for correctly marinating the queen's dish, one of the best meats I've ever had. It's easy to describe the meats: perfect. Time to move on to the salsa.  The award winning salsa bar is second to nothing in the city. If you don't try the peanut salsa, you're missing out. Even though it's changed over the years from a spicy cream salsa to a spicy salsa and back to a spicy cream salsa, it's always been phenomenal. The pecan is more of a cream since it's not spiced like the peanut. The "red pepper" isn't exactly salsa-it's red pepper oil, and if you have a leftover side of it, fry pork chops in it... you'll be all set to go back to santisima the next day to start it all again! There's everything from pico to several types of vegetable salsas, and the cilantro cream is good at cutting the heat you've added to any dish.   If you want to taste some of the food people leave Arizona talking about, look no further than this fun little hole in the wall. One of the plus sides is probably going to be that you could come back to this place on every visit, and bring your kids and grandkids here someday: hopefully this gem never leaves the streets of our spicy valley!

u0GRS3pzJhcLJ2PB23QnBw.text: This is a solid dive place. Great tacos. Great food all around. Service was good.   I tried 5 of the gourmet tacos. All were good.  The place is a little dirty, walls and windows but that almost adds to the place. I'll be back for sure.   The salsa bar is nice. Too many to try on one visit. I like this place.

pD7Xb-uH48pL904s8AYl-A.text: Yes, my 3 year old spilled salsa not once not twice but 3 times. Our sever happily cleaned it up all 3 times.   Probably only 1 or 2 salsas that are mild enough for kids. Ours enjoyed the cliantro one and the Pico de gallo. She tried a few others but immediately downed water and her face turned a little red. She may have grown a little hair on her chest. Our favorite salsas were the peanut and guacamole.   I had the street tacos. Carne Asada taco was on point. Ranking the 3 I had 1. Carne Asada 2. Al Pastor 3. Chicken  Wish I could tell you about the rice but the girl ate it all, so if she ate it I'm sure you will enjoy it too.   Next time I need multiple margaritas. Happy hour, anyone?!?!

Even the rice was dry out.  The caldo de mariachi was too salty with flavor. The margarita was too sweet. Had to ask for flatware, napkins and water refill.

r3jAE07NcNXoCa2wrVD5xg.text: The food is delicious.100% authentic Mexican food. Me and my co workers always choose to go there for lunch. Their salsa bar has many great options and their horchata is delicious.   I do have a couple of complaints to say; during lunch time the place gets packed and has very limited space. The dining area is very small. Some portion sizes are unreasonable for the prices they charge (ex: torta below charged at $9.00) And the waitress/cashier during the day, skinny with black hair is extremely rude. She has no customer service what so ever. She seems bothered when you ask her questions about their menu or just in general. If you read through the reviews I'm not the only one who thinks so. She makes our visits  very unpleasant.   Other than that I recommend the quesadillas. I gave this review 4 stars because of the food but if I had to go by service then I would give one

ZySWUCd5ZEBz3-n9A01UBA.text: Extremely busy on the weekends. Best time to go is during the weekdays or after the weekend afternoon rush. The horchata is quite unique. Love the salsa bar with a variety of different salsas! Everything on the menu is pretty good! I would recommend any of tacos.

XnVyCV3shSl2w5HYdsKydg.text: Delicious food - had the different veggie tacos and the cactus taco. A plethora of vegetables cooked just right. So many colorful unique flavorful sauces and salsas helped a lot. Really really delicious.  The chips were good too, not greasy at all  Hot hats drink had nuts and fruits in it which I ate with a fork afterwards...  Service was good. There were two servers and they handled it well. By the time we left it was packed and there were people waiting outside on the bench and inside at the bar.   We parked around the corner in the white spaces. The place has a cool exterior and a cool interior.  I'll add a photo of two  Enjoy, folks, this one is a winner...

hm5JfY4ad_zquFRsoTfIqA.text: My son recommended this place, I didn't know what to order, and asked the cashier for suggestions, he said they are well known with burrito and enchilada styles, we ordered a pork and steak, total is $40 for 2 burritos, If it tasted good then i would not mind to pay for the price, BUT It tasted bland, I could get more than 2 burritos and tasted 100% better than this,

t3_ecMgunoRFYXkLUXQT9Q.text: I was here!  Guy Fieri came earlier than me as well!  The best modern Mexican and first Mexican place we went to in Phoenix.  This place is a hit!  The service was slow and they forgot our drink orders a few times.  But the tequila they suggested was good.  Here comes the most important part.. their food.  We ordered their shark taco to share.  I had their El Gaucho Burro and my wife had their El Gaucho Quesa.  My wife is not a big quesadilla fan, but she liked it and it was so good when I tried it!  Her quesa had the perfect crisp texture to each bite.  My burro was excellent.  Since we both had El Gaucho, the fillings were the same ingredients.  Here's the climax.  They put cucumbers and bell peppers into their El Gaucho Burro and Quesa; that is a genius idea!  Those 2 ingredients brang out the taste of each individual ingredient from our burro and quesa.  Man, it was good!  Prices are good.  They have their own salsa bar.  I recommend their creamy cilantro salsa.  They also have good spicy ones as well.  A chips refill for your chips and salsa will cost you about $2?  Oh yeah, this place is pretty small.  They try to utilize as much as they can.  Very rare you will find Chinese eating Mexican, but I saw a few here.  Got to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. El Gaucho Burro
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. El Gaucho Quesa
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shark Taco

RFoBZOFYezAgykPXNat3Sw.text: The foods is amazing and the mole is out of this world.  I will be back many times. My husband had the fish tacos abs he said they are great.

xlsRP1-QHvQwwwNeJw37zQ.text: I was so disappointed by our meal! :( I really wanted to give this place a chance..  PROS The salsa bar is very extensive and you can tell that it is all homemade! Great selection and favorites were the salsa verde Cheap beer - Modelos were $3 My favorite taco was the Al Pastor, added pico and extra lime  CONS Very small place, we got there early to avoid the wait Seating by the window can be VERY warm especially during these summer months Music was static and scratchy it was annoying while eating The chicken mole taco was such a disappointment - the flavors were not right The rice was non traditional was just plain with no cilantro or salsa/seasonings  Did we eat most of our taco platters? Yes. Did we think service was a little spotty and can be improved? Yes. Do we think that our divey place in Downtown Chandler is levels above this "modern/more pricy" version that is out of the way location wise) for us? Yes.

mtuWvkRM7oxpX9LcV6FUew.text: Best Mexican food I had ever had. Of course, this isn't saying much considering East Coast Mexican food has nothing on West Coast. Now I know.  I came here twice. This place was so good,  I dreamed about eating their shark taco that night. And the next and our last day in Phoenix we went back to get more. Nice way to round out our stay in Phoenix. Best meal for last.   First Night: If you don't get the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco, you are missing out. Perfectly crispy beer batter. Amazingly soft and tender fish. Topped with cabbage and some kind of yogurt or mayo sauce. Not sure where else you can get dogfish shark tacos, but I wish all my fish tacos could be shark from now on. Make sure you order the shark taco and not the regular fish one.  If you're not a seafood person, the Mayan Conchita Pork Shoulder is a good taco to get. The pork shoulder was cooked until tender and the sauce was delicious and flavorful. The pickled onions on top is a perfect combo with the pork.  Second Night:  The second time around I had the shark taco again. This time I also tried the Cabo Shrimp Taco. Another amazing taco. The shrimps were large, and I'm not sure what they put in their batter but it was so crispy with a nice tang to it. I also tried some of the Al Pastor Street Tacos. Order this if you want something strong in flavor and charred. The street tacos are also cheaper than the gourmet ones.  Sides: The Guac was chunky and fresh with tomatoes, cilantro, onions, and I think cranberries. The salsas were all average until I tried the jicama one. It's so fresh with the lime and cilantro. Best salsa I had ever had. Each table gets a free basket of tortilla chips. We got two for our table of four.  I never had horchata before, but it seemed to be the recommended drink to get. I wasn't a big fan of it. Not that it wasn't good, but I'm just not a fan of horchata in general. The pecans, cantaloupe, and strawberries did provide freshness to the drink, but it was too overpowered by cinnamon. The drink is huge at 32 oz.  There is only one guy acting as a server, so service can be a little slow. But these tacos are worth the patience. The restaurant itself is a little bit cramped but there is enough seating. There's also one large table for a big group.  On a side note, I saw a picture of Guy Fieri on a board next to the salsa bar. He seemed to have signed it with the date 12/14. Future Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives joint?

The quesadilla is amazing (enough for 2), definitely unique and delicious!  Love this place! So don't go there, I need to keep it quaint!!! Just kidding of course....

lfW-PKo3j1V8ZOUX2y196w.text: I was really excited to go and try La Santisima because i have read great reviews and friends have told me it is amazing. WW03VvjWdjdEtY5PxYmH9Q.text: Visiting from California for the weekend. We found this gem on Yelp and thought we would see what the hype was all about.   We ordered a cadillac Margarita, skinny Margarita, queso funido, fish taco, shrimp taco, carne asada burrito bowl and EVERYTHING was amazing!!!!!!!!!!!  We can't wait to come back!

s4JQWhTn6J9ytPlecZQTOg.text: How can I possibly start this review? I'll just say it. This is my new favorite Mexican food restaurant!!!! Really really. It's THAT GOOD. I've been eating Mexican cuisine since I was a baby-so I like to think I know the good stuff when I taste it. This place it "IT" for me. I'm so happy with my experience, because I had really high expectations.  I could go on and on about La Santisima, but I'll just cover the highlights so my review isn't painfully long.   *Horchata-amazing (I like that it was served to me in a to-go cup because it's so large)   *Tacos-unique and exceptional in every way (Lots of meat!  Insane flavors.)  *Salsa bar-most impressive I have ever seen  *Menu-large and intriguing (I want to come back to try just about everything listed) *Atmosphere-great artwork   *Service-stellar   This place is so good that I was telling my waitress I can't wait to come back, and I hadn't even finished eating. L-O-V-E this restaurant. Wow. Wow. Wow.

7PNh0j72iJGfnhp0nbWpfQ.text: If you come to Phoenix and don't eat here you are missing out on life!!!! I have never had Mexican food like this. I had the shark taco and a Marlin burrito!!!! Life changing is not a bold enough statement. I'm a foodie and this place is incredible. Please come here!!!!!!  The salsa bar alone is worth the visit. It is cheap in price only. Everything about the place is magical. It looks a little scary from outside and at night the sign is not lite up but we took a chance, and it was one of the best choices in eatery I've ever made. Salsa Guacamole is to die for!!! THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING LA SANTISIMA!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yKiSPAJrHTlPXDSAAt-XtQ.text: Shrimp fundito. Oh lord. Five stars. Five stars, five stars, five stars! So much delicious cheese with shrimp, butter, garlic, delicious tortillas. Order this. This is everything. Our server was sweet and fab as can't be. I got the pastor quesa and it was so good. My sisters got the mahi burro and a variety of street tacos. The little ones snacked on our food and had a quesadilla to go. One of the other servers unknowingly handed it to the wrong table, but they were so kind and remade her meal--plus she had the amazing horchata. She did not want to share, so she was mostly concerned about keeping her little brother at bay! The quesadilla was so flavorful. I love the larger than usual chunks of pineapple, and the cranberries in the chopped guacamole was so nice and bright. I expected more cheese after the shrimp fundito, but I'm a cheese person. The burrito was killer and came in second. The street tacos were well seasoned, carne asada was deliciously tender. I definitely recommend this place!

kCD2va2hGvb9JLniWwF6ew.text: Gourmet tacos from abuela's kitchen, an off the beat location in Little Mexico. The well ornate sit in resturant has a great vibe, bright colorful art work and a strong Dia de Muerto sets the right mood. Service is great and simple, from the self serve salsa bar to the strong drinks menu, adds to the home feel.  La Santisima's staple taco is a must have. Nicely toasted cheese over well seasoned steak makes for a great combination.  The roasted peppers and onions add a nice balance and grilled mushrooms just work. Not much on sauce but the beef and vegetables highlight the entree.   Mayan cochinta was loaded with flavor. Tender and savory pork shoulder has a ton of favor, the pickled onions help add a zing to the dish. Recommend you have it over a plate cause it'll ooze down you hand.

tXvei3NS6wouOANo1l-sSg.text: Vegan: I got the veganized quesadilla based on a few reviews here. They can't add beans inside like somebody mentioned, only on the side (make sure to ask for beans without cheese on top) If you are a "junk vegan" you may be good to go. I personally hardly eat fried things and wanted to make an exception for this. They fry the whole thing so it sits in a layer of oil on the plate and the spinach and mushrooms etc inside are soaked as well - all I tasted was the oil. I have only been vegan for a year so I can imagine this must be really good with the cheese but in vegan you may be better off with a burrito or taco.  Omni hubby had the tacos and loved them! Salsas are really nice as well, cilantro, pecan and Mexican were really good. I would go back to try their other stuff!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan quesadilla, many sauces and two tacos

MgPMBVJJY_bC2iqVweMFIw.text: Answer the phone. We try repeatedly on several several occasions to phone in an order. Yes we understand the order will take an hour, we account for that but ANSWER the phone. Good gracious how rude and unprofessional, you don't answer the phone because you don't want the business. I've heard you mumble this when I've been here. Disgrace for my neighborhood taco shop. YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED. Ridiculous   Update. 7/7/2107 AGAIN and AGAIN No one answers the phone. You think a recording will pass for not answering. You give your neighborhood a BAD name because you can't properly staff your restaurant. Oh and today's recording says "Happy 4th of July", 3 days later.

KWy6dNREr7ycYqs81pXixA.text: This place has some of the best food I've eaten. Even the tortilla was superb! Any downside with limited parking and a slightly cramped dining area are quickly forgotten when you take your first bite. There is a great selection of salsas at their salsa bar, ranging from mild and tasty to hot hot hot and tasty. Staff are pros and friendly and will help with the menu if your not sure what to order or if you have any questions. They also seem perfectly willing to make accommodations if you ask for substitutions or additions to your order. This is a definite must try place, cause you'll love it.

Hq-G-r3WhTLntprA9PrUSg.text: Came here with a friend who would not stop raving about how amazing this place was. It had so many great reviews, so I was pretty pumped to try it. They have a rather large menu, and I was pleasantly surprised to see how many vegetarian options they offered. They have a nice, fresh salsa bar, however many of them contain ingredients that are smoked, which I do not care for, but they were still rather delicious. The strawberry, peanut and rabano (radish) salsas were surprising and tasty.  I ended up ordering the Azteca tinga lonche and a Pacific white fish taco. The taco was good, but the breading was a little soggy, and came with way too much mayo. The fish flavor overpowered pretty much everything, even when I drowned it in salsa. The first bite of the lonche reminded me heavily of manwich...something I have not eaten since I was a small child. The flavor was too tomato-y, much like manwich, and was tough for me to finish. The birote it came in, however, was delicious and crunchy. It pains me to give a low rating, when other diners are dishing out 4 and 5 stars. I would be willing to give this place a second chance, but good bread and salsa is not enough to entice me back just yet.

k1eDHn9GLD9sEwUF_Lb9KQ.text: We take all our visiting friends and family to this taco mecca whenever we can.  You will not be disappointed if you go.  The taco's are ingenious and you will leave contended and happy.  The salsa bar is phenomenal.... they have good beer and their taco are awesome.  If you looking for great food, you have found it.

biWCyLrh7Vc6KgqgYf4M4A.text: The food here is amazing and has been for years. There are more salsas in the salsa bar than I've seen anywhere else, more types of tacos (and they're all great), and a special house horchata with granola and fresh fruit that I've never had anywhere else.

Gt3SuN8sLnBp3bchGSdk8w.text: Delicious food and excellent service!! If you plan on coming here during your lunch hour I recommend you call ahead. Wait time can be a bit lengthy if you have limited time. The people here are friendly and very professional.

sWbw2SYpaj8IUTE2eUbPAA.text: Are you tired of, or bored with, the typical Sonoran fare that surrounds us on nearly every corner in the valley?  If so, then you need to put one of the two locations of La Santisima on your list. The only things that you would recognize are the usage of the words: tortilla, taco, quesadilla, and burro. It's that unique.   I've eaten more times than I can count at 16th St, and several times in Glendale. Here's what you need to know between the two. The original 16th St is small, almost cramped. Parking is literally ON the street edge, and around the corner. It can be dangerous backing out of your spot into the northbound flow of 16th St. You will often find a wait to be seated, and there is no indoor waiting area, just a bench outside, and seating for perhaps six at the (full liquor) bar. You will more than likely be privy to your your neighboring diners' conversations, as well as bumping into them at the salsa bar. It's got wonderful ambience, certainly, but it's not for large-parties, or those having issues with claustrophobia, or anxiety that might be sparked due to tight quarters. Those using wheelchairs or scooters should go directly to Glendale. There is ample parking in the rear, and at neighboring venues. The dining room is at least twice, or thrice, that of 16th st, and there is patio seating along Glendale, outside. I've not ever had to wait there, due to the extra seating available.   The salsa bar gets much praise from other reviewers, and I'll get that out of the way first. Yes, there are a dozen, or perhaps 14 choices there. However, batches are kept small for freshness, and they may not have a couple of your faves once you've discovered them. However, there will certainly be ample remaining choices to top your light, airy, housemade(?) chips. Your first basket is gratis, but they do charge for extras (sometimes, LOL). It's very, VERY easy to ruin your appetite with these, due to the wonderful tastes and combos that you simply have not likely seen elsewhere. Chopped jicama, lightly salted w/cilantro? A roasted combo of several different peppers, and onions? Watermelon salsa? Peanut mole? You get the idea....  The menu lays out their special recipe combos pretty well. You can certainly get a standard type street taco plate, with or w/o rice and beans, with several of their takes on the standards, such as carne asada, al pastor, etc. The rice is simple, yet not your standard rosa-colored 'Spanish' rice. It even appealed to a former Asian g/f, who ate plain white rice as a staple. Beans are on the creamy side, more 'refried' than charro style....again quite tasty for their type. However, I almost always succumb to one of their bowls. All can be ordered as burro wrapped in a large tortilla, but I always get a bowl. Afterall, I know I will be semi-full from those chips! I've had the House Special bowl more times than I can remember, and it does not disappoint. But, I've explored out of my comfort zone a time or two, without disappointment.  Quesadillas come in a large fresh corn tortilla, unlike anything I've ever seen at another restaurant. That adds a unique texture and flavor to their already delicious fillings. However, if you think you would be put-off by it somehow, be sure you specify that you wish to have a traditional flour tortilla.  I have to make a special plug for their guacamole. Like other recipes, this one is unique, and  darned yummy. They add cranberry, jicama, and I believe mango to your standard avocado blending. It's creamy green nirvana. Well worth that second basket of chips, for sure. Don't plan on sharing a small serving with any more than one other diner. Otherwise, violence could very well break out at your table.   Well then, it's time for dessert. This is perhaps the only reason I am hesitant to provide them with 5-stars. Frustration! Their take on a leche flan is quite different than what you're used to (that's the theme here, right?). Picture more of a tres-leches sponge-cake, because that's what it is (in my book), and what it should be called (to my thinking, LOL). Suffice to say, in the many times I've eaten here, it's been sold-OUT all but ONE TIME!!!!  I even ask for it BEFORE I ORDER MY MEAL, just in the hopes of reserving one for myself at the end. No such luck, LOL.   Alright, it's time to go eat!

Ow27oXimVjMGvNU9sqWOaA.text: Been here a hand full of times and LOVE it every time I go. Their quesadillas are not like any quesadilla I've ever had; all of their tacos are delicious, they have a huge salsa bar, and the best horchata I've ever had. I'll def keep coming back.

9JcVQpK4k1CCc86JGIPvYw.text: Best Mayan Cocinita Pibil this side of the Border!! I've been coming to this place since they served tacos on wax paper in plastic baskets, and though the atmosphere has changed, the food has not. Solid menu, great salsa bar, delicious albeit expensive margaritas, and very friendly staff in a cozy, genuine atmosphere. Be prepared to wait -this place is small, with only a handful of tables, but very worth the wait!

dS9ZzvJrj_2Qs7sLH7iQKQ.text: Service is absolutely dismal. First we waited 40 minutes on a Sunday night because they barely have any seating. Once we did get a table they were quick to bring chips. Only chips. The waiter never mentioned the salsa bar. I knew it was there but still. Then they didn't take a drink order. After waiting for 5 minutes we walked up to the bar area and begged for water. Last thing I wanted to do was eat chips with salsa without something to drink for over 45 minutes. Another 10 minutes went by before they finally decided to take our order. Then the wait began to get our drinks. It took another 15 minutes to get our drinks--sodas, nothing fancy. This was after we watched the waiter make plenty of other drinks for other tables. He made 3 margaritas for a table that got there after us. Finally after one hour and 45 minutes our food arrived.

r-BDHxL_KTHSwDpxNSYukQ.text: Love this place! We go here every chance we get. I've lived in the neighborhood for 5 years now, and haven't found anything better. Le Santisima is as good as it gets!

sMHJeFQ3IQBfOAXPc35KfA.text: I heard the food was good however service was poor.  I get that Sunday can be a busy day.  The staff should greet people as they walk in and let them know how long is wait.  Instead everyone is ignored.  I really support Latin business owners however it's important to pay attention to all the little things.  It truly does make a difference!!

wW2UU8yNBWXxyFdwwu-omQ.text: Oh hells yes!  I had driven past this little gem several times and never really gave it much thought.  That is until a friend of mine invited me to join for a bite.  Some may say this place is small, but I say it's quaint.  The menu is pretty big, lots of veggie options:)  I ordered the veggie burrito (mushrooms, spinach, cheese, rice,  etc.) and my friend ordered a few different types of tacos.  I was excited to see how amazing the salsa bar was!  I opted for a creamy cilantro sauce.  It totally kicked up my burrito!!  I could order that burrito each time and use a different salsa and never get bored!    The service was top notch and the prices were very reasonable.  Two very enthusiastic thumbs up!

OVIsS4DcJ4muZA5Fz8Y8rw.text: The horchata is remarkable!!! No one makes it like this place!!! I love that they also have a huge salsa bar.

Rpygn3CymVkLvH0Ug-WnJQ.text: Tacos. Ammmaaaziiiing! Try cochinita pibil!!! Try the salsa Mexicans for sure and lonche w cochinita pibil fantastic too. It was a great experience

7XLkxL_13khJXWiqfI8LOQ.text: I wanted to like this place but I go two different tacos and they seemed so bare and tasted very similar and only had meat on it. The salsa bar was amazing. I'll probably try it one more time and skip the tacos.

pNikpybl6odJfacbZwZ4Mg.text: The salsa bar is "all that and a bag of chips!" "Since when do you go to a salsa bar, where the salsas are actually really full of flavor, thick (not watered down), and unique?!" as my friends put it so well! It's sounds strange, but the pecan salsa was delicious! The peanut salsa was still spicy but had a hint of peanut in it, so it wasn't overwhelmingly "peanuty." There was a strawberry rhubarb pepper type of salsa. This may sound a little too strange for most, but it was almost like a spicy dessert type sauce. Don't forget to order some margaritas to wash those salsa and chips down. I would say you could get filled up on salsa, chips and margaritas alone here and be more than satisfied, but I'm not sure the owners would be too happy about that! The salsa variety was nothing less than astounding! And don't worry your precious little heart. There are traditional ones too: green tomatillo, chipotle red pepper, jicama, and cilantro... just to name a few!  Slow roasted cochinitas pibil (pork) tacos, slow cooked chicken mole tacos, beer battered Dogfish shark tacos, battered shrimp tacos, el gaucho steak in chimchurri sauce tacos with guacamole. Oh gawd, yes! And affirmative... these were all eaten in one sitting.... well, with a little help from Bryan too. He's so thoughtful for that too. I might have died from eating too much. We live so far from here that I just wanted to "stock up," and I came oh so close to having to be rolled out of the place like that "blueberry girl" from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory!

jtiC2bP8c891qMS63lm2ig.text: WOWWWWWWWW  Seriously, wow. We took the kids here one night when we were looking for someplace good to eat. We were going to go to America's but we used to live there, so we tried this place out instead. It's right down the road, so we were like "what the hey." Firstly, the outside is so cool looking. With that big ol sugar skull thing. So artsy. I was a little nervous we'd be out of place. But then we thought... "well, it's not in the nicest area, so it can't be too scenester" SO glad we made that decision. So we go in with the kids and sit at a table. The seating area is very intimate, I didn't mind that. The decor is really cool, gotta love a place with a great ambiance! The server was really nice, not overly nice. He did a great job. Omg the salsa bar is amazing. We tried them all! The kids loved trying them and naming them. The cilantro salsa.... never had anything like it in my life.   I had the fish tacos that were such a relief. I have had some bad fish tacos in the past so I was a little nervous. But wow. We also had a margarita. They were both strong so I got to finish my husbands. Yay for me! :)   I was a little disappointed that there isn't a kid's menu. I think they should make a small taco plate for kids, and maybe an option for a small burrito with a side of beans and rice. But the kids made due just fine. My daughter had a bean and cheese burrito and my son had 2 of the carne tacos. They both loved their choices and my husband swapped a carne taco with one of my Son's fish so they got to try it all. Yum. The chips were also great and made it nice to be able to dive right in to all the salsa options.   The price might be my favorite thing. All four of us ate, got drinks, and my husband and I had a margarita all for about 40 bucks including a nice tip. You really can't beat that! We will DEFINITELY be going back to La Condesa!

4mgOf5yjpx7Yj2-3D2HyVg.text: Hidden gem. Hole in the wall with the most unassuming store front but delicious salsa bar with great authentic Mexican food!

t0gl-pU3bTn2W0byKWYlnA.text: The Queso Fundido with the mushrooms and poblano peppers was delish.   Loved the mole tacos.   Outstanding food.

LkFhVhuVgB7V5BdcrEi10w.text: Amazing tacos. I've hadn't taste such a delicious taco for a long time.

JucPMgXf2vJDvGa5tNMmkA.text: love the salsa bar but service can be WAY slow during peak hrs. THEY NEED MORE HELP!! Food is fantastico!! Try it but avoid peak hrs.

xJLKCrBLCgThR4VNMCt1yg.text: Dude.  I love this place. It's walking distance from my house, that is baaaad news for my thighs. I've driven past it multiple times and it never caught my eye. Finally, I did notice their large statue thingy outside of the establishment. It was all lit up as I drove by during the evening. When I realized it was a gourmet taco shop, I knew I had to go asap.   I went with my boyfriend and we both went to TOWN on their chips and assorted salsas. My favorite was the pecan salsa. Sweet and spicy! For our meals, he ordered 3 tacos and I ordered 2. The pork tacos were slightly bland and made me worry at first that I was going to be let down, but then came the chicken mole taco - oh my! Delicious! Sweet and savory, it was perfect. I know that sauce is difficult to make too, so, well done. Most of the tacos actually don't come with cheese - you know why? Because the tacos are so bomb you don't even need the cheese really. Their flavors are very carefully picked to taste a certain way. Save the cheese and salsa for the chips! You'll enjoy the tacos just as they are.  YUM!

0z-f_7E-LI0F3gC3KczxEw.text: So fantastic! The salsa bar alone is worth going to see, unique tasty salsas. The tacos are big not street tacos, found out after I ordered 5 of them, but had plenty of take homes. Their horchata is the best I've ever had. The place it's self is small so make sure you get there before the rush. But absolutely check it out!

_ONUMngPudj3JmV0PVboMQ.text: This place is a gem. The have any type of fresh salsa you could imagine. The energy and decor makes you feel welcome as well as the staff. We had the street tacos and they were amazing! My favorite was the Al Pastor. We will definitely be back!

rUMJ6k5XtEx5Z6VI50dwWw.text: If you haven't eaten at this place, you're missing out! The tacos are some of the best in the valley. Not much seating and fills up fast, but well worth the wait.

QZCT_BenUL4pbgu721O8wg.text: BEST TACOS.....EVER!  was visiting phoenix and found this place on yelp.  great food, great atmosphere, and AMAZING SALSA BAR.

Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9JDVJBBaEzc6xrCggGxHVA.text: I tried both the machaca and shredded chicken tacos - barely edible!  The shredded cabbage looked to be a week old on the overcooked beef, which did not really qualify as machaca.  The shredded chicken was swimming in a tasteless red sauce.   The combo platter promises rice & beans - more like thimble-fuls of white rice and bean soup.  I will say that their chips and salsa bar was great, but the rest was awful!

BwZwU1ui8457oOifRIlEjQ.text: Got here at around 2pm on Sunday and had to wait a hour to get seated. So get here early! Food was awesome only down side is they need more staff. Overall we had a good experience

7zDNDgTTbOdSnM-0eqOf6w.text: As many close to me know, I hold Carolina's in very high regards as it is cheap and delicious and I have claimed many a time that it is my all-time favorite. However, until I tried La Condesa, I had no idea what the hell I was talking about. La Condesa Gourmet Taco Shop has surpassed Carolina's - nay - EVERY restaurant I have ever known. I write to you with a mind blown and blurry with recent memories of an unreal salsa bar and horchata topped with pecans, melon, strawberries, and cinnamon...  I can die happy.

Nj9dyqHdUhLWtDT_3S1SIA.text: Great!  But long lines and crowded.  Huge servings, lots of tasty choices.  Salsa bar is varied and delicious.

FPG7d0Z8MWwMWKgjZVOdqw.text: Amazing tacos, full of favor. Also have a great salsa bar.

waa00JjmRyISXiC3XqxzcA.text: Thank you Yelp. I just received an email with Yelpers' reviews of Burritos. Usually the recommendations are far and away or not fitting my food mood. However, La Condesa was right in my wheelhouse.   The location is ok, but the interior is spotless and fun. Lots of Day of the Dead and Luce Libre to enjoy while you choose salsa from the 12 or so available. Did I mention that there are a lot of salsas? For a condiment king like me, this is heaven. Peanut and Pecan Salsa, WHAT!?! Both were tasty and new flavors. Mayan Cochinita Burro jumped off the menu. I had beverage ordering anxiety and caved to the Horchata. Best Horchata I've had. There are nuts, strawberries and other tasty floaters in it. The burro came, and it was lava-esque. I couldn't touch it for 20 mins. Luckily I had salsafest 2011 to keep me busy. The burro finally returned from the sun and it tasted delicious. Melt in your mouth stewed pork and refried beans in a possibly homemade tortilla. I'll be back.   $12 Food, drink and Salsafest.

ZMzDAEC2FcNlIGsRg7aAQw.text: Great tacos and Mexican drinks.  What a hidden gem

rh32yDzIfB9rwtS3uyecIw.text: This is the best Mexican food ever. Holy moly. Like, not even a competition after I ate here. The food is unbelievable, authentic, and delicious. The location is a bit sketch, but don't let that deter you! Nice and modern on the inside, and can we talk horchata? We should talk horchata. fresh strawberries IN THE HORCHATA. It was like experiencing your first orgasm. You guys are amazing, keep it up, I will for sure be back many many times.

BRKd_H7_TTyDVEaIv8SdwA.text: Hands down my favorite mexican place of all time! Big cheesy chimis, huge burritos and tacos with the tastiest mexican fillings. My favorite is the Mayan Cochinita Pibil, so good Johnny Depp would've shot him dead in Once Upon a Time in Mexico! haha Seriously so good, plus they give you chips with endless salsa! My secret is to mix the spicy green salsa with the creamy cilantro! I love this restaurant so much I would marry it! lol

t0HW9yLZZJ0QGBiCRPGWxQ.text: This place is so unique. Everthing is a little different in a good way. I LOVE the pecan salsa! The tacos are great!!

8rfaiO1v1_BDbsZjurw_yA.text: Omg - their Salsa bar is amazing.. A bit spicy but I like spicy.. Horchata was delicious.. their  guacamole has tiny pieces of mango and cranberries - it's semi sweet and just so good.. I hear mole sauce is just heavenly but since I don't eat meat - wasn't able to taste it :( do try their rice - it's flavoured with cilantro and garlic and has tiny pieces of corn.. Everything was just perfect..

nCCUDEXAvaAPqQFlYUD7TA.text: This is my FAVORITE taco shop! Every salsa is unique and delicious. Margaritas are some of the best I've ever had out - not too sweet, yummy citrus pulp for flavor. Amazing horchata. Beautiful artwork. Kind of small inside so you may have to come at a slightly odd hour to be sure you get a seat. Oh! I almost forgot about the guacamole! Very fresh and very tasty!

c-LBO9Svm11rMgP08iliKg.text: Awesome tacos. Salsa bar is super fresh and offers many unique combos. My favorite was the spicy peanutty salsa. Soooo good. The place looks a little dicey from the outside but the food is top notch and service is outstanding.

cuzKHRkfJmpu8PfvzAn4Bw.text: Oh.my. God. I have died and gone to taco heaven. Finding decent Mexican food as a vegetarian is hard, but I have succeeded! Not only were these the best vegetarian tacos I've ever had, but the best tacos I have ever had. Also the salsa Mexicana is to die for.

bHiyP4iOmxe6Ow-Uy7Ewtw.text: I ordered the green chili chilequilles with poached eggs and a margarita with a corona. The food was awesome and the drink was superb but what really impacted our first time experience was the wait. It took about 5-10 min to get water but she did bring our chips out first. They have small plastic to go cups for salsa which is an inconvenience to keep going back and forth for refills, not to mention half of the sauces were bland, (had no flavor).   At this point we ate two baskets of chips and still didn't get our drinks we ordered from the bar. Our food actually came our first then finally my margarita and two mechiladas came. We ate half our food as the chips filled us up from waiting so long. The food was delicious but the service needs immediate attention.  Another issue I had was that the ladies room had no hand soap so I decided to let the staff now. Shouldn't they check this prior to opening? It's unsanitary if the staff goes to the restroom and touches food.   All in all, I'd give it one more try but I'd go if I'm not in a hurry to go anywhere. If you are on a short lunch break, don't come here unless you're ok with showing real late to work. Hopefully I can leave a better review next time I visit. Great food, bad service when it comes to timing. Otherwise our server was nice.... btw there was only a couple dining and three girls. They place wasn't packed so I shouldn't have waiting about 25-39 minutes for my drinks and food (-_-)

lemLvnR_tM0RL_Jeuhpv7g.text: So myself and a coworker passed by this joint and loved the outside decor for the sign. Yelped it, and bamb! A whoppin 4stars huh, so today we stopped by to try it.   Let's just start off with the entrance to the place. Line to the door. No tables open. One cashier, during the lovely lunch hour.   The tables weren't bussed yet so we sat at a dirty table till it was cleaned. Can't blame them as the line never stopped from growing and to go orders were huge as people walked out.   Food arrived and then the taste buds had an awakening. I tried the Cabo Shrimp taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil taco, and Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Shark Taco. All are very delicious just as is. Did not need the salsa bar they have but tried them for the chips the give while you wait.   Only downside to the joint is the tortilla. The tacos seemed like they served them on some you get at Frys and or even a knock off, definitely nothing gourmet or authentic about those.   Overall spent $16 on three tacos priced 3.99 each and a drink. Will I return??? Probably not, maybe to try others from the menu. But not worth the 4/5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. In clockwise order-Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Shark Taco, and Cabo Shrimp Taco
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and Salsa bar

wh8OSAbPKKerZyfRDU0utA.text: Great flavors. Amazing how they can combine all the ingredients and make fabulous dishes. Food is not spicy, but the multitude of salsa sauces can be. Cilantro salsa, strawberry or peanut salsas. They have close to 20 choices of salsa.  Highly recommend visiting

-3oqxYO8-vpDzunBPjr4hQ.text: The menu has lots of variety. As does the salsa bar. I got the street tacos, brisket, al pastor and chicken tinga. All were good. Next time I'll try a burrito. My coworker got a burrito and could only finish half.

_1v9DTZcx76qdVQLNqxtZw.text: Santi and I came to La Santisima looking for a good Mexican fare, and walked away pleasantly surprised by the overall experience. The small, squared-shaped interior included a small dining area, a full salsa bar, kitchen, and a small bar area in the back. The wall-to-wall paintings and artifacts were striking, and nicely added to the casual and festive atmosphere. The menu consisted of an eclectic listing of gourmet tacos, street tacos, burros, deep-fried corn quesadillas, and lonches.   The Al Pastor Burro ($8.95) arrived with spicy pork, homemade salsa, pineapple, tomato, lettuce, guacamole, onion, cilantro, avocado, and al pastor salsa. The burro was tightly wrapped in hot pressed tortilla. The spicy pork was nicely seasoned with sweet pineapple to brighten the flavors. The rest of the supportive ingredients added subtle touches and kicks. The textures of the onions, lettuce, and tomato were noticeable, but I wished there could be more guacamole to round out the flavors. The burro was sizable, and good to share when cut in half. I recommend it.  The Aztec Tinga Taco and Maya Cochinita Pibil Taco ($9.39) came with rice, black beans with Oaxacan cheese, and two sizable double-decked tacos with shredded meat and red onions layered on top. The Tinga Taco encompassed tender shredded chicken, tomato, and chipotle salsa. I wished there could be more chicken, but the taco was mouthwatering delicious. The Cochinita Pibil was made with pork shoulder wrapped and slow cooked in banana leaves, lime marinated onions and salsa to add acidity and sharpness. Their distinctive taste from one another made the experience worthwhile. The rice and black beans were not simple fillers, but instead they were surprisingly flavorful and addictive.   The Tialoc Veggie Burro ($8.95) was put together with mesquite-grilled cactus, caramelized onion, garlic, tomato, mushrooms, jalapeno, and Oaxacan cheese in a tightly wrapped hot pressed tortilla. Personally, I prefer the soft, spongy, and stretchable flour tortillas, but the firm and hot pressed version was surprisingly good, resilient, and held everything together quite well. The grilled cactus came in large pieces, and the pleasant textures nicely complemented the generous earthy mushrooms. The Burro could taste bland for some people, but the addition of melted Oaxcan cheese added nuances to the sweet and savory flavors. If I were to order this again, I would add guacamole and more cheese to the mix.   Lastly, the Arabe Burro ($12.99) had plenty of al pastor, hummus, aguacate, pastor salsa, lettuce, cucumber, tomato, red onion, avocado, red pepper, and Tzatziki dressing on top. In this case, cognitive dissonance can be a good thing, as this Arabic-inspired burro was a hit. The sweet and spicy pastor coupled nicely with the smooth hummus, and the support ingredients rounded out the flavors by bridging flavors of the two worlds. This is one of the worthy items for those looking for an adventure, along with their great looking deep-fried corn quesadillas at many tables.   The chips were refilled upon request. Among the 12-salsa options, my favorites were the chunky chipotle, smoky Cabo, sweet pecan, spicy Mexicana, peanut, and spicy avocado. Unfortunately, the cilantro salsa had an overpowering sour cream flavor, and some of the other options were too watery, didn't register, or live up to my expectations.   The restaurant can get very busy throughout the day, so service was not their strongest attribute on each visit. The food took some time to arrive, but the salsa bar and complimentary chips were there to scale down the hunger pains. I thought the prices were a bit higher than San Francisco and Los Angeles. However, there was a nice mix of original and innovative flavors to set them apart. Quality-wise, the food was less greasy when compared to a traditional taqueria. Interested diners should come open minded, and not expecting the most authentic fare. I hope to return to try their Oaxacan Shrimp Mole Burro, Chicken Mole Street Taco, and Pumpkin Flan. 3.5 stars for the overall experience.
