OXsyNDGBmUc35EQb7ikehg.text: Went in on a weekend, was pretty busy, but got a seat pretty quickly, about 10 min wait tops. We were very impressed with the salsa bar, makes it so whatever flavor your looking for to enhance your food with that this can be self-done :P Ordered the chicken shark mole taco, wow! that was yummy, had this two weeks ago and the flavor is still etched in my taste-buds memory! Over all the dinner was excellent, will definitely be back.

Xjb-gBgHCq8aG6w6Bb2mYA.text: Every time we visit Phoenix we take an Uber straight to La Santisima from the airport! Our favorite Mexican restaurant ever and they have an amazing salsa bar!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QymXq2wcN7APOQHb5gXH1Q.text: Love the margaritas, extensive tequila menu & the food is great! Great salsa bar! A great place to bring family & friends when visiting Phoenix. Only downside was that they are a little short staffed & takes a little while to get yr drinks & food. Plan to be there a little while, but in the end, it's all worth it!.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ADARf8MGECts0Oh7roFjMQ.text: Had to wait 40 minutes for a table despite there being half a dozen open tables. Never got a water refill or offer for a second drink. The waiter literally took our order, dropped off food, and then brought us a check. Nothing else.   Food was good, but service was so bad I'll never be back.

L9G05mlRRp8R2GfvmYbVkg.text: Decided to drop into this establishment that I kept hearing amazing things about. First I ordered the Award Winning Margarita, and if I could I would give them another award. Holy cow this was delicious with the spicy salt on the side!!!! (Sighhhhhh) I was sad when I finished it...three drops of tears came out. We got some of the tacos for appetizers and let the waitress order them for us. Let me just say that the baby shark was fried to perfection. The signature taco everyone needs to try because the flavors coming off the steak were tasty and forced me to sit back and enjoy. Finally for our final dish of the day we had a Quesa which is this interesting take on a quesadilla that was more like a stuffed sopapilla with a delicious filling of steak, mushrooms, peppers, onions and some sort of magical dust that made me fall in love! This place was awesome and the only reason that it lost a star was that they seemed short staffed  and the poor waitress was running everywhere and appeared to be the only one there. Thank you for upping the downtown food game.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Dxvuka9Y6YuMsLSXluMLoA.text: Visited La Santisima for first time last week w/sister for lunch,I had el pastor sandwich, FABULOUS, going back 10/3 w/5 friends for dinner. Servers are very knowledgeable, easily explaining the menue,atmosphere very comfortable, CAN'T WAIT!! Sharlene, Phoenix top notch GO TO PLACE

3FEixAx7JqCX617XDhgtCA.text: I have only been here once but it won't be the last time.  The food here is so fresh and the salsa selection; i have never seen anything like it and it's all so fresh and interesting.  The ambiance has a lot of character but people come here for the food. I just had tacos and was blown away by the flavor.  The shells were good but the meat was seasoned nice, the veggies were crisp and the staff were awesome. I will definitely be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The front

NSu_pS3NCyVF8TiE4nhmlg.text: The menu is kind of big and many items may be unfamiliar to many.  They have a baby shark taco and numerous other items that sound unique and exotic.  Even the horchata is quite large and they sprinkle all sorts of toppings to it.  The salsa bar also contained items I usually don't see in other taco shops.  The green salsa was spicy and delicious.  I was surprised at my bill being over $21 (3 tacos + beans/rice + horchata).  Regardless of how fancy a taco is the price shouldn't be so high per person.  It's a freakin' taco.  Also I wouldn't recommend parking  on the main road facing the restaurant.  Some are signed for another business in which after I opened my car door someone popped out and sternly let me know they will be calling the tow on inappropriate parked cars.  Also these spots when you back out is super dangerous as cars on the main road are racing by pretty fast.  There is a parking lot on the side of the restaurant that is much safer.

xHknLlf8ENt7NlbGDrK1pg.text: Seriously outstanding tacos.  Not sure why we waited so long to come here.  Will be bringing everyone that comes to visit us in Phoenix here! Thanks!

_58vblLkd10FryUiHIFZbQ.text: What a surprise! Not only do they have strawberry salsa, which made my toes curl, their mole burro was fantastic. It's very different from the mole we get in Los Angeles, richer, more of a heady chocolate flavor with a hint of sweetness.  Delicious.  The tortilla soup was also quite yummy and their salsa selection was outstanding.

qMAyP622b2k-m47Dl3B-pw.text: Food was very good, it wasn't what I expected as they use different ingredients together (like pecans in the sangria or cranberries and mango in the guacamole). Everything was fresh and home made. The only thing lacking slightly was the service. They got a few things wrong, took awhile, and was a little slow. But it definitely wouldn't stop me from going back. Menu is very extensive and you can customize.

Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sangria mad with gin, apples lemon and pecans

REJZUxdW0zPGFs9KMnx5uA.text: VERY small, parking sucks, good food. Nice variety of salsas. *Don't come on your lunch hour unless you are an executive lunch.

p2vwx1jDrcVE6LA9-OvGNA.text: This 4 is more like 4.5 stars and that's only because of the size and the 45 minute wait (which never end up really being 45 minutes.. and as a NYker.. this is not such a big deal.. it's the norm). When we had our food.. we understood why the name.. we reacted with "ay santisima" lol!   The salsa bar is very creative and gave us mad options like the "peanut chipotle" and more. Now let's talk about these margaritas.. man oh mighty.. best margaritas I've had! and I've had my fair share of em! It's strong enough and they throw in a slice of grapefruit that really gives it a nice zing! The service was great, yes the bar is tiny and they clearly are understaffed but that didn't stop our server from giving us 5 star service! Drinks came quick and so did the food! Now the menu.. it can be a little intimidating and overwhelming with the immense options.. but definitely go for something you haven't had before, you won't regret it! I can't wait to go back!

aefYRr75y3GcWZj-97Z1Sw.text: Went with my family for a birthday celabration. We had a bad experience. First of all the service was horrible, the food was overpriced for the portion served. They forgot one of our orders and still  charged. The waitress was rude and never returned to the table. The fastest thing we got was the check rather than the food. I do not recommend this restaurant unless u like overpriced food and bad service.

RDBD7aCYvYBCekZS_aLO6Q.text: I've been coming here for years, since it was named La Contesa.  I've also referred numerous business clients and friends.  Never again!  Not only has the service gone downhill, the prices are outrageous.  The one server brought us stale chips, unsalted.  There were at least 4 bussers working the place, but only one server???  Very odd for a 5pm dinner rush.   The guacamole and cilantro salsa taste as though it had spoiled.  Ordered queso fundido with mushrooms, a chicken taco plate, and a chicken burrito with enchilada sauce.  Never got the queso - no big deal I guess, somewhat expected when you have only one server and it's busy.  Rice was cold for both entrees.  The kicker was the final bill.  They now charge you for meat on your tacos and burritos.  It cost $20 for a chicken burrito with a side of cold rice, no beans!!!  The menu says extra charge for shrimp or mahi mahi tacos (2.95 to be exact), but nothing about a chicken charge for tacos.  They charged me $2.97 chicken on the tacos!  All in all, based on the quality of the food, the horrible service, the prices, the weird smell, and the stagnant air (A/C wasn't working in the first dining room), we won't be coming back.  Very sad, as this was one of our favorite restaurants in town.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Used to be one of favorite restaurants.  Service and food quality have gone downhill, while the prices have soared.  Highway robbery!

kZQHKUAZHhe4G772rhn6zg.text: I wanted to be blown away by a gourmet taco shop, but sadly I live in Southern California, and when you live there being amazed by tacos take A LOT. I definitely recommend this place, but it doesn't have the WOW factor.  The Pros: Awesome Salsa Bar - about a dozen delicious salsas. The regular Mexican salsa was flavorful and spicy. Some nice rare options too. Service - Our server was very nice and attentive. The Al Pastor - I tried the premium carne asada, fish taco, and al pastor. This is the only one I would go back for - great taste and tender pork.  The Cons: Price - Like double the price of what I'm used to paying for any kind of taco. Pepsi brand soda - Hells to the no!! and they didn't have Mexican coke either (they were apparently out). Bleh on the fish taco - again, I am spoiled because I only eat fish tacos in Baja, but the batter was very soggy and bland.  Small place and tight parking but it wasn't crowded on a Sunday.

CgZCzoSasD5Yr6RV_Mzt9A.text: This place has become one of my new favorites! On the list of must tries are: fish tacos, salsa bar, and the Horchata (probably the best I've had). This restaurant is small, so if you're coming in a group you will most likely have to wait to get a table. I usually just sit at the bar, order a couple of tacos/rice/beans and then I'm out. Service can be slow at times, but the food always comes out tasty.

_DsdvSavYsYfl7Mh_xKgOQ.text: The most delicious margarita I've ever had... Seriously!

QBiEJieA5DuGVsl6sXpLYA.text: Best carne asada tacos in Phoenix! I love that their tortillas are freshly cut and grilled. Everything is always delicious. However it is in a super sketchy part of town so you will get some unusual characters around.

f6iS8ZV7p5rnYXi8KfX11A.text: This place has at least 3 different names: La Condesa on Yelp, La Santisima on the front of the building, and Santa Santisima on the menu.  Call it whatever you want, just find the place.  It's so good, my friends and I came here twice during our trip, on the word of some locals we met at JoBot Coffee.  It's a really small place, so expect a wait unless you happen to get lucky and pop in at a slow time.  The guacamole is stupid good, as are the shark and pork tacos.  If you're really hungry, skip the 2 taco platter (just adds rice and beans) and get a third taco, or order the guac.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The lady on the front of the building
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shark taco on the right (can&#39;t remember which steak taco is on the left)

n8uYe3NojIxQSH9fScbToQ.text: I was so excited to go here after seeing an episode of Check Please! Arizona but my high hopes were quickly dashed. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon (around 4ish) and found several couples waiting to be seated and were told that there was a 20 minute wait for 2, which was odd as there were several empty tables. The AC was not working and it was over 100 degrees outside which made the wait even worse. I was pleased with the Grapefruit margarita while we waited but then my hopes were dashed again as our waitress was very...forgetful? Ditzy? Lost? The menu was enormous and too confusing, the salsa was all very spicy (some people who enjoy Mexican food do not like super spicy), and the service was just pitiful. We waited 20 minutes to order, and then another 20 for a beer. The food was good, but overall it just was not worth everything we had to go through. I was looking forward to trying the Flan and having a nice, cool horchata for dessert only to find myself being disappointed again because they were out of flan and the horchata tasted like watered down milk. Needless to say I will not be coming back here again. My advice: if you have a few hours to kill: try going on a weekday in the middle of the day and hope for the best.

A896eyyVcd-4GJZ4uEK8pA.text: I'm not even sure why this place has so many reviews. I try to be nice about reviews cause I know how this effects various businesses. We went here on a Saturday night (group of 9); and before I even decided to rate this place.... I went around asking the entire crew what they would rate this place ... all of them either said 1 or 1.5 out of 5 stars.. When we got in, we had to wait for 45 mins to get a table... I mean that's understandable given the fact that we were a large group... once seated.... everything is just so slow. We ordered and the food literally took about 45-50 mins to come out. That's way too long. The waitress was nice. (only reason why I'm giving them a one star). I advise this business to give chips for free since the wait is so long. Anyways, overall ... not too happy with the service.. and the food wasn't all that at all. There's a lot better Mexican restaurants around!

lKR7DunlII8UUzLMf1LX7Q.text: Hot food hot. Cold food cold. Yep, delicious. Horchata was full of delicious fruit and nuts. The place was very clean. Sat at the bar and saw the food come thru the little window. No rush, no fuss, just cranking out quality grub. Salsa bar would take a couple of trips to truly savor, lots of choices.

ITh6eXNe_sE2DPGf7uXtFg.text: Holy cow, this place is great and very accommodating for vegetarians and vegans. The poblano quesadilla was incredible. Be sure to hit up the salsa bar and order some horchata, you won't regret it!

dEIj1Jblp1eARxlARNK32g.text: I have updated my review after my last visit. They have expanded seating now so they are able to accommodate larger groups now! The service is still a bit slow but eating chips with the excellent salsa from the salsa bar helps pass the time.

Ig2CCZnKF2QEopglKhtkMg.text: Their quesas are the bomb.com! They're very big, so you can totally split one with a friend. The salsa bar was great and had different varieties of salsas and guacamole. We went there around 11:30 and it was pretty busy, but that's not surprising for a place that has really good food eh? I'll definitely be back to try more! :)

N6dXF8Ukb48rvdAtw-q7_A.text: This place is tiny and often packed. Great salsa bar, my favorite is the cilantro and 7 chiles.  If you like texture, you have to try one of the quesas.  Its a type of quesadilla/empanada/tamale.  Made of a corn masa, it is filled with cheese and other ingredients, folded over and pinched closed.  Then it is deep fried.  My favorite is the shrimp.    They do have a full - but tiny- bar.    I've been here at least a dozen times an d always love it.  ALWAYS.

kufyVoWKqYL-Wc2KAPg5LA.text: Love the concept upgrade Mexican food with authentic flavor, I am not a big fan of beans but the black beans here are delicious!! I have tried the taco platter and also went for brunch and had chilaquiles super good as well.

NWYNSSm7WLk62DA-68KGqA.text: My wife and I use this as our go to quality taco spot. But I could spend all my time just sampling the salsas. Great midtown PHX spot. Parking is somewhat difficult if you come during busy hours but don't let that deter you.

PxHkcncL73-3gmYAj8XbFA.text: Best Mexican food I've had in years...and I've had a lot.  Everything was excellent, including the free salsas.  In fact, the cilantro salsa was so good I'd drink it. The quesadilla was deep fried, which I wasn't expecting.  Had I known, I'd have gotten something else.  The fried breaking was a little overpowering.  But, everything else was memorable, and we're working out how to stop again on the way out of town.

yrDA60L4VCkelY1czNwK2g.text: This place was ok...  Parking was slim, but there was space on the street.   It's a nice, friendly place.. small, but welcoming to our large group.  The salsa bar was nice.  There were a lot of different ones to choose from and everyone was able to find ones that they enjoyed. The chips were free (there were some reviews saying they were charged for chips..)  i had the taco/burro combo.. I got the shrimp taco and the gaucho steak burro.  The shrimp had a lot of breading.  It had good flavor, but the shrimp was a little dry. I also found that the steak in my burro was a little dry.  Again, it had good flavor, but i was disappointed in the meat. The grilled squash that came with the plate was good though!   I decided that I had to try the horchata because of all the reviews.  It was pretty good, but I didn't care for the chunks of fruit.  It was difficult to drink through the straw towards the end, and I ended up wasting 1/4 of my $4 drink...   Pricing is higher than noted.  My plate was $12ish and the horchata was $4.  After tax and tip, it was over $20.    All in all, it was a decent meal/experience, but I probably won't go back.

VqmH2Hcpg3q4UP4PXSDOUw.text: Had a Groupon - went there today...  It was fantastic!    I had the Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Taco plate. Loved it!  I normally don't order rice and beans but since It was my first time visiting here, I did get them.  The beans had a nice flavor and they were moist enough to dip my chips in and eat that way.  The rice had bits of corn and cilantro and was very flavorful.    The salsa bar was also delicious with several options to choose from, including a strawberry salsa that was very nice for the sweltering Phoenix summer day.    I liked La Condesa so much, I bought another Groupon while eating my lunch!  :)

yPXvbwEnmNyLXFdIpuQuWg.text: Hands down one of my favorite restaurants anywhere. With a few exceptions, I've tried most of the menu and I can say that everything is superb. The quesadillas have a hand-made corn tortilla that is almost like a pastry. Whether it's filled with al pastor or arrachera steak, it will not disappoint. The cochinita pibil and chicken tinga are also do-not-miss items.   The fresh salsa bar has some very unique and delicious offerings, in particular the pecan, strawberry, and chile de arbol salsas.  The service is always super friendly and the decor is very inviting.   I sincerely look forward to enjoying La Condesa for years to come!

qeN2n2FaS5KRSn0GCpdRIA.text: Service is taking too long lately. I don't like waiting for 15mins just to place a Togo order, mostly because no one pays anY attention to the customers at the register or waiting to be seated. Also the bean burrito was good but not worth $9.00. Tacos use to be packed and for a great price. Now they are chincy even with the calabacitas. I paid $7.00 for a Mexican squash sliced and grilled. I could have paid 65 cents for the squash and pan grilled like they did. Very sad. I wish they made tacos like they use to before they went on triple d (food network). They still have good salsa (strawberry is delish) but they have lost the taco. I don't wanna pay $4.00 for a chincy taco that has no filling. Btw give more beans and rice, it doesn't cost much to make either so give at least 2 tablespoons instead of one. I'm very serious about the serving size.

dVt4mUJyim20l7sJWL6MJQ.text: This place easily gets a 5 star for amazing authentic Mexican food - some of the best I've had.  We had a group of 5 and all ordered different dishes - all were extremely flavorful and well prepared - difficult to choose the one we all liked best.  The service was barely a 3.  People were nice but we didn't see our water much and took long to get a drink, the check, etc

jmOZyqLAQz5tEcYc4NwsCA.text: Hole in way gem,not to be missed. Great tacos ..good serving size..salsa bar is great..margaritas with real alcohol. Super value for money

SPaCySzPfbnLUM-rYvLbDA.text: I was going to meet a friend for lunch at Barrio (one of the only places you can get "real" Mexican in Phoenix, which I could never understand -  we are less than 4 hours from the border!!). Unfortunately, it was before I yelped much, so I neglected to notice that they were closed Mondays:( Dejected, we drove down the street looking for someplace else to go. I can't remember if it was the Catrina that drove us in, but as soon as I saw the salsa bar, I knew I was in heaven. It was like actual food that I've actually eaten in Mexico (rather than assorted patterns of tortillas, rice, beans, and cheese). Now we take all visiting friends and family to this place. A visitor from LA said they were the best tacos he had ever eaten and I'm sure he wasn't lying.   Many people have commented on the salsa bar. My favorites are the creamy ones (pecan, peanut, and cilantro) and most of all the sesame (to me, the spiciest one on the bar), and usually I try to sample some of each one - but taste is in the eye of the beholder. The important point is that you don't want to fill up on the chips, because you will be sad when your huge plate of food comes. So I'd like to share my strategies for maximizing the salsa enjoying experience without getting uncomfortably full.  I start by limiting myself to 5-6 chips which I break into smaller pieces for dipping. Once the food comes, I take the second tortilla from each of my veggie tacos (the tacos themselves already have just the perfect type and amount, so it's pointless to try and add more) and use it to scoop up the salsa. With only the one remaining tortilla, you do get some drippage, but you can add more salsa to any veggies and cheese that fall out and eat it with a spoon. Then for dessert, I pour the cilantro salsa on my rice. Mmmm, salsa. I would buy this stuff by the tub if they would let me. BTW, I asked - they just laughed.   The only draw back is that my poor husband tries to order a margarita every time we go, and they still don't have any. I hope someday they will take his advice and add it to the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie taco plate

3XY_D5keWx0evgM0rEgtRA.text: I have been to La Santisma about four times.  Their wide range of tacos and salsas make it a must for anyone looking to go beyond your regular Arizona Mexican Food.  This place is a very hip establishment with lovely art and decor reflecting the Mexican American culture.  The tacos themselves are quite delicious.  I had difficulty deciding on what to eat because everything looked delicious!  The salsa bar has something to suit everyone's tastes. If you want something mild, medium, or hot, they have it.    This place is not a secret, and space is limited.  Be prepared to wait for seating if coming during dinner hours.  My only issue with La Santisma is that they charge for refills on tortilla chips.  I understand that they are running a business and giving out unlimited chips could be detrimental to the bottom line.  However, with so many delicious salsas available, it would be nice to be able to have some refills to really take them all in and pick a favorite.  I give La Santisma 4 stars due to decor and quality of food.

gRg1n5vT3z3eQBUpVWagaQ.text: Is this real? Are they serious with this? The ambiance was small, cozy, and art was hung on the wall that was really very good. Unbelievable service and food. All the salsas at the bar were stellar and my shark tacos were dynamite. I'm kind of a sucker for rice and beans and I think it's hard to mess up but I've still had some awful rice and beans at some other spots. Luckily, this place had some of the best I've had in a while. The prices were great, helped by a wonderful happy hour. I will be coming back for more because everyone loves tacos and La Santisima does tacos well.

PIocAOZv9Sj3CrdGqoastg.text: This place was pretty good! Shark tacos were really good. Their horchata was amazing! Must try, it had strawberry, pecan, and melon I believe. Will definitely return soon.

okpgCf5t2UFtnMCZEy049Q.text: We came to this restaurant because every time we go to a new city we try new places. We like to watch Diners, Drive ins  and Dives and we try some of the places that they mention. This was a mistake. When we first got there, we had to wait even though there were four tables available two partially bussed One was completely cleaned and one was not at all bussed. There was a couple in front of us waiting and they seemed irritated as well. When we finally get seated we go to the back of the restaurant and there was a few tables available. They explained to us that they ran out of ice so that's the reason they were so behind. I'm sorry I don't understand how a restaurant pretty much shut  down because they ran low on ice. So they show us to our table the hostess sets the chips down and says help yourself to the salsa bar. We make our way to the salsa bar and are greeted by a sign that says extra chips are 2.40 or something and a salsa bar that was almost completely empty. We waited 10 minutes decided to go back there was a man standing there and he had mentioned he asked for cups for the salsa a few minutes ago and they still have not returned. Also the salsa was still not refilled. So we ate or chips with no salsa. We also asked for some guacamole prior to going to the salsa bar the second time the waiter said he thought they might be out of guacamole but he wasn't sure he would let us now. 10 minutes later he comes back to take order completely forgetting about the guacamole and when we asked he said yes they were out of guacamole. It was odd the would be out of guacamole and they can't refill their salsa bar but they give you chips and tell you to enjoy the salsa bar. So we order our food and if I'm being honest it's pretty decent the beans are amazing definitely The best beans I've ever had. The rice was really good. I ordered a margarita with a Corona. Usually those come in a margarita glass the Corona upside down in it. This came in a  tall highball glass Filled about a quarter of the way and the corona on the side it was absolutely terrible. And then the server who I will say it was pretty decent gave us our check came back and picked up our cash and the first thing he said is I don't have any change you guys. And I don't know why but  that bugged me really bad because first of all it was only seven dollars and you're a waiter how can you not make change for a customer. We actually didn't want any change but what if we had. All in all it was not A good experience and there were several people in the surrounding tables there also unhappy especially with the salsa bar being so crappy. And I don't understand and I cannot wrap my head around The fact that just because you're out of ice you can't seat people I don't even understand. Maybe they just had a bad day who knows!

SdqYMkiXAMDysHgZ7sGzmA.text: Great food and salsa bar. Personally, I love the strawberry, 7 chiles, & Mexicana salsa. I had the crane asada (ok) and Mayan Cochinita Pibil Tacos (very flavorful!) combo with rice (mixed with corn - soft and yummy!). My friend order the burro with beef and chimicuri sauce which was soooo delicious. Prices are reasonable $10/plate.

V6ur9Jd6sH0LZyYwFcVh9Q.text: Very good Al Pastor Burro. It's a little hard to find right away from the road and parking can be a hassle but this is such a great place! Their salsa bar has flavors I've never even thought of that go way beyond green, mild, medium and hot. The meat in my Al Pastor Burro was so juicy and flavorful and the pineapple was actually in there for once! Will absolutely go back with friends next time for sure!

RTCZJx3AvuVqA6iio3LIVQ.text: Amazing! The best Mexican food I've EVER had! Get the horchata, you'll be thanking me later!

N3Xi86lzKKSEajEf_C37JA.text: Food was good.  Place was small and it took me a while to figure out that we had to order at the bar.  After paying for our meal, we enjoyed the salsa bar, then out of one of the black t-shirts a roach comes out and was about to get on another woman who was leaning on the wall.  I immediately informed her and they left.  I just sat there and pondered whether or not to eat the rest of my tacos, they were good after all.. I won't be going back.

XWyX_ckN4Dbmy6sEx2zoJA.text: LOVE the dogfish shark taco and the chicken mole taco. The salsa bar is awesome. The horchata is delicious. Perfect tacos at a reasonable price. But the restaurant is small, so avoid peak times or get your food to go.

FDR2FeySZbjs5RL3PgcCKQ.text: Jim W was in town and that was all the reason needed to party, well at least have dinner.  Heather C and Ryan C also were able to show up.  This was my first visit here.  I arrived last and there were chips, guacamole (thanks Ryan) and several salsas already on the table.  About half way through the second basket of chips we placed our orders.  Most of the table got tacos and I got the Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken Quesa.  I also ordered the Horchata which was very tasty with the addition of nuts and fruit but when done left a pile of stuff in the bottom.  The Quesa was delicious, quite filling and actually made two meals for me.  Just a note: mole does not do any better in a microwave on high than gravy, but it still tasted fine.  Service was fine and she split the checks after she had already given us a single one.  We were dining fairly early but as the evening wore on it got pretty busy on a Thursday even with a major Haboob going on.  Definitely a place worth checking out!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken Quesa

OsTVT1kgFkD9Y9440TEJlA.text: Went there with the whole family cause it was nearby. We weren't expecting to walk out so satisfied, especially cause we're all so picky. Highly recommend the quesadillas. They're filled with Oaxaca cheese and flavorful meats/veggies, folded over fresh maza then fried. The salsa bar is colorful, unique, and spicy!!

BcJeRGl20cTPtGXbdwtyEw.text: Great shark taco, mole quesadilla, salsa bar with peanut and pecan salsas, decor, and best goddamn horchata I've ever had.   Thanks for the find, yelp!

-Ky_c9kVlIyyc0QJECCRmA.text: I bought a groupon here last year and finally got around to trying the place. My son and I are pretty picky eaters, so we kind of created our own. I ordered a chicken and bean burrito enchilada style, with rice and beans on the side. I don't know what the heck was in that burrito, but pretty sure the meat was not chicken. I had a stomach ache before even walking out....I honestly should have asked for a different item. I don't know what was wrong with the meat. The portion itself was huge. Very large plate. The salsa bar I liked, lots of different options, Inside was cute. Warning though, parking is a hot mess, its literally on 16th st. Good luck getting out of there during traffic. Waiter was nice, but slow. Over all I was disappointed. I will say, the beer battered fish taco sounded good. May go back to try that, but other than that based on what I ate, we wont be returning.

QKpfIPi_tpzOrRGCo0sQkg.text: We have been coming to this place a bunch lately.  At least 15 trips to eat and it has been unbelievably good every time!

UfPAT7oLj0ttzOFA2OKl2Q.text: Wow!  This spot is legit!  Just went their on Father's day and was blown away!  The salsa bar is killer, some many tasty varieties.  The quesadilla is what won me over and is worth the trip alone.  The street tacos are very tasty.  If you are a Mexican fan this is a must go.

0UjS67W8rAgqAJfz0D5smw.text: Terrific little place. The salsa bar is fabulous as others have noted. Everything looked fresh and distinctive. Had the Oaxacan Mole Chicken Queso. It was a large stuffed, perfectly fried stuffed tortilla. The chocolate mole was one of the best Mexican sauces I've had. A little spicy, a little bitter, and very savory. Haunting.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oaxacan Chicken Mole Queso. Looks a little like a breakfast pastry but it&#39;s completely savory and completely delicious!

iyWjsXxZTaM7mDR2aJEcpg.text: We stopped by for a quick bite to eat. i was told to come try the tacos.  its a really cute but very small place.  Clean and organized.  Very good salsa bar.  The seven chili and mexicana salsa were my favorite.  We ordered queso fundido...i liked it. One of my favorite dishes to try at new places. It did not dissappoint.  Only bad thing was...they could have given a few extra pieces of tortilla with the queso.  We tried the guacho and white fish tacos.  The guacho was excellent.  The white fish wasnt anything special.  Needs some extra seasoning or maybe a spicier sauce instead of the cabbage and white sauce.  I would come back and new stuff because i was pleased with my first try here.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. white fish tacos

Yqm6X7bj2GytaNsUqdZOvg.text: In town for the weekend and my girlfriend found this little taco place. The tacos here are pretty darn good. She and I split a shrimp taco, carne asada taco and a pork taco. They were all pretty tasty. They have a bunch of homemade salsas but none really knocked my socks off. I tried five different salsas hoping one would catch my attention but I was kinda disappointed. Luckily the tacos were really good.

ti9Gj-vgRFUVNp8hBhkIEQ.text: Great menu and options for vegan. Now if you have never tried cactus tacos then think before you do. It's very bitter, I wouldn't recommend but the other tacos I got vegan style were awesome! The margs were great, but I loved all the vegan salsas they had!

3rPNqIufNLNsR3bLa2tm2g.text: Great taco spot in Phoenix.  Always busy.  They have a huge menu to appease any dietary need.  I love the cactus, mushroom and potato tacos!  Also has a great salsa bar that you go and get what you like.  Anytime I have gone they have always been busy - staff is running around but also so nice and helpful!  Order the horchata - Christmas in a cup!

kMh7VO2OaCveOyMN2XJFWw.text: I've never been here, but pass this all time. My best pal said it was the best in town and he doesn't lie. Now I have to go to taste and experience myself. I walk in on a Friday evening and the big heavy door closes behind me and all I see inside is all this pretty art hanging, as well as, the bright colors and decor. Super cute! Our server was so polite and very very informative about what specials there are , as well as, extremely personable. My date and I started off with the cheese quesas and it amazed my taste buds. So good! It was a meal in itself, so big! The masa was so crispy and cheesy! I've never had this before... like ever! I had no idea these were in existence. Game changer for sure. My date had the carne asada tacos, which so delicious (don't judge me bc I tried them too!). The meat wasn't chewy or small. I decided to have the gourmet tacos, which were a dogfish shark  taco (amazing), shrimp  and a flavorful Mexican mignon taco, de-f*%ckin-licious! All of the tacos were so delightful, but the mignon taco hit the spot. The meat was so tender and the chunks were so juicy. I can't stand when I go to a taco joint and their meat is so tiny and crispy. This by far took it to another level. Somebody's nana put their foot in this recipe for sure (not literal) lol. The house margaritas were great and my Paloma was huge! Bingo, bango, bongo! Total hit!!! Loved every bite. I ate so much, I swear I was going to burst. I just couldn't get enough. I'll be back!   Catch me on IG @Rezzilient to see more pictures and places I've been! Like and follow.

WOKyOC1_N6QzCH3TMoPN3Q.text: The taco selection is amazing! Sure, I'll wait in a long line on taco Tuesday just to get my hands on the mix & match deal served with rice and beans. You can also swap out one of the two and get two rice or two beans. They also have a salsa bar and additional items you can top on your tacos, etc. NOM! If you're coming on a weekday (during noon time), I'd suggest you to grab a menu a overlook it while you're in line because the menu is huge and it gives you second thoughts on what you're ordering. There's also a water dispenser with cups near the register when you're waiting in line.   Five stars because... - Tasty tacos. - HUGE menu. - Vegan/Gluten free options (the section is pretty big). - Friendly and excellent customer service. - Salsa bar was clean and filled.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata topped off with fruits and pecans. Delicious!

geYN3VX3OrpgxBdSNvxUlw.text: Our only stop for Mexican food while in Phoenix for a wedding...and La Santisima did NOT disappoint!!  Enter a warm and inviting restaurant with beautiful portraits of calaveras hanging on the walls. We were there for an early supper (about 5 pm on a Sunday night) and we were seated immediately. The restaurant did seem to fill up around us, and by the time we left it was probably half to 3/4 full...for good reason!  After being seated, our waitress brought us a bowl of fresh house-made tortilla chips and indicated the salsa bar along the wall. There were about umpteen different salsas to try, including both fresh and cooked favourites, such as pico de gallo (translated: rooster's comb :P) and salsa verde. I give the salsa mexicana 2 thumbs up; the cilantro salsa was mild and creamy - I didn't dig it quite as much.   Apparently everything is delicious in this restaurant, but tacos are their thing. I ordered the mix and match platter with the following tacos: the barbacoa, the Santisima specialty with mahi mahi  and the Marlin. The tacos were served with the most delicious rice (tasted as though it was cooked in a rich broth) and yummy refried beans sprinkled with melted cheese. OH AND - the plate is actually a large, square stone/ceramic plate about an inch or more thick...and it is HOT. It kept all of the food super toasty for the entire duration of our meal - which was a fabulous way to enjoy the last taco :)   The taco winner of the evening was the barbacoa - between the texture of the braised meat, the sauce and the homemade corn tortillas, this was by far my favourite. Rich and savoury and served in double corn tortillas... you can't really go wrong! The marlin was my second favourite, only because it was served in a fried corn tortilla and covered in sauteed onions...the filling of the taco was tasty enough but not a highlight. Finally, the specialty came in last, but I think it was only because I chose the mahi mahi - which was cooked through (not used to eating that particular fish cooked). I would certainly try it again with the chicken, shrimp or steak options that were available because the sauce and other filling components were delicious! It was only the texture or the cooked fish that threw me off...   All in all, La Santisima stands out as a fabulous choice for Mexican cuisine on all fronts: food, ambiance and service!

K0U-8ra5qIGp-uY-k9KbXw.text: Have been wanting to check this place out for a while and got to stop in last night. The host was very nice, despite being busy, and was even the one who brought out water and chips to us. After that, we didn't have anyone stop by the table for at least 25 minutes. Once our server finally came by, the experience was great! They have a really good salsa bar and lots of menu items that I've never seen before. We had their $3 negro modelo special, a shark taco, a marlin taco, and 2 chicken mole tacos...DELICIOUS! The atmosphere is nice too! All in all, it was a good experience and we'll be back!

This location is the original one, there's another in Glendale and apparently one in Flagstaff too... but I'll keep coming to this one. My margarita was also the bomb! Give em a try for sure!!

-6BKMWE7RtbUvLwc6kKePQ.text: La Santisima is my go-to for sit down Mexican. I love their tacos, and they have an incredible salsa bar with ~20 options. The horchata is a must try. My family has to eat here every time they visit!

BJq7vvzisHFmQRVXtHjBXQ.text: I'm going to rate 5 stars to La Santisima even though there are a couple things I'd like to point out. Food is delicious I like the combination of flavors they use. They have a salsa bar with many options to choose from in my opinion it needs a spicier salsa and I would remove maybe a couple. The waiter messed up our order and never brought a lime we asked for. At the end we got a complimentary fruit horchata which was really good. The place is a little bit too dark as other tables where using they phones to light up the menu in order to read their menu. Menu is a little confusing as well. Over all food wins and that's why they deserve the 5 stars for me.

CSgNX8TcASTVq4E_qLi5sQ.text: Lovely downtown restaurant Right off the I-10 Old school magic Love the atmosphere Single girl can walk in have a great Dinner Amazing margarita that was fresh And unique Chips and salsa bar Exceptional And the tacos Loved Had the poblano with raisins and beef!!! To die for))) And a barbacoa taco, Meat was tender and just the right amount of heat!!  I'll be back with the troops
