XRXdEihcK_YXDbKngZZVOw.text: This place is so badly managed it's almost unbelievable.  The dining room has literally, 36 lights.. 34 of which are burnt out and have never been replaced..  it's a simple matter of replacing GU 10 bulbs,  it's not trying to find the location of the Ark of the covenant.  Instead they opted for a clip on style flood light ..with extension cords running through peoples table .. when they turn the flood light on the blinding beam felt like we'd been spotted by border patrol crossing the US Mexican border at night.   Also here's a tip ...if you run out of guacamole every single day maybe you should make more guacamole in the beginning..just a thought..  That being said the tacos are tremendous!

MHY8qWXMrxaArBbOii5wXQ.text: Don't go if you're starving and need to eat right away cuz the service is really slooooooow.  They're nice, BUT SLOW.  Extensive menu and our food was delicious.  Waiting 10 minutes after you sit, 15 minutes to order, 20 minutes for food.  Did I mention they are SLOW and the food is delicious??

Y4rIBIXkkfnbjwr_PMMTFA.text: Best gourmet tacos in Phoenix.  Don't worry, even though the tacos are nice you don't need a tie to dig in!

RWsS9MQrOJC_zlpeM5a-Yw.text: I could have only eaten chips and all the salsas from the salsa bar and I would have been a happy camper. I wish I could have packed the salsa bar home with me, but unfortunately, it doesn't work like that. (TSA has a limit in liquid ratios).   I tried almost every salsa from the bar and I have to say, the best one is actually a combination. Mix the guacamole and peanut salsas together, and you instantly have salsa crack. I could have eaten tubs of the mixture and still wouldn't be sick if it. The heat of the guacamole salsa balances quite well with the umami of the peanut salsa.  Street tacos were good too but my mind was on the richness of the salsas. They should just change their name to Salsa Heaven.   Other than the salsas, please note the service was subpar and the prices on the menus and what they actually bill you is inconsistent, but only by a few cents so no point in arguing.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry margarita because they ran out of tamarindo

iVubuueimD_jsrGtll_C8w.text: Meh. This place came highly recommended, but it wasn't anything special. The food was okay and very overpriced for what you get. We ordered a three taco sampler plate,  and, while the presentation looked colorful and different, each taco tasted pretty much the same.  I will say, however, their guacamole is fantastic! With that said, it was $6 for a small bowl of it. Also, they have a nice selection of salsas at their salsa bar.   I give it two stars for the lackluster food and also the environment. There were flies in the restaurant competing with my every bite, and the women's bathroom was horrible. Everything was broken!  The toilet paper dispenser, paper towel dispenser, door lock, and even the toilet seat.    The restaurant was very busy for a Thursday afternoon at 2:00 so I may have hit them on an off day.

DZ-G8Kd5rYLz47k6z51n7Q.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant of all time. I've been coming here since they were the size of a 4x4 with the Mexican candy shop next door. I don't live in Arizona, but I visit fairly often and when I do, I eat here pretty much every single day, or as much as I can. The salsa bar is great, and their tacos are my absolute favorite. Sometimes the filet in the filet taco can be a little fatty and chewy, which I personally don't like, but usually it's good.

ubyn1rtilaawG98JVfHUOw.text: Food here is delicious and the drinks as well. My issue is when you call to try and place a pick up order; they ask you to hold but take forever or don't come back to the phone. I've been on hold for over 22 minutes to place an order for co-workers and myself. I would rate it higher if the phone orders weren't such an issue

T2RZ3bQAVmkNZVBase_Qkw.text: Horrible place to dine in. The decor was horrible. The seats were worn out. The food was mediocre. The horchata was lighter than most of the ones I've tried. It also had strawberries and cantaloupe in it that you can taste which is good.

y-KuibgbHmBT18htq5ohag.text: This is the best Mexican food in Phoenix.   Very tasty. I grew up in Tucson  where Mexican is great on every corner. The salsa bar is excellent. The chips were ok. I will return for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street tacos Tuesday 2.00 very good.

TWI26eWvJe6NA5FtJQDgPw.text: Everything positive I read about this place came True as I entered. Although service started out a little slow at first-I think I was just really hungry, the food was phenomenal. Their salsa bar was nothing short of awesome offering a wide variety of flavors and heat to appeal to anyone. The margarita.......pretty potent but delicious.  I ordered a variety of three soft tacos with rice and beans and sliced avocado. Pretty authentic. LOVED it!! If you love True Mexican meals, try this place. It looks like a hole in the wall from the exterior, but usually that's where you find the jeweled spots. Anyway, I cleaned my plate despite being very stuffed from the chips and salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

McHkAeTuEjnJh486p9lj4Q.text: Great food, great service and love the atmosphere! Our server was amazing with suggestions and he wasn't wrong, EVERYTHING was good! I was blown away! Love all the different salsas, their guacamole was phenomenal and don't even get me started on the Sonoran Burro! And always make it enchilada style, with the red sauce! I can't wait to go back!

bDDoYW4aQ78pFXsKBY5fBQ.text: La Santisima is my fav! Just be forewarned the service is really, really slow. But everyone is so nice and the food and drinks are incredible. I recommend the tampico marg and the salsa bar is delightful!

ybZ1l8yEmNYg2i87AxxKlQ.text: I've lived in Phoenix for 19 years and this place is hands down one of the best burrito/taco places around. The Al Pastor here is to die for. Full of flavor and cooked to perfection, you will never be disappointed that you tried it! The chicken tinga is also delicious. The huge salsa bar is very unique and a fun way to spend your time by trying out the different salsas before your food arrives.

pKwi8l3M1aZmN-zwYcSCnQ.text: One of my favorite taco shops in Phoenix, with a vast variety of salsas and menu items, new school and traditional tacos, and a deep-fried quesadilla. Yes, you read that correctly. Surely you'll have a heart-attack immediately after, but it's worth it. I almost think it's time for them to update locations, and get into something bigger since it's a nightmare to try and eat there around the lunch rush time, also its sort of rustic appearance doesn't quite match how good their food is. If it wasn't for recommendations from friends previously, it's the kind of place where you'd walk in, take a quick look, and walk out. Needless to say, don't allow that to deter you from exploring their menu, you surely wont' be dissatisfied.

0fSyYhILAthdtp0Lg5VCOw.text: I wanted to love this place. The chicken mole tacos are killer and the only reason they're getting two stars instead of one.   A confluence of negatives brought what should have been a five-star review down - fast.  1. Our waiter didn't have his heart in it.  He barely smiled, didn't share any pleasantries and was drier than toast.  No offer to refill water, to show us the dessert menu.  Just overall lacking in basic customer service skills.    2. When was the last time you went to a Mexican restaurant and didn't bring home a doggy bag?   The portions here are for a bride-to-be trying to lose weight before a wedding.  The shape of the rice was a 1/4 measuring cup.  The refried beans were about 2 tablespoons worth.  3. The wait for menus.  The wait to be acknowledged.  The wait for drinks.  The wait for the meal.  The wait for the check.  i wanted to belt out that tacky song: "Cuando, cuando, cuando?!?"  4. The temperature.  Lukewarm food is not cool.  It sat somewhere for some unknown reason.  I'd usually send it back but damn!  I thought I'd eat next week.  5. The outside at night.  What's up with the no lights?  We drove by the first time because we had no idea it was open.    6. The margaritas are creative but DAMN!  Inordinately expensive.  We are not on the Upper East SIde of Manhattan.  7.  The plates.  I guess they're reminiscent of Mexican pottery but they looked like they could contain lead.  No bueno.    The salsa bar is killer - they make their own unusual and tasty concoctions (pecan salsa?).  Quite lovely.    But they really need to step up their game and stop resting on the laurels of Diners, Drive Ins and Dives.

yZhlvWn1V5C3bNmsmMprNw.text: Super expensive and I specifically drove there to try their Chile en Nogada quesadilla and they had been out of the sauce three days earlier !!!  but never told me so when I called to ask if they had it that day. I tried their regular quesadilla which tasted so bland and the cheese had a plastic taste. WILL NOT COME BACK EVER,

BxxJZFXb55P8lEblygNnKQ.text: Best food  everrr and the place it is amazing...

ckZ8aOuhFl0EVAkGX0Xnpg.text: After seeing the great reviews on Check Please and DDD, I was excited to give this place a try but after our recent visit, my family and I will never come back to this restaurant.   1. The sign stated wait to be seated. We patiently waited about 10 minutes before a woman finally came up to us with a menu and told us to go cash register to place our order.   2. The tacos were nothing special and far from "gourmet." The salsa bar, however, had a wide variety of salsas, but not one was memorable.  The tacos were overpriced for what you get and there are definitely better tacos in the area and much less expensive. The rice was good so if you prefer rice over tacos, then this place is for you.  3. Lastly, the ladies room was filthy and visible from the main dining room. Not that we could see the door to the restroom while we ate but the door remained opened with the toilet clearly visible to my and other tables. Gross, yes but to make matters even worst, it appeared as if the restroom hadn't been cleaned in several days.   Very disappointed!  I truly hope this was a one off experience, however, I don't think I have it in me to try again after such a lackluster and frustrating experience.

lDI49neAcM-pQMa7z1AQZg.text: I came here for my Dads 50th bday. My parents had always told me they loved this spot but I thought it was okay. It has some really cool vintage features and i love the eclectic feel and the awesome mozaic statue out front. I just found it to be cramped inside. The service was disorganized and the food came out at different times for everyone. They also need some sound absorption inside its pretty loud. I hope it got better because it has great potential.

iwcjH4w7hjL9wUr9oARpyA.text: Small spot with beautiful original artwork hanging on the walls. Food was spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

55MAsN555WBNMglSIokayQ.text: I absolutely love the food here as I am an avid Mexican food enthusiast. Everything I've had here tastes delicious - from the tacos, burritos, tortas, and quesas (like a quesadilla but made with a fried corn tortilla) which are a must try! The only reason I didn't give a 5 star review is due to the mediocre service. It sometimes takes over 10 minutes to have someone come over and put your name in and the table service is average every time I've been. Nonetheless, I continue to come here regularly because the food is so tasty!

JBEnjRZ_Ttm4fJr20Br2Qg.text: This was my first time here. I will definitely be returning soon! The horchata was the best I've ever had. Not too sweet but comes in 32oz portions. The casadillas are insane! More like a deep fried calzone. Delicious. Gaucho Burrito was also incredible. 15 salsas to choose from. Parking a little tough but don't let it hold you back from visiting this gem.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa bar
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jXrgQwR9FJBbS2MfBuFllw.text: The food was delicious! I ordered a margarita, the Fundido dip with chorizo, and tacos. Flavors were delicious and the quality was great! The menu is slightly overwhelming (in a good way), but provides GF, Vegan, and Vegetarian options as well! The open salsa bar was great!

16qzT_RdYNeetkMOmW45PA.text: Tacos are authentic! Salsa bar is awesome. There can be a bit of a wait but when you get to your table they already have chips there waiting for you ! Burritos / burros are huge and they grill the tortilla, nice touch. Servers are awesome but a little short staffed. Try the tamarindo margarita!!

I4GoEkrFJXfRzwcmKyIqtg.text: Small restaurant, really good food. The Shark taco and Horchata are the best I've ever had. Don't care too much for the name of the restaurant (theme) or the dark artwork displayed. The food was worth me tolerating these images of the  SPIRIT of Death....he...he...

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shark and Marlin taco plate.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shark and Marlin tacos.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best horchata ever!

mIPPztz9fhPZItC_RpzlYw.text: A great little taco spot hidden in Phoenix. The pastor tacos have a nice hit of spice, which contrasts well with the sweetness of the pineapple. Prices are reasonable. This place is seriously small, we went on a Tuesday afternoon and it was empty, though I can see La Santisima filling up quickly during the evening. Our waitress was reserved, but not rude.  It's not in the best neighborhood, which is kind of sad, because there's an elementary school across the street, but I feel like the best eateries are usually in someplace sketchy. Often, you must venture outside your comfort zone to experience the sublime.  Also, I neglected to try the salsa bar, I was so memorized by the pastor tacos. I'll definitely return on my next trip to PHX.

6JDCPEYHK7Vq6tCNNSt_tA.text: This place prompted me to leave only my fifth Yelp review in like five years (shame on me, but oh well). The food was just SO good. I had the chicken mole burrito and it was about as close to "perfect" as it gets. They took the simple finishing step of grilling the burrito lightly, which gave it some crunch and made it taste like a non-fried chimichanga. Why don't more places do this?? The salsa bar had more options than I had time to test, but each one I sampled was delicious in its own way.  I wasn't expecting a full bar, but yep, they have one of those, too.  The atmosphere is better on the inside than you would think by looking at the outside. It's small though, so don't be surprised if there's a wait.  We will be back many times in the future!

XQKLU1U4LQ0WIDiuFUdpNQ.text: Great service. The best actually. I'm not familiar with Mexican food and the staff were very helpful and and polite. The staff, as well as the food made this eat out trip great.

HVtxg2LZkw1E0-HmjqxEAA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I miss the days when I used to live within walking distance and could really relish my time with the house margaritas.   I love their decoration and small dining rooms. It's cozy. Their salsa bar is just amazing, the mexicana salsa is my favorite, but they will have something for everyone.   You can't go wrong with anything on their menu. Dig in and grab a margarita!

G3litOuZtMjiG3_1MgABNw.text: I like the options of salsa, but the place was dirty. The table was dirty, the chairs were dirty and they have some type of fly clear along the edges of the windows. The service was okay, it took forever to get our food of tacos, which I do not understand the turnover time to make tacos. If their excuse for the wait is because its made from scratch, then this place is not the place to go for food. I gave it 2 stars because I feel this place might have been good at one point, they just needs clean house and retrain.

qO4Z5LE7RxC-NH1Ev0Ui4g.text: The food here is absolutely amazing! Our group had tacos and a quesa, with every single item being delicious. We had to wait a short time for a table, but even a long wait is so worth it. We loved their salsa bar too.

Mzp7yTZHmbzAw2U3WZ7zbQ.text: Listen. The only thing you need to know is this: the hype is real. The positive rave reviews are real. Just come here. It is out of this world.

aTVN_S1BbNd5Az-fUXZIxA.text: AL PASTOR, ALL DAY.  The biggest draw of this place is by far the salsa bar. Love all the green ones and the chipotle. Not the biggest fan of the peanut one, but to each their own! Eat the gaucho taco and absolutely the al pastor. The al pastor is a smaller street taco served in two corn tortillas but full on flavor. The meat is tender but with just the right amount of chew and the spices do a great job of cutting the richness of pork. Add a little jicama salsa for crunch and variation. Chips are good, they're thin enough you can eat several without getting too full. I love the rice-it has corn in it? I'm a textural person and it definitely adds a little character to rice.  I've seen people sipping on huge cups of horchata and that's definitely next on my list of things to try next time I'm back.

NHl5902UmnPJ1PPf6mx2TQ.text: Wanted to take my family to a authentic Mexican restaurant for tacos in downtown Phoenix and came across La Santisima. I like the decor with day of the dead theme (think Disney's Coco) and family like atmosphere. I ordered their Horcata and it is one of the best I ever had (had fruit in the drink as well). Prices are average if ordering tacos individually, I ordered 3 street tacos in a combo and it was under 10 dollars with rice and beans. I tried 3 different flavors and they were equally as good, their Carne Asada taco was on point. Even the plates were unique, like sand-carved style. Overall, the portion size was good, started off with complimentary chips and your choice of salsa from the salsa bar, it was a feel-good plate and experience.  Highly recommend if you visit the Phoenix area..

nVT_DP29i-SW4cMLUPSm3g.text: I'm not one to review very often, but this place is hands down my favorite restaurant I've ever been to in my life. I'm an arizona native and like to think I know a thing or two about Mexican food and this place has perfected it.  Must try: cochinita pibil taco   Their whole menu is great but that taco alone I could eat every day of the week.   Don't pass this place up!

BM6KCx2B4-Eg6UHNT_57Aw.text: If you have all the time in the world and love to be ignored by your server then go here.  Seriously, I've been to the Flagstaff location and hands down it deserves 5 stars. Phoenix location, not so much.  We expected a bit of a wait on a Friday night. What we didn't expect for a party of two after waiting 30 minutes in a half full restaurant was to finally get a table only to be ignored. It took another 40 minutes for someone to take our order. This was after the bar couldn't understand we wanted two drinks.  The food is good but not so good that you can't get equally good food along with good service elsewhere.  The cauliflower, peanut salsa taco is good. My second taco wasn't the right order. I waited some more. When the beer batter avocado taco arrived it was a bit bland. Good texture but not a lot of flavor. My boyfriend ordered the pork and pineapple burro. It didn't have any pineapple in it. Pork was minimal. It relied mostly on the filler of lettuce and onion.  Disappointing.

6fJAXskQ-i2dFgGOmU-ivw.text: Heard about this place from an out of towner believe it or not & had it bookmarked for ages (like 12+ months). Then the hubs & I saw a DDD review & being a mole freak fan had to come & try the Chicken Mole Taco. Boy freakin' howdy. The best mole I've had well since EVER. I sincerely loved it. The hubs got the fish burrito with Mahi Mahi & it was divine. The tortilla & fish were super fresh. The molie I want to take a bath in & eat my way out. Just amazing. We tried a mango margarita we shared. It was sweet but not the usual margarita mix sticky sweet grossness by any means. We loved the salsa bar too. So many salsa choices & not 14 varieties of green & red traditional salsa. FYI a chip refill is $2.40 but worth it. Very creative delicious salsas. Loved the entire experience. The place is small so it is a bit cramped as it you feel like you're sitting at a few tables at once & the whole restaurant has only 2 servers on a busy Saturday night. They seat you, take your order, refill your drinks, deliver your food, bring your check, they are the cashier & bus their own tables as well. So it's not like you're waiting because they're flirting with a busser or on FB behind the drink stand. They are BUSY! So be patient & kind. The food is worth the slowness. Now run & enjoy the taco deliciousness!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love Decor

tSE-BH4D1uUJcIwS2CjsJA.text: Always a line out of the door but the service is quick. Great tacos but you could head somewhere else for far less time. They have a salsa bar and good margaritas.

uU5cnquzbLJv9wggER4NcA.text: Not from around the area and came here based off of the string reviews. Pretty disappointed in the service and quality of food. The tacos were average at best and the drinks were all overpriced. Would not reccoment to others visiting AZ

_395mTI-porpWk8anMAGkQ.text: Based on Yelp we decided to try this place. I can't figure out how this place has 699 reviews and an average of 4.5 stars?? I am not sure what the hype is about!! Simply because Guy Fieri graced this place with his presence; I love him as much as the next person but that doesn't make this place entitled to 4.5 stars. Everyone else who rates it 1 or 2 stars nails it!! The atmosphere is down right disturbing, a twilight zone experience! I kept thinking the entire time "How does this place have 4.5 stars and 699 reviews?" "How?" "I just don't get it?" "Please explain, somebody explain it!!"  Service: They have the approach of we have an outstanding reputation and you can take it or leave it attitude.  Food: The salsa bar is unique in that there are a variety of combinations, some strange, peanut, some good, pecan, most have a good kick! But the salsa cups are so small you can barely dip your chip! I got the cheese quesadilla, just not my idea of good, at all! Looked beautiful but too much cheese and I LOVE cheese; cheese is one of my top two favorite foods! That should say a lot! I ordered a side of beans and rice and the beans were really good! That is why I gave two stars for the beans and beans alone!!!  Atmosphere: The tables are not level, extremely dirty, the chairs are upholstered and covered in stains and filth! I am not hard to please, I'd be up for a good hole in the wall joint, as long as you felt like it was clean and they cared about you being there! But this place is just down right weird! I love the other girl that said this place is schizophrenic! Pure craziness!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Variety of salsas
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beans and rice
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese quesadilla

vYwqL1GUBUjACddwhubWTQ.text: Holy $#!+!! Best tacos and margarita I have ever had... get the Cadillac, baby shark tacos and mariachi loco. Wow... wish I had this place near my home. #Legit

WbzYNDoPScY2PTQ4evqyuw.text: Customer service sucks!!! Waited 15mins just to get the menu. Food is good tho

mffImODUtuVHl-8BycHcqQ.text: This place was awesome.  From their website:   Our aim is to deliver everything that is exciting and fresh about Mexican cuisine to the people of Arizona, banishing old perceptions of heavy, greasy, taste bud-searing, so-called "Tex-Mex."  And they nailed it.  There were 13 different salsas when we went, and all differing with heat and ingredients.  Not a traditional place.  Be aware: there's not too many tables, and waiting seems to be expected by patrons.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The salsa bar.

ruFpb8PeGNTYq3O_Ow3dnQ.text: Best salsa bar in Phoenix Amazing tacos Always a wait in the evenings and you can't even order drinks at the bar while you wait which kind of sucks.

Uoj3oKJzXVxemCbc1kHMmQ.text: Great place, not fancy but good food and awesome drinks. Can't beat $3 margaritas during happy hour. Waiter was funny & friendly. I will bring friends to enjoy this place. Prices on food are decent.

thNgiNplt82u_ckIlmG0lw.text: Food was delicious, portions were better then expected and the food was high quality. We had the Shrimp and Carne Asada Tacos w Rice and Beans. I cant wait to go back and try other plates. The horchata was also amazing, different then the normal but very good!

Y__8A6XL7_VqXPlsNbywJg.text: We spent a few days in Scottsdale a week ago . We ate at few restaurants that were recommended in Scottsdale and we were not happy with them at all . Our last day in Arizona I went on a search myself and found this little gem . I had the tacos Sonora . My husband had the 3 kinds of tacos . It all was very delicious !! We loved all the Salas's they had .   You need to go off the beaten path to have good food and I totally recommend this restaurant.   The service was also good!

sMr0bn_sbub87tDIQW3lng.text: A wonderful salsa bar with more than ten different kinds of salsa. I was seated and given a basket of chips but I had no clue where the salsa was till I saw people queuing at the backside of the room. I had ordered tacos and they came out delicious wit the sides. The food is good but the service sucks. The place gets very crowded in the evening even on non weekends so need to plan ahead if you are going with a big group. 5 stars for the excellent food and the salsa spread, will visit again if I'm in phoenix

7ZQRRlqCBtK7u_zGL-lWPA.text: The guacamole and the salsa bar are enough to make you happy. The tacos were hit and miss.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa bar

iTFfpK0asJOdFdz9OLx_uA.text: Between the friendly atmosphere, the cost seating, and the to die for tacos - this place is truly five stars. You would be lost in Phoenix without their salsa bar. I absolutely recommend making your way to this taco haven.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We shared the shark, shrimp, carnitas, and steak tacos. So amazing, would definitely be a regular if I lived close by.

TiaUqexyXG-JGipyAGY55A.text: Great spot!!! Artwork was amazing the bartender was so fun!!!!! Local hanging out .....the food was bomb diggity i had the carne asada plate wow! The margs off the chart ! Kudos guys welcome to the neighborhood!!!!

tOK-5NhgAe-0agt_DKoy6w.text: Food is amazing I recommend the tiger shrimp tacos or the arrachera tacos. Salsa Bar is amazing. It's small and there is a wait but there's a reason why. It was worth the wait.

7X3uu6qzh4SAl4QQxtbTGA.text: Best Hispanic food in phoenix by far. Service is on point. Although there is this one male server that always seems to be in a bad mood. Owner is always nice though. Wide variety of sauces. Chips server before dinner was delicious.

8H1FW2PMoiPQfiQpO_386Q.text: Spicy and amazing food! Kinda want to keep this one secret, yes it a place you def don't want to turn into a tourist joint. Also the name has changed on the exterior signs.

V7nkLqHCIgefZX0XzSl4ig.text: The food was Awesome! I'd definitely come back. We sampled about 3/4 of the salsas on the complimentary salsa bar and they were all excellent, the chipotle salsa being my favorite. My burro was also excellent and very filling! Service was mediocre. I needed to ask for a refill on a fountain soda and the server forgot our order of chips to go with all of our salsas. He did eventually get us our chips and soda and made it right, so I felt satisfied when it was all said and done. Adding one more server would do wonders.

NBKyALlVyV5GvSrroibQfg.text: "Oh wow, what did I get myself into?" was all I thought as I pulled up to La Condesa.  I'm not familiar with Phoenix or the surrounding neighborhoods, so I was a little taken aback at first.  The business looks like an old house, as most of the businesses in the area do, i noticed lots of bars on the windows, and the majority of the business signs in the area were in Spanish.  THE ONLY reason I noticed this is because I'm unfamiliar with Phoenix and was traveling alone.  First impression, the restaurant is tiny! I would say that at capacity, the restaurant is pretty loud and I had a difficult time hearing my server. The tables were very close together, all the chairs were mismatched, and the lighting was really dim.  It was very difficult to get to the back of the restaurant where they put the salsa bar.    The house margaritas were made with fresh grapefruit and lime, and that was perfect for me. Unfortunately, the food wasn't as good.  I had the shrimp burro, and it was really sloppy.  It melted out of the sleeve and fell apart while I was trying to eat it.  Plus, some of the tails were left on the shrimp... let me tell you about shocking!  The service was sub-par, in my opinion.  My server was inattentive and didn't ask how my food was.  I had to flag down the server like an air traffic controller in order to get my bill, and it took a while to get my bill back.    This one is not a revisit for me.

jNFUIKiju_GA5_sTvpxojg.text: I used to come here when most people wouldn't venture this far down 16th. Now you can expect an hour wait on the weekend. It is well written it, though.  I rec the Gandhi taco on corn tortilla, with addition of fried oaxaca cheese. Obviously not vegan anymore, but yum!!

XGpWTk4I4R5Co9cqdg9g_w.text: It's small and cramped inside,  but the food is great. The tacos are huge and delicious. Also,  the quesadillas are gigantic,  easily shared by two people. And of course the salsa bar is the best in the valley.

3lJCBXxL25d7f62EoD3ULQ.text: I like this place... there are a lot of interesting salsas to taste and the people were very friendly. However, the meat taco I had (it was recommended) was dry and not very flavorful. The vegetarian one was pretty great though- both could have used more spice. All in all- the location is cool and small- I like that it is unique for Phoenix, and I would definitely come back if I was in the area- I just wish their food was a little more spicy.

ZpBlCttaXGop9pmRB_fp1A.text: Fantastic, everything on the menu is great and the decor is very nice. Lots of salsas to choose from.

b8DQ3BJ10VHbcBkd6dIBnQ.text: My new "Comfort Food" favorite! If you like varying the taste of your favorite dishes this is your place! Light up your palette with multiple savory salsas and match them up to a plethora of uniquely prepared gourmet tacos, burritos, and quesadillas.  I had the Mayan Conchinita Pibil Quesadilla, which is pure decadence all by itself. However, I paired a few bites with their fresh guacamole and one of the kickin salsas.  (Something with Cabo in the name, or the other one that looked very similar). While the presentation was beautiful, I started to break through the paper lining the basket. That grosed me out a little, but by then I was full and bagged the rest for later.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mayan Conchinita Pibil Quesadilla. Holy Decadence!

JErJn_nuKXPrLAFQr2S2iw.text: I've had some delicious Mexican food here in Phoenix.  But this place trumps all.  A stocked salsa bar, delicious fish tacos.  Seriously, what isn't good here?  I'm going to keep going here and trying a different menu item every time just to see if something is subpar here.  I'll put my savings on it that there isn't a single thing that isn't good here.  I'd probably go here just for the chips and salsa if Mexican food isn't your thing, but your coworker or spouse or some guy or girl you're going on a date with insists on La Santisima.  Just go.  No excuses.  Nothing.  And order the chips and salsa.  Try every salsa.  I don't care how strange pecan salsa or strawberry salsa sounds...trust me, it won't disappoint.

a9Ulr_I69p0aN90xYzQwSg.text: Have only been there once but we were impressed. The flavors were rich and delicious and the dishes unique. Looking forward to trying it again!

bsP7mpCxO6cmC5lEfl-ZWA.text: LOVE the food here and the atmosphere is quaint and authentic with great artwork.  Plan on being there a while- I think they have such an eclectic menu preparation time is long (no matter which location you go to).  The food and margaritas are well worth the wait though.

yphB3KXnkE9tQOI7GlSlHw.text: Great food all around. I usually get the Fundido, Argentine quesa, or any of the tacos. After that load up on the crazy salsa choices.

CVvsYU5DvYN7TYp4W4rO7Q.text: It's a good local Mexican restaurant. Good server and lots choices of salsa. We'll come back if we visit Phoenix again..

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ebEaKquh7ofVKdS8NNRn9w.text: Okay, so I literally live a few blocks away from this place. There are so many Mexican options in the area, but I knew this was one we had to try.   First of all, the place is tiny inside. We had a 15 minute wait on a Sunday afternoon which was a little annoying, but also proved that they aren't lacking in business. The worst part is that there is literally no where to stand. So we kind of tucked our bodies into a corner and tried to stay out of the way. That was kind of awkward. I was surprised that this was a sit-down restaurant. I was really expecting an order-at-the-counter type of place. In fact, I still think that would've probably worked better.   Once we got our table, we were brought a complimentary basket of chips and a tall bottle of water to fill our own cups with. I like that the chips are free (especially since they have all the delicious salsa options), but I was disappointed that you get charged for chips after the first basket. We ordered the guacamole to go with all the salsas and were pleasantly surprised. My husband makes guac at our house all the time and I'm a bit partial to his, so I was excited to try such a refreshing, different take on guacamole. Pretty tasty!   For our main course, I ordered the veggie quesadilla and my man ordered the bean and cheese burrito. Both were delicious! I have to admit that I wasn't a fan of the fact that the quesadillas are fried, but the amazing cheese made up for it. I was worried that I wouldn't have enough cheese with all the veggies they stuffed inside, but I was so very wrong. I seriously could not get enough of that cheese! I am craving more right now...  I guess one of the downsides to this little place is the fact that it is so packed inside. We literally were just a few inches away from the table next to us (and the guy nextdoor was so annoying!). They also only had two servers scurrying between all the tables so the service was not the greatest. We had to wait awhile for drink refills and the check which was a little disappointing. The food does come out quickly though so if you're hungry, you wont be kept waiting.   So yes, I was quite pleased with our first visit to La Condesa. We will be back.

mV4F0dhZLoa3fCUyVMJrOA.text: Have I really not reviewed this place?! I've been coming here for years & just love it. Their salsa bar is bomb.com...you must try the pecan one! It's sweet, unexpected, and has a good kick. Quesas are wonderful. Try a taco protein style. You can thank me later...

wDQ6WURIumne3DgiNzb8MA.text: After Dos Molinas (food is spicier) this is my second favorite Mexican Food place. Lots of variety.  I have only had real mole at two places, unfortunately, their version did not grab my taste buds (probably why there is your favorite potato salad (in my case my mom's) and everything pales in comparison). I avoid lines, by eating early say around 3pm.

5J1xe1eLaCs2iX5cyLQV1g.text: Wow! What a great surprise, You can definitely taste the quality in the food! Great selection of salsa and the menu has a variety for all. The good isn't over done to the point where you can't finish your plate. I will most definitely be coming back here.

-rJ42nF2YSCuPBz6m8pDqA.text: La Santisima is hands down the best Mexican restaurant that I've ever been to!  The salsa variety is out of this world.  Our office eats out on Friday's & I'm always taking new people that agree the food is awesome.  Get there right when they open at 11 am for lunch because there's less than a dozen tables.  The prices are exceptional for the quality of food & portion size.  Very authentic food!  Highly recommended.

8QE5viHvfQ3UswNTakAiFA.text: I've been to La Santisima twice, and it's definitely one of my favorite Mexican places ever already. It was what changed me from being someone who didn't like Mexican (though I grew up where the only Mexican was Plaza Azteca-level Mexican) to someone who loves it and is excited to try more!  PROS: - The salsa bar: Great flavors and variety! My favorite was the Mexicana, but mixing the pecan with the jicama was also divine. We accidentally tried the strawberry salsa (it was unlabeled when we went, and we thought it would be spicy), but it was also surprisingly delicious! - The food: I ordered the taco plate both times. I arrived starving and left stuffed beyond measure with a to-go box in hand (and I eat a lot.) I ordered the Cabo shrimp taco and the Pacific white fish tacos on separate occasions, and they were both fried perfectly, without being too fishy (which I like). I loved their chicharrones taco, but my boyfriend (who doesn't have general sentimental, warm and fuzzy feelings towards chicharrones like I do) found it a little tough. I can't currently remember the names of the other tacos I got, but they were all phenomenal. I've also heard great things about the burros. Just thinking about it makes me hungry again.    CONS: - The service: I'm not sure what about the service makes it so slow; the first time I went, it was packed, and understandably, service was slow. But yesterday, I went and there were probably 15 tables open, two groups ahead of us, and it took about 20 minutes for us to get seated, with no explanation for why we weren't being seated. Additionally, someone at my table ordered a bottle of wine and it took them about 10 minutes to come back and say "Sorry, we don't have that. Would you like something else?"  Tl;dr: If you have time to kill and good company, definitely worth going to. If you care about service quality and speed, maybe not.

YEcuO3HnD5anEQZ8x3qsjQ.text: If you can get seated next to the salsa bar, then SCORE!! Lol.  So many tasty salsa's to choose from.  Try them all!!!!!!! The veggie tacos are delicious!  I love the peanut salsa and cilantro salsa.   A new favorite is to mix the jicama salsa with the cilantro salsa. Sooo good.  My go to is the bullet burrito.  I love me a good bean burrito.  The house margarita is big, fresh squeezed, and swimming with citrus pieces to nibble on.  It is so delicious!  My favorite menu item is the quesa!! The Smoked Marlin, and the veggie quesas are loaded with flavor! Oh, and try the guacamole! They put cranberries and jicama in it.  I hope you'll love it as much as I do.   :)

Iap1bPouOa5Rw9OyDsDvtA.text: Food if excellent; unique and yet authentic flavored. It's all oversized burritos and quesadillas (corn masa and fried, excellent!) as well as many variety of tacos. Well worth the $, and the margaritas are excellent to match with some unique offerings. The  tamarind is a good one.

KSdX9IlEmn5STMkw2zXr6Q.text: La Santisima is a great option for legit Mexican in Phoenix. The food itself is 5 stars; the only thing preventing a perfect 5/5 was the service. The waitresses were very friendly and by no means provided poor service, but definitely left some to be desired with only a 2-3 total pit stops to the table. In all fairness, it's a bit "divey," so it's part of the experience.   This originally caught our eye as it was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives, as well as great reviews. The selling point and highlight of our visit was the salsa bar. I consider myself a salsa pro (I refuse to buy jarred salsa, I'll only make my own), so it was fun to sample 15+ varieties. Pro tip: only the first basket of chips is free. Additional baskets are $2.40/each.   Our tacos and burro were great themselves, but did need some pizazz from the salsa bar, perhaps by design? After we doctored them up a bit, we wiped our plates clean. The tortillas were especially delicious. Value was also great. With water to drink, our total after tax was less than $20. Overall, I would recommend La Santisima!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome entrance!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gandhi Vegan Taco/Veggie Taco plate in forefront with Sonora Carne Asada Burro in background. Salsas everywhere in between.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Help yourself to the many varieties of salsas at the salsa bar. Our personal favorite was cleverly-named Salsa Mexicano.

H_L2PaCPwGYYX5Gaoms2Sw.text: Love how their menu basically blasts TexMex as giving Mexican food a bad representation. Now this is authentic Mexican food. Not some heavy just because we're Americans portion.   Ordered a lonches. Because they wanted to be different from a torta. But even in the mindset of what a standard torta is, these lonches are WAY BETTER. Bread sustains itself to the fillings (instead of falling apart or soaking up stuff like a torta bread does. Ordered shark. So that was different. There was a freshness to it due to a cucumber to give it a nice crispness to each bite. Brother ordered the al pastor lonche and he thoroughly enjoyed it as well. Girlfriend ordered the mole quesadilla. And yes yes yes! Delivered on the multiple layers of spices within the mole. Man, have I always only had flat moles (such a sad fact). Now, I can imagine not being able to order mole from anywhere else ever again! Eeeek! But do give it a try. Oh, and this quesadilla looked more like a dessert. But nope. A nice balance between the spices of the mole, meat (chicken), and cotija cheese that's sprinkled over it.   Also tried their horchata. Once again, flavors up the Ying-yang! Theirs nuts, melons, freshly mashed strawberries. So definitely not your typical Americanized Mexican restaurant.   Tip: don't park in the front. It's extremely difficult to back out into the busy traffic street. Especially if you're alone. Somewhat more doable if you have someone standing outside the car giving your a thumbs up.  Remember: food adventures are out there. So eat 'em up!

bS602PsjZ-kopwPRhjvWSA.text: This restaurant was recommended and I'm glad we checked it out! Variations on traditional faves and new offerings I've never heard of. So many choices we'll be back for sure. The tacos were melt in your mouth, I could have had a dozen. Salsa bar has unique flavors and everything was delicious. Could have been 5 stars but service was great, but painfully slow.

COjGy5M-c5I83QTxU7aMpw.text: Don't be scared and it's sketchy location! This taco house is one of the best salsa bar is I have ever had. The food is excellent. Ingredients are fresh. I came here for anniversary dinner with my wife on Cinco de Mayo. We had a great time!

JvbKjHLFPGfS3DeuMrZ2Tg.text: I can not say enough good things about this restaurant. If you come for no other reason you have to visit the salsa bar. There are no less then 20 different salsas. My favorites are the pecan (yes PECAN), cilantro, chopped chilies with garlic and the jicama. They say the first bowl of chips is complimentary, but I have never been charged for additional chips. There are so many delicious choices on this menu, and there really hadn't been an order I have regretted. I always come back to the chorizo fundido and the veggie quesa with extra cheese. I have tried about every quesa option at this point and the meat in this quesa, while optional, detracts rather then adds to the flavor. The chorizo in the appetizer more then hits my carnivore button. I would also highly recommend the tamarind margarita, with its tangy tamarind fruit muddled into the drink and the chili salt rim, you can't go wrong. On the way out you have to order a horchata to go. With its fresh strawberries and chopped walnuts it is unlike any horchata you have ever tried. You may be tempted to get one with your meal, but that would be a mistake. This drink is so complex and delicious it needs to be sipped and savored. The spices, flavors and textures of the food needs only ice water and a single shared bottle of Coca-Cola to complete the experience. They don't offer dessert, so take the horchata to go. You won't be sorry! I would also like to add that apart from the burritos all the menu items are gluten free. You need only stipulate corn tortillas when ordering things like fundito or as a side to the soup.

iBMKr12Zk2ffHDz4KUEi7w.text: Intimidating menu but great great tacos, so you can't go wrong with the street taco section if not sure where to start. Huge variety of salsas to try, making eat bite unique and keeps you coming back forever to try new combinations.   Pricing is good on the street tacos, the specialty tacos are a bit of a stretch, but still a better deal than touristy "gourmet cantina" places.  Order at the counter and they bring it out to you pretty quickly, very small dining room for how many people come here. Parking is pretty nonexistent. But the food and friendly ordering makes it all worth it!

YMi20JRWRCDVyAxrQCTwFA.text: Yes! Yes! Yes! .... I've been here a few times now and every single time I come I ask myself "now why don't I come here more often?" I do live close by, but then their long line reminds me why lol.   This place is so freaking delicious! First of all their beans are perfection. And their salsa bar is like its own tasting station lol.   I've had their bullet burrito, azteca Tinga burrito, shark tacos, shrimp burrito, quesas, guacamole, and their veggie burrito. Everything was great I have no complains.   If you love horchata you have to try theirs. I promise you will love it! I can go in there for just that a bullet burrito and chips with salsa. LITERALLY.    It is a very small place so I wouldn't suggest coming during lunch/dinner hours. You will just stand there looking at everyone enjoy their food thinking to yourself "ok can you please hurry and swallow your meal, because it's my turn to sit and swallow mine". Lol  I usually come here before busy lunch hours and dinner hours so I can get a table asap.   Customer service is always great. Their menu is to the point, my kind of menu!

35IH-bY3fF2zesnMyZGRBQ.text: I had lived in Phoenix my whole life and had never been here until recently.  My first visit was a great experience and I highly recommend the shark tacos and horchata. Parking isn't always easy, but it's definitely worth the trip.

SElBRt6-ZvmGbiorVjaE-g.text: Question: Living in the vast sea of Arizona taco shops, how does one stand out?  Answer: Just do whatever these people are doing.  From scanning the menu, it seems like the concept here is La Santisima wants to give every regional tradition of Mexican cuisine its chance to shine through a specialty taco. They absolutely knock that goal out the park.  I wish I had 4 stomaches so I could have sampled everything. What I did get though has given me reason to go back again and again to accomplish that goal.   Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco - bomb  Cabo Shrimp Taco - Bomb.  Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco- BOMB! (please order this for yourself)  Excited to try more when I get the shot.

78o8xa2DgbEktIbfculjxg.text: Whenever we travel anywhere I use the "TV Foods" app and then cross check places on Yelp to find great places to eat. Well, this place was awesome!!! It's a small neighborhood like place with great food. They have a salsa bar with about 20 kinds to try. My favorites were the mango/strawberry one and a orange colored pecan one (had a nice kick). My wife and I both got gourmet tacos. I can't remember what all ones I had but all were great. Favorite was the battered shrimp one (top left option on that page of menu). The Horchata was the best one I've ever had (so said many others on their reviews). Had real fruit and pecans in it. Must go to this place!!!! We will go again.

8kr_Q_31p8oeV9YDVBDJdA.text: The food was excellent. Whatever you do plan on ordering a Cabo shrimp taco. Trust me.  Update - second time back had the Baja Shark Taco and the traditional quesa.   You can't go wrong with anything here but I would highly recommend everything I've mentioned so far.  And the service was much better this time, came on a Saturday.

ctDpLWVlGEMGoNYbdFctJA.text: We stopped here about 11am Saturday for breakfast after flying in, it was delicious and the service was great!!

gDinDlad4q4X0tfCKnCXlg.text: Unbelievable food, friendly and helpful staff, great vegan options. This place seems to get packed so plan ahead but I think it's well worth the wait.

scIA2qd0XMY3s7TZcnxCdg.text: One of my favorite Mexican food restaurants in the valley! I have been here a handful of times and always bring my guests from out of town! Love the salsa bar and they have great vegetarian options! Great atmosphere and a great location just north of downtown!

1L_0T4texTwuHn2KPGj7yA.text: Their tacos did not disappoint! I had their mahi al pastor, chimichurri steak, and chicken mole tacos. The chimichurri steak was just whatever but the mahi al pastor was really flavorful. Their black mole was silky rich and I appreciated the pickled onions that came with it to brighten the flavors. They had a spicy avocado salsa with a real kick and you really can't knock the huge basket of fresh chips you get while you're waiting! Can't wait to come back and try more tacos!

XOaqw6hcU7g7T_C1dSETLQ.text: No matter what you get, you're going to love it. Everything is so flavorful and with all the salsa choices, every bite can be different.

a0g2SjprfaFHl41m92hZGA.text: Went to dinner, the salsa bar was bad and dirty,food and service sucked over priced tacos. the only thing good out of this place is the picture.

8-8od5Jhho9DcL345L1EIg.text: As always, GREAT FOOD AND MARGARITAS. But service was the absolute worst. We received our margs after our tacos (which took 50 min) and they still charged us. Server didn't even apologize. Sucks to leave so disappointed from a favorite restaurant.

R27F_epnnbLddxYJAN0hBA.text: FINALLY!!!!!   I moved to PHX about 6 months ago. Obviously, I expected to find lots of great Mexican places. So, on a Friday afternoon I had some extra time and a strong craving for Mexican. When I found out Guy from DDD had paid this place a visit, I had to give it a whirl.  First - it is TINY! I actually drove right past it the first time. The service was top notch with my waitress guiding me thru the menu. Unfortunately, at the time I am *starving* so looking at all the possibilities and making a decision is practically impossible.  About that time, the waitress walks past me with a quesadilla... It was love at first sight!!!!! And again at first bite!!! I went with the pork shoulder with pineapple. The thing about these quesadillas - think a Mexican version of a calzone! Which is basically pure magic. I can usually put down some serious food - I could barely finish 1/2 of the quesadilla.   Based upon the reviews, I had to order the Horcheta. WOW! They were not exaggerating about the size. It was a steal for $4.   My only regret was that I only had room for the Horcheta for desert. I saw another table with what i assumed was tres leeche cake - it looked delicious!!!! Next time perhaps.  This is my current place to beat for Mexican. 1000X's better than The Mission... Especially considering dinner for 4 at The Mission was $100+.... Here it would have been maybe $50.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Guac was a pleasant surprise!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork shoulder, pineapple, just AMAZING!!!!!

VUDV6QXmoR60uF3DOW93ng.text: Bomb.com You're missing out if you don't eat here. Best taco I've had. Big portions and to die for salsa bar. I still think about these tacos, would definitely come back here if I'm back in the area.

YQJ3Coi6efKkt88Byw8Dbw.text: I've held off on writing this review because I knew that to sit down, revisit my visit in my head, and dream of the flavors would hurt my heart. There is NO Mexican food in Hawaii. I repeat, there is NO Mexican food in Hawaii. Don't let anyone fool you...there is NO Mexican food in Hawaii. See, now my heart is already aching.   It was 10:20 PM on a Saturday night when I touched down in Phoenix. Somehow, I made it out of the airport before 11 PM and that is how my journey to La Santisima began...  Hurry up, catch a Taxi, and Yelp the nearest, best Mexican food that is still open! BOOM, La Santisima!   Arrive to La Santisima with my colleague at 10:58 PM. Okay, I know it's fucked up. Let's be real. This is the nightmare for anyone working in any kind of customer service. "Oh you want help right when I am in the middle of ending my day? No really, ENDING my day in 2 minutes. Please get the hell away from me."   We knew we were taking a chance, we knew they might not seat us, or even let us order food to go. We walked in, with our luggages, and we saw the jaws drop. "Yes, hi...we just got off a 7 hour flight and we are very hungry. Can you help us?"   We see that half the tables are already stacked up but after a sigh, they seat us. Mind you, there was another couple in there WAITING for the rest of their food. Praise Jesus, hallelujah!   The menus were handed to us promptly and in the same motion, we apologized for coming in so late. The very nice man, I think the owner or at the very least, the manager, said not to worry and that the kitchen wasn't done being put away so take a moment.   Right away, my eyes fell onto the word "Cabo." What can I say? My last trip to Mexico was very good to me. Cabo Tacos it was! My colleague ordered 3 different tacos and we both ordered the horchata.   Now, this is where you may say that we were so damn hungry and that saying this was the BEST Mexican food we have EVER had is an overstatement but no, it's not. We both lived in California previously and we are both well-traveled. This was the bombest of the bomb. Is that a phrase? Better than any food I had my whole time in Cabo, too.   The Cabo Tacos were fried lightly, fresh, and piping hot. The slaw was perfectly crispy and cool. The tortillas were soft. The rice...oh my god...the rice...If Heaven is just clouds of this rice...I'm down with it.   The salsa bar didn't have as many options left at 11 PM, understandably so, but what was left, was great. There was a peanut sauce and radish sauce that still stick out in my head. I wish I could have had them both bottled up and shipped to me.   Anyways, WHAT NICE FREAKING PEOPLE. They let us sit down at 10:58 PM and happily served us food, waited to clean the salsa bar until they saw we didn't need/want anymore, and gave us the biggest freaking horchatas in a to-go cup. The horchata had a bunch of fruit in it. I've never seen it or tasted it like that before. Magic. Better than tequila. That's a bold statement coming from me...  I love you chef, bus boy, and boss man. I love you and I miss you and I love you and I miss your food.

qR9egz-ZT8-klcgweRpEzg.text: Good tacos not the best I've ever had. Then again I'm spoiled living in California. Margarita was also too sweet for me. Good way to kill two hours during a layover at phx.

k8D9HJXkF-BfHu9tZiRZKQ.text: Wow what a disappointment here. The rice was Day and the chicken tocos we're not tasty at all. You also have to get your own salsa. I would totally pass and go to another place close by.

vfCHdxZ-yZtfucDt-SCVvg.text: Food was decent, salsa bar was grate! But let's face it folks, this place is a dump. The bathrooms were disgusting. Smells like methane gas, giant holes exposing past plumbing problems and no way to dry your hands. The wife said the woman's bathrooms were the same. The service wasn't the best and the kitchen was quite filthy.  Overpriced food, warm beer ( which they ran out of), $9.99 for salsa to go, but they had no containers. Woke up the next morning with severe diarrhea!!

pd24d4qTLJsa5e2hcJREKg.text: Sorry, Phoenix location...after all was weighed out and a huge discussion...Glendale puts the boot on and knows what to do with it. I think this one converted most of that boot into real estate for Mother Goose. UGH...the parking is terr-id, the food is above phenomenal and the service sucks....what to do. Geez, I mean I HATE to do this to such a quality food place but everything was so frustrating about this morning. We pull up, no parking...end up putting my boyfriends MLC car on the street...gasp, its next to a homeless pretty sure 2 brain celled and sucking on Tide Pods dilapidated shirtless, shoeless walk of life. No good. The service, seriously I can't say much because  it did not exist. I actually got up and went to bar to locate how we were going to wet our whistle...the salsa is beyond the best, the meat, the marinades and the quality is above and beyond the absolute best! Best pibil I have ever enjoyed and the tinga is amazing...seriously GLENDALE, GO.  I just hate the parking, lack of service and the cramped restaurant with a bar that has no bar stools and ...oh wait I got it!!! the server and the parking spaces are the same...they don't exist....damn.

NrBf3HeFs6c_ZdVp2PJvcQ.text: This place has gone done hill, and their prices are ridiculous now. Today is the last time I think I'll be patronizing this joint. I'll miss their amazing salsas, but not the dirty tables and floors, or or the really loud music, or the slow service or the ridiculously overpriced food items. Too many choices when it comes to yummy Mexican food in this town, and this place got a little too big for their britches IMHO. You gotta try harder people! I hate when places get popular like this, and decide it's cool to gauge people and not put their best foot forward.

xOqG0xyXgM0-43-S0qvd9g.text: Best street tacos. Salsa Bar is full of variety. I could tell everything was fresh. My New Mexican spot for sure

LVXUsx5Lng1n3YBwQLQ92w.text: I had a whole hearty meal. It wasn't heavy which I loved. It was nothing out of the ordinary but I did like the quality of the ingredients used. I probably wouldn't attend again.  The customer service was not that great and our drinks were never refilled. The 3 star is pretty generous of me.

4DOH9vZO5U758f2g5kGZvQ.text: Had really fantastic tacos at lunch today. The Cochinita Pibil was note perfect, and the Marlin brought me back to Mazatlan. Salsa bar is tremendous as well, my favorites were the strawberry, the pecan, and the chipotle. Get there early for Lunch!

M_5BeL-lvIIjOhFcplcwcg.text: Food was delicious. Margaritas BLAH!!! Definitely will go for food and then venture somewhere else for cocktails!!

AUI5hc4axjNz9GDD2mqarw.text: Their quesadillas and shrimp tacos were amazing!  The horchata was almost like a fruit cocktail...very different, but still delicious.

5WuerDlxo9hVIcHNDZ-rXQ.text: Food is good but service is HORRIBLE!! Slowest greeters and servers ever! One hour wait from seated to food on table. Good thing they were not busy because it would most likely have been 2 hours! Asked for an Horchata 20 minutes and still nothing. Had to get up and go ask for it. I won't be back such a turn off to have bad service. If no stars possible I would have selected that.

arNEbwQiw1xShI076IHXXw.text: So good. It was my first time and I didn't realize you get chips on your table and the have a very interesting salsa bar. I went for the mole, and I was not disappointed! So good. They have a good vegetarian selection too. I also tried their family recipe barbaquoa and their pork tacos. They were good too. But next time I'm just getting the mole tacos and chip. I should also mention their beans were really good too.

2yVcWqslv91Dc3jfXub9sQ.text: Overrated  Overpriced  Long waits  Very small location  Jam-packed Elbow to elbow tables

eWmDSSFxeZTsdifUIyveYA.text: This place is fantastic. Great salsa options and it's nice to have good tasting vegetarian options. The staff was friendly and the overall vibe is great.

B8aGpHq8955U1PWoMsI2UQ.text: Well this place is stinkin delicious.  The service is a bit slow, and the restaurant is not that big, so expect a crowd- but the fresh food definitely makes up for anything the former was lacking.  We enjoyed the specialty burrito with steak, and it was mouth wateringly good!  The salsa bar is a nice touch, and everything tastes really fresh and well made.  I'll be sure to stop again when I'm in the area!

zUPhRCFhZEOdCS-BbU9JAw.text: Great food. Loved my tacos. Salsa was great. Alot to choose from...  Great michelada.  Service and decor is weak

S6ubzB18B7hO2q8pQWeAFA.text: I spent only a few hours in Phoenix waiting for a flight and came here for a quick dinner. I will never forget this place... Great tacos and the salsa bar was really fun. Tried all sorts of salsas I'd never had before. Some interesting nut ones

9mmVOdC_bl8sUv_IYshe0A.text: Great local place.  The food is amazing, but the service was only ok.  Great place to go with friends, but this would not be my first date location.

zylH79iITH33p0Te7UZ54w.text: I ordered take-out, which isn't their forte. I was not offered a seat, nothing to drink, and generally had to figure out whom to address to place my order. There is a salsa bar, but when I got there - around dinner time - the salsas were mostly gone. There are at least two salsas worth writing about, but there were no cups/lids to take the salsa with me. Upon request, they provided me four one-ounce cups with four lids, so I did get to try a bit of four types of salsa, period. The fish tacos were odd, but the smoked swordfish actually tasted yum. NOT for $9+ though, which is part of the reason for the low star review. Overall, you couldn't convince me to give this place a second try. Bad service - the servers/staff seemed too busy to help (service is a biggie). Recommend you go into the insurance business with your people skills.

XxV-qZ19PMPbxMwbnvs3WA.text: I came here expecting yummy food after a long flight from Miami and I was so disappointed! First of all, let me start by saying this is not a $ sign place, I would say more like $$. We ordered an horchata, which was pretty good (but then again I've never had one before so... no comparison there). We ordered the mix and match tacos and all I can say is I don't ever want to try mexican food again. I'm cuban, so I know about flavor and good hispanic cooking, but these were not blah! There was no flavor, out of the 3 mini tacos I ordered the only one with SOME flavor was a chicken one that was loaded with onions and spicy sauce. So you can guess, it simply tasted spicy. Overall, if you find another place with good reviews go there. I thought this place would be great due to the 1000+ reviews and the 4.5 rating, but I was greatly disappointed and ended up paying $40 for 6 mediocre, small tacos and a drink!

dPDdctMyGbVv4uvDb3zpPQ.text: HOLY SH*T this place is good. Shark Taco plus peanut salsa is great. I love this place, will be better once they add more seating. May check out the Glendale location if their is more room even though I live all the way in Chandler.

K__jg08fbNX88fHqWXcpnA.text: Over hyped I think. To me the tacos actually lacked flavor. Had a combo of 3 different types and thought they were all somewhat bland and lacked real creativity. Basically its taco truck food (not a bad thing) at probably triple the price (a bad thing). Now the salsa bar is awesome and this is where this place shines. Lots of unique flavors and it is clean and well presented. The chef/cook came out to check on orders so i think they care but the price does not justify the food....

sfL_5bFmAayt-Wj0bhRGwQ.text: Again shark taco is great. Al pastor also great. Chicken very good   9/26/2015 Shark taco plate and salsas awesome

G2yeLYM4AvFB5LNj_C3kzA.text: This place is awesome, and I am deciding is my favorite Mexican food restaurant (restaurants-both locations are pretty much the same) in the Phoenix area. I have eaten here (and at the Glendale location) a total of 4 times, and each experience has left me wanting to come back.   The salsa bar is the best I've experienced with an amazing variety of tastes, fresh ingredients, and mild to moderate spice. Order extra chips straight away if you love chips and salsa.  The food is outstanding-from their pibil to their arbol, to their beans and rice. They use very high quality fresh ingredients with KILLER flavor and spice. While there is a very strong Mexican feel to the restaurants (no gringo influence that I noticed-Thank you), there is also a modern feel to their menu. So I've started out with the more popular dishes/recipes, but I am excited to try out some of their other offerings that appear more modern.  Their margaritas (I've only had the house) are the best, period. End of sentence.  Finally, you should be aware that the physical spaces are pretty different. I'm going to guess the owners are young and without the resources to afford something more expensive. But don't be put off by the space. I love that they have more modern art, and the food more than makes up for any misgivings one might have about the space.  If you really love Amazing Mexican food, you must try this place. I can't imagine you will be disappointed.  PS, I don't think their prices are reasonable/not expensive.

PpRia35Z10emaneUQtce6A.text: My daughter took me here after a Cardinals game and it was Great!  It's a small place with lots of character.  The salsa bar is amazing and the food is even better!  It's far from QC where I live but if I'm in Phoenix I'll stop in for lunch or dinner for sure!  Give it a try!

yTHkvmGDX4RJWJ_8NPfc6g.text: Cant believe all the rave reviews on here! If you like to eat dry, chewy tasteless meat in your tacos....this place is for you. If you like to eat with plastic utensils in a dirty restaurant and pay $3 for a coke....this is for you. If you like grimy walls, dirty floors and a salsa bar with half the choices empty....go for it. The meat in the street tacos were overcooked, chewy and tasteless. The taco meal for $9 came with 2 small tacos, and a thimble full of beans and a similar amount of rice. On a piece of paper in a plastic tray. You have to get your own plastic utensils and napkins...which I dont mind, just not at these prices. The famous salsa bar was half empty and I had to ask for forks as they had run out. Poor, very poor. Dont waste your money.

VgU9uJyJj9bZt95vPT3XuQ.text: My friend and I stopped in here after a day of shopping and it was nearby.  The reviews on  yelp made us stop by.  The three stars are really based on the quality of the food and the location of the restaurant to me.    The food quality was good, but didn't knock my socks off.  I can get just as good tacos elsewhere in the valley. - Two taco plate ($9) - had two different kind of tacos, with two tortillas per taco type, rice and beans.  I had the smoked marlin, which I tasted more of the salsa than the marlin...  and the Sonoran carne asada tacos which were yummy but I've had better elsewhere. - I also wanted to try the el pastor street tacos ($3 for two tortillas).  They were yummy but sadly I had Rocky Point on the top of my mind and I remember getting better there....  -My friend got a chicken deep friend quesas that had peppers and onions in it.  It was very yummy and a large portion but very rich.  The restaurant was cute, but small.  Luckily it was just the two of us because a large group would be too much. The menu was extensive, it was hard to make a decision. There were tons of salsas to try and a free basket of chips when we sat down, so it was fun to try all the different salsas.  The wait staff was friendly and attentive, I really did like my lunch there but I wouldn't call myself a "fan".  It was good though, and if I happen to be in the area (which is very rare) I would stop in.

pUHB9m2FxEAZ6VK_WGV08g.text: This is taco heaven.   Starting with the salsa bar that has several different types of salsas. From your classic pico, to pecan, strawberry, and the popular cilantro-cream, plus many more. Emphasis on the pecan because sweet jesus that stuff is so good.   Refreshing Jamaica? Check. Sweet, milky horchata with nuts & fruit? Check.   Lots of variety. The Mahi Mahi tacos, the Sonoran carne, the Dogfish, the Cabo shrimp - all of them are incredibly delicious. They do seafood very well here; never over or undercooked, and usually served up with fresh cabbage and drizzled with mayo, mole, or what have you. The rice is also excellent - always tender and perfectly seasoned. The Bullet burro (beans & cheese) is also pretty good, especially when you smother it in their fresh cilantro salsa.   I've noticed some people saying they wish it was located in downtown-downtown Phoenix (what they really mean is gentrified), but I disagree. I like the location, especially because it's nestled in on the same street with other less "hip" mom & pop shops. It has a great neighborhood vibe - very comfortable.    Put simply, I love this place. If you haven't tried it, you're missing out.

eVdCW8UGYlP844JwG1KC2A.text: Amazing! Found this Place through Yelp while trying to find a good place to eat with a good Vegetarian selection & We're NOT DISAPPOINTED! The Energy/Environment inside is Very Pleasant, the Paintings inside are Stunning. Our server was Alan, he was very helpful & nice, answering our questions. My Fiance had the Steak Tacos & Margarita. I Ate the La Santisima Veggie Burrito, I'm in LOVE with it! Also I would Recommend try the Cilantro Salsa, the Guacamole one is GOOD but it is also Very Spicy. (There are many kinds of salsa) Service A+ Food A+ Energy Just a really Good Place  We Will Definitely be Coming Back, Regularly.  I Wish I could give MORE STARS!

FvZpkEYbJEgAtxZHr_XVCQ.text: So bummed. We have been going to this place for years which is why I gave it 2 stars over 1. In the food biz service is everything and this place has broken my heart. We brought a friend here from NY ranting and raving about the food the whole way. When we arrived we were quickly embarrassed as the entire staff treated us as if we were invisible. We stood by the "please wait to be seated" sign for almost 10 min. as the staff worked hard to not make eye contact with us. We ultimately had to ask the busser if there was a host. Half the restaurant was empty. They easily could have acknowledged us, sat us, offered chips and told us the kitchen was behind. Instead they chose to completely ignore us making us feel as if they wanted us to just turn around and walk out. We took the hint and went to Pepe's Taco Villa where they made us feel at home.

MpbGVr4Q6CoDhyrFjlzfYw.text: Love the salsa bar and the burritos are always great... not to mention the house margaritas.  Only wish the wait wasn't crazy but that's what happens when a place makes great food!

lc9YbR-w31P8UE0dne921g.text: Small restaurant, but bar seating is nice.  Great salsa options.  Food is excellent and great quality.

aJgTamy0qPpj77hqR1-4OQ.text: Husband introduced me to this place yesterday and I was totally impressed. Donot pass up the cilantro or pecan salsas!

SGs6y-AVGpCqxmBhDisfNg.text: Wait was over 30 min for 2 people. Numerous tables were open but waited to sit people. Food was not good and not worth the money. Would not recommend this place.

I74cLkfgdI7SU1tT9d8bDg.text: My waiter came to my table to take my order and came again to give me my check. No refills on drinks or nothing. Disappointing.

5PDhMLi1BHiNO3dkNFFpwA.text: Waited for 10 minutes at the bar without so much as a hello from the staff here. I understand being busy, but to not even be acknowledged while waiting is pretty rude. I didn't try the food because I tired of waiting and left. Probably won't return.

zWIRlT9FrqU-80kT7Hk1-Q.text: Food was great, service was a bit slow as far as drinks.  But the food came out quickly.  We will be back.  Limited parking, but no fault of the restaurant other than where it's at on 7th street.  At lunch on a Saturday there was plenty of side street parking.  Boyfriend loved the horchata, said it was the best he ever had.

8JTS0I9AWGN4cHbpnaLs4w.text: Food is consistently amazing.  Service is consistently deplorable. There is absolutely no efficiency, management, or organization.    Last time we had to order cocktails 3 times before we got them and ask for the check 4 times until we threatened to leave. So, here we are. ...  Today, we waited 40 minutes within their new expanded dining room.  3 servers, a hostess, and a bartender overseeing 8 tables and shooing customers off tell them 45 minute to an hour wait for a 3/4 empty restaurant.  There was a sauce covered bean in the bottom of our chip bowl and a shard of glass on the table when we were seated. Both pictured.  Ordered drinks and meals immediately upon being seated;  knowing the glacial pace witnessed so far and after another 20 minutes, we have an empty chip bowl, empty cocktails, and still no entrees or even a visit from a moving person.  What a success this place could be if anyone cared or even knew what they were doing attempting to run a business.

JsGAQkptWk2VAXQsRnpsyg.text: Based on my first visit, I would have happily given La Condesa a 4 star review. My veggie tacos were delicious, and I loved all the fun salsas. I couldn't get enough of them! Really, the only negative was the cramped quarters.  My second visit, however, was not nearly as good. On the positive side, I got guacamole this time which was studded with dried cranberries and tasted great with the strawberry salsa. I was impressed with the service too because my friend's order came out the same time as mine despite the fact that we ordered separately 10 minutes apart.   The tacos this time were awful. I decided to get the vegan tacos since the description of "no pintos, no rice" lead me to believe that the beans and rice in the veggie tacos weren't really vegetarian friendly. I'm a pretty strict vegetarian so I try to avoid food that's been prepared with meat-based stock. The vegan tacos come with black beans which were absolutely flavorless. I'm not sure these beans encountered even a grain of salt during their preparation. The tacos also had iceburg lettuce in them which tasted dreadful of course.   So now I know I can't have their veggie tacos, and the vegan ones suck. No reason to visit again.

bCtfBu-L4lCB00C_RIls7A.text: Holy delicious batman!  These tacos were amazing! Very very filling. I only ordered two and walked away completely satisfied. They have a cornucopia of salsas!   I wish I could tell you what I had but I could not choose so I asked out server to pick two  out for me. My coworker did the same thing.  However with his, we asked about one ( his favorite) it was the shark taco.  It's quite small so lunch time it gets very packed. I would recommend getting there a bit earlier or later than noon.
