Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ccWuLy-EPyyU9BI8Y3-kow.text: Decent to good food but expect to wait and wait lol if I was only rating on service I would rate them a 1 star. I have been 3 times and I'm done !

vZ2XClWuqdUCL46Q00WXJQ.text: Awesome place, and so much better now that they have expanded. The salsa bar is the highlight!

sfESLfMUoYw9-AY3AR6DTQ.text: Great service- server was friendly and attentive. Small place, will probably have to wait if you could at a typical busy lunch or dinner time. Food was on point, even a few options for vegetarians! Good sized portions, not overly pricey. Love having the salsa bar there!! The jicama drink was similar to a berry juice, was a little too sweet for my liking but once it was watered down a little, it was delicious. Will definitely come back here next time!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ghandi and the vegan tacos!! Love the salsa bar too!! Pickled onions were so yummy

TIWPjLadOl_PhtfOfo6whg.text: Great service- server was friendly and attentive. Small place, will probably have to wait if you could at a typical busy lunch or dinner time. Food was on point, even a few options for vegetarians! Good sized portions, not overly pricey. Love having the salsa bar there!! The jicama drink was similar to a berry juice, was a little too sweet for my liking but once it was watered down a little, it was delicious. Will definitely come back here next time!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie cactus and ghandi tacos with yummy rice!!

fnD7LiyBI8iSkhDtSHeNtQ.text: I would not recommend this location , the service here was so bad . Came on a Sunday not really busy at al , took them 40 mins for us to get a table when I could l see open tables ( more then 3) . Then when we sat down it took over an hour to get our food . The food was good nothing bad to say about the food . Just the service. The Glendale location was so much better . I will never come here again , I will drive out of my way to Glendale next time .

M15FWm0CumT5K6TsXaSdww.text: This place is AWESOME! My husband and I were in the area and decided to stop simply because of the Yelp reviews, it didn't disappoint! The service was great - we were immediately greeted and our drink orders taken right away. We both ordered the horchata - wow! Such a delicious twist to the already yummy drink. I ordered the mole quesadilla and my husband had a pastor bowl, both delicious, seasoned perfectly and pretty darn close to being authentic Mexican food. This place is a must - parking is limited as is the seating space inside, but worth it. I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastor bowl - fresh and not too filling, just right
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mole Quesadilla, big portion, very yummy
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata with strawberry, melon and nuts - delicious!

AcHMkXv5xQFPU4WagIFqUA.text: DELICIOUS TACOS! I loved this restaurant. The margaritas were BEUNO!!! I would definitely suggest visiting here if you are coming from out of town. It is a great hole in the wall. Be patient, just be patient and enjoy the experience here. They do a great job managing the wait and the food hardly took long for how busy they were.

-t-Akun_Lr1e0WTEQ5r6qQ.text: Went there yesterday around 6 pm!! When we went inside there were maybe two other tables seated!! They made us wait for five minutes before they set us!! I'm not sure how they have so many good reviews!! The best thing they have is the salsa!! Not sure if they don't have help or they don't hire because it was the worst I have seeing!! We waited about 40 minutes for our food!! The steak tacos were disgusting!! The beer was hot!! My son only had couple of bites of his burrito!! And he can eat!! When we left there were at least 10 tables open and  there were at least 20 people waiting inside and outside!!  I just don't get it!! I have so much to say but I'm going to leave it at this!! Never ever going there again!!

LbVMjgX1QRM4WB62U8vMIg.text: Oh the mole!!!!  It is a treat to come here and have such amazing flavors, salsas and variety.

KvTNcGR-20sc6hEPL9XDNQ.text: This place would match, if not beat, any taco shop in LA.  Good service and amazing tacos with a complexity of taste.  The Salsa Bar bar is delish and the salsas add a whole new depth of flavor when added to a taco.    I one star off because the place is pricey for tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa bar!

-jWFBrTEunNS6VTU_RHSTg.text: This review is based on a catering order with David. I tried to place an order for take out and that didn't work out. So, David, who I am assuming is the manager, worked a bit of magic for our out of town clients to get their damn lunch on time. Thank you, David! It was very much appreciated!

91zRXwPGlNXYMCWkRbOnBw.text: Totally worth the crappy parking situation here! My girlfriend and I came in on random weeknight for early dinner and the place was already full. Wow! Could be due to the limited seating or maybe because the food is terrific. Both? Likely. Chips arrived promptly straight from the oil pan - nice and toasty. And we helped ourselves to the salsa bar - which is completely fresh, creative, and whets your palette at the get-go! We loved the cilantro salsa and salsa mexicana the best. Zesty! The servers were quick to take our order despite being busy and minutes later my tacos de arrachera arrived. Sooo good! I mean. Wow! Meat was tender and juicy ....and the combination of spices and flavors was heaven. My friend ordered the Condesa specialty taco. Another winning ticket! Condesa has nailed the right way to make beans too. And..don't get me started on the deliciousness of the horchata. I've had me some horchata many places ..but this really rocked my world. Rocked it!   Condesa, I have just two requests: Please do something about the sitting area so we can actually fit in this place. Also, please don't be out of flan next time I come in! Thanks!

DFrA6PtCdXPRuxNGge-eCQ.text: Worth the wait. The quesadilla is the best. It's like a Mexican calzone you need to try it. Delicious salsa bar and food.

ojDx4OBouaTMf9UDjE9WGg.text: Oh, I dream about the salsas here... I love all the different combinations, and could very easily make a meal with those alone. Love the tacos and the horchata as well.

NPj1dBpErkrR9KTdDxrmGQ.text: We recently moved to Phoenix and were excited to try all the new culinary wonders around us. Unfortunately we found this place first and were HOOKED! We have been there 3 times in the past week. The mole is delicious as is the Aztec Tinga Burrito. Even the veggie taco is scrumptious and is not missing meat in the least! The horchata is really, really good as well. Keep it up!

P_fJsgasQ1puwyzMCWie8Q.text: Really great salsa bar, tacos, quesadillas and burros.  Service is hit or miss depending on how busy they are but are very friendly.  Just get the food ala carte, the beans and rice portions with a combo are small and aren't that great.  Not a very good selection of beers and the regular margarita is just so so.

HEO6PP6pUwCs5u8ycvFHJg.text: mmmmmm.......the quesadillas are A M A Z I N G!!!!! who doesnt want it deep fried?! lol, also their salsa bar is delicious....try the pecan salsa!

B-gA6YYKlkHCveoe4TOxIg.text: It is in the weirdest area!  But the food, good!  Had the shrimp and carne asada tacos, the beef was a little tough, but the shrimp tacos were yummy!  Best part, eating all the guacamole they had out, yummy!!  It's worth going back ::-)

62fXc1H1SoCUtwZelDj6-Q.text: $6.99 for 2 chicken mole tacos, rice, beans and chips and salsa?  Unreal.  I am a mole freak.  The first time I had mole it was hand made in a process that took 6-8 hours.  It spoiled me.  If mole is on a restaurant's menu I will try it and usually with disasterous results.  This is the first place in years and years....and years that has chicken mole that was as good as the homemade batch that spoiled me.  And for $6.99???  Jeeez.  I think I'm tearing up.  Also the horchada is ridiculous...Get it.

TEBwaYKqXkWQsf4HfcDwzQ.text: I had heard many good things about this place so I finally decided to eat there. The restaurant is small and cozy with lots of mexican art on the walls. On to the food... The salsa selection was very generous and I liked most of them. The beans were great and so was the rice. Now about the tacos, the mole was not that great, they went overboard on the chocolate imho, the carne asada was good. The chicken tinga taco changed my life, it was amazing! Overall it was a good experience. I will be going back soon.

T8vjKPBQaGtLAHQ9Fg2wPw.text: YUCK! Craving Mexican food so my friend and I decided to stop at this place for some burritos. We were impressed with the large selection at the salsa bar. When we got our stale store-bought, rubbery chips the salsa wasn't so appealing after all. We both ordered chicken burritos and were shocked when we got a basket with a tortilla filled with soggy chicken bits and bean soup. It wasn't possible to use a fork and knife in a basket so we tried to pick them up and the burritos spilled all over our hands. It was a mess! I asked the waitress to look at the menu again because we were not satisfied with the burritos. I hate to waste food but we could not force ourselves to eat them. She said we had to pay for the burritos and then she would give us "one" taco. She made us feel very uncomfortable as she waved her "one" finger in our faces so I told her we would pay for the food and then look at the menu again. She immediately brought me the check and waited over my shoulder for me to pay for it before she handed us the menus. Her angry attitude scared us, so we no longer wanted to look at the menu. We just wanted to leave and try out another restaurant. I would not recommend dining at this place. The quality of food was horrible and the service was even worse. Waitress with vile attitude and crappy food equals a no win situation. You're better off dining at Taco Bell.

NMq_LY-jRzKZuRo4qAuHHg.text: What a great hole in the wall.  Cool vibe, very clean and an AMAZING burrito!  Had the Mahi Mahi, it was awesome, and the descriptions of the ingredients in the other items will grab your attention.  For what it is, plus some, it does not get any better!

VIMGuA5IZktGWkUMyKRVCA.text: Just really good salsa's and Tacos!!  Just had a late lunch with the wife...had the fish tacos plate and the pork tacos plate accompanied by housemade horchata...both tacos were really good...especially liked the salsa to accompany the pork tacos.  The beans and rice were good. The horchata had fresh strawberries and nuts in it, tasted like they had  just made it!   Salsa bar has a really good selection..especially like the avacado and the tomato chipotle.  Will be back for more and try their queso's or a burrito.

FMlFlDugqanfj26wAUPXow.text: As the name implies, it's an eatery that specialized in tacos and wide variety of salsas.  Among 5 of us, three ordered tacos and were pleased with the food, and two persons ordered the Quesa: La Condesa Mahi Mahi and Sonora Arrachera Quesa.  The quesa is like a jumbo empanada  made with corn flour dough then deep fried. We ordered it at the waitress recommendation.  I'm sure the soft corn flour dough makes it very hard to stay together during the frying process however the creation is way too doughy and heavy, with little filling. Nobody ordered burritos. If we come back again, I'd definitely recommend my friends/family to stay with the tacos.

ReFznL7fAKPdABwwbY9s1w.text: Small joint, delicious food. You must try the Mole Quesadilla, I've never had anything like it, and it was the best thing I have ever eaten, maybe in my life! We thought about ordering a couple to take home, but we didn't (but we should have!!). We also tried 4 of their tacos, you can't go wrong with any choice. On the way out, we ordered the horchata and it was great. Lots of cinnamon, just sweet enough, good for a dessert. There are some fruit bits in there, and I am usually not a fan of stuff flying up the straw like that, but it was fine. There is also a large salsa bar, many varieties to choose from. I'm looking forward to going back to this place.

LLBHs1SE3mabWKwGntyxGw.text: I have eaten here twice and it is consistently excellent. I have had a shark taco, mahi mahi taco and veggie taco. I had to bribe my meat-loving-high-cholesterol-fighting mother into "splitting" the mahi mahi and veggie taco's with me. She loved them, too! The horchata is like nothing I have ever experienced. Love the fresh fruit and nuts in it. The salsa bar is a tastebud orgy of sheer delight and a playground for foodies who love complexity of flavor. But best of all... for 2 tacos, a little side of rice and beans, chips, two BIG drinks, it was only $16! Plus, we listened to The Smiths and old Mexican folk music. This place rocks. Oh, and for those reviewers who were frightened by the neighborhood, get over it. I live 5 blocks in a historic neighborhood and it is as safe as a city can get. If you come for lunch, you just might take a walk a couple blocks up to get a poleta for desert. 16th st between McDowell and Thomas has successfully embraced its roots to create a truly positive cultural experience.

RbeoKJ4CkcWq9Ii12_KNlw.text: Really enjoyed the food and the salsa bar. Everything I have tried here so far has been great. The mole is very tastey and I have to say you must try the quesadillas they are awsome (but mind you they are not for those watching the waistline).

qhqdQ0UwY9FQCvrVrRU-HA.text: Good food but service is lacking.  Self service, sort of.  No trash cans, no easy refills.  Food is well worth the experience, though.

FNmNbavA-IJJaOsBKrz7TQ.text: salsa bar alone is worth visiting, types you wont ever see anywhere. the pork shoulder and quesadilla's are so good! enjoy

JdLAWhcrO8Dry0F6nM8g3Q.text: I live the Dia de Los Muertos decor and big wooden furniture here. The salsas are outstanding and so are their tortes. The carnitas is my fav for tacos and burritos. The mole is slightly too sweet for me though. Definitely worth checking out if you are in this neighborhood!

pefri4DqCusZ1rzJSCRAsw.text: My parents came into town last month, and they always want me to take them out to eat.  I, however, don't go out to eat, so it makes it really hard.  La Condesa isn't far from our house, and I've been wanting to try it, so we went there.  The food was amazing!  Even my mom - who is the pickiest eater I know - liked it!  The different salsas at the bar are great, and the food is delicious.

ck76ik7YJMm8b3GEmF25jQ.text: I, unfortunately, rarely make it out to this part of town. When I do, I tend to go an binges, scarfing down food from one or two of my favorite spots, and adding a new place that has been on my must-try list. This time, it was La Condesa.   Everything about La Condesa took me by surprise, regardless of the high expectations I already had. I loved its interior--the small space, the rustic wood furniture, the artwork, everything. A big departure from the usual feel of cheap-mexican restaurants/taquerias, it felt homey, warm, inviting. I was expecting to just shoot a quick order to the girl at the counter, but instead got table service, and extremely friendly and attentive service to boot (sounds like it's usually an order-at-the-counter place, though).   On to the food: don't expect the usual suspects at the salsa bar--these salsas and toppings were phenomenal. I didn't ask, but I suspect they were all made in-house, and seemed incredibly fresh and were really a unique assortment. A great mellow, nutty peanut sauce, smokey chipotle salsa, creamy/salty cilantro, an awesome Mexican (or was it Mayan?) salsa (my favorite of what I tried)...my only regret was not sampling more.  What I loved about the menu were the unique options that branched far beyond the usual suspects. I went with three tacos: tinga, mole, cochinita pibil. When they arrived, all of them looked beautiful, and were surprisingly and thankfully chocked-full of meat. I took one bite of the mole and...HO...LY.....SHIT. Ever go to a restaurant and casually take a bite of something without giving it too much thought, only to be immediately punched in the face by its deliciousness? I love it when this happens. It's one of those pure joys in life, and happens far too infrequently...but it happened here. I'm a sucker for any type of mole, but sometimes they fall a bit 'flat'. This one did not. It had a fantastic bite and complexity to it that really elevated the mole to one of the best I've had. The tinga and cochinita were both equally great. The meat in all three was insanely tender and flavorful from the great sauces they had simmered in.  I paid the bill--$9.80--and realized that it was an awesome deal. Sure, you can find tacos in town for less than $3/ea, but they will not be like these. Not to mention, the portions were generous, I got free chips and a run at the salsa bar.   I drove home feeling like I was teetering on the edge of purging...this was, after all, my second substantial meal in the course of 1 hour. But it was well worth it. Adding yet another spot to my list of places I have to hit when in the area. Already searching for an excuse.

F3Z5JGgaz6PBnmWn9796tg.text: I read all the great reviews on here and in the 'Phoenix's 23 of the Valleys best new places to chow down' and was excited - both my sister and I love street tacos. Maybe I missed something, but I have never been more dissappointed in my culinary adventures. The chips were alright...the array of salsas was impressive and all the ones I sampled were quite good. We ordered 5 different tacos a la carte - Cabo Shrimp Taco, Sonoran Carne Asada Taco, Aztec Tinga Taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, La Condesa Shrimp taco.  The Cabo was tasty, but nothing to write home about, the carne asada was tasteless and overdone, the Aztec Tinga was not bad... but very one note and we were over it after the first bite. The Condesa Shrimp taco had  WAAAY too much garlic and the shrimp had zero flavor - I came across at least 10 full slices and I still have the taste of garlic in my mouth hours later.  Overall it wasn't horrible - it just wasn't good - definately not 25 dollars worth -  this is not a place I would return to nor would I recommend it to anyone else If you want good street tacos see my reviews.

xmf2QsYtRa3umZGiI2Wsmw.text: Now we're talking.  Fabulous tacos -- the Chicken Tinga is amazing, as is the Cochinita Pibil.  The salsa bar is amazing; lots of choices, some of them specialized for your taco/burrito.  Reasonably priced hole-in-the-wall.  Service is just o.k. and it gets hot in the summer (no/weak A.C.), but the food and the value are excellent.

39M4OXoqO4GExtdnfSfY2w.text: tasty menu with lots of variety, twelve salsas at salsa bar, seafood options, table service, handmade tortillas, giant basket of chips included free, no lunch rush.  all this AND priced similarly to america's taco shop, which can't hold a vela to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. half the salsa bar

2R3X3mOo-FdpmZ_yKfmDZw.text: Stopped in on Saturday for lunch. Place was dead, only one other couple in the restaurant. Noticed speakers on the wall, but no music was playing. Not exactly a jovial atmosphere for a wonderful spring day in March. I ordered the Carne Asada and a Cochinita Pibil to be washed down with an Horchata. I then proceeded to the Salsa bar which appeared to have an outstanding selection and I immediately started filling cups with the many varietals eagerly anticipating being able to dress up my tacos. Chips were then brought out to snack on while I waited for my food. I can only describe these as cold, flavorless, and typical of most chain restaurant chips. Not a good sign. My Taco's arrived shortly thereafter. Unfortunately these too were nothing to write home about. The tortillas were cold and appeared store bought. The carne asada was overcooked and lacked any form of flavor. I attempted to spice things up by adding salsas, but these too were flavorless. Very little spice and hardly any seasoning. The cochinita pibil was enjoyable, as it was juicy and tasted like a quality cut of pork, but wrapped inside of a cold store bought tortilla the experience was muted.   I highly doubt I will be returning to this restaurant, and I honestly question those that have written such outstanding reviews. My opinion, no taco shop should bill itself as "Gourmet" if it does not make its own tortillas, has bland salsas, and cannot make a juicy and flavorful carne asada.

5c68qVTiJE71-cu4v9Lfkw.text: Liked the artsy decor and slightly unusual taco selections.  Would have preferred 3 rather than 2 tacos in the combos.  I had the Cabo shrimp and the conchita pilbil tacos.  Both very good but neither knocked my socks off.   The various salsa were indentified by signs while I was there and lots of fun to test against my tacos (even though I ended up preferring the most standard versions).  The strawberry salsa is a definite must - astounding to get strawberry taste and heat at the same time and it works!

w15NByGsVedQLmpydJ7gPg.text: i drove from avondale expecting something worthy of such a long drive. salsa bar was very good. the chips were nothing above normal as was the food. the worst part of it all is while i was midway thru a taco a bug scattered across my plate. when i went to go pay i mentioned this to the waitress which only shrugged and took my bill. didnt apologize or even seem remotely interested in my complaint. i wasnt expecting a free meal by any means but a sign of concern was expected.

9GXzNF4NHir6MEGhUmeM6A.text: I think most people have a "go to" restaurant & for us it's this amazing place for Mexican food.  We've been around the Phoenix area for many years.  It's wonderful to see a new business succeed right from the start.  That's this place !  Wonderful menu!  Excellent service!  Nice atmosphere!  If you're in the east valley or really anywhere in the valley, give it a try!  You won't be disappointed!

IWUl7_JXwvfHq4lebSNGMQ.text: My second time here and the food had been fantastic both times!  I got the Jamaica Rose Shrimp and La Nueva Ensenada and my husband got the shark taco.  We enjoyed everything very much and the service was speedy and friendly.  We also love the many selections at the salsa bar!

VhiW8a-XBk3M-dHMdCNJ6w.text: We were driving around starving and stopped here. Seems they are famous for salsa and tacos. It was really crowded. That's a good sign. The tacos were freshly made and good. The salsa was great. Wish I could take it home. We tried a variety of sauces and wanted to buy one of each. It was fun just taste testing. Worth the trip.

vSLbjaNz9NwCRr6Ij6X3IA.text: First time at this Taco haven.  Simple and funky spot with unique combinations, flavors and choices.   A definite stop for Mexican food.  I'll be back!

CM-uQ7iAuaLZ83TGAMyDLA.text: The service was a bit slow but the wait was well worth it. The tacos were outstanding and the tortilla soup was the best I've had. My daughters had burros which were also excellent. I will be back whenever I'm in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla soup

r-x5oui8fbuD5hsacNKScw.text: Came here with a party of 10 and had an awesome, awesome meal. The waitress was so on top of things, and made sure that everyone had drinks (relatively) quickly, and always had full water glasses. (I say relatively because one margarita took a while and it took a few tries to get my coke, but again, we were a party of 10, so it wasn't a big deal).   While we waited for our food, we sampled the salsa bar, which has 16 flavors of salsa. The waitress brought baskets of chips as soon as we sat down. Each one tasted so different, and while we didn't love all of them, we had so much fun sampling and comparing the different flavors.   I had the fish tacos, which were awesome. Everyone on yelp raves about them, and they were totally right. So flavorful and the tortilla held up well. I also had a quesadilla - most places make their quesadillas with flour tortillas, so I was ecstatic to see that they made theirs with corn (extra points for being gluten-free-friendly!). They let me sub out the pork for the steak, and the quesadilla did not disappoint - stuffed with cheese, steak, and some veggies, this this was awesome.   Wish I didn't live so far, because I would absolutely become a regular here.   Good for: cheap dinner, night out with friends, date night, any time you're feeling hungry!

RAB9JChMfC1jUf6jmEWgFQ.text: Adore this taco joint! They have a huge selection and great service. Try the shark tacos!! A very authentic feel, with a salsa bar in the corner. This is a smaller place, without a waiting area so we had to wait 15 minutes outside before being seated. This in no way detracted from how great the food was, but if you go at a busy time, just be prepared.

8TuUOjVWleuR99fBfOXcKw.text: I had to finally give La Condesa (recently changed their name to Santisma Tacos) the five stars they deserve. THIS PLACE IS MY JAM. We eat here all the time and believe me when I say that their santa condesa veggie taco is the best you'll ever have in your life (if you're vegetarian) and definitely awesome even if you're not a veggie. My go-to lunch/dinner is the 2 taco plate with one santa condesa and one ghandi vegan taco (their guacamole on this is divine). If you haven't ever had a horchata with fruit and nuts in it, it's about time. Theirs is delicious.   They also have brunch (!!!!) and it's so fabulous. Just make sure to add Oaxaca cheese if it's not already part of the option, trust me.

et2s7SkHTnDyh7hsYfIy_A.text: I loved the ambiance and the different salsas but the food could've been seasoned a lot more. I ordered one of the veggie burro and it had great potential, just lacked seasoning until I added salsa. I will definitely be trying this again though.

9jKMCJCeMQv2g0DFnu5wxg.text: Food was awesome! Went on a Saturday night about 6 and had about a 5 min wait. Right away got chips and water so we could try out the abundant salsa bar! Nice fresh Margherita while we waited for our steak, chicken and chicken mole tacos which were amazing!  Son had a steak quesa Dillard and hubs had steak burrito ALL AMAZING! Nice, fast service! Food was a bit more of a wait than normal but so worth it since it all tasted so fresh! Definitely a "come again" spot!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SldWJSwMZgADvN-cb8Iwjg.text: This was my first time trying this local eatery. The food was great!! I had grilled chicken tacos with rice and beans. The horchata was exceptionally good, a must have if you visit this establishment.   They also had a salsa bar with several different salsas to choose from. They were not spicy at all, but that is never a bad thing in my case.   The service was friendly and prices were fair. The only downside is that it is very small and not enough tables for everyone. I would recommend coming here with your significant other and that's about it. Leave the family and kids at home or just take it to go. You might end up waiting a while for a table to clear.   I would definitely be coming back to try different menu items.

G-C_iC_hW-Kg0Ep7PV3-9w.text: This place is amazing!!!!!! In my opinion, the best thing on the menu is the chorizo and potato taco!!! Can't wait to come back this place! Service was great as well!

a3ckWrWLGidM2gJCUosQ6w.text: Best salsa bar in town by far.  Stand outs to me would be the 7 chile, and the Pecan.  The Cabo Shrimp and the Mole tacos would be my favorite tacos.  And best of all is this place just doubled in size, so that should make wait times much shorter.  A great place to take any out of town guests to get some wonderful authentic Mexican cuisine!

cemzdMnV0wGbnBgihQ_mIw.text: I will lead with saying that this place has awesome tacos. That said, the service is awful, at best. They seems to run 1 waiter/waitress at a give time which seems odd since they are always busy. Granted the place is small, but still too much for 1 wait staff to run, at a non stop pace.   My bigger issue is how the act towards or treat customers. Below are a couple of lines I heard today a lone "you're going to have to wait at least 30 minutes, if you want to wait", almost seemed like they didn't want me to to stick around. When I sat at the bar which is supposed to be first come first served, I asked for a drink as I waited for my table. "Everything is first come first served, so you're going to have to wait for that too" is the answer I received. For a drink?   Overall this was a strange and disappointing experience, and it was the second time something like this has happened. I really enjoyed their food, which makes it more disappointing that I likely will not be coming back.

Hckkos9NHawYEU6Pj6IBWQ.text: I seriously love this place!!! One of the best taco places I have ever been to. Everything is delicious there. I would go there weekly if it was closer to where I lived. I recommend everyone stop by, you won't be disappointed!

2OVwADLRJ2lI5UtKBccshg.text: Not impressed, after reading the comment i though it would be a great spot, but wish i didnt go there honestly

ztXckPiEF-U7afiY65FYoQ.text: Poor service, took over an hour to get burritos, freezing air conditioning blowing right on us, sound system not working just crackling loudly the whole time. They charge 5$ more just to get sour cream and enchilada sauce on burrito.

bZs3oLml9Jya0g_vpYctIA.text: For those who are less adventurous I'm telling you to get over the rough look of the neighborhood and go eat!  The food is fresh and excellent every time.  Yummy horchata that my 2 year old loves.  The salsa bar is fun as well. This is our second time and we are already planning our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa bar!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yeah fish tacos

AdsYdMd0GnBFFBBJNNdX7w.text: Nice small restaurant for street tacos. Had the carne asado tacos which are fresh and tasty.  The thing that stands out here is the salsa bar with the different varieties of salsa to choose from. Fresh and home made with a great opportunity to experiment and sample all kinds.  Very small place with old tables and dawn of the dead motif if that is your thing. Service is good but they dont have much to do with you. The parking is limited and may need to park along a side street.  You order at the counter and they bring the food to you. Simple and easy  Recommend to try their tacos if you want real tacos and something different

KS-R_Nq5e0mLzZEERZxCBQ.text: Service is a bit slow at peak times but food is great! The mole chicken quesadilla is where it's at. My advice is to order ahead of time then show up like 15 minutes after they say it will be ready.

Din_mZCXqQ7zE5mHKfSiwg.text: Authentic tacos. Wonderful flavors, and an awesome salsa bar...what else do you need?

5xX_usp-5SBek1Ut69ujRg.text: Good food, bad service  First thing which is fun about this place is the salsa bar. Food is always good, simple, flavorful. I have been going here for many years. The drinks were added later and do not disappoint.  The food attracts lot of people, but finding parking is always an issue. Once you walk in, you quickly realize the noise level because of the way the place is constructed and set up is very high. Last but not the least, the service is always poor. We had rude servers where we walked out without ordering one time. That is the reason for 3 stars.

pBIrdAx8VSvd7klmqxGEaQ.text: Always good, always more than satisified! Get there when they open because it can get busy. The new expansion was a great move! Love everything about this place!!

rZxUO6wRYsp59CbKvwbRJw.text: The burro was fabulous. Hard to describe how wonderful the food is. The horchata was the best we ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata fresh fruit made it incredible
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aX8C8g4uVA6RNSY-edT-RQ.text: Me and my girlfriend were watching Diners, Drive ins, and Dines when Guy stopped here. We realized they were about 15 minutes away so we thought to check it out. It's a tiny little hole in the wall place that has about 10 tables. It can get kind of cramped but it is definitely worth it when that food hits your tongue. This place has the best mexican food! The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because of how tiny it is and the fact that you have to pay $2.40 to get extra chips. Aside from this, this place is awesome!

W6DWIZ8lODjM02GoTOpTOQ.text: Arrived here for lunch off peak (2:00) and the place showed signs of being super busy, and was a wee bit dirty.  There was only us and another party and they did start catching up on the bussing while we were eating. First off, BEST Mexican I've had in a long time. Anywhere. The guac is something special and different.  See the photo. The pork shoulder and steak w/chimichurri sauce were amazing, even the simple rice side was great. I did like the steak taco better than the pork but the favors were very different.  The salsabar was a real treat!  So many things to try. Will be back next time in town.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guy Fieri was here. No wonder it was featured on Diners Drive Ins and Dives. Place is awesome.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork shoulder and steak taco plate.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Holy guacamole!

gFzUALgMpFuvrUM2B2dJ0A.text: Now with another location opened in Glendale, this taco paradise is truly become a staple place to eat in the state of Arizona! Inspired by the flavors and ingredients of Mexico, you can explore a variety of meals I've already fallen in love with. As you can expect, all ingredients are fresh and flavorful. One of the key things that sets this taco establishment from other larger brand competitors is that they try their best to help you forget about unhealthy, heavy, greasy style Mexican food you've had in America. It's time you experience what actual Mexican food is all about and perhaps you'll never go back to the rest. Popular items such as Quesadillas, Tacos and Burritos come to life with the help of fresh green tomatillos, Oaxacan cheeses, chipotle chiles, flour and corn tortillas. Other amazing things to try include the Horchata beverage, Carne Asada, Baja Sur Shark Tacos and more.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baja sur shark taco.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gaucho quesadilla.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mayan conchinita pibil quesadilla.

rFzhm_oskRRbr21kU_hZ9g.text: I've been here twice now and I just don't see what all the fuss is about. Yes, the salsa bar is amazing, and the margaritas are yummy, but the food is heavy and somewhat bland. My friend ordered a chicken quesadilla and they brought her a cheese one instead and it had so much cheese in it that it was almost inedible. I got a veggie quesadilla and it was ok. My husband got steak though and it tasted and smelled phenomenal! I would try this place if you like chips and salsa and are looking for huge portions, but wouldn't suggest going out of your way for it.

LT3UNnPcAvTol2BfhkPJog.text: Haven't been here for a while, and they've expanded their seating since last time.  So, we didn't have to wait long. Everything still tastes good, but you really have to bring it for tacos in this town, more so every day. Service is still slow.

Ax7KiIUHRtyN6BmSKPjIGA.text: This is one of my favorite places for tacos as I have many options as a pescatarian. I have tried the wild white fish, shrimp, and vegeatarian tacos but I noticed they now have a smoked Merlin taco I can't wait to try! The best thing about this spot are the salsas; they are fresh, unique, and so addictive! I love the nopalitos salsa, with red onions, champignon, jalapenos, and cilantro that I can almost eat by itself with a fork. The only thing I don't recommended is the bean and cheese burrito as it is impossible to eat without it ooozing all over the place.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild white fish tacos combo

yFbn2xkCGFqkj7Yduym5KA.text: We were taken aback by the decor, waitstaff, the patrons, and classic rock playing, because it appeared filled with hipsters,  an all male staff, and an interior with a very confused identity.   HOWEVER, I will be returning, and I will tell you why.....        1. Salsa bar, simply delicious.  All of them. From mild, to smoky, to hot, there's a peanut and pecan salsa, jicama, guacamole, Pico de gallo, and several more.         2. Great menu choices, not your typical American/Mexican options.          3. The street tacos! !! We chose Al Pastor,  Carne Asada, y Cochinita Pibil with rice and beans. Uhhhhh-mazing!    From a white girl who used to never eat Mexican, who is now married to a Mexican..... I was totally impressed. My husband said 4 stars, because he's got a picky palette.  Thoroughly enjoyed my meal! Can't wait to return for a Horchata, and to try the Mole!

agSCiPpAOvZB_8NDhK4hFA.text: I thought the food was really good. It was a little busy because it was lunchtime, but thats ok because that means the food was fresh.

9Lax4vArRBnWsyP1lRdGPw.text: Feel like I'm just repeating what everyone said but it's that good. We went on a Saturday about 1pm and the place was packed. We waited about 15 and got seated.  Great service and salsa bar. Got the carne asada tacos and they were delicious. With the many salsas that they have you can really add many different flavors to your tacos. Loved it but I think next time I will go during off peak hours

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious tacos. I&#39;m craving them right now

f2Pk_PQUfGW0He_4eo0n2A.text: I was brought here for lunch by a co-worker, and it's now my go-to dinner on the way out to Coyotes games.  The tacos are out of this world, but even better is the salsa bar.  Peanut salsa? Cilantro salsa? Pico? Yes, and more; over 10 salsas made fresh daily on site. The place is small and decorated brilliantly in a Dia de Los Muertes theme year-round.   Sometimes the waitstaff can seem a little disinterested, but during lunch you order from the bar and sit down whenever something frees up.   Don't go here for the service, go here for the amazing food and enjoy a little taste of Mexico in Phoenix.

Vba2u6srJPNNOKrClyNghQ.text: Honestly, love this place. The Yelp reviews don't lie. I can't get over La Santisma's  salsa variety. I literally had to dig into my memory to remember what I even ate here because I was so amazed by the salsa bar. I literally got up and filled containers nonstop with EVERY single salsa (no shame). I didn't let that go to waste, I tried them all and left little behind. Of course, I loved the spicier selections, but everything was amazing. After eating so much salsa, my pastor burrito came and was pretty good. I think it was a little dry, but nothing salsa can't fix. I tried some of Eric's shark taco and carne asada taco, those were really good! Next time I think I'm going to give a carne asada quesadilla a try! The beans were also great and I must say I left full and satisfied!  Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsaaa
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork y&#39;all so bomb

2ScpQxqNAqYkMsYEPRQNRA.text: I decided to try this place on a whim. We looked through the pictures on yelp and the tacos looked great. As we walked in we immediately noticed that the place was like really small but the atmosphere was laid back. The menu had a huge selection of tacos, burritos, tortas and quesadillas. I had the specialty tacos with Mahi mahi. Pretty good stuff since it came with rice and beans. The salsa bar had a wide variety of salsas to choose from too.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Specialty tacos with mahi mahi, rice and beans.

dEStdEeN3H5Y2czHOWxmYA.text: Peanut salsa (?!?) is insanely good. For veggie lovers, the veggie burrito is super filling and delicious with more than the standard rice, beans and fajita veggies. I'd go here every day for lunch if I worked closer

SZAitIl7owobAM-P03mRxg.text: Amazing fair with a laid back atmosphere. Love the salsa bar!

PtQBaB6VGrlZHCakpSL95Q.text: This place is amazing. The pastor tacos are out of this world. Like a fiesta in your mouth. I would recommend you trying them with the chipotle salsa  from the salad bar. I enjoyed every last bite I even wanted to lick the plate. The last time I had pastor tacos this good  I was in Mexico City.  This place is very small they have a little bar and it is dark. But when you have pastor tacos this good who needs light anyways;) the salsa bar was impressive I would recommend this place to anyone . I will be back with my mother, sisters, brother, aunt, uncle, Cousins neighbors friend :) AMAZZZINNNNGGG !!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing tacos al pastor. Little bites of heaven. Absolutely amazing.

brbuJuF4DN7mfuv_8Ev13w.text: This place was an incredible find. We trusted Yelp on this one and it did not disappoint! The only knock (and it was no surprise if you read the reviews) was that it was pretty small so they run a pretty small crew.  With the 15 or so different salsas at the homemade salsa bar and the late amount of food we got, we were not in any hurry to leave!  We will definitely be back here soon!

8yTIbBgqU5nve_O-vogVqA.text: Best Mexican food in Phoenix! Went with my family, we are total foodies and were blown away by the flavors! Service was also very good.

uF1L2YjVl155ux1gwHcdXQ.text: Best Mexican food in town.  Hands-down.   A locally-owned, authentic gem!  The mole is phenomenal, and you can have it with either chicken or shrimp.  The house margarita has a lovely blend of lime and grapefruit juices and it just plain delicious.  There are tons of veggie options here that are not just lame, meatless dishes.  The La Condessa Veggie Taco has a mix of Oaxacan cheese, mushrooms, smoky poblano peppers, onion, spinach and garlic...and it is to die for.  The all-you-can-eat salsa bar adds a fun touch.

EN0bnjK_7zIHOFBOmIOXng.text: Today I got back with my girlfriend. And it happened to be Tuesday. So taco Tuesday right?my mom doesn't let me go out often unless it was prom or some sort of social gathering...but she's on vacation in Dubai, and I wanted to feel dangerous so I decided to take my chick to the hood and found La Santissima.   The neighborhood that the restaurant is located in gave me a sense of impending danger and my girlfriend say she's into bad boys so I think I turned her on when We came into this joint.   The food was OK. Nothing out of the ordinary. Just Mexican food, you know?  Walking out of this restaurant, I feel like a man for once in my life. I took a selfie with La Santissima in the background and sent it to my friends.   When I was walking to my car a homeless person slapped the glasses out of my face...I mean I didn't need them to see, those were sunglasses. I probably shouldn't have worn them at night anyway. I just wanted to be cool and also I wanted to call the police but I sensed some heat coming from between my girlfriends legs so we ended up making out in the parking lot next to the shipping container. Nice placement.

y8McXqf7BI2UEXAkdLpMGw.text: We arrived at 11am and left at 1:10pm.  The food came out extremely slow (12:30) and service was very slow.  The food wasn't bad, but not worth the wait to eat.  The Margs were good, but again, not worth the wait.  The salsas were good and liked the variety.  It was our first time there.  It wouldn't come up in our minds to go eat here again.

Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mix and match tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Marg

QxdWo8i5U1k2PJlHpBUkkw.text: This is the worst Mexican food I had in my life!! I don't even want to take the time to write all the bad things, but it was disgusting!! (The "Arracher steak" really bad quality, taste like horse or dog meat and I'm not jocking).

F3ny3lCOa7-LNFzqCQBNXw.text: Let's eat Mexican. Great place, will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dZ0sCM3CCYZA5hcS3gci8A.text: Love the Santisima Salad with chicken.  I'm not usually a salad person, but this is fully-loaded and quite a large portion.  I love using the spicy green avocado salsa instead of the salad dressing.  Also, love the unique flavors and wide selection at the salsa bar.

wDbSMHHnsIA4acE8VQJfmw.text: Walked into a small crammed room with dingy white walls and Day of the Dead themed wall decor. The place seemed to be in disarray as a regular. Food was basically $10 and up. Quesadilla is good, was like a mexican calzone type thing. All in all, not worth going there. Guy Fieri did them a solid giving them more credit than they deserved. Food was tasty, but perhaps the customer service, seating and cleanliness can be better?

Yn0k1m2Guw8HuYWnP5PECw.text: This place is amazing. We had the horchata, a burrito, and an assortment of tacos.  As mentioned by others it is a smaller space, but the service is fast and good. They also load you up with chips and the salsa bar has a great variety of things to try. You can snack away some of your hunger if you are starved.

TrhD6an_03tZW9ZF4MOYkg.text: Came to La Santisima for some authentic street tacos. Read the reviews on Yelp and had to check it off.  The selection of tacos and salsa is ridiculous. They have so many!!  I kept it simple and had adobada tacos with beans and rice. Really really good.  Definitely authentic! The beans reminded me of my mom's beans.   I appreciated all the gluten free options as well. Decorations were cool!   I gave it a 4 star because the gourmet tacos were a little over priced. Somewhere between 3.95-4.80 a taco. Other than that, everything was great.

abkeW5L_C10Oe8j-YYS7jg.text: Best burrito I've ever had. My bf verbally moans when I say La Santisima. Salsa bar is cool AF and is about as clean as you could hope for when it's open to the public. Love love love this place.

Muti-D7tJ1IMfHKqscggWg.text: I love this place due to the large, I mean really large selection of salsas!  There are over 10 different salsas that are so unique and fresh.  My favorite things to eat is their Chicken Chipotle and Carne Asada tacos with a side of beans (that comes with cheese on top).  These tacos are also on happy hour for $2!  They also have a really good Horchata that is super unique and a little expensive, but it has real nuts and fruit in it that makes it special.  I love bringing friends from out of state here!  Although this place is not in a very safe-looking area, when you walk in it looks very clean and comfortable.  The decor inside is very unique and artistic.  Even the bathroom alone has unique paintings.  I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. happy hour!

x7ac342-C6uSi_b975PCjw.text: I like this place!  Good food and a great patio.  I'm actually giving them 4.5 stars and rounding up.    Even though the salsa is probably the best in Flagstaff, it still is not as good as the Salsa I grew up on in Texas.    They do have a large salsa bar with lots of interesting flavors, but I wish they would get rid of some of the unpopular flavors and focus on the good ones that always seem to run out.   Also the guacamole and horchata are fantastic, but not as good as when they first opened.   I'll be back....

FnLuhwlnoxfrXbb93W_Y_w.text: If you're a salsa lover, this place is for you.  If you're a taco lover, this place is for you.  If you're a living, breathing human person with taste buds, this place is for you.  The chicken tinga tacos are by far my favorite - super robust, smokey flavor pairs perfectly with the acidity from the pickled onions. Mmm! Plus, their salsa bar is one to write home about - get the peanut salsa, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Tinga Tacos &amp; More!

y-PXnEfLFtTb4cTQNLXX7A.text: The good: The tacos here are amazing. Best I've ever had? No. But enjoyable, if pricey. I had the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco and the La Condesa Veggie Taco. The pork taco was tasty, though extremely messy; the onion pieces were huge, but weirdly enough they had no flavor at all. My favorite was the veggie taco. The vegetable variety was great and they were all cooked to perfection--crisp but fully cooked. The cheese on top was like the glue (best glue ever!) and had a lovely salty tang.  My husband had the pork taco as well and also the Sonoran Carne Asada Taco. The steak taco was his definite favorite; he thought the pork chunks were way too big.  Our server was good--much better than when I visited the Glendale location by myself and was ignored.  The bad: Yes, the salsa bar is great, but the restaurant is so crowded that it makes getting the salsa difficult. The restaurant is downright claustrophobic, and it wasn't even fully packed with customers when we were there. We wanted to finish our food and leave ASAP so we could stretch out and breathe. There's not a great deal of parking, either.  The tacos are served in baskets lined with tissue paper. With really messy tacos, that means the paper disintegrates and you can't easily cut big chunks of meat with a knife.  Really, it's a place with great tacos and a horrid location. We won't visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie and pibil tacos

IbA12ulEfEr3yy5kzytTgQ.text: Horrible. I don't understand the ratings.  Chips we're  flavorless, salsa bar was sad and everything almost empty, after saying I was gf brought me a burrito obviously messed my order up and when they finally brought correct dish out it was cold. Seriously what a disappointment! Waitress had an attitude and just did not care. If you are used to good quality food and good service do not come here.

5uZ_NFsdiVTQrvXoNDdyKQ.text: Truly great tasting food and cocktails are amazing.  The restaurant itself is very small and they should figure out another layout.  The wait staff that day was sort of mediocre.

erADt-JJQ-HqDB_smozJFQ.text: I thought I was going to give this place 5 stars. I stopped by for dinner last night with a friend, and we both seemed to have a great meal. I ordered the al pastor quesa, and she ordered the tapatio quesa. We both very much enjoyed the salsa bar too. However, a few hours later, we were both puking our guts out. Update: 12 hours later, still puking.

htH_uw1ljWS7FDI1_8Y92A.text: Specialty burrito was amazing. Veggies were still crisp, marinated chicken was tasty and rice was great. All wrapped up in a light nicely toasted tortilla.  The salsa bar was phenomenal! Quaint atmosphere - I don't live in Phoenix, but I will be sure to eat here when I am in the area.

Nxh1wA7-DWtrNhA05lnglQ.text: So my sister and I decided to try this place out, due to YELP reviews, and man are we happy we did. It was sooo good.   Loved the salsa bar (the pecan, surprisingly, was my favorite) and we both got different versions of their quesadillas. She got the pork pastor and I got the chicken mole. Both were outstanding and different than anything else we've had.   They hand make their own corn tortillas, fill them with cheese and your filling of choice, and then deep fry them. This gave them a crisp outer shell but a light and almost creamy masa interior. So good!    FYI - the neighborhood seemed a little questionable (lots of bars on the Windows) but we went during the day and felt perfectly safe. The place was bumping with other happy diners and we'll definitely be back.

nunqmVYkZBOGEhSiENYl2Q.text: Stop!!!! And wait... forever.  Be prepared to have hunger pains for over an hour (at least) as you wait for your name to be called. Here's the kicker. The restaurant was full of empty frikin tables!!  I'm all in favor of waiting for a good meal...  but waiting endlessly to eat, while the restaraunt sits half empty is some sort of tortuous joke.  And they won't apologize for it, let alone have an explanation.  Go here to starve. Not to 'eat'.  I beg you. Don't go.  How's the food? I have no fu*!%ing idea! After waiting for over an hour, we left. To get good service, and good FOOD elsewhere.  Going here, after spending over $7 on an uber ride, is my first regret. Not getting a photo of the restaurant being empty, while there was a line of famished patrons waiting outside, is my second regret.  Could I have saved them??  No. Can I save you? Yes. It's my obligation.  Cheers,  Dj

iN_AMpH2Bb4bbznbpNzSyg.text: We have eaten here at least 5 times since we moved back WOW the guacamole and the Margaritas are the bomb, but the service and the food are the best in the Valley.  I love this quaint place and will always want to go back, love the food!!!!  And very friendly people there.  Always a happy vibe going on.

ozDDTm2EqwIb4pQVYeX--w.text: Really amazing food. Salsa bar is impeccable. Wait is atrocious, but "they are working on it".   Overall 9/10, but yelp doesn't let you do 0.5 stars and I like to round down

Lpdm0tlp2dMgJ-AE3SQoBg.text: It's Monday, people! What are you all doing here?  That's what I wanted to scream as I asked the gentleman at the bar how long the wait was.  There aren't that many tables stuffed into this small establishment, but apparently they really are that good that people are willing to waste time that they will never get back, to eat here.  So, I stepped outside and summarily informed my wife as to the long wait. I also reminded her that the other places she chose the past two days had prolonged delays for seating. I felt like I had lost precious moments in my life waiting to eat. On the upside, I was spending time with the only person that matters, so it was not even remotely a total loss in time. I was simply exaggerating.  So we waited outside, and tried to engage all the other customers. But, everyone was agitated for having to wait, and no one was wanting to engage in random conversation. In fact, the leaders of each party kept going back inside asking how much longer they would have to wait. I thought it was funny because we were all blocking the front entrance and we would've seen anyone that would've left. So, why bother asking how much longer? Duh!  I also thought how funny it was when a couple would leave, and the groups would go back inside and check in. Lemme do some basic math for you, okay? 2 people leave, and there are 10 of all you all! How many seats do you think will be available? :)  So, I go inside (not to ask how much longer), but I grabbed a menu (why waste time waiting in line and not be prepared), and I commandeer the only remaining flan in the house. I go back outside, and I tell my wife that I reserved the flan. She was a little perturbed because she didn't think I could do that! Well, everyone else is harassing the 2 servers (and one of them is pregnant), and I was just being polite and proactive. I kindly asked if I could have the last flan, and the gentleman set it aside for me.  So, about 50 minutes into the long wait, we finally get a seat. I must say, we really did experience how small this place was because as mobility was definitely impaired when you eat here. There is no chance that you won't bump into ANYONE!   Let's get to the food part. The variety of Salsa that this place offers is amazing. Their unique flavors, and various combinations thereof are fantastic. You can mix and match them, and they just make you that much hungrier with every bite.   We had the Sonora Carne Asada Burro and the Street Tacos. Additionally, we also had the Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken Quesa.   The verdict? Definitely worth the wait. The meats and the sauces were just phenomenal. Each and every bite was wonderful.  Then for the finale, I had my flan. By that time, everyone in our original group was seated and were still in various stages of being served with either drinks or their food orders being taken.  When the pregnant server lady brought out our flan, EVERYONE looked at it with envy as it really was a delicious masterpiece. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed it. Then everyone wanted to order it, but alas, they all found out that I ordered the last one!!! (Evil eyes across the room)  More evil eyes came because I quickly learned how to multitask the server lady. While she was getting our flan, I went ahead and gave her my CC, asked for boxes for our leftovers, and also asked for refills.  So, while she was gone for quite some time preparing our flan, she left the only other server to take care of everyone else. When she returned, she had our box, our refills, our flan, and our check all done.  All we had to do was enjoy the flan, drink our refills, box up our leftovers, and sign the check / fill out her tip.   And we walked out of there, while everyone was still wondering how to get served in here.  A few things that may detract from future experiences that you may want to be aware of. There is minimal parking, so you have to park on the side street but don't block the homes. The wait is long, and the service is slow unless you learn how to stack your requests so they get stuff done in one trip.  Otherwise, what a wonderful dining experience, even for a Monday night!  (Gosh, how I missed it when Monday Night Football was going on. I never had to endure this during those times)

OhgTYv-gJM7ufz9LKXZ06Q.text: Omg this is my new favorite taco place in Phoenix. There is a wait during lunch so call in your order or be prepared to stand in line. The horchata is also amazing. I got a lot of different tacos but couldn't decide on a favorite. They also offer other foods as well. We went for a business lunch which was great. Atmosphere was nice, not too loud. The cheese dip appetizer is really good.

1kAEmDhrr-QCzy-RnP52-w.text: I desperately wanted to love this place.  Unfortunately I thought it was just average.  The salsa bar, the unique tacos, etc. all seemed like the right lineup.  Taste is king and I didn't think any of my 4 different tacos was striking.  Not a bad dining experience at all, just not amazing.    Ambience, service, etc were all great.  Perhaps others will find it more amazing.  Maybe I would try a burrito next time?

6gfSHoFGTNSFxefeZ-3aDA.text: I went here with my family and it was a really good experience. We waited only 10 minutes for a party of four, and we got seated promptly after that.   The assortment of salsas are incredible, my favorite is the avocado and the strawberry salsas. I had a burrito that was one of the most popular ones and it was absolutely delicious.   Check out this unique place if you're looking for a great taco spot!

vKeogoHYYkX7_nw0HfxR5g.text: Best margaritas I've EVER had. Tacos are fantastic, salsa delicious and authentic. Everything is fresh. Only downside is that it's quite small. Worth the wait and prices are great

mUstXGnkIh7jkwLvCowOeA.text: We went based on Yelp reviews and are very happy for it.  The restaurant has an authentic feel to it and some interesting wall art.  Not a single sombrero in sight.  We both had the tacos,  which are amazing. I recommend you get 2, unless you are really hungry.  The guacamole we had was also very good.  All the staff were friendly and helpful.  We recommend this place.

Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HaDwX1SUBLOXFaskIW5CTg.text: Amazing tacos and Mexican food in a very small settings.  The only limitation is its size which adds to the charm. The food is amazing service is good and the salsa bar will help you explore aside to salsa you never knew existed.

eLRTxCJFHHSni2LlZ_W0Ww.text: What a cute little place! It's hard to not notice it when driving by :) I had the shark and beer battered fish tacos and they satisfied my craving. First time trying shark though! Love the salsa bar! lots of variety to choose from. Would love to come back and try other options on their menu next time I'm in the area!

vxfecaE-yccuq7HWBm1rPQ.text: I went for breakfast on Sunday.  The huevos ahogados were an absolute life changer.  I recently relocated from Dallas to Phoenix, and was looking for a change of pace, as far as Mexican food is concerned.  This place is so authentic and the people there are really helpful.    This place is now a staple in my short list of amazing spaces.

R5c6J2w5LgJK3s3blHnEpg.text: food was pretty alright.  the menu is quite extensive, it can overload people if they don't really know what they want.  I had to ask for suggestions since there was so much going on.  the hostess/server made a couple suggestions for me though, and i was pleased with what i received.  the organization with staff though really needs to be improved like others have said.  all the servers and hostesses appear to be college aged girls yet they don't seem to know what's going on when the place gets crowded.  after i had been seated, we still waited 20 minutes for someone to take our order and it wasn't even the server that's supposed to take our table.  it was the hostess that took our order and told us "our" server would be by with out food.  i like the food, not the disorganization though

XI6XwSOMKZ44NiiOGH1svg.text: Awesome restaurant! We were stoked to find this after flying in from out of town. Plenty of options for the vegetarian/vegans and meat lovers. Incredible salsa bar. Allow yourself time to look over the menu, definitely not your "American Mexican".

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetarian Tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa Bar
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meat trio with rice and beans

kkcc8iI8_atQL2D5mdyeKQ.text: We love this place. Delicious food, quaint atmosphere, and delicious food. Recently expanded to double the space, there may still be a wait, but it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy to see this hometown gem expanded and doubled in size.

pONhS4Z_1wcWLRhNNVlYoQ.text: Very good gourmet tacos, and excellent service by Matt and the bartender. Got El gaucho with beef, Cabo shrimp, and a mole chicken taco.

Tb4_OpurmqpKmN2zSAhNow.text: Found this little gem from Yelp reviews and it was AMAZING!! The food was outstanding! The salsa bar was unreal with so many choices and so delicious. We went 2 times in the same 4 day trip because it was so good. When you pull up it's not the nicest area of town and it seems a little sketchy at first but don't let appearances fool you, the food is OUTSTANDING!

uy69EYukoPd1ugrU3pxNDA.text: Pass! No kids menu. Expensive and very different from the typical Mexican restaurant.   Although the margarita was great, the food was not. We asked for a burrito for each of the kids containing just chicken and cheese, and they charged us $25 for the two of them. My husband and I ordered a chicken burrito that was so-so, for $10 each.   I would have been fine with the prices if the food was good but it wasn't. The chicken was almost all rubbery dark meat.   The salsa bar was fun but the chips were stale. The service was okay but I couldn't believe they charged us more for two burritos that contained less ingredients for the kids.

mj0ew5WZ2u06wAoYY9JXQQ.text: By far one of my favorite Mexican restaurants to eat at in Phoenix.  I recommend it every time i get the opportunity. Everything from their exceptional salsa bar to their Quesas! You will not leave disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesa con papas y chorizo!

mepZtO44NWaeZbch5zqlgQ.text: I can't say enough good things about La Santisima. Best Margarita I've ever had! Get the house (Santisima) Margarita.Tacos and Quesas are beyond delicious. Everyone I've taken there has fallen in love with it too.

buX2ffeS35tNPD1BtvoTEw.text: I really like the choices of salsa. They give you some interesting flavours and textures by using pecans and jicama. As weird as it sounds, it's worth trying it out to discover new things and it might surprise you like it did me.  When I came here, I was a little disappointed because they didn't have any shrimps so I couldn't get one of the tacos I wanted. I ended up getting  the Baja Sur Shark Taco and another taco. Both were very good, but I did prefer the Shark Taco. I also had their horchata which was just okay...it had too much cinnamon for me, but I like the addition of fruits and nuts with it.  This place gets crowded especially during lunch time and it's a small place. They've got interesting paintings on the walls.
