HFmoONgk9vnSVY--ST947g.text: I wouldn't know. After sitting at our table for 20 min with no service, i left. Thank God you can throw a rock and hit good Mexican food in this town. I went down the street to La Frontera and got real tacos

ycGbehXv60e80a_TJJZz0A.text: The saddest thing about this place is that it's more than 2,000 miles from my house. Hands down, best street tacos I've ever had! Mix and match them if you go.

Zeeh7AFLmAJdIssKe07wmA.text: My dad & I were in town for the day. We were sooo hungry & in the mood for anything so yelp helped me find this place & of course we were kind of iffy about it & expected it to be like every other Mexican restaurant, BUT we were totally mistaken! My dad is from Mexico City, but has been living in the US for almost 22 years. This is the FIRST place ever to actually have tacos that tasted just like from his hometown! He even teared up because of the memories that filled him (no i'm not exaggerating!), & when my dad says the tacos are authentic then they are! This place will be the only reason why we will come back to Phoenix! Hopefully this place lives on for good! :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool entrance.

xp7wyicylEFXTMoNbCs48w.text: Visited on Thursday February 23rd at 6.30PM. It had been a while since our last visit and i noticed the restaurant had expanded. Great expansion because i did feel in the past that this restaurant was rather cramped. We arrived at the door noticing at least 5-6 empty tables and room at the bar. We were greeted by a young hostess who stated that she was not allowed to leave anyone in because the waitresses/waiters were too busy and she did not have enought menus for everyone. We asked if we could sit at the bar and drink water until they were ready. We did state that we drove 45 minutes to get here. She stated that it might be anywhere from 40 min to 1 hour wait. My frustration with this whole scenario was that there were plenty of tables open and we were not allowed to sit down. Why expand a restaurant if you cant staff it correctly and get enough menus for each seating space in the restaurant. I will never visit this restaurant again based on this experience.

SR1zsgRuDOoEpZBasX9NEQ.text: Overpriced. The food was different, but I didn't enjoy the taste and will not return.

yQJMaCDrZacTtS9EJ--iiQ.text: Love Love Love this place! ALL of the food is amazing! I am a salsa freak so the FRESH salsa bar is wonderful! I always get a refreshing Michelada when I go here! If I had to pick a favorite item on the menu it would be the carne asada burrito. I love that it has just GOOD quality meat, pinto beans and thats it! Oh and they toast the out side of the tortilla to give it the perfect amount of crunch. just know that this is a small place and if you come right at dinner time especially on the weekends you will had to wait but it is soooo worth it!

SspuIym778zUAsp18v785w.text: Only reason i cant give them 0 stars b/c its not an option.Never stopping here ever again....stopped on a Sat 1/21/17 asked for table of 8, I get it its a small place and tables are scarce but was told 20min wait....waited 1.5hrs for nothing. Multiple parties of 4 went ahead of us. When I asked why the wait was taking so long and having multiple 4 people parties go ahead when  their tables could have been combined to accommodate us, the waitress gave me attitude and back peddled b/c she couldn't come up with a reason why others were being seated before us. If they weren't going to accommodate us just communicate and we could have gone elsewhere without wasting 1.5hrs of time. Can't rate the food b/c we were never given any service.

nY1fRSr4MjdmSLKVV09OLw.text: The place has changed quite a bit since I have reviewed it.  Now there is a bar and a wait staff.  I ordered an horchata, a cochinita pibil taco, a shark taco, a smoked mahi mahi taco, guacamole, and also tried the al pastor taco, and pollo asada taco.  (I didn't order this all on my own.  I had a group of four and we shared.)  The decor is dope and makes you feel like you are about to have a great taco experience.  The horchata is 5/5 hands down the best horchata you will have in your life.  I'm talking nuts, strawberries, cantaloupe, cinnamon, and more.  Devine.  The shark taco is boring.  Not much flavor at all and needs lots of salsa to give it some taste.  The cochinita pibil is 5/5.  Tasty, mouth watering, juicy, flavorful.  Excellent.  The smoked mahi had some nice flavors but was lacking on meat big time.  The guac was average.  They put fruit in it and pomegranates to try to kick it up and be creative but it didn't quite come together.  It needs some more work.  The al pastor was very disappointing.  I am a huge al pastor fan and this was poorly done.  Dry, lacking flavor, very boring.  The pollo asada was exactly the same as the pastor.  Boring and dry.  The beans and rice were above average.  Nice flavor, moist, and good texture.  They also changed out the tortillas and now have dry boring corn rather than the awesome soft ones I had before.    I stand by my opinion on the salsas as I had on my first experience.  It's cool to have 20 options but only four of them are worth your time.  Two of the reds, and two of the greens.  Sesame salsa?  Peanut salsa?  I tried them all.  No thanks.  It's obvious this place is knocking it out of the park.  It is very trendy, always packed, and holds over a few hundred reviews.  If you go and you probably should. Mark my words.  Order the horchata, two cochinita pibil tacos, and stock up on the traditional salsas.

wGrwP_mPedcrBSo0haG4Ng.text: Fantastic. I had gaucho borro, was delicious but I should have added rice and beans. Margaritas were tasty too. Guacamole was from perfectly ripe avocados, which I really appreciated.  If you go at night, don't be discouraged by the total lack of lighting outside. Inside the food was great and staff was welcoming.

V90gMN72C-UxX36VrF5V2A.text: Love the food. Wife and I visit her ever so often and I've tried a few different dishes. This place is not your run of the mill regular meat, cheese, tortilla and red sauce Mexican cuisine. Plenty of seafood and veggie items. The salsa bar alone is something to visit for as there are so many delicious items.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Looking out the front window.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New decoration.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Abora Burro.

GXlwGznCbfZ3adCfJIUGsw.text: The food is very good, but probably not "gourmet". The entrees and salsas won't disappoint, and there are great choices for everyone. In all honesty though, La Santisima is just a cut below the Taco Guild or Barrio Cafe. It is not that they are doing anything wrong - the other places are just a little bit better.  The food is inexpensive, the drinks are good, and you won't leave without a smile on your face.

qaHJEzQOJXrNvqaVQR-6mA.text: La Condesa was the final push to convince me to sign up for Yelp.  I've been using Yelp for years to find everything from local cuisine to family doctors but now it's time to share.  So here goes...  La Condesa was excellent.  From the moment we entered through the heavy spanish doorway, to the smart and humble decor - we knew we had found something unique.    Our server was polite, engaging, and insightful.  We've been searching for the ultimate Baja-style Fish Taco so we chose a-la-carte tacos this time and will return later for the full meal.  What we did experience this time was a dream come True in the land-locked state of Arizona.  The two pieces of fish in each taco were huge, hot, and crispy, wrapped in a light corn tortilla with a liberal covering of cabbage and white sauce.  With the first bite I was instantly taken back to memories of lounging beach-side in Mexico, or more recently the taco shops of Southern California.  My second and continued bites were adjusted to new heights of flavor with the plethora of home-made salsas available.  I can't wait to return and plan to bring friends!  Troy.

bH43kmNUD0D4FR02m1_wwQ.text: Great Food! The numerous fresh made salsas at the salsa bar we all flavorful and tasty, even when they brought the heat.  That is how I judge a good salsa. If you bring the heat ... The flavor better be there too!  Really liked the Salsa Pecan!  The fried quesadillas are wonderful. Loved the Al Pastor.  The burritos are well portioned and full of meat   They need to work on servers being more attentive.  Even when they are "in the weeds."  They were obviously down a person given the way tables were not getting cleared quickly.

doa3ykz6qxr50UrEu93CLw.text: Very good. From the hot chips to the variety  of salsas great flavors. I had the steak taco and shrimp taco excellent  seasoning, piping hot and nice waiter.

SuyNhY9A_t7SBcB0Kx8JDg.text: When you come here, the best thing you can do is order a plate of tacos, more tacos then you can comfortably eat (but you'll eat all of them, damn it) and build a fortress with the salsa cups.  There are so many different kinds of salsa here.  Just keep going back until you have a cup of each different kind and stack them so you create a barrier and no one can see you stuff your face with that delicious food.  Don't be afraid to wipe with your sleeve, because no one will see you.... the wall of cups of salsa will be blocking you.  Eh?  See, I think ahead.

w_FSdLd-IA2l5Rb54_wOaQ.text: Tasty tacos, great decor, pretty mediocre service.  Setting: I was pretty excited to try out this place, because I'm a fool for good tacos. This place definitely stands out in its neighborhood--the facade does a great job of making it do so. The inside has a great-looking bar area, the artwork is really nice (I dig the Dia de los Muertos theme), and the furniture is nice and colorful. It's a cozy little place, with tables very close to each other to fit in as many as possible in a relatively small area.  Food: The food is pretty excellent. I ended up trying 4 different tacos during my visit, and they were all very good. I tried the Mayan Cochinita Pibil, La Condesa Veggie Taco, the whitefish taco, and the Gaucho taco. I was most excited about the cochinita pibil, because it's one of my favorite dishes, but I ended up being most impressed by the gaucho taco. The steak in it was very well done, and the flavors went well with each other. I could have used some more chimichurri, but it was tasty nonetheless. The cochinita pibil was very good as well. The whitefish taco was a little bland. I wouldn't have minded some stronger flavors in it. And the veggie taco was quite good--right up there with the cochinita pibil. The rice and beans, though not the star of the show, were really good! I liked that the rice was a little "stickier" than most rice you find outside of more Asian-type restaurants. And the beans had great flavor.  When I first opened the menu, I was very conflicted over what to order. There are so many great options! I'll definitely have to come back and sample some of the other options. The salsa bar is pretty great. There is a good range of selections, including a few options I had never seen before (e.g., strawberry salsa and pecan salsa).  Service: This was definitely the downside to the experience. Despite there being nobody in front of me waiting for a table when I arrived, it took about 30 minutes of waiting to get a table. Seeing as there is nowhere inside to wait, that's a long wait in the Phoenix summer heat. Once seated, it took a further 15 minutes for anybody to come over and ask for my order. And once I had finished, I sat there for about 30 minutes before I had an opportunity to request our check. Fortunately, I wasn't in any sort of hurry, but that's a lot of waiting.  All in all, I enjoyed the experience and will be back. It's a little pricey for tacos, but the ingredients generally merit a price higher than your typical taco stand.

Sa1YSJhVQayRT_susJfL7g.text: The -1 star is only for the atmosphere, bad lighting and sound system (with loud music). Their veggie tacos were tasty, with fresh tortillas and yummy salsa. Tasted like Abuelita was in the kitchen. Our server looked like he wasn't a day over 18, but seemed like he had years of experience, and very nice. Almost hope they don't spruce up the place, it would be difficult to get their delicious food!

uTc1JV8JCUJ_hlJ7xia-Hg.text: Excellent food.  Great choice of salsas. Good service.  Can get crowded because it's not the biggest place, but honestly it's not usually a problem to get a table right away if you go right after work and get there between 5-6 p.m., plus then you can take advantage of happy hour. Woot!

Q-wwaSUm77IFsXS0ZGXs4w.text: I've been all over the web to find out how much you charge for your fancy tacos. Can't find your prices..code for toooo high for me. Sorry.

pLomP0Zu6UkV693HF2W-HA.text: Man we had 3 moms and 3 kids and 3 babies for lunch! The place was packed so we waited about 45 minutes for a table. The food was good and the staff did the best they could to walk around us! Thank you for understanding!

iVMP1jC7qBJS9Fb-NXWQmQ.text: Authentic food is so lacking in our culture today.  This is a rare find for excellent, native Mexican food.

E-gj61KzNtgcFMFBEC8SFQ.text: The food is excellent. The salsa game is strong. Do not go to this shop if you are in a hurry quality takes a little time. All of their margaritas are $5 all day Tuesday. There house margarita is one of the best margaritas I have ever had.

WxB1jHmImwD70qMjYbR1sA.text: Awesome food!! Really really good! Great atmosphere as well. Definitely recommend for Mexican food lovers!

nRKk7-5URbe4OHROzeyHlA.text: Have to eat here when I'm in Phoenix. Delicious, especially the salsa bar. I went back so many times, that I told the waiter just to bring me a soup bowl and a spoon. Who knew my favorite was the radish salsa? Not me.  The quesadillas are like none other: made with fresh corn masa, kind of puffy, and loaded with your choice of filling.  La Santisimima, mi corazon, I'll see you in November.

eDhIUAHF-nGRWOebaTbiRg.text: The food was great ! But the service was really REALLY bad . Our server Sandra was super friendly tho. She's very kind and sweet. The hosts and the gentlemens who were their were really rude . Only reason why I stayed was because I had already ordered.

nFp2ZoPpIejyq9Sd7cEFWw.text: We drove from Mesa & it didn't take too long on a Sunday afternoon. It was our first time so we parked right off of 16th Ave. but I would not recommend it because backing out is dangerous due to limited visibility.  Atmosphere: There were paintings on every wall. Most of them are themed after Dia de los Muertos--the Day of the Dead which is the restaurant's theme. There was a small bar with about 4 bar stools. I would say maximum seating capacity is about 35 because & that is packing every table full & there is barely any room to scoot your chair out to walk around. The muzak reminded me of Jamaican music but my husband said it sounded "chips & salsa" music to him. lol  Food: My daughters are picky & do not enjoy spicy food. Both of the enjoyed the burrito, the orig. quesadilla & the rice. The cheese was unique & flavorful. I am 42 & don't remember ever having eaten it before. Here is a bit about it (Oaxaca cheese  is a white, semi-hard cheese from Mexico, similar to unaged Monterey Jack, but with a mozzarella-like string cheese texture. It is named after the state of Oaxaca in southern Mexico, where it was first made) y husband said the 3 street tacos he ordered were DELISIOCO. In other words, if it had been served on a plate that was sitting on the floor he still would have eaten them. We also enjoyed the Mexican Coke & strawberry soda while my husband had a Corona with lime. For dessert we shared a slice of Tres Leche Cake (4 ways) which was topped with a bit of whipped cream, drizzled with caramel sauce & pieces of pecan.   Overall: The food was very good but I felt bad for them & the customers who left because there was nowhere to sit. I suggest they do what they can to buy out the business adjacent to them & knock out the wall to expand at their current address or, better yet (unless they have other parking I don't know about) relocate to a building with more parking & tables.

b1CAaOGR7KsnG21jzaWdDQ.text: I'm visiting from San Diego where we have the best Mexican food . The menu , I didn't really get so I ordered the soup which was great ! A little bit of direction on where to order would be good . The line was long the people in front of me didn't know where to order, they just passed me a menu . I stood in line hoping that that was what I was supposed to be doing . My star rating is for the salsa bar , I'm very impressed. It's hard to find places that offer a hot salsa

bGFEyL9T-B3cojUmMIFdeQ.text: Amazing Mexican food with a variety of delicious salsas at their salsa bar. Our favorite was the salsa pecan and the tomatillo salsa. Lots of taco options including a yummy veggie one with beer battered avocado. Definitely check this place out.

4Xofl1lj0-ON3u2ZJyBA_Q.text: Really Good Food! Had the shark taco, it was interesting. This is probably one of the best taco joints I've been to in phoenix.

gng5JXUsMbcimh9emmCS3A.text: I'm from California and I would move across the street from this place. Fantastic tacos and salsa. The pork was great. My barbacoa was great. My chorizo was great. This is all you need to know.

DrOROrqzszXKFhryiaDfiQ.text: This place is great.  I love the salsa bar.  They have so many types of salsa.  Small and can get crowded but worth it.

rbSiFzhmAE46j_JF31Um_A.text: My favorite taco shop in all the land! Great tacos, amazing salsa (my favorite are the green salsas, and especially the Salsa Pecan), and great drinks.  I love consistency in a restaurant- I've been coming to Santisima since it was Condesa, and each time, it's the same, great food. I always get the 3 taco plate with rice and beans- their rice is soooooo good! I usually have the Santisima Especial (I hope that's what it's called!) and it is the best! It is a smaller space, I would recommend going in off hours.  I always want to try the horchata, but I'm always way too full! The margaritas are delicious, but pricey and not as strong as they cost.  Mmmmm... Santisima!

qxWeMgFLfhXr12V_uqh7Mg.text: Wow talk about authentic Mexican food!! Amazing tacos amazing salsa!!! Amazing horchata!!! The food here is pricey but so worth it!! I'm in love you can tell everything is made with love!!! From the second we walked in to when we left they had people coming in and out of the doors! Food came out fast and service was fast for how busy it was! I will be back and so will my party! Best Mexican food in the city hands down!!!

m8plq-GgseH4GzVTM1VyjA.text: Tried out this little place after trying their new location in Glendale. Man is this place small! There's limited parking up front and the whole restaurant can fit in my backyard. BUT the food is still as wonderful and delicious as ever!   We arrived after going to Comicon and where immediately greeted and told the wait time. Once someone vacated a table, it was cleaned quickly for the next person. Our food came out at a reasonable time and so worth the wait! Our server was very friendly  and gave us some delicious suggestions. I would definitely come back!   Just be careful where you park because during rush hour, you won't be able to get out easily.

CriwmRlo6CVacRbx9ZKMOA.text: Good Mexican Food,  Long wait but worth it.

jIsBqo1i7VBuCq4aq64oMg.text: Best Mexican food!!!! Love the salsa bar food is always fresh and amazing !! Have had everything on the menu and absolutely love it !!! Everyone in downtown Phoenix must try this place !!

n9gR9CIxW3eUJBAco1trsw.text: Mole sauce and strawberry salsa! Show up early or come ready to wait. I will definitely come back next time I'm in the area.

RdfzOAnxHSo_kfeUqVIdZw.text: The food is wonderful the margaritas are top notch service was good. My only problem with this place is that it's too small for the amount of people that come in here. I seen a signed picture of Chef Guy that was signed for diners,drive inn ,and dives; from 2 years sago. I wonder with all the business that they have seen why not expand? But anywhoo, everything was great I just don't like feeling rushed due to others coming in, starring waiting for a table.

JO4PMA0nbk7kApNFA1GV3Q.text: Great tacos and especially salsas in a somewhat crowded small shop on 16th st. Maybe the best part of the experience is loading up on the salsas from the salsa bar and going to town on warm chips. (My favorite is the peanut salsa).   They are also really are proud of the chocolate mole which is very unique and something I have not seen at other shops. They mole is great, very flavorful, but also very intense, so make sure you want a hardy meal before ordering a dish with it! Parking can be tight, especially if you come during the lunch hour as there are only a handful of spots outside the building.

sgokZWXu1V_NmEdfNMhV0g.text: Delicious food and reasonable price. I like Mexican food so much, La Santisima  is great Mexican restaurant.

gj9aWPezU7byrMuS8iFEOQ.text: This place makes the best horchatas, we  had Their tinga, carne asada, and pastor tacos and they were dang delicious all the meats had so much flavor, if I wasn't so full I would have ordered 6 more tacos, I also ordered their house lonche. It's pretty much a torta.   That one so good nice crunchy bread, and the Oaxaca cheese was so soft and full of flavor. Will definitely be coming back for more  Thank you guys for the great service

R_Kjg3R9R4TE21fnjSqTkA.text: Amazing food!!! Great service!!! Loved it!!! I will go back for sure! The guacamole salsa was amazing!!!

He8dUnrPhBBIEyG0Zgs5VA.text: I have to say, I thought it may have been a pipe dream to think that because Phoenix is closer to the Mexican border that we may be able to find better Mexican restaurants here. But the theory proved True. I'm from Minneapolis, where good Mexican places are few and far between, the only good one I can think of being Los Ocampo.   This place had the best salsa bar I've seen yet. The steak tacos I had were excellent; the meat was moist and flavorful with no gristle and little fat. They would have been even better with a little cilantro though. The rice and beans were some of the best I've had; the rice was a tad soft/wet but the flavor was spot on. We had margaritas, apparently on special, for only $3 a pop. They were tasty but strong enough-enough that I had to let my husband finish mine off because I was driving. The only thing I would say needs improvement is the ambiance; my chair was uncomfortable and difficult to scoot in and out from the table, which was a big pain and drew attention to us when I attempted to nurse our baby. The chairs could use reupholstering too.  Tip: their parking is out front but easy to miss when you're driving down 16th, which is a busy thoroughfare with a speed limit of 45 (?) don't quote me on that but people drive FAST.

_O_xQnT9iSeAspmhhzhMug.text: We drove down from Prescott, for the day, to do a little shopping and found this place via Yelp.   SO glad we decided to drive the extra 20 minutes to get there (despite being surrounded by restaurants at the mall).   This place is good for vegans, vegetarians, and meat eaters alike.  I chose the Ghandi and the veggie tacos (cactus), while my friend had meaty street tacos. The food was fresh & delicious and the portion size was perfect.    Loved the salsa bar!!  Other reviewers mentioned the dried cranberries in the guacamole. It was a delicious sweet addition and the guac was perfect!  We will definitely return for a meal next time we're in Phoenix hungry for Mexican food.

rI_oIYkMIrv0lhjfuqhtqw.text: The Salsa bar is really cool but the food is just OK.  I would recommend going for a snack(chips and salsa) and a couple beers, not dinner.

t9vQdkR5-k6KykvQfOmVXw.text: Diner's Drive-ins and Dives location...  known for their tacos and salsa bar.  Everything was tasty and the prices were good.  Service is basically counter service, but good.  The place is small, but they seem to move quickly.  Don't be surprised with a wait for a table.  Make sure to try as many salsas as you can.  The tacos were very good - I had very high expectations, and while I wasn't blown away, they were very good.

PMNm5vPkI8WAjgaTOyfvMg.text: This is one of my favorite places. The food is unlike any other place in town. The enchiladas are thick. The salsa bar is great. The only problem is that it is small, so it can get crowded quick.

g6aVX4ifFjT4L2P8nXJmUg.text: I was really excited to try this spot as I drive by it almost every day. My boyfriend and I decided to check it out on a week night. The place was very busy so there was a thirty minute wait. Once we were seated to took more than 15 min to have our drink order taken. We ordered our food and proceeded to wait another half hour. The tacos were "specialty", but I didn't enjoy any of them . The chicken mile was not good at all. There was a thin layer of beans which was almost comical. The pricing was ridiculous to top it off. I will NEVER go back there again and strongly discourage my friends from even trying it.

iwuGympNMmGQtX-C9BVLWg.text: La Condesa, you stole my heart.  Gourmet Taco Shop indeed.  Your saucy mole put me over the top.  You really know how to spice up a relationship with your many wonderful salsas.  I loved your warm decor and warmer service.  I can't wait to come back to sample your salsas and try more tacos.  I finally made my way here to meet some friends on a trip to Phoenix about a month ago, then I met another friend here on my most recent trip.  $3.99 gourmet street tacos.  Filling.  20 or so salsas.  Delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DpQfq9kATzdNo168X7Lvlg.text: I have had the great pleasure of working with Suzy and Bruce at Inter Valley Escrow. As a lender that has worked with countless escrow companies I can say with absolute certainty this is one of the best you will ever find. It is because of Suzy and Bruce. They go WAY above and beyond what is expected to make a deal come together. I highly recommend them to anyone who wants an escrow company that is fast, courteous, and willing to go the extra mile!

BPMMuYOgWXb8L6pAHykQIg.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE.  The food is good but the terrible service killed it for me.  It appears as though the waiter didn't know the menu very well!  Won't go back!

q1JdrKH99mIXqOUvsSgZ1w.text: I use to go there and the food and salsa bar was excellent! I don't know what happened! They either sold the place or got different cooks or changed their recipes on their sauces, but things have really changed for the worse! I am really disappointed! It use to be the best place in town! I  am really sad! I see they are opening other places! If they don't get better they will lose business!

q8mkIZjDsFVmd-KXUzmTNw.text: Wow!!! The food is amazing!!! The margaritas were very good as well. Joel, our server, took great care of us!!! Cool place to come to with family and friends.

jP-mlQQeh195ajhvZptO7w.text: The food here is excellent.  The atmosphere is fun and they have a great salsa bar.

5GD0KVazYx4aAWdjKGKjhQ.text: Hunting for authentic Mexican food??  La Santisima is the REALS!! They have over a dozen salsas in their salsa bar and let you help yourself with the complimentary basket of chips.  I ordered (2) Carne Asada and (1) Al Pastor taco and added the rice and beans for a total of $8.97.  Let me start by saying your food comes out piping hot on a hot plate.  The food is made fresh and it shows.  The refried beans were delicious, really creamy, and flavorful. The rice was not dry and also way above average in taste.  The Asada was so flavorful and tender. Definitely better than most places I frequent. The beef was not chewy at all and has an almost melt in your mouth consistency.  The Al Pastor was also amazing with all fresh ingredients including the pineapple.  If you're in the Coronado area, do yourself a favor and check out this little gem!

Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. El Gaucho Tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Asada and Al Pastor

vSrLtAZfb9FcGqSsHUfX7g.text: Wow.  This is a great spot.  After driving by two times, I finally parked near the party supply company and walked into La Santisima to find a small dining room full of satisfied customers...and a huge salsa bar!  Highlights include the Santisima taco with Oaxaca cheese, and the baja shrimp.

gWuxfT3hwNgkpkvbV6rIfQ.text: After moving from San Diego, CA I found the best Mexican food here. Vegetarian/Vegan is just awesome. Food quality is great, clean and variety of sauces excellent. They just need to improve their setting chairs. It's very old and foam coming out.

lwlcxFW6WO5qIgCnZZpF0w.text: I have tried to eat here so many times and the wait is always RIDICULOUS! There's always empty tables and the line waiting is longer than people are seating eating. It's at least a 30 min wait even though more than half the restaurant is empty.  I have come on both weekday and weekend and early around 5-6 pm.  Being a pregnant mother of a toddler waiting is just not an option. Seems like a bad business model. Go to Taco Sahuahro instead excellent cheap street tacos.

ZWCdobRjRAEq5YwYlLMxFg.text: This place is delicious. Everything tasted fresh, service was great and tons of salsas to choose from. This is my go to spot when I'm near downtown!

swb9qr58qAMl0OYaY0qhUw.text: We absolutely love this place!  The food is amazing as is the Horchata (my favorite). The service is always good and the people are friendly. The salsa bar is wonderful and has a great variety. We drive 45 minutes just to eat here :-)  One of my favorite places to take visiting family and friends to get a taste of the amazing Mexican food in Phoenix.

_3jF8aQBXf5kMeMU9K2dUQ.text: La Santisima's been in my bookmark list for some time. I had heard a lot of good things about it and their menu had some items you don't often see such as cochinita pibil and chile en nogada. We got here around brunch time and I decided on the black mole chilaquiles. I love mole and I also love chilaquiles so the combo sounded perfect. The chilaquiles come with your choice of "traditional vegetable," egg, or options for meat such as chicken. I asked the server what vegetables came with the vegetable chilaquiles but there seemed to be a language barrier; he didn't really understand what I was asking him, only saying yes there are vegetables and when I asked again, that it was a popular choice.  When we arrived we were seated promptly by the hostess but it took quite a bit of time for a server to come over and take our orders. So, we had plenty of time (Plenty....) to take in the atmosphere. I love the Dia de Los Muertos theme of the restaurant and the paintings of la Catrina were stunning. We also indulged in the salsa bar which had a plethora of unique options such as sesame, pecan, and peanut salsa. While I appreciate all the variety, most of the salsas to me were just so-so. Either they were too one-dimensional in taste or had an overpowering flavor that was a turn off for me. My favorite of all the ones I tried was the pecan salsa. I normally don't like creamy salsas but I liked the nuanced, nutty flavor combined with rich smooth creaminess. One suggestion would be to list the heat level for all the salsas since some were a lot hotter than others (I think the peanut was the most spicy of the bunch I tried).  Getting our dishes also took quite a bit of time. There was only one other table (A 4-top) that had ordered ahead of us and our meals weren't really that complicated to make. When I received my dish, it looked nice but when I looked at the ingredients I thought, "This is it?" It was a handful of chips, a ton of mole sauce, a small sprinkling of melted cheese and a small portion of black beans. As for the "traditional vegetables", I received a laughable amount of the tiniest pieces of avocado (2 pieces not quite the size of a pinkie finger), and about 4 slivers of red onion. Are they really hurting for money that much they can't spare me more onion at least? Or at least a regular sized piece of avocado? If I had known there was so little in this dish I might have spruced it up by upgrading to adding an egg or chicken. The taste itself was OK. I did enjoy the complex flavors of the mole sauce and the chips tasted good but after a while the dish really needed some extra forms of vegetable (Or bigger portions of them) to balance out all the deep, earthier flavors. The chilaquiles came with 2 buttered slices of baguette which I thought was weird. I've never had crusty bread with chilaquiles before. They tasted good at least.  I did take a bite of another breakfast dish, one with chorizo, hash browns, beans and egg. That one was a huge portion and a lot better.  While I did enjoy the ambiance, my dish was not worth the amount of money I paid for it. Add to that the painfully slow service when it wasn't even that busy I would probably visit another Mexican restaurant in this area over this one.

LEsDPKv5DV5DIosxuut78Q.text: Usually has a long wait and a tight place. Food is decent, I've tried tacos and they were okay.

XkZ5RxvbU0r5yzaEhvV79w.text: I've been to this place a few times and I always get the same thing. Oaxaca chocolate mole burrito is one of my favorite things to eat. Their art in the restaurant is amazing too I would definitely recommend this place to all of my friends. Also my favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix

U48vTZmgL-k1hJvJqzOiwA.text: We order the steak taco, chicken chipotle and two shark tacos. The chipotle chicken taco was the best thing we ate.  It was saucy with the pickled red onion on top.  Yummm. They have a very unique salsa bar with lots of choices for salsa, some cream based, some vegetable  based. Very cool.

kThF5No90WTN3h8u_3i3uQ.text: This is a hidden gem in Phoenix. Their Jamaica Rose Shrimp burrito is A-MAZ-ING! Prices are reasonable, lunch rush hour can get a bit crazy but there's always room to sit and their food never lets you down.

oiYCmsi_a7OomX_ozE8I8A.text: Best margaritas ever! Tiger shrimp tacos are my favorite. Large salsa bar. Cool artwork. Nice staff. It's a favorite!

24HoosQDvopuK_C6QnPoxw.text: The best fish taco I ever had. I love their black mole sauce. The service is as good as their food. Highly recommend.

uUdTdK2iQO67KhCWf1W7Lg.text: Man, I've never given such a low review... where do I start? So I get an hour long lunch everyday. I work extremely close to La Santisma, so I figured that this would be a great place to check out and that I'd have plenty of time to sit down and enjoy my food. Wrong.  I showed up with a coworker around 2:30pm. There were maybe 18 other customers MAX in the restaurant. It took about 15 minutes for us to get cups of water and it took 30-35 minutes for someone to take our order. And had I not approached a waitress requesting to have our orders taken, it probably would've taken longer. There were plenty of waiters and waitresses standing around, chatting. Customers that came in after us were served before us.  The menu is huge. There is SO much to choose from. This is a huge plus! It's a little overwhelming but I LOVE variety. I couldn't decide so I asked the waitress to tell me what the spiciest burrito on the menu was. I ended up requesting the Mayan burro.  While we were waiting for our food to arrive, we checked out the awesome salsa bar. I LOVE salsa and tried every single one of their options. My favorite was definitely the cilantro one as well as the green chile one. We visited the salsa bar 3-4 times (seriously, we loved it), and our food still hadn't arrived.  Upon its arrival, we had to wait an extra couple of minutes for utensils and napkins. By the time we had everything, we had maybe 10 minutes left to eat our food. I ended up eating a fourth of my burrito and took the rest to go. I was late for work.  The burrito itself was not spicy, but it was good! It was a good portion, it was $9.99, and it was very flavorful... after I drowned it in salsa. Honestly, I probably wouldn't get it again. And I know this place is known for their tacos and not their burritos, so I'll be sure to check them out if I ever come here again. And to be quite blunt, I don't know if I ever will. I'm not sure the food is worth the wait and the horrible service...  As much as I loved the salsa bar and the ambiance, I definitely feel like there's some other place out there that has better service and better salsa.  Until the next time I decide to visit this location and update my review, this place gets two stars for me. I might even consider just doing take out because there is no way I'm waiting again. I can only imagine how long the wait is during lunch hour...  There are so many areas for improvement. I truly do hope some of these concerns are addressed. I really wanted to like the place, but I just can't get past the horrible service.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Almost all of the salsas!

YFSIB8I_6dOKVIWv_ZqTcg.text: I"m feeling a little tepid about this place.  People just rave about how good the food is and so I expected to be totally wowed.  Not so.  We walked in around 7:00pm on a Saturday night and we were told it would be an hour wait.  Okay, we hunkered down for the long haul.  It was actually more like half an hour before we were shoehorned into a long table in the back room with a lovely view of the ladies room and what appeared to be a storeroom.    The artwork is quite interesting and provides contrast to what otherwise appears to be a dining room transported out of a tiny village in Mexico.  It was hot and loud and being hearing impaired, mostly just a wall of indistinguishable sound.  Our server was nice and efficient, getting margaritas for the others and for me, as the DD, iced tea.  There was one tiny corner of a wedge of lemon in my tea, but fortunately, the well-appointed salsa bar had more.  Speaking of the salsa bar, that was the highlight for me.  The first time I've ever had a strawberry-chile salsa and it was delicious.  I had several of the mini-cups with the abundant and fresh tortilla chips.  I also had a peanut salsa that tasted like a sambal, but with a nice, slow burn.  Again, a very tasty salsa.  There were about ten other salsas and they all appeared fresh and very popular.   The menu is like a regional loop through Mexico, and I found that very cool.  There were regional specialties with a local twist like Mole, Tinga, Cochinita Pibil, and fish tacos.   There was also a variety of vegetarian/vegan options that appealed to the veggies in my group.  I couldn't stray from a "burro norteno" that was a combination of beans, rice, potato and green chile pork.  I wish there was more green chile pork in it, and it was a bit dry, but flavorful.  Yeah, I plan to go back some night with my wife who is a vegetarian, and perhaps something will trigger that spark so that I can rave about it like everybody else.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry salsa?!?  It ffn rocks!

C-5zjAV0eRmX85YmZwYWOQ.text: Had the 3 taco plate.  One was really good(the chorizo one), one had no flavor and was so dry i had to douse it in salsa to make it edible.  The third was fried in the tortilla, which was a bit strange but ok.  My friend had something else.  I forget what but he said it was fairly poor.  We waited a long damn time to get food.(30 min at least).  They gave us free chips, but it turned a quick dinner that i had high hopes for into a very long one that i would have rather not eaten.  I liked the salsa bar.  It was pretty impressive in its variety (16 different types i think)  Not going back without a gun to my head.

vGdPvsfHNm4J-8FWm5LeVQ.text: Traditional Mexican food at a low price, what else in the world is better than that. The food was hot and fresh and the salsa with salsa. and flavorful.   I love the ambience of this restaurant and can get out of there for which is always a plus. I highly recommend this restaurant

Bb-TdhdX8LILn_X3MJgKzA.text: La Santisima is wonderful, one of my favorite local Mexican spots. The menu is unique (not your standard taco and burrito place) and they are cognizant of both vegan and gluten-free diets.   The best part is the salsa bar! They have several typical salsas, but they also have several unique salsas (strawberry is the best) and sampling each is part of the experience.  My favorite menu item are the quesas, it's like a fried corn quesadilla, but better.   It gets busy during dinner time, so plan accordingly!

vn3YGYE25QT6CbE41WYw5g.text: This place is epic. The menu is extensive (almost overwhelming, you have to read it slowly) and offers so many awesome combination. Taco lovers: meet your new favorite place. In addition to awesome tacos they even have a great salsa bar where you can try all sorts of salsas with different heat levels which really add flavor to your tacos. I HIGHLY suggest the La Santisima taco with steak: it's out of this world!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Three taco platter

dWouFAPweMAqu6YE-gip1Q.text: My husband and I met up with some friends here for lunch on a Saturday. There is limited parking at the restaurant, so we had to park in the neighborhood next to the restaurant. We went to La Santisima in Flagstaff last month, and had a great experience. There are still lots of great options here, but the service isn't as friendly, and the food in Flagstaff seemed to taste better. Not sure if the food here was not as great due to the long wait and several customers present today.  Again, this place isn't bad, but I'm sure there are better options for Mexican food in the area if you look a bit more.

8vHfhBQ7TskdpyNSX5aNVA.text: The Salsa Bar! Holy moly! I wish I took a picture, it was huge. I was enamored by the strawberry salsa (tried to replicate at home to no avail). The food was served on clay plates, nice touch, and it was pretty tasty. I recommend this place every time someone asks me of a Mexican restaurant that will blow their expectations away. I do warn, there can be extremely long waits, like at least an hour wait if you're lucky....hence my 4 star review. Now I do know that they were working on opening more dining space, but at the time they also lacked staff. I will try out soon to update this review, but overall it is a great experience.

A77qqRcPOI636vIeLmYoYQ.text: It's okay, nothing too special, the menu prices on yelp are different than in person, so make sure to have a little extra cash handy.

h_6-eUycbY37_5O-u7NopQ.text: This place is just like a trip to Mexico City.  The food it's good, the atmosphere here is great the music it's a little too loud but hey for lunch time it's just perfect, no one wants to think about work at that time.  What can I said it's just a great place!

f4Wnmmfca4E11mhUJVdoWg.text: Best Mexican I have ever had anywhere in the US.  This place is amazing!!! The wait is worth it.  Small only about 10-15 tables.

m2AAfDPTrhhIGAdTsWMvCw.text: Lunchtime is very hard to find a seat, but once you do you're treated with a great selection of unique and well-known Spanish staples. Worth the drive for lunch or dinner if you're not from the area, check out the shark tacos!

73krKb3iOqK2h6pFckfMxQ.text: I had AL pastor.  The meat was really well seasoned.  Great service with a friendly staff.  The salsa bar is amazing.  Plenty of options I loved the guacamole!  I would definitely come back.  They do have limited seating but the food was so good if there is a lengthy wait I'd order take out.

UiugxAQw-MYDcY6M_Cw4zA.text: OMG! The best horchata and the salsa bar was great. The tacos were to die for and I loved the mole taco.

zG0bQomvwt5fV1l2Y-oKRQ.text: This place has a great salsa bar, and it's veggie/vegan friendly!  The tacos and burros are delicious!  It's a small place with great food and friendly service.  I love it.

6n1hoOPSz0q01eAQMhDEfQ.text: After two consecutive, relishing visits, I have declared La Condesa as my numero uno taco joint in the valley of the "Bertos". The obscure and hoody street it resides on has always kept me hesistating until one day! Before I immersed myself into the unknown, I had to do some Yelp investigation.  I wanted to know which taco(s) in particular people were raving about.  Coincidintally, the ones people tipped about were the ones I also adored!   I kept seeing Yelpers talk about them dogfish shark tacos, so I knew I had to order those first along with the can't-go-wrong carne asada! First thing that happens upon entering the cool, wooden door, you place your order at the counter and find an open seat once a number is assigned to you.   Being that they specialize in tacos, I focused on just that (for now)! They do have burritos and other things but its all about the tacos!  Here are your options:  1 Taco: $2.99, will not fill you up, but it is still a decent size.  2 Taco Plate: $6.99, you get 2 tacos of the same core ingredient (ie. Carne Asada, Fish) plus 2 sides (refried beans and rice)  2 Mix Taco Plate: $8.29, you get to choose any 2 tacos from the menu, plus the sides I mentioned.  Beverage is additional.  What I have tried thus far:  1. Dogfish Shark Taco:  Killer! What makes these so awesome is in the beer batter!  They are super crispy, hot and the fish itself is still soft and moist!    2. Shrimp: Again, Killer! Comes out very similar to the shark tacos, except it is shrimp!  3. Carne Asasada: Holy cannoli folks! Some might argue that America's Taco Shop are better but I would say the quality and taste is near even!  Condesa might edge them with its overall composition and various salsas!  It had that mesquitte, charred off the grill kind of taste and cut perfectly to fit into a taco!  4. Cochinita Pibil (Pork): The first three tacos I mentioned were pretty darn good! But this one stood out quite well on its own.  It was savory and packed with excellent flavors!  As the menu stated, it was slow-cooked, fork tender!  The 2 sides-  Refried Beans: Excellent!  Rice: Excellent! perfectly cooked!  The cool part about dining here is enjoying their Salsa Bar! If I recall correctly , there were about 10 different salsas to choose from!  The tricky part is pairing it with the taco you just ordered! Experiment, I say! As part of every order they bring you a basket of warm, house chips!  From the outside, you would never assume that such a great taco place existed, but once you step inside you know something good is about to happen!  Every wall has some sort of hip and contemporary Mexican art, from flowers to people.  The overall decor is very tasteful and upbeat!  Staff members are very friendly and courteous!  I took my office colleagues out during my second visit and they have nothing but positive responses and is begging to come back for more!  Whether you are a connoiseur of Mexican cuisine, tacos or just love eating good food, I highly advise you stop by!  For the overall great taste and value, its hard to beat this cool taco spot that will please all your senses!

uXE3wQS4EpdmrXZjkT6pNA.text: We were excited to try this place bases on the reviews.  I am giving this 4 stars because it was kind of a long wait (35 minutes) and there aren't a lot of benches outside to sit, (also it was hard to get water refills during our dinner.) But once inside, it is totally worth it!  The salsa bar is very unique and I liked how I could sample so many different kinds.  I got the mole tacos and would recommend trying one and maybe a different kind.

U7yRKR-A3Udj39ui1jdgOQ.text: The burrito I had was the best burrito ever. I'm here on a 6 hour layover and was told to visit this place.  Very good food

xMvMZra09aM23Z4HvifScA.text: Food was great! The fish and the shrimp tacos might be the best in Phoenix. The salsa bar is just as good and has some great traditional options - just like mom's house! The drinks were generic but generous and well priced. I give them 3 stars because of the service, or lack there of. Every time I go in there, whether it is 6 or 9 pm there is a 30-60 minute wait and about 4 empty tables. There is a sense of confusion and priorities are not focused on customer service. The bathroom was a disaster. I've seen better kept facilities at night clubs and that worries me. You know what they say about the bathroom - it is as clean as the kitchen!  Like I said, they had folks out the door by 7:30 and I had to go up to the register to pay because no one came by to pick up my tab/card. We had 2 dinners and 2 rounds of happy hour drinks - we paid $70. For that kind of money, I would at least expect to be seated at one  of the many open tables that were available when we left. Instead, they let people wait for over 30 mins while others (me) had to wait 20 mins to pay. I think I'd go back but maybe just do take out.

qVJTkTBuVoTiAM95TuNqyQ.text: Amazing Mexican food and sauces!  I never have experienced such diverse foods. They have pulled recipes from all over Mexico and excel at reproducing some amazing food. If you love Mexican food you must go here. Their salsa bar is like no other. Pecan salsa, peanut sauce etc. And they have a good tequila selection!

ISJHECvW7bAR615OYlgkGQ.text: so lucky to have this place in my neighborhood  amazing menu, helpful staff, salsa variety is the best in phx

iuZIpEt43p56y5CzOYUdTw.text: Thanks to Yelp I discovered this Amazing  Taco gem on the way to a meeting down town.  La Condesa has a great salsa bar. The margaritas are tasty too! Love the selection of tacos on the menu.  The tacos were so delicious that when I started eating, I texted my husband to go there on his way home from work. Luckily he made it there before I had to take off to my meeting, and agrees, the food is amazing.  The carnitas is my favorite.  I cannot wait  to go again.

TM8MlBb6NVRTkPjVUnsqEw.text: This place is hands down awesome!   The salsa they make is really tasty and unique. They have flavors I've never dreamed of like strawberry salsa.  Every time I go there they have something new and exciting to try.   I've had the tacos and burritos (which were both amazing), but I think the tacos are a little better (plus you get a side of beans which are about as good as you can get anywhere).   My only complaint is you only get one basket of chips for free and they charge for additional refills. Oh well.

EABTXakEJD_tHJxivqW8ow.text: Love the salsa bar and how many vegetarian options there are.

a3wDWEVOa3R-UP_FZhO_Eg.text: Been there not so much anymore s***** food was great people think they know what they're doing not so much

9LGRv4vQ8pBcOsx8240HQQ.text: The salsa bar, the horchata, the veggie burrito, the fish burrito... SO GOOD. However, their tacos didn't do it for me (specifically the tortillas). Hey, can't win them all.

vAWZHJm5aL_0698-p3eAVw.text: The very best tacos in town. The Aztec Tinga is fantastic...but the real star of the show is the Napoleon taco.   Also fantastic are the quesadillas...and they will forever change the way you think about them. You'll never order a quesadilla from Taco Bell ever again. You've been warned. THESE quesas are puff pastries filled with gorgeous things, and then topped with Mexican sour cream.   Also check out their salsa bar. Too many to choose from; and there are no wrong choices to make.  Run to La Condesa. Run past every other mediocre Mexican restaurant to get here because THIS place is the real deal.

eAbFkEY3roYGsCxK7lrqfQ.text: The food here is delicious! No matter what you order everything is always fresh but my favorite is their salsa bar they've got a wide variety that is sure to satisfy anyones palate. Also the art on the walls is awesome!

9NGAcOQBbNH3O_FtnseK-w.text: I still love this place. A lot. Perhaps even more so now that I can walk there from my apartment. One thing I forgot to mention in my last review is their fantastic margaritas, which have squeezes from fresh orange or grapefruit, pack a punch and are very cheap ($6) for the size.   I know I said I'm not much of a "regular," but La Condesa has made me one. Spectacular.

_do_5QsU_OSxPzlfmlUwHg.text: Thank you, Yelp!  What a wonderful place.  I had three street tacos -  al pastor, chicken and cauliflower.  My friends had burritos and raved about them, too.  Nice salsa bar, too.

_h5gQuI2UtJ54bjWxDy1eg.text: This place was great. Started with the guac which was probably the best I have ever had. The party I was with had a combination of tacos, burritos and sandwiches ... All which were winners. Too bad I love so far away it this would be a go to place.

fjFc37sRtqeRykKhWcD8aw.text: My friends and I went here on a Saturday night and we all had great food! The deep fried quesadilla was unique and excellent, the rice and beans were probably the best I've had. A few of the guys got tortas and enjoyed them, especially the La Santisima Speciality Lonche! Portions were large, salsa selection was good and the drinks were tasty and fairly priced! We will definitely be back!

yJveGCqV9oqBmnq5Ic1_iA.text: This menu is off the chain and everything is SO freaking good! Guacamole was made perfectly. We tried the original torta to share and wow was that flavorful! When you get to the taco list, it's never ending - street tacos and tons of gourmet tacos - how can you choose!? I asked the guy at the front for recommendations and I'm still trying to decide if it helped or not? Haha really just because everything on the menu is that good. I went with the mole taco (really awesome), Argentina steak (more awesomeness) and this one that appears fried but isn't (I'm blanking in the name but if you say fried taco they'll know exactly what you're talking about). Anyways I cannot wait to come back for more and try the rest of the menu!   Go try this place and thank me later

QYWPd4wz54W9cMJGzR4R8Q.text: Really conflicted on how to rate this place because the food and service were both 4/5 but the atmosphere and general appearance inside was really off putting.   I dropped by La Santisima with a friend on a Sunday night around 6:00 pm. Parking was a bit interesting, but thankfully we were able to get a spot on the side of the building. Now, I'd been to the Glendale location a couple of times earlier and once I entered into the Phoenix location, I was at a loss for words -- in the worst way possible.   It was dimly lit, dingy, and dark and had a general look of disarray and chaos. We were seated quickly and were able to put our orders in while we sampled the salsas and some of my favorites from the Glendale location were nowhere to be found. In terms of the food, I got the veggie quesa and my friend got a burro. I have gotten the same quesa at the Glendale location before and it just came out as a massive, well adorned, well though out plate that I felt like was a behemoth of a dish. The quesa at this location was noticeably smaller and did not have any of the accouterments/garnishes that the quesa at the Glendale location had. My friends burro was the same in the sense that it was literally a plain looking burrito cut in two on a plate. The food itself tasted good and our server was great, but the atmosphere was just so dim and dark that it really detracted from our experience.   I say drop by the Glendale location if you want to enjoy the great food and skip on this one if you're looking for any type of nice atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesa

Js2tQ5lPiNLxQs0WSgC_bQ.text: After landing at the airport, we did a quick yelp search and saw this place so decided to go here- BEST DECISION EVER. We had traveled really long hours and it our first visit to Arizona;this was the perfect welcome meal. The place immediately stands out when you walk inside with the eccentric art and loud,fun music playing in the background. We stand in line to order and then sat down, the food was out within a few minutes. We ordered the queso for the table which was literally incredible; if you only get one thing here,GET THIS. I have nothing but excellent reviews for the food, everything we ordered was beyond amazing and absolutely original in taste. The horchata was delicious, probably the best I've ever had. It has a cinnamon taste to it and pro tip: it taste a lot better if you pour it out and drink it with the pecan and fruit chunks! If Guy Fieri rates and reviewed this place(which he did), you obviously gotta

FBLzeOxAOSMLH_ti0TMUqw.text: I found out the BEST TACO place!! This place is a gourmet taco heaven for vegetarians as well as meat lovers.   We got seated right away and our server got us chips and told us to help ourselves do the salsa bar, that has more than 12 different types of salsa. They even had a peanut salsa and pecan salsa!! Every salsa on that bar was so good. My fav was the strawberry salsa and this hot habanero salsa.    Hubby tried the street taco plate, which was delicious. You can choose any 3, he has the chicken Tinga, Barbacoa and shrimp. I had vegetarian tacos, one was with deep fried avocado dipped in beer batter served over cabbage and this amazing sauce. Also tried their Santisima vegetarian and cauliflower taco. It was so good!!  They serve their quesadilla deep fried, my son had that enchilada style. It was huge, he loved it.  The margaritas looked amazing, so many different choices, I hope to try at my next visit
