JPoMun39H9aHWgTo9sR2Nw.text: The food was bomb!! Worth a try! I added pictures below. It's in a hidden location.  The only reason I'm not giving it 5 STARS is because service was okay and the ambiance was "whatever." Given we got there an hour before closing, there were still people there. We didn't get waited on, so I had to ask for someone to help us. The reason they didn't help us was because I  the hostess made a mistake, she didn't add our name to a list so the two servers didn't know. No excuse. Both of them walked by our table served other tables around us, looked at our direction for 15 minutes and not one person cared to ask us "have you've been helped?" and then we we did get service it was dry and bare ass minimum. The light fixtures above us were terrible, it was cold, and no music. Everyone was just whispering to each other, probably afraid that others could hear their conversations.   I would give this place another try maybe on a Friday or weekend. Love the salsa bar.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zy6dchznl0-wWTzivGZWrw.text: I'll defend this location just as much as Glendale's. But with over 2,000 reviews, I'll keep it short. This is a top 10 spot in Arizona for Mexican food (in its price range, at least) and anyone who disagrees has terrible taste and should go back to Illinois or something.   Savor every salsa because while each individual salsa may not be the *best* out there, they are all above average, and there's like 15 to choose from. That being said, you could easily chow down on like 3 baskets of chips in the time it takes to actually get your order. It is great, but goodness gracious does this location also take longer than expected. 20 minutes into your wait, you'll think "OK it's good stuff so it should take longer than average tacos do". And then you'll be like me and reach that point where you're just hangry and seriously ready to berate someone because no other place in the valley would be this consistently SLOW.   In that moment of frustration and despair that will happen LITERALLY EVERY TIME YOU VISIT, your food will appear and it will be glorious. You will devour it in half the time it took to prepare. I mean seriously it was just some mole tacos with shrimp (in lieu of other proteins)--don't you guys prep before you open? They'll act like everything is OK and they didn't just break you with the wait time, you'll tip generously, and be ready to do the same song and dance the next time you want good Mexican food.   I guess that like the wait times, this review didn't end up being so short after all. But if you've got a free hour and a half, your taste buds wont' regret it!

EGIleajDdmPbt3fnCk563g.text: Five stars all the way! The guacamole was out of this world, make sure you order it as an appetizer!! My boyfriend and I both ordered 3 specialty tacos each and split them so that we could get a taste of 6 (the speciality taco menu is huge and trust me, you're going to want to taste as many as possible). The best ones in our opinion was the Santisima special with chicken and the steak/chimichurri!

KJpuAxftG9axvtcaSp99xA.text: *Review based only on take out experience*  First of all: the menu prices on Yelp (menu pictures) differs from actual prices. We ordered two burritos and paid around $32.00. Personally, I think that's a bit excessive for 2 burritos. I wasn't sure if we were buying burritos or stocks in the restaurant.  When we called and placed our order for two burritos (one shrimp & one aztec), we were told it'd be ready in 10 minutes or so. The person who took our order sounded like he may have been new as it was pretty confusing just to place an order.   When we arrived, I was a little surprised by the location & appearance...its in a very questionable neighborhood & parking is tough! As sketchy neighborhoods have the best authentic food(typically), we were still excited to try. Since we couldn't find parking, we kept the car running while I ran in. When I walked in, I was even more shocked to see how everyone was dressed. For some odd reason, people were extremely dressed up for the casual setting that it is.  It was also very busy inside.   I told the cashier that I'm just picking up an order and she gave me few cups for salsa and gave me my total. When she told me it was around $32, I had to double check what we ordered! After confirming that it is in fact for two burritos, I was surely hoping it'd be the best thing I've ever eaten.   They were ok at best , salsa was also just ok. My shrimp burrito had a ton of veggies in it but the tortilla was super thick & our chips were stale. I've had way better burritos at other places. Maybe we just ordered the wrong thing since this place does have a lot of good reviews & I noticed few awards on their dining lobby. It may also be possible that it used to be better at some point & went down in quality but up in prices?

PQEjPc-0bzcityiSuFI3LA.text: Definitely a must try place. They have a salsa bar with over 10 types of salsa which is a sure thing to start with. They go great with the chips they serve. Tried their veggie quesa and veggie taco plate with assorted tacos from avacado to cauliflower which was really good. The portions are huge. The ambience is casual and the service is quick.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie taco plate
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa selection from the bar with chips

dFJp8t4Q_GmdYwdhX-0qcg.text: Best Mexican restaurant in Phoenix to take your vegan friends! Delicious and creative foods. Love that they grill their burritos.

oi-OTIxZA8cFm1deRS6Xug.text: Drinks: Classic lime margarita - simple, sweet and sour.  Margarita chilantro - best part of the meal! A mix of spicy peppers, cilantro and lime that only got better the longer it mulled. Poured the rest of my lime margarita in the remaining mix-ins to pull out some of the awesome flavors. So good!   Entrees: Al pastor Lonche - all of the components were good, but lacked a certain cohesiveness. Could have used some extra spice or something to break up the dryness. We originally wanted a different lonche but they were out of the pickled onions for the other one.   Street tacos - carne arrachera, chilango suadero and al pastor. Chilango suadero was probably the fave. We came about an hour before closing so there wasn't much salsa from the salsa bar to try out and enhance the tacos with.   Interior: Awesome art hanging from the walls! Did not feel very clean and the tables were peeling but it certainly didn't take away from the freshness of the food.   Service: Server was awesome, friendly and helpful!! Food and drinks were out very quickly (:

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita chilantro
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al pastor lonche

Gl2l8bdpT8Fw4O9lAgyq9w.text: Amazing selection of tasty authentic tacos and a plethora of sauces for which to enjoy them. I would also highly recommend the horchata: best I have ever had!!!  Please note that table service is limited to certain hours and you may have to order up at the cash register in the front.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing authentic Mexican tacos !!!!

yxot92QggfgJl9kvKHTfaA.text: The food was phenomenal but overpriced. I took off one start because I felt like our waiter overhyped menu items, like the guacamole, which he told every table was selling out. It was a tiny cup of guac for $10 and was good, but not a must have item.   The menu is unique and my friends and I enjoyed the flavors- best mole I've had!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burro with molé
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burro

XOD2cbdnORtcOyPPVeZjug.text: Made a visit here with a friend, after hearing great reviews. The food was good, but I was super unimpressed with the service. The waitress basically took the order and left for 30+ minutes.   Food-wise, the tacos were okay. My favorite part was the horchata.   The place has a cool theme and I see why locals would stop by.

-jGxbykQAz-Kot_N3jFeUA.text: Pretty good hole in the wall type of place.  Late evening dinner.  Sauces were pretty spicy. Food was tasty.  Service was great.

dXJC65qmCEa5ZLv988PXFg.text: Provender: tacos! On Saturday mornings they have both a breakfast and lunch menu. I ordered the guacho, espana, and mayan chochinita tacos, which were fantastic. The michelada was also delicious.  Prices: reasonable, the specialty tacos are about $5 each, but they have combos.  Parking: there are spaces on 16th and Palm lane.  People: fun for all ages.  Perks: the food is amazing. The artwork inside is dope. They also have a salsa bar with a wide variety of salsa. Oh, the wait staff are excellent. Jordan was such a cutie. If I lived here I would've asked her out . . . on a taco date!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary chips and salsa.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Petite signage.

jFRfHhRlgS4mn8SjEyGN8A.text: This place is a MUST go for tacos. The ambience is very dia de los muertos in terms of decor. The servers were very friendly and incredibly helpful in deciding what to order. As a vegetarian, I am typically limited in what I can order for tacos but this place knocked it out of the park; they had a whole section for interesting vegetarian tacos and burritos. Ordered the veggie classic santisima which I would highly recommend! The melted cheese on top of a layer of mushrooms was delicious! Also ordered the Gandhi tacos which tasted a little like a salad. And ordered the avocado fresh cheese taco with a spicy salsa which I would also recommend. Honestly, this is probably the best taco place that I've been to. And to top it off, every single salsa at the salsa bar was great!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hi-P72gthja8DDVOa3G-WQ.text: We went to this place because of the high reviews. It was a waste of money. The quesadilla was way too oily and the cheese did not taste good. The tortilla chips tasted store bought. And I dont think white rice with raw red onion, corn and feta cheese should ever be allowed in a taco because it did NOT taste good. The only good thing about this place was the sauce bar.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

r4B1G2Kt1IV7cy4b2qMmTA.text: If I could give them negative stars I would. Just left this establishment without eating our meals.  Waited 9 minutes just to be seated and should have took this as a sign.   Ordered our food. It was served to the table next to us. The waitress brought the food back to the kitchen and then re-served the food to us 5 minutes later. We know for sure it was our food as the other table ordered something completely different and our food was ice cold. Needless to say we didn't eat it.   When my husband asked to speak to a manager we were told they didn't have one. We were willing to pay for our drinks but were told not to and we paid nothing and left. Totally unsatisfying experience and disgusting as the other couple had touched the food. Definitely never ever go here!

RyYY1nd79YlhIFnJgLFd4Q.text: I am a bean and cheese FANATIC and this place is it! I will absolutely be back and the servers were exceptional as well!

giNL58EpNOESr7ZWU8qO7w.text: UPDATED REVIEW 2018:  It saddens me so much to have to update my review of what used to be one of our very favorite places to eat out. Since their expansion this place has gone downhill so fast.  First, the service is just awful now, it shouldn't take 10-15 minutes to get someone to come and take a drink order, especially when servers have walked past your table several times.  Second, when food is ordered, you expect it to be hot when it arrives at your table, our food has been lukewarm at best the last couple of times we have tried to dine here.  Third, even my used to be favorite part of this Restaurant, the salsa bar, has managed to highly disappoint me.  My favorite cilantro salsa had little to no flavor whatsoever, and my other favorite, salsa pecan was so spicy I couldn't eat it (it's always had a little kick, but this was way more than it used to have). I have tried to give them the benefit of the doubt three different times now, and they still continue to disappoint, and to top it off, I have gotten terrible stomach aches each time I have visited recently (this never happened prior to the expansion). What the heck has happened to this "gem" we found and loved so long ago?!?!?   I so wish it would go back to the way it was.  ORIGINAL REVIEW:  Love, love, love this Phoenix gem!  I stumbled upon it when I was out house hunting & my husband learned about it from a co-worker, so we tried it one night & have been hooked ever since!  The salsa bar is awesome & the food is fantastic!  We are so happy to live just a few short miles from here & we go often!

1AdTytJ1mIKyOJJF6FY9Ow.text: Best tacos in town. It's a very small restaurant so you might have to wait but it's well worth it. The food is fresh and reasonably priced. The salsa bar alone makes it worth the trip. The Margaritas are also very good if a little pricy.

V4O9_vlCkxCuzryKyv6geg.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place.  Shocking.  I LOVE this place. Their quesadillas are doughy cheesy heaven.  HEAVEN. Their tacos are the stuff dreams are made of. Their salsa bar proof that there is a god. Well, that may be much, but still, awesome place. And guess what kiddies? They finally have beer! Decor is nice, room is a bit small to contain all this awesomeness though.  Its cozy. let me recommend  the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco.  That pork, tender, so very very tender.  Amazing in the quesa as well. The dogfish shark and shrimp are great too.  I haven't been disappointed yet actually. Order one of everything! (maybe two of the pork)

kBEY3NtLykwJVI2YAr_2Kw.text: Yum !! The Mayan burritos are amazing ! Slow roasted seasoned pork in a delicious flour tortilla. So good. I ordered them to go so I don't have an opinion on the service this time. Go get one !!

0ZIG_rZbL5MurB7ivm0yeg.text: Unique atmosphere complimented by wide variety of free salsa. Reasonable prices and pleasant service. Food is great!

BkvgkT_wVqhIcBhvFFSp5g.text: Awesome food, great atmosphere. Salsa bar is really good. Horchata is a must try. Very well priced. We will be back.

WfmwdvhtYyrgvRx4YIuBSA.text: The salsa bar was an instant hit amongst my family. The guacamole was creamy and spicy. The salsa Mexicana was our favorite. Food was wonderful and inexpensive. Service was fast considering how busy the restaurant was and there were only 2 waitresses. Would definitely recommend it!

nkb4vBdJKVtoNEc_Qxdk7g.text: I really like this little place. Great bean & cheese burrito, good mole.   Salsa bar - exceptional.   The missing star is due to service. Everyone is really nice, but they just need more staff.

hxg0ROmHdvwWZxPCutXc7w.text: Simply put - if you don't think this is 5-star food I don't know what to tell you.  Salsa bar is amazing and had things I've never seen before - and it was amazing.  If I could only drink and eat chips and salsa , I'd still give it 5-stars.  Tons of taco options. Their quesadillas are more like empanadas and fried (super delicious.)  Go here...and prepare to come back often...

CStwWtngg7N01fQZLQtwEQ.text: Lunchtime out with a relative on a weekday, and La Condesa has a seat by the window. There is really nothing like its saloon-artsy walls for us to gaze.   The Dia De los Muertos motif and wooden furniture make it perfect for easy conversation.   Most folks seated around us already know where to go for lunch that's not too pricey and homemade.   The Horchata is nothing short of liquid dessert, filled with pecans, fruit and rice milk.  You can avoid dairy all together with this and a special bullet burro with guac and lettuce. The salsa bar sets the standard for good restaurants.  It's wide variety of salsas leave little doubt what creative people run the place.  My hope is that only a few people read this and try it. Otherwise, to my chagrin, the next time we park on 16th Street, we may have to WAIT in a line outside.

enFsPwXq8VilLqspMYxoUQ.text: Went here for happy hour after work (5:00pm) on a Friday night and my party (of 2) was able to be seated right away.  I really liked some of the artwork hanging in the restaurant.  We ordered several types of tacos and loved them all.  Even more impressive was the well stocked salsa bar ranging from cheese causes and mild salsas to some that really make your mouth burn.  I had a great time here and will definitely go back.

DJ09a6BwgIazdkA1p3BlEQ.text: Super yummy taco spot. There selections of salsas and sauces is amazing. Many traditional and many very unique ones I've never tasted before -peanut salsa?! Our tacos were all delicious and they came out of the kitchen pretty quick. Definitely left my belly very full and happy. Highly recommend checking out this spot.

wY-sAH8ssh2_bdMdmBCqWA.text: my friends convinced me to give this place another chance.   the salsa bar is SO good. I don't really recall what I ordered to eat but i do remember not loving it. it was decent though.   the salsa on the other hand is amazing! salsa all day long!

2oGxCv3YMmCIvQ1SXP9uog.text: Everything is so good. I love the salsa bar and their unique take on Mexican cuisine. Get a horchata, you won't regret it. The alcohol can be a bit pricey if you're not getting happy hour, but worth it. The margaritas are so fresh and I really love how they add a teensy bit of grapefruit.

qOZwh5c2siBNyGAXCDKO3g.text: The cabo fried shrimp tacos are the best thing to me. Salsa bar is awesome as well. Little over hyped. Cramped seating. Service is mediocre. One guy does a good job but he's not always there. I've had to wait for a while before. One time I just estimated my tab, left money and left. For a spot that made it on diners and dives they need some work. I would think they would care more about service and presentation. Food is always good. But I'm not there to hang out for long. Reminds me of a little dive in mexico. I usually enjoy myself despite the flaws. Best is go when its slow.

oGSsRimLxV5z0Z1cWPEt6Q.text: Holy Tacos and Salsa Bar!!!!!! This place is the real deal. We came here 10 minutes after opening and we were glad we did. This place filled up quickly and for good reason. The tacos were incredible. The spicy pork, the beef, the white fish all mouth watering. The refried beans and rice served on the side tasted awesome, I just wish the portions were larger. Right away we were served large baskets of warm tortilla chips and we tried every salsa at the bar. Some were very spicy!!!! I enjoyed the cilantro cream one on the fish tacos. The quesadilla came with avocado slices on top and the cheese was very tasty. These tacos were gourmet! I really enjoyed everything we ate here and would definitely come back. Prices are fair as well. They staff kept refilling our glasses of water and kept checking in on us. We had a great lunch here.

ian-ncydflEJRv07yzYHUA.text: We went based on recommendation and it did not let down.  Great taco place.  Ok I am going to go Spanish on this one.  Delicioso!

ZKNXGyOa8WhOXEhLGDvDQQ.text: So whenever former Phoenix Yelper Jim W arrives or departs, you can count on a dust storm, a big one.  It's like he's got his own set of haboobs.  But when he suggested La Condesa, I said to hell with a clean car and clean hair.  It was about time I met La Condesa.  And the pleasure was all mine.  First off, the salsa bar is more like a salsa buffet.  And the guacamole..yum, it had mango in it!  Not sure if that's a seasonal thing, but it was tasty.  The carne asada taco was good, but the Mayan Cochinita Pibil taco (let's just call it shredded pork) was so far beyond good, you have to taste it to believe it.  And I suggest you do, soon.

Tnkuvax6mDEya1Z_SoyTLg.text: My mouth just died and went to heaven. Great atmosphere.  Great salsa bar. Great margaritas. Great tacos. When I'm on my deathbed in the distant future I will die happy. Knowing that I indeed experienced life!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fillet Mignon tacos

K5RoYOFPncPh03JDe7N9Pw.text: It's simply delicious, especially if you want a meal. The chips and salsa were delicious and varied from peanut to salsa roja. I recommend Sopa Azteca it has a quick and you can taste the flavors of the broth, the Oaxaca cheese and chip strips topped off with avocado slices. The fish tacos are amazing, as they have a real Baja flavor; topped with mayo, beer battered fish! My fiance ordered the Sonoran carne azada burrito. The horchata was served with pecans and strawberries (you can opt out of strawberries). The portions were great and therefore we didn't order dessert. Yes the wait is long, however they are waiting on the state to approve a new line of cooks(?) But trust me, it's worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos with rice and beans
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is sopa Azteca

EimbHm9es0HEaERxsPFm8g.text: Awesome.   This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. The food is amazing, I get the Taloc taco, it's vegan! The real shining star of this place is the salsa bar. Always a ton of options, all ranging in different levels of spice. Be careful, you might think the fruity one won't be spicy, but it'll surprise you :)   The drinks are also good and reasonably priced.   Always consistent, always good.

B2Uehek31A9li5PgwMJYVg.text: Amazing food. Loved the inner city vibe. This place couldn't have been any better. Gourmet at very reasonable prices. I'll be back again.

jN5y0iSgK-7FTH4dUerlXA.text: My friend told me this was best Mexican food around. I wasn't hesitant at first because I always believed the best Mexican food in Arizona was in Tucson, but she may be right. La Santisima is fantastic. I had the Azteca Tinga burro, and I don't remember the last time I had chicken that was so juicy. I think their secret is in their sauces/marinades. The burrito was huge but I ate it all up because it was so good and I could not stop. I also love the salsa bar - they have a large variety of salsas and it's fun to try all of them. My favourite is the strawberry one.   The only downside was that service was slow. I think we waited 15 minutes just for someone to greet us and take our orders. I heard that the restaurant increased capacity so I hope they will increase staff too in order to meet the increased needs.

CExlelFerKTlQnQMOQhbJw.text: Get here early! Parking is tight and the line gets long. But it is so worth it! The rice & beans are fantastic. I got the Mexic burro, it has a mango salsa inside that ands a little sweetness that was unexpected and so yummy. They have a ton of vegetarian options, so I will be suggesting this place to my Veggie friends!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pictures inside

44QrT2PqmIIN8yYILanPvg.text: The food was delicious, I got the Tapatio quesa which is a deep fried quesadilla, with adobo pork. There is a salsa bar which is nice and the first basket of chips is free and then if you want chips after that it's $2.79. The service was not great, we were sitting down for a long time before anyone asked us if we wanted drinks or anything, I had to ask someone to take our order and my friend had to go to the drink area herself to get her margarita because the waiter never went to get it. Poor service, good food.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tapatio quesa

M2P7XmwLqSRz-52ANxYWdQ.text: Offers more of a unique offering to the traditional mom-and-pop Mexican restaurant. Lots of tasty tacos to choose from (the tiger shrimp was the best we tried) and they do a different spin on quesadillas. These are served fried and puffy. Lots of cheesy filling inside- the Gaucho was tasty but with all of the unique flavors (chimichirri, pickled onions, etc) I thought it would be a bit more flavorful. Definitely large enough to share.   Salsa bar has many flavorful options, but I don't like the idea of all patrons having access to something I'd consume (too many dirty hands, coughing, sneezing).   The margarita had barely any tequila, but I did appreciate the fresh fruit slices in it.    This is a TINY, TINY place and doesn't offer much authenticity when it comes to decor or music (Katy Perry and other pop music - cringe).

J2ItzPGSXVWENVX2eIEziw.text: I liked this place but I dont feel like it's as amazing as yelp says it is. They do have a large salsa bar which is nice for people who like to try tons of different flavors. I found only a couple that I really enjoyed. The tacos were good, but not the absolute best I've ever had. Service was mediocre at best. I would eat here again if someone invited me. Decent food for sure. But the best I've ever had? No

BDAoff1ti5UZB-F1DvYEpA.text: I don't give 5 stars. But LS deserves it-- amazing, life changing food. Good atmosphere and nice staff. But the food is phenomenal. They have 30+ different kinds of tacos alone-- even vegan ones! But the clincher is they do protein style tacos. So low carb people delight!!! They wrap their tacos in crispy Oaxaca cheese and omg it's amazing. I'm not on a low carb diet and I still order it. Yum! I'm Hispanic so horchata is staple. But their horchata is out of this world. I stop by just to order one and leave. Try it. You will not be disappointed.

2t8snYroXM-G5_ISfouugg.text: The sauce bar alone is worth the trip. Jenny C and her horrible taste buds can have her Taco Bell and their sauce. I enjoyed trying peanut, strawberry, radish, cilantro, guacamole, Cabo, chipotle, and Mexican salsa. We ordered a carne asada burrito. Good sauce in it, a healthy amount of peppers and avocado and cucumber. Fresh tortilla and ingredients. Cool dia de las muertes decor and a tight, cramped but bustling crowd. It's probably a better foodie place than a first date location. I loved it. I realize tastes differ, but anyone who thinks Taco Bell has more to offer ought to get their head and not just their tongue checked out for damage. That's you Jenny C.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Just about half of the many salsas

ZJ6rkZb-V_yLrYu30UwUhA.text: It was a nice twist to a traditional food. The concepts were all there, the ingredients, salsas, meats, etc.. but what made it fall apart was the lack of seasoning on the food... i was really excited to try it out but it ended up tasting bland. I ended up leaving semi-disappointed. That being said, I would definitely return if the food were to be seasoned because there would be a goldmine of flavor in those tacos.

2qKPcTRNapPPVhVN1wO8RQ.text: Incredible!  Stupendous!  Filling!  And then there's the Margaritas.    My friend, Kenner Bob, from up Iowa way, was in town for her annual visit to Aridzona and it's my most excellent pleasure to choose the joint for us to brunch and have a smart cocktail, or two ("Let's all have a little drinkey!").  I'd spotted La Santisima via Yelp about three months ago and knew immediately I wanted to try it. I'm so glad I waited for Kenner Bob's visit as it turned out to be the perfect place.  We started our culinary journey with the joint's Guacamole. Admittedly, I'm not one for bastardized guac, but this guac was da bomb. Chunky with diced mango, dried cranberries and the usual salt, pepper and garlic. Every bite equated nuclear yummy noises from both of us.   Kenner Bob chose two tacos (all street sized) from the Mix-n-Match menu:  Mahi-Mahi,  Chicken Tinga (I think) and one from the Specialty section:  a beef brisket number that was sublime.   I chose the Tiger Shrimp, Chicken Tinga and a Pork taco that escapes my memory.  I loved the Pork number.   Sides for both of us were the included rice and beans. The rice was buttery and tasted like cream was involved in its making. Scrumdiddleyumptious, it was. I'm a rice fanatic so I could've eaten 20 or six tubfulls.  Trust me when I say it would take at least 20 visits to this joint to work one's way through the menu. Kenner Bob and I took 20 minutes -- whist eating the chips, salsa and guac -- to decide on what to order.  Everything -- and I mean EVERYthing -- sounded delicious.  We could've read every choice's description but we finally had to "shoot the engineer" and place our order.  The waitrons are incredibly patient and understanding of dyed-in-the-wool foodies trying to decide which goodies to order.   The added drawing ticket to this joint are the Margaritas. There are about 10 choices.  Kenner Bob ordered the Award Winning Margarita and after one sip she said, "I'd vote for it!"  For Kenner Bob it was the perfect Marg:  sour but not overly so; sweet but not treacly.    My Marg was incredible. To save my life I can't remember the name of it but it contained an herbal liqueur.  Truly, if this danged ol' cocktail doesn't cure you then you weren't sick.   If you're seeking True Mexican cuisine in a super casual restaurant -- and killer-diller Margaritas -- corer  rapidiamente to La Santisima.

xhj0ssZtV4-RwzMxeHQ7Eg.text: OK so I came here to try the Horchata because I saw all the great reviews on it and I am glad I did because it is AMAZING!!! They put just the right amount of ice in it and the bottom has strawberries and it's mixed with a bunch of other yummy fruits such as mangos (i'm not entirely sure what else quite yet... still in the process of drinking lol) and then it's topped with just the right amount of cinnamon.  The only reason why I only gave them three stars is because I have yet to try the food but I will on my next visit and on top of that I tried to call multiple times to place my order and nobody ever picks up the phone which is a no go for me because I'm always on the run!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy yummy horchata

T3Fc0ItOxPt7YtxWvBL0xQ.text: This place is probably paradise for my white/non-hispanic friends! I was born and raised in Mexico, so I know La Santisima is NOT authentic mexican food. But it is tasty food and for a good price. Yes, they have a salsa bar with about 23,594 different salsas (ok, maybe I exaggerated a bit) but only about 2 are pretty tasty.   I say this restaurant consists more of "Mexican-American" food. But if you're hispanic and want to take your non-hispanic buddies to a "mexican" place, then La Santisima is the perfect spot where their minds will be blown thinking they're eating "authentic" mexican food and at the same time you'll be satisfied too with the tasty Americanized version of a torta or quesadilla. But shhhhh... you know the secret, they don't!

D2wfrgo4tYgieZ3cbaT3NQ.text: This is authentic and delicious food. I am so happy we found it! The food possesses layers of flavor and I cannot wait to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tequila list

h2dTTVHOroJpr-futJkaOQ.text: I went to La Santisima for the first time when a friend took me here for lunch. I have been here about a dozen times since then!This place was on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, so there is a lot of hype around this place, and trust me, it's real!  La Santisima has a superb menu with a big variety of items to pick from. Their tacos are delicious and they have a great Aztec Tinga taco. The quesadillas are huge, I can only eat about half when I get it.  They offer a large salsa bar that has at least 10 different salsas ranging from spicy to mild flavors.   They offer a house margarita for $5 that is delicious, I get about two when I come hehe.They have a small bar but the drink offering is big, including Mexican beers.   Service is friendly, fast, and courteous. 6-7 PM seems to be a peak time for this restaurant, so make sure you're here on time to get a table since it's a bit small and can fill up quick!

Lo0iztCti1_P3sRNxNCLKQ.text: I ordered the arrachera and the mariachi tacos. I feel the hype was too much. The arrachera tasted like it was seasoned in a pound of salt. To me, it wasn't such a pleasant taste. The mariachi tacos tastes like they were missing salt. One of them seemed like it even had way too much oil. However the beans and rice were real good. Aside from an angry lady behind us, the atmosphere was pleasant and really really enjoyed trying all the different salsas that they have.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arrachera and some mariachi tacos

xFqlMNtJJNaPem0P2YGUcA.text: Tacos are so good!  Laid back atmosphere and good service. Was looking for some good tacos and it definitely did the job! Highly recommend coming here for some solid tacos!

v0F45lRmSreW6g7kj0rPRw.text: After driving much of the day from being in Grand Canyon and Sedona, our last stop was Phoenix. We were STARVING and tired so we chose this place to eat because of their "reviews". I am sure they have delicious authentic Mexican food but unfortunately we couldn't try it because when we walked in at 9:30pm on Thursday a hostess or who knows who quickly rushed over to us. I thought for a split second she was rushing to greet us instead she said that they were closed ? Google and yelp said they are open until 10pm not to mention their OPEN Sign was on and lighted. She said they close at 9 but their restaurant had customers in there. The worst part was when I walked out I was taking this picture that I have attached and that same girl who ousted us saying they were "closed" came outside and said actually we are open you can come in haha no thanks !

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Terribly rude not worth my $$

qfYMb-puZEb9x3LPcR6faQ.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican places in Arizona.  Always fresh food and very tasty. I normally get the steak taco combo with rice and beans.  Lots of salsas to choose from and usually pretty busy inside.  Would come here more often if it wasn't a 25 minute drive from where I live.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak taco combo for takeout.  So good.

RBSncy4pocxK0bPlp2_9Dw.text: i reallllly need to come here more often. this is definitely a little gem of a mexican restaurant that fires on all cylinders.   the restaurant itself is adorable-i love all the awesome dia de los muertos paintings on the walls and the unique decor. while it isn't in the greatest neighborhood, you'd have no idea once you walked inside.    the salsa bar! oh my god, i don't even know where to start with how amazing this thing is.  i am a huge salsa fan (wouldn't mind eating it with every meal, or as a meal, whatever) and i've never known of a restaurant to have so many options! i could literally come here and only eat chips and salsa for hours and never get bored because of all the choices!   horchata! they put an interesting spin on the horchata by adding pecans and fresh fruit to it.  i thought this might be weird since i've never had it that way, but it was totally delicious and refreshing.    food! the menu is packed with delicious items that have some unbelievable flavors.  i recommend the carne asada burrito or the bullet (bean and cheese).    i'll be coming back soon!

IJUqnsu8U-PTbquQoJDW9A.text: My hands down favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. The dishes are complex & very flavorful. Great salsa bar too. The horchata is out of this world.

wdbDr3hM9PxoHq4MT4pVjw.text: La Santisima has an excellent selection of salsas. The food and especially the various burritos, are unique and taste excellent!

ahWrwhbIGYETXYUq5LELQQ.text: Yet another eatery I've put off trying for way too long! With a name that doesn't dissapoint this gourmet taco shop is appealing on the outside, and warm and welcoming on the inside. Seating is tight and scarce, so arrive early and be prepared to make new friends. My favorite part about this place aside from the food, is the salsa bar... who knew that many salsas even existed? I ordered the El Gaucho burro, packed full of marinated steak, then topped with avocado, cucumber, and chimichurri sauce which gave the burrito a crisp flavor. I then proceeded to drench it in chipotle salsa from the salsa bar! The horchata here is to die for, made fresh and topped with walnuts and sliced fruit! For the price, you'll be hardpressed to find an authentic Mexican meal this good anywhere else!

6kJ7PVkUlfV17sva5YCjrA.text: Excellent mole! The home made horchata with fruit & pecans. Great place to take out of towers for authentic Mexican food.

CtYzBFZcwv4c6-adjk5I6Q.text: This is a cool little place to try. I think the best thing on the menu are the quesadillas. They are traditional Mexico City style which are not in the flour tortilla as most places serve but are maid out flour ( I think they are from Mexico City because we were brought up eating them this way). They are deep fried which is worth trying just because of how deliciously amazing they are! There salsa bar is unique with lots of choices, but I do wish they had at least one spicy one. I think their service can improve, ( maybe our server was just having a bad day). But overall good place.

LBqPOe2Jr1thEqYKdyW0ag.text: So I get why this place gets 4.5 stars, the tacos are fabulous!!!!! Yep, 5 exclamation marks good. The tacos are gourmet. I tried the mahi mahi (grilled, I'm not sure if there is a fried version) and the veggie taco. Hmm, they are both equally good; I can't pick one over the other. I can say that the Pecan salsa helped out the fish taco with a nice spiciness and gave it that pizzazz it needed to set it apart.   This is my first visit to La Condesa so, I'm not sure how the place works, but from what I gather you just walk-in and grab a seat then a server will eventually get to you. It was a Sunday evening when we stopped by and there was only 1 SERVER!!! Poor thing was running all over the place. I don't blame her for not getting to us with the first few minutes we sat down. After a little bit she regained her composure and was friendly and accommodating. She really shouldn't of been the only person serving the place was hopping as one group left another entered. There was no one standing around waiting for a place to sit, and honestly I don't know where they would wait.   The paintings on the walls are amazing. Great art work to look at. However, I was seated at the bar and faced empty bar shelves and the light above me was out, so it was very dim. So as far as ambiance, it just wasn't quite working for me.   Back to the food.. The refried beans could use some improvement. Okay, so I am Hispanic and have been eating beans since birth and I have never had beans so watered down. It was more of a cold bean soup. Maybe that's what La Condesa was going for, but that didn't work for me either. The rice was good and warm.    I enjoyed the salsa bar. So many salsas, Cilantro (like), Pico (like), Pecan (like), Peanut, Mexican (like), the list goes on!!  I would visit this place again with the hopes that I get a table next time!

tPxniXicpWHLckKbCiMILQ.text: In Phoenix there is nobody more important than the person who takes care of your A/C.  Mechanical M D deserves more than 5 stars.  He is available when he needs to be, gets things done quickly and will actually repair things rather than just take the easy route and replace them.  He tries to protect your wallet and that is unusual.  I didn't even think to mention "trustworthy".  That is getting harder to come by these days.  Next time you have A/C problems just call Mechanical M D and don't worry.

honS-2OHqz4AN35YYRfJkQ.text: Here's what you'll like. The salsa bar.  It features about a dozen types of salsas, ranging from traditional to the more obscure pecan. The cochinita quesadilla, which really doubles as a Mexican stromboli only deep fried and not baked, is a culinary triumph. And the artwork, all of which macabre -  depicting 'Dio del muerto' scenes -  is erie to say the least, but colorful and provocative.  Here's what you won't like. Your missing car if you don't lock it and set the alarm. The chairs - likely designed by an orthopedic surgeon whose life's mission is to rid the world of scoliosis, one taco aficionado at a time.  In their defense, the chairs look to be some kind of Mexican relic, something they found in an old Mission or something. They're artsy and very heavy carved wood.  One problem. They're so heavy, when you stand up, attempting to furtively sneak to the salsa bar for the fifth time hoping no-one will spot your sloth-ass in the process, they'll give you up in a New York second as they make the most God-awful racket scraping the bare floor.   I don't like it when I'm trying to be sneaky and some inanimate object signals everyone, warning them of my intentions to abscond with the entire salsa bar, greedily hogging it all to myself.

FfQiIVr1y3rlFXEFf8iB4w.text: This place has to get all five stars. Ok, the area is a little suspect I will admit; that can be countered with the excellent food and excellent prices. This is the kind of food that goes for $12 - $15/plate if it were located in an upscale area.  They have done a great job with the interior and the food is really wonderful.  5 Top reasons I love La Condesa:  ~ Beautiful food. Unique flavors.   ~ Great salsa bar: aver a dozen lovely hand made salsas; I liked them all  ~ Price: you can spend under $7 and have a really good meal  ~ Convelient: It is only a 2 minute drive from 24th & Camelback.  ~ Atmosphere: the interior and the service create a great place to dine.  ***We eat out several times a week, and this place is now at the top of the list for my wife and I both.***

RA_8ByqVLrBMyn30JOptlw.text: As much as I love their veggie quesa and amazing salsa bar, I am taking them down a star because I found out they use lard in their rice and beans.  As a vegetarian, this really limits the menu items I can eat.    Veggie quesa is pretty much the only thing I can get.  It is fantastic so it is worth going just for that.  Actually, I'd probably even go just for the salsa bar.  But I wish I could explore other options too.

ElDzampOP8p4cPjf4HbRsA.text: Enjoyed this small boutique Mexican restaurant with emphasis on healthy and unique dishes.  Friendly service.

5EZmWi5RaKxculRyFHU36g.text: Just moved to Phoenix, and am SO HAPPY that we live near La Santisima. The salsa options alone make every trip back well worth it. Highly recommended if you like great Mexican food.

24ZpL1CbsclQFCcoPQJagQ.text: Really great salsa bar, tacos, quesadillas and burros.  This is 'authentic' mexican; not Macayos.   A few downsides though, it is really small & not really built for families or large groups; plus, I wouldn't park in the neighboring streets.  I got yelled at by one homeowner saying if they saw my vehicle again they're having it TOWED!.

4TgS7PVwcYbTYcOSDlmsew.text: After almost 2 months of visiting this place, I am still fantasizing about their food!  I trusted my fellow Yelpers when I was taking a road trip with family to Tucson from California and had to stop for dinner on the way.  The Yelpers' raving reviews did not let us down.  When we got there it actually looked closed from the outside especially since the OPEN sign wasn't lit, but we took a chance and opened the door anyway to find that it was indeed open.    It's a tiny little place with a Dia de los Muertos theme, so it was rich with color and culture.  There was only one server so it was a little slower than we'd like, but in her defense, she was pregnant.   We each had to order the horchata with pecans and melon because it sounded so good.  The cup it came in was HUMUNGOUS and thank goodness for that because it was awesomely delicious!  We also pigged out on the chips and variety of salsas at the salsa bar.  The salsas are seriously amazing and there were a lot to choose from and taste.  I especially loved the jicama salsa.    I ordered 2 carne asada tacos with rice and beans.  I was already so full from eating all those chips and horchata and usually it's hard for me to enjoy the taste of something after I'm super full, but the tacos were so good I finished them.  I only tasted a little bit of the rice, which was okay... probably my least favorite thing I ate there, but the beans were very good!    I was soooo full afterwards and I left with a smile on my face and a new favorite restaurant that I'll have to stop at whenever I'm in Phoenix, which isn't very often, sadly.

fK9ItqUMVauEnGumwZVKQQ.text: Veggie Burro + Salsa Sesame = Heaven. Salsa Chipotle is a close second

StSqpsnJkBQbjtaPRtI0xw.text: Soooo yummy. Great variety. Come early to avoid the crowds in the small confines. Great salsa selection and the horchata is to die for.

1sBRcTQWS0_8n9em8BAFSw.text: This place is amazing! I love their salsa bar and the quaint environment. They don't skimp on the serving sizes either. The tacos always have large portions of meat and fixings. It's one of my favorite places to take out of town visitors. They are always impressed and satisfied. Oh, and the horchata is the best I've ever had. Yes!

9OtMlxjsLqknDI1525oPsw.text: Amazing salsa bar selection, fresh ingredients, very flavorful, mouthwatering tacos. A great dining experience for me and the work gang. Totally worth the drive from downtown Tempe. Can't wait to return. Mmmmmmmm!

pOS58U2jv4CGX_gLyTknoQ.text: Love this place! Not super close to my house but always worth the drive, or a fun place to stop by if I'm headed to the Ranch Market. You have to be looking for it because it's in a tiny strip mall and could be easily passed up. I love the decorations inside it's Dia de los Muertos themed and all the art work is super cool. They have a salsa bar with tons of different salsas you can try out which is fun and gives you a good variety of spice and flavors (try the strawberry one!). All of the tacos I've had have been delicious but if you do get the plate with 2 tacos and rice and beans you're going to be really full or have half of your plate to take home. I haven't been for the happy hour tacos or whatever it is so I will have to make it by 6 one day for the deal. Highly recommend this place.

PlBqcB2g6Q8hcAK2F3IOEg.text: We were in Phoenix for Spring Training (The Cubs) and decided we wanted Mexican food for dinner.  The food was good, the Atmosphere OK and the service was a little slow.  We enjoyed their Salsa bar and the guacamole was very good.We'll most likely come back next year.

_HPDPn-97lOeDN8xDcHKyw.text: This is one of the best places I have ever had the pleasure of eating at. Best burrito I have ever had!!! No joke I kept eating it because it was just that delicious and almost made myself sick. Please try!!!!

LcqH-Idek7sd-rVafN-WbA.text: I had the gaucho taco (chimichurri beef something or other) and the cochinita pibil taco.   Honestly amazing food.   Really interesting assortment of sauces and salsas (jicama salsa, peanut sauce stuff was great.) Looks like they just recently added some awesome new tequilas so I'm looking forward to stopping by at dinner time. Really authentic stuff. Looks like they just had Diners Dives and Drive ins there as there was a cool metal art piece signed by Guy Fieri. Food came out quickly despite lunch rush. I'll be back soon.  Recommended to people looking for authentic places to make their more boring friends jealous of their foodie acumen.

3wZWmWtvWxJe372FVOGVHw.text: Awesome Food.  Best salsa Bar.  They need a bigger restaurant to service more customers.

BeWO2OjcqbC3meRxlB_hoQ.text: Item's tasted include.  Free Chips and Salsa Bar - options including Chipotle, Pico de Gailo, Robano Pibil, Peanut, Jicama, Pecan, Soy, etc.  Baja Sur Shark Taco - Corn Tortilla with Beer Battered Wild Dogfish and lettuce with cilantro mayo  Cabo Shrimp Taco with Beer Battered Wild Tiger Shrimp and cilantro mayo, jicama  Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco - Roasted Pork Shoulder with Achiote Rojo slow cooked in banana leaves topped with lime marinated onions and salsa habanera mayo  Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken Taco - Spices, Chiles, Nuts, and Chocolate  Realizing that an inordinate portion of our travel west, from the Port Fonda experience at Greendirt Farm outside of Kansas City to The Shed and Salsa Brava, had focused on Mexican food I couldn't help but pass by La Condessa while my mother was in town for tacos and although I know some in Phoenix may claim the space is not "authentic" enough for them (from what I've gathered, according to some locals you need to have questionable evaluations from the Health Department to be legit) I can say without a doubt that although I've not been south of the border, these are the best tacos I've ever tasted.  Beginning first with another free chips-and-salsa-bar stocked with a baker's dozen of house-made salsas and sauces paired with slightly salted, almost greaseless, and pleasantly warm tortilla chips and moving on to the four tacos featuring local produce and fresh proteins on (unfortunately not house made) imported flour tortillas I particularly enjoyed the crunchy texture and delicate flavors of the shrimp taco while the bright acidity of the pork shoulder and smoky spice of the chicken taco both worked nicely as well.    Perhaps not as regional as some taco stands (or trucks) and instead choosing to focus on the depth and breadth of Mexican cuisine from coast to coast I'm sure the is "better" or "more authentic" cuisine to be found both here and over the border, but thus far I've not experienced it (outside of the vastly more upscale, expensive, and certainly less authentic Distrito.)

c-9n2KZyOOVu3x_ZyH_0nQ.text: Yesss. I. Love. Tacos. So I got steak and shrimp gaucho tacos and a mahi taco and wasn't disappointed. It's really pricey and the service was slow, but they made me special salsa that was reaaaallly hot after I asked which salsa from their expansive salsa bar was the hottest since it's all clearly made for gringos. Oh and the sound of the chairs screaming across the floor made me cringe. I seriously doubt that I'll ever eat in the restaurant again. I would totally get to go orders since the tacos were bomb and I want to try other stuff!!

P4Nzfl5Hwat8PW4qvSeSXQ.text: Food is fantastic!  Service always stinks.  Will keep coming back though.  Food is too good:)

SNLRo9socDO0tUgRb74nQQ.text: if you're looking for the original Mexican taste this is not the place

lpeOESEL5lFA-dEDzqb6tw.text: Tried coming here once. No parking!  They have like 3 parking spots. Its hot as hell outside no one wants to drive around looking for a place to park on a regular Wednesday night.  Maybe if you can walk or ride a bike or a horse it may be worth trying.  Get a  building with more than 3 parking spots and this place could be legit.

VSNlE0dcf25P01wfi8CsDg.text: I've never eaten anything at La Santissima that wasn't delicious, and the portions are moderate to large. The salsa bar has some great choices and unique flavors. The prices are very reasonable. If you go early, the wait isn't so bad, but the service once you're seated could be better.

8jW6AoQWpUtyTNOKwnctkg.text: Food quality is incredible. The flavors are exceptional! They are very busy but despite that the service is still very fast and efficient. Margaritas are delightful as well; we will definitely be back!

EzefOnDZHO0R_INaCApjPw.text: This place was so totally awesome and unique. My girlfriend and I are visiting from Colorado and this place was recommended by a local and damn did we get lucky. The food was amazing and our waiter Abraham was super kind and took great care of us even though it was busy. The burritos and the salsa bar were out of this world amazing!

86N8LINoD_miSLHGnvOBkQ.text: The place is amazing. And it's REAL Mexican food. Don't be fooled by that la pinata bs. Do yourself a favor and check this place out.

rlz2myWyPPB-Y0Z1BqfLxA.text: Great little place.  Could tell it would be fantastic by the lineup to get in.  Very good tacos and an even better salsa bar. Decor is spot on.  Pricing was very reasonable as well.

bEQ9ECrgfdfARClsPZGKzA.text: This is NOW my fab taco spot. The portions given are more than any other place I usually go to. Their salad bar has so many salsas to choose from. Its so hard to think of something I didn't like. And the horchata is like no other, you'll definitely come back to this place!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huge freaking portions and so flavorful !

FjMlTCYprfcxy0nF6Qko9g.text: The Chicken Mole tacos are phenomenal The salsa bar is the best I've ever had.  By far. La Condesa is a must try.....then you will be back... - M

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great Place! - 20 salsas - chicken Mole tacos to die for - seems like the Countess has...

E6YsQtpcw55JJeOkVqRrbA.text: THE BEST salsa bar in AZ. Amazing everything else, but the salsa bar alone is worth the price of admission.  Expansive menu, the kind that normally would be cause for concern. Yet, everything on it comes out perfect.   I love the fried shrimp tacos and the carne sandwich thing [I forget what they call it now but it's NOT a torta]  The horchata is diabetes in a glass and absolutely worth it [share with a friend, or bring your insulin]

atd_KxZNU_1Di9Mu2LrbVQ.text: Great food, but the service has gone downhill since expanding.  We like the expanded menu. The waitstaff is pleasant, but inattentive.  Example, we came in and a staff member was leaning on the bar chatting, and didn't acknowledge us until another person came from around the bar to seat us.  Great food though.

DpuR1Qo-_22ibs1lUhoF4g.text: One of my favorite little local restaurants! The street tacos are amazing.  I love the cultural variety they bring from south of the border.  The art and atmosphere are hip but not pretentious.  And the salsa bar is stocked with 20 different unique flavors. Watch out! Some of them are very spicy! Small inside so there was a wait on Friday night, but the service was fast and friendly. Love this place!

trS89u_GPBIvh58hiZP_9A.text: Food was great they even serve vegan food  , customer service not so good you have to wait 25 to 30 min to get seated even if they have tables available waiters just walk by you don't say a word to you, salsa bar was pretty much empty at 6pm come on people.... they also serve food in  earthenware dishes you can even smell right in to it...

5eDagnvYdqb5nJ-hQQWdfw.text: This place is delicious. Shrimp mole taco and fish taco and cactus taco. All were great. So is salsa bar.

6Og5gqJR260tfTd_0OfLhw.text: Best tacos I've had during my week in Phoenix, with a literal buffet of well-made salsas to match.   Busy and a little disorganized at lunch (they needed one more person to help handle the crowd), it's worth seeking out.  Get the horchata with fruits and pecans, too - it's great.

y8Dy2rOV6b9BqoQ9m53UGQ.text: Suggest getting street tacos Chicken mole Shark and whitefish Baja style Pork pibil  Chips and chiles sauces incredible!!   Partners had the gaucho:: awesome  The mole ........ Food of the Aztecs gods... Yummy

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Also!! The rice and beans moist,  flavorful customized awesome!!!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Entrance in 111 degree lunch hour

-kdS5RteeCOL1gJLIfq7sA.text: I could have made a meal just from the chips and the great variety of salsa at the salsa bar.  Strawberry and peanut salsa were unique and expertly crafted.  They could have seemed gimmicky but the flavor was no joke and went great with the rest of the meal.  The salsas set the bar high while waiting for my tacos and the tacos had no trouble clearing that bar.  I had 3 different tacos and wish I had room for about 15 more as every variety sounded good to me.  I'll definitely be back to work my way through the menu.

9QZZqhvRY5zerk4Sdz975Q.text: Go early to avoid a long wait. But even with a wait, it's worth it! All four of our meals were superb. We sampled the fish, pork, shrimp and steak tacos, and all were delicious. We tried two with the "protein option", which had griddled cheese instead of tortillas, and I don't want to eat them any other way ever again. One of us had the lonche (like a torta), and there wasn't a crumb left. The salsa bar at the beginning of the meal (you help yourself) was unique, and it included 8-10 different kinds of salsas to sample (peanut, pecan, chipotle, tomatillo, etc.)  Definitely worth the trip. Bonus is the little party store next door with pinatas and all the fun fillings.

Qli0va9RusRoDWuuzI4-xQ.text: Food is good, really good. Service is atrocious. It should not take half an hour for a box so I can leave.

TXGTM-ApXEDbCs5uZ7yD3g.text: Used to love this place but they expanded and apparently the kitchen can't keep up. I tried to call in an order but the phone just rang continuously. So I went to the restaurant to place my order to go and was informed their phone isn't working. I said I wanted to place a to go order and the guy points to the kitchen and says "see all those tickets up there (there were maybe 7) it's going to be a 45 minute wait for a to-go order." I worked in the food service industry. That is horrible customer service. He then told me I could place my order online through Yelp ($10 delivery fee). I was planning on ordering a mole bowl with a side of beans. All of those items are already prepared and take less than 5 minutes to put together. I took my business elsewhere. Learn how to speak to your customers.

SeDvabjOvz1p4OtrBmEyEg.text: My boyfriend and I were craving Mexican and wanted to try a new place so we decided to come here! Since all of the Yelp reviews talked about how amazing this place was we thought it would be great. But it was far from that. The service was fine, the food however, was not. I was charged $13.50 for a bean and cheese burrito al la carte, which wasn't on the menu, but it was more expensive then the majority of the burritos on the menu which included meat, quac, rice, salsa, etc. On top of that, my entire burrito was filled with just cheese. I literally had to unfold my burrito to find it was a tortilla wrapped around shredded cheese. No bean inside. Extremely disappointing especially when our order was so simple and the food was so over priced. Would not recommend to friends and would never consider coming back here.

ZlTHQAuov3f279drMZk8GA.text: Been here a few times now and this place is amazing.  Like many, I am in love with their salsa bar which has at least a dozen different options for dunking your chips in.  While I wish they would provide bigger containers to fill your salsa in, it is meant to be a sampler and not a meal.  The choices are great to have and everyone will find something they like.  What keeps me coming back are the amazing tacos.  I order the shrimp and the mahi fish street tacos each time and they are some of the best in town.  Really great flavor and healthy portions.  Can't wait to eat again!!  A few particulars - this is a very small little place on 16th with mostly street side or residential parking, no actual lot.  During peak times, good luck finding a seat and the line at the register where you must order will leave you waiting a bit.  It's worth it for the taste, but just be prepared.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great salsa bar with something for everyone.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome bar!

LPBGCxa-BVRanyZXKOYbBg.text: I love the food at santisima.  the salads are much larger than necessary but very tasty and fresh. I usually order them to go while at work. It could easily be shared with two people.  Another favorite is the Mayan cochinita pibil tacos.  They're not the mini tacos that you find at so many restaurants these days; they're hearty and filling and greasy AF, but also they are what really brings me back.  Their margaritas are really good and they have several different types to choose from. One common thing I have noticed is that there are not enough servers for the amount of tables and people that are there. I guess what I am saying is that you might only get one margarita, so make it last.

kcTyQcGtV1skThQU2MvYuQ.text: Not what i expected. I got a quesadilla and there was a puddle of grease on the plate. Not just a little grease, it was tons of it. I took a bite and it dripped down the side of my lip. Could only take 2 bites. I showed the waiter and he just shrugged his shoulders and apologized. I know he didnt cook it, but he didnt offer to remake it or worst case scenario take it off the bill. 2 street tacos and 2 bites of a quesadilla, that looked nothing like advertised for $21. Never again, lesson learned.

DOa5ZgLb4rxKp1VVS4CWdA.text: The variety of salsas is pretty damn good. They will have everything from the most unoffensively bland salsa for gueros to a chile de arbol salsa that could make my daddy sweat.

zcsBc-zUg6HyZ2IG4s-UhA.text: Best local Mexican food Ever!!!! Amazing service, Amazing Food, Amazing Salsa bar!!!!

NrD9bQI3T-XMzowTVzHQLA.text: Absolutely love this place! Tacos are amazing and salsa bar is creative and diverse (the cashew salsa is truly delicious and there are a number of options to choose from). The gaucho taco is a solid staple with charcoal grilled steak, sliced avocado and pickled onions, and the arrachera taco has subtle complexities of flavor despite its somewhat simplistic presentation. There are also an abundance of other delicious/unique menu options (such as the deep fried Quesadilla for example), and the wait staff is very helpful and kind as well. Would definitely recommend this place to family and friends in search of a local one of a kind hole in the wall Mexican restaurant. Definitely a must try if you are in the area.

rd04uCGPc-bn-FR7KTkMwg.text: Not worth the hype... waited 30 mins and got bland and flavorless fried pork quesadilla... Yuck. Unfortunately me and my pregnant wife we both ordered similar item she had chicken in hers and I was lucky one to get the deep fried chewy like gum fried pork which was Very bizarre. Horchata was again over hyped I felt. All in all it was 40 minutes wait time with my pregnant wife and garbage like taste at least what we ordered. The salsa's are not so great I can make better one in my Vitamix @home or you can get canned salsa's from food city which are far better.  May be the burritos and Tacos are good and I am writing this review if there are someone like me who might dislike deep fried chewy pork in Quesadilla.  It was $33 with tip $38 (I don't know why I tipped... lol)I  wish I wouldn't have gone there and would buy some food for hungry people on the streets with the same amount of money that would have given me much satisfaction. Will never go here again... If in FL try Senor Taco in St Petersburg and try all the items it's worth every penny. I am an Indian and trying to find a good Mexican restaurant but it's bland taste in Phoenix including this place.

wIE3GGLbIxJWSLEQ0dKG_Q.text: Great little gem for authentic Mexican food tucked away in a small building on 16th Street.  They have great service, a comfortable atmosphere and an amazing salsa bar! We tried the smoked Marlin and El Gaucho tacos. Yummy!

X6y1kmT78xfsXYmr_C43Nw.text: Found this place on yelp and with as many great reviews as it has.... how could it be anything less than amazing?!? Boy was I wrong! It was Sunday evening about 5 pm so I can understand the 30 min wait to be seated. I figured I would get a drink while we waited, so I ordered 2 michelada's with Tecate Light. I will confess, they were good which accounts for one of the stars I have given. By this time, I have noticed how unhappy all the employees seem to be. Would it hurt to crack a smile? Once seated, we placed our order and were given a half empty basket of chips... the chips were good and the salsa options were great! The salsa bar is what earned that 2nd star! Unfortunately, chip refills will cost you $2.70 - may have been worth is since it took some 30 min plus to get our food. The food was meh. Dull, over-priced and served cold.... like it had been sitting a while. To top it off, when we got the bill - the michelada's were $12 each!!! This place really missed the mark for me and my husband and we will NOT be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $12 Micheladas?!? Ouch.

HsORvrM-JI30vHiVh1-4CA.text: The food is amazing! Fresh ingredients & great taste! The quesadillas are my favorite, filled with cheese! My One Complaint: I was seated by the salsa bar next to the wall & somehow ended with white all over my jeans & jacket! photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Noticed it On my way to the car... I took part of the wall with me... Not cool!

7wi444KBXC9vhrDkt_T5zg.text: Not worth it. The tacos are mediocre... Sonora taco is meat (small portion), factory tortilla and cabbage. The Mariachi taco was a Barbacoa taco and the shell was hard, meat was dry, and I was searching for the flavors and there was none. When they say gourmet tacos, I'm thinking it would be like Barrio Cafe.. nope not even close. Rice, is white rice and corn, nothing special, beans are your typical beans you get from any Mexican place. I would say, maybe I can go back and try something else on their menu (lots of options), but the service was very amateur (couldn't complain about anything because they don't check on you during your meal) and the host had to clean our table after we sat. Also, the pesty fly was why they got 2 stars from 3. The decor is authentic looking and I love the paintings but other than that, I'll spend my money down the street instead.

yKWdPcT9Vzs2vCWOJeq3Zw.text: Took my parents and the wife a few days ago. Service was awesome. Food was delicious. The only down thing was that they only had 4 Menus for the entire packed restaurant

BKDp3F4AUzm0-82EiQKHLQ.text: This is the best taqueria I've ever been to!! Highly recommended for the fresh and delicious food with a bunch of  sauces available to try in a place that is clean, and a team who can also cater to vegans.  I'm not Mexican, but I've heard of the different sauces in their cuisine, and I finally got try some of those on trip with my fiancee to Phoenix.  I dream about the food in Miami when I'm craving Mexican food.

jHNyub2Xnz7F8xh3uWln0A.text: Great food. I like the decor. Loved the margaritas. Friendly staff. Definitely a great place to eat. Must try at least once especially if you like Hispanic food

I-ueWOB1nv_62_KMLd3EZg.text: Amazing chef style tacos made to perfection. Great tasting salsas at the salsa bar. Decent service.

ZQaPh0TN5zaz06Y2ReahFw.text: What's most fascinating about La Santisima is that their three separate locations seem to vary greatly in reputation. There's the one in Downtown Glendale, which receives mostly positive reviews. There's one in Flagstaff, that strangely receives a lot of harsh criticism. And then there's this location, the flagship, which receives an exorbitant amount of Yelp reviews that are mostly positive, with the occasional one-star reviews complaining about their terrible customer service.  My feelings on Santisima have always been mixed. It's one of my girlfriend's favorite restaurants based on the quality of their guacamole, horchata, and rice and beans. Hell, they also make some pretty decent tacos to boot. But as many people have stated, Santisima is a primary example of a restaurant that's become incredibly popular, but has failed to adapt their model to accommodate the crowds.  Wait times are very common. Parking is horrid, there's hardly any room to wait inside, and rarely will you ever be greeted upon walking in. We usually have to hunt down a server in order to put our names on the list. What's also strange is that, you might see tons of empty tables inside that are unused, while crowds of people are waiting inside in order to get in. When we were dining there recently, a nearby couple finished up their food and left. Their table was left uncleaned for over an hour - all while a group of about a dozen people were waiting outside.  I've also learned that this isn't a restaurant where you want to spread out your portions. Order everything at once. Drinks, appetizers, and entrees. And as soon as they bring out the food, request the bill. If not, you'll be sitting around here for a long, long time.  Santisima's menu is kind of intimidating. They cover a lot of ground. Probably too much, in fact. I usually play it safe and just order some of their street tacos. They're good, but in the last few years with increased exposure to other options, I don't quite consider them to be as mind-blowingly amazing as some people are saying. Rice and beans are very good, however, with my girlfriend always citing how authentic the beans taste in comparison to that canned rubbish most people dish out.  Many people rave about the salsa bar, as if it's some kind of new, foreign invention that they've never seen before. Yes, people. There's a salsa bar. Any reputable taco place has one. Santisima might be considered a cut above the rest, however, because of the variety available.    I ordered their traditional quesadilla on a whim, expecting the same thing I receive at practically every taco shop in Phoenix. Instead, I received a giant-sized, deep-fried quesadilla with oaxaca cheese and butter flavoring that's more on par with a gordita. I love the cheese, but the breading is a bit too chewy for my taste.  Their horchata is consistently referenced by many people as being one of the best you can find - provided that you're into chunks. The drink, which is far superior to the more commonly found pre-mixed rubbish, contains hearty cuts of strawberry, cantaloupe, and pecans. In my opinion, it definitely lives up to its reputation.  The place has a "dive" feel, similar to what you'd find at Barrio Cafe. Thankfully, they're a bit less arrogant about their prices - so the place seems more of an authentic establishment and less like a yuppie playground. However, watching clueless men unknowingly walk in and out of the "Catrinas" restroom always manages to generate some laughs. They've since added a "Women" sign above the door to stop this from happening.  The food at Santisima is very good - although I think my girlfriend is a bit more enthusiastic about it than I am. I don't quite see them as the five-star establishment that so many other people claim, but they're still worthy of a strong recommendation based on the food alone.  Recommended!

xzLbfsu2zHKSTZgqaA0vWQ.text: I didn't realize this place was on Diners, Drive- Ins and dives until we got there and saw a huge picture of Guy Fieri. Trust me when I say you need to go here if you visit Phoenix. There is a salsa bar that you can go to to get any sorts of salsa they have made for the day. They were delicious! The food was absolutely fantastic. I ordered a pork burrito that was so good every bite, and there was a lot of food. I couldn't finish it, and I can eat a lot! My husband and friend both really enjoyed their entrees, too (shrimp Jamaican burrito and a roasted cauliflower burrito). It wasn't until after I ordered that I decided to ask the server what their most popular dish was, and I wish I would have ordered what she described to me! Our server was really friendly, too. I'd be in trouble if I loved in Phoenix because I probably frequent this place more than I should.

jsXVhay2g32zRKivmP15zw.text: Amazing food, restaurant is horribly ran,stood around forever to be acknowledged, when we finally were we said we just needed to pick up a to go, and then we proceeded to wait even longer just awkwardly standing around as people ran in front of us and behind us, they were sure fast to have us pay, but then we're slow about giving us our stinking food, then the order was wrong and they didn't do anything to make up for the inconvenience, probably won't be back.

yJx5uLllx9fP6WGwGWLhWg.text: If I ever go back to Phoenix, I am going back to this restaurant. Salsa bar, incredibly fast service, outstanding tacos (reccomend the brisket) and the best habanero cilantro margarita I've ever had. Highly reccomend making the journey to this restaurant.

crLqYqiqqMobVhAMDC900Q.text: The absolute best Mexican food! Everything is made fresh to order and delicious! The mole is unforgettable! The drinks are top notch too.

LWw9HjFtAYIXQJDIpdgg8A.text: Some of the best food I have had in Phoenix. The atmosphere is beautiful, the server was wonderful. They have tasty traditional salsa and interesting flavors I've never tried. For breakfast I had the criollo plate - SO GOOD. I was hooked and decided to get lunch as well. Tacos al pastor are the bomb diggity. You won't be disappointed

bNi8mwfQvw5KnmC_a_qAFA.text: Oh My God!  I don't know how else to describe the flavors, the art, the music, and the vibe of this place.  The salsa bar has a good variety.  The guac was unique, chunky with bits of mango and crasins, onions, tomatoes.  I highly recommend the cabo shrimp tacos.  Don't come during the rush times. This is not traditional Mexican.  The flavors are from the Oaxaca region which is why there is only corn tortillas and fruits in a variety of the dishes.  This is not the place for smothered burritos, enchiladas, chimichangas, or fajitas. This is taco land that also has burros and fried quesadillas. I hope you enjoy this as much as I did.

enz51I99KNxxA3r7PvNdBA.text: I travel for a living, so I'm not just comparing this place to one or two other Mexican joints.    That said: the Sonora Arrachera Burro was hands-down the best burrito I have ever had in this country.  Do yourself a favor and order one of their quesas before your meal, too.  And come hungry - those burritos are not small.   My only regret is that I'm not in town longer, because there were other menu items that sounded really good as well.  I guess I'm just going to have to come back to Phoenix soon so I can try another one.

kTrAQ-tjrWF9mv0uY2JbGg.text: This place has the best gourmet tacos in Phoenix, they also have delicious margaritas that make you want to go back , they also have a full salsa bar with so many different types of unique salsas. I been coming here for the past 5 years and I've never been disappointed, definitely recommend it.

K6ClSzifkio0C9WRja_gAg.text: Love the salsa bar !!! Basically this is the hole in the wall that was featured on food network diner dives and drive ins. We had to wait in a sketchy neighborhood for 30 min so was it worth it?  I would say yes since i haven't had too many good Mexican salsa bars. This one had about 10 salsas one was even strawberry !  The smoked marlin bowl was delicious as well as the beef steak tacos.

Jra_r_LJKquG4nF29TNfJg.text: The salsa bar with complementary chips is a blast.  Not truly complementary as the food and drinks are not cheap for a taco shop.  Husband had the pork with banana leaf, rice and beans on side.   He left the rice alone (too full). His burro was excellent with a good flavor to the slow roasted pork.  I got the chicken burro with moles sauce.  It was not great, no taste of nuts or orange.  I took the flour tortillas off and mixed the chicken with a little salsa.  Still not great.  Five stars because my husband's pork was good and the salsa bar was really fun. Place was really busy.  Will come back to try something else.
