VCQ22KVpXxL9DACKCKbeQQ.text: on 12/4/2018 my husband and I came to eat here right as soon they opened. They opened on time. Inside the place it very authentic. Love the wall art. It was very clean. The personnel were very friendly. the only table service is when they take your food to your table. So you have to order food at the register, pay and then get a number. It is a popular place so it got full and busy quick. The food was really good. My husband and I are foodies so eating at this place was fun. The salsa bar was delicious. You can sample lots of different salsas. None of them were spicy, but then again I love spicy so don't take my word for it. I recommend this place. I have family coming to visit me soon from California and this is the first place im going to take them to eat. For any foodie, you got to try it at least once.

5j1QPMbcqK8fVxzYR6NVdg.text: Being originally from the Midwest, I had no idea Mexican food could be so dynamic and delicious. La Santisima was suggested to me by a coworker who lives locally.  My wife and I try and visit La Santisima weekly and are working through their humongous menu. Every thing we have ordered was delicious and the customer service was great.  The Oaxacan Black Mole Burro and Quesa has been one of my favorite entrees here along with the Queso appetizer.

ccEKlhCzTqmSflkh8DEGQw.text: I was so excited to try this place out, I'm always looking for the next beat tacos. My boyfriend and I get there and immediately noticed the great interior design of the place. Really well put together. We get seated and noticed that there was a little salsa station. We picked ourselves most of the salsas they were serving. Honestly, they were good but not the best.  After 10-12 minutes of waiting for someone to take our drink order, a waitress comes. She later comes back with our drinks. We yet again had to wait a little longer to place our order. We finally ordered our food. 15mins go by.. 25... 30... 40... honestly that's the last time I checked the clock! We were getting so impatient. If it wasn't because we had eaten chips we would have been more hangry. Mind you it's the 1st time she had check up on us after an hour of being there. My boyfriend wanted another drink but our waitress was nowhere to be seen for most of the time we were there she would pass our tables but not acknowledge us at all.  For the 1st time after she took our food order, god knows how many minutes later she comes and checks up on us She then comes to tell us that something had happened to her their ticket machine and I guess the cook never got it because the machine was jammed. She gave my boyfriend a beer on the house. Three minutes after that, we finally get out food!! I mean the food was good, it was actually really good and we enjoyed our plate I'm not gonna lie we thought it would be bigger portions but it's OK. I was just really upset at the service we got.  Not gonna lie, I went to the bathroom it was  pretty dirty there was toilet paper on the floor, you could tell they haven't been cleaned in a couple hours and there wasn't that many people in the restaurant so I don't know how many hours it had been since the last clean. The menu was a little overwhelming.  The 2 stars are for the food and design of the place.

4qHPFsJCQ-Ty40PM9DBZ3A.text: Was in Phoenix for a few hours only and decided to give La Santisma a try, solely based on review count.  Left a little underwhelmed. This place was covered by Guy Fieri and that raised my expectations a few notch.  The gourmet tacos were nothing special. My group had the fish, shark and chicken tacos. And none of the 3 stood out. The salsa bar had over a dozen salsa variations and most of them were good. However, the disposable cups were too small. Ended up making several annoying trips to the salsa bar. Recommend the peanut salsa. I had the La Condesa Shrimp burro. It was good. The guac was also pretty good.

My friend ordered one of the quesadillas and took half of it home to enjoy later since they are quite large! The chips are super fresh and delicious with the right amount of salt and the salsa/condiments bar is AMAZING! My favorite is the salsa verde. As we were arriving I was so excited as this was on my list for awhile!    We walk in and I'm in love! We were greeted and escorted to our table in a timely manner. My grandma, my mom and my best friends had to experience the deliciousness of this establishment.   Thank you for being amazing! I'll see you soon! Thank you for the fresh chips all the time!

pYJtl1QwJ4unT2Mgs_TOCg.text: Just one word..  WOW!  I could write how great food was but i wouldn't do justice.  So let's just stick with wow!

VJ6QrtFM_mPk215pnXkdaw.text: The most unique-tasting Mexican food around! We keep this restaurant in our lunch/dinner rotation. We swing by every 1-2 weeks. Here are 3 different dining options:  Dine-in Dinner: On busy week nights service can be really slow. We've waited 30+ minutes to get our food and we do not have the patience for that. On average the wait has been about 25 minutes from when they take our order, which is alright but could definitely improve.   They provide complimentary chips & salsa with the meal. They have a salsa bar with tons of different flavors to try.  The horchata is just as unique as their tacos - it's mixed with fruit bits and pecans. We order it every single time, definitely recommend giving it a try.   We've tried a handful of gourmet tacos and a couple of burritos. They were all good but the tacos are better. We've tried almost all of the tacos in the gourmet menu and every single one has been amazing. I understand why it's always so busy but we really dislike the wait times.. So we stopped dining in and order take-our instead.  Take-Out: We've been ordering take-out and we have been obsessed! We call to order ahead, pick up the food, bring it back to our house and enjoy our tacos & horchata. Our food is always ready within 20 minutes or less which is so much faster than dining in. We are fortunate to live about 5 minutes away so we save a lot of time by doing this. The food doesn't get soggy and tastes the same. They still provide chips to-go & access to the salsa bar so it's the same dining experience without a server and eliminates the wait time. Huge pro for us.  Weekend Brunch: They only provide brunch on the weekends, the weekday menu items are not available. Their brunch is great as well! They have sweet and savory options to try from. Our favorite was the crunchy French toast - perfect amount of sweet and great texture. We've only gone for brunch once but I would definitely go again. It's not as busy as the weekdays so the dining experience was good.  Overall the food is 5/5 but I had to knock down a star because of the slow service for weekday dine-in. If you don't mind waiting or happen to stop by when they're not busy, you'll love this place. If you live close by, I definitely recommend getting take-out.

Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata with fruit &amp; pecans

zI02k9WE2ZQn8Tb-YeQ4Qw.text: Came here on a semi-busy Sunday night. I ordered at the counter and sat in the nice dining area. There's a drink and salsa bar. You'll also get free chips when dining in. A good chunk of the chips were a stale and the ones that weren't were tasty.   I got the mix and match three taco deal which comes with rice and beans. I got one carne arrachera (steak), chilango suadero (beef brisket), and Al Pastor (spicy pork). All three tacos were delicious. The rice and beans were good, too. I waited a good 25 minutes for my taco plate which is longer than most Mexican restaurants.   Had I not tried the stale chips and not wait as long as I did, this place would've been 5 stars just based on the tacos. The steak was the best.

_dH1Ix49Onlg59IgYut9Mw.text: Went there last night with my roommate and we had a delicious meal! We were immediately seated and the service was attentive. I ordered there taco chicken soup and four a la cart tacos, all were very good.  My roommate ordered their fish tacos and enjoyed them very much.  I will definitely be back.  I love this place especially because of how authentic the tacos are; the mole taco was my favorite.

plUbTv35ijOfJBVsUKIcQw.text: The best Mexican food around. Salsa bar has too many options - cilantro salsa got me like crazy. The classic lime margarita ( superb tasty), gandhi bowl, gandhi taco, vegan burro ( I don't remember the name) second one on their vegan menu- these are the things we ordered and every dish stands top.  Really liked it. FYI the waiting time is crazy. Entered at 8:10 and we seated by 9:00. I have no idea if they actually take reservations but a must try place.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar menu

p80Kr8V6dEXN-qUp19grag.text: We had but one evening to ourselves in Phoenix and La Samtisima is what we chose for dinner! Wow! We arrived early at 5:30pm before the incredible line started and were able to come right in for a table.   Thankfully, we were able to try everything from tacos to tequila and guacamole and enjoy it all! We got our leftovers to go as the service was unhurried and friendly! We had our late dinner*2 that evening in our hotel at 11pm+ and made it out the next morning on our flight back to the east coast!  We look forward to returning! Family calls and family needs comfort when times are tough! Add guacamole and life is good!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Appetizer!

Y4saGAWB3hHZuDurp3nNQA.text: Headed to La Santisima to get some great tasting tacos! It was a taco craving kind of day. Arrived around 7pm on a Tuesday night and the place wasn't too busy, was greeted and seated right away. Started the meal off with some house made guacamole, it had cilantro, serrano chili, onion, tomato, mango, jicama and cranberries. Oh my yum this stuff is amazing. Our server even told us they just where awarded best tasting guacamole in the valley and I'd have to agree! ( phoenixnewtimes.com/best...) I knew I wanted tacos, so I went with the mix and match 3 tacos with beans and rice plate. For my tacos I went with Aztec Tinga Taco, Oaxaca black mole chicken taco and the La Santisima specialty taco. The Aztec Tinga Taco was tender juicy shredded chicken with tomato, onion and Aztec chipotle salsa. The Oaxaca black mole chicken taco was a blend of spices, chilis, nuts and chocolate made in to this rich flavorful sauce that was mixed with shredded chicken. The La Santisima specialty taco had steak, toasted Oaxaca cheese, mushrooms, poblano peppers, onions, garlic and salsa. While all three tacos were great and flavorful, I am still dreaming about the mole, omg the mole is soo amazing, I need more of it in my life. The salsa bar is still on point with lots of variety. Never a bad meal at La Santisima. Need to go back asap for that mole.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9sw7usRTA1V2UFonGGjnFA.text: I decided to come to AZ to visit family and this was my only night here, so I decided to try some Mexican food. I spent about 45min trying to find a great place to eat and this restaurant had amazing reviews on yelp which I for the most part trust, so I was super excited to try it out.   We'll start with the good bc I think that's most fair. The refried beans were pretty good and they have a salsa bar with all different kinds of salsa which I found to be pretty unique.  Other than that, I was extremely disappointed in my visit. It cost $45 for 2 quesos and two sets of tacos. Fair warning, you CANNOT mix the street taco mix and match plate with any of the specialty tacos even thought the menu clearly states "add any tacos from below to the mix and match plate for an extra charge", and next to each specialty taco is the charges of 50 cents-$2. We had a take out order and specifically asked how much two street tacos and one of the specialty tacos were and they said an extra .50. Turns out we get there and they charged me for the "gourmet taco" plate which was an extra $5 (in addition to the specialty taco fee) than the street tacos because I had ordered ONE specialty taco.  They first tried to tell me I had ordered gourmet tacos. Thinking this was my mistake I apologized then read them off my order I had on my phone and when I realized they were in fact on the street taco plate, they then said "oh you can't add on gourmet tacos to the street tacos" and I said ok that's fine. I guess I'll pay an extra $5 thinking they had spiced up my street tacos bc I was now paying for a gourmet plate. Unfortunately, these tacos were the same as the other set of just street tacos we had ordered. I could have gotten ALL gourmet tacos for the same price. My tacos were bland and even the salsas didn't do much which made paying extra even worse. The rice on the side was also mushy and overcooked.  Lastly, I was thinking oh well it's hard to make a bad queso, so it's good we had ordered that. I was expecting some great queso with it being $9. This again was not the case. The queso was completely solidified and we had to reheat it twice while eating to make it even dip-able with chips. I have ordered fantastic take out queso, so I didn't see that as an excuse for bad queso. Again, super bland and not sure goat cheese was even in it because that has a particular taste that I love.  I am definitely NOT coming back here again. Perhaps it was just my own particular experience with this food and yours could be great but if you want a great food experience with the abundance of options here in Phoenix, I wouldn't even risk coming here.

FaPB4p2adG35oKFeacux8Q.text: Love love  really great food so sweet staff service was wonderful the food is authentico ! We will be back

j342frakEmbEKCVk_nJNag.text: We're still enjoying for now but this place is slipping. Over the past few visits we've noticed a decline in the quality of food, service and the building. Recently, the food has been dry, overcooked and bland, we've been given stale chips on the regular, come on they're just chips. The chairs are covered in food stains, the booths are ripped everywhere and the walls are water damaged. The most upsetting part of our visit was the smell of raw sewage near the salsa bar. I hope this isn't a sign of things to come.

zuyFcu9jnyYLodvbE_46rA.text: So good!!  I came here on New Year's Eve right before it closed and was so glad I got to try it.  I went with the street tacos combo (3 tacos with sides of beans and rice). I loved that the food came on a hot plate because my tacos never were cold. The unique spices and flavors in each tacos were so delicious.  You get a free order of chips per table with access to their various salsas. The guacamole was surprisingly spicy!

S9O-A37xeA2_ZPWKQMLOiQ.text: My absolute faveeee tacos in all of Arizona. I haven't tried their specialty tacos, but their al pastor street taco is HEAVENLY. I don't have any pictures either because I can never wait that long to dive in. The orange creamy looking salsa (I think it's pecan) is my favorite one from the salsa bar  The servers are nice and the food comes out fast! I usually order to go and the food is always done ten minutes after I call- even when it's busy.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al pastor tacos with extra pineapple on the side

lp5Hq8ULthjhIJvjdWrIkw.text: Walked in for lunch on a Saturday. There was no wait for 3 people. Although there were a couple of empty tables, there was only one server and she seemed moderately busy.   As soon as we sat down, the server brought us iced water and a bowl of nachos. The first bowl is on the house. There's a bottomless salsa bar where you can grab as much salsa as your heart desires. I kept going back for the pico and the jicama.  My group shared two plates of the Mix & Match gourmet and street tacos. Each Mix & Match order comes with 3 tacos and rice and beans. I ordered the Pacific White Fish gourmet taco and Carne Arrachera street taco. If I had to choose one, I'd go for the Pacific White Fish again. I don't like cabbage, but the cabbage and sauce is what made it for me. That and the fresh, crispy juiciness of the fish.  Loved the food, the service and the decor.

TtuLsDO0bW9RZ0I_H6_5XA.text: The salsas are so original and delicious, not to mention the delicious food. Also gluten friendly. :-)

HcfGlZLk5xnt6YmheZT3FQ.text: My wife and I love this place. We go to their location on Glendale Avenue.  Love the Salsa bar. We enjoy the burritos. Some people may think the prices are high for tacos and burritos. The quality is worth if!

VDPGSWMCDrDwK344JqgjbQ.text: Awesome selection of tacos and great salsa's... the restaurant itself it very tiny though! When its busy good luck finding a seat. You can always carry out.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool signage!

xUqAfIJO06ya9CbQAN60Hg.text: Came here to check out a New Mexican spot and it is definitely my favorite. Everything is fresh and tastes amazingly good!! I tried their shark taco and my brother had their fried quesadillas  Great service too. Can't wait to come back.

GmflmUM-BtCfPT1A37DAZg.text: My first time here was really good the Horchata had strawberry in it and cinnamon on top. I got the shark and shrimp burrito and it had lots of flavor. The Burrito was big enough to probably share with two light eaters. The salsa bar was great I tried somethings that were outside of my normal but it was a good experience all around. Other than the place being small I have no complaints. Great place.

kPZwfr6cYWp6bXV4sKkapg.text: This is hands down one of my favorite taco shops ever! The restaurant itself is pretty small inside, but it is always packed because it is a local favorite. There is a salsa bar with around 15 different types that you can sample for your chips and dinners. Every time I go I get two fish tacos, and they always hit the spot. The different alcoholic drinks look amazing, and I will have to try one of those the next time I come! I have tried taking every person I love here just to share this favorite of mine with them!

zYV0A02lqRVKdeln1nVxgg.text: The worst thing about this place is the number of choices.  Well, they also charge for extra chips.  But you shouldn't eat so many chips anyway, save room for their delicious tacos.  The Pibil are great, as are the gaucho tacos. I'll definitely be coming back to try more of their creations.

j5CViYNFuxEvWIz0oL0egg.text: We stopped in on July 4th for lunch. We were told we could sit wherever we wanted.  The server walked over and asked for a drink order. He later brought chips and let us know they had a salsa bar.  We walked over and they have a big selection. We tried several and they were very tasty. We ordered the fried quesadilla with chicken and beans and rice and an order of guacamole.  The quesadilla was amazing. The chicken was cooked perfectly and it was spicy. The refried beans were the best I have ever had, I just wished the side was bigger than the small cup it was served in.  Everything was excellent, except the service was a little slow. We had to ask for water, silverware and an extra plate a couple of times before it was brought over. But, the food definitely made up for it. Cant wait to go back!

72V_uU41kZipUOTn6WMBnQ.text: Yelp helped me find this gem. Every part of the meal was delish from the salsa bar, house margarita, to the street tacos. The staff was very friendly as well. It is a very small location and I went during off hours, it worked perfectly.

hvxgmxkiknjZsKyAsKAm8A.text: Salsa bar was great.  Some of the salsas were extremely hot and kinda wish they would label the heat index somehow.  The tacos and horchata were fantastic.  Two young guys as the servers who were extremely friendly and helpful. I didn't realize the quesadillas were fried which I didn't like.  I am not sure if it is listed on the menu, but that really is a slight complaint.    I would go again and just stick to the tacos

wDvUjGE0GtTjBaBXWE0cnA.text: I am from California so used to amazing Mexican food. But this place may be my favorite yet!  I had the beef quesadilla which was prepared differently than I've ever seen.  Fried large corn tortillas with yummy tender steak and cheese inside.  Wish I had room to eat the whole huge thing!  Also sangria was a work of art.  And totally reasonably priced.  Plus really nice people. So happy I followed yelp to this wonderful place!

4sqwMv7pDBfZDFADvAe6rQ.text: Order at the counter and decided to try lots. Street tacos were good but not the best I've had. Quesadilla with shrimp and chilies was amazing. Chips and all the salsas were great and the guacamole with cranberries was also very good and a nice change. Margarita was very good. Downside was the paper lined baskets and plastic utensils for eating. I'd go back but didn't leave raving like so many others.

99a8VLn9v_sQUNqiNHuwGg.text: Great tacos.  Burrito was good but bit salty.   Doesn't look like much from outside but we had great lunch there.

te05tNTGqKkJSFHB5zQDqw.text: 1st time at this restaurant I was surprised they make you wait outside the building for a table.  Because it's  really small inside, 10 total tables... 30 minute guarantee wait.  Noticed two dirty tables were available while we waited, those 2 dirty tables only sat 2.   Decent food, probably an 8/10.  Those 2 dirty tables were never cleaned until we finished eating.  By the time we were done eating 6 groups of people were waiting outside and there were 6 dirty tables waiting to be cleaned for these 6 people.  Only 10 total table in this place and they are making people wait 30 minutes just so they can get around to cleaning them.  Customers kept coming in and they would tell them 25 minute wait.   As a customer eating in the restaurant this will drive you nuts and make your experience a 4/10 and not want to come back.  Just because they make people wait outside in the heat when tables are sitting dirty for 30 minutes.

hbZfHV0s2qYW6V_M3HLpig.text: I had lunch at La Santisima today. Food was great, their horchata is awesome, and I loved the salsa bar. They were packed so the service was slow but totally worth the wait!

8CTaOR4p6DHWRLRgi5dxwA.text: Salsa bar alone is worth it.  Awesome artwork is worth it.  Best tacos/burritos are the cactus ones.  Not overpriced.  We love this place.

vlsR08vhEX92OWTtUV7UJA.text: This food is phenomenal...best salsa bar, tacos and burritos! El gaucho and the santisima special are the best!

nag0RoICQhmwtWmr--HU-w.text: So glad we finally got to try this place! The salsa bar is awesome and our tacos were so good.  The veggie taco had so much flavor.  The service was also very good. Two very nice attentive servers! Can't wait to go back.

nDeGeVEcMQjx52ej4zrWAg.text: Great restaurant! Food is fresh, delicious, and fast. Fancy, gourmet tacos for a reasonable price.

i2LYKwu5T26f4-oedazJNg.text: All I can say is SALSA BAR. I love this place. A little bit expensive for a taco place, but I'm not complaining. I'd recommend this to anyone who wants fresh authentic tacos

kap3eJSklUkOMpmxYkhaaw.text: Shrimp Tacos are out of this world!!! So fresh and tasty. The horchata is great also!

vbT58fDoUaV7UVU20UBvDQ.text: I've been in to La Condesa twice now, both during their happy hour. If you're not aware of their happy hour, familiarize yourself with it. It's pretty damned good ($3 delicious margaritas and $2 chicken tinga or carne asada tacos).  To start, there is the salsa bar. You get one basket of chips (any more than that you pay for, but my wife and I never eat more than 1 basket-full) and then there are about 16-20 different types of salsa and sauces to try. I've only been brave enough to try about 5 of them, and they've all been decent-really good. My favorite was their tomatillo, and their chipotle didn't really do it for me, but I don't usually enjoy the taste of chipotle peppers in general. Too smokey. The first time I went I got 2 carne asada tacos and 1 chicken tinga taco. I was disappointed in the carne asada. The meat was dry and topped with dry shredded cabbage. It has a decent flavor, but I had to put salsa on it because it was too dry for me. The chicken tinga, on the other hand, was pretty fabulous. The chicken has a very flavorful sauce on it with good spice, and it's topped with pickled red onion. Fantastic. I also had a plate of rice and beans which were delicious as well. So, the second time I went in, I ordered only chicken tacos. No biggie. I highly recommend checking this place out. 5 tacos, 2 margaritas, and some rice and beans for $20. Brilliant.

QdWtHsS51uONDjpsAoP_bQ.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this shop and have never had anything there that wasn't delicious. They have tacos, burritos, quesas, and tortas. I've had tacos, burritos, and quesas (think thicker, deep fried quesadilla) and have never been disappointed.  I really love the tacos because you can get two tacos with rice and beans for about 10 bucks and be completely filled. Their horchata is really delicious and soaked in nuts and fruit for an interesting take on typical horchata. They make an AMAZING spicy margarita and a magnificent michelada---I can't even tell you how great they are. Of course, their salsa bar is my favorite part of this restaurant: 15 salsas that are unique and flavorful. The only reason I give this a 4 instead of 5 is because the last few times I have come (at varying times/days), they have been swamped and they only have 2 waiters. I recognize the space is really tiny (only about 8 or 9 tables and the bar counter) but there's also no real waiting area, which can get annoying in the summer.

76grHxzj5q7Y5eBsMMtO9g.text: I have enjoyed La Condesa numerous times. I am stuck on the La Condesa Shrimp tacos. Awesomely fresh and I love the spinach instead of lettuce. Beer is cold, service is slow, but very good. Before my trip last week I would have ranked at least 4 stars, but the shrimp were NOT deveined. Not only mine, but my friend who went with me. I had 2 shrimp tacos & she had one with a carne asada. She loved the carne asada. I don't know that I can eat the shrimp again...what a bummer.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La Condesa Shrimp Taco with rice &amp; beans, Chicken Mole burrito &amp; Carne Asada Burrito

_Omx7zxxjAtxWD9JtT8YVQ.text: I can't believe I haven't written a review for La Condesa yet.  I have never been disappointed here.  Ever.    Here is the deal:    -you start with a side of chips.  And then you get to feast on the humongous salsa bar.  My favorites are the pecan (creamy, thick, and with a kick at the end), cilantro (thinner but delicious), and the tamarindo (sweet and spicy).  Sadly, the tamarindo one seems to be quite elusive and is not always available.  You could spend hours trying all the different salsas.  I agree though with Iain, the peanut was the weak link.  -next comes the real food.  I have only had the tacos, but I imagine everything to be of the same quality.  So these tacos come with double tortillas to hold all the ingredients.  These aren't skimpy by any means.  Two should be sufficient for most people.  The Cabo Shrimp is amazing.  Huge shrimp beer battered with a creamy sauce on top.  The chicken mole taco was also great with that special chocolately flavor to it.  Today, I tried to Mayan Cochinita taco and it was stuffed to the brim with tender as can be pork.  I have had the rice and beans before with a combo and I would say the beans are better than the rice.  Though in my opinion after four or so visits, it's best to come enjoy the chips and salsa and then indulge in two tacos.  This place is really hard to find, but if you find Palm and McDowell, it's right there with a few parking spots along the street.  If you like tacos, you need to come here.  It's just that simple.

ephSN58q5xiVApZmiEQ_xg.text: La Condesa is in a rather unassuming location in Phoenix.  But has a nice atmosphere when you get inside.  The first thing I noticed was their huge salsa bar.  We sat down and were brought menus and chips.  I tried most of their salsas.  They all had their own very unique flavor.  the peanut salsa was really interesting.  My favorite was their tomatillo salsa.    I ordered the Oaxaca Mole taco and a carne asada taco.  The mole was excellent with great flavor.  The carne asada was bland and flavorless...huh?  I dumped salsa on the carne asada taco and when finished was rather disappointed in that particular offering.  Also ordered their calabacitas.  They were seasoned well and tasted great.    I had a bite of my partner's pork taco and it was amazing.    I am glad we found La Condesa and I will definitely visit again to try some more of their menu offerings.

1FIHvPxhZ1wIep9L4EFWxg.text: Awesome food, good service and a super salsa bar.  The place was little small but nonetheless it was great!..

Vy-LzKNIz-t5uSolTytxcw.text: First time here tonight. So delicious! Loved the salsa bar. Loved my tacos and husband loved his burrito! Wish we lived closer and could add this place more often.

GugEX6zGa3ryH99MjBI9jA.text: This place deserves the hype. I asked the waitress to surprise me with with a couple tacos. I was impressed by the three she ordered for me, but the special shark taco was unreal. It was the best taco I have ever had the pleasure to consume. This is a wonderfully unique eatery. I would highly suggest dining here.

QaSSqSkC00Fuabo5VIDbxA.text: I've been eating at this place since it opened.  I'm not going to stop.  In fact I don't think I could stop if I wanted to- it's too good.  All the tacos are great (I especially like the La Condessa special taco with shrimp) and the El Gaucho burro and Bullet burrito are always a good choice. The place is clean and the staff are nice.  It's not always the fastest place to eat, but hey rushed eating isn't healthy!

4jK4mVkCk84EOGZDh7XW9g.text: Beau and I enjoyed a burrito and fried tortilla with chicken mole this past weekend. Ate late and avoided the dinner rush - there will be one for many a nite! Loved, loved the tasty salsa bar and down home service. Thank you La Condesa.

kv12s-mtTMkptdTleSvLWQ.text: Reasons why I love this place: 1. Horchata with all kinds of goodies inside, like pecans and cantaloups and strawberries, I mean these are "real" and not those freeze-dried stuff. My poblem with it is it only comes in one size--32 ounces, which is like two meals for me.  2. The salsa bar...never knew there could be so many kinds of salsa! That alone is an adventure in taste-testing. My personal fave is the jicama one, which really is more of a relish but who's checking.   3. Chicken mole and pibil...they do it right. Their mole could be a bit spicier for my taste but that's what the salsas are there for. I had the chicken mole as a taco and the pibil as a burro (separate occasion, alright, don't think I'm a pig now).  It's a great date place, I think. It's small, it's quaint, in a good neighborhood, and the satffers are very friendy.   I love this place so much that I didn't even care about the tiny creature scurrying across the floor near the front door. That's  not their fault though. That was just an unfortunate situation. Not a reflection of them.  So try it.

ZoPU22EXtr99PqrnlY_FUg.text: I have been here a handful of times and always enjoy the food. My only complaint is the service. Its not horrible but definitely not great. I would still recommend it for the food.

b4qnOWEpSt1Vbki-CnQgog.text: Omg OBSESSED. The bullet burro...simply amazing!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HTLq7WpSDu3Sas1MaEFLiA.text: Awesome salsa bar. The Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco melts in your mouth. The horchata tastes like a liquid cinnamon bun.

0bCyULGqd_BtZaEo80fgHA.text: Great atmosphere, phenomenal service and fantastic food. I ordered the baja shark tacos and cabo shrimp tacos. Fresh and very delicious to say the least. A MUST TRY!!

6WNFZ0bkqRWC2O39nSK3hg.text: I can't get enough of this place. I consider myself a bit of a taco fan and this place keeps me happy! Also the salsa bar is pretty creative. Only complaints are if you order their amazing horchata, it only comes in one size which is a bucket and the other complaint is they only provide 1 small basket of chips per table, any more will cost ya like $2!?! Forget the chips and spend that on another taco!!

N759mC5Gdh_LYYNgVveYvQ.text: the food is good, the service is not good sometimes. in fact sometimes the service kind of ruins the experience when i eat in so i always order to go. and even when i order to go i must wait 30 minutes for my food, even at times when they are not too busy. i have tried multiple times to call in my order ahead of time so i dont waste my time with this restaurant, but many times their phone just keeps ringing and they never answer it. funny tho, because when you walk up to the counter, there is their phone right next to the most encountered area of the restaurant. when i have the patience to put up with the lack of decent service here, i come and enjoy some good food.

X7GA4gvKIt-rjf7agzuWDw.text: service a 2, food a 5!!!!! you need this experience at least. highly recommend shrimp taco, cochinita pibil and mole negro.....

8WnXwx6Im7oV0cbupw0sdw.text: Was here 2 years ago. They've added a sit down bar. Interesting variety of unique salsa. Small place but not cramped. We all tried different tacos. Was fun .

Mz7Bn6pBSCEfPIH08dCH3g.text: This place has the best horchata!!!!! You have to try it, but it only comes in one very large size so it is best to share. They also have a great salsa bar and good vegitarian tacos.

b_b4n_e-MgB5mnCH9bRIBg.text: Went again tonight with my sisters and we shared a few tacos... great service, the waitress was super friendly, and although she was the only one there was attentive.  We ordered a burro to go, and she packed it nicely with a bag of chips.  We finished out this meal with some flan, and having had what I thought was great flan in Mexico, I was pretty impressed!

ppj9Kx1EJgVVUWehr1v3kQ.text: Fish tacos were amazing but two waiters for a jam packed restaurant. No bueno. Horchata was as nasty as it the name sounds.

smeCF2BQcwQ56LO9AQ1gZw.text: I LOVE La Condesa.  What more do I need to say? The salsa bar is amazing! I really like their carne asada.  They do but beans in the burrito, which, at first I wasn't sure how I'd feel about it, but after a couple, I really like it.  I've had the pork and shrimp tacos also.  The quality is always top notch.  I did the artwork too!  Two negatives...The music can sometimes be loud, and sometimes they are REALLY packed and parking is a bit tough to find.  Other than that, I HIGHLY recommend!

flCNuiuhab6Eug0xCvc6wA.text: INSANELY GOOD!!!  If you are adventurous or just love Mexico City cuisine you need to try this!  Forget what you learned in Rocky Point, this place is legit' They have a salsa bar with 12 - 15 totally original flavors that could get you by solely on the chips and dip.  Do not come here and not order some form of their special pork (I cannot spell it).  Quesadilla is the star, you will have never had one this style.  Tacos are great (carne asade or the pork preferred).  Burritos are ho-hum.  First-timers must order the Horchata drink offering.  It does not dissapoint!

5HryPFYnLWrnyDGa7Lm5qQ.text: Well cross that one off the list....  We went in looking forward to giving the new neighborhood taco spot a shot. Read solid reviews and thought we could add a new dining spot to our rotation. Wrong.  Not only was it a billion degrees inside, the flies were everywhere! The service was adequate (given the volume of customers) but the food was...well, sub par. Not horrible...just not very good. The famed salsa bar turned out to be a few Tupperware tubs of salsa that tasted remarkably similar to the selection available at Pro's Ranch Market.  We're gonna head back over to America's next time we've got a taste for tacos.

C_h9RmC1Xz0qbEemlU_mLA.text: One of the best Mexican spots in town. The food is great (salsa bar!) and so are the margaritas. That said, it is crammed - try to go on a night when it's less busy to avoid feeling the full brunt of that.

OtVpgJq_TEzY7lxd_YVDcQ.text: I went to this location as I was driving down 16st saw it out the corner of my eye and I'm glad that I made the stop, it was kinda packed but my party only waited about ten minutes. I ordered the gaucho taco that was recommended by our waiter that was one of the best tacos I had ever had and trust me I've had tons of tacos and don't even get me started about the shrimp tacos they have

x4ichYoiH-b5DwMWF-WJ-g.text: I may be biased because I'm a wino and and was annoyed they didn't serve alcohol since it had been a hell of a long Friday, but this place isn't as fan-fucking-tastic as everyone screams it is.  Don't get me wrong, these are some darn good tacos, but they're not going to change your life.  When I went, the salsa bar was almost dry which was very disappointing considering the wide variety of salsas is one of their claim to fames.  I'll try it agian, but not on a Friday night so I can avoid as many creepy little hipsters as possible.

v_VMKwmHbyYIrqJGS06i-Q.text: Awesome Quesadillas. They are more like empanadas than quesidillas but they are so good. Try the mahi mahi, it was so fresh and the sause was wonderful. the salsa bar will show you a dozen different salsas. Really fun to try them all.

9P5fql_A66EEv5kNxg_cgA.text: Just had half of a shrimp burro and half of a mahi mahi burro and it was absolutely fabulous. The cilantro sauce and mushrooms made it! A+ Also - best horchata on the planet!

UM0v8w_Sk0TtNZz9pJxyjA.text: These are not your buddy's street tacos. La Condesa hits the nail on the head when it comes to flavor. Cochinita Pibil that tastes like Cochinita Pibil... though I would be fine with a little more achiote. The tinga is great, with citrusy notes on top of slow cooked beef full of chorizo and onion flavor--don't worry, the onion sweetens it up.  My personal favorite is the baja shrimp taco. Big juicy pieces of breaded shrimp stuffed into two corn tortillas with cabbage and mayo on top.  My only point of contention; they should warn people that more than two tacos is actually quite a lot of food. It would help get over the sticker shock. Beans and rice are unnecessary.  A suggestion: Provide people with suggestions for salsa/taco pairings and make everyone drink the fruity horchata, it's awesome.

F4khkZv_X6JQk8C7IyS4Qw.text: This place is amazing.  The cochinita pubil and chicken mole tacos were unforgettable and the salsa bar alone is worth the trip.  The salsa cilantro was a great choice.  I'll be telling all my friends about my new favorite taco stop

GbYcwIif2hE4jmMtQAYBkg.text: soOO yummy!!  the best vegetarian tacos around!!  fantastic salsa bar too  & the Horchata soOO delicious! mmmm

S7UO_a7xtyiCz4hYXphsFw.text: This place reminds me of my Nana's (Grandma's) home cooking.  For instance, when you order a carne asada burrito... it doesn't look like your typical fast foot burrito... which is great.  You truly get a more authentic Mexican feeling here.  I'll be back soon.

VIankxDVgnS8XBJHd-A2Qg.text: I've been to La Condesa three times this week for the mole chicken tacos. I think about them all the time. This place is cozy inside with a big salsa bar which I'm working my way through.  Be sure to try the cilantro cream! The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because service can be a bit slow, even when there are only two tables of people. And also, I nearly lock myself in the bathroom every time because that darn latch is so hard to open.

bqqM7eU-H-ZczXqjmoUMoA.text: Amazing. Really. We were driving back to LA and we're looking for a place to stop for a quick but yummy lunch.... Found this place on Yelp and I am so glad we stopped here. Best tacos I've ever had. Salsa bar is amazing. The waitress mixed up my order so I have no idea what I ate but it was phenominal. Seriously, you need to eat here.

KyADQfkRX1HAh9GN1ypMew.text: Now this is what I'm talking about. Authentic food, located right in the thick of working class neighborhood. Lucha Libre & Dia de los Muertos artwork give me something cool to look at as I devoured a killer GOURMET HANDMADE CORN QUESA ! The owner was super cool & chatted with me about the unique salsa selection. If you want authentic regional Mexican food, then go here or go die.

8OAKHxju_ujPaqRMRLb13g.text: Current favorite Mexican place in Phoenix. Will have a spot on the permanent rotation. Have tried 3 types of their tacos so far and none of them disappoint, but the fish tacos have to be my favorite so far.

PV1lfr7h9NpPS1tF_qrKxw.text: Yum, tacos... Ok the thing that stood out the most was how fresh everything was. The salsa bar..a definite plus... I love a good salsa... My favorite the Strawberry Salsa.  Wholy cow was that good! The quesadilla was bigger than I've ever seen I couldn't finish it!!  Loved, loved loved the artwork, The only negative I could find was that the furniture for some reason felt a little awkward like I was in everyone's way while they were trying to get in line to order, but that really has nothing to do with the food.  I'm givin' this place a thumbs up... authentic and delicioso!

cQU1N2vhT_OxRgb2N2ex0A.text: Oh. My. God. This place is so amazing, even the rice is delicious!!! We had the shrimp with veggie tacos ( I can't remember the exact name of the dish), Sonoran Carne Asada Taco, and al pastor burro. Every bite is better than the last, and my cousin and I had takeout! I can only imagine what it would've tasted like fresh out the kitchen. We also had strawberry margaritas (non-alcoholic to go), and we added our own tequila at home :-) An amazing last dinner to our weekend trip to Phoenix!!

gSg1WYBtB5jppp7CeX51HA.text: Everything is good. And hands down best salsa bar imaginable. Best, best, best! Small and always crowed though, which I blame mostly on the awesomeness salsa bar.... Did I mention how great the salsa bar here is?

QzpnEspnrw5cHOv2yaen8A.text: Amazing food & the absolute best horchata that I've ever had! The atmosphere is great including the paintings inside and new calavera they put outside. The food is always fresh and there's a variety of different salsas to choose from at the salsa bar. Great little place to have around the neighborhood, great addition. :)

hi8NoH7ElA2YMP-8VyYwxA.text: Wow!   I was pleasantly surprised when I stepped into this joint. The decor was fun, the restaurant was super clean and the food was so great! I am so excited that this is within walking distance of my home.   YOU MUST TRY THE HORCHATA! It tastes like my mom's except better. Wait? Is that even possible? Yes! I swear to little baby Jesus that this is the best horchata in the universe.   The Cochinita Pibil taco was great, the mole chicken taco was great and the salsa bar was killer. I tried 5 or 6 and they were fresh and uniquely flavored.   The best part? Three people ate for 20 bucks! I could have eaten cheaper if I had not gotten the plate. I took half of the food home, if that is any sign of the healthy (but not overly large) portions here. One taco would have done it for me.   I will be a regular at this place!  You should try it too! :)

8ftZc2hZtUOFo2ll-p_8ow.text: Well, as this place is 4.5 stars after 144 reviews, it's not like I am going to share anything that will ruin the secrecy of this place and just how great it is!  I had plans to bring one friend here who is Dia De Los Muertos obsessed.  She blew me off, but I was so looking forward to it, I talked two other friends into joining me to check out a new spot.  The gal is a jamiaca fiend, and was thrilled with the drink.  Having read reviews on the size of the horchata, I convinced the guy to share one with me, we could always get another if we needed it.  (We didn't)  WOW - no other horchata will ever measure up!  Yes, the salsa bar ROCKED!  We sampled 6 or 7 of them.  I could live off the jicama, cilantro, jalepeno and lime tastiness!  And the hot red one that looked greasy had the most amazing heat/flavor ratio I could imagine ever encountering.  Truly, the acme salsa!  Being indecisive, I went a la carte with the tacos.  One each of the cochinita pibil, one chicken mole and one carne asada. I was busy having a foodgasm with the cochinita when the gal freaked on her carne asada, making the guy have some - and they both agreed it is better than America's Taco Shop!  (Mine had to sit and wait while I was having quality alone time with the last bites of the pork.)  I will say I wasn't thrilled with the mole.  This is NOT a knock on how La Condesa does it - and if you're a mole fan, it may be amazing.  I'd never actually had mole - turns out I am just not a fan of the overall flavor.  But I love almost all Mexican food, and I love chocolate!  How is this possible!  Two rights making a wrong?  Weird!  That said...I will be back.  Over and over!  This is definitely on the short list of places to have a quick, great meal in my hood!

VXu3dMVdpwiBZH7sCUV9_w.text: Do yourself a favor and start eating here (if you're not already a fan).  #1. Hands down best salsa bar on the PLANET!!!  If I can help it, I eat here at least 2x/week. I literally order the same thing every single time and it never gets old: veggie tacos and horchata, both of which have ruined any other Mexican restaurant for me... nothing comes even close to their glorious flavors, and it's always fun picking and mixing the different salsas with the food.  The super chill and friendly staff and unique atmosphere are also worth mentioning.  Seriously, I hesitate to leave Phoenix because of this place.

nPdaB_yrNsaxbHi2Dx66GQ.text: Stop reading and just freaking go there NOW!  It's the best place for street tacos... by FAR!  From traditional carne asada, pollo asada, carnitas, to exotics like fish and shark tacos... it's FANTASTIC! The price is fair and their menu is pretty large.  The place is definitely not Scottsdale. It's a small place and looks kinda dirty.  They have the whole "Day of the Dead" theme going on.  It's an odd looking place but trust me, these are the kind of places where you will find the most authentic food.  They also have a small bar to serve up some nice cocktails and beers.  Their chips are very good and they have a salsa bar with over 14 different salsas. I'm glad my friend recommended this place to me.  I look forward to visiting often.  It's sure is a LOT closer than driving to Mexicali for the same tacos! :)  Advise:  The seating is limited, so if you arrive at the traditional week day noon lunch rush, expect to wait for a table.  It's first come first serve.  I usually visit around 1:30pm or on the weekends.

V9MBc3IqlUIe2RCaXsLXww.text: Amazing food, I had the three street tacos plate with rice and beans. The rice and beans are some of the best I've ever had. I had Tinga, Al Pastor and carne asada tacos and they all were delicious. Salsa bar is also great and it has a wide variety of options. Definitely recommend this place when in the area.

LTGpS7mQrLIbgGIv1I7cWg.text: Awesome taco and salsa choices, but no big crowds.  For a foodie, it's great there are no long lines and waits for seating, but peoples, YOU'RE MISSIN' OUT! In Saturday for lunch, had a seat at the empty bar. Tables mostly full, but not jammed with folks. Good for me though, service was quick, and room to kick back.  Ordered Azteca Tinga and Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken tacos, but oddly, was served Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco instead of the Azteca. I double-checked with the server 'cuz the Cochinita was absolutely mouth-watering! Over-the-top when paired with the Cilantro salsa (just a touch). A definite repeat item. Black Mole was certainly delivered as described, with dark, somewhat smokey-molasses flavor, but a bit too heavy for me.  Ti[p: Pick just two-to-three salsa to sample, and then decide on how best to enjoy them-some just with chips, others to top off a taco. How to be sure what's best? Duh, come back again!

bE0dumriUyF39yYPG_CMhQ.text: This little Phoenix gem delivers everything you want from fine Mexican dining without all the touristy bullshit. The exterior has classic Dia De Las Muertas tile work and the interior is rustic, intimate and clean. The menus and prices are simple and excellent and the food is phenomenal.  The salsa bar is one of the best I have ever experienced. At least 12 different salsas. All different and all excellent, and I believe, made on the premises. We had, Pecan, Peanut Butter, 7 Chili, Mexicano, Pico de Gallo, and Cilantro salsa. If variety is the spice of life, what is a variety of spices?  The absolute, takes the cake reason for 5 stars is the Horchata! I am a fan of Horchata. I have never had Horchata like this! 32 ounces with what must have been muddled strawberries and apples and fresh ground cinnamon. So good, so good.

q3yWtTuyA1nAARbI3YKZNA.text: SOOOO thrilled to find this place! The food is excellent - not the heavy cheese-laden Sonoran style that the Phoenix market is used to, but a lighter, more flavorful Mexican style. Lots of things to choose from on the menu. Loved my chicken mole burro. Margs were delicious and I cannot wait to do happy hour there - an afternoon of $3 margaritas and the amazing salsa bar with a great variety of salsas. I particularly liked the pecan, peanut, and chile arbol salsas, although they were all really, really good. If you love horchata, you'll love the one here.

6xjX152jaVQ0wLG4POakvg.text: I love this taco shop.  They offer a wide variety of tacos and they are all good.  My favorite are actually the vegetarian tacos.  They come spilling over with grilled veggies and cheese.  They are amazing.  The salsa bar offers a huge variety of different salsa including unique salsas made from fruit (strawberry) and nuts (pecan).  I took away a star because the seating is super tight and it is hard to move around in there.  The seats themselves are really uncomfortable (heavy wooden chairs).  I agree with a previous reviewers that I can do without their rice and beans.  But the tacos are so filling, you will not need them.

S5RnWvtn2tu89wgDTvPsTA.text: Veggie taco was awesome and so was the chile verde burro.  Service was good and the server took time to explain several items which was very helpful.  Salsa bar was excellent.  The only negative is the limited seating.

0xuMNAFWCKvlj5WRMLGOZA.text: Great stop after getting off the plane from the airport. We were looking for something casual and delicious and this place at the spot. Great mole tacos and gordito burritos.

U8Mo_c3gYhI58_cLV9btPw.text: Tiny, tiny place with food to die for!  The burritos are outta this world.  Lots of salsa to choose from with tasty chips.  Everything we've had has been delicious. I usually get the al pastor burrito and finish it later at home.

kfToU9ilISqGseNx9Z02Eg.text: Good "upscale" mexican fast food, if that makes any sense.  Lots of great flavors to be had.  Mixing and matching with the unique salsas (peanut, pecan, cilantro and jicama salsas are standouts) allows for some pretty awesome flavor combinations.  Sort of an odd place, because it the menu feels like it should be a takeout or order-and-take your seat kind of place, but it has a beautiful wood bar that seems wasted on the environment.  If they do carry beer, it isn't in an obvious place (no taps, no display refridgerator).  And they appear to only carry one type of wine.  Just think of the drinks as afterthoughts and enjoy the variety of food you are able to enjoy...

mN3UbbFQjnrwHjq-FgqsZA.text: Specialty taco and margaritas are great. The Mayan taco is also good. Mole and Marlin were interesting but not as good.

TZNQH-Aqm9KM9Z4WrsMiPg.text: From my experience up to this point this place is hands down the best taco shop in PHX.  The salsa bar is awesome with a ton of options and their street tacos along with the gourmet tacos are great.

Snl4jE22W-yNodeghtXkWA.text: My husband and I stumbled on this place about a year ago after reading about it in the now defunct Calendar Section of the Arizona Republic.  We have been in love ever since.  I want to try a burro or something else so bad but I cannot tear myself away from the Tacos like a few other Yelpers have experienced, addiction, in a good way.  My husband ordered a quesadilla one time and it was delicious but I need my tacos, the shrimp ones are my faves with the chicken mole coming in second.  Vanessa (I assume this is her name from other reviews) has one of the prettiest smiles I have ever seen!  There must be a hidden Wizard at this Oz- like place, I have not ever seen anyone else except "Vanessa".  Whom ever is behind the curtain is a culinary genius in my book.

tbbaP7cy2NLH7DXBg8dfTA.text: I come to La Condesa quite often (at least once a month) because it's really close to my house. It's one of those hidden gems along 16th Street and I really wish I could give it five stars but I just can't. Here's my summary of the place:  Good: -The tacos are delicious! My favorite is the Mayan Pibil taco.  -The prices are pretty descent. -The salsa bar is AMAZING! I can't get enough of the pecan salsa.  -The chips are free and they go fast with such great salsa selections. -The margaritas are tasty.  Bad: -The service is really bad. I'm not they type of customer to really care too much about service at a restaurant but it's pretty ridiculous here. I took my bf here the other day and it took about 8 minutes before anyone came to the table to greet us. I would say this was a fluke but, unfortunately, it's happened a few times now. Also, I have had two occasions when they forgot to bring out silverware/napkins. I've had a couple times when they've forgotten to bring out my margarita (they're really good here btw) and one time when they brought it out looking like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for 10 minues (all of the ice was melted). It's really sad how bad the services is because I absolutely LOVE the food/atmosphere.  I guess the bottom line is that La Condesa makes some amazing gourmet tacos and salsa but they fall very short on the service. I'll be back but there are plenty of other places I can go and receive great food AND great service (i.e. Gallo Blanco at the Clarendon Hotel).

1_HCtl_OlNT0PAJqXfA1dQ.text: The best tacos EVER!!! They taste like Mexico I love it... The place is super small but the wait is worth the while

WyIVb0BzK1J3nduGQDTvYg.text: Had a sample of tacos. The mole is amazing and so is the tinga!  The salsa bar is amazing with many delicious and spicy options. Don't be fooled by the guacamole...it is spicy but delicious.

P2zYpxMgqyjvwSiAP-7nCQ.text: We go here at least every few weeks. Very Authentic.  The prices are pretty average. I do wish that they had some bigger bowl of salsa as they give you these small little tester cups to try their salsa bar out with. You also have to pay for your second bowl of chips which isn't exactly ideal. This place is usually very very busy. I believe they had a bench to sit outside and wait. The staff doesn't seem to have any sort of order or manager there to help them out. You definitely will sit at your table for at least 15 minutes before minutes before being asked what you want to drink and then get your drinks probably 15 minutes after that.  The staff may ask you if you would like to order your meal enchilada  style but just a heads up- it costs an additional five dollars or more to make this happen. I think they should let people know that as they are ordering or add that price on the menu.  Overall we love this place because the food is so good but we do think they could make a few changes to benefit their business and customers. Update: Ate here again as we do every few weeks, the service is TERRIBLE but the food is delicious. The place was not very busy but again, the service was the worst service you've probably ever experienced. Not a place to go if you are in a rush, with guests or if you are trying to accommodate etc. we sat at the table ready to go with drinks empty for a solid 20 minutes at least. They need to hire a manager and get this staff up to speed on acceptable service.

1nl138OAWP4dJeCqJPFoqQ.text: Their tacos are fantastic!  Margaritas fantastic.  Seating could use some help. Crowded, Too many taters in the bag.

DJmsSSwOhzNy-88ZSGIH0Q.text: I went with a friend over here after work one night on a recommendation. I loved my food it was much bigger than I thought and more gourmet to. I was expecting a little cheese crisp filled with meat, but it was so much more than that. I had a margarita that was really good but I think it was grapefruit all it says on the menu is margarita's but no description of any of them.  The place was very tiny and cramped, but it was colorful in a good way and was not super busy. The service was a little slow and it was our first time so it took a while before they told us you get your sauce's from the little bar.  I will be back in the future, overall it was a good price and taste food.

ZLSN0Mjal5DAhekt454hcw.text: I get to Phoenix a few times a year and I come straight from the airport to get the El Gaucho Quesadilla -- Argentine beef is so tender and flavorful and the crunch of the quesadilla is perfection. YUM!

8Rx3T1PNXbQVBUynYUwJsQ.text: One of many great little Mexican restaurants in the area, this one definitely has the best salsa bar. This provides for amazing combinations on a variety of tacos selections. Great place to drop in for a late lunch or early dinner, when they aren't too busy.

HFAvCp3SZkeZCRQzIS-zeg.text: The best tacos, hands down. Comfort food: beans & rice are just as great. Salsa bar is unique and amazing. Kinda steps out of the traditional taco scene, but great food none the less. On the downside: small dining area, spotty service, lighting is a little off. Overall this is a must-try.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aztec Kewl

aOtEgBpVxQTnwlyJaYoFmw.text: They have so many different salsas to pick from...(Mango, Strawberry etc etc)  We tried almost all of them with the homemade chips as we waited for our food.   I ordered the chicken Quesadilla, but this one came with a deep fried corn tortilla covering all of the goodness in the middle. It was great because it was gluten free friendly. It was a big meal and well worth very bite.

yc1tmOKsIA8II9uiWbM8Nw.text: A truly great casual and authentic Mexican restaurant with a gourmet twist. La Santisima sports great artwork on the interior. They have a salsa bar with a wide variety of interesting flavors. The food is delicious, unique and interesting. Less traditional, but flavorful and satisfying. So are the portions.

_yprhoUjOztidy1hIEo5aw.text: The Guisados of Phoenix.   Order the smoked Marlin tacos they are amazing. You will easily forget that you are eating fish.   The salsa bar selection can be a bit overwhelming. You want to try everything but at the same time are afraid to because you don't want to make the wrong taco salsa combination. Ahh the paradox of choice.   Horchata lovers will be enticed to order the house Horchata which goes for $3.99. The specialness of that drink all float on top in the form of pecans, diced cantaloupe, and strawberries. A girl walked in solely to order the Horchata to go.

B6QoYwW22GvHrI52GUj4Yg.text: OMG....love this place! Best salsa bar and the burritos are grilled and delicious!

6A5ZXJAnog4TmLzlsYJazg.text: Sauces are great! Guac has cranberries in it but so good! I got the steak, shark and pork taco. All were good but the pork was my favorite.  Horchata was good! Chicken Quesadilla was something I never seen before but lacked flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadillas

70dz-pzWfQVze3nGfr2Qig.text: This place is amazing!!! You'd never known it from the outside---it's a little hole in the wall on Calle 16 right in the middle of Mexican mercados y paleterias. It's tiny so expect at least a 30 minute wait at peak hours. They have a serve yourself salsa bar with some of the most unique salsas I have ever tasted---from strawberry to pecan to habanero. The menu is not your typical Mexican food but there isn't a single bad thing on it. Don't bother with rice and beans on the side-- not needed. Try the mole quesa-- its my absolute favorite. The horchata is a family recipe with fruit and pecans in it and its amazingggg and a great big size option. You won't be disappointed in this incredible spot.

0odZFo16tofAug6etOZEfg.text: Very, very good "real" Mexican restaurant. This is not in the high-income part of Phoenix, but certainly the area is safe. The restaurant is positioned between a pinata shop & an empty store, but you cannot miss the signage! Everything that our group of five ordered was excellent. I had the chicken quesadilla; it was not like any other quesadilla I have ever had, with the shell a unique experience. Great place for informal dining with a different version of Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Can&#39;t miss the signage

AcbRDYGKOCH2nl2TSMO6MA.text: If a place in Phoenix has almost 500 reviews and it still has almost 5 stars, you know it has to be good. I came here for a quick lunch after work one day, and couldn't have been more pleased with my experience. The fish tacos I ordered were absolutely delicious, and the staff was very friendly. The salsa bar is genius! So many different flavors, it's like having 10 different dishes in one.   Overall, do yourself a favor and try Santisima if you're in the mood for Mexican.

Y5dXUp_T1GtAN2xy1crdog.text: Their salsa bar is very inventive, and tasty.  Food is excellent too.  I will definitely return.

mk6BErjGg8ke5kGwk1C7zg.text: I am giving this place 4 stars because it is unique. The night we went it was crowded...but we went because of all the hype on Yelp and my quest for Fish Tacos. The service was good. I tried all the salsa's and only liked a few. And as for the tacos...they were ok. The Shark Taco needed a better sauce and I would have enjoyed it much better. Truthfully, I didn't find the shark tacos as great as everyone else does on these reviews, but then again, I am new to Fish Tacos. I also tried the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, I found this flavor strong (unlike other Mexican places I have tried), so that is good, but I didn't really care for it.  The bad, my son ordered the steak Quesa. He didn't care for it at all, I did like this, but then the waitress took the entire thing away when we weren't done with it and Dave didn't even get a chance to try it. So that was a bit disappointing, given he didn't eat hardly any of it.   Overall...I am glad we went.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shark taco

512HPXlM1akRhBNeSVMoCg.text: Fantastic yelp recommendation! I took my husband here for lunch before we flew out of Phoenix. This place gets packed for lunch and it maybe hard to find a table! No place to just wait and hangout, unless you want to wait outside. But they turnover tables pretty quickly. Best thing about this place was the salsa bar--so many varieties. My favorite tacos were the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Tacos...hands down!

zh_RvHO4sHV7nPYk-IV-BA.text: I love their salsa bar , there is a taste for everybody. You should try mole they make , it's excellent. Good portions, I can barely eat half of my burro. Food is just amazing. Very neat small place, one of those places that you should try at least once. Bathrooms is a little bit of an issue , that ladies bathroom door should be fixed , it's little uncomfortable to sit where while someone else can just walk in while you do your business.

-Qgpkdvo_AaJ7n6S7Oozvg.text: Love the food here.  Salsa bar is amazing!!   Their quesadillas are incredible.   Chicken tinga unbelievable.   I always have incredible service at La Santisima.  The restaurant is small, so get there early or you will wait for a table.

YIUBtZH5YYrhTB0Xns0dpw.text: This place has been a tradition of sorts when I'm in town for work but unfortunately I contracted a nasty bout of food poisoning after eating there this past Monday night. I can't say with 100% certainty that it was the Guacho Burro but the only other thing I had eaten that day was a frozen breakfast sandwich and a coffee. Never again. Shame, I enjoyed it.

h5y6jfnzMDKslu-56Lp4Ng.text: Love there tacos... They have diff flavors then most tacos places. Deff worth trying you won't regret it

uK9La1J_479gORHW76xSAg.text: They weren't kidding when they said they had an extensive salsa bar!! I tried most of them and they own had their own distinctive flavor and it made my burrito great!!   Ok so this spot is in a sketchy part of phoenix. That's the first thing I noticed when I got off the freeway. Transients mostly around BUT I've learned that the best food spots come from restaurants that are in places you wouldn't think to go. Hence the term HIDDEN GEM.  It's SUPER small here. Luckily it wasn't too busy. But it's literally a small box of a restaurant. It looks like it can hold up to 25 people safely.   I ordered a carne asada burrito, chicken taco and one of the houses popular burritos. I can't remember the name of it but it was delicious!! My burrito had lettuce, tomatoes and their own house sauce. It was so delicious! My burrito is on steroids!! It was so big too!! You have to come try this spot out if your near Phoenix!

Evages86F6NjcX3gRb640w.text: The food was excellent but the service needs a lot of work.  The girl working up front does not know what she is doing. It was hard to watch her struggle as the two groups in front of us left after waiting for 20 minutes. The kicker is that it was not even packed. There was about 10 tables open and she made four groups wait for over 20+ minutes. She needs to be trained or let go.  The waiter was stressed out and could not remember something you said to here a few seconds ago. I ordered a Coke and horchata a total of three times. We only got the horchata as we were leaving...... The horchata was delicious though....  We ordered around 8 street tacos of different varieties and they were all A+. The selection of salsa was also very good. You can tell that they are understaffed and struggle with giving good service.  We thought we would try some tequila and the waiter brought us house tequila which tasted like cleaning materials. We then ordered the $15 Don Julio tequila and she brought back out the same house tequila..  Even though the service was terrible I would come back for the food.

PPi8UzlAJXKNkkQNDWjgQA.text: The portions were huge at a great price.  You have all types of sauces to chose from but the taco entrees were flavorful enough that you didn't need to sauce it up.    A great casual joint to fill yourself up.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos, one grilled and one deep fried.

dIGyhLRlO4KdC4UGhpNsFQ.text: A plate with 3 tacos, a scoop of rice and a lick of re-fried beans was $15 dollars! I ordered a michelada after seeing the pictures of it here on yelp (which let me add that the michelada was not even on the menu) and that thing costs $12 dollars... for 1 beer and some clamato juice in it!  I saw of bunch of plaques on the well for "best of...." this and best of that, including a 2012 "cheap eats of phoenix". I interpret that plaque as something having to do with "low prices" however, it seems like the restaurant totally moved away from low cost!  taking away the cost factor, i think the food is good. i ordered a Marlin, Cochinita Pibil and barbacoa taco which were all great and my wife ordered a "lonche" with skirt steak which was also good. the salsa bar does have great salsas but they're watered down... it can't even be scooped, you can only "wet" your chips in it and if you add it to your food be ready for your tortilla or lonche to fall apart ... they might as well serve the salsa on a cup with a straw so you can sip on it as you eat!  There's one plaque that this restaurant deserves to have on the wall... the one that says "Best use of a small space" tables are so close to one another, it gets really crammed in there.  OVERALL Rating Food is an A Prices C Horchata B+

CmVys0QyE3aDKFJ4zXqBlg.text: This place seems to be universally loved in Phoenix. It makes sense because the food is excellent. Every person I was with raved about the food afterwards. The salsa bar was also great. Lots of flavors to pick from and most were just the right amount of spicy.   You really can't go wrong on the menu here. The burros (get them enchilada style) and the fried quesadillas are probably the most popular things and I'd recommend either of them.   The reason I'm only giving 3 stars is because the service was extremely underwhelming. They were clearly understaffed (which seems to be a common theme for this restaurant), but it was extremely difficult to get hold of our waitress and we waiting close to 50 minutes for our food.

5EB-OnkrSvRkvGPlVjCPmQ.text: I grew up in the SW but have loved in the NE for 20+ years. Also worked in a Mexican restaurant during high school and college. This was the best Mexican food I can recall. I had Queso Fundido with Choizo and Poblanos, paired with a 3-taco platter of Baby Shark, Tiger Shrimp and Mahi.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6C-2LNvjoOQdlwGil7fQKA.text: BAD EXPERIENCE!!!!!!!! We ordered breakfast being the only two people in the place and we waited around 40 to 50 minutes to get our food, once we got it was cold and awful.. never coming back

WCAyZkQ_dRk--UoqKVLJqQ.text: Love the salsa bar with so many different varieties from sweet and fruity to hot and juicy

soN8N7zf6wZ43ubrRRzCbg.text: Food was delicious. I got the Argentinian steak burrito and it was really good. The tortilla chips weren't anything special, but I liked the salsa bar. As another reviewer noted, there was a strong smell of sewage coming from the back room which was a turn off. Hopefully they get that fixed.

_yxLYAkbyWKqCKhHfd-4KA.text: The Nagado taco was dope. Different from anything I've ever had. It was a little loud but the salsa bar and the food made up for that

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xAoguArqgMPSGCad8VEFjA.text: The place is a little small so we had to wait a bit for a table. The food is fantastic.   Steak asada tacos were perfect. Nice chunks of meat with shredded cabbage.   We also had the black mole tacos. Also outstanding.   The selection of self-serve sauces is the standout.  They have maybe 20 sauces for you to sample. The variety and quality of the sauces is excellent and should satisfy any palate.   If I'm ever back in Phoenix I will definitely be back.

sOgSUkCugyjbOUdnzwH-8A.text: The Margaritas were delicious!!..but, I don't see myself coming back. We were a big party when we arrived but there were tables and chairs available to combine however, we still had to wait to be seated and there were no other new guests coming in at the time. Also, the wait to receive our food was WAAY to long.   The food was overall pretty good but I didn't find it as "the best I've had" especially not for their prices.

BV-xXbFJCBm05HQJ75dgXg.text: I have been to this restaurant a few times when traveling to Phoenix. Good taco menu with some unique combinations. Make sure to go early for a table, but also because the salsa bar tends to get a bit picked over as the evening wears on.

tLIi-xh3Yv7VfC09xZcfkA.text: Love this place, the food is simple but delicious. Only reason I'm not giving this a 5 star is the salsa ramekin are way too small, but so good ;) !

xnxsjnIvhdQ5hIv_ijvqZQ.text: Great food but boy..... the wait to get served is so long. And forget getting your appetizer before your entree. We waited 30 min for appetizer only.   If they continue with this horrible service I'm sure they'll go out of business, no matter if they were featured in Food network.

qpOOdH6QtGAkWLFvcz2cGg.text: Meh. The best part of my order was the rice. I had a taco combo plate with 3 tacos. The taco shells were way too crispy and dripping with grease. I could hardly bite them. Not really impressed with the flavors of the different meats I chose. For what I ordered, over-priced and the flavor was underwhelming.

ini-F9ITCRgOVpjbYLmHSg.text: I was hard core craving Mexican food and had previously bookmarked this place so we decided to check it out.   Parking was no issue and we were seated right away. We received a bottle of water and a bowl of chips without even having to ask for it. The salsa bar was extensive but many of the salsas had run out. The available salsas were amazing. Especially the pecan salsa, which I had never had before, was awesome. Creamy and rich.   I got the Tlaloc cactus burrito (can be made vegan or vegetarian). My first time eating cactus! The Tlaloc was yummy but made with too much oil, I had grease dripping down my hands while eating it. The oil was a definite turn off and 1/5 of it would have sufficed to pan-fry the veggies. That's why I'm deducting a star.   I'll be back to try a fish taco or quesadilla.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My veg cactus burrito
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips with some of the salsas. Pecan was my favorite.

A_vlWIVimf5V9hKP_9g9sw.text: Best tacos in Phoenix.  Parking sucks, the neighborhood is meh, and the dining room is a mess, but all that melts away once you eat a taco (the Tinga is my favorite).  They have all the meats, and all the salsas, and it is taco heaven.  Come midday if possible, because there is a line every night.

GqZKX9rq2xvyNMynI8H6Vg.text: The food was pretty tasty, but the service was not. I was ignored by the waitress for ten minutes until she asked if I wanted a menu.

7LqZRRBuVhSdi-tnPkcyag.text: Excellent Mexican food with amazing salsa bar. They doubled the size of the restaurant this year.

UTwSYBxj_UNUulK2ZiqZug.text: My absolutely favorite place to eat tacos in Phoenix... wait, make that Arizona! So happy they got the expansion done because more people should visit this little gem when visiting. Don't let the neighborhood discourage you from coming - the tacos are worth the drive! Get the al pastor and tinga... don't forget to have a margarita too as they are oh so good!! Enjoy the salsa bar in the second room too.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

okAUo8Y9zi5qKznuJv1MxQ.text: Food and service was good. We will definitely eat here again!! The tortilla soup and the tacos were bomb!! You have to order the horchata! We even took one to go!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BXi_bav2IueQLjxUpJjMaQ.text: Super good place with fantastic chicken mole (if they don't run out). The wait and organization of the order/checkout can be obnoxious but it's worth it for the mole and dogfish tacos!

pBbo9roHkzskuQjBoHgUHQ.text: Absolutely amazing tacos and drinks. I'm an Arizona Native. This place has not been influenced by the Midwesterners and snowbirds so the food is still full of flavor and spice. Great salsa bar!

gFESlKMQ2tM2GsRlODhOWw.text: I have to say I think this place is over rated.  It's good but I wouldn't say top ten.  If you aren't from the Southwest u won't know the difference tho and it will be a great place.

Cj7FjoFPR1--2HZMTzb-oQ.text: My mom and I were referred to go to this place for some tacos and so when she was visiting me in Phoenix, we finally went to check it out! We pulled up and were very skeptical by the look of the outside, but we were greeted right away to pick a table. We both got the Cabo Shrimp Taco and a steak taco and it had this amazing fried cheese in it. And the salsa bar was amazing. I think the Cilantro salsa was my favorite. The beans and rice were also to die for. The shrimp in my taco were so delicious. I couldn't get over how amazing this place was. We happened to go for happy hour and got $5 Grapefruit margaritas as well. BEST MEXICAN FOOD EVER. I wish there was one in California.   P.S- Everyone around us ordered a quesadilla because they are stuffed inside their homemade tortillas and deep fried. Can't wait to go back and try these.   The service was awesome, too!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. grapefruit margs
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5ctYDIQMNFEi9YnhkeDTxA.text: Someone suggested this place to us and were warned that their customer service was slow, but goodness we weren't expecting THAT slow for a restaurant. My boyfriend asked for a local beer from tap and called it by the brewery name instead of the beer name and that apparently confused them even though it was the only Huss beer they had up there (never has that happen to us before at other places since every beer tap has the brewery name). The thing I hated most was that they don't split the bill by the individual if asked. Only way to split it is by splitting it in half, which sucks if the other person orders more than you. Luckily, we basically ordered the same thing so half worked for us. The tacos were yummy so that made up for everything else, however they weren't yummy enough for us to want to deal with that again.

29FEU5i6eSfigl0ydJIuKg.text: The menu is overwhelming and bursting with options. My friends were disappointed that quite a few of the selections weren't available. The burritos were mostly rice and the quesadilla was deep fried which was light on filling and mostly fried dough. BUT. My tacos were great. Really really very good. And the salsa bar was a really cool concept full of many different flavors. The service was poor and at times we though our server was kind of rude. I would go back for sure. But o my to stick with the tacos. Take the service with a grain of salt and you'll be fine

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

T3K24vTq-o6oIG-yVXGAXA.text: First off thank you fellow Yelpers for leading me here!!   So far I've been here twice and I will definitely be back...again...and again...and again! ((And again)) Both visits were for lunch, round one was a to go order of Al Pastor street tacos ** we will start here.   I walked in (the fancy shmancy wooden doors next to the Tienda) and it was jam packed. And this was around 2:30 on a weekday and it really is a little restaurant AND the character and ambiance are unique. So inviting. Anyway, I first attempted to order the Asada tacos...then mole however they were sold out .... Hence the al pastor. The flavors were amazing. They weren't (in my opinion) traditional, however they were delicious and I WILL order them again in the future.   My second visit was a sit down lunch around 1:00 on a Wednesday with the hubs.
