We were able to sit, eat, and relax before my one hour lunch was finished. So they are very quick!! The place got packed closer to 2:00 by people of all ages which is a really good sign. Anyway, I ordered the black mole tacos and the hubs got a trio street taco plate. *{Holy Moly}* Yelpers!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   Everything this restaurant serves could be considered magical bursts of flavors that rock your Mind!!!   Just come here and eat. The food is to die for. The salsa bar is something to be rivaled and their margaritas look heavenly (I need to go when I'm off the clock!!)  //cheers//

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. //street tacos plate of al pastor, Asada, chicken mole//
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. //chicken mole taco plate//
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. //al pastor street taco plate take out order//

n41qCX2x9ZwUwF2Dc_oakg.text: Disgusting! Dirty. Lame service.  After waiting 20 minutes, seeing plenty of empty tables and still not seated,  we watched one of the workers throw down two big bags of ice (to bust the cubes loose) onto the floor. Then the bags were opened, lifted, laid on the bin, and raised up until empty, shaking all the ice into the open bin.   here's the problem - - The bag protects the ice, but as soon as it is thrown on the floor, the outside of the bag gets contaminated.  The floor they were thrown on was already soaking wet, in a very dark area behind the bar.  After I witnessed this huge mistake, it made me think we should just leave. So we did but I told them why. The person in charge pretty much brushed me off, and the bag-dropping guy mentioned how it's "just the bag"... that got dirty...  I didn't feel any change would really take place after pointing out what we just saw, and how the guy so casually brushed off my concern. Wow!  We've been here five times before, and I'm wondering what kind of sanitation problems they have in the kitchen, where nobody can see, if they so openly soil the ice in my drink.   Disgraceful.  I trusted them, but now I don't.

TOfLdbCV-HitITm0WvOhpA.text: Another review by BAM You got to get in here Homes!  I had the namesake taco plate with chicken and and the sides of black beans and rice.   All these great tastes...let me start with the sauteed Spinach...Spinach, What? That's right.  I'm RUINED. I can never have another taco without thinking of this beautiful gastronomic experience, deep in one of the hood. I will never be the same.  When you find this gem, don't see it and pass it by, turn around. "IT'S ALL GOOD..."  Family recipes. I asked the owner of these recipes were from "Abuelita" and he said yep. From the Family all the way.  Killer Homes. Your mouth gonna be broke!  Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco A Baja Sur specialty! Corn tortilla stuffed with beer battered dogfish shark.  Cabo Shrimp Taco A Cabo specialty! Corn tortilla stuffed with beer battered shrimp.  Sonoran Carne Asada Taco A Sonoran specialty! Arrachera steak marinated with Mexican herbs, fresh garlic & olive oil, charbroiled with mesquite charcoal.  Aztec Tinga Taco A Mexico City specialty! Freshly made shredded chicken with tomato, onion & Aztec chipotle salsa.  Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco A Yucatan specialty! Roasted pork shoulder with achiote rojo, wrapped in banana leaves and slow-cooked until fork tender. Topped with lime marinated onions & Salsa Habanera Maya.  Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Shark Taco A Oaxacan specialty! A legendary blend of spices, chiles, nuts and chocolate made into a rich and flavorful sauce, mixed with shredded chicken.  La Condesa Veggie Taco Toasted Oaxacan cheese, mushrooms, Poblano pepper, onion, spinach & fresh garlic, grilled with olive oil.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

g9h1ILsxiARbVlgfoHTCIQ.text: Guac has dried cranberries! Salsa bar superfun.   Drove across town to return. The corn quesadillas are phenomenal. HUGE! Mine came with shrimp and poblano peppers.   Art on the wall very engaging. Seems like each had a story to tell.   Service very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qcvhgZA0fQhODmDHmlwQVA.text: I'm a vegetarian and the options La Santisima has are phenomenal! I make it a point to try something different every time I visit and have not been disappointed yet. Everything is delicious,  authentic and real. Highly recommend you visit. Have the bean dip to start... you'll thank yourself for doing so.

NVJo9MSyM62Y1e_GkL8pCw.text: I was so excited to try this place. Heard great things, however I was so disappointed. The food was ok. I tried 3 different Tacos and the el pastor had a good flavor the meat on the other hand was chewy and didn't taste like pork. Salsa bar had many choices but no flavor at all. This place feels very neglected and dirty. Won't be returning

WI9K5TR1-TGdappuAl-DZw.text: Well.  Hmm.  I suppose I should start by saying I have never had any issues with the food here.  It is always delicious and incredibly satisfying, and the salsa bar (especially the pecan salsa) is friggin' capital A Amazing.  I also really enjoy the atmosphere, and the servers themselves are great.  However, every time I visit I notice that the speed of service is slower.  Today was by far the longest wait, at almost an hour to order and get our food.  They've also recently expanded, so their dining area is roughly 3x the size it used to be (which definitely puts a dent on the already long wait time).  In the end, I'll keep coming back.  The food is worth it.  However, I really hope this isn't a precurser to negative changes for this restaurant.  It would be such a waste of a great thing.

Fy-HaOn6WNkWxCijyyUejA.text: Let me start by saying ..... This restaurant is hyped for NO reason.  The horchata is definitely a fail in my books. There was too much going on in the horchata that I lost the taste with all the fruit in there including walnuts. It should just be called "Fruit Drink". You can't even get a sip with something coming up your straw. Also ABSOLUTLEY not worth 5$ !!!! FAIL   To eat I got 3 Tacos (Carne Asada & Chicken Tinga) and rice and beans The carne asada tacos were basic and tasted the same as any other place . I did enjoy the tinga taco it had a lot of flavor but nothing was good enough that would make me want to come back.  My boyfriend got a deep fried carne asada quesadilla that he said was "good" but nothing amazing.   All in All it's all hype  You can get better tacos and Horchata at Ta Carbon!

jRieQS7J_nuLMMELDmhSOA.text: Salsa Bar. Salsa Bar. Salsa Bar. I cannot say enough yum things about this hip little spot. The tacos were divine, the meats and spices were absolutely perfect. Loved the service here, and did I mention the salsa bar?? So many choices and every one a winner. I can't wait to go back.

oyfP__shXuiI8XO7ptUVIg.text: DAMN DAMN DAMN this is good! The salsa bar is out of this world and if you have not eaten for a week cram down the gaucho or the shark tacos.  I would give this place 5 if it was not so damn busy. I hate waiting but the food is good.

xKflN2we1Ys3dFUbDCM_Fw.text: La Santisma was our first stop upon arriving in Phoenix. It was over 100 degrees outside and my family, bf and I were hungry. I was craving street tacos and found this place on Yelp! The Argentinian steak and the dog shark tacos were my favorites. The salsa bar was awesome as I laid out different types of salsa in front of my plate. The best part was sipping on a huge drink of horchata! I also admired the Mexican paintings on the walls. The restaurant was small, packed, busy and worth the wait.

kFnyOJxlzYjtxPQ3FOPz_Q.text: Just. Brilliant.  This place puts Barrio Cafe to shame.  There isn't a bad thing on the menu.  The food is amazing, the atmosphere is warm and fun, and the service is spot-on.  Oh, and unlike Barrio, the prices are very reasonable.    Forget the Barrio Cafe hype, THIS place is "The real deal."

0ybYAKfWoDVe5OfqyTZaLA.text: Been coming here for over a year now, ordering the same thing. The "El Gaucho" burro. Probably the best Burro on their menu... the Burro is amazing. Sadly, since coming here they decided to expand their restaurant. With clear notions that they have zero clue how to run that many tables. Seeing 8 people waiting over 40 min to be seated with more than 8 chairs available is not how you run a business. Considering I've run a successful restaurant with about 5 times the amount of capacity, one must consider an expansion before making one. Being understaffed and the kitchen being behind is absolutely zero excuse for letting people stand and wait to be seated while your kitchen catches up when the room for seats is available. I'm seriously appalled with this place after the last two times being here. If you're going to have the audacity to add $$ to your prices then justify it with the knowledge to know how to take care of your customers. Here's a tip. Tell your servers to seat people and offer them chips and perhaps a drink on the house if it is in fact the houses fault for being behind. Probably will not spend a dime here anymore which is sad considering I thought they had the best burrito in Phoenix. Get your kitchen together. Best of luck.

tM8ZFj6wyxQK4g4kjyQBcQ.text: I've been here about 4 times now. I love this place. The name has changed, they've been serving alcohol for a while now, there's a new location in Glendale (I need to go), and the menu has expanded but isn't quite represented online yet. Even the physical menus can be different. The one I had had a few more items on it than my friends'. The horchata is still the best I've ever had. The margaritas are so freaking good.  I tried the marlin taco that wasn't there last time I visited. I love trying things I've never had before. Marlin is an odd fish. Their preparation makes it look and taste almost like pork. It's just... different. Still good though!  My friend got the veggie burro. She said it was pretty tasty, but a little on the bland side. We agreed that it can be hard to make vegetarian food flavorful at times. She liked the salsa bar because she could add a different flavor between bites.  They get slammed on weekends. I was here at 7pm on a Friday. They need more than 2 people serving and clearing on weekends. When every table is packed there's almost no room to move. Getting to the salsa bar can be pretty awkward.

m6c6GXF0Jln0FjtTg7FoqA.text: You can tell they take care in preparing the food here. The meats are tender and the sauces and spices are to die for!

aYcyTZB55AHd5sf0Kz7iIA.text: Amazing tacos! The seating and parking can be a little dicey, but the food is worth it.

q_1WCUVzbpYOF6NlFHZhwg.text: I love this restaurant. It can sometimes be difficult to find solid mexican food, but this place nails it, bringing dishes from various regions in mexico, but mostly central and southern.  The salsa bar is fun, it is great to find a dish you like and experiment with new salsas. The negative of the place is also its charm, but it is small and usually very busy, so expect a 10-15 minute wait.  My favorites are the burritos, with a grapefruit margarita.

QPIvQGB9MUQbJjUgVGWe3Q.text: I like the Cochinita Pibil the best. Not a fan of the other tacos and I could do without the rice and beans. The horchata is something to write about. I have never had horchata with fresh ingredients...Very Tasty. The server was nice and quick. You have to get your own salsa so stock up. Would love to stop by again!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Took the leap of faith before the shot. Two tacos--Cochinita Pibil and Fish Taco

paj7tB61jppy6LT8Ln43fQ.text: They claimed to have mighty good horchata!! The Horchata was indeed great!! :)  I liked It!  But not the best in my opinion, no place like Mexico could ever offer amazing Horchata to me thus far, nothing like the one's you'll find at street taco stands late at night in places like Cuernavaca, Chihuahua, Mexico city and or Acapulco!  _ Anyways, coming back to La Condesa this place is super tiny, and should consider expanding to make it a bit more comfy, just my opinion!  The taco platter I had included the Carne Asada , Pacific Fish and Cochinita Pibil taco. All three were okay, and just okay. The rice and bean were also A-ok, nothing too extravagant nor elaborate. I really think this taco shop could do better, they have the potential to, like their amazing salsa bar is a huge kudos to consider, and the staff too so you got that down Condesa, Keep up the good work and plenty of room for improvement if you care to know!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Way too much food!! But GREAT Cochinita pibil, okay carne asada and not so good pacific fish taco :)
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My sisters plate, Tacos al pastor, she said they were really good!! :)
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My amazing sister enjoying her Modelo!!!

f6N1DbDZRp8aGlPvS4fabA.text: Best tacos in town. No doubt. Always on point, take out option makes always eating their tacos super easy. It gets pretty packed late nights and weekends. Still worth the wait. Always.

vF7d7paY_aemPKfnTLNZbw.text: Great food. Tiny hole in the wall. We went for our first time on a Sunday about 430pm. Didn't think it would be busy since it was a little to early for dinner and late for lunch but we're we wrong. Had to wait only a minute or so for someone to leave and a table to open up but this place had people coming in non stop. My wife and I split 6 different tacos that the waiter recommended. All very good. Favorite two were the steak called something else and the shrimp. Those two were unbelievably good. Steak was super tender and shrimp tasted very fresh. Very well seasoned. The other tacos we tried were all good too but not as good as the two listed above iny my opinion. We both also had their house Margarita which was fantastic. Definately will come back. My new favorite mexican place for tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos tacos and more tacos.  Awesome salsa bar. Gauranteed to find at leat one you will like.

1twcDZbHfr2o9vmlemwKQw.text: The menu has expanded!  Got there early for  dinner meal.  There are only 10 tables in here so you may have to wait at high times.  We were seated quickly, ordered no the food was out in a flash.  We ordered the Marlin fish taco and and Sonora beef taco plates.  The fish taco was juicy and flavorful; one of the best fish tacos I have had.  hUbby also like his steak taco.  The salsas were low, a tribute to their goodness.  Once they got filled up, we helped ourselves to Jicama, guac, cilantro and tomatillo salsa.  tHe guac salsa has a good kick to it so beware.  We ate all the free chips.  Overall a great food experience in the heart of the Barrio.

-ZR2izsYs4WrTH4BEwhF3w.text: One of my "go to" places in downtown Phoenix.  Food is very good, salsa bar is excellent.  Very creative menu, so you aren't stuck with just a single filling choice in your tortilla.  House special is a fave. Place is very small, which can be an energetic environment for a meal.  However, it can also be a bit of a pain when you want to go to the salsa bar at the same time as someone else.

mOgJ7EquLsUrD0g5AxcRzQ.text: Seriously amazing food. Salsa bar for whatever you need. Food was very well priced and service was friendly! Highly recommended.

QWHCQTQTH9s_VSqEP2iLiQ.text: The guacamole is incredible-- big avocado chunks, cilantro, onion, tomato, mango, dried cranberries.... amazing. And the El Pastor Burro our recommendation. Great place for fresh Mexican food!

1F6rk1Y0ITyxXKQ9aTIElQ.text: I enjoyed this place.  Pretty good food and interesting decor.  Not the usual "Mexican" place so come in with an open mind.

ZmYeT6AEE3JOVGmgzPgqqQ.text: If "10" were an option, I would have picked that as a rating. This place was off the charts!  Highly recommend the Spicy Margarita. Oh, and bring an appetite.

d4WoEjJ5EnYWs5J7v0mMBg.text: Good food keeps us coming back but overall services is not good and definitely not friendly. The hostess was absolutely horrible, not one smile and made us feel like we were inconveniencing her! One bright spot was the bartender that took our drink order well we waited for a table. The restaurant was enlarged recently but still a long wait and tons of open tables well we waited so either the kitchen or service wasn't ready for the larger space. Not sure how much longer we will keep going back if the service doesn't improve!

S1IpMEXd_iQtOyAeus1YRg.text: Pleasantly surprised at what i found after walking through the doors. Yum. I underestimated the 2 taco plate size and got two additional street tacos (happy hour 3-6 m-f), leaving me stuffed.  The fried shark was great - awesome crunch with perfect texture while not being fishy. I've had better mole but it's worth the try if you've never had it. Carne asada and cochinita were also good.  Experiment with the different salsas to make each bite different.  This place is not cheap for tacos but def worth the groupon when available.  Good luck parking in front if it's busy.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

K16BSfMo1wItRpvXKrvOfw.text: Steak tacos are awesome. ..so is salsa bar! Make sure you come by early, for no wait.

QVHHWJz0hTVYAcOpvOw8Kg.text: Service was absolutely horrible. The waiter barely spoke to us. I felt like I had to beg him to do anything. No one asked if we wanted water.. Had to flag the guy down. Then I made the mistake of ordering more chips and had to ask several times for the waiter to bring them out. When he finally did he looked annoyed w me. He never asked us how our food was. The final straw was when it came time to pay, I told him we were paying separate and then he let out this long sigh that included his lips flapping loud as if I asked him to do the hardest thing in the world. I didn't want to leave a tip.. Because that's how bad it was.. But ultimately I couldn't do that. I just won't come back. I didn't feel welcome in the first place.

BO2oGmMyxn8FYDAz3Akuuw.text: Saw this restaurant on Diners, Drive ins and Dives and realized it was down the street from my work. The salsa bar is off the charts. Didn't even realize there were so many types of salsa. The ones I tried were delicious!! Restaurant is quaint but adds to the feels. Art work on the walls is super cool and also adds to feel of the authenticity. Highly recommend!! Loved it!!

ckXar1mfFgbh_JQiReWw7A.text: Came in on a Friday 5-ish for an early dinner with my friends. The place is cute, few tables, it's got a bar and 2 bathrooms. Salsa bar was awesome! There's tons to choose from.. My favorite was the salsa picante, jicama and the cilantro.. Ahhh soo good. I got the fried fish taco plate, the shark taco on the side and I also tried their horchata! The tacos were great! I love the rice it's got flavor to it and the horchata was very delicious! It's got fruit, cinnamon and nuts on top. Ok, so I didn't know it was big! I think the cup was 32oz, it's good for 2-3 people!!! The down side was the service..I don't know if the lady was stressed out because there's a lot of people and there's only 2 of them serving.. But they need to add more server/waiter during peak hours.. The guy was doing 3 jobs, at the bar, cashier and serving as well. I feel bad for them. We were waiting for our food for a long time, probably 30-40mins. When we got out of the restaurant, there was a lot of people waiting.. I will definitely come back again, just not peak hours.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos &amp; steak burrito!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My favorite was the salsa pecan

OKt830dUPoNcqtXJftCWvg.text: Great food, however cramped seating, and service that could use some improvement. I love the salsa bar, but quite a few of the salsas were empty, and not being filled up. Definitely enjoyed what I ordered! I look forward to eating here again, while hoping for an improvement in the service.

l7fW_Q8cSMX8Hm6mps8RjA.text: Tremendous food that has only gotten better over time since the restaurant opened a few years back.  The tacos are the best item on the menu, and the quesadillas are a close second, in my opinion.  This is not the typical Az-Mex quesadilla.  It's deep fried and incredibly delicious.  I'd go with anything including arrachera.  The salsa bar is as good as hyped here on Yelp.  My personal favorites are the cilantro, the pecan, the peanut, and the strawberry (when they have it).  A couple of great typical molcajete blends are there too.  Don't miss the house margarita.  The happy hour price of a few bucks is a total steal.  It's a ruby red grapefruit blend, and it's absolutely delicious (and well worth it even at the regular price).  You can eat like a king with a huge helping of food, great salsas, a quesadilla to split, have a margarita, and walk out for $15-20 per person including tip.  Delicious food and one of the best places on Calle 16.

Ll9wQrfbo3upCbMVassr6A.text: My most absolute favorite place to eat! The chicken quesadilla is my favorite and pairs the best with an ice cold Corona and a handful of different salsas to dip their awesome chips in. I love the cilantro salsa as well as the chipotle, but they are all so amazing!  The quesadillas are huge and I always have leftovers even though I stuff myself because it's so tasty.  This place is one you cannot pass up!

RfEcJxbV0sbA0pEwDBt9kg.text: Great tacos and amazing horchata!   The salsa bar was fresh, and it was really fun to try out different salsas. The Horchata and the Jamaica come in huge cups and are both excellent. I had the Mayan pork and Chicken mole tacos. They were delicious and filling.

1OTWusLsU2AvjG0NFKMrbw.text: Love this place for tacos, beer and a huge variety of different salsas! If you're looking for good tacos in Phoenix, you should definitely try La Santisima.

2KbvfswDgGL1dts9mBzNww.text: The salsa bar is delicious and surprising, the place was crowded but service is fast. Plenty of chips to try all the different salsas and the prices are sweet!

Kkt39zGbohzRAwCsyQPwRQ.text: The salsas in the salsa bar are uncommon and exciting, but satisfying, without filling you up. This is great way to start the meal.  There are many favorite tacos of mine at this place. Cochinita Pibil is a must.  Beer-battered seafood tacos, whatever the kind, are always a success.  Whether you drink booze or not, you will be happy beverage-wise (Horchata with fruit/nuts! Strong Margaritas!)  Go there!

yqqU7Ulu66VhFV9OmIm1Ag.text: I can't say enough good about this great little restaurant.  Honestly.  I always eat out when the general public isn't out in force, and I love going to La Condesa in the middle of the afternoon on weekdays.  Many good restaurants have the afternoon restaurant "limbo" period where they close until dinner, but it's great that this place doesn't.    Every single thing I've tried there is so good I wind up benchmarking most other Mexican-style restaurants against La Condesa.  Starting with their tortilla chips and salsa, the chips are always super fresh, and their salsa bar is the best I've ever seen; all home/hand-made gourmet salsas, TWELVE in all, obviously all made fresh.  Each one by itself is incredibly great, while I have about 5 favorites I always focus on.    I got addicted to their mole sauce.  That's surprising for me because I'm not a big chocolate fan at all, and the first time I saw mole sauce, just the idea sickened me!  Plus the first time I tried it, the person who made it really didn't know what they were doing -- but that all did a serious about-face once I tried La Condesa's.  It's hard to not order their mole chicken, but if you want to try another truly interesting and great gourmet taco, burro, or bowl, try their Pork al Pastor, it'll blow you away too.  I recently tried it burro style, and with some fresh tortilla chips and a half dozen cups of various salsas, it was almost too much to eat -- I chose to just have ice water with the meal, and the whole tab came to about $9-bucks.  Even when you just want water they bring you a glass filled with ice and lime wedges, and a stopper-type liter sized bottle of ice cold water.    Service is always fantastic too.  There isn't a whole lot of room in the place, maybe 15 tables and bar seating as well, which is why I also like going there when the crowds aren't around.  They're open for breakfast on Saturday's and Sunday's, I haven't been there during those times but I'd bet my bottom dollar they make a killer Huevos Rancheros!    This is certainly a must visit restaurant if you haven't eaten there before -- I almost don't want to write such a great review because they do enough business as it is, and I don't want to ruin one of my favorite places to go!  I'm picky, but not unrealistically so -- it's not often I'll write a 1-star review, and the same goes for 5-stars.  This place is absolutely a solid FIVE STAR restaurant, hands down IMHO.

iAsxrKanPU_CYqrJMJ7chA.text: What else is there to say about La Condesa that hasn't been said in the hundred other 5 star reviews of this place?  Not much, so I'll just add the following for extra emphasis...  1. The tacos.  Oh the tacos...  even living out in California, the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark tacos are made of dreams and sunshine and sugar plum fairies.  If sugar plum fairies came in the shape of delicious, beer batter fried dogfish shark pieces.  With just a little cream sauce and lettuce so you don't miss out on any of the shark.  And the Cochinita Pibil tacos... there's fall off the bone tender, then there's meat that's pretty much as  close to melting as meat can get.  But these are just my favorites... I've tried all the tacos on the menu, and they're all delicious.  2. The salsa bar.  If I can give this place any criticism, it's that they run out of salsas far too often.  Late in the day.  Just before they close.  Look... sometimes I'm in a peanut salsa mood, sometimes I'm in a chipotle salsa mood, sometimes I'm in a strawberry salsa mood.  I can't help it.  3. The horchata.  Just order it.  It's big.  Bring guests.  Share it.  I come here far too often for someone that lives 1000 miles away.  Love it.

3euniggd0mRVvqUbyIGHwQ.text: This place was terrible, I never leave bad reviews, but I was expecting high quality tacos and was very disappointed. After reading numerous articles we decided to check it out on Friday night. To begin with the restaurant is small and loud. We decide to get our food to go instead of waiting. Our order was messed up, I received a meat taco when I ordered something else (I don't eat meat). The rice is congealed and sticky and bland and the beans are runny and unbeatable. I was very disappointed with the customer service and the experience overall. We will not be back.

gHBBEA6nz75Dv979_KwB7g.text: Wow! We pulled up to this place with some skepticism, but after entering we  immediately knew we were in for a great lunch. With a salsa bar in the corner, we were given chips and first tried 3 different salsas. We ordered two types of tacos and a chicken mole quesadilla to share. The tacos were good, and the quesadilla was like a fluffy fried calzone. Absolutely delicious! The only bump was the fact I ordered my taco with no mushrooms and it came with them, but I didn't mind that much.   My husband had a hornitos margarita which was good as well. Next time we're in Phoenix we will certainly be back!

wGLwlX1sqOfKWoIQV0cuvw.text: Best Taco place in the valley. Great selection of salsas and hands down best Horchata in the world! Small and not the best seating but who cares! Carnitas are  tops.

CZwbOPfupdSGVbKqsQeHyg.text: Outstanding wish I had this place in Utah the quesadillas are amazing, great selection of salsas

KihpbKaU0reJwGDUHAGr8A.text: Lots of options, cool/hip smallish place, great vibe....  Salsa bar killed it, and service was quick.    Just what you want.

nL9zvk2mylWwTTqbCTr7JQ.text: Best horchata I've ever had. I crave it weekly. The salsa bar has options for everyone. Only down side is its a very small building so there's always a wait but it's worth it.

W8kX8TcMwsaHWL-zYMaePQ.text: Some the best taco I've had. I had the Al Pastor (pork), Carne Asada & Chicken mole. The service was friendly and a salsa bar was amazing with 13 different salsas.

4U3IBwuwq7yPfP_FwExJVg.text: They're in a new location with parking and lunch space much. Their service is very quick, even when they're busy.

KeFxzq5f2V0hIMCa9-dm_Q.text: At the outset, I want to say that the rating isn't because of the food; the food is great. The service....well, they need to work on it. I ordered some food to take out and showed up to get it. I could see the bags behind the counter; I asked a number of times if they were mine. I got blank looks. Finally, someone stopped to look and told me that they couldn't figure out who took my order so they couldn't pull up the order on their POS system. You can imagine what cold tacos and burritos taste like.  The salsas are the best ever; they serve them on a salsa bar and let you pick the ones you want. However, there were no lids for the containers for take out...  If you go there, expect to wait; it is popular. Expect slow service. Expect good food.

oclnsyaaq50siMSl8T5AdA.text: Great little restaurant with very tasty food. A good variety of Mexican favorites with a gourmet treat. Servings are large, plates could be shared.  Not a huge venue and gets filled up quickly. Great salsa bar to try different salsas

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great tasting chicken soup with a hint of hotness.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So delicious and huge!  The quesadillas or their version of it was very tasty. Lots of cheese and homemade tortilla shell.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious tacos. Choose three from a great variety. Served with rice and beans.

iCLA6CQYRvQFtIcQAN2LYg.text: Best quesadilla I've ever had, I wish I could get it back home. It had that really fresh Mexican style cheese, between a very war and flaky tortilla.  You can never go wrong with a salsa bar, particularly one that has a creamy almond salsa, yeah.

nEdxIuXYYvmWR2kc1oz7tw.text: Saw a cockroach crawling along the bar wall, didn't mention to anyone so I would freak out people out around. Just wanted to let the public know before they go in.

gY70-Vae4Zq0ETVrZd16dw.text: The best Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. Amazing recipes for tacos and quesadillas, like the chimichurri style Gaucho. They have incredible breakfasts, too. Incredible chilaquiles! And their salsa bar is world class. Finally, the servers are pros: so efficient and friendly. We don't go anywhere else in downtown.

1CbxNkEEjn_1TE3lY951kQ.text: I don't know how you say amazing in Spanish but that is the only way to describe this restaurant. It gets better every time I come. Muchas Gracias!!!!

4r9ZCbcK_vcNP6TGLvkJOg.text: This place used to be so delicious. We loved the tacos and the salsa selection back in 2012-13. It's so not the same now. Service was disappointing. Food was bland. The horchata was still yummy, but our server never came back so we couldn't order another. The 4 ice cubes in my water melted and our tortillas went cold and still nobody came to check on us. The salsas were still good, but there wasn't  any jicama salsa. The tortillas were like Guerrero brand I think. Def not made in-house. I'm sad that I will never go back again.

-q9uAhCHAxiNjfxqu2ztpg.text: Great place!!! Service was excellent getting seated took a little longer then I liked but well worth the little wait. I recommend trying the 3 taco platter for first time this way you can try a little of everything. But Mole was definitely my favorite.

aDQE6Hg639HX2bv6odi5jA.text: Thanks fellow yelpers.  Heading home to Seattle from an awesome spring break with family needing some good Mexican before hitting the airport.  This place delivered. Exactly what we were hoping for. Street Tacos were awesome, salsa bar a hit with everyone in the family and the guacamole with cranberries were legit.  Thanks for keeping it real.

yl6t4gasuzTRkSGd4XTwZw.text: Unassuming spot for legit tacos. Salsa bar had a plethora of options, the couple that I tried were fresh and very good. I had never seen shark on a menu before - so I tried the shark, shrimp, and steak tacos with a side of rice - did not disappoint! Contrary to other reviews, I thoroughly enjoyed the rice. Next time I'm in the area, I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. From top to bottom: Shark, Shrimp, and Steak tacos.

jADwrXsbbypj2Fjv_Vgj6g.text: The food is INCREDIBLE. Best burro I have ever had! The service, on the other hand, was pretty bad. This was this past Sunday afternoon. It was busy, but we had to wave down a waiter to even get drinks.  I will always come back, because the food is absolutely worth it.

Wdhrdsol3_t-1gQzu9cWpQ.text: Three visits before the last I would have reviewed much higher.    As a self proclaimed salsa snob, I like that I can try such a variety and found several that were spot on.  From Hot! to exotic.  I could just go in for chips and salsa bar and savor one of the jalapeno, cilantro margaritas! Caution, they use fresh jalapenos so sometimes they are much spicier than others.  My friend loved the tamarind margarita.   Prices look high but you get a lot for the money.  Their burritos are HUGE and most of the tacos are made with full size double corn tortillas. There are many choices to fit all tastes.  However, I would not recommend the fish tacos.  I ordered the baja style and could not eat it.  It tasted as if it had been frozen for a long long time.  The other tacos tried were very good.   Our last trip in, there were 4 of us, no problem getting a table on Friday at 4pm but the service was terrible..  Not sure if they were breaking in new staff or what.  In three visits, I knew their menu better than the waiter did and he had no knowledge of their "special house margaritas".  Service as really slow and they kept making mistakes on the drink orders.    I will give them another try.

uvF9WbI3GNpIkLP30QviLA.text: Found this place while traveling in Phoenix on Yelp.  We were in the mood for good Mexican food and this is the place to go.  It also was a featured place on DDD and so I was happy to visit a place that Guy had visited and recommended.  Loved the Art Work on the walls there.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yelp recommendation for some authentic Mexican groceries this afternoon

ArG1xy4xIZPnvgwiIOgl_A.text: Santisima is still a great restaurant, though the wait times are still long and they could use some improvement with increased wait staff. The mole quesadilla with chicken is delicious as is the horchata which delightfully has cinnamon, fruit and chopped nuts to accent the flavor. The prices have gone up, which is a pity. The expansion next door has opened up the space which makes seating easier though you still have to wait a bit too long to get your order (worth it though...the food is delicious) Still love the artwork and decor which is based on Mexican La Lllorona and Day of the Dead themes. Alan our waiter was fantastic, personable, and hard working. Would give place 5 stars if they could just get more efficient between seating time and getting served the meal.

uUUTS_Bhq-OQLfGRieoK7g.text: Monday for lunch and people were waiting out the door. They mentioned 20 min, first time there not from AZ but BF said food is amazing.  We waited 10 min tops sat down.  Place is small but staff is working hard to get everyone in and served.  Right away you just notice how happy the people are to be there.   I ordered the burrito special with shrimp and a Jamaica agua.  I was starving went I went in but could only finish half of the huge burrito. Partly because do the chips and delicious salsa bar.  Definitely coming back when back in town.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the frames in the women&#39;s bathroom.  If you had a brother growing up in a Hispanic household you know El Santo.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special burrito with shrimp.  Shrimp perfectly cooked and veggies so fresh.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

v5_nC2kBAUFxKT71L-xZrA.text: Obsessed with the white fish tacos! I've never really liked fish tacos but they've won me over and salsa bar is amazing! Go there hungry- you won't be disappointed

i04VdjrpUTpg6mlKTFc3ew.text: Wow, this place is truly amazing. I had smoked marlin, mahi mahi, and shrimp tacos. All fantastic. My friends and family all loved their food too and the mole is excellent. I also had a mango margarita with a chili rim that is probably the best margarita I've had in Arizona. Could not recommend this place more. I love Mexican food and Santisimas keeps with tradition while adding their own incredibly tasty flares! Love, love, love!

58lEvGA6ZlPSJKTWLzSZuQ.text: This place was always good, except today was not too good.  It's bigger now.  Took 15+ mins to get seated although place was only half full at 2pm on Saturday.  Service was slow too.  Ordered large Guacamole it was small portion didn't look fresh, tons of other ingredients like cranberries and not enough avocados.  I had chicken burrito, but it was mostly beans.   My friend was way hungry but didn't finish his plate.... didn't like his plate either.  Maybe just an off day for them, not sure.

R_28TxrUhuVntX9OTppzKw.text: Excellent food, and a wide variety of choices, among both the entrees and the salsas.  Good service.  Parking can be an issue, but the food is well worth that small hassle.

GZDifvlbJelIbobjYVwuKg.text: The La Santisima Specialty Taco was delicious. Best ever.  The Salsa Bar is amazing.   I'm going to bring my friends back here.  The owner called me by name, that felt good. This was my first visit.

YQkNndyAXv1ok5ad6E_Afg.text: Was expecting more given all the hype. Wasn't the experience I expected. I ordered the spicy margarita and my date a regular. Glass and presentation was beautiful but it was extremely sweet and I could not taste the tequila. Triple Sec is supposed to add the sweet, not tons is simple syrup laden weak fruit juice. Salsas were tasty but a little watered down. I'd rather have 5 or even 2 awesome salsas than 12 not so good ones. Some weren't even labeled. Tacos were good but fish and shrimp were deep fried, I was expecting grilled. Their signature taco was excellent. I'd like to give 2 stars but if I haven't ordered margaritas it's 3.

8m-jQevW7iWaJrO5Rgq-4g.text: Salsa bar had so many delicious choices and flavorful options that I was beside myself with excitement! The street tacos were so tasty and unique flavors has me come my back for more!!! Can't wait for my next trip back to this restaurant!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Try them all and you won&#39;t be disappointed!!!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Just a few of the uniquely tasty salsas! We had 3 of the street tacos and a steak burrito. Can&#39;t wait for my next return!!!

BwBgdmDPw62PhG6GCrR_2A.text: I've been here twice and both times I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and experience. This last time we waited awhile for our order but the server took an item off the check to make up for it! He made great recommendations and was very attentive. My absolute favorite was the shark taco but everything was good. The salsa bar was great and had a bunch of variety from hot to mild. They also have a fab Bloody Mary from what I'm told.  Can't wait to go back!

Qw8ZAKj_R-1WwdSJoD-Vrw.text: I grew up in a Mexican household so I tend to be super picky about eating at Mexican restaurants. I can't stand generic places like On The Boarder and Mi Amigos.   It was around 8:00 pm on a Wednesday when I showed up. It was super busy but we were seated within ten minutes. The servers were attentive throughout the night. :D  That said: I love the idea of a salsa bar but I wasn't a fan of all of them. Personal taste.  Their food was awesome! It didn't need the salsas at all. I ordered three different gourmet tacos with beans and rice. All of them unique and on point.  Plus, I ended up with a food coma. Enough said.

sxx4sbVCCHUuBbSTdLlmZg.text: I am not a huge fan of Mexican food so when my sister took me to this restaurant, I was not expecting to me blown away. Except I was! I loved this place, from the beans to the different types of salsa and the to-die for carne asada tacos! My boyfriend had the al pastor burrito which he loved as well. Service was great however my only complaint is that there aren't enough servers. We found ourselves waiting a lot but I knew it wasn't our server's fault. She was just extremely busy.   5/5 stars for sure! :)

9ERhasubZ6QokdDWPtZ3RQ.text: Great place, good atmosphere, a little on the small side but what they lack in size, they make up in flavor. The salsa bar was great and the food came out in less than 15 mins. There are no televisions or loud music to distract you from good conversation and good food. Parking is quite tight but don't let that detour you! A solid 8/10. Only "complaint" is the dish called the "Mexican Flag". If you don't like nuts and sweet dried fruit in your tacos, don't order this dish. Took us a little off guard lol  Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata with strawberry purée on the bottom...Amazing!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadilla al pastor. Delicious!

Vzq_2K4HPLXrbcNeZIYSJw.text: Best Mexican food I've ever had, wait staff is usually really slow but the food is worth it.

Pj5jBcI_tI8WdTgFFATrtA.text: I was very excited that today was my father's birthday as it gave me the opportunity to spend quality time with him....oh and try out this great restaurant. :) After inspecting many of the great reviews, I was thinking that this establishment could not be as good as advertised but it was. From the amazing salsa bar to the great fish tacos, the food here was very, very good. As many have mentioned, the salsa bar has many options to choose from and each has its own authentic flare. For lunch today I ordered the carne asada and shark taco, that came with beans and rice. The fish and carna were so flavorful. In my opinion, you know when you are eating good Mexican food based on how tasty a fish taco is and theirs was great. To go with my meal I ordered their horchata that many yelpers have raved about. I love horchata but sadly I can not list theirs as a favorite. I am more of a simple guy when it comes to this speciality drink and having pecans and strawberries in it just was a little much for me. You may ask how I could still give it five stars but if you had the opportunity to try all of the other items that I tasted they more than made up for it. Overall, very good food and a place that I will definitely be going to in the future. There are many seafood dishes that I look forward to enjoying in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loved all the sauces
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al pastor burro with red sauce. Great dish.

SQpMY2-aernej0mjkuIg3g.text: Amazing house recipe horchata. Salsa bar to die for.  Street tacos: the BEST.  Will go back as often as we can.  Tamarindo Margarita AMAZING!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tamarind Margarita!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street tacos galore!

k8mnvJMtuVsfOsmJdhxBsw.text: The mole in this place was orgamical!!!' My eyes rolled back in my head and I almost screamed out!!! The salsa bar?!?!? Forget about it!!! Crazy Mo fo good!!!  If I lived in Arizona I'd live in this place!!! Jesus our waiter, the f$&kin best!!!

G5G0TY_p0m5z3gQFY83_hQ.text: Fantastic!  After a week of eating out here, this is hands down the best food I've had in Phoenix.  The bread for the "Lonches" is baked on-site and is phenomenal.  Fresh ingredients are handled expertly in the kitchen and the result is out of this world.

Ddd-uHFgBcHnznYQTDtEPA.text: This place is not for people who are looking for fast food experiences...... it's slo-mo in every way and well worth the mouth watering delicious food they bring to your table ..... so many different salsa selections even one with a peanut butter base maybe my favorite..... so unique and delicious..... it's unbelievable!!!! Please take the time and visit!

oUlZEwVG884HNEQXomF-gg.text: My family's first time here. We heard great things so we HAD to come. We had a 20 min wait unless we wanted to sit at a dark (no light)table. We didn't want to wait so we accepted. It was darker than I had expected. The table wasn't cleaned so we grabbed napkins to clean it and the hostess finally comes and cleans it for us. We got our chips and was told the salsa bar was behind us. There was no salsa at the bar. We asked for the salsas to be refilled 4 times.  Our food came out at separate times. We had no silverware. I asked for flour tortillas for my soup and didn't get them. It wasn't a great experience. I'm not sure we'll be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drink menu

aKi66-kk13e4H40xnOxNYg.text: The food is wonderful! Salsas galore! You might have a bit of a wait because this ain't fast food so be sure you bring some patience! Will eat here again and again!

zbixuifub5HSOJWctVR21Q.text: The food here is amazing.  So many unique and delicious salsas to choose from and the entrees  were superb! Very unique Mexican food spot that I'd definitely recommend. Friendly staff a real plus, too.

TTZotHoIphOTGdLintl5Hw.text: Great place to take out-of-towners. These are show and tell tacos, pricy and small portions surrounded by beautiful art and murals. You can definitely get cheaper tacos elsewhere without all the fuss. This is the BEST a-la-carte salsa bar in town, but the small plastic containers are inadequate.

6QVu4mfDyxskE5D58KgWSw.text: Smells like mop bucket from cleaning floors. Ordered pastor burrito enchilada style. No cheese inside or out. Was still pretty tasty.

7R9jsfhlHPmkSyiqxV4xvA.text: Margaritas are amazing!  Tacos on point. Baja shrimp a must.   Gourmet tacos are your thing it place is a must in Phoenix

H41KP25PT0XFf62_SM6WNQ.text: Awesome guac, if you like it fancy.  Really great tacos, small quaint dining room.  Reeeaaaallllyyyy long wait.

y4-RaKdfqrfcERd64B7_tw.text: The food was delicious and the margartia was the best one that I have ever had. The service however was poor. It took way to long to be addressed by the waitstaff. I believe it was because they did not have enough employees. We will be back!

v2cjGwscaRlQyloWBx687A.text: Greatest happy hour ever!  Cheap beer and street tacos.  We did not get any of the specialty ones but it did not matter, everything was fresh and amazing.  They have the best mole in the Pheonix, we searched multiple spots and this one is special.  Salsa bar is crazy!  I am taking my family here when they arrive!

TF8VFmQ9R5y4sqdWUHgd3Q.text: The self serve salsa had a great variety and was a lot of fun. The margaritas weren't amazing, but the food certainly was. I enjoyed a few street tacos, but particularly enjoyed the refried beans. I was visiting Phoenix, but it is definitely the best Mexican food I've had in a long time.

SIE8w49uzXbDnQ8CXxz3aQ.text: This place is a local gem, and we were introduced to it by a local.  I hesitate to review it, for fear that the out-of-towners will find it.  You'd have to know where it is though, because the tourists are not going to accidentally stumble upon it.  It's in the middle of the hood in Phoenix.  The only thing setting it apart from the other old-school business fronts with barred windows is the giant mosaic Day of the Dead Catrina above the door.  Known as a "gourmet taco place" to locals, the menu also features burros and quesadillas.  Where else can you get a shark soft taco or a Mahi Mahi burro?  I have no idea, but you can get them here.  My husband loved his Mahi Mahi burro.  I had a more traditional Carne Asada soft taco.  All their flour tortillas are hand made, and fresh.  And did I mention the salsa bar?  About 20 different kinds of salsa for you to try, with the chips that keep coming to the table.  My favorite was the creamy cilantro one.  There are also peanut and pecan based salsas, so those with nut allergies, take note.  You may not expect nuts in your food, so pay attention.  Seating is limited, (maybe 10 tables) and the restaurant was full when we were there, for lunch, in the middle of the week.  If you have a group larger than 4, it would probably be wise to call ahead.  Parking is also limited, just the few spaces on the street in front.  The only slightly disconcerting element was the giant mural of Frida Khalo.  It's a little odd to be stared at by a giant portrait of a mustached woman while eating such wonderful food.  We liked it so much that my husband took my dad there.  My dad is a notoriously finicky eater (which means I probably came by it naturally), and he is still talking about it a week later.  Yum!

dzw_Y3iqqizWgs82V_F05w.text: An oustanding, quality restaurant with reasonable prices.  The carne asada bowl that I had was amazing.  Enough for two meals for me, but it was so good, I ate it all at one time.  I did take out and while waiting saw all of the dishes come out to the customers.  Everything looked amazing.  I can't wait to return and try some of the other items.  The salsa bar was amazing with over 12 choices of different salsa.  I mixed the guacamole (hot) and cilantro (mild)  salsa and it was one of the best that I have ever tried with the perfect level of spice for me.  You can't miss this place.  Thanks again for a great meal.

gbk4w55MTW0JAxZVPCxGxg.text: Great Mexican food in a quaint setting. Excellent  tacos and burros. Horchata is original, well worth the try.

-Zq5CNjvpPyOB98yw6Gtkw.text: Ohhh baby the horchata is simply amazing. 5th star well deserved. I felt like a little kid scooping the pecans and strawberries with a spoon at the end.

N3ug8rmNrFe76u_2cKHkpQ.text: This place is very good. Their salsa bar is great with many different selections. Whenever I'm thinking about eating Mexican food, this place always comes to mind.

LdlBar8Y6856pLrftRfSKg.text: REALLY great salsa bar selection here! I would go here strictly for that reason alone. The food here is great. The drinks are delicious as well. They hand make the cocktails with love and use real fruit. I had the blueberry martini and there were so many fresh blueberries in it I could barely finish it haha! My hubby got the horchada with rum...it tasted like a pina colada! Yum yum. In a rougher part of town, but this is definitely our new go to spot for Mexican food when driving to/from the airport back up to North Scottsdale :)

n4vUqTjorfDjoyTXjhUYZQ.text: Awesome flavors. We went on a Saturday around 1:00pm and the place was empty but filled up soon afterward. Service was prompt . The menu was bigger than expected and sounded pretty authentic. They have a full bar which was a plus as I was in mood for some tequila. I had the smoked marlin tacos and slow cooked pork tacos..both were incredibly flavorful and excellent. Not the best I have ever eaten but darn close and I have had a lot of great tacos in my travels. The only disappointment was I was hoping to also get a chile reano, sadly they don't offer them. I'll go back for sure when I am in Phoenix.

IK4eLrnMRORQRVLuHV5pXg.text: My boyfriend and I went here for the first time today. The food is great, and so is the service. However, if you don't like fried food, don't get the quesadillas. My boyfriend had the horchata, and he says it is the best that he has ever had. The horchata is sweet, but not sickly sweet, and it has strawberries and pecans in it.  The salsa bar is awesome. You receive complimentary chips, and you can choose as many salsas as you want.  The menu has a wide variety; there is something for everyone! Even vegetarians. The dogfish taco lives up to its reputation on Yelp.

llELvwgpAp6C6oAKRsOn2A.text: Holy *%#*!!! The mole is legit! Best I've ever had. Everything else is also quite tasty, but the mole is what's to write home about.

OpfG8xABlpW0rKiNscdsUQ.text: On my way home from the baseball game I decided to stop in here and see what all the excitement was about.  I drove past it and then turned around and got a parking spot right by the door.  I ordered the dogfish shark taco and the cochinita pibil taco combo with rice and beans.  I received some chips as I left the order counter and stopped at the salsa bar to get some pico de gallo.  When I got to my table I scooped some pico onto my tortilla chip and wow, what great fresh taste!  I also had some tomatillo, jicama and chipotle salsas that I tried on my tacos.  The shark taco was good and the cochinita pibil was even better.  Even the small cups of rice and beans where really good.  I grabbed a menu on my way out and am already trying to plan what I'll have on my next visit.  I especially can't wait to try the horchata.

tBwYslb3lc6f-rJbUR1Kjg.text: Love this place but the service sucks. I sat for 7 mins and did get any service. No water, just chips. They ran out of the cups for salsa and I just sat there. What a joke. I asked if I could place my order, the waiter just said yea, then walked away. So I continued to sit there. After what seemed to be 5 more minutes I just gave up. I left. What a shame too, I used to like this place. They need a better wait staff. Fail.

-3_vpN3hL6KPuj87f0mx_A.text: Great place. Easy to miss though, so look closely. Small place and not much parking! Once we actually found it (we drove right past it the first time) we were greeted warmly. The menu is extensive and there are a ton of great options for vegetarians. First time I've ever had grilled cactus (and it was great!). The server was friendly, the food was fresh, and everything came out really quickly. They also have a salsa bar so you can try a bunch of different salsas on your food. The decor was also pretty awesome- lots of Day of the Dead decor. The overwhelmingly positive reviews are justified.

AewXQd8BN5-G9sgx-eJqww.text: Truly superb food. Service is...quirky-- you need to order at the counter and grab your own utensils. Locals know the ropes, so the newbies have to figure it out on their own. But if you want an authentic, neighborhood feel, and excellent food, this is your place.

mF7_qox4jRHwTt4l3VtpAg.text: Gross and expensive!! Don't waste your time, money, or tastebuds!!

QOry_Km2P7BllABPaa99AA.text: This is the diamond in the rough type mexican food you'd expect out of Phoenix. Fresh tacos. Love the salsa bar. Guacamole is fresh and tasty, almost a little sweet. Give it a try people.

-N0PXKPWD1yjquFGdu8WEA.text: My friend raved about it so I thought I'd try it. First off, the place is SMALL. luckily we got there right when they opened. Seemed like as soon as we got seated, the place started to fill up. I enjoyed the salsa bar and the different assortment of salsas. As for my actual food. I didn't care for it much. To me, it didn't have much of a flavor to it unless it was drowned in the salsa from the salsa bar. Was going to order a strawberry horchata to go but every time we asked for something, the waitress took a while to come back (she only came back in a hurry when it was time to pick up the money), so I said forget it. I won't be back but at least I can say I went.

xcarJfgbiycs12j8o4zsSw.text: Thank you yelpers! I was searching for mexican late at night and was really craving something authentic. I struck gold with La Condesa.  It is a True diamond in the rough part of phoenix. I ordered the carne asada burrito which is simply meat and beans. Anywhere else that would be boring and plain, but it was seasoned perfectly and full of flavor. A perfect vessel for the salsa bar from heaven. Every bite was different depending on what spicy concoction I chose. I also couldn't resist trying the maya conchita pibil taco, which was packed full of juicy shredded pork. So juicy in fact that I had to eat it quick because the corn tortillas were getting a bit soggy. Did I mind? Oh no. I just sopped up any juice left and sighed with pure contentment. They topped the taco with nothing else but pickled red onions that were delicious. Simple done right.  Can't wait to go back and get that horchata!

GET1zjgN3BQlfXuE902pJA.text: we love fish tacos, but find it hard to find good, "authentic" ones near our house without paying scottsdale prices. i've heard of La Condesa, but since it's out of our "circle of convenient driving distance" we never think of it.   thanks to the wife, we were all set to meet some friends here last night. we first noticed that is an actual sit-down restaurant. i assumed with all the hype, it would be a grungy, post-soviet area looking eatery (re: carolina's), but no....it was nice inside, replete with some beautiful dia de los muertos paintings.   we had to wait about 30 minutes for a table to open up. once seated, we were brought a jug of water and some chips. then the fun began! trying out each one of the approx 15 salsa's at their salsa bar. i liked many of them, but wound up going back to the traditional salsa and pico. of note, the cilantro, pecan, and strawberry salsa's were good, but only for a few dips.   i ordered one each of the shark, the shrimp, and the veggie tacos. they are small but packed with flavor. so juicy, they come stacked on 2 small corn tortillas. i actually savored the veggie and the shrimp instead of wolfing them down. both very tasty with that mexican sauce they put on them, and the fried shrimp were perfect...not caked in batter, but just a light dusting. i didn't get to the shark ones because i was so full, so it's in our fridge waiting to be eaten. i also ordered a margarita...it was rather delicious!  there are so many choices of tacos, burritos (with/without the tortilla) and fajitas...and several for veg heads. it's difficult to pick 2...which is why we must definitely go back!!!!!

SSZwMcsK8u9GjcHvGdZ7kw.text: I was nervous about the location (not the safest looking part of town) but was quickly and pleasantly surprised to find we made the right choice. This restaurant is tiny (maybe 10 tables), so the one waitress would seem like enough, but with the popularity of this place she could have used more help. I orders the vegan burrito and was so happy. Wrapped in a freshly made tortilla, veggies delight with all the right spice.

JdJdyITtc1LRwbEooSQZTg.text: Amazing salsa bar! Loved the cilantro variant...  Excellent tacos, great prices... A gem hidden in Phoenix.

fvk9zzDpMR5jukoIYL2zjQ.text: The place is very compact. Way too small for my taste so it's not very comfortable to dine in. The salsa bar has good salsas but presentation make sit unappealing. Service took really long but all in all the food was ok. The horchata was really good!

kSSVQy4WO7CvL8jmB_xC-Q.text: O... M.. G... This place is out of this world amazing! So many types of salsa.. The chile verde burrito I had was ridiculously yummy!! The reviews are pretty accurate here.

QoOzK20NyiwVLFPq1pt_BA.text: The best salsa bar in life. Delicious vegetarian options, love them.

Njn2PhsBR_wvbhpDKBJ3Zg.text: Wanted to try this place out after driving past it so many times. Good food, and atmosphere. Service was extremely slow. I enjoyed my experience but probably won't be back.

X_ZFtovoOj1q8N9XFsI5XQ.text: i got 3 street tacos. 2 of them were just meh but one of them (i think the pork one) was aaahhhh may shingggg. my boyfriend loved what he ordered as well. the salsa bar is great but it was all too spicy for me hahaha. plus the fact that the prices are so low makes this spot a must-try.

bmKDGvNsubdvtKGiQwY-Ow.text: Smallish, but very interesting tacos and burrito place. Larger portions than I expected - two tacos with rice and beans was plenty. But I forgot to post this when I first wrote it and I can't remember the details. But I really enjoyed it.

hQLCcnUYyjRTBaWeEHfa-Q.text: This place is great.  I really like the food and the atmosphere.  It's a pretty straightforward place that's got a bit of flair tossed in.  So it's a good spot for the foodie and the not so foodie.

EMZ8WXg1_0H09249s_7l5g.text: Delicious food. Service was just too slow. Waited approx. 20mins just to order my drink. Otherwise it was good

sNNOMLooIWldWJvKUWZxmQ.text: This place was such a pleasant surprise. The food was absolutely delicious, the salsa bar was great, and the grapefruit margarita was super refreshing. Will certainly be back!

iBlVarWWPsDW9RZRyjvp1A.text: Definite five. We're visiting PHX and trying to make as many taco stops as we can. This was a total yelp find, and we ordered based on tips.   The horchata was exceptional--light and fruity. The best horchata I've had. Five just for that.   Five for all three tacos we tried: Oaxacan Black Mole, Santa Condesa Mahi Mahi, and Mayan Cochinita Pibil. So good.   And five for a varied and delicious salsa bar, great neighborhood feel, and helpful waitstaff.   If I lived closer if be a regular!

vAcjBIvTA65PSdTkP6ir5Q.text: I saw 450 plus reviews and almost 5 star rating. Well here is another 5 star. The menu is a little overwhelming at first. So I tried the Cabo Shrimp taco. Amazing. Then the smoked marlin taco. More amazing. Then the tinc a chicken taco. OMG. The salsa bar is extensive all made from scratch. I tried six of them and they were all terrific.  The salsa peanut and salsa strawberry really stood out.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Pi2mpsax3g9KJ2TyxXIe4w.text: My coworker and I stopped here for lunch today. The selections on the menu are plentiful and overwhelming. I was impressed with the variety of vegetarian options. I had the gaucho burrito, and my coworker had the Azteca Tinga burrito. The food was amazing! Make sure you get the horchata. It was the best I've ever had. There were strawberries, apples, and nuts in the drink. You will be mad at yourself later if you don't order it. The salsa bar is also ridiculously good, but your burrito will need no condiments.

Z20f2E7yhYgjd9L-iVPBkg.text: I absolutely adore this restaurant and thought it was time I gave a review. The Santisima shrimp tacos are to die for - simple as that. Everything I've ever had here has been flavorful and uniquely delicious, and the homemade salsa bar is the icing on the cake. The only criticism I can offer is that they're a bit on the slow side in terms of bringing out food, particularly for to-go orders if you don't call ahead, but I can't blame them for being busy or successful!

WpA1wc0zRtQ1sAvAzTPTzg.text: The food is good from prior experience.  I love the concept but the service was lacking here.  My friend and our kids were waiting at a table for a bigger one to open up and nobody came to clean the table.  To me that is just rude to offer it to us to wait at and not clean it.  The place is just too small and they should change their policy of not letting you order anything until seated.

JHoYGbBjKYZ1g8paHtJzTQ.text: Great, cozy ambiance. Great service. Complex, unique, and absolutely delicious flavors on everything that I've tried (tacos, quesadilla, salsa, margaritas). The quesadilla is unlike any other I've ever seen or tasted, and absolutely the best. The margaritas are the best I've had in the valley, and the happy hour price for them is amazing.  Their menu is so awesome too, so many things that are unique and not commonly found.

HtPQy6sCzqOnBw96G14wqw.text: Street tacos were good but a little overpriced. Ordered a Yerba Buena tea whatever almost choked on the stem of the lemon. So not so Buena after all. Salsa bar was cool but they were pretty much out of everything. Not the best experience. Place is very aesthetic lots of art. Food and drinks ok.

OMYLZRdiPFJfSXdd-t1LTg.text: My favorite taco shop! The variety of tacos and salsas make it nearly impossible to choose even one favorite meal. The horchata is great- mixed with fresh fruit and spices...different from how I've previously had the drink, but a happy surprise!

mWBd9UV7dlOM_0DkqaYfjQ.text: La Condesa Gourmet Taco Shop   After a long break from Yelp, I knew that eventually I would find myself in a situation where I could no longer hold my tongue, and my need to share would overpower my desire to remain silent. La Condesa GTS created just that situation.   I entered this space wound tighter than a spring ready to pop. Surely there could be no way that it could meet the lofty expectations set forth by my fellow yelper's reviews. But there is something very pure about this place, and as I stepped through the over-sized wood door, I knew this southwest girl was home.   The best way I can describe the atmosphere is Southwestern Minimalist. Monique H was dead on with her praises for the artwork - The Blue Demon (long live Alejandro Munoz Moreno) proudly intermingles with Diego and Frida and the acid treated floors feel natural. I also liked that this is clearly a community effort, with the art work provided by two exceptional Mexican artists (Manuel Gilavalos y Garcia and Ricardo Ramirez) and the furniture/decor provided by Bellas Artes de Mexico. I love that there is already a partnership, holding this little gem up until it can take flight.   The food is clean. The flavors crisp. The portions more than adequate, and the prices less than I would expect to pay for such quality. Most selections can come in the form of a taco, a quesadilla, or a burro, although there are one or two additional options under both the quesadilla and burro menus. Each flavor combination is clearly described and in a handful of situations, there are salsa suggestions outlined on the out of this world salsa bar. The best way I can describe this is to think of a wine pairing with a food that will make flavors pop... in other words, just try it because the sum of the parts is way better than the individual components!   The Mayan Conchita Pibil and the Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken are two of the finest examples I've had of either. Both are mouth wateringly moist and fairly melt. I would suggest the Peanut or Mexican salsa as additional choices for the MCP for the spicy recommended habanera. The guacamole and cilantro salsas were both mild choices and if the mole were not already a mouthful of perfection, might be the additional layer of flavors that bring you to the tipping point. Personally, I found the pickled onions severed atop with some of the Jicama salsa, tossed in for a little crunch, just enough to make my eyes roll back in to my head. I mean seriously, if I could wiggle around naked in this stuff, it would be a really good night! The Aztec Tinga is deceptively simple. Your first bite may seem relatively ordinary, but then start the countdown. Within a few seconds, the flavors hit you like a wall of emotion. Your lips and tongue begin to tingle with the heat of the perfectly balanced peppers. My BIL has tried the Sonoran Carne Asada and was unusually quiet as he made his way through his plate, so I have to assume that was good as well. Finish things up with those out of the world beans, or some of the grilled Mexican Calabacitas and a meal just can't get much better.   So much has already been said about the iconic salsa bar, there really isn't much I can add, except to say, try them all! You will find two or three that send you to your happy place.   The staff was super friendly and more than ready to answer questions or make suggestions. It's an order at the counter and take-a-number kind of place, but you can generally expect several service passes through the dining room.   My only cautions / suggestions would be to grab a takeout menu so you don't have to stand and look at the wall menu with your mouth gaping like a cod fish and be prepared to park along Palm if the street inset parking area is full.   This is my new love. I will definitely be adding this in to the regular rotation. At a dinner plate with drink running you between 8 and 9 dollars (with enough food to make two decent sized meals) this is one indulgence I can fit in to my life with little or no rationalizing. Please take the time to check this place out and support yet another wonderful family owned business. Look around when you come in, because I may be joining Joel L on one of his weekly visits. : )

gMWk69RW8z4FRb73feq2cg.text: So I finally got off my yelpn butt and made it on over to La Condesa for lunch today. I got there around 1045, so I was that creepy taco stalker in the parking lot for about 15 minutes. I ordered teh La Condesa Shrmip Burro and the Oaxacan Mole chicken Taco. As I waited, I was able to check out the 8 or 9 different salsas they had there. Great stuff, I only packed up four. My fave, by a mile, was the creamy cilantro salsa. I wanna bathe in that stuff, like now. My food was ready pretty quick and I was in and out, which is nice.The taco was great, I really liked the flavor in the mole. I decided to add some of the peanut salsa the had, which was pretty good. I do have to say the Burro did fall a bit flat for me. there were tons of ingredients in tehre, but somehow it seemed to be a bit bland without adding any of the salsas to it.  Kiinda like that girl you see at the club, and y ou get home and...well, you get the picture. It was a good burro, but the shrimp were somehow flavorless and the bacon was non-existent. Not that I'm total food snob but when you tell me there's bacon in that mug, I wanna taste me some bacon. Overall my meal was good, I'm going to go back another day and try some other things on the menu, like the dogfish taco. Two thumbs up for the creativity on the food and the salsas, it's hard to stand out in teh Phoenix Taco/Burro scene.

G8agkXlnag4PQRq1s7YGHQ.text: Been twice. Authentic, high quality & great price for what you get. Salsa de Chile de Arbol was the best!! Loved the decor. Orchata tasted fresh, which is a rarity in most Mexican Restaurants.

fVOVJRHRB12fUa32kpqmWw.text: I just bit into the mole street taco.  Delicious.  I've lived in Puebla, Mexico, the birthplace of mole and La Condesa's is the best mole negra I've had outside of Puela.  This little restaurant is a wonderful suprise in this otherwise unassuming part of 16th Street.

ZhVS35_JOcbjt5kttbQdcw.text: My new favorite Mexican joint in the Valley! I'm working my way down the menu, but at this point my favorite tacos are the cochinita pibil (so very, very flavorful), the Oaxacan black mole, and the gaucho (or whatever they call it --- it's the steak taco with the Argentine flavors). The salsa bar, with about 12 selections, is mind blowing. I especially love the pecan salsa --- never had it before coming here but now can't get enough of it.

D-6UHBGbc0So1eiuTTi2rw.text: I had high expectations for La Condesa, but it quickly turned to La Confusion. The three of us went in during the week for a late lunch, salivating at the thought of some tasty tacos. We each ordered a different  taco combo plate, one Aztec Tinga, one Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken,  one Baja Sur Dogfish Shark, and a quesadilla.  After waiting a significant amount of time, the waitress brought out our quesadilla and one combo plate with one Aztec Tinga taco and one Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken taco. Despite going over our order numerous times with our server and another gentlemen, somehow, what we wanted seemed beyond comprehension. They brought out the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark taco combo plate and, after waiting so long and confusion over our order, we gave up and ate what we had. The Azteca Tinga was superb. The Oaxaca Black Mole was good. The Baja Sur Dogfish wasn't really any better than your average fish taco. The rice is a white rice that had decent flavor and the same can be said for the flavor of the refried beans. La Condesa has a great salsa bar, a cozy interior decorated with some great Dia de los Muertos art. The staff was nice and friendly, despite the fact our order remained so elusive. But, after the ordeal with our order and the less than stellar meal, I have to say that La Condesa was an utter disappointment.

ZDWFDPBBG4L6RrEaGpB93Q.text: Super slow service.  Make sure you don't get the ques and get the burros instead.  We waited for over 30 mins for the food and they messed up one order.  That's a long time for mexican food.

DU483r7IOBwkuS_WDl47Ug.text: I'm a salsa fan, and this place must have had 20 fresh salsas just waiting to be enjoyed. I tried most of them and they were excellent. Five stars for the salsas alone. The tacos were great - mole, shrimp, etc..

vK-hDqJL6KvnHwaLPdba_A.text: Love La Condesa!  They have a fantastic salsa bar with delicious, interesting salsas and a range of fantastic tacos (something for everyone).  The environment is cozy, albeit a little small.  The only thing that would make it better is if it were BYOB (they recently started serving alcohol).  Phoenix needs more restaurants like this one!

A4Gj1TleUp2pCnef3hrG1g.text: I met a friend here for lunch and it was both of our first times. When I arrived, I parked next door at a mexican party shop. I am not sure if I was supposed to park there or not. Luckily I didn't get towed. Parking is not so fantastic there and you have to drive slowly down the street so you don't miss it. The restaurant is in a non-descriptive block.  When I walked in, I loved the big wood chairs and tables. The feel was authentic mexican inside. We grew up going to Mexico every family vacation and my parents always liked to go to the non-touristy spots, especially in Cancun downtown. This restaurant reminded me of the Yucatan-inspired restaurant we visited that was right next to the bull fighting arena. So did some of the items on the menu. There was a mini bar for the salsas, and I think they had about 6 out. I wish they put a name card out for them so you knew what they were. I decided to grab a few different ones and see which I liked best. None of them were outstanding, but I did enjoy the unique, but hot strawberry salsa. I  decided to try a corn quesadilla off the menu, looking forward to real mexican queso in my meal. I ordered the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Quesa. It had Oaxaca cheese, roasted pork shoulder with achiote rojo and Mexican herbs. It was delicious, though, it was so filling, I could only eat half.  I was unhappy about the tortilla chips.  They tasted old and stale. I figured they'd be fresh and hot from the fryer since I got there right when they opened.  I need to go back again so I can really get a feel for more of the food and atmosphere. I think this is a review-in progress situation...

3xa4nh-hTdgM3Bq_Fagt5Q.text: i love this place great serviice great food could be cleaner though , its always so busy there isn't tim to clean up lol but other than that it great love coming here :)

BOMYoN_UAmpZY7TajWs1EA.text: Been driving by this place for some time, and finally I decided to try it. I was skeptical at first because the parking isn't very inviting. The restaurant is somewhat small but yet quaint. I was very excited to try all the salsa's but was utterly disappointed when the chips they brought us were hard, stale, and just not suitable for eating. I think they were some of the worst chips I have ever had, I had one.. I requested another basket and they kindly bought another basket of chips but they were the same, Stale, hard and dull. I ordered the Aztec Tinga Taco, and they were very good. The salsa's were all great. The service was great, and the waitress apologized for the chips, and stated that they had ran out and had to buy some etc, etc.. Overall tacos were great for the money, just disappointed with the chips.

oUaSFpVe261HOUabYrbHYQ.text: Almost missed this place, because Yelp still shows no alcohol, and a mexican meal without a beer or margarita is not complete.  Glad I went!  We split the shrimp, veggie and pork tacos.  This is the only place where I would consider ordering a veggie taco over the meat ones.  The grilled vegetables were packed with flavor, and the cheese was perfect.  Add an awesome salsa bar and mexican beer, and you have the perfect meal for before or after the ball game.  I would have given 5 stars, but the pork tacos didn't wow me.  Don't get me wrong, they were good - but just above average.

mW9XcBvYaJKSuRculKr5Ng.text: Excellent and unique!!  The steak quesadilla is huge...a meal in itself.  It was fried to crispy, flaky perfection.  The tacos - el gaucho steak and cochinita pork - were very delicious.  Prices were very reasonable, especially considering the quality of the food.  It's a smaller place but we went at 4 pm before it got crowded.  It's a must for taco lovers.

jr5lGiKsUqjf7HdvcToicw.text: as tony would say....'Grrrrreeeeeat' little taco shop  just a little north of McDowell on 16th st, drive slow or else you'll miss it  the shark taco were awesome, perfect crisp  i did tried the carne asada meat, which could of used a little more favors  the salas bar was pretty cool, lots of chooses  the best part about the meal was the horchata....Mmmmmm  my mouth waters just thinking about it  it's about $4 or $5 for a 32oz horchata....better share it with someone  they put fruits and peacan.....yummmm  i would drive there just for the shark tacos and horchata

oU9mWb2Gz-IlWQjpQjyiaQ.text: Just left this place. I understand they're busy, but that's what every business tries to achieve right? Because they were busy they gave below subpar service. It was a man and woman working and the woman looked miserable and wasn't exactly polite. The guy was trying his best but service suffered. We were told there was a thirty minutes wait originally, but noticed two spots at the bar open. So we asked if we can sit there and she said let me ask. After walking around for ten minutes, not talking with anyone and seeing that we didn't leave she wiped the bar down and we sat. We got our chips and we grabbed our own salsa. After ten minutes we got water. And that's it. No one offered to take our drink order or food order. A single man sat next to us after us, and a four top behind us. The four top was the last to be seated. Got their order taken first. Then the single man. Never us. They looked at us and it's a tiny restaurant so they saw us.
