The woman seemed like she didn't want us to eat there because they had a bad rush. Well don't worry we won't come back again. And all the placards for their awards were for another taco shop.

rSniko49Oy0mLVNeDAae0Q.text: yep...pretty much my new favorite taco shop in the valley...I tend to stay away from beef so carne asada holds no appeal for me...BUT this place has a little bit more of a variety of tacos-I had the Oaxaca black mole chicken shark taco and the mole was the perfect mix-just spicy enough....and the salsa bar made me giddy!  I can't wait to go back. YUM!

XdL7bYRJiRoj2d9sFfbOfQ.text: Okay.... Where was the strawberry salsa? The Guacamole was gone too.  I went here with my sister and was so confused with the menu. It was posted on the wall and it was so hard to read. Why was it posted on the side and not in the front? The place was okay. I ordered the the shrimp tacos and got fish. They messed up my order, but they were busy...oh well. The fish was good though, so I didn't complain. I'll try it again and give it another chance.

1AiQ63NcBTLuj0wzF9LCVQ.text: Love this place! Great ambiance and busy. We've had to wait for a table on occasion but get there in-between times and you'll sit right away.  Cochinita pibil is the first taco we pick and then whatever else strikes the mood, you can't go wrong with the tacos. Go straight to the salsa station and try a variety of flavors, you'll be back for more! Margaritas are big and Micheladas are bigger. The walls have great art too.

ZkXcJEhuYTry6tC-vi39oQ.text: since I cannot show my face in Gallo Blanco ever again, this has now become my fave gourmex establishment where they will trade food for $!  the tacos are good. the salsa is better. the only downfall, is NO ALCOHOL! ...which may be why I am still able to show my face in here...and perhaps why the hairspray is not sticky... NO ALCOHOL!

KicMYbWvIFixBhFPTWwb9Q.text: Amazing food! You must try the horchata and the mole tacos! I could eat here twice a week.

LfNp-dVX8xfQCoWQgPsfHw.text: Chicken tinga burros and grilled zucchini, oh my!  So I've been here a few times and figured it was about time to give it a review.  It's easy to pass by this as it's squeezed in between a closed down car repair shop and a Mexican party shop, complete with pinatas hanging outside.  The only giveaway is the fact that however nice your ride is, there's at least two other vehicles here way classier parked beside you.  You open a large wooden door to a cacaphony of fantastic smells, dizzied by this olfactory blast and pupils adjusting to the darkened lighting, and stumble to find an open table to sit down at.  The furniture is all heavy wood an iron, a signifier of the quality of the place, but the placing is not the best, leading to endless bumping and apologies, the only thing that could be considered a bad point to this place.  If you love salsa, this place hosts a bar with at least ten different types of salsa including ones made from ground pecans, which became addicting after the initial shock of eating salsa made from nuts.  It's hard to find for those coming with quite an appetite I recommend the Santos Plate.  It's a choice of one taco, one burrito and a generous helping of grilled zucchini.    I tend to slather anything I get in salsa to raise the spice level, the chicken tinga in a burrito does not require it at all, by the end of this huge burrito I was starting to feel sweat droplets forming but I couldn't pull away from how delicious it was.  The taco choice recommendation is the pork shoulder cooked in banana leaves, the flavor was amazing and the red vinegared topping added just the perfect amount of sweet and sour.  I'm not a big fan of chocolate but if you are, the mole taco will definitely hit those key notes with you as well.  I've never personally ordered the horchata but one of my co-workers did.  It only comes in one size, LARGE.  Be very thirsty and take your insulin beforehand.  Thirty-two ounces awaits of what was originally horchata, now spiced with cinnamon and nutmeg, ground pecans and strawberry.  Definitely not your average rice drink.  Overall you can't go wrong here, everything is made fresh, hot and delicious.  This place has become a monthly ritual spot, it should be for you as well.

pp9De5thvzsgvw8s9dxtuA.text: This place looks pretty rough from the outside, and is easy to miss. On the inside; however, it's quite comfortable and nice. I'm a fan of Horchata in general, but I have to say La Condesa has the best I've ever had. Also, they managed to change my opinion about Mole with their Mole Chicken taco.   The salsa bar has no equal! Cilantro Salsa, Jicama Salsa, Peanut Salsa, the list goes on an on. You can experience what seems like enless and amazing combinations of flavors.  I'm definitely going back!

sFKLHQz2t4dKgNgleVaVxg.text: My favorite place for tacos in all Phoenix! Try any meat or vegetarian "La Condesa style"... . Everything is fresh and tasty... Service is also friendly and quick...i highly recommend it if you have visitors from out of town.

9w0QTLR3LhUFRkgGeK2oJQ.text: Best part was the chips & different salsas (tried 3 & they were all fresh & delicious). The tacos were another story. Had the carne asada: dry, chewy, and flavorless. This isn't a taco truck, I expect better.

0sl_aehfivoHs7ywIQJFRA.text: I love this place. The Pecan Salsa alone is enough to keep me coming back. The Horchata is divine and the brunch offerings are filling and hearty. We shared a Traditional (Cheese) Queso which was filled to the brim with Oaxaca cheese. It was not one of those flat Quesos you find at most places. It looked more like a turnover with it's flaky tortilla dough. We each had a burro and should have split one as they were enough for a meal by themselves. We noticed their Happy Hour Street Taco deal right after ordering so that will have to wait for another visit. Pecan Salsa oh how I love you.

uyBNa4AUwhtX9ovTbfN0bg.text: I won't beat around the bush. This was hands down the best Mexican food i've had in Phoenix so far. The salsa bar was incredibly varied and interesting, the street tacos at happy hour were delicious, the house margarita was perfectly balanced and the handmade quesadilla destroyed any preconception I had of what a quesadilla was supposed to be. Highly recommended. On top of that, staff was attentive and the atmosphere was unique, and unpretentious.

dx8Btw2xh0Y4pKKaTY5CCw.text: It doesn't look like much from the outside but the food is outstanding, and it's a great place for lunch. It offers free chips and a salsa bar, and the hardest part was limiting myself to just a few salsas. The 3 I had were great. Chicken mole torta (though they don't call it a torta) is rich and tasty, just right. I'm glad they offered a Groupon; I'll be back.

rNa2EgHnR5tjzL6pdBGQAA.text: Just left this "Kitchen Nightmare" on Cinco De Mayo. The moment we walked in we could tell the food would be good. Unfortunately, the vegetarian Quesa was basically a pocket of air and tasted like it was fried in something that fries fish.The place is being run without strategy or organization; staff wanders around aimlessly without purpose, empty tables everywhere, bussed and not, and the bar was full of dirty dishes so no where to sit on CINCO DE MAYO on a Friday night. Meanwhile, patrons were left to wait for up to 45 minutes while the incompetence continued. The manager (ponytail) has no clue what he's doing, seemed to make his staff uncomfortable, and makes customers uncomfortable. The guy is really unprofessional and we couldn't wait to leave.  Not going to return here until changes are made. Also to the manager: stop touching the arm of your waitresses, it's creepy. -Former waitress of 4 years.

6FACrPZL85RYBaEpYOJlcw.text: Mexican style food in Phoenix is both varied and plentiful, so any restaurant that can lure me in to being a regular is doing something right.   La Condesa is a hip little taco shop on 16th street, close enough for me to walk to. The decor is a trendy/traditional mash up that works well. Honestly, the food is good enough that I'd probably buy it from a guy in an alley.   I've sampled several different varieties of meat based products as well as the beans. Everything has been well prepared and fresh. The Mayan Cochinita Pibil in particular is drool-worthy. It's mildly sweet and super tender. Adding a little of the chipotle salsa really sets it off.   Ah, the salsa. There are some truly interesting varieties, from tamarind to pecan. The pecan salsa was a great surprise, with a nice amount of heat. It really sits well with the carne asada.   My only negative comment involves the parking situation. The parking lot is situated in such a way that in order to leave you have to back out onto 16th street. If a big ass SUV with tinted windows happens to park next to you (which always seems to happen) then pulling out can be...invigorating.   La Condesa now has a well earned spot of honor in my restaurant rotation.

EJhvKcupXAqz0-eJsEV9LQ.text: If I happen to be driving on 16th street south of McDowell and want a margarita and some fine Mexican fare, my first choice is Barrio Cafe.  However, when venturing out with my nonalcoholic parents this weekend, I consulted Yelp for some good Mexican food, subscribing to my parents theory that the most authentic Mexican food is in a hole in the wall joint in a scary part of town.  Well, La Condesa is not in an area where I would take an after dark stroll, but it is by no means a hole in the wall!  The restaurant is small, clean, well decorated and most importantly they have a salsa bar filled with amazing salsas, made fresh daily to suit all taste preferences.    My parents and I had various burritos and the bill was under $20 for the 3 of us.  Mom still hauled away quite the selection of "to go" sauces and the waitress was very polite and didn't even call her cheap (which I of course made sure to do)!  To make the evening even more exciting, I accidentally spilled my water on the floor and knocked a painting off the wall when I stood up to leave.   I will return to this restaurant not only because i feel guilty that the restaurant lost revenue by us dining there, both through extra takeout and damage, but the food was also excellent!

gypWlvSrQnBdqOxuCB2Hvw.text: A hole in the wall but amazing quesadilla!!! The tacos were alright, the star of this restaurant would definitely have to be the quesadilla, you can't go here and not order one or two or THREE!! Lol the bread/crust/dough if the quesadilla is amazing! The salsa bar for the nachos they provide while you wait for your food is fun and there are some good selections, esp the cilantro one and I don't even like cilantro.

HGSreSUFp5lgnzk3N6TmlQ.text: Love the idea of a salsa bar.  The three I had  were all good.   The Norteno burrito with red chillies, beans and pork was best burrito I have ever eaten.

T6WU8PuflNcRmwhtYAfqFQ.text: I love the artwork.  Its a tiny little restaurant crammed with a bunch of little tables and chairs.  You go up to order at the counter, there's a salsa bar in the corner with a LOT of different salsas (most are not that great).  They do bring you the food and you do get a basket of chips on the house.  The tacos are pretty heft - about 3 bucks each.  They are "Gourmet tacos" after all..    All in all, its kind of uncomfortable service/restaurant wise (self serve) but the tacos are very good and you do get chips and a variety of salsas.  Not the most friendly staff and the cost is kind of high for a place like this but its pretty dang good.  Get it to go if you don't mind packing a bunch of salsa cups.

kgPmgczj_BJbFP6L95r3UA.text: Gourmet tacos!  Try any two gourmet tacos you will not be disappointed. These tacos aren't your regular small street tacos these are some serious tacos. I tried the la santisma taco with arrachera carne and the shark taco. Both were incredible. Really like the shark taco with its sauce.  And the santisma taco was right on. Real Mexican sodas with real sugar straight from the glass bottle. And don't forget the salsa bar. Seriously, so many salsas to choose from. Try them all, I did and simply went back for those I liked, no loved!  Oh. Did I forget even the rice and beans were good and I only know this because they mistakenly added them to my plate, the chef was being generous the waiter said. Thank you I said!  These are definitely better the average rice and beans.

RJEEM-JHk2uHTBYTsZPo9w.text: The fresh salsa bar is the featured attraction.  20 - 30 types daily with differences nearly every day.  The food is great-to-fantastic.  Decor is nice and the space is small and tight.  Don't expect table service - go to the counter, order and pay.  They will bring you your food.  If you are looking for white linen napkin experience, go to The Barrio.  If you want some of the best salsa and tacos in town - come here.

dDBGJTQMGnhOhnOlpEmz1A.text: Mole' taco was a little bit on the chocolatey side... Cochintia pibIL was not spicy as usual  and Al pAstor was on point.  Salsa bar was great!  Great service!!  Reasonably priced!

WD6o-OotrcINHIb9NIyACQ.text: Just ate lunch here after the Home and Garden Show....great place! The food is fresh and delicious and the salsa bar was delightful! My husband's margarita came with slices of fresh fruit which added a yummy dimension. The decor is pleasing to the eye. The place is small, but the wait was short. Even though we live in the East Valley, we will definitely be coming back soon!

jO12eRZ9p_CQ-lAFsCtt1g.text: The food is 5 +++ Stars! Completely unique and so flavorful. I can't say enough about the Quesa's (except I really hope they are fat free...hehe) Their tacos are even great after a 15 min car ride back to my home. Everything I have tried has been very tasty!   The Salsa's are 5++++ Stars! The cilantro cream, holy moly can I have a gallon to put on anything and everything...I really  think it will make everything taste amazing!  Over all La Condesa is a great Gourmet Taco shop and the quality of the food definitely  puts the Gourmet in the name. I love using La Condesa as take home food for out of town guest, they are always impressed!  What knocks my review down a star, difficulty parking and the lack of AC in the summer. I much prefer to get it to go!

7nlqXG-hKw_P7-4WA9h3vA.text: Visited here today for lunch for the first time. I was pretty excited about a salsa bar since I've never been to one and my last meal would definitely include chips and salsa. The rave reviews on Yelp won me over so I decided to recommend this place to a friend so we could meet up for lunch.  Luckily I snagged a spot right out front at 1pm but I'm not sure where the additional parking was? Upon entering, the place has some cute decor but it was a little startling to walk in and see that it's pretty small inside and it was busy. With no hostest stand, I immediately had that, 'deer in headlights look' about what to do and where to go but I was recognized when I walked in within a few seconds and luckily there was a table for two open. While I was recognized and that was a relief, I wasn't greeted per say but was just asked if there would only be one for lunch. I said I was waiting for a friend so luckily they sat me without her being there. The water came around and gave me small plastic Solo cup full for water and menus. I've never seen solo cups like this in a restaurant? Maybe it's for the lunch crowd? I noticed all the other tables had larger drinks, also in plastic cups, so maybe it was just for your drinks to go?  Anyway, my friend arrived a few minutes later and after we got caught up on our week and looked over the menu, I had to flag down our waiter to order. I attempted to order the grapefruit margarita that I had heard rave reviews about but the waiter didn't understand 'Grapefruit Margarita' and offered some fruity one with melon and something else. When I confirmed that it didn't have grapefruit and he offered another one, again without grapefruit, I opted just to forget it and drink the water. I figured I would fill up on chips and salsa so I went with two al la cart tacos. My friend ordered a mahi mahi bowl. I was pretty impressed with their chips, not overly thick like some places and pretty light and the the 6-7 salsas we tried were mostly good. I wasn't aware there was a need for peanut salsa? It was definitely different but not something I needed to try twice. My favorites were the creamy white one (can't remember the name) and the strawberry salsa one. You go help yourself to the salsa bar once they bring the chips but it looked like you had to pay extra for an extra bowl of chips since they were on their special of the day board for $2. Also, the salsa bar had small dipping cups to eat the salsa. They're about the size of the to-go dressing cups you get in other restaurants but not quite as deep. Again, they were plastic so it kinda took away from the overall feel of the meal. I'm all for convenience and I know this probably cuts down on the customers filling up larger containers and wasting salsa...and doing dishes...but I would think there has to be a more environmentally and more aesthetic way to do this? Granted, this is no fancy Mexican place but they seemed to put effort in the decor so maybe that's where they spent all their money on rather than real dishes? It definitely did discourage me from going back for seconds though so maybe that was their goal?  Our food came and both my tacos were really good. The presentation was nice, no plastic there! The tortillas were fresh and all ingredients seemed quality. My friend said her dish was really good and she got a really big portion.   We enjoyed our meal but our waiter never returned. A young kid, maybe 8 or 10, came over and asked to take our plates and he asked if there was anything else we needed. I requested the bill thinking he would tell our waiter that we were ready for the check. I'm guessing this is a family owned place so I understand everyone pitching in but the kid then delivered our check and then took our credit cards to pay for the bill! Our waiter was standing back at the register, almost watching over him though, but I still wasn't overly eager about handing over my card to such a young kid. He was at least faster than our waiter though so I guess it was okay.  I really don't mean to harp on this place because the food was good. Just a few more things done differently and I could see this being a go-to spot for me. For now, it doesn't top my list of places I have to come back to soon.

xB70mj3UhCN958iJU_0C5A.text: If this is ur first time, order the La Santisima Specialty tacos with carne asada. You're welcome. That salsa bar though....

HouWKqYAFzaFgs9At6D6YQ.text: The best horchata and salsa bar ever!! When you come here, you have to try the horchata, unique and oh so tasty. Also, I'm a salsa lover, I love to make it, I love to indulge in it, salsa is my middle name.  So when I come here, its always the best part of the meal. My favorite is the pecan salsa, so creamy and not what you would expect a pecan salsa to taste like.  The burritos are delicious as well and I've had the tacos too, everything is so eye appealing as well as tasty! I wish the restaurant was a bit roomier, but it stays consistent in the number of people coming in and doesn't get overcrowded. I wouldn't recommend to big parties. But overall I love this place and recommend you try it out.

WskJlw98Dz5FzpoBrMmNcw.text: The food is simply AMAZING. Some of the best pastor and chicken mole I've tasted. The margaritas as so good that its all I've ever had to drink there lol. I've heard the horchata is good. The place is small and the place is super small but that still won't stop me from going. I wish the staff members were more friendly or even attempted to greet you. When they see you they kind of look away and its awkward. The service is not fast at all, and you will be lucky if you get a full sentence out of the waiters, especially the lady. They are lucky the food is literally AMAZING!

9ETDst3oaMQ0yeySVnNVeA.text: We waited way too long to check this place out!  I had the Baja Shrimp taco and Fish Taco with rice and beans..... all delicious!   Wifey got the Maztalan taco and we enjoyed sampling almost everything the salsa bar...something for everyone. Will be back soon to try some more!

pGHKv1xdkRD1NOT4AHMjRQ.text: Gourmet Tacos at it's best!  The lovely lady behind the counter was the owner that served us. My friend John and I decided to check this out this evening, and all I can say is it's the bomb! I ordered the deep-fried shrimp quesadilla with ooey-gooey cheese! ( I know it sounds unhealthy, but I had to have it) It was enormous and succulent!   John and I both had the pecan horchata, and it did not disappoint.  We went there around 8:00 pm when it's slow, so our service was stellar. They have a lot of great sounding items on their menu, so I am looking forward to returning.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. John and I had the Pecan Horchata. Yum!

3VdVZUgVzuzImGoIFO_zWQ.text: If I lived in Phx I would eat here every day. I am vegan, my boyfriend is not. We both agreed the food is the best Mexican fare we have ever had. My mouth is watering just remembering our meal.

tM50O5Ctn-dr5L8yYu28pA.text: Really good tacos. The Cabo Shrimp tacos are excellent and very authentic. They are sooo similar to the tacos we loved in Cabo!   I'd highly recommend this place for great food cheap.

2vfoF5OpVFeGFFYo_k8r5g.text: LOVE LOVE LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE this place.  I have found my new place that I will go to for tacos over all else now.   So my mind was way bigger than my tummy but here is what I ordered:  1. Aztec Tinga Taco- Spicy yummy and honestly one of my favorite Mexican dishes so this was one of my top fav's  2. Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco- This is how I found this place and it was a good taco but didn't stand with my other tacos in taste.  3. Arrachera steak Taco-  This was the first I ate and it was awesome the steak was nice and charred and the flavor was just killer.  4. Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Taco-  Woooooow this one was awesome packed full of flavor and was very moist.  This was another one of my fav's.  5. Gaucho Taco-  This was my total favorite.  It was a carne asada steak taco with avocado and Argentinian Chimicurri sauce on it.  Oh man sooooo yummy I am drooling just thinking about it right now.    Last I had the Horchata which had a interesting twist with fresh fruit and pecans in it.  Honestly it was one of the best Horchata's I've ever had.    On top of all this they have an AMAZING salsa bar with about 15 different salsas for all palates.    If you've never gone take my advice and go and thank me later.  I can't wait to go back probably won't make it past tomorrow.  :)

jLlF767tNh0lmpCh1hRNPQ.text: Tacos are yum! Went a couple of times and ordered between shark, beer battered shrimp and white fish. Each bite... never disappointed. My daughter ordered the a pork burro that had pinnapple.... wow! Service is slow at times but the food and drinks more than make up for it. Definitely would visit again and wait longer if needed.

PkSvbYK0odhlFjmrC1dkfA.text: The food gets a solid five. Service a 3-3 1/2. Service wasn't bad, it was just busier than I think they expected. It's small, and a bit crowded, but worth it.  This was my second visit. This time I had the mole quesa.  OH MY GOODNESS! Amazing.  It was so big I had to take half home.   The salsa are great. Love the creamy cilantro salsa and the strawberry salsa. Try the guacamole with mangoes.

Io2Rxwf86MNnyih6tL1QfQ.text: Soo good. The salsa bar is awesome; I've never seen flavors like pecan or peanut before. The horchata is delicious, comes with the lots of fruit inside. The quesas are good if you have a big appetite and like a ton of cheese. Also very tasty tacos.

A9CnM6_zcSQBTp2E8w-D6g.text: La Santisima has a great variety of Mexican foods from many different regions of mexico, with a depth and richness of flavor that is absolutely amazing. Their happy hour is extraordinarily reasonable, but one of my favorite things is the salsa bar. Around 20 salsas with a variety of flavors and ingredients, from a pecan salsa, to old standbys like pico de gallo. I would highly recommend this restaurant to ANYONE, and have brought folks visiting from out of town. Everyone agrees, this is the best of the best.  P.S. The place is definitely cozy. I would recommend coming in during happy hours if you are trying to avoid a crowd.

Ajs_I9waa9evIGY-hr4-Ew.text: Great little hole in the wall place. Be aware it is tiny, and there will likely be a waiting list. Totally worth the wait. Try the quesadillas or Burritos. Margarita was a bit too sweet, but otherwise a great little place. Very very affordable.

o1FoWQX-7sHc9s8nBT2i8g.text: Well we went back just to check and, sure enough, this is still the best mexican food we've ever had.  My taco with pork cooked in a banana leaf was uh-mA-zing.  And the margarita was too.  I think I just gained five pounds.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Don&#39;t be fooled by the sketchy exterior.  Go on in.

HAyJAgcQFAlnxVpNbHk-zA.text: Good food best horchatas. Staff is good. I think the food became a bit greasier over the years. I would still go, but a little on  the greasy side for me.

8gUrbRVvYr6nU2MQAYRC6Q.text: Popped in here over the Labor Day weekend after reading the Yelp Reviews.  One word....WOW!  The tortilla chips were fresh and not soaked in grease, the 20+ salsa's were fresh and flavorful, the burritos and street tacos were some of the best we ever had.  To top it off, our server was wonderful.  It's a small place with 20 or so tables, if their busy I urge you to wait it out.  They turn the tables quickly and it will be with the wait!

SbPFgan22z_dmHQ-ZMdX_A.text: Not sure if we went to this one or the other one, but let's just say it' s tiny and rustic on the inside.  We got lucky with parking.  The margs were good, not strong enough, but after 2 I was fine.  The salsa bar was very very good, I wish the containers to hold the salsa were bigger. The lighting is kind of poor, but that adds to the charm.  I had conchinita pibil quesadilla, which I really loved.  My boyfriend had a chicken mole taco and an al pastor taco, which he only liked, not loved.  We would never have found this place if it hadn't been for the locals, so we were grateful.  I would go back, my boyfriend would too, but would order something else.

GC54UumiXprR0sIGLc0F5w.text: Awesome street tacos. Best in phoenix and cheap! The place is small but the service and food is amazing. This is my new favorite place for tacos.

puBtsdKB7K9IjulJyg4oKw.text: I'll start by saying that the food here is usually great. The pacific white fish taco is perfect. The salsa bar is just alright. My real complaint here is the service. Every time I walk in the servers all just ignore me until I actually say something like "uh hi I'm here to eat food" it's very awkward and makes you feel unwelcome. I'm an industry person and I really can't imagine letting a table sit for that long without at least checking on them. Bad vibes.

KKE11wl12i_vDmLM5InwjA.text: It's a good little place with a nice authentic vibe. Certainly plenty of salsa options - ranging from acceptable to pretty good, but you can't argue with the variety.  I thought the roasted pork shoulder taco was flavorful and delicious. Found the black mole chicken taco to be a bit too bitter, but the meat was tender and good. Enough salsa verde on top got the job done.  $2 negra modelo on Sunday was a bonus.  Certainly worth eating. Especially for $10.

Pvc1Rp4LQ7Tfj0wWGOaNFw.text: Came in at around 4PM on a Saturday, parking was terrible but we assumed it had to be good since the parking lot was packed. Walked in and the whole front room was packed with patrons so we waited patiently to be seated. The artwork was phenomenal and the full bar was inviting, but after five minutes of not being acknowledged in any way, we were starting to lose patience. Finally we were seated in the back room, which is much larger and at the time nearly empty except for two groups of 5 people.  We both ordered three tacos each, which were way pricier than we were expecting, they range between 3.99 and 5.50 each or you can do a mix and match plate. Many of their options are seafood so that limited us a bit since we aren't fans, though if you like seafood maybe you'll have better luck than we did!  The salsa bar is extensive so we were excited, we loaded up 12 mini condiment cups, filling them with everything from clearly pico to some more mysterious salsas. Tried out a few on the chips as we waited for our food and found that none of them were spicy in any way, the best was the Pico and another similar to it.   Finally our tacos arrived and we dug in. Well we tried to. Instead we each ate about half of each taco (except for the barbiccoa which both of us got, I ate both of them after he discovered he hated it). Each taco ranged from bad to almost inedible. Each taco was miniscule, barely the size of my hand and barely filled except for the lack luster and down right gross tasting garnish. The meat quality on the other habd was great, tasteless but great quality so there was room for it to be delicious, they just failed that goal. In the end the only tacos I could suggest were the barbiccoa, which I found good enough to even crave again but for the price and how lacking everything else was, I can guarantee we will not be returning.  I would suggest this place to anyone with family or friends who like a great setting and casual drinks with some small bites, especially if they're not generally fans of Mexican food. The place is inviting and interesting with plenty of tasteless options to explore.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. An assortment of let down

GlCS_djfSpIXRA-3qHYUHg.text: If I could leave zero stars I would. It literally took us almost a whole to get our order taken. At 5:30 finally after we were asked what we wanted to start with, the restaurant ran out of guacamole, which I just don't understand. I don't even know who our server was because One girl helped us but the whole time she did it she rolled her eyes and complained how she wasn't supposed to be our server. Very poor service very poor management. She did apologize at the end for the poor service but I really think that we could've at least been accommodated with a free drink or a free dessert. We were so excited when we saw that guy from the Food Network came here, but we left so disappointed.

Qc6bswK8yPHRQs0Gdxy-dQ.text: My husband and I are visiting from Los Angeles, saw the reviews and decided to give this place a try. IM SO GLAD WE DID! Very rarely do we try a new place and EVERYTHING we ordered came out spectacularly. I had the Mamacita Margarita, we split the Big Sur Shark taco, shrimp tacos, and pork shoulder with poblano. Did I mention all the salsas at the salsa bar were well spiced and delicious? I love how friendly and attentive the server was, and the overall atmosphere was relaxed and bright.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gZRv_F4K-UiTKQykKJnFlw.text: 5 stars+ for queso fundido con chorizo, service from waitress, and salsa bar. 4 stars for Taco El Gaucho. 3 stars for decor and price to value ratio. No stars for lack of bar to sit as a solo traveler.

quy-SaqtRTOG-lNfA3hX7w.text: My friend and I have been here a few times but it's our most recent visit that truly inspired me to write a review. I know most of us look only at the tacos and ignore everything else on the menu. Big mistake!! My friend decided to order the al pastor quesa while I decided to stick to tacos. Their vegetarian taco section caught my eye and I ordered the cauliflower al pastor. I also ordered their potato and chorizo taco which I absolutely love.   Their extensive salsa bar is always a delight. Although, most of their sauces tend to skew spicy. It works for me, so no complaints there. Our food arrived and the chorizo taco was phenomenal, as I expected. But the real winner that evening was the quesa. Bless the lord! This is one of the best things I have ever tasted at a Mexican restaurant. The meat was incredibly flavorful with an opulence of cheese (again, not complaining). The crust itself was beautifully flaky and crisp. I have had dreams about this quesa after that evening. If you ever visit this restaurant, consider skipping the tacos (which are actually pretty great) and order the quesa. You will not regret it. I feel I should quickly mention the cauliflower "al pastor". This was one the saddest things of the evening. Huge chunks of barely cooked cauliflower thrown on a taco with some sauce. Meh! The quesa, however, outdid all my expectations. So I'm still giving this 5 stars. I will absolutely return!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cauliflower al pastor and chorizo with potato tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al pastor quesa

OCQZ73TgsMXf9UpL3de8vA.text: I'm so disappointed and sad.  Saw this place on Check Please and saw that the Yelp! reviews were raving, but I can't give a great review.   1.  Service - poor.  Had to ask for a menu, way too long of a wait time for every.thing., did not get attention I expected, such as a water refill..., had to ask about my food (which conveniently "just finished", but it had been sitting based on the cool temperature of the food).  Literally there for over an hour on 1 plate order.    2.  Food - mediocre.  The rice was good.  The tacos were nothing special.  The salsa bar is impressive, especially the pecan salsa, but unfortunately there is only so much salsa and chips you can eat.  Plate was less than $10, but I wanted gourmet tacos.  3.  Atmosphere - not enough room.  Someone actually took my tot's seat when we went to the bathroom...?  I'd like to assume this just wasn't my day...

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos were acceptable if you&#39;re hungry.

VpI34om--yTC9qPR8E8AIg.text: Just took my family there.....waited quite a while to be seated.....then when seated they brought chips,  water and menus...but then we ceased to exist....after 30 minutes with no one taking drink or food orders we left. So bummed as i had out of town guests that I wanted to have experience my usually favorite restaurant... .will not go back

s5Poc8gT19X8qkVXse-Tew.text: I loved the art as soon as we walked in, then the salsa bar was another bonus before the meal even started. I really enjoyed looking through the menu, a bit more nontraditional than I have seen elsewhere. I ended up with the Guisado Tenoch Burro because I wanted to try the cactus, and the Horchata was recommended as well. Overall everything was very good and reasonably priced, I would definitely come back and try more of what they have to offer!

_OHA5MsSlmtpiQFMWk-Mvg.text: This is probably the best Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. Weird thing about Phoenix is all of our best Mexican restaurants are not very aesthetically pleasing, it's almost like it's a requirement. But, don't let the looks fool you, the place serves some amazing Mexican food. Definitely has some central Mexico influences with things like Mole and vampiros, but I usually stick to the tacos. The house special taco is one of the best tacos I have ever had. They have mixes of modern and traditional Mexican dishes and the margaritas are good, however they could do with some more beer options. Come for the food and you won't be disappointed.

1fm_k1CxU8V-IpHn_6d5yg.text: I got the lunch special. The food was very good but I saw the chef use his bare hands while making my dish. Kind of gross!

BkvLH9S6xm2ludo9WS6X2w.text: Top notch salsa bar with super friendly service. The pecan salsa was my favorite! Pricier than many other Mexican places out there but what you get here is quality. Would definitely come back again next time I'm in town!

MCjFiCwju1wz5gGz4STQNw.text: We were downtown for a show so we decided we'd give this place a try. Our waitress was AMAZING. Had a wonderful personality and was very knowledgeable about their menu. Both myself and my husband ordered their gourmet tacos. Their rice and beans are amazing. My favorite taco was their beef barbacoa. We will definitely be back to try more tacos.

hoVhT9Yiirp49IvSStzbMw.text: I VERY rarely give 5 stars flat out...but the Torta that I had today for lunch blew my mind, so I had to give 5 stars. Honestly this place is amazing and I'm already craving more.  I ordered the Mayan cochinita pibil Torta (which they call something else) it came with just pickled red onions on top and rice and beans on the side. I was initially worried that I would be too dry or boring because it was so plain, but one bite and I was hooked. That slow roasted pork was to die for. I basically inhaled the entire sandwich.  My family also ordered some tacos and those were incredible as well. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the beans, they were just a little too watery for my taste but they were still good.   Highly recommend for satisfying cravable Mexican food fix.

_nzCszWmVJ5caCAB0ZPDpg.text: Great food great art fair service ... The service could be better The short little guy up front has a terrible attitude. Food is great the staff needs to Up There GAME !!!

hOSvATLnuK1-IRKLS-2kwA.text: I was really excited the moment I saw the salsa bar. I love trying lots of options. Started with chips, salsa, and some guacamole. I particularly enjoyed the Salsa Chipotle. I had three different gourmet tacos: Sonoran Carne, Mayan Cochinita Pibil, and another that was soaked in a sauce and then toasted. They were all fabulous.

MnRSYWidJXjLnMoBUgm34A.text: Great salsa bar, fish burrito (La Santisima) and pollo negro mole. Haven't had a bad meal here (and I can walk from my home - and do often).

LGaVgBWkeGxB6vHsukpjQg.text: If you're Mexican do not come here. It smells. We had the hostess tell us multiple times are server was coming then she would end up helping us. The waters are not natural. The meat was probably microwaved or re-heated. Did I say it smells? The complimentary waters are faucet water.  Update: this the next day. I had to leave work early today. I have the stomach flu. My little cousin was crying yesterday his stomach was killing him and he had never felt such pain.

UJSF6kNF69JaeH0REUHZ4g.text: The tacos here are by far the best--and that's coming from Lady who loves within distance of Charlie's tacos.

jD1IrTlkJ_90tlw3YLl-2A.text: In love with the decor and ambiance. The food was amazing.... gourmet tacos  dumbs up!  The michelada a were to die for..... great customer service, only downfall is the waiting. It's so packed all the time the waiting is for ever long. Don't get there super hungry, you'll starved.

DBIx2PKCdOmW97mY-8RApQ.text: Tried the tacos. Take the mix and match. You will not be disappointed. The ambience is perfect for a casual date or family gathering alike.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pictures or paintings. Gorgeous decor

UQojjSbVN2E02VSr6g_nEA.text: The food is as authentic as it gets. The specialty tacos were amazing. The salsa bar was out of this world. Loved the peanut salsa

VUcS4vXalZ0oxOr21JaxvQ.text: We wanted to grab lunch before heading to the airport, and La Santisima was the perfect place. The salsa bar provided many tasty options to add to our already delicious lunch. Highly recommend!

wh6zK03GIr4Qq5P8mwI07w.text: Nice, small restaurant and good music as well.  I showed up on Tuesday around 4:00 PM.  Only 3 tables occupied, had to wait for service for at least 5 minutes and of course, when dining alone, 5 min seems like 10.   I ordered the 3 street taco plate with chicken asado, al pastor and the Mexico City Taco (can't remember the name).  They were tasty, but truly uneventful.  Ive had better flavor from a roach coach and I am a street taco lover!!!  The chips were good and the salsa bar had a wide range of salsas to choose from and all were delicious and tried 6 of them.  On a side note, the chair was old and ripped my pants!!!  Oh well, shit happens.  All in all, it was good, not great.  I would have hoped for more timely, enthusiastic greeting.  I rate it as "average"

57QksC4I2eciUtR8JIJHcA.text: La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop is my favorite place in Phoenix to get fish tacos and Mexican seafood.  The ingredients are really fresh, and everything tastes yummy.  Service can be a bit slow and seating is limited.  So, I recommend calling and placing to-go orders.  If you try to eat inside the restaurant during peak hours, prepare to wait 30 minutes.  I usually get the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Tacos, but I also like the  Cabo Shrimp Tacos.  My boyfriend prefers beef, pork, and chicken dishes.  So, he usually gets the Sonoran Carne Asada Tacos or the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Tacos.  He also likes the Aztec Tinga Tacos.

b-fYGgpG8XQNRGeiMT8Ndg.text: This place is so busy it's ridiculous. I was willing to give it a try and understand that it was during lunch time but the bad experiences kept coming. Busy time means no chips unless you ask for it. One of the bartenders, who I think was the owner was, running around opening doors and wiping the sweat off his head and still had time to make a margarita without washing his hands and grabbing the straw right from where the guest was going to put his lips on. Good thing it wasn't my margarita... While I'm waiting I go to the restroom which was poorly cleaned. Pee... everywhere which again the person before me could of been the one to do it but get this... no hand soap. I hope the employees were washing their hands after using the restroom. So, finally get my food which looks good until I look at the basket which was holding the food and see there is dried gunk from whoever used it before me. Beans. Rice. Salsa. It was all dried on there. I took my wrapper out of the basket and set it aside. Already grossed out by the dirtiness I decided I was never coming back. As soon as I got home after my 20 minute drive I immediately began feeling sick... I wonder why. I really don't even wanna think how much germs I came in contact with.

p2mvD3keu3yqa-8IHBtAIw.text: Was driving by this restaurant and saw loads of cars so I figured it must be good and it was. The horchata was the best I've ever had (and I lived in Austin and ordered it frequently). It had a spoonful of sweetened strawberries in the bottom and loads of cinnamon on the top. Yum!  The chips were basic, but the salsa bar was a great surprise with some very unusual offerings (e.g. a creamy cilantro salsa, a pecan salsa, a jicama salsa). The burro was loaded w rice and chicken mole. The mole sauce was rich and complex, but I wish there had been more in the burro. As a final note, at lunch, you order at the counter and the line can be slow. So don't find a table and peruse the menu (like I did) or you might look up and find that the short line is now VERY long!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken mole burro. Very tasty. Could have used a bit more mole sauce.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fabulous horchata. Touted as a family recipe. Makes me wish I was part of that family!!

aedXRs3RJiFL6hp84d81Mg.text: There's nothing I can say that hasn't already been said about the GEM of joint... without a doubt my go-to for great Mexican food!!!  Small and quaint with an awesome salsa bar and delish food!

-RkOEhmtWhoXRiXx7Hm9Jg.text: La Santisima is delightful from start to finish They have a buffet of salsas available from guacamole to peanut to strawberry to....kimchi salsa?! It was heaven.   Highly recommend the quesadillas. They are deep fried to a perfection. The rice/beans that come with the tacos are out of this world and the horchata is also incredible--and strawberry infused!

7minBXCLZHntfQbAkEWlBQ.text: Delicious Food, great service, and amazing Salsa Bar.   Only complaint is this place is always crowded.  It's hard to get in and out on your lunch break.

bc6TxwzZgaW4AGeKvwQ-0Q.text: This place definitely has a unique concept (Santisima) which I didn't care for, the vibe was a lil dark for my taste. But overall the food I didn't love the meat wasn't that great either and the service was ok could have been a lot better.

F2cjzebnlClftcmAicqj1Q.text: I love the pecan salsa !  Great tacos and margaritas as well.

AXP9dD4o5FVI79tmucGnNA.text: AVOID this place is dirty and has a bathroom smell as soon as you walk in... waited to be seated and the server said wait a minute and never approached. Waited 10 minutes- looked at the food and said forget it. Not up to par with the restaurants from Los Angeles at all. If I could give a negative start review I would.

tgbbv4yWQ6HLJfREJVUQ9A.text: This is the first time I've been to this location (went to the Glendale one twice) and they are both 5/5! Haven't had anything bad from either location. Street tacos were great (chicken was super tender and could be cut with a fork) and the mole had the right combination of smoky and chocolately taste. Salsa bar is also one of the best I've ever seen - my personal favorite is the pecan salsa. The cilantro salsa is a close second, which is funny because I normally HATE the taste of fresh cilantro. I've also ordered the El Gaucho queso, which is basically like a big Mexican calzone. Steak was prepared well and tender and the outside shell was perfectly crisp on the outside.   As good as the food is, I have to say the horchata was my favorite item. It's a little different from your normal horchata as it contains walnuts, strawberries, and a healthy dollop of cinnamon on top. It seemed strange at first, but it works!!   Prices were very reasonable too (4 street tacos, steak queso, and a horchata all for $24). The restaurant is small and unassuming, and is the kind of place you would easily miss if you weren't looking for it. Also, it's pretty small and cramped in there, but when the food and drinks are this good, who's noticing that? Sure, this place may not be the most authentic Mexican restaurant (mostly gringoes up in here) but it is still one of my favorite restaurants in the area since moving to Arizona two months ago!

gr6_Bb-vMpYa5kmLWRKuwQ.text: I've been here a few times. Its small and always crowded when I come. Food takes longer than usual to come out but it's worth the wait. They have an awesome salsa bar but if you get there at the end of the night you might find it empty, which is disappointing. Don't come here if you're expecting street taco prices because they are far from that. Carne asada tacos are good but not worth it for me.  Anyways I go here for their AWESOME fish and shrimp tacos. They are pretty big and are delicious. Their food stays pretty consistent in taste. One of my favorites in town that I have found so far (my quest for good tacos never ends).

k6HlzEUAmUtipWeuCSq9Pg.text: Amazing salsa bar, I have still yet to try all the salsas but I'm working on it. The food is good, environment is cozy. Not some sort of franchised restaurant which is a plus (2 locations tho), overall good place though.

dUiSc8WzJWtc-5Lbs78jnA.text: Best Mexican in Phoenix hands down. Incredible food, horchata is insane. Oh man, love this place.

GxMcg0oi6jsCM9zQ1LHJ0g.text: What can you say about a place that has already seen the stamp of approval from Guy Fieri? Well, the positives are quite clear, good food at low prices and an endless salsa bar that pushes boundaries with creations like strawberry salsa. But with this success the whole-in-the-wall charm has been lost. My visit became a transactional act due to poor customer service by the sole waitress attending to all the tables in the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

H6oUmW8bO_zAoUP5ueCS2A.text: I really wanted this place to be good, the reviews certainly make you think its going to be, we went here twice, the first time our food was under whelming and service was ok and the atmosphere was fun.  We always try and give a place two tries before never going back or writing a so so review, so visit two was actually worse than the first visit. Tried various street tacos, no seasoning, meats dried out, and service was so so.  This will not be a place we try a third time, there are to many other great places in Phx.  I wish them luck, I hope it was just two bad days, and we happened to show up both times.

TDtRiHw_mb9_b8iMk3q_UQ.text: I had an extremely hard time deciding whether to rate this restaurant three or four stars. It is a solid 3.5 stars, but I decided to raise it due to the free salsa bar and authentic food.  The restaurant is a small location with an all-you can eat salsa bar with various flavours such as cilantro salsa, peanut salsa, tomatillo salsa, and strawberry salsa just to name a few from the selection. The meal also came with a free bowl of tortilla chips, but extra bowls cost more. The tortilla chips were a little thin for me, but definitely tasted authentic.  I ordered the taco plate with two different tacos. When ordering it was a bit difficult to understand what the waiter was saying, but contrary to the menu, he said that you can have two different tacos on the menu instead of one type on the taco plate for $8.99. In the end I paid more than the $8.99 for my taco plate in the end.  I got to taste three different tacos and a part of a burrito after sharing with some other people eating with me. My wild white fish taco was extremely crunchy, but disappointing due to the fish ultimately being too big for the corn wraps. The traditional Mexican taco was very spicy, and the meat was fairly flavourful. The best taco was the pork shoulder taco which was moist and tasted great. I also tried all of the tacos with the spicy guacamole provided at the salsa bar for an added kick. The pork burrito used a flour tortilla and was relatively bland aside from the pineapple salsa which was a refreshing sweet flavour.  Overall it was a nice portion, but was a little expensive. The food is definitely authentic and provided a delicious taco.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco plate with a wild white fish taco, Mexico traditional taco, beans, and rice.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa Bar

TJpOGi1PYsUFnG_D4xKVmQ.text: The food here is fantastic! The tacos were fantastic! The salsa was great too. It is a very nice hole in the wall with fab food.   Special mention goes to the steak verde taco-phenomenal!   As stated before the service is ok, the neighborhood is rough but the food makes up for it. I'm just not sure id come here after dark.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak verde and carnitas tacos-delicious

7tqAq0lgplPCH3nAJQVPEw.text: Tip: When it says 3.99 a la carte, it's actually only 1 taco. Only the taco plate has 2 tacos. We made that mistake and our bill ended up tripling in price.   On a brighter note, the horchata was fantastic! This is the first time I've seen horchata filled with so much fruit and it was such a large size, perfect for sharing. We ordered the slow cooked pork taco and I thought it was a little too messy. I enjoyed the fish tacos the most, light and crispy.  Also loved the extensive salsa bar and the fact there is cilantro salsa!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita

GkdHUsaZfO3VS3Zo0m2i9A.text: Fond memories here at La Santisima. Every single time I come here for their La Santisima veggie taco plate, it feels like a great life decision. These tacos are heavenly with fresh sauteed mushrooms, spinach, zucchini and onions with melted cheese. Then there is the salsa bar with around a dozen house made salsas. They best is the Mexican salsa and the pecan salsa crema. Oh and can't forget about their massive horchata drink they serve with chopped nuts and fruit on top. For those who partake, they have a bar with several tequilas, and probably other things. Small place, but cozy and intimate. Good spot for a casual date night where you can be a cool Phoenician that knows of the perfect spot for dinner. Parking is on 16th street, kind of a weird diagonal situation where you hope you don't get side swiped by traffic... But hey. Totally worth it if you do. These tacos. Yum.

QQBJ-k4T-oKgOVIoFxbX7g.text: This place is delicious. The food was very authentic which is rare to the Phoenix area. We look forward to trying everything on the menus.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Santisima taco, Mole taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil taco
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili En Hogada taco, Pastor taco, Mole taco
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mole taco, Pastor taco, Carne Asada taco. Rice and Beans

JEBMQUmho_GFtIDQgNQcxw.text: Oh my. This place is delicious. The food was amazing and fresh. Legit mexican food. Food came fast and the quesadilla/queso thing will now be included on my last meal menu. The whole ordering/getting a table was confusing but we just followed the herd. Would def rec'd going off peak hours and don't come with more than 4 people.

WAx--Gaxc3zaEAgaThFoPQ.text: Soooooooooooooo good. Packed even at 2pm and people continuing to come. Expect a wait but it's worth it for sure. I got the 3 street taco plate with rice and beans. Chicken, al pastor and beef. All delicious. The rice and beans were great too. We also had a half order of guacamole which was phenomenal and more than plenty for 2 people.  The salsa bar has a crazy variety and we didn't try any we didn't like. Try this place out. It's not in the best part of town but who cares.  If you're about good vittles you will leave full and happy.

3d7-1-VCq3uSyqim8oY_0A.text: We just got off the plane from Kansas City and needed to eat quickly. We looked on Yelp and found this amazing place. We loved the salsa bar and the three different tacos we had. All we can say is "WOW"!! We now wish they would come to KC.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The three tacos we had for lunch. Wish we had time to try everything!

24PlsewtblMFriat9bRsxg.text: A hole in the wall with delicious, authentic Mexican. Made me a fan of horchata. Best I've ever had. From their salsa bar to their tacos and burros, everything is rich and amazing. I usually have to wait for 30-40 min for my food, due to how busy it always is, but well worth the wait. You won't be disappointed!

ESDlUXaIxVVXe5OlVtA5Rw.text: I ordered the shrimp and carnitas tacos (both delicious!)  and washed it down with an ice-cold Mexican Coke (the only soda I'll drink).    The salsa bar is GREAT - variety. The walls are covered with local art.   Con: There is nowhere to wait if the modest sized restaurant is full. No one wants to wait in the heat during the summer.

s_jf6L3oy2aY6Rfk8KGjyw.text: Not quite sure about the hype...we stopped in on a Sunday evening and did not have a great experience. They had good foot traffic and we were seated within 10 minutes or so. That's when it went downhill...   We received stale chips, the salsas were just ok, and the service was very slow. After one hour and 15 minutes, we still had not received our dinners. We finally asked them to pack ours to go because we needed to leave.   The business is very aware their service is slow. Apparently they expanded their dining room but not the kitchen.  When we finally got to eat, the food was just ok. Maybe it would be better when fresh.

GZXs-sU-a_yTF9SntsjFjQ.text: Wife and I came during vacation and arrived about 10 minutes after opening. There were already 3 parties there at 11am. Promising.  Orders were taken at the cashier, then sat down with a number. The menu was a little confusing with all these caveats and pricing schemes, but at the end of the day, we got some tacos and we liked them.  *** FOOD *** They allow you to create "meals", so we got two - one with 2 gourmet tacos and another 3 street tacos.   Cochinita Pibil Street Taco (5/5) Mouthwatering and delicious. Pork was super juicy and well worth it. You'll see this in many other reviews and there's a reason for that.   Al Pastor Street Taco (2/5) I have a habit of always trying my favorite meat everywhere even if the reviews suggest otherwise. Wasn't really a fan, flavor was a bit lacking.   Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Gourmet Taco (4/5)  Cabo Shrimp Gourmet Taco (4/5)  *** DRINK *** I have two categories of Mexican places. Places that serve horchatas and places that don't. (The latter contends with Taco Bell.) However, living on the east coast most of my life, I haven't seen anything other than a normal horchata... I had a pleasant surprise here.  Fruit & Pecan Horchata (5/5)  Topped with strawberries, pecans, and a healthy dose of cinnamon, this had enough body (i.e., not watered down) to take on the sweetness delivered by the fruit and still taste like an horchata. It was novel and delicious. Highly recommended.  *** BOTTOM LINE *** Check it out. It's worth it. Get an horchata. And one to go.

AoIpT-Yb_QAbM9giEM16Jw.text: Found this place on Yelp last year during our vacation and had to come back. The food is delicious. Street tacos and burritos are a must try. And the salsa bar, so many options if you like spicy try the one with nopales (cactus). The classic margarita is so refreshing, my kids love the horchata.

evfPRJhNX0ZvF6vj7azOlQ.text: We moved to Arizona about 4 months ago and had driven past this place several times, but last night we saw it on an episode of Triple D and decided its time to try it. This place was amazing! Who doesnt love tacos, especially for breakfast/brunch! But they do serve actual breakfast on the weekends too. We will definitely be back.

o2wIZJJmgN5mFNoQ0UglcQ.text: Love this place! It's a bit small, but the food is delicious and the salsa bar is always changing flavors.

IXNBSfF19vF7eGDD-FXCLA.text: This place has a very unique atmosphere. My family owns the oldest Mexi restaurant in Scottsdale so I know a few things about Mexican food. First off, the food was awesome however the waiter was not very helpful for first- timers. Second of all, he snuck guacamole into our order. My dinner partner was upset they weren't up front about that. She is less experienced and thought the guac came with the chips. Shame on you for that. Be more upfront and helpful to new patrons. Probably will not be back but thanks for the amazing tacos!

AyXJUAWuVycZTu8-8QJVig.text: The salsa bar will invade your dreams. If I could I would bathe in their cilantro salsa.

IeRfQWXxPg5V8O0AX0cDpA.text: We were looking for some mexican food and I stumbled upon this place.  What a treat!  The food was really good, especially the Quesas and Tacos.  They have a great salsa bar as well and Real Coke.  The parking is a little tough and we had to wait 20 minutes for a table, but the food taste and quality was well worth the wait.

yT5oCYBvLk3f_89xsbEyfQ.text: The food was OK, they give you very little food  for your money.  The horchata was very good, but expensive.  There is a long wait to eat.  The service was not very good either, we had to keep asking for water refills, and chips. The bathroom is tiny and behind their supplies, our waitress was not very accommodating.  Didn't like it at all.

QDAErxcJmA-5PUFfVh4wEA.text: Really great vegetarian meals. Salsa variety is great, my favorite is the strawberry one. I had a vegetarian burrito enchilada style that I'm craving right now

BJUNqxiJNvD00PLLXQ-WnA.text: I saw this on an episode of Diners, Drive thrus, and Dives. The seating and parking are very limited, but we were lucky enough to find a table big enough for the four of us. Our order did take much longer than expected because they were out of tortillas for an enchilada my wife ordered - so they made it from scratch. When it arrived it was magnificent. I ordered three tacos including a Oaxaca Black Mole Taco. That was one of the most incredible tacos I have ever had. I have had mole before and wasn't a big fan, but this was fantastic. The salsa bar was good, the chips and salsa excellent, and the horchata was the best I have ever had. I would certainly go here every opportunity I had.

lnU95zx9cKclLnktXfsyyQ.text: Came here after my boyfriend had done seen it on Yelp. It is not by any means a large spacious restaurant. However, the best Mexican restaurants are primarily a hole in the wall.   We split the House Margarita. We had asked for no salt but it still came salted. It was good,  although I don't like salt on my margarita when I am trying one for the first time because I want to know what it tastes like without anything added.  I got a lot of food (because I couldnt decide what to get). I got the traditional Quesadilla which is ironically not a traditional quesadilla. It is a corn tortilla  folded over that has Oaxaca Cheese inside and its fried. Its kinda like a Calzone but better. If I had to pick a cheese that could possibly be my favorite cheese in Mexican cuisine it would be Oaxaca. The Quesadilla was amazing but it is HUGE. I was expecting something around the size of my hand.  Nope, one half was probably the size of my hand. We did ask for no crema but they still put it on there. I also got the Conchita Lonche, the meat was delicious but the bread was kinda hard. It does come with mustard, which I was not expecting. It would be a great thing to order for Lunch for anyone who works downtown (which I do).  My boyfriend got the shark taco but I was not up for trying it mainly because I barely eat fish tacos when it is cod inside. It did look good displayed on his plate. I didn't get to try the beans but the rice was good. I have a hard time judging rice because I still believe my Nana makes the best white rice.   The service wasn't bad but the woman was the only one really taking care of tables and about 4 tables including us walked in probably within 5 mins. So she was running around taking orders, running food and then touching back to the tables to see if anything was alright.    In the end, I definitely am coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The quesadilla. Sooo good.

AqhZrO4ZuBmmpKqEYiWj-Q.text: Great find! This place is a little whole in the wall and not the "cleanest" environment....but the food was great! Best margarita I have ever had...and that was only the house margarita. Can't wait to come back for happy hour when they are only $3.00. I had the shrimp and carne asada tacos while my husband had the burrito with carne asada, bell peppers, avocado. Everything was delish! The salsa bar was great! So many different choices and all were excellent. The table behind us had the guacamole and quesadilla...both looked yummy..they were very loud about how great it all tasted too! :)  I will definitely come back!

HM_3Spuxe_4G-d4zEoVFWA.text: The tacos here are to die for.. The dogfish shark tacos rock.. The salsa bar is absolutely insane, lots of real spicy options.. Kitchy, inexpensive, I feel a must for locals to take your tourists as that "hole in the wall" place with some real spunk and guster..Pack some heat.. Its the Ghetto:)

G51axfg0qE7qdnOGpV3T5w.text: I ordered a burrito and 2 tacos w/ rice/beans. I was charged $20.85 for what I thought was a rip off. Looking at the chicken it appears like it's been sitting at room temperature all day. It's black, dry and old looking. They must think people are stupid and won't know the difference. It's harsh to say, but I could not finish a meal I purchased due to disgust.

e6gSmQKu_cklsQqjnA8zZA.text: We tried this place due to yelp.   We were impressed with the atmosphere as it has beautiful art hangings and the place is clean.  I ordered the guacho burrito and the horchata due to the yelpster's recommendations. I usually don't go for beef so I wasn't crazy about the burrito, but it was good.   I was freaking crazy about the Horchata though!  I am a salsa snob so it takes a lot to impress me.   Rule number one - it must cause burn or don't call it salsa.   The seven chiles was so good that there wasn't much left at the salsa bar.   What was left, I took!  Second best salsa was the salsa peanut!  It was creamy, hot, flavorful and the best salsa peanut I have ever had!  So happy that they serve real salsas. My only recommendation for them would be to improve on the chips.   The chips are a bit thin, but cover them with salsa and all will be alright. When in Phoenix-go to this place.   It's a bit small, but hang in there and grab a seat and set your tongue on fire then cool it down with the horchata!

jECLKCv7M77vMq-PgMJC3Q.text: this place was ok not as good as people make it seem one thing I like is salsa bar. dislike the location.

UwJ33EkOm1J7kCdyOyerbQ.text: they have 2 taco orders and i was stuck between two kinds so the waitress said, you can get one of each. perfect. i love problem solvers. the tinga and the cochinita are great. they come with picked purple onions. they pickle them with lime so it comes through strong, but i like lime.

FPrsIgVEKi00-0RmPPxOHg.text: Amazing salsa bar! There wasn't one that I disliked, although there was a chipotle one that I loved the most. The pastor tacos were the best of the street tacos we tried. Amazing flavor! The carne asada was okay; not great. Would go back for the salsa, pastor, and to try other things.

xEHP8NDuxGpcBSbi9imoVA.text: So good!  Had a burro,  ate half took home the rest.  I'm now eating the other half for breakfast and have been brought back to a euphoric verde sauce heaven!

LKw55mCSIwHtrSWsPcFH0g.text: What a great place!  Good food that is very reasonably priced, and more types of salsa than I've ever seen before.  Our group had a lot of fun going up to the salsa bar, and bringing back samples of the huge selection for everyone to try.  I'd go back there in a heartbeat!

CduiCresZ_BJuDj_CIA9Kg.text: It is a little confusing when you walk in, but you do seat yourself and a server comes over with menus and chips. Help yourself to the wide variety (about 20) of salsas @ the salsa bar and your server will come take your order. I got the cochinita pibil tacos and my husbannd got the carne asada tacos...we got the combo plates with rice and beans, 2 tacos for $6.99. I don't know where that person has been eating who said this was expensive...the plates (baskets) come looking a little plain, but you have all those salsas to add to your tacos which makes it fun and filling! Rice and beans quantity was a little small for my husband, but just right for me. The carne asada tacos were good, but the cochinta pibil were amazing! I love the artwork and the tables and chairs...it's a great place! Plastic cutlery is a turn off, but who cares when the food is so good. I like La Condesa more than America's! *ducking behind the sofa*

FBd-S11KLRYaN44JiDPvYw.text: Great food can be served anywhere. My wife and me got lost couple of times while on gps!!duh! Who thinks of such a neat and cool place in this neighborhood. The food is great , really really great and their salsa bar is seriously awesome.thanks to all my yelp family for giving me this place!

d3mMain5Ic7aNIDYnUsjDg.text: Considering salsa is my favorite food group, La Condesa is a small piece of heaven. The carne asada and cabo shrimp tacos are delicious. This place gets very busy during lunch and is pretty cramped. Wouldn't recommend for large groups. Mmmmm salsa.

P3wr3h0cIOqkyqO_eLfiSw.text: It was a very decent place. (I still live/die for Ritos)  --Price:  It was $6.99 for my burro.  For its size, it was about average.  --Food:  I had the Oaxacan Black Mole Burro. I was good, but not mind blowing.  I would say it was worth the visit.  --Service:  Alright I guess.  I could take out my balls, rub them on the table, and the waitress would never know.  Take what you want from this.  I read so much about the chips and salsa: Chips sucked my shaved anus but the salsa was good.  I had better at Costco. **Strawberry salsa was good**  Overall it was a good experience (hence the 4 stars), but I will continue giving my money to RITOS.

ViLzYgwCYZXfP2fQhX-KGg.text: I was so hyped on my way here, I brought a coworker to order for the whole store. It was so busy, everything looked great. I said I've never been here and I'm starving. He ordered for me and it literally ended up being a beef burrito with only retried beans and nothing else. I'm sure everyone else enjoyed there's but man was that confusing

e-c-TBXsgreaPRRO4hF8qQ.text: As many have mentioned, this place is freakin fantastic.  I vote for La Condesa Shrimp tacos as my fav.  Best horchata I've ever had and eating the fruits and nuts when your done is a tasty dessert.  The Rabano (radish) Pibil salsa was so amazing I almost killed their supply of little cups going back for more.  That's one I'll be trying to recreate at home forever but will never get quite right.  Slightly sour, slightly hot, it's like a Mexican kimchee . . literally, I just drooled on myself thinking about it.  Viva La Condesa!

xLLE-u8B8EO8Nwhq76oTng.text: Wow...this place is so good it is ridiculous!  The Azteca Chicken Tinga quesa was amazing and the carne asada burro was to die for!  The food is so flavorful.  The salsa bar is fantastic...so many choices and they all have such good flavor.

XCviBWxbAfURtJWT6gcrXg.text: Hands down yum and fave taco place in town!!!!! Haven't tried the burros as I'm in love with the tacos... Love love the salsa bar as well! Cute inside, nothing fancy and a great place to take friends. If you like barrio, you will love la condesa (so will your wallet).

CCvxwp_siptcr1VvB4_COA.text: so my mom is in town and wanted some good mexican food.  i ran through the list of places that i know in my head and have frequented.  i stumbled across La Condesa and suggested it.  but i wasn't sure, i mean, i wanted to take my mom somewhere nice and i wasn't sure about La Condesa's atmosphere or food.  after much deliberation we decided on going.  and boy oh boy, we were not disappointed in the least!  to begin with, i'm a big fan of dia de los muertos imagery.  so to walk up and see a big mosaic sculpture above the door, i was already biased that this place may be my new favorite mexican food spot.  inside was decorated much the same with beautiful paintings of dia de los muertos portraits.  stunningly beautiful (i wish i had asked if they were for sale, but they had just finished up a remodel, so i was assuming they were not available).  their salsa bar is amazing!!!  my personal favorite was the jicama salsa.  but i could seriously sit and just eat chips and salsa.    i had a big sur dogfish shark taco and a carne asada burro.  the calabasitas (mini-squash, kinda like zucchini) were amazing!  the service was great too!  she was very friendly and was willing to chat up with us...always nice when i'm trying a new place.  this will definitely be my new joint for tacos and burros, hands down!

Rs36gMzorw0jip7hMC9ABA.text: I've had all their Tacos and they are all excellent.  My favorite are Cabo Shrimp & Oaxaca Black Mole Tacos.  The best way to enjoy the tacos in this place is to put them into rotation like in baseball and do the same with the multitudes of creative salsa.  The worse thing about La Condesa is their tacos made you wonder what the hell did you eat at Taco Bell.

cfwT5XRdNifjGGgiIbIHpg.text: Best authentic Mexican food in Phoenix that I have ever had! They have an amazing salsa bar with flavors I never could have thought to be salsas. I have the mahi burro and it was awesome. Everything made from scratch down to the tortillas. It's in a kind of "rough" location, but don't let that stop you from this place!

AjVcSMDjzQQsVek4G7zO9g.text: Wanted to try this place so bad. Ordered $45 worth of food for 2 people. Problem was that we never received our drinks or chips. We told the waitress after 15 minutes and just watched 5 tables after us get their drinks, chips and food. Waitress finally came around and gave us chips and then told us it will be a few more minutes for our 2 cokes. We then told her that we just want to get our money back. Then instead of her giving us our money back, dhe made us stand in the long line again and didnt even apologize. WOW... unbelievable. We ended up total spending about 40 minutes there and didnt even eat anything. I understand that the food is great but not gonna spend a dime if they dont provide good service....

OXA4RoU3__9OoUCeFefnjA.text: It is the superlative bean and cheese burrito in Phoenix! Classic taste and the refried beans are not cooked in lard, which is nice for vegetarians to know and whatever oils they use give them a good savory taste. No bland beans here! If dairy is not your thing, the Ghandi Vegan burrito has fresh guacamole and black beans matched by no other. And if the entrees weren't enough, there is also THE best salsa bar of all time. The red chipotle salsa must have some sort of addictive substance in it, as I cannot stop at just two servings.  The service is top notch and the atmosphere is mellow.  My only issue is that it's kinda hard to see from the road. But you can see the sign pretty easy if you're looking for it.

qz1WSzkapBJCbSqK2v1Kbg.text: Being from Los Angeles I pride myself on having discovered some great taco shops and trucks. La Santisima was a Yelp driven decision right before driving back to CA.  The food was absolutely amazing..........an explosion of flavor that is second to none. You can taste the attention given to the preparation and the quality of all the ingredients. I'm going to always make time whenever I'm in Phoenix to stop in.........however the food is so special that I may actually drive back every so often for a fix.

YL5azuBPBL3E1WyPx5scxw.text: Had the mole burrito (and of course mucho chips and salsa). Have nothing negative to say at all. Definitely more of a quick, cheap, and easy type place.

Qk51jbyRJt9igMYB90aNvQ.text: What took me so long to get to La Santisima?  Not much to add to the myriad of great reviews about this place other than to say Yelpers are dead on with this one.  The food, drinks, atmosphere, and staff all make this place a valley favorite for good reason.  Tonight my brother and his wife took me here as a late birthday present.  They've been here dozens of times and love it.  So I was confident what I was about to get would be pretty money.  And it was.  Let me first confirm what so many are saying about a specific drink here.  The Horchata.  Yes, its enormous and yes its awesome.  Has a nice light texture with accents of cinnamon and nuts.  The salsa bar here is also as extensive as advertised.  My brother and sister grabbed cups of each and every salsa for me to try (which was hilarious to watch since they were carrying full handfuls of salsa cups).  My favorite salsas were probably their cilantro and tomatillo.  As for the main course, its a taco shop first and foremost so I went the taco route.  The two that Yelp suggested most were the Mayan Cochinita and Cabo Shrimp.  Outstanding choices.  The cochinita pork was out of this world tender and delicious.  And the cabo shrimp was delicious and the portion on the taco was VERY generous (I could barely hold it on the tortilla).  The other thing that stood out to me was the rice on the side.  Seriously.  This isn't your run of the mill rice.  It's got a creamy savory thing going on.  Not sure exactly what they put in there (though I did pick up on some corn notes), but that rice is good stuff.  We didn't do dessert this time, but I'm sure I'll give that a try next time I'm here.  The service we received was super friendly and on point.  The place is small with seating for no more than 20 and it was pretty busy on a Saturday night.  So on most nights you might have to wait just a bit for a table.  Parking here is also pretty scarce so keep that in mind.  Its quintessentially traditional and delivers a wonderfully tasty experience.  I'll be back regularly and that horchata will likely accompany each of those visits.

rwgO_I_K7w0H5mV5kcNIgQ.text: All I got to say that these were the best taco's I've ever had. Found this place by chance on Yelp by chance on a visit to Phoenix for the Pro Bowl. The salsa selection is good. Next time I'm in town I'll be there again.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

inFoZ_gdiaf_bm41Kc9W2A.text: The first free basket of chips was a great way to sample their salsa bar. Portions were huge! I loved their rice with a few corn kernels .

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Norteno Green Chili enchilada style
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Tacos

ZtSpQ1akLilUOTKs2C_XCA.text: I hate it when I don't love a place that everyone else loves, but after seeing the reviews and ratings for La Santisima, I expected a lot. I wish my expectations had been met!  This is definitely hard to find, but we were able to park in one of the few spots up front. The parking lot is small, and you might have to park a few blocks away in the nearby neighborhood. If you have a big car, you should probably skip looking for a spot right in front and just park in the neighborhood to save yourself some grief.  The restaurant is small and cramped. Seating is very close, and even during early times, there is a wait. If you don't mind high impact, you'll probably be fine with La Santisima. Service is very slow - there's only a couple people working in the restaurant serving as host/hostess, server, and from what I could tell, bartender. I have to give credit because obviously the two servers were running around like crazy, busting their butts and doing the best they could, but I really think it would be good to hire another person so that you don't have to wait to be seated, wait to receive a menu, wait to receive water, wait to order a drink, wait to order food, wait to receive food, etc. In short - things might be sped up (quite a bit?) if another person worked there.  Salsa bar is nice, but I think bigger cups should be available in addition to the small ones because it's annoying to get up 93874 times for refills. I did love the peanut salsa - spicy and delish. House margaritas are nice, and strong! Quesadillas are delicious and wonderful as an appetizer. I would get them again as a meal.  Tacos... hm. El gaucho tacos had very chewy meat, with little seasoning... bland. Pork tacos are pretty good, but but not wow. Just... hm. Much to be desired. Beans are too salty, but the rice is very good. I don't know. I just expected more flavor and better quality meat.  In sum! Not bad, just OK.

IHkdXSGc67TKBbwnMkDOFA.text: Stopped by for a quick lunch - the salsa bar was superb. Lots of selection - none were very hot though including the "de arbol". It took a while for the server to take my order and even longer to get a drink of water. I I ordered the Sonoran Arrecheta tacos and they were delicious - basically carne asada with cabbage.
