The server let my food sit in the window for a while and never came back around to fill my water. So because the food was ok but the service was terrible on many fronts it gets a two star review.

YjYlNNuJF5g-ig23u7xz6w.text: This place is a hidden gem!  The food is savory, genuine Mexican food that is reasonably priced.  We tried tacos, tortas & the cohinita pibil burrito - all were succulent!  The salsa bar is great, you can try several or all.  The place is not fancy and you don't really get a waitress, you get in line, order your food & pay, take a number & drink, then someone will take your food to your table.  Give it a try!  You won't be disappointed.  Parking is tough - limited.

4qSO0Ut6gNGlUcPnKorkzg.text: If you have an interest in the best tacos in the state, then stop playing games and come to this place. not fancy, not cheap, but worth the time and money. these guys are the real deal

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the best tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. don&#39;t get scared, the tacos are the best

54m16gCy5B8tMnCIztykxQ.text: Life is all about creating a balance. This idea translates to a restaurant with its elements of food, service and decor.  The gourmet taco shop La Condesa is still trying to find its own equilibrium, but the line of customers nearly out the door isn't giving the new establishment much of a chance.  La Condesa is located on 16th Street, just north of McDowell, in a neighborhood that's no stranger to tasty Mexican food, including Tortas El Guero and the popular Barrio Cafe.  With no shortage of good Mexican food, how does a new place stand out? They do things their own way.  You'll notice striking artwork on the walls. The art is beautifully lit, and from a visual standpoint it's hard to look away, that's until you see the salsa bar.  Once you place your order at the counter, you're given a number. Then have a seat and a staffer will deliver a basket of crunchy chips. This is when the fun begins, tapping that salsa bar.  On each of my visits, the salsa line up was never quite the same, with at least six to choose from. Standouts include an Avocado Salsa that was vibrant and flavorful, the chunky salsa Mexicano and the Creamy Cilantro Salsa.  If you run out of chips they will refill your basket, but try not to fill up on chips while you wait for your food, because you will indeed wait, and wait, and wait... On each of my visits the kitchen took from 15 to 45 minutes to deliver my order. But don't let this discourage you because some things are worth waiting for.  The tacos are served on two 6-inch corn tortillas. You can order tacos ala carte ($2.99 each) or as a two taco plate ($6.99) with rice and beans.  The beer battered Cabo Shrimp version was hot and fresh, yet perfectly crunchy while leaving the shrimp moist and tender. The Sonoran Carne Asada had a great flavor but was more like jerky, tough and dry.  Burritos were mostly a miss, while paying a premium ($7.29). You can choose shrimp or mahi mahi. Mine were filled with too much rice and not enough seafood.  However the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Burro ($6.99) was an absolute killer. Filled with luscious roasted pork shoulder, it was so tender you don't need teeth to eat it.  The handmade Corn-Quesa is going to bring me back. They take fluffy corn masa and fold it around your selection of fillings, then use their deep frying to create a unique and substantial alternative to tacos and burritos.  Being a purist, the Traditional Quesa ($5.49) was one of my favorites, simply filled with gooey Oaxaca cheese.  The same Oaxaca cheese is paired with the earthy flavors of mushrooms in the Maria Sabina Quesa ($6.99).  For me, the thing to order is the Azteca Tinga Quesa ($7.29). Stuffed with shredded chicken, tomato, onion and chipotle sauce, the flavors were complex and each bite was sheer bliss.  Service is friendly and on some nights you might even see the owner's kids helping out.

wtW8U_8JoPjTrBUlmWyEMA.text: This is one of our favorite taco places! Once in a while we get some bad pieces of meat in our gaucho tacos but generally ok. The space is very small but it's worth it.

B27f7x4YgmKKjmgpUCjsbA.text: Awesome salsa bar and SHARK tacos!! You rarely see the words "gourmet" and "taco" in the same sentence, but La Condesa somehow makes it work. However, La Condesa isn't in the best part of town, and I'm glad we came here for lunch versus dinner. We tried: -Different Salsas from Salsa Bar (Pecan Salsa, Pico de Gallo, Mexican Salsa, Sesame Salsa, Cilantro Salsa, Grilled Peppers, yelp.com/biz_photos/la-c...): I liked the Pecan and Sesame salsas although I didn't get much pecan taste. The cilantro was too watery, but the grilled peppers were really good (and had a nice spicy kick). The pico de gallo was solid, as was the mexican salsa. Their tortilla chips are really good, and thin and crispy, so make sure you try them! -Tacos (From L to R: Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, Carnitas Street Taco, Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco, yelp.com/biz_photos/la-c...): -Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco (Roasted Pork Shoulder w/Achiote Rojo, Wrapped in Banana Leaves, Slow-Cooked Until Fork Tender and Topped w/Lime Marinated Onions & Salsa Habanera Maya): I ordered this since a lot of other people seemed to like it, and it was a "Yucatan specialty". However, it was just ok. The pork was a little dry, and the flavors didn't stand out. I wouldn't order this again. -Carnitas Street Taco: Pretty good! The carnitas were very flavorful, and I liked how bite sized this taco was. -Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco (Corn Tortilla Stuffed w/Beer Battered Dogfish Shark): DELICIOUS! I've had shark meat before and am used to it being tougher and firmer than regular fish. However, there wasn't a big different in the texture, but there seemed to be more of a sweetness to it. I guess I enjoyed the "Baja Sur specialty" vs. the Yucatan. This is a must order if you go to La Condesa! I only saw a small strip of parking available in front of the restaurant, but it is shared with a convenience store. I think street parking was also available, but I'd recommend making sure you don't have any valuables out! I definitely plan on coming back to La Condesa and trying their other seafood tacos, but will make sure it's during lunch. Dining in is the way to go so that you can sample all of the different salsas. The staff was nice, but weren't the quickiest.

Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Different Salsas from the Salsa Bar (Pecan Salsa, Pico de Gallo, Mexican Salsa, Sesame Salsa, Cilantro Salsa, Grilled Peppers)

DedvMn3IkUAb76FnUqt_pQ.text: The absolute best Burros and street tacos for a great reasonable price!

9qbDQ-CZPZgGXHLZuTHJUg.text: Came here to meet a friend of mine yesterday. We were seated in about 10 min around 8:15pm, so it wasn't super busy. We waited for 15-20 min for a server to greet us, which didn't happen. So finally, I walked up to the the bar area and informed the staff. One lady, who was probably the server in our area, said she'd be with us in just one sec! I went back to the table to wait with my friend. 5 min goes by and still no one came so we got up and left. What an absolute waste of time and no care in the world for their customers. Messing up an order is one thing and fairly understandable, but not a total lack of care and disrespect.

D9ymI9E4JmL3wJowcmKOzQ.text: Visiting from out of town this place had Great Mexican food. Not an expert on Mexican food but I have been around a lot of places in the USA searching for something good and most places have fallen short. For my taste buds this place is top notch. Thumbs up. I really don't like giving 4 or 5 stars reviews but it's hard to find good Mexican food on the east coast.

Fm4J8K085ZPUmSzUIGZDkg.text: Love their salsa bar and margaritas. The avocado salsa is my favorite. I don't eat meat, just seafood, so the menu is a little limited for me but I can always find something tasty.

4PWkoU7Lh18Ma9ys2MSiiQ.text: Drove by it the first time due to major remodeling on outside building , small and quaint inside - many salsas to choose from for your chips ( additional chips are $2.40 a basket) Street tacos were excellent , one person in our party said the retries beans were the best they ever had . Good  quick service even thou every table in the place was taken.

evzCm2IbDaiOB-0bymFRLg.text: This place is awesome! Great salsa bar - I could eat their chips and salsa alone as a dinner. Yes, it's that good! Their tacos are delicious! I love taking out of town guests here because everyone is always impressed with their salsa bar selection and great food!

bAafPVEWwpq-739OkdfySA.text: We must have arrived at an odd time for them to be busy because the service was lacking. The kid was super sweet, but we waited and waited... and then waited some more. The food made up for the wait, but we were HANGRY when we got there and it almost got ugly.   We got street tacos and they were awesome. We wanted to go back when we were flying back out of PHX, but we totally would have missed our flight and no tacos are worth that.   That being said, one of the reasons we came here is because Yelp said that vegetarians go nuts here... and that was just not True at all. Veggie options left MUCH to be desired, so beware.

lo66ZLTIvnKcxkaJUjEDjQ.text: Vegan post- this place is the ultimate. The salsa bar is on another level, the avocado is my favorite. The quesadillas might be the best meal I've ever had. I got no cheese, add beans to quesadilla. The rice is the best rice I've ever had, easily. The nopales tacos are also amazing.

I traveled all the way from N.California looking forward to trying them again on our vacation but I felt the risk of getting mugged and or raped was simply not worth a burrito.

wzw8M8N9fWWtZsd7Ut4zmQ.text: Lived here 40 years and love tacos! There is not a better taco in this valley PERIOD! These people create masterpiece tacos and toppings! The peanut salsa is incredible! Great food, fast and friendly service and a clean environment! A must try!

hw_ceVdmXay36zKz1roptQ.text: It took forever to be seated, food took forever to come out by the time we received our food  was cold. 2 people in our group left due to the poor service and the fact that there apparent fish tacos weren't even cooked. Overall terrible service, probably won't be coming to this location again off of 16th ave and mcdowell.

JDay9yjruqtbkN4eZkNj8Q.text: Don't let the exterior fool you! This is such a great place. I had 2 Mexican street tacos, Aztec tinga and al pastor. The al pastor was amazing. But plan to get a few - these tacos are tiny! My boyfriend had the Aztec quesa and wow, I will never eat a more delicious quesadilla in my life. The chicken was so well flavored and the tortilla was fried and so delicious.  The salsa bar was fun. I really enjoyed the strawberry salsa. But I wish there was a more traditional salsa at the bar as well. Highly, highly recommend a visit here.

w35CE21IsdFcujG_tuLdUw.text: Sunday afternoon and we were starving. We saw the gourmet taco sign so we discussed quickly and did u uturn because curiosity set in.  The place looked like a sticky dive but it was packed and we had to wait 15 minutes which was a sign of YUUMY food so we waited!   See pictures of  what we ordered.  I love the cucumber in my burrito which you made for a unique taste compare to the normal burrito you get everywhere. I order side of red sauce which was also had an amazing consistency and taste. My guest order ed a shrimp taco which was also yummy. She loved every byte of it (her exact words) so much she had it done before I could eat half my burrito.  Our server Joe was also very pleasant and I enjoyed leaving a nice tip.  Going back for sure!

wWBiDi1iDQnNVGUqZNzz1A.text: I decided to try this place again. It's a lot bigger than before the food tasted great! I am in love with their horchata but it's a little pricey. The only negative thing I have to say is to move the salsa bar away from where the restroom is at, kinda gross.

Cfe9OWBGUuaQk2dFjwDlrw.text: I used to really like this place, But I always seem to get bad service. Now that they expanded it seems worst. I came to dinner tonight and it took 15 minutes just to get water and chips. We finally were able to order and we both had the quesadilla with meat. We had to ask for napkins, silverware and more water. Our food was made wrong, didn't have what the menus said it did. There was tiny pieces of meat. Not sure I could even use the word tiny. There basically was no meat inside. It was over loaded with cheese. There was No flavor to it at all. We were never greeted on how everything was. So I never got a chance to change my order. I was just greeted with the check faster then the service in this place. I was extremely unhappy to pay for shitty service and bad food.

Wn3Cu6gumpvrYc9AUzSZ_A.text: Food: very good...  authentic and worth visiting.  Maybe better to go.   Service: SUCKS.   Incompetent people who don't know how to operate a restaurant.   When I walked in, there were 10 people in line - many "couples".   There was an open table for two at the front of the restaurant.  I approached the hostess (incompetent) about the table she said, "we are not using the table" followed by something about not wanting to overwhelm the wait staff.   Then, 5 minutes later she went back and talked to a waiter about the table.  She then proceeded to have a party sit down.  Really?  Overall experience:  I was there for over an hour just trying to get two tacos.   Food came out lukewarm probably because it was sitting in the kitchen waiting to come out.  Overall, service with waiter was pathetic.   The people here don't know what they are doing and should go to school to learn how to run a restaurant like a business.    My (Hispanic) friend always says, "Mexican restaurants are not known for service".  This restaurant epitomizes this statement.

99NAQlhqIW2bW00M1Wt4DA.text: I mean, it's whatever. At 1500 reviews, who cares at this point.   We're never in the area and decided to stop in for lunch this past Saturday afternoon. Bad choice. We were completely underwhelmed.  Pros:  Food. The salsas were great (our chips were stale though...), the tacos were outstanding. I had a chicken tinga taco (so juicy and topped with my favorite: picked red onion), a steak/veggie taco (topped with some sort of fried cheese...HELLO!) and a battered fish taco. I finished most of it, but I should have stopped way earlier. #fatpants  Cons:  Literally everything else. They were clearly understaffed (which by reading the reviews...is a trend? What?) and kept a wait, even though tons of tables were empty during our meal.   Bussing: We finished our chips and I piled the empty salsa ramekins, used napkins, etc. and pushed it to the side of our tiny table. You'd think our server would remove it when she set our plates down. Nope. WTF? I had to flag down a bus boy to put in his tub. Our table was so small and we needed the real estate to eat comfortably. When we were clearly done and asked for our check, she still didn't bother to pick up our plates and clear the table.  Wait: I get it. I worked in the service industry for way too long. I do understand. However, I've never been so close to walking out of a restaurant before. It took about 40 minutes for us to get our lunch. Our server walked by and told us "Oh, your food is about to come out." That was the midway point, as we waited about 20 more minutes. Why would she just say that to us when it wasn't clearly ready? It felt like bizarro-world  The dining room was pretty grimy.  Truly, the food was amazing. But, we won't be back.

QVMhognV98oZrv5K1iF6YA.text: So many taco and salsa options!! Met up with a friend and we got one of each on the taco Tuesday specials as well as all the salsas. Absolutely recommend you come here if you like options. We also got the margaritas and they were good. Service was a little slow but we were fine because of the bowl of chips and large salsa selection available.

SRVWlqHuM1cdpjtYF1Tv4g.text: Food here brings you back to old tradicional Mexico , the food is really implemented with lots of the tradicional spices of Mexican cuisine, there's great selection on the menu , the service is top notch , and definitely the taste of food is excellent, I will definitely put this place on my bookmarks of places to come back .... btw there's a salsa bar :)

LJ3R_jCGMrCM97THhUsr5g.text: This is the best food I've eaten in a long time. Eating a low carb diet can be difficult when eating out - especially at a taco place - but their menu offers a "protein style" option, where they wrap the taco filling in fried cheese. It was amazing! The tortilla soup was also incredible; I'll probably dream about it.  I'm super bummed I don't live in or near Phoenix, but that's probably good because I'd eat here daily.

jVIsM8978h-iLl6cs3Kk_g.text: Overrated and expensive. The food seems "toned-down" to me. It can be loud and cramped, and parking can be a pain. The best thing about it may be the extensive salsa bar. There are so many better options here in Phoenix.

-czzQSQyRJypt5SAOoOGbQ.text: What more can you ask for from a legit Mexican restaurant? La Santisima has the tacos and salsa bar that make up Mexican food euphoria, and even offers serious vegetarian options.   My friend and I had dinner here. Driving from El Paso to Los Angeles, we had become sick of Chex Mix and energy drinks. I didn't realize La Santisima had been featured on Food Network's Triple D, but the Guy Fieri memorabilia gave it away immediately. In a fantastically awkward moment made possible by fourth generation cellular technology, we watched the restaurant's Food Network VODs right as the server came to take our order. The server let us finish watching.  There were more tacos available at the restaurant than its online menu currently displays. The veggie tacos I ordered were a classic guac, black bean, pico, and lettuce combination. They also offer a grilled zucchini type side for those that are looking to avoid eating rice. The food was fantastic. The freshness was palpable and the flavors were balanced. With so many salsas to choose from, I felt like a child in a candy store. Did I mix salsas? You bet I did. Maybe people should start saying, "I felt like Chris at a salsa bar."  The restaurant had an odd atmosphere. Maybe it was the mermaid skeleton with dollar bills clipped to it. La Santisima wasn't quick - despite being an odd hour in the afternoon, our food took quite some time. They also charged for every basket of chips past basket numero uno. I'm sure the United Federation of Restaurants that Proudly Serve Chips and Salsa was furious at the first member restaurant to offer unlimited chips - that restaurant set a ridiculous expectation!  La Santisima was pretty tasty, and I would return for the salsas and tacos. I'm excited to see if Los Angeles has similar options.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie tacos and grilled zucchini

KiFlz4zzbQRHIFvjWBqGYQ.text: Best everything! Tacos, salsa, rice and beans!!!! I love tacos and I have to say this place has ruined me.... thank goodness it's across town or I would be there every day!

CfmdyLfLfoymLTfatqfulA.text: While there is very little to be said that hasn't been already, you simply can't go wrong with tacos. Just point at random at the taco section and you'll be happy.  The salsa bar is full of types that I didn't even know existed. Almond salsa? Load it up!   Make sure you come before lunch/dinner time if you want to get seated/don't want to eat off your lap.

IrpWAWanaBYMcmbj5n0IMQ.text: The last 3 trips to Phoenix we've made have included a stop at La Santisimo.  The best street tacos I've ever had.  Their mole sauce is extraordinary, the steak gaucho tacos are killer good, the horchata is sooooo good.  On top of all that, the huge variety of salsas at the salsa bar will keep you coming back for more.  My favorite is the peanut salsa.  WARNING:the pecan salsa is HOT!

VFoqP1JRu1uxahHOcGpUQg.text: This places quality has fallen off bit time. After this last tapatio burro I won't be back for a while. Old not well shredded pork,  not fresh cheese, made me feel bit sick to my stomach. Used to love this place, shame, not at these high prices.

feYub-cZHltJKcJhneVWkQ.text: This place is straight up 5 Star, great food, great staff and great experience. It's simply a 10!!!!!!

9nhBK10I44ZyUavDHSzJxw.text: Great place for tacos and every kind of salsa you can think of. Must try the horchata and michelada. Glad they expanded the location on 16th st.

av3tR-A6xy3FmXdi9igUhg.text: First, the chips and salsa are great with the salsa bar and variety of flavors and heat.  That's where the good goes wrong...  There is something wrong in the restaurant plan: it took over 25 minutes, for example, for the check to be picked up after it was dropped off.  It took way too long for nearly every aspect of the dining experience: water, drinks, food, check.    We were in no rush, so contrary to some of the pushback on this nearly unanimous criticism, this isn't an entitlement issue.  This is a baseline comparison to other great local restaurants (such as El Comedor Guadalajara or Cocina 10 at Crescent) -- the service here is very poor.  I don't know if it's a structural problem, but it is indeed a problem.  The tables and chairs are too close together even for thin people, which makes it difficult for customers (and STAFF!) to maneuver in the expanded dining room.  This place has potential, but not until some of these baseline issues are addressed.

8h-mkj1uG03Uvnp0ZdOSYA.text: This place seems to be going downhill. The rice recipe seems to be only good with one cook.... Cross your fingers.   We ordered the guacamole and it was watery and had a few chunks of avocado... It wasn't "made".   The service is ALWAYS SUPERIOR. Love the front staff.   Please get good again!!!

diRuRVEsdWxHHCVSyv3SQw.text: The black mole chicken taco's are the best I've had in Phoenix.  I've eaten black mole from Mexico City to the Yucatan, and these will rival any of them; except for our Aunt's in Mexico City.

OXRirihgycie3xB8wr2Drw.text: Excellente! The food is amazing, the salsa bar rocks and the service is nice. This is the place to go on 16th Street. Hopefully it's awesomeness and popularity don't ruin it...

YwpEILtQFr1q0dtciuHCtw.text: I don't tout many restaurants especially Mexican food but La Condesa is by far one of the best taco shop restaurants I have been to in the valley.   It is hard to believe that with almost a Mexican restaurant on every corner in Phoenix that most if them if not all of them are disappointing or overpriced.  If you want a Scottsdale vibe with overpriced drinks and unauthentic food then this is not the place for you but if you want home flavor cooking with fresh ingredients with an authentic smile, then don't miss trying out this great new hot spot. You won't be disappointed!

m7FJlmbO_vG2um96Px0Shg.text: A great taco spot can be judged by the salsa. I pony up to the La Condesa salsa bar and prepare to judge. Today's salsa varieties included strawberry, cilantro, guac, and my fav a spicy salsa with tamatillios. Spicy, complex, AUTHENTIC, developed flavors exploded in my mouth as I sampled a rainbow of salsa with the chips that arrive before my tacos. Instantly, I could tell,  La Condesa Gourmet Taco Shop knows what they're doing in the kitchen, they care about quality, and are super fresh.    If Mexican food can be judged by salsa, a good Mexican restaurant can also be judged by the frijoles. These beans did not disappoint. Great flavor, perfect consistency, delicious salty cheese on top. MMMMM!   The Main Event: Tacos. Yay! Roasted Veggies: Awesome! Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco: WOAH! My lunch buddy declared: "This is as good as my favorite taco stand in Mexico!" (She lived there for 6 years!) How's that for authentic?! The Horchata may be the best in town. Definitely homemade, with strawberries, mmmmm. Not too sweet or watery. I can not wait to try the fried quesidillias.    With food this delicious, decor may not matter, however the inside is cozy & clean with heavy wooden tables and contemporary chicano art. I especially love the doors to the banos.   Prices are completely fair, cheaper than a combo at a chain restaurant. Meal for two with drinks was $20.  Taco Row is one reason i struggle with the thought of leaving the southwest. Salsa and tacos this phenomenal are difficult to recreate too far from the border. La Condesa, the new kid on the block, is worthy of praise & adoration.  i look forward to a long, delicious affair.

_f-okQ3b3xjI_zUdWQkjCg.text: I almost feel useless writing this review, I think everyone has said it all.  But still, I liked it just that much that I want to have my say anyway!  I had one shrimp taco and one pibil taco.  The pibil was...... just... so, so so so good.  It made me want to exit through the kitchen and shoot the chef a la Johnny Depp (*i will not shoot any chefs, please do not report me).  The tortillas were just right, and I already want another one.  The shrimp taco.... I hate to say it but it WAS bland.  Not bad, just not very flavorful.  I poured on a bunch of the Cilantro Cream salsa, which didn't add much.  I'll stick with the pibil!  On to the salsas:  Believe the hype over this strawberry salsa.  Who the heck thinks these things up??  Regardless, it's brilliant and I hope they start selling it by the jar.  I was super excited about the cilantro cream, but it fell a little flat.  Like the shrimp tacos, it was good, just not filled with flavor.  The only other salsa I had was the plain old salsa, and it was really great as well.  And as for the horchata, I have never had horchata like that.  It really was delicious, but just so sweet and rich that I don't think I even finished 1/4 of it.  And for some reason, you can't get a smaller size.  But for a few sips after your meal, mmmmmmmmmm.  Dave B is right about the price.  BUT, we each got 2 tacos, and neither one of us finished them both.  I really think that splitting a 2 taco meal, combined with the DELICIOUS tortilla chips, is more than enough for 2 people.  As others have mentioned, the artwork is just stunning.  I love Day of the Dead art, and these were beautiful.    In short, the Yelpers are all right.  Just go, and thank us later.

tCxOKh3tRbPvgq1dFMfQ-g.text: Fred M. pretty much said what I would say, so I won't beat a dead horse.  I'll add, though, that they offer a wide variety of deep-fried quesadillas.    Did you catch that?  DEEP FRIED QUESADILLAS!

YU8e_RZtmmoeEdrU11-ebA.text: Off the charts delicious and menu is extensive and unique. Best occixicana tacos ever. Can't wait to come back.

BKFuoDBDZOMFE1ermT_aDQ.text: I like the salsa bar!  Good to try at least once.  The horchata was yummy with all its chunky bits of nuts and fruit in it.  Those are the only good things I have to say!!  I didn't really like the food that much.  Not much vegetarian selection.  I probably won't go back.

O1yooFxyVo7aGbBlN0vGhA.text: Love the salsa bar. 15 varieties. Street tacos rock.

6MT8mcJScVwyUqgik0o1ew.text: All delish! Burro Taco recommended by waiter was a great choice. The fish taco was excellent as well as the shrimp taco. Salsa is done right! Can't wait to visit again! Great atmosphere and service. The decor is interesting!

goPYWBMB-LuIO0oHCgHFVw.text: Keeping this brief..  Went for lunch on Monday after a co-workers recommendation and was blown away by how good the Cochinita Pibil Burro was.  The pork shoulder is marinated in achiote, orange and a bunch of other stuff and was unbeleivably tender.  Great tortillas as well.  My Mexican buddy declared it some of the best meat he has ever eaten.  The salsa bar had some pretty interesting stuff in it and everything I tried was great, including marinated onions and two different salsa verdes.  A plus was the Pico was pretty spicy, with large chunks of Jalapeno in it.    I will definitely be back.

RWyEi4lcshPoALxdIwc0VQ.text: Best Mexican food in town!! Their traditional Quesadillas are delicious and are the Chicken Mole tacos & Al Pastor tacos!!!!! This is making me hungry now!!!

ysgJIshRcqxGjHxXsXGg-g.text: Solid three and a half stars, rounded up because I am feeling magnanimous today . Others have already waxed rhapsodic about the high points of this little hidden gem: the decor (slightly kitschy, somewhat modern and a pinch of rustic), the salsa bar (over ten types, freshly made and flavorful without the tastebud massacre of straight hot chilis), and the horchata (yummy and light, made unique with the addition of finely chopped cantaloupe and strawberries and a sprinkle of pecans).   Being a quesadilla fanatic, I got the veggie one. Now, mind you, I had not read any reviews prior to my visit, so I was somewhat disconcerted  by the three pound Mexican calzone that arrived. I'm not complaining -- it was quite tasty -- but the puffy, doughy corn "tortilla" exterior was a bit much for me. Oh yeah, and the five handfuls of cheese inside of it. Too much. The damn thing was so big, it eventually became three meals.  My SO, the ultimate Mexican food snob, dug his chicken burro, although it was overstuffed and gooing and oozing everywhere, requiring him to attempt to consume it with a (cheap, flimsy plastic) knife and fork. Try cutting a hot, goopy mess wrapped in a tortilla sitting on a single thin piece of paper on a wicker basket with bendy cheap utensils. Yeah. Total mess. Not first-date friendly.  The location, parking, and service are questionable, as others have noted. We beat the rush by going late morning; I didn't think the wait for the food was unreasonable, but I wouldn't be stopping in here for a bite if I was in a hurry.  While I loved the horchata, the fruit was chopped just finely enough to go shooting up the straw unexpectedly. Total choking hazard for the less physically coordinated (read: me).   Overall, pretty, pretty good. We'll be back, although I'll pass on the quesadilla next time...

tyBmgd25bIT5UqjOvQGzwA.text: YUM YUM YUM!!! This place is amazing. The focus is fresh delicious food. Everything tastes like it was made from scratch that day. Everything we've eaten had a distinct flavor so you can really get a feel for lots of different tastes. Whatever kind of "Mexican" you are in the mood for; this place will deliver. Nothing here ever feels like it was rushed to be cooked faster.  I have been here twice and the second time was even better than the first.  The first time we had 2 Cochinita pibil (pork) tacos, a Dogfish Shark taco and a Carne Asada taco. All of them were amazing with each having their own unique seasonings, complimentary accoutrement (pickled red onion for the pork, cabbage and creamy salsa for the shark etc.).  The second time we got a 'Dogfish Shark' taco, a chicken mole taco and a chicken burrito. The chicken mole was outstanding. My mouth is watering remembering it. It was a perfect earthy balance of the chili and the chocolate dancing on my tongue. The chicken burrito was also amazing in its simplicity. The refried beans are smoky and smooth in an indescribable way. The chicken was slow cooked and complimented the beans well.   The horchata was very good- and not gritty or powdery or too sweet like many places. My only complaint (because nothing's perfect right?) is I would have liked more ice. Yeah- that's all I could come up with.  The variety of salsas makes it fun. The first time we went they didn't have the strawberry salsa we had read so much about, so of course we had to come back! We got the strawberry salsa and there was also the peanut salsa which I preferred to the strawberry one. Again the variety of tastes in the salsa is fantastic. The flavor combinations are unique and widely varied from sweet, to savory to spicy.  I work around the corner so will definitely be back for more!

09Yec0V_CMRMAslIhohX5A.text: MMMMM!!! Love this place! The Salsa bar is awesome. They have updated it since the last time we went so they now have a full bar! YAY!  The prices are great and you get sooo much food. My boyfriend and I was always have left-overs that heat up wonderfully in the toaster oven . There is not a lot of seating but that's down town dining for ya.

cb0j910DEtfWIJhxgaJxog.text: I stumbled upon this place not knowing it is a trendy eatery that is usually over crowded and full of wanna be foodies. The menu has some moments of brilliance but often lacks sensibility. Take the strawberry or peanut butter salsas. Nice try but not ready for primetime.  The corn Quesadillas are made with masa and rice flour to give the turnovers a nice crispy crunch and fantastic flavor. 5 stars for the taste! Loss of two stars is simply for the stupid furniture that is packed in like you would with a moving truck. Just too dammed confined. They would be better off putting a couple tables out front to serve. Trying to squeeze into one of their small tables I almost knocked one of their priceless works of art that are just hanging balanced on a nail.  If the chef can mature and work on some of his experimental flavors this little eatery should have customers for years.  However if they continue to operate under such cramped conditions people will stop coming in just because of the logistics.

fuCb-WFVJtRRzd6w2HDK1g.text: We visited here on a Saturday afternoon and we immediately knew this was a place that we would be returning to regularly. The food was wonderful and the salsa bar was just plain fun. The wait staff was extremely helpful in understanding their menu and her recommendations were spot on.  We're looking forward to working our way through their entire menu, one visit at a time!

OhwOw2k-iQdTEFClseiHjw.text: I hadn't been there in quite some time but went for lunch on Monday. Amazing! Had the chicken mole quesa which tasted great and was more than enough for lunch and dinner that night. Also had a salad which was really good. I'll go back often!

voysf7ru-lOg1qefJrgXZw.text: Love this place!  Salsas are excellent the beans could use a little something but other than that it's great!  Must try if you love tacos!

KKaK8EbEQ_KOsb8I_5wB-w.text: Best tacos I've ever had. Ate the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco (pork shoulder taco) as well as the Baja Surf Dogfish Shark Taco. The pork shoulder was my favorite because of how well the marinations blended with the pork as well as the small hint of cinnamon... Fucked up good! Both tacos came with a plate of rice and beans.  As mentioned before the pork shoulder taco has cinnamon in it which my girlfriend is allergic to so she switched if for the Sonoran Carne Asada Taco. The carne asada was well done and you could taste the mesquite charcoal it was made on. The salsa bar is another reason why this restaurant is good, due to  how diverse it was. There were so many salsas that we couldn't test them all before the chips ran out; can't remember the names of all of them, but the peanut salsa was awesome.

5IQNzN7ggRGdWUoONkurjg.text: Great food, very slow service.  I can't imagine what it would be like if they were busy.

praBvWPU62kqRceV-cTb-A.text: This is mine and my daddy's place! We love the food, and the salsa bar is great. It's a small place and it's always busy. We love to come here every Sunday night.

7xx6xhaprbjhJDWttjr6og.text: Really good food, decent sized portions and good customer service. A tad bit high priced, $30 for two people and only one beer. However the hotchata was so amazing it made it all worth it....there are nuts and fruit in it, what?! I can eat my delicious horchata as I drink it? Yes please.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The front...the beautiful calavera sculpture that originally drew me in.

QmDWnXG8Y-J2EJnsDp88qg.text: I was excited to try this place out but after the bad customer service I walked out after 15 minutes of waiting there. I went with my husband and 6 year old son and as we walked in we saw it was busy. I didn't mind it being busy or waiting but after 5 minutes of waiting and none of the waiters greeting us and just passing by over and over again I started to get annoyed. So we stood there another 5 minutes as another group of people came in.  A couple minutes later the waiter went to them and sat them in an empty table he had just cleaned off. I was in disbelief and told my husband that it was time to leave. It was a waste of 15 minutes just standing there. I have never written a bad review before but how we were treated was awful and I hope they see this review.

WN-A3O3NfHzJPmPBYgB1gg.text: Amazing! Cant wait to go again. Really great salsa bar, and lots of choices on the menus. Hubby was a bit apprehensive about going but he enjoyed it

RsbxicrFGt5sNc2h6F6QEw.text: Chicken Mole tacos are so delicious. Great art, not too busy on Saturday evening, small place... Every good Mexican place has great salsa and beans...and they bring you chips...they are doin it right.

PJSg-zIHExgAIDi-JKKbmQ.text: I came to Phoenix for a business trip and didn't want to eat near the arena so I looked up any nearby triple d restaurants. I randomly chose one to yelp and from the reviews and pictures, we chose this one. The whole ride there I was salivating over the pictures of the deep fried quesas. I knew I wanted to try that and the fish tacos. It did not disappoint. Soo good!! And on top of that they have a salsa bar with like 10 different salsas you can try! Super friendly staff. One of the waiters gave me a bag of chips no charge to take to go with all the yummy salsas! I would definitely be coming back here when I visit Phoenix in the future!

jxCp-kdom9BD9SA0ZjgWxQ.text: This place is hands down a hidden gem. Food is always amazing. Don't forget to order the  Horchata! It is the best in town.

ciXaXpqbF89ZflHYmcE2YQ.text: I've been to all the notable taco places in the valley and this is the best AUTHENTIC Mexican restaurant in the whole valley, period!!! THE PRICE is what's really unbeatable!  I went the other day and had chips & salsas with the best salsa bar(free), a 2 taco plate(big tacos, not street) with rice & beans(which are awesome by the way), and 2 MARGARITAS and the bill came to $16!!!!!!  How is that even possible???  I've been to places that sell one margarita for $15(In La Jolla CA)Lol.

7LbmYDxz3WSRSE4OVjv_eg.text: Diverse menu and great salsa bar.  Fabulous service and will return.  Came in for breakfast, but ended up downing 3 tacos.

LrwY3h3N3IKUkUtYjEKlYw.text: Everything I've had there has been amazing. The Veggie Burro is my favorite. The salsa bar kicks butt and the horchata is the best in town.

yP3gqD-wjUd0onZgoi13tg.text: Sweet spot! Very cool ambiance. Food was great. Salsa bar was delicious. Pecan salsa was amazing. Never would have thought of and almost did not try, but was the best of the batch. Would have liked a little more spice, but all were good. Shark taco, colors of the flag burrito was stunning. Another combo (meat, raisins, and apples) that was great. Quesadilla was also great. Not the standard quesadilla but better in my opinion. Small with only 10 tables, and things were a bit slow but more than worth it!!

aSWBAfBVkmmD2tzlcTxXqg.text: First thing I noticed when I came here was how cramped it is! That usually doesn't bother me but it's awkward when you're waiting to order while standing next to a table of other diners the whole time. Service was rather slow but there was only 1 cashier during dinner service so it's not her fault, she probably just needed help. That's the only thing preventing me from giving 5 stars. The food is really damn good. I had a bean and cheese burrito and a veggie taco and let me just say the burrito was a super good deal because it was huge and wrapped well (I hate when beans explode out of the tortilla) and the tacos were amazing. It's nice to find a place that serves veggie tacos because it seems like no one else has them in the area.

XeDsgbQoBbXVZCtBylLahA.text: The food is amazing, salsa bar is bangin, and they have delicious and original vegan and vegetarian options!

ZX5muZk9UWVoFPSNpmDrMA.text: Everything here is delicious. Best salsa bar in town. The pecan salsa is my favorite. Mexicana and pico are second favorites. Horchata is a must. Beware the cheezieness of the quesos!

80aD9O-loE6ka8wv3hm5Eg.text: I'm not a fan of what's annoyingly referred to as "Tex-Mex" food, at all. It gives me the idea of pseudo-not-fast-food like Moe's, or lame cantinas, run by people whose ancestors probably couldn't pronounce "cantina," that cater to the effete-minded "Margaritaville" crowd.  My wife, however, was attracted to the outside decor and lured in by the "gourmet" in the name.  Welp, folks, let me tell you: I'm really glad I went in this place. Their big advertisement is that they want to turn the tide of opinion on Mexican food/Tex Mex whatever from one of greasy, unhealthful junk to tasteful and thoughtfully-prepared fare- to the end of the latter, they did their due on me!  The woman and I had their take on quesadillas, which weren't the usual stupid flat flour tortilla cheese sandwiches with a pile o' salt and a not-pile of meat. In fact, these guys were made from homemade corn tortillas, deep fried (though not doused in grease) and filled well with your menu choice (In my case, al pastor; the wife got mahi-mahi). Folded over like a calzone and topped lightly with cojita sour cream, these guys are filled with flavor- flavor I've not experienced at any other Mexican joint in this city. The light crispiness of the tortilla really drives it home, and the quesadilla in all makes me think more of "tamale grande" than what you would classify as a quesadilla. (again, a boring flat cheese sandwich).  The price is kind of high; and while the portion is not *big* big as if you might get from a typical Mexican restaurant around here, let me tell you pals: It's well worth it.  Can't wait to try some new things here, sometime. In the meantime, go and try a quesadilla if you want to be flavor-blasted for the first time in Phoenix.

QJyQRRQqJ7YbC1s4ILdlEQ.text: Wow where to start... If you decide to give this place a try based on their "good" ratings and reviews you're better off looking elsewhere. Me and my girlfriend were looking for ordinary tacos and when we noticed the awesome ratings and good reviews this place had achieved, we thought it would be at least decent. When we got there and ordered our drinks, I ordered the horchata because according to people on Yelp, they had the best one could taste. As soon as I got mine, I noticed it had some kind of canned fruit on top, if had some sort of strawberry syrup and to top it off, it had a brownish color instead of the usual white. When I tried it, it was so sweet that one sip is all I could take before I decided to tell the waiter to take it back because I was not going to pay for that. My girlfriend's Jamaica also had a purple color to it and she told me it tasted like grape Kool-aid. When we were attempting to order food, all I wanted from the start was a few simple tacos... Their tacos were $2.97 each!!!  That is absolute madness!!! For the size of the tortilla and the quality of the taco, the MOST those could have been worth anywhere else was $1.25. When everything was going bad and our night had been ruined, me and my girlfriend started looking around and we noticed that only white people were eating there. Then everything made sense; white people don't know REAL mexican food, so they assume this crap quality was the "best they had ever tasted" and thus very good review on yelp came from white people. If you know what real mexican food tastes like and are looking for just simple tacos, DO NOT GO TO THIS UTTERLY AMERICANIZED MEXICAN JOINT!!!! You will be sorely disappointed. ANY cheap taco stand in Mexico can beat the taste of these so called "street tacos" AND FOR A THIRD OF THE PRICE!!! If I could I would give this place 0 stars.

znAsb4eYj5v4IBm7ik_IlA.text: Recently some of my colleagues from Spain were visiting and on their last night in town, I offered to take them to dinner.   They immediately told me that they NEEDED to have authentic Mexican food and they really wanted tacos.   After searching through pages and pages of Yelp and Google, and polling my friends on facebook...I finally chose La Condesa over many strong recommendations of Los Dos Molinos, Barrio Cafe, Aunt Chiladas, and many more....   Now, I realized that never having been there myself before I was taking a bit of a risk...but my fellow Yelpers surely couldn't lead me astray, right?!     Happily, they did not!   The food was delicious.  The four of us all ordered different kinds of tacos and we all loved our dishes!  I had the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, which I DEFINITELY recommend!  The flavor was amazing! a little heat, a little citrusy....mmm mmm mmm!!   Two of my co-workers had the Carne Asada and they both raved about it the whole way home. we all shared an Horchata for dessert -- wow!  very good too!  It's a big drink, so I do recommend sharing - it's totally worth it!    Their bellies were content before the long flight back to Espana!     The portions were good.  Not too big, not too small.  Two tacos were filling - I always like to know what to expect.  Nobody had any leftovers, so I think the portions were just right.    Of course, the salsa bar is a key feature of this place.  I think we only made it through 5 or 6 kinds and I liked them all.   The mango one was one of my favorites, which is a surprise b/c I'm not usually a huge fan, but I loved the sweet and spicy combo - it was done just right.     I've already sent the link to my foodie brother in law - the whole fam will be visiting for the holidays, we will definitely be going back!   This will be a MUST visit place for my future recommendations!    Yeah!

dldYKPTy7j0HdK4-twnr9w.text: Horrible service.  We walked in to place a to-go order and were not even acknowledged.  Then we stood there for at least 5 minutes and waited. No menu to even look at so we asked someone if we could see a menu and the man rudely told us to give him a second.  Clearly they don't need our business, so we walked out and will be taking our business elsewhere.  Also, it's pretty disgusting how you can look straight into the bathroom and see the toilet from the bar and tables.  Gross.

1T5XxUywbE2BqziJ96ZlSg.text: This salsa bar will ruin your life. You will lay in bed awake at night thinking about the salsa combinations you didn't try and how your life is not as fulfilled as it could be if you had tried it... The food here will change you life for the best and for the worst (cause you'll want it all the time).

9KVo8PZDcHL_COdNK7Prvg.text: My parents taught me, "when you don't have something nice to say, then don't say anything at all."  Yelp has taught me, "when you don't have something nice to say, tell it like it is."  Sorry mom and dad, Yelp FTW!  I like my restaurants how I like my style, un-cramped; unfortunately, this place is packed full with wall to wall tables and chairs leaving about 3 inches in between you and the guy at the table next to you. Don't plan to come here during the lunch rush with a big group, you're lucky if you can fit one or two people through the door. The parking isn't that appealing either, you are practically parked in the middle of 16th street traffic. :-/  La Condesa makes a pretty good taco, and their salsa ain't bad either. To their benefit, they do have some fairly unique salsa's to choose from, such as strawberry, peanut, and pecan; but in my opinion, unique doesn't necessarily = awesome. Any of their tacos will do you right, but my favorite is their pork.    In my opinion, and lets face it, if you're reading my review, that's exactly what you're looking for right? La Condesa over stated when they went with Gourmet in the name. Sure, everybody likes their taco's but who wants to pay $9 for two tacos and leave feeling like they were packed in like sardines in the middle of a seedy neighborhood? If it isn't obvious yet, I don't plan on coming back soon, I can take or leave their salsas and tacos and wouldn't be bothered either way.  Happy Yelping Phoenix, hope you find that hidden taco gem you've always been searching for.

_3_axqUtjHnKqx5BRG95rg.text: SO good!  I love the enchis and how there is a salsa bar...a little pricey in my opinion but it was delicious!!

RZTlowsDgdOUeJrhNrZWZQ.text: I'll echo the sentiments of other reviewers that the service here is horrendous; staff is completely rude and aloof.  Phoenix has tons of great mexican joints, no need to frequent this one. Overlook the hype and take your business to a resturaunt that actually appreciates your business.

ta4toHsNp7nneT15wwQ2_g.text: QUE BUENO!!!  Been to this one and the one in Flag and both have been INCREDIBLE!  The food is beyond fantastico!  The tacos, the burritos, and the salsa bar are just awesome!  The salsa bar alone is pretty amazing, with all the different types.  The drinks are great, too and not at all stingy on the pour.  Love this place!

vb-z-I7Lg_FUKNpV0pdN4Q.text: Killer tacos and the salsa bar is unparalleled. Get there early, nut if your late it's worth the wait.

A6OCcU8ksefEJ1wysGXBKA.text: La Santisima has unique taco combinations that you will not find at just about all of the fast Mexican-American food joints. Their salsa bar is the best that I've ever had, allowing the patron to make some delicious flavor combinations! Definitely go here!

KHlzlWv5rgQizClwx990mQ.text: Depending on what time you go you might have to wait. But it is absolutely worth it. I got a soup and a burrito. Both were delicious. They also give you chip and they have a selection of salsa choices. My favorite being the chipotle.

t0rZt4QOBAHt07T-0jzj7A.text: Be prepared to squeeze in close to your neighbors, but the food is certainly worth it! The salsa bar is fantastic!

Wkpy-WfSLQya6y2sScm5tQ.text: Tire of the old sonoran style Mexican food? Find a taste of deep southern Mexico food here! The rice is not red/orange YAY, finally! and the orchata is a nutty and fruit infusion! I drive from afar to this place because its definitely a different class of Mexican food. The wait is pretty long so I don't recommend if you are dying of starvation lol but it is worth the wait. I recommend coming during off peak time frames to grab a seat, wait and enjoy

qPOvS3JPV3_R7NHRcO2X5Q.text: Strong margaritas... Fantastic good... Good service... Great vegetarian options... Veggie tacos were off the hook... Chips not so hot but this hole in the wall place has a lot going for it.

FWVlDFIUCiUJTRM_O9tbXA.text: This place was a waste of time, the service was supper slow. After more than half and hour of not getting even our drinks we decided to leave and cancel our order.. will definitely not be going back.

wp3nt1OJu6m1na3jXbVKdA.text: I don't know why this place has such high reviews. Ate here on the way to the airport. The restaurant including our table was filthy. The whole place seems like it is covered in grime. The food was greasy and lacked flavor. We had horchata, shrimp and mole tacos. Does not live up to the hype. Our waitress was non-existent for most of the meal and the food took forever to come out. I would never eat here again.

V1M2ytMV8uAWVQGFwanV9w.text: What can I say that other reviewers haven't? This place is awesome for vegetarians (there are like 8 different vegetarian taco choices!) and the salsa bar is awesome (strawberry salsa!). I really liked the guacamole, which was chunky and light with refreshing chunks of jicama and tomato with the avocado.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole &amp; salsas

OFmwEXZiqYPRg-anVLw9Zg.text: No Bueno! Rude waitress, cold and bland food. If it was busy I could understand..... it wasn't busy...I will never go back. A high priced pseudo Mexican food restaurant.

bEfFc0rTpkyJ4730Lm0iaA.text: Holy. Cow. This place is the real deal. From their salsa to their margaritas- i can not get enough of this place! The portions are great and the food is spectacular melt in your mouth Mexican. It's a tiny place with great service. Definitely check it out.

W7g0POlFCTEXah3oqEabiw.text: This place MUST have paid for their reviews. . I'm sure I'll eventually see this review being removed.  Service here is beyond horrible. It took a table next to us 10 minutes before being greeted. Keep in mind, there's only about 10 tables in the whole place.. All in one small room.  The food here is bland. Gross. The steak taco and burro we ordered were both full of gristle. Also got a specialty burro with shrimp. Blah. All bland with no flavor. For having menu prices on the higher end of the spectrum, you would expect a better location. Scary!!!   The only deserving star for this place is their salsa's. They do a good job with the salsa, I must admit.  But I don't see myself going somewhere JuSt for the complimentary salsa.  Do yourself a favor and go a couple blocks over to EL Nopalito's

SDcaDqeBe4k1eROVnOPeqg.text: Great gourmet tacos! Recommend the brisket one on the street taco menu. The pecan salsa is very tasty as well! Classic margarita-phenomenal! Wonderful lunch spot.

Wsup5ASienFSuY1LRhuUTA.text: Loved their Mole Burro. The sweetness of the mole mixed with a nutty spice flavor was the best. Our waiter was very prompt. Their salsa bar is worthy. At least 12 different types of salsa. So soooo good! Great place to eat for the price. Come here.

2CDGe0GMIuunXIwIaMesqw.text: A little hole in the wall...aren't those the best places??  Unique variety of tacos and a salsa bar.  The place is small, so off times or weeknights are best!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YH87dkp_gOuUz_9mm-vzuQ.text: So, mi media naranja and I were flying out of Phoenix early in the morning: we were headed to Boston for a couple of weeks. I didn't want to get up at the butt-crack of dawn to drive up to PHX from Tucson, so we decided to stay the night close to the airport. Of course the normal "what do you want for dinner" conversation started, and we decided we wanted some good Mexican food before we left the desert Southwest. Yelp led us here; when was the last time you saw a 4 1/2 star review with 500-some odd reviews?  Those 4 1/2 stars weren't lying. The salsa bar is ridiculously fantastic! Strawberry salsa? Yes please! I had four helpings of the robano pibil salsa. Chips were sorta warm, nothing incredible; the real star was the salsa. I ordered a couple of al pastor tacos and a Mayan Cochinita pibil. The pastor was delicious, and the Mayan taco?? The pork was mouthwateringly tender and perfectly seasoned. I felt sad when my plate was empty.   My better half had the cabo shrimp taco, which she didn't seem super excited about. The mole taco, however, got her talking; incredibly, she shared a bite with me. I agreed; it was phenomenal.   Service was fast and courteous. I'd take off 1/2 star for using the restrooms as a storage area for extra dining-room chairs. Kinda gross. Overall, though, it was excellent and I am glad we went!

Utm_Aa5PwT8c4hnb2BDKig.text: Love the salsa bar!! Kind of a tight squeeze but worth it.

s6ucl_zhHAdQTAZVjQ6-TQ.text: Hands down, the best Mexican food in the valley! This is the first place I saw the use of cactus in Tacos and it was yum! I am so glad that they have good vegetarian/vegan options.  They have a kickass salsa bar as well. My favorite one was salsa mexicana.  The food was so good that I forgot to take pictures. Sorry, hehe!

JqGsS0FWhZypWe8WnqOzVg.text: I was craving street tacos and this place is as close to the street tacos you will get in Rocky Point. It's a small quaint place but they have such a variety of different salsas I didn't even know existed. The corn tortillas were fresh and the carne asada tacos were extremely on point.  I'll be coming back here sooner than you think just to get my taco fix!

LfIeRhzdU1hjDdu9qQEkTQ.text: This is one of my favourites Phoenix restaurants. The food is delicious and very authentic.

iEPRbxj9ZwA7du7VzQC8Ng.text: The quesadilla was huge and unlike any other quesadilla out there.  Big margs with tons of different varieties.  Gonna go back and try the tacos.  Great staff and cool atmosphere too.

ZuGCSPYGAkNPufXC8grVRw.text: My family & I ate here for breakfast after the Phoenix heart walk. Being a weekend the place filled pretty quickly. We arrived shortly after the restaurant opened so we quickly greeted and seated. If you're a first timer the place is small, not much space in between table, be weary if you have younger children. We were given a breakfast menu along with the standard menu. Our daughters had pancakes and scrabbled eggs which they both loved. I am the biggest fan of their horchata. I absolutely love it and sometimes stop by for just that. I order the egg Benedict with the option of red or green chili pork. I told the waiter I wanted red chili and he repeated green. I corrected him and requested red chili. Again, this is a smaller place but busy, so don't expect your food quickly. When our food arrived my entire plate was cold. The side of beans were not warm, but cold. My Benedict, also cold and not red chili but green. The poached egg was more boiled as the yoke was solid and not runny.   I've eaten here before and I have to say this visit was disappointing. I may only return for the horchata or dinner but never again for breakfast.

js3pGRqNJBWGUYTxw1rCPw.text: Stop reading and GO HERE NOW! Best tacos ever. No really, they also have a crazy awesome salsa bar.... SALSA BAR! Why are you still reading? GO!

Rp94sanOmMA6yjohsq_TAg.text: This place is just ok. Tables and seats are very close to each other, kind of hard to get through to get to the salsa bar.   We ordered a lonche and a quesadilla and they were ok. Not bad, but not super good either.   We also ordered a santisimo remedio, a drink with grapefruit, lime, tequila and soda. Well, let's just say I should've just ordered a cup of ice with just a bit of tequila. My husband ordered a non alcoholic one and he got a lot more drink than I did.   Overall, the place is ok. It didn't leave us wanting more. It has fame because Guy from drivers and dine-ins visited. That's what caught our attention.

u4I_f1dE2-VLwpFM8u2BrA.text: Really really slow service. The food was good. I recommend the oaxacana mile taco. I don't mind waiting for gourmet tacos (they post blunt signs warning "we're making your gourmet tacos as fast as we can") but I do mind waiting for water.

adkIfXI4O4VJ0p9W_UpiaA.text: went here because I was excited at their vegan reviews of how great their tacos were. When I got here I had no idea how popular this place actually was. There was a 30 minute waiting period, but I expected long wait since we came at 6pm. We wanted to try out their guacamole, but they were already sold out? that kinda saddened me lol.. especially since they ran out of the best salsa in the first 20 mins of us sitting down (least spicy and most flavor). I tried many other ones but none compared. They never bothered to fill it back up either which I didnt understand, but maybe since it was later at night they thought that would be pointless. they were also very busy the whole staff is always running around catering to everyone which I actually loved. The people who work there, work their asses off. I could tell. Plus none of them were rude at all, which is always a great thing because most restaurants dont treat everyone the same. The food was great I cant complain too much. Definitely recommend this for meat eaters though. It caters to vegans with a large selection of options unlike most restaurants, but not the healthiest if you are a real vegan. Corn tortillas aren't exactly healthy, and I have had better fried cauliflower. If you came here with family that wasn't vegan Id say you are safe here for everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. tlaoloc a la carte, mexica ahuacatl, and cauliflower al pastor all vegan tacos

AkH0LRcwCzF7a0fQukpwVQ.text: We have been to many Mexican places (around the nation) & found this one on yelp.. it's very authentic (not Americanized), it has the right amount of heat. Loved the salsa bar, their tacos (loved the Jamica shrimp one but Mahi fish & Mexic Mignon were ok). Beans & rice had good flavor. My husband really liked his burrito...I was a little skeptical about getting their tramarind margarita but was one of the best margaritas I've ever tasted. Waitress & their service were equally good. Definitely going back here and trying other things on the menu.

dMCExZ8yGSXrZOpmoUirmQ.text: Wow lots of choices for Salsa at their Salsa bar. Food was very well done-good flavor and decor is really fun here!

x6CkdwRUuqiFNxOFWcEe3A.text: I was in town for business and tried this place out based on previous yelpers. There is a salsa bar which has multiple options to supplement the flavor of your dish. I tried the carnitas burrito and it was probably the best burrito I have ever eaten. The presentation was very good as well. Also - I was there during happy hour and got a YUUGE margarita for less than $5. I'll be back next time I am in town

0c4xti4IqE86yB1wrE56mg.text: I have been here a few times and always felt satisfied after each visit. I love the atmosphere and the design of the dining area, great art. The baja shark tacos and quesadillas are to kill for. huge variety of different salsas and the horchata is a one of kind with pecans and pieces of fruit. The waitresses are always attentive and polite. Nice selection of beers as well.

0RHDMlPGD4-cnuzFHIU6wg.text: The Gandhi burrito was amazing!!! I substituted the rice for cheese and it tasted delicious!!! Everyone raved about the salsa bar, but the salsas seemed old and noone was refilling them, it was a great concept but wish it was more fresh! The horschatta was also good, a but pricy but it has fruits and pecans which we never had before! My husband got the tacos which were good but not the best hes ever had. I would def go to get the burrito

yC_nO_9udLUaogr8dVkxmw.text: Me and my partner ate here last weekend for the first time. It was busy, the wait was 20 minutes but well worth it. The prices are reasonable and parking wasn't difficult to find. The food and atmosphere are perfect.

31DFoo-TMicAY0zAJxwqZA.text: Holy Hell is this place fantastic!! Have already been back after the initial visit. I'm still in the process of forgiving the bf for not introducing me to this place before. I mean - seriously - we've been together over a year and he's just now taking me here. I'm still mad (jk).  Haven't done any plates - just a la carte tacos! Because. TACOS!  YUM! And the horchata was outta this world! My goal is to make my way through the taco choices! So far - each one is delicious! And the salsa bar - fantastic!! About 13 different types...peanut, strawberry, pecan, tomatilla, roasted, etc...   The place is small. The staff hard working, friendly & diligent. XTRA tipping highly recommended as they are busting butt.

tOUCbbrmgHFNZvyllBSaXg.text: So good.  I've eaten lunch here a few times and always go back to their veg taco.  So yummy.

ng2w0e0dt3TwvboZ4SNdsQ.text: Ya'll don't understand.  This is it.  This is the place.  This is as good as it gets.  When people say, "Know any real Mexican restaurants?" take them here. When you have people fly in from out of town and say, "Take me to a hidden hole-in-the-wall spot" take them here. When you want to impress a date, your parents, or just have delicious meal... take them here.  If you go at prime dinner time it'll be a 15-30 min wait.  But it's so worth it.  You sit down.  They place a complementary basket of chips and you look to the back where there are 10 different salsas.  Yes ten.  And not this made-in-a-bag BS.  Real fresh stuff.  So you get to experiment with these while you wait for your food to come out.  Next, order the Horchata.  Get only one and share.  They are huge.  Their margaritas are also good. Finally, get something with the black mole and/or oaxacan cheese.    I cannot overstate how amazing their mole sauce is.  All of their food is excellent but the mole... I have no words to describe it.  I have had their black mole tacos, their black mole sandwich and the heavenly Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken Quesa which is more like an empanada.   I am from the Midwest originally.  Before I moved here, I swore off Mexican food.  It was greasy, disgusting, and tasted like hot and salty mush.  This restaurant is probably my single favorite place to eat since moving here 3 years ago.  Treat yourself to this place.  You deserve to know happiness.

tDiQ-mqb3-awBAY_o6Z6gg.text: Tacos the way they should be. I cannot rave enough about this place. Considering myself a foodie that likes to try NEW places all the time, I found myself coming back to this gem on vacation. The mahi mahi and shrimp taco special combo were so unbelievably good, I would rank them above the Grand Canyon. Was I just that hungry?...um no.   Salsa bar is great and there are bottomless chips, margarita was tasty. Service is average, but if you come here for service you have it all wrong!

_L8Y3smyiHNnA03I6SPSVg.text: Love this place. Typically high on my list for taking out of towners out for lunch. Best salsa bar in Phoenix

mpkr1ziH3gJixjwtLQKpcA.text: Super. Rad. Service! Came in during lunch time with one of my employees, and was immediately taken care of by our kind server jasmine. Food/salsa is also amazing of course!

yLsMLWNzmiCXfbBef9_zqQ.text: I really wanted to give this place less stars, because the service took so long. It literally took an hour to get our horchata but it was so worth it. It was like nothing I've ever had before!!! This Horchata had melon, strawberries,cinnamon, walnuts and other fresh ingredients that all came together perfectly. They also serve Mexican Coke Cola which is better than regular Cola.  The quesadilla was far from a traditional flour tortilla. It was some kind of a pita tortilla. It was delicious.   The shrimp tiger tacos were so authentic and cook to perfection. The street tacos taste just like the taco shops in Ensenada Mexico. The rice was cooked with a buttery taste which my taste buds could not refuse and beans were good as well. They have the salsa bar with such a large variety of salsa. The cream salsa, cilantro salsa and the chunky salsa were all wonderful options to put on the shrimp and fish tacos together.   Believe me I wanted to hate this place, But everything they did wrong like take 40 mins to bring food Was so worth it. The place is truly a hole in the wall, crowded with many folks from different walks of life. Worth your time and inconvenience to taste such perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The vibe
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The place will be crowded because the food is good. It&#39;s worth the wait.

7ZvSJfIGiimd3OG9F7zQ5w.text: So people rave about their food here. I had the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco, Cabo Shrimp Taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco and the Santisima taco. They were good. The seafood tacos were basic but good, I wish they put more effort into the slaw they put on them. The other two tacos were shined much more. The big hitter of the meal was actually the salsa. I would come back to this place and just eat salsa and chips it was that good. I had a house margarita and took one sip and non another sip it was gross. Overall stick to the taco, salsa, chips and a beer (don't touch the margarita), stick to that and it will be most likely in your top 10 Mexican restaurants you have ever eaten at.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mifVJNPYqAWew3LDkVIF8A.text: We flew into Arizona, jet lagged and hungry. This taco spot was near by and food network featured it.  Outside the place looked a little sketchy, but inside it looked like a typical taco spot. We got fresh chips to start. And then we ordered about 3 tacos per person (all of them were good!).  The best thing about this place is their salsa bar. They have everything from pico to strawberry to pecan salsa. Some were spicy, some sweet. It's insane. And delicious.  Pretty cool and simple taco spot in Phoenix. Small dining area though, so don't get mad if there's a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsas of every kind

GknuRlFyU8kinIz389IIaw.text: The food is good but it's way over priced and there's not a big menu selection. It's just burritos! Just some good over priced basic burritos

for4eC7F0xe7z80KRULJ5Q.text: Love the vegan tacos and all the variety of salsas offered.  But the service leaves much to be desired.  We have been waiting for our tacos for over 30 minutes and its not even full. Its way past the lunch rush so we are not sure why it is so slow... we are about to leave... Will think twice about coming back here again!

1yDnQYArZWNPrlWI9lyBag.text: Great Salsa Bar!!! Awesome breakfast burritos made fresh :) We also got to try the tiger shrimp tacos, steak tacos.  The service was very friendly and attentive, will definitely come back to try their margaritas!

0U5ZM1K3jEtU3oGnJlgJgw.text: I reserve 5 stars for meals that are  exemplary. This "gourmet" taco shop is truly that. Every bite is a flavor party, including the array of succulent salsas ranging from chipotle to creamy cilantro. The spicy jalapenos are truly spicy, turning me into a fire-breathing dragon for moments after I ate them.  This restaurant does justice to vegetarians, all veggies are sauteed with care and attention to spices. The mole nearly made my partner dance, dark and intricate like a Spanish tango. My Santisima quesa was a revelation, full of flavor and topped with Mexican crema, a thick corn crust that managed not to be greasy.  And the horchata? It's the real deal. We shared a margarita that tasted natural and refreshing, not a bottled mix in the house.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Santisima veggie quesa, amazeballs.

Rlfs0m3G7hABv4BaSL5HhQ.text: Authentic. Original. And a salsa bar that has flavors that put all others to shame.   Parking is limited and the neighborhood is not the best. Come for lunch on a weekday.

fa1AEhP7BmV7FafGkU6Sqg.text: O M G ! ! ! Not what I was expecting. An absolute delight from the moment I walked in the door. Do not miss the salsa bar. What amazing flavors they concocted. Each one unique and complex in flavor. I had the steak sandwich. I understand they make the bread there. It was fresh with a moist and firm inside and a crisp yet delicate crust. The meat was prepared in a way I have never had before but dying to go back and have again. A balance of flavors. I can't wait to go back !!! This place is AWESOME!!

sixWiSTVXcuHr1H8GkqMiQ.text: La Santisma has some loft reviews and on top of that it has been visited by Guy Fieri.  You probably already know that if you're reading this review.  Those two items equate to a chance for a letdown of epic proportions.  I'm happy to report this place lived up to the hype and then some.  It is really small in terms of dining space, so arrive early or be prepared to wait.  Also straddling up to the bar is a good strategy to get seated as well.  The salsa selection is extraordinary - I think there were 10 or so different offerings ranging from pico to sesame.  If you're a lover of all things fire, definitely go for their hotter sauces but beware as these pack a punch.    The menu is loaded with tacos - this is Santisma's speciality.  Very vegetarian friendly but it also has choices if you're feeling like more of a carnivore.  I went with the fried avocado, cactus and la santisma tacos - all were awesome.  These things are big and they come double wrapped in tortillas so definitely keep that in mind.  Santisma also has a wide variety of margaritas available and to top it off - free chips (first serving).  Go!  This place is legit!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. LARGE margaritas with some spice
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All the hot sauce you can desire

wDHhfIHvzCEJn3ipgDpugg.text: Awesome Gourmet Tacos!  Loved the "La Santisima" taco with Steak!!!

EN3TA1jvOVUB9VsKS46Kgw.text: MY FAVORITE place to go for authentic tacos. LOVE their salsa bar too.  I always get their santisma burrito with shark. Grilled (special order so it's not on the menu, but just ask and they will accomodate). I feel like it brings out the flavor of the shark better. I also love getting their tacos (any of them) with grilled shrimp (also special order and not on the menu).   I just don't like deepfried stuff haha but this place is amazing.  Everyone says their guac is great but I think it's overrated. I love that it's chunky and tastes fresh.. but it's sometimes lacking in flavor because they make this in bulk. When making things like this in bulk, it can be hard to evenly spread the ingredients. Skip the guac and invest in another taco!

QKWj7l_IwM4gEsFX4vZlIQ.text: I have to say my experience today was an extreme disappointment.  And it had nothing to do with the food. Unfortunately the service was so bad. It was like pulling nails to get someone to take our order. And to get a refill on my water took entirely too long.   But even worse was the smell of sewage in the back dining room. As soon as we walked in I smelled it. I don't know if there is a leak or what's going on back there, but it was very distracting and made eating there very difficult for me. I thought it was coming from the women's bathroom since it's RIGHT THERE (gross) but it turned out to be coming from the back storage room that opened up into the dining room.   Again food was great, ad my Blue Demon Margarita was sensational.

V4V0izYYTn_O2dQtest96A.text: We were visiting from Sacramento and were very impressed by this humble and amazing location. Hand made guacamole was the bomb. I had the 3 street tacos. Tasty rice and beans. Husband also had tacos.  Three gourmet tacos. whitefish and  meat.  Yum-0. The tequila menu puts  a tequila museum in Sac to shame. Overall super good. Will come back again.

h9S_aPV5ukVbWeE7MxxvKQ.text: How can I not like this place? It has my name written all over it!  I came here on a Saturday night to sample this popular gourmet taco shop. I stepped into the dark interior which had a Day of the Dead decor and filled with ten tables for hungry diners.  The menu is divided into five sections:  Gourmet Tacos or Gourmet Taquetzin Street Tacos Gourmet Burros or Cazuela Bowl  Gourmet Corn - Quesadillas Lonches  I ordered the Al Pastor Burro (spicy pork, salsa, pineapple, veggies) $9 and Daniel got the Tlaloc Vegan Burro (mesquite grilled cactus, caramelize onion, veggies and cheese) $9. Both of them did not have rice or beans inside (a.k.a. fillers) and still kept it hardy but not overstuffed. My Al Pastor had the spiciness and sweetness which you typically find but what made this burro special, was it was grilled on the top and bottom and the fillings were made from high quality ingredients. And for you cheese lovers, you won't find it inside but I'm sure you can request it. The burro was a healthy alternative and the cactus had a nice texture. My only complaint was it needed additional salsa to add to the flavor. Be warned ... take a Beano before this meal!  All meals came with a basket of tortilla chips and unlimited trips to the salsa bar which had at least ten different types of homemade salsa to experiment. Most of them had a kick of spice to it and you can pick from chunky vs. smooth salsas. My favorite was mixing the Salsa Mexicana and Avocado Salsa. Talk about double dippin'! The Salsa Chipotle was also another favorite for us.  Personally, the lighting was a little darker than I preferred during dinner. I wouldn't call it romantic but rather adventurous!  Since it was a busy night, the two servers were on their toes and the wait for the food was reasonable. They had an extensive cocktail list with many of the diners enjoying their margaritas and homemade horchatas.   I hope to return to try the mole street tacos and say I ate at "Santisima"!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al pastor burro $8.97

CsFnA5zHvaSoP_GfO8F9oQ.text: Horchata was really delicious. Had a bit different taste with strawberries, other fruit and pecans. The salsa bar was fun. We enjoyed the Mexican salsa and chipotle salsa.   We got the three taco plate with al pastor and pork. The tacos weren't amazing. The other pork was better than al pastor for sure. We also tried the second burrito down on the menu, enchilada style. It was yummy. Would recommend that over the tacos any day.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. HORCHATA
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Three taco plate. Rice and beans are really good!

XmIjiqSb8AAcvCt3pYIUcA.text: Top 5 taco spots in my books. Double tortilla with ample amount of succulent meat with juice dropping on the plate. Each bite is mouth watering and goes great with my margarita at 11am after a hike. The salsa bar was impressive with over 10 different types. It made me want to salsa dance my way back to my seat and taco about how good the salsa was.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco about my salsa dancing on my tacos

wfQgO_y4qm5D1L1xQOZkDw.text: Service was a little slow and the food was good but nothing out of this world I expected more after seeing the show on diners drives and dives. Maybe I didn't order the right thing but compared to my wife's cooking I would rather eat her Mexican food rather than go there again. Maybe if I'm in the area I'll give it another shot but I'm definitely not going out of my way to go there the only thing that was excellent and off the charts was the decorating very awesome

U9OxfobUXYymgMxJw6w7pQ.text: Good food and good Service. This place has lots of choices when it comes to food. I have been here more than 10 times and I have always ordered something different each time.   They also have a good selection of vegan and vegetarian items.

tR6lzENejzxrLzkWPzg3xA.text: On our last night in Arizona, there was no way we were leaving without trying some bomb Mexian food that everyone raves about.  After some time on Yelp and Google, we came across this restaurant and the sheer number of reviews caught my attention.  Known for their tacos and margaritas, we were on our way to Phoenix.  After a basket of homemade tortillas chips with a buffet of assorted hot sauces and salsas (I liked the jicama one and the Chipotle for a kick) our queso appetizer came.  It was stringy and delicious, super hot in a stone container. My fiancee and I each ordered the 3 taco mix ( I got the baby shark, El gaucho, and mahi mahi.) All was so delicious. I sipped on the tamarind margarita with a spicy salt rim.  Large size for the price and strong. Can not wait to visit again when we're back in the area

I9MLDgtHJLAi4430OntJsg.text: La Santisima is a gourmet taco restaurant located about 3 miles away from downtown Phoenix and was featured in Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins, and Drives (foodnetwork.com/videos/l...).
