In fact, I noticed the signed Diners, Drive-Ins, and Drives memorabilia hanging near the front entrance of the restaurant. There is actually another La Santisima location at Glendale, AZ and one of my friends mistakenly drove to the Glendale location due to miscommunication. Our waiter was someone who just started the job a day ago and he said a lot of people ordered guacamole - I took his advice and it was definitely a great recommendation. Menu: I have tried plenty of street tacos in Los Angeles, but oh boy the La Santisima's menu completely overwhelmed me. There are just so many regional tacos (Yucatan, Oaxaca, Ensenada, Mexico City, Sonora, Baja Sur, Guadalajara City, etc) to choose from! In addition to tacos, the menu also includes lonches (pretty much like torta), burritos, quesadillas, and botanas / sopas / caldos / ensalada. Salsa Bar: 14 different options such as pecan salsa, peanut salsa, cilantro salsa, Cabo salsa, Mexicans salsa, pico de gallo, etc. Each table gets a basket of complimentary chips and extra chip will cost $2.70. HOWEVER, you will also get another basket of complimentary chips if you do order a side of guacamole. *** [Mix & Match Plates (3 tacos with rice & beans) for $13.98 (extra charge if you choose any tacos from the La Santisima Gran Reserva Tacos) - all tacos had two layers of corn tortilla] [Taco 1] La Santisima Specialty (toasted Oaxaca cheese, mushrooms, poblano pepper, onion, spinach, fresh garlic grilled with olive oil, special salsa cilantro served with your selection of meat - steak; extra $0.99 for plate): Excellent and flavorful steak with crazy toppings - this was the best one out of the three I tried. (4.75/5) [Taco 2] Mayan Cochinita Pibil (12-hour slow cooked roasted pork shoulder until fork tender marinated with Achiote Mayan rojo, Mexican herbs, wrapped in a banana leave topped with pickle onions; extra $0.51 for plate): It was one of the Yelp recommendations, but I thought this pork shoulder taco tasted just okay. This was my least favorite taco out of the three. (3.5/5) [Taco 3] Baja Sur Baby Shark (Corn tortilla filled with beer battered wild baby shark cazon, cabbage, salsa cilantro & mayo; extra $0.51 for plate): Well seasoned and tender fish taco. I liked La Santisima Specialty just a little bit more, but I will not shy away from ordering this taco. (4.5/5) [Rice & Beans]: Rice tasted slightly sweet and bean had a slight spicy kick. Both were very good. (5/5) Guacamole (aguacate, cilantro, chile serrano, onion, tomato, mango, jicama, cranberries; half for $6.99): It also came with a basket of complimentary chips. One of the slightly sweeter guacamole that I have tried and I really like it. (5/5) Horchata (Family recipe fruits and pecans; $4.50): Talk about a huge bottle! A very unique horchata with strawberry and a hint of cinnamon. It was a very solid horchata and just slightly sweet for my taste. (4.25/5) *** Recommendations: Don't eat too much chips and get hook on salsa bar or guacamole because you will not have enough room to finish your tacos. Tacos aren't exactly cheap here, but this is really the taco shop for foodies in general.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Signed Diners, Drive-Ins, and Drives memorabilia

Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La Santisima Specialty (steak; top left), Mayan Cochinita Pibil (top middle), Baja Sur Baby Shark (top right) - rice and beans on the bottom
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican salsa on the left and pico de gallo in the middle

J_wwahlE7At6XzbKdaKjpA.text: Very good food and service! Good vegetarian options! Would definitely recommend and would come back again to eat. Very friendly services who had a good laugh with us.

zI-vDl8Gp3Wvs8rlQLGIng.text: One of my favorite spots for tacos. The Gaucho is a winner!  Take time to enjoy the salsa bar. Haven't tried the traditional salsas, too busy with the peanut salsa and the jicama.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Excellent tacos!  Stop here when I&#39;m in town for business. The salsa bar is fun - try the peanut.

OyxGSJHl6dqbqyFeQLv8ug.text: Our group arrived a few minutes early.  We spent a few minutes talking with a bartender.  He explained a bit about the restaurant and made some recommendations.  We spent a few minutes admiring the artwork that adorned the walls throughout the restaurant.    This is really a homey sort of small place, but the variety of choices is impressive.  A large variety of tacos and tortas are the main choices.  Fish, shrimp, chicken, beef and pork are protein choices for Oaxacan mole, Tinga, chipotle, Sonoran and several other flavorings.   The black mole is a standout.  Slightly sweet with a strong earthy flavor - it was a favorite at our table.     The salsa bar has close to a dozen different choices for chipping/dipping and adding to some of the tacos.  My order of Grilled Calabacitas fell a bit short.  You usually don't order this unless you really like it.  Only a few rounds (8-10) of thinly cut zucchini served on a large platter.  A smaller plate would have made these tasty morsels seem like more but actually, more would have made it seem like more!  One of our group is a perfectionist and was put-off by the chipped terracotta plates and platters used as serving pieces.  They seemed very at home with the restaurant's decor.  Mine was scraped clean of any extra bits.  Service was quick and efficient.  They may have been a bit understaffed but our group of six had no complaints.

xPK834huKO7W8ow5b7sPuA.text: With the one exception of my wife's taco. These are about the best I've ever eaten. Legit Mexican food that expands out of the traditional Mexican cookie cutter that most Americans have grown used to. The food here is more of a central mexican style food. Some of the beat Mexican food in town!

pr_ypLxOsEb6GBUx66n5tw.text: Stopped for what I heard was excellent tacos from many people. They were so right!   Hands down, best tacos. I had the fish and chicken Tinga taco and my daughter had the Carne Asada tacos. My came with the most moist and flavorful rice with a lighter side of beans. The chips were served warm and we had a variety of salsas for dipping. The standout salsa has to be the smooth and creamy cilantro. Soooo goooood.  Ok, the fish taco was served with coleslaw. The corn tortilla was doubled and made to perfection. Probably the best fish taco I ever ate. I will dine here again before I leave Phoenix.   Well, came back for dinner and was not disappointed. Tacos rice and beans were delicious. I had a brisket taco that was grilled in shell with seasoning and sauteed onions on the exterior of shell. Yum. This will be a regular stop every time I'm in Phoenix. I've been cooking for years and don't know How do they cook the rice??? It's so good.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trio of tacos with refried beans and rice. Carne asada and pork.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trio of tacos. Fish and brisket taco with re fried beans and rice.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Some sauces from bar

82-sWaVxkaC91WZD8gRSSA.text: I LOVE THEIR TACOS! They are usually pretty busy and the service it kinda slow but the tacos are so good! I've returned multiple times. Plus the salsa bar has a variety of salsas to please every one.

L098f6wKwzZfDhCQUTQUlg.text: A classic Hole In The Wall that is a solid 4.5 to 5.0.  The only ding was the lack of attention after our order was placed. This place has an amazing salsa bar with things like a 7 Chili Salsa, Peanut Salsa (think Vietnamese Peanut sauce crossed with hot peppers - amazing!), Radish Salsa Jicama Salsa (Jicama,  Cilantro and Lime - yum), Pico de Gallio, Green Salsa, Red Salsa.. I think there were 12 in total.  Too bad the chips were a bit stale and not that special.  The gourmet tacos were amazing.  Try the house special asada.  I also had the chicken rings, pastor and a plain asada.   All were hot, juicy and flavorful. This is going to be a regular stop when I am in Phoenix.    There is parking on the side of the restaurant so you don't have to back into 16th.

Jx3W-psMNF1K1Wx3jQoCnQ.text: Excellent Mexican restaurant! I've been living in AZ for 6 years and stopped even trying Mexican restaurants- always disappointed. Not anymore! La Santisima is awesome! Service was excellent! Food was excellent! Drinks were excellent! Pricing is extremely reasonable for the quality and quantity of food you receive.  I rarely give 5 stars, but this is the apex of a Mexican restaurant experience in Phoenix!

70_9si1zls7j8FLn17bO6w.text: I work nearby and have tried this place for late lunch a few times. THE TACOS ARE A MUST. I've only ever ordered the 3 chicken tacos with rice and beans on the side, but it hasn't disappointed each time. The meat in the tacos are juicy, flavorful, and def hits the spot. And yes, the salsa bar is to die for, so definitely try these out if you visit!   The service has been decent each time, although I do think they could do better with being attentive when refilling drinks and overall checking in on customers.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xXicbRcTwVTg6lcbJnq4Tg.text: An excellent experience with great food and service. Without a doubt the best tacos I've ever had. The tacos are thick and filling. Don't forget to pick up salsa at the salsa bar.  All the tacos are loaded. I worked out before and was full with 4 tacos. I tried:  La Santisima Special taco: again loaded with cheese, and steak. A juicy satisfying mess. Would come back for this.  Mariachi loco taco: crispy, toasted shell with tasty barbacoa and onion filling. My second favourite after the La Santisima Special.  Cabo Tiger Shrimp taco. Loaded with juicy battered shrimp. A really good combination with the cilantro and cabbage  Anda Lucia taco: This was my least favourite but it's because I'm not a huge fan of beans. But the chorizo and potato are juicy delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The mariachi loco

wIchHCRRKyDLVXaOmh9byg.text: Great Authentic Mexican food. Employees are friendly and helpful with food suggestions. Love this place.

8KkhrO_4QNJYbx1uvgJNGg.text: Ya'll are as high as our super sweet but (holyeffingshit) slow server with your 5 star reviews. Come on already. I've been twice, both experiences were about 1:30-2p in the afternoon, aka the end of most restaurants lunch rush. The first time, the waiter spilled Sprite on my husband and apologized but never came back to help with it because they were so busy. BUT THAT FILET BURRITO THOUGH. Took damn near an hour but it was so freeeeaking delish. So, I went again, with the same naivete as most of you, hoping it was an off day. W R O N G. Today we waited 10 minutes for water, 15 minutes for chips and 50 minutes for food. 1.5 hrs in total for a (holyeffingshit) $17 delicious chicken burrito plate, some tacos and a horchata.   Being in the industry, I was watching the people around me like a hawk-- I cannot help it. Restaurant management runs through my blood and is 99.8% of the time a curse because I notice every flipping detail and rarely enjoy myself when out to eat. Today, I noticed two servers in a packed restaurant. Maybe 3-4 kitchen staff. No bartender although a lot of booze was being ordered. I watched 3 customers walk out after not being greeted at their table and 9 (yes, nine) take off after waiting at the door for a table for way too long when there were clean tables inches from them. People were making their frustrations known and some were honestly pretty pissed. I am really confused why they don't switch to counter service, it make SO much more sense for their concept.    No mediocre free salsa bar and damn tasty but super overpriced food is worth this kind of service.

y_PRtrjWaaIRUqxxenG69g.text: Rice could be a little better and I wish they had regular salsa other than that so delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-o3z37dDdOpBJjTVjXeT0Q.text: The food is great and the service was excellent, our waitress was so sweet! Strawberry margarita is worth trying, like their taco plate but it was all a bit over priced. $13 for 3 small but tasteful tacos with a side of rice & beans, I however, substituted the beans for an extra side of rice. Authentic Mexican but with a bit of a twist. Salsa bar was unique but the dishes are sample sized and only your first basket of chips are free. The rice is so good, especially if you add some lime juice! Overall good experience but probably won't go out of the way to go back, mostly just because you pay more than you should.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa bar, taco plate, Jarritos, strawberry margarita

O5I5YIL7tbagW9kePpcXxg.text: Met up with Aileen mid week.  A really cute place! I loved the artwork. I had this place bookmarked for the  longest time.   I ordered the fish tacos and they were a-ok nothing stood out for me. We both ordered house margaritas and mine was a little too strong but tasty to Aileen.   If I am ever in the area I might try different menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ar0h6TDLdQ_VmfIG0vzDew.text: Wow! We stopped in after dropping off our parents at the airport and I was blown away. They offer so many types of salsa, the cilantro and pecan were by far my favorite. I had the shrimp tacos, Barbacoa tacos and the best taco I have ever eaten, the nueva espana (roasted pork). We also shared the queso which is literally just a bowl of melted, gooey delicious cheese. I could've eaten the whole thing myself. I absolutely recommend the queso and the espana tacos to anyone who is looking for great Mexican food! It was very busy for a Monday afternoon but it was well worth the wait and the cost. Everyone's food around us looked delicious and they have beers on tap, bottled soda, homemade horchata and tasty looking margaritas! I would love to go back before we move!

4ioHT8wiJ695zcy5CUTbLQ.text: 2,000+ yelp reviewers can't be wrong, right?  Spoiler alert, they weren't wrong.  Every bit as good as the hype.  We went on a Saturday at 6:30 pm and were seated immediately.  The margaritas, the salsa bar, the queso fundido and the TACOS were all top notch.  Food was piping hot and delicious.  My only regret is that it took me as long as it did to come here.  We can't wait to go back.

gJKIZFLBcJa1wVO-bQkmZA.text: Great great great food!! Best guac we have had in a while. Nice and chunky. Had cranberries in it, which I would have though would take away from the taste, but actually made it so much better!! Street tacos are delicious and their salsa bar is amazing. Great food!!!!! Definitely a memorable place.

mDKBhTNUbEDJzRhVPYJ5tg.text: Wonderful food, great service. This place is a must go to. The food is very authentic and presented well. Will come again.

a1hbfCdOVUNEGRAUl4T9AQ.text: Aztec Tinga Tacos were amazing, service was acceptable. The salsa bar is great too. I did't try any cocktails but the food was amazing I will be back.

bELN2GeDV1ZDw1Y6T8_k5Q.text: Yeah, so, everything everyone else is saying about this place is True.  Marvelous tacos, great salsa, cozy and cool.  I had the tacos with chimichurri and pabil (sp?).  I would have ordered more but I had to run back to the hotel for a work meeting.

cIgB2AUO6O4zx62mCYEocQ.text: AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME!!! The place is small and if you have to wait, don't worry it is worth your time.

JE8aZv1pzW9wGNK31pIlig.text: A-freeeeeaking-mazing!!!! Everything's sooooooooo good!!! Seriously authentic and flavorful!!! Mix the pecan salsa with the chipotle salsa - it's bomb!

j6J3XoT8z4zBcvlcZ-dlwQ.text: Can fill up on the salsa bar and out of this world horchata alone! The street tacos and bullet burrito are all amazing. Margaritas are mixed well.

9_zbQMZB5DMyY_l6EPE6-g.text: One of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to. The taco bar was awesome...we went crazy over it! Special mention for cilantro, pecan, guacamole salsa. Th e main course was also really good. Tried the fish taco and I wasn't dissapointed and hubby was happy wi th his chicken taco. Portions are generous and best part about this place is that they have a lot of options for vegetarians.we will be coming back here for sure :)

UHOh-mXUyocAonTDkyjUZw.text: Excellent quality! This may be the very best food for the value one can get in the valley!  The carne asada was incredible and seldom do I eat the beans and rice, but they were both amazing too!  Very good - I can't wait to return.

-0fJ9e_3Jt-BE21gqWM4AQ.text: Absolutely delicious. Fresh ingredients that don't hide under heavy sauces. Great alternative to the regular taco shops.

ciWgLCmgH5wrN3QtR3rS6w.text: Dear Condesa, I wish you had a few more vegetarian items, and that you didn't get all persnickety and confusing about the whole torta/lonche thing, because that led me into an ordering error. However, bygones. While I didn't love my veggie lonche, it was obviously very fresh and prepared with care. Also, please refill the salsa bar more frequently so that I won't be tempted to get too much of the really spicy ones and burn the he** out of my mouth. And put more tequila in the (non-happy hour) margaritas. Thank you! Amalia C. P.S. Your chairs are too heavy. P.P.S. In reflection, maybe this was more of a 2-star for me personally but my husband really liked his street al pastor and carne asada taco plato and again, it all seemed fresh. So I bumped you up. You're welcome!

RBk7w4jafg5OTip8XvNCWQ.text: cool place! I really enjoyed myself at La Condesa Taco Shop. The food was fresh, and the place was very relaxing.   The bar is impressive with unique styles of salsa.   I ordered a shark taco and the cochonita pork taco. Great choice! The food was very tasty and fresh. I highly recommend this place.

NQ7Dn7gqCklRFQtwLbBEVg.text: Great sign.... Um couple of the salsas were ok.... Chips were spot on...Service was great! Food not so much. I think there trying too hard to be like barrio cafe and honestly fall short. Guy Fieri was too nice. If you like a gringo taco u will love it. I prefer real flavor and authenticity.

7_Rm7UxyBdj4qLUFx-rHXQ.text: Al Pastor street tacos are where its at!!  Solid margaritas.  Hole in the wall place with a good vibe.

TZxvV2ac1INqz_05KmOLDA.text: Simply my favorite tacos in Maricopa County. We've sampled several different types and they all were amazing! Great for lunch and we got quick service. They also took our large family group even though the space is limited. You should go.

-MHJ4RjzsWnSa1LsitQ8bw.text: The space is tiny. Like the variety of salsas. BOMB Horchata. Food was good. Would try it again.

9X6ZQMfwm4gwoh_siYAPDw.text: We tried this spot last night for dinner. First impressions were not good. The lighting is horrible. The restaurant layout is over crowded and the lack of ambience is just sad. Now with all of that said, the food was delicious! The salsa bar was a lot of fun. We enjoyed trying several types of salsa while we waited for our food. Unfortunately, the waiter did not put our two courses in properly, so after waiting an hour, everything came at once. This was only after we asked about it. The waitress apologized and did comp our beverages. We are our entrees and wrapped up the first course to eat the next day. We will try it again and hopefully they won't be as busy or their kitchen will have their act together.

zFyP1-pg5IDPsDgJD-WSFg.text: Worst service ever. I had chunks of bone in my chicken burrito, and no one came to check back to ask us how the food was. On top of that the place was small and claustrophobic, there was 3 groups of screaming kids that echoed the entire time we were there. I would not recommend this to anyone!!!

lztTJhYOWMdxGHq61Izc9w.text: Really good - fresh food!  Lots of variety in what to order and what salsas to get.  Even my 2.5 year old loved his ginormous quesadilla.  We will be returning.

5m5wM5BI8VMEiubLa5zpRw.text: Simple, best shrimp taco's! Love this place!

jF23L0wS8Rf_75clHyNJJQ.text: Hands down the best Mexican Food I've had in AZ! Not your typical greasy, heavy Mexican food. Everything is so fresh and delicious. They have a huge salsa bar with a variety of salsas. Their margaritas are delightful. I highly recommend if you're craving something a little south of the border.

uxgIJzdQO-2OpOlrV3PfQQ.text: The Yelp rating is what made me drive out of my way to pickup a late lunch. If I were just driving by this shop I would have never stopped.  I ordered a three taco plate with three different tacos. I do not remember the names, but they were ALL excellent! I ordered a Quesadilla. It is different from the Americanized version but I did not care for it. Love all the salsas!

1HvVSMhNx1P_wM_Kd5V02Q.text: Food was very good, actually. The only thing I didn't care for was that the salsa bar wasn't very full, and they didn't pay much attention to it. They were busy though, so it wasn't a deal breaker. I still enjoyed my food, though.

dJxWY3Xy0JyAxyZJTTR6mA.text: Hands down best tacos! They have quesadillas and burritos as well (I think they added sandwiches recently but I don't know for sure). Anyhow, the quesadillas are fried, so if you shy away from fried food, don't even go there. The salsa bar is the best I've ever seen and I enjoy mostly all of what they have available. I like the arracherra taco, the tinga taco and the guacho taco. Perhaps I have spelled those incorrectly, I'm not sure but whatever you get it's going to be good. I do not however, like the beans. I don't know what it is or why, I just don't like them. I do like the rice with the corn in it but generally speaking I just get the tacos a la carte. OH and the Horchata? OMG, get it I promise you even if you don't like Horchata you will probably like this. It is huge though and has fruit and nuts and wow, it's just good. I like the Jamaica (sp?) juice too, but who doesn't :-P... Obviously, I don't speak spanish sorry for my awful spelling. Everyone should try it here, but they are small and get busy so try to find a time not everyone will be going to eat.

XHYsU2zLfNZhoADcSVgpKg.text: It's been almost 11 hours and darn it if I'm not still thinking about that mahimahi burrito. So fresh. So tasty with the various salsas. So awesome that it's just down the street and I can come here whenever I want and spend WAY too much time choosing the salsas I think would best compliment my meal. It just don't get much better than La Condesa, and that's coming from me, and me has a pretty serious taco/burrito issue, as in I always want them and I always want them.

zImCVM9Cv-qIJmkYJhZHBA.text: Another hidden treasure in the valley of the sun. I went there for lunch and it was packed,  food was great as always.

ke6N0eqtVSNRzHpKCguwAQ.text: For shame.   For shame.  Ok, this review is not to talk about the food at La Condesa .  I am a huge huge fan of the food and service, and everything else about this place except one thing.  While eating with a friend from Tucson, he recognized the art on the walls as being the art of famous San Francisco artist Sylvia Ji.   So we called the owner over to ask about the artist.  She told us all the art was by Mexican artists Manuel Gilavalos y Garcia and Ricardo Ramirez.   These are obvious reproductions of a young artist who is currently very hot and exhibiting all over the world.   How has La Condesa gotten away from this for so long?        The owners probably have no idea, but this is some shameful shit, and as great of a reproduction as it looks and makes the little restaurant feel,  Sylvia should be notified and should cease and desist on these "artists".      Google Sylvia Ji  and check the La Condesa website and compare the art, and you'll see what Im talking about.   One of the paintings in there is an EXACT replica of one of her paintings.

kr-kIY6EcV4rv-EvNn4xnQ.text: The tacos are $4 a pop (I guess that's why they call themselves a "gourmet" taco shop), but they're worth every cent. I came here twice and tried much of the taco menu. My favorites were: cabo shrimp, fish, mayan pibil, arrachera and guacho. This place has the best salsa bar I've found in Phoenix so far, too. Great house margarita as well!

MeXC4i0x7fJNNFfY0mzmsA.text: The salsa bar alone would make this place phenomenal! Our favs were the Salsa Strawberry and the Salsa Cilantro. My only advise for this place would be to just order one taco al a carte because we had so much chips due to the quality of the salsa we were stuffed. The horchata is home made and the best I've ever had! They top it with cinnamon, pecans, strawberries, & cantaloupe. It sounds weird, but it was very good. They also use extremely fresh, crisp cabbage on their tacos. It was very impressive! My boyfriend had the pork shoulder "quesa" which is actually a fried quesadilla and that was also very very very good. We will be back.  My ONLY complaint is that I ordered two different tacos & got two of the same tacos... But it was still very delicious & we will go back to try anything else that sounded good.

_SX9j_OEtT56xbuiZd0O1Q.text: Ate there today after golf w/husband & his best friend, took some coaxing to get them into small place in not so best area ...but SUCCESS! Tacos were great, salsa bar & chips awesome, fun for all. Like posted elsewhere, SMALL noisy but worth it.

sEz-qiqSHSMMXOCSsdu9cw.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my visit here.  The layers of flavors in my Al Pastor, Tinga and Carne Asado Tacos were awesome!  My only complaint was I was expecting it to be less expensive based on the single $ on yelp.  I think this should be updated to $$.  (I didn't mind paying what I did at all, it was totally worth it, but the expectation based on what I had read here was in my head.)

ms1pq7hxhNID5iljiubSeA.text: I could go there just to eat chips and salsa, very good! The tacos are really good too. Small little place with great service and great food.

JmE8LhEH-1r9S8D_EYTbtg.text: Everything was really good. We loved the salsa bar with all the interesting choices.  Carne asada tacos were great. Can't wait to come back and try the fish tacos.

upqoAILAKkIGsIZ1xZ6BDA.text: I couldn't put off my ravenous feelings anymore after leaving work the other night and pulled over at La Condesa. I had been meaning to try it for quite some time. So what if I was a party of one. Satiation is more important than social appearances. The place is in a mildly sketchy area next to a little market that sells pinatas and a few groceries. To me, this actually lended the place some street cred. Anyway, I like how the restaurant's interior has none of the feeling of a Baja Fresh or Chipotle yet the prices are pretty reasonable. The dining room doesn't look like it can fit too many people so I'm wondering what it's like on weekends. The bathrooms were reasonably clean and I got a kick out of the whole lucha libre motif in the bano for the chicas.   I had a pork mole burro with the mole made with chocolate and nuts. Muy sabrosos but the meat was a tad salty or too kicky, not sure if it was the tanginess or salt that had me asking for more water. But I think that is more a matter of personal taste buds, not the reflection on the cooking. I found the meat quite tender. And I felt like a wimp only being able to eat half the burro. Next time, I will probably do the two-taco deal. There was only one gal doing all the bills and service. She was quite nice.   But what will make me come back again is their awesome salsa buffet. It makes the salsa trays at chain restaurants look like plainer, less adventurous salsitas. I had the strawberry salsa (sweet yet salty), jicama, cilantro (my favorite but found if you have too much too soon, you'll feel lit) and peanut. It got to the point where I had to tell myself "no more chips" so I simply sucked the salsa off a chip like it was a spoon. Yup, it reduced me to that. Anyway, I do need to go back and get some more ideas of the food. But for now, I'm a fan.

YIFx6eoozAgrtID6hiPDMg.text: Food was absolutely delicious - we ordered the shrimp tacos and a beef burrito- and very reasonably priced! Comfortable atmosphere, polite servers, and amazing horchata!

vfIu_qAaJHAvBGVdhC2Gnw.text: the service wasn't the greatest, but their salsa bar makes up for it... and their guacamole is the bees knees the place is rather small so it wouldn't be the best choice if you have a large group. also, get the horchata! it's really big and pretty sweet so it's something you could totally share with a friend :)

MP48MLatQZZPEUDPYVTjfA.text: Seriously fantastic. Friendly. Delicious. Salsa bar. Enough said!

OyhYb0j-WjVGkNV4YlXYEg.text: wow!  i have never been to a taco shop like this!!!!!!  outside of the restaurant looks like in the ghetto and a little hard to find.  there is parking in front, side and across the street of the restaurant.  the ambiance is really nice.  cool paintings on the wall and very small and only a few tables available.  since the restaurant is small it gets real noisy.  oh and plus a bar with seating.  during lunch this place fills up fast.  once you sit down someone will bring some chips.  next, you walk yourself over to the salsa bar to select from the 14 salsas available.  kinda cool and different.  i'm a wuss when it comes to hot stuff but gave it a shot.  i loved the strawberry salsa and it was dang good!  when you order you need to place your food order at the bar.  we ordered the mayan cochinita pibil taco and oaxaca black mole chicken shark taco.  for too adults i thought it was pricey for 2 tacos per plate with a small portion of beans & rice.  all freaking good but a little too spicy for our taste buds.  for the record we still loved it.  this place is AWESOME!

zW8Tuiz1rzAnZLFk153N8g.text: I saw the good reviews on here and decided to try it today. I was not a fan of the food at all. I left hungry because I decided not to eat my street tacos, they were still bleeding from the meat. My 3 year old loved his quesadilla though. It can be that I'm use to more authentic mexican food. I would have rather stuck with my instinct and went to salsita or El Taquito. This food is for people who has never tasted good mexican food. I wouldn't recommend this place to a hungery latino. Also its not kid friendly. Very very small inside. Everyone that left didn't look happy for some reason.

bJA-gn5tIOiADrr0T7zTjA.text: The salsa bar IS the best in phoenix. Just tried the Napoleon taco made with filet mignon: loved the sauce with mushrooms and crunchy onions, as good as what you would find in a fine dining restaurant. This will be my new favorite along with the cabo shrimp taco: big fresh and juicy shrimp fried to perfection! I also love their quesadillas...not like anything you would get anywhere else.

td8gAE-vn6kwBD9yuIqMzQ.text: Went to La Condesa around 630PM on a weeknight and drove right by it a couple of times. No lights on outside at all. The parking was kind of scary as well.  On to the food. The Shark Taco was good until I ran into a huge piece that was so tough that I couldn't get my teeth to sink into it. The carne asada tacos meat was a bit tough and cold. The pork taco was pretty good and the meat was tender.  The salsa bar was the most interesting and yummy thing in the place. I loved the cilantro salsa the most.  If you go there you may want to pick a time when it's a little more busy. Not sure if my food was at its best since it was just before dinner? Not sure. I will give it another try though. Each taco was about 3.50 each. There are a lot better taco joints in the area though.

Ky0C3_T9rjcpXA0aYC5bQw.text: If you're a fan of big fancy, red carpet joints, this is not the place for you. The service is not good, it is understaffed, the restaurant itself is small and there are a boat load of people there. If you like eating some kick ass Mexican food though, this place tops the list. I had the pork and bean burrito with a side of their chipotle salsa. The meat was so tender and the flavor was so developed, I wept a little with each bite. This is on my radar for the next time I come out to Phoenix.  Just hope they find a bigger location or open a taco truck.

FZOHN0DgNSVTOjjBaiFefg.text: La Condesa, I give up on you. We try and try to excuse the terrible service, but no more. It's not worth it. It's too slow and inattentive and they just don't give a damn, so I'll take my $33 elsewhere.  This time we were disappointed by the food, too. We returned our horchata for being too thin and tasteless, and you brought us new ones after we finished eating. You drizzled a pretty crema all over the top of my torta (sorry, lonche). How do I pick it up and eat it?   In the past we forgave the dirty tables and loudness because your cochinita pibil was pure bliss. But not even that makes up for the service. :(

IHqugwDyx-1Tl5bPAGiPxg.text: I have been here twice now and both visits were great. I love the Salsa Bar they have with fresh homemade salsas. Both visits I ordered Taco plates. I have had the Tinga Chicken and the Carne Asada. The Chicken was much better. I have also had the mahi taco and a shrimp taco. Those were amazing. Their Horchata is delicious as well as their rice and beans that accompany their Taco Plates. I highly recommend this place. I hear their margaritas are great too. I will be back.......many more times.

5Qj_88vNeUXnku4dX3C_oQ.text: Like everyone else said, the atmosphere and artwork are what really make the place! We ate around 7pm and luckily we only had a 5 minute wait but I could see there being a long wait during the dinner rush since there's limited seating. I highly recommend the guacamole dip, I have no idea what's in it but it's so unique and delicious (I think it has mangoes and cranberries?). I also had the shark tacos which were good!

X0Bmsske0KfYVIHaSFlSpw.text: La Condesa is amazing.  I'll keep this review short and sweet...  Short wait is well worth it.  Horchata is amazing The Mahi Mahi Burro might change your life... if i wasnt already in a relationship with the Jalapeno Cilantro Hummus from Pita Jungle, i might actually try to make love with this burrito.    Everything about this place is great.  Eat here... if you don't, you are probably crazy... maybe you are the dude at Circle K that is always talking to himself by the dumpster...  That dude creeps me out a little bit.    So, i guess the moral here is:  Eat at La Condessa, so you don't end up talking to a dumpster.  That is all.

0x4e5vF-lrmR6X1YDBX6dg.text: Finding someone who can make better mole than I can deserves 4 stars.  My absolute favorite is the chicken mole burrito.  The chickens mole burrito is just that- loaded with lots of shredded chicken, minimal rice in a flour tortilla.  The burros are gigantic and the drinks are gigantic.  I cannot comment on any other items as I am extremely satisfied with the mole and don't venture far from it.  I think you can order chicken mole tacos but I am unsure.  The salsa bar is tasty, too.    Apparently there is a Happy Hour on weekdays.  I noticed Tequila behind the bar but didn't see any beer and am unaware of what the Happy Hour entails.

sd7n1EGkO6K9aZxRWbCp-w.text: Tried the tacos and their unique quesadillas. Two thumbs up - though my waistline might not appreciate too many of those fried quesadillas, lol. They'll have to be a treat - not a regular thing for me.  Their salsa bar is a lot of fun. Be prepared to spend some time sampling all of them.  Gotta love the dia de los muertos decorating. Unique!

6cOibkJYeOEV7WizmkZ52w.text: Best bean & cheese burrito in town!  And, the salsa bar is fantastic!  Try the pecan salsa... Its delicious on everything!  Sometimes the servers seem unorganized/overwhelmed so, you'll need to be patient.

ZFDN04iWQ24jykh-qeuWEg.text: Strawberry salsa?? I've never heard of such a thing....but damn it's good! It's like chips and salsa...for desert! Fish tacos were on point, flavorful and plentiful. Topped it off with a premium margarita and I tell you what, that was the best meal I ever had! Now, for a place that has such good food, they got no where to sit. There is like 4 tables here and the bar, so try and go here during a not-so-popular time during the day to eat. Being able to sit back and enjoy all the food here is well worth it. The art on the walls are cool too.

Vw3YGBuJVuvjGoPDeaIFaw.text: BEST HORCHATA EVER!  I've never liked horchata, but I was told this was the best of the best and I absolutely had to try it.  So, I did and I am SO glad that I did.  I would go back for the horchata alone.  Amazing.  I'm already planning a trip back just for the horchata!  I get the 3 street taco combo with rice and beans.  I've had the carne asada, al pastor and cochinita.  The carne asada was delicious and the cochinita was good, but my absolute favorite was the al pastor.  It's the best al pastor taco I've ever had!  The salsa bar is awesome.  My favorite is the tomatillo and my friend loved the chipotle.  It has something for everything and it's all fresh.  All in all - a great little place (emphasis on little - probably not great for a large ground of people).  The food is authentic and very, very good - I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong here.

0QapxTtzVZnheVWjDnABDg.text: I am an Arizona native and taco lover, and I have to say that this is the best taco shop in the Valley. They offer a ton of unique menu options rather than just run of the mill fare, and the salsa bar is great. In addition to your standard salsa varieties, La Santisma has stuff you won't find anywhere else like creamy cilantro salsa and pecan salsa. Plus, the staff is super friendly and helpful. Just be warned, it's a small place, so you may have to wait for a table during peak times.

UIlG72xuDSEGuUkAGqd6Nw.text: The BEST in Phoenix: Fish tacos (beer battered with cream sauce) Horchata (contains fresh fruit and pecans, yum!) Salsa bar (includes peanut and strawberry salsas)  The owner is this cute little lady who is always very nice

SWExMuj9bmg3TGrcNSBppw.text: This is an excellent small restaurant.  They have great vegan options and huge salsa bar providing a wide range of flavors.  We will come back here in an instant.

CFJz7rDSsLI7Sw7lkc9czw.text: This place just keeps getting better and better. They have updated their menu which now includes red and green chili. I tried the red chili and it was amazing and truly unique. Also, great margaritas! Still one of my favorite places!

YY6VoFA8Vao9wmpyrmJMnw.text: Loved the salsa bar with all kinds of fresh and unique salsas! Pecan, Jicama, Peanut, and Radish to name a few and I'm not usually a fan of tomatillo but it was really good. I had the steak and the black chicken mole tacos- the steak was on the dry side and lacked flavor but the salsa helped kick it up the few notches to where it needed to be. The space is small and tight, but with a cool modern Mexican decor. It looks like there is room to expand which I hope they get around to soon. We went for lunch and it was crowded and cramped. Service was good and attentive.

OlXjF3X4lou4R_l1Qtlizw.text: The tacos were amazing!!! When you step inside you'll think you are in Mexico. Everything from the art to the bar is authentic. The salsa bar has so many exotic selections that you will salivate over. The menu even caters to vegetarians. The tacos and burros are amazing. I will be a regular here and you should be too! Oh yeah and Alfredo makes killer margs!

bsGQyxFOQgIsOxdU6_dcIQ.text: Looking for something different when you crave "Mexican?" Try this little gem. You will never be disappointed. Promise!! (Start with anything al pastor.)

KBdJRrGyAAsVjDnhQNTiVA.text: My profound love of Mexican cuisine and a bevy of shining Yelp reviews of this place led me here last Saturday night. My BF and I arrived just after 7pm, which was perfect because just after we ordered the place filled up- fast!  The salsa bar is fantastic! Some of my fave's were the peanut, chipotle, strawberry and a chunky dark one who's name escapes me..... But really they were all good.  The very best taco that we tried was the Cochinita Pibil (sp?) It was heavenly- packed with meat that had a kind of smokey, kind of mole/chocolaty taste- it was incredible. All the taco's we had were great though. To start with- the tortillas are so freaking good on their own, and they pack the meat inside of them. I'm getting hungry just thinking about them.  Lastly, my BF is a lifelong connoisseur  of quesadillas, so we ordered a steak one to split. Holy crap- it was a monster! They split it up for us but it looked like we ordered two of them! Humongous! It resembled a strudel pastry! Big, flaky and lightly drizzled with something white, sour cream maybe? I dunno, but it was to die for!  Even the next day when we reheated our leftovers this cheesy doughy meaty concoction was still fantastic! The chicken tinga burrito was almost BETTER the following day! (Maybe because it didnt have to compete with any tacos)!   All in all we were very satisfied and will definitely be back. I would like to wait for a bit cooler weather though, because the place is quite warm inside. That is why I only gave it four stars.

EuhBuEeLS9JXiXT0CSkthg.text: Awesome food, great service! Love the guacamole. The lighting outside the restaurant is not so good, so we passed the place twice. Once inside, everything we ordered was great! Tacos with mole, El Pastor tacos, steak tacos and - did I mention - guacamole! A must do in Phoenix. Go now!

1KTej2FDeVXiEY3O4U52_g.text: Street taco were excellent. The rice and beans that came with the tacos were very good. Tastes very authentic. The shark tacos were also very good. They also have a fantastic salsa bar. It's a small place but you can usually get a seat with a short wait.

EmHcU28hlk5o4eMim8qOtw.text: My first time here and I am still waiting on 4 tacos, 35 minutes later. These tacos better be worth it!!!! Great horchata.

xrazwCnwOUu4O0xDWj_CLg.text: My favorite Mexican food in Phoenix. This is a must try. The salsas for the chips are outstanding also the burritos. I always get the gaucho, is to die for. Great job, thank you.

yVV4jInMeSFUpwYYyj6pmg.text: Just go here. You won't be disappointed.  The atmosphere is cozy and hip with rustic tables and chairs and dia de los muertos artwork lining the walls. The staff is FRIENDLY. I can't emphasize that enough. I have been for lunch and they handle the crowds well. At dinner, and during slower traffic times, they are very attentive and ensure that you have everything you need.  The food. Where do I begin. I will start with the amazing salsa bar. They have about a dozen salsas per day. Fresh. My favorite is the seven chile salsa which is simply roasted chiles and red onions. They are all amazing though.  As far as the tacos, I have only ever eaten the pibil and the mole, and that's because they are so good, that I can't branch out yet. Every time I go, those are the ones I am craving. The pibil is so good that it makes me fully appreciate Johnny Depp's character in "Once Upon a Time in Mexico" having such a love of good pibil.   If you go at lunch, go before 11:30 to beat the crowd. This is one of my favorite places to eat. Hands down. Get some horchata to go as well. They top it with fruit and pecans. Yum!

urbq69YBmizjXJott5lZAw.text: In area for personal reason. Asked a local where to find some good eats. Without hesitation he said "La Santisima"! Easily found the building using smartphone maps. Walked in on a Saturday afternoon to a bustling restaurant that is so small I had to chuckle. Without looking at a menu ordered 3 fish tacos and a bottled coke. While waiting, i loaded up on the condiments. Got my order in a reasonable time and bicycled to Coronado park to feast. Hands down, the best fish tacos i have had. California, Hawaii and New Mexico cannot compete with these fish tacos. Did not know this "gem" was featured on D,D & D. Any person who fails to give 5 starts is just being a pinche pendeho. And the neighborhood is NOT SKETCHY!!! Brown people don't bite. You can't ask for better food, faster service or tastier condiments.

UflIPC1tFXMEW2gackEcEQ.text: the food was good, but not great. the horchata; however, is one of the best i've ever tried. i could come back just for that.   the real reason why this place gets 2 stars instead of 3 was how the manager dealt with our issue. my friend ordered the filet mignon taco plate and the menu clearly said it was 15.99. We got our bill and it says 21.99. So we asked why and she said it's because they changed the menu. Well.. not the 4 menus that we were given. Instead of fixing it, she argued with us and tried to find a menu with the new price. when she couldn't produce one, she said she would need to call the owner blah blah. seriously?! and then she takes another 15minutes talking on the phone with the owner, I'm assuming, instead of dealing with her waiting customers. left such a bad taste in my mouth. in the end, she changed the charge to 15.99, to which i left a $6 tip and a scathing note on how they can have their money back. we will never return to this place.

sa-fIx0wMSEa3dzHgL5NtA.text: This place is delicious we got tacos and a burrito both came with plenty of meat and choice of rice and beans. The salsa bar is amazing so much to choose from and the staff is super friendly. This place is also family friendly which is a plus since it's very difficult to go out with a baby. Will definitely be returning.

dFrCJqXDUHU-97FNHJ47HQ.text: Tacos with unique ingredients, salsa bar with endless options. Need I say more? So delicious. Quaint and cute inside. Delicious! And reasonably priced. Two tacos with beans and rice for around $10 and it's plenty of food.

VfDpCQ3Vg9ZzDuvQ7qwAPg.text: Excellent food.  We ordered 4 different kinds of tacos and all were simply superb.  You must hit the salsa bar in the back wow there are some great creations back there.  We must have made 5 trips.  Service is super friendly and fun.  Margaritas not bad.  Come for the food the decor is fun but overall not over impressive. When back in Phoenix I'll be back soooo good!

AejsH_iCi7HDUfSjgVh_Kw.text: For the last several months America's Taco has ruled the downtown Taco scene.  Now just across the neighborhood a new rival emerges.  Not since Magic and Bird graced the hardwood have we seen the seeds for so tasty a rivalry.   From the great Mexican artesenia laden decor to the great service to the impeccable salsa bar- try the strawberry or peanut salsa- the place is top notch. The menu is diverse so it merits several repeat visits for purposes of exploration.  I'm still a novice but I am completely sold on the cochinita pibil.  The pork is as tender and flavorful as anything you will get up the street at the Barrio Cafe.   The place is still young.  But the rate at which incredible reviews surface on Yelp , it is testament enough that it deserves your patronage.

DLYpQ-5YmIiyMbb7PsnzaA.text: Some of the best Mexican food I have had in AZ. Only thing I would love for them to do is give bigger bowls for your salsa in case you really want to dunk a chip but I still managed anyway! Amazing drinks! I will be back again and again!

whspwkl6zSkukxew9gzSCw.text: so so so glad I can walk here. Excellent food, tiny place, great atmosphere.  Salsa bar is unparalleled

hzbKSuBFD_TKrTQoNI47GQ.text: Went here for lunch - it was packed but service was quick and we were able to share a table with another group. Taco selection is excellent. Highly recommended.

zTSdtmZklfLJS3jTf34hXw.text: Absolutely first rate, best Mexican (Oaxacan) food in town. Best I have ever tasted! Incredible flavor profiles. This is not your typical Mexican fair, it is bistro chef quality. Highly recommended!

Y6n9R5-F3-eLPqINJpuCIQ.text: Was is good.. Yes Did it blow me away.. No  I arrived here about 4:45pm Monday evening. It was me and the photographer for AZ Republic.   I look over the menu and the salsa bar and man did it look good. I was hoping there was a sample platter or something but the best I could come up with was the 2 Taco meal.   I opted for the Chicken and the pork, one of each.   What I liked:  -Chips with out having to order them separate.   -Tacos full of meat.  -Staff was nice -Rice and Beans were good.  -The salsa bar...way cool  Meh:   -Corn shell was overcooked on 1/2 (one side) -meat was boring without salsa, good thing there is like 20 to choose.   It seems like the upscaled two hippies and it worked! 3.5 out of 4

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and pork rice and beans
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cilantro Cream, Peanut, Strawberry, something, Jimica, something and something. LOL

Bg9XRlmO5Fu5c7lCVSrLkg.text: Is there a secret door I don't know about? My expectations were way to high I guess. Definitely won't make a special trip back over and probably wouldn't stop back by even if I was hungry and close. Pickled red onions in a burrito doesn't constitute next level Mexican cuisine. I think the high rating is for environmental authenticity.

uBa6k5WQq_RbfEK50hRONg.text: Yum! I wish their space was bigger and had something further on the northside but that is honestly the only thing I can say negative about this place. I have never had anything that I didn't like. Everyone who's visited me has wanted to come back to Phoenix to eat these tacos. If you go during a normal meal time expect to wait probably at least an hour. But it's all worth it!

YYPPSXJsYBPoNX1pSo53Cw.text: Tacos and salsas were good, but the quesadilla we were not fans of.  It was too bland and the deep fried corn shell wasn't that good.

bxs_nMtJyRf7aSxVCV37tg.text: Pork on a Fork 1949 E. Camelback Rd. Next to Fry's Food. As a native of Phoenix Arizona I can say unequivocally this IS the Best Barbecue I have ever had in all my 39 years of breathing.  My first visit and it won't be my last.  As soon as you walk into the restaurant the beautiful mouthwatering aroma filled the air.  I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw and a cornbread muffin.  My hubby got the Big Boy Sampler which included a sample of all their meats; smoked sausage, pulled pork, pulled chicken, and beef brisket.  I ordered a fountain drink RC and found a seat.  To my delightful surprise I had the choice of 4 different sauces to compliment my delicious succulent barbecue.  I also had a taste of the chicken, sausage, and brisket thanks to my loving husband who shared some of his sampler.  After I enjoyed my lunch I met the manager Jake and told him how much I liked everything and how I will be coming back. Whether you are visiting Phoenix or a resident like me Pulled Pork on a Fork is a must!

BoaxJD39i0oGLMYTQ8K9QA.text: Oh. My. God. Everything was amazing. The salsas -- I want to go back just thinking about them. I ordered the mole burro with extra mole sauce enchilada style. The best mole I've ever had. The habanero margarita was so-so but I'm definitely returning and telling all my friends about this place regardless.

_1EQwQt8z8qEdkupgcBzsA.text: This place is good for tacos! I think they way they pack them might be a little too heavy for me but I'm sure a lot of people appreciate it. More bang for your buck to some people. They have a salsa bar which I loved a lot. Different flavors... nothing wrong with that. Our service was a bit slow though. It took for ever to get our margaritas which wasn't the best. I only order the classic margarita which is usually my favorite but maybe they have something that they are known for. I'll def be back one day. Thanks again!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aS9BUIiKPP9C9v8gOsKeKA.text: Amazing tacos and the best horchata I have ever had in my life! Wonderful prices and the salsa bar is incredible and free! A favorite spot for my husband and I!

rfgcstcGG2Nm10Bu3EbXyg.text: Weird, authentic and crazy good.  Service may be a question mark so order an extra beer  and bide your time.

xXNMJwTfUOhS8elskZgvzg.text: Ambience: A Cleanliness: A Customer Service: B Food: B+   Price  -It is fairly inexpensive. Compared to other places I've been to in the area I think its in that cheap to moderate range.   Atmosphere -It looks like a hole in the wall when you walk in and its kinda of a turn off, but when you go to the large dinning area its really nice so the moral of the story is don't judge a book by its cover (or its entry way in this case I guess)   Customer Service  You order and pay at the counter as if it were a fast food place, but if you are staying they give a number and someone brings the food to you. It's fine, but I think because they have the huge dinning room, they should just take it the extra step and offer full service. I think it would just add a little extra something to the experience.   Food  So I spent an entire week in Arizona eating nothing but tacos, burritos and enchiladas and I've had all three at this restaurant (we visited twice) and I'd say its food falls right in the middle. It is not the best Mexican food I've had locally, but it is fairly close to the top. If their meat had just a little bit more flavor it would probably be one of my favorites. Their drinks however are AMAZING!   Overall I think this is a solid lunch or dinner place. Good food, good price, I just wish it was a little bit more upscale by adding wait service.

hqHrfibCuqjvFoXAHh60rQ.text: Price is just right! Meal is delicious! However, we had to go get up and order ourselves, luckily we came in Hyatt before a huge crowd did, phew all that time we would've been waiting on.  Anyway I'd tell my friends and family about this place and I'll have to give it another try.

0g_UE_iA3kplYkUO4MUaIw.text: We were traveling in Arizona, found this place on the show website of Diners Driveins and Dives  The number of vegetarian options they have is second to no other mexican restaurants we have dined in. You can eat here just for their salsa bar if nothing else. They have about 15 varieties of salsas most of which are awesome!  We got the chicken mole burro, beer battered avocado and cactus tacos, all of which were great.The food took a while to arrive, it gave us plenty of time to try their salsa bar  The service was great. Will definitely recommend this place to others.

ZsWQFSmOv24vwYe5Ga8goQ.text: Aw, what happen to you La Santisima? You used to be one of my favorite Mexican restaurants but the last few times weren't great and my recent visit made me not want to ever come back.   I came to dine and service was awful and took forever to get us water. No kidding - it took about 15-20 minutes. I finally placed my order of the shrimp taco, chicken tinga taco and the steak taco. Our food didn't arrive until another half an hour. The restaurant wasn't even busy!! Our food arrives but we weren't given silverware so we sat there looking at our food for another 5-10 min. The shrimp taco was ok, the steak taco dry and I had enough that I didn't want the other taco.   I'm so disappointed. Oh well, bye La Santisima.

GnkOk9LratykPizffTdm-Q.text: I heard of this place because of the horchata! Strawberry horchata is so bomb!!! The food is great too. I personally went for the drink but the food got me hooked. There's another spot in Glendale and honestly they're both great

nzi_F95fyWTs00H7Ois4sA.text: Good food. Expensive. Noisy. Ordering and getting your food is a little frustrating especially when it is packed.

IwuI9M24B44b6AN9oGKIkA.text: Super good!! Like all the reviews say - this is authentic Mexican food! Street tacos were exactly what we've been looking for in Phoenix. Over 30 varieties. Just point at the menu and you can't go wrong. Also enjoyed the Micheladas. We will definitely be back!

Pf7zg8xM0UWOu-CE0nvbbw.text: Wow! This place is a home run. To start they have a massive salsa bar with at least 10 different kinds. Would have been great if they were labeled but that just meant I had to try everyone. A couple I didn't care for but more my tastes than their execution but the majority were excellent. For lunch I had the Mayan Pipil Burro with half and half enchilada sauce. I love burros and get them whenever they are on the menu and this was the best I have had. The guacamole was also amazing. Decor is interesting and dark in a good way. My family and I planning a trip to Arizona in the spring and I can't wait to come back.

jCAmK88z-5t4l1GqXO6ypw.text: Awesome and very unique tacos. They have some classics which were also good. The menu is pretty good and it's tempting to want to order everything! Keep in mind these tacos are huge, with the exception of the street tacos which are normal sized. I loved the poblano with pomegranates. It was AMAZING!!! Their salsa bar is also great. We especially loved the jicama salsa. Definitely recommend checking this place out. They have incredible deals on drinks for HH too.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9wcCpo3V5UIAvIHm344O-Q.text: My family and I came here about 2 weeks ago for dinner. Chips and salsa were great, which should be a given. Also had a Mamasita Margarita, which was okay. The description said mango, so we expected slices of mango, but no. It had chunks that got stuck in the straw. Which was annoying but drink was still good. Then came our food, we ordered street tacos with rice and beans. I ordered pastor tacos which come with pineapples, when they came, they only had about 2 pineapples on them. Our waitress brought us a cup of some more, which made up for it. Then, my boyfriend, ordered 2 pastor tacos and 1 Ranchera taco. He ate the pastor first, then went on to eat the last. After his first bite, he said it was weird, but didn't know how to explain how. So my mom and I tasted it, and it tasted so bad. Not flavor wise but like it was old & expired. That's the best way I can describe it. They brought him a different taco but he had a bad taste in his mouth after that. Quite literally. Pretty skeptical about coming back.

-xF1YJWmQY6-i0pkdHhLNg.text: The best tacos and burritos in town!! The mole is amazing, get the burro or the taco- you won't be disappointed. In addition to having amazing mains, the self-serve salsa bar is a great perk. There are usually 12 different types of salsa, so mix and match and find whatever you like.

1kw6ToRrsVh3Xfd0Z6MkfA.text: Fresh homemade tortillas, tacos, rice & beans. The salsa bar was disappointing. Empty bowls. The salsa left were weird flavors. Extremely slow service. 15 minutes to receive a cup of water. Go here for the food "not" the ambiance or service.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 tacos plate

MDTbNIrQGlMhMsgzqSMWzg.text: I was very glad to stop here. Lots of vegetarian and vegan options. You can truly eat at your heart's content.   I came with the wife and we both ordered the 3 taco platter. I got mine vegetarian, she got fish tacos. While the tacos were being made, we got some salsas from the salsa bar. This is a very nice feature, we tried a few and I really liked the tomatillo salsa and the jalapeno salsa. Then the tacos arrived, and they were pretty good, accompanied with rice and beans. This is not a typical Mexican restaurant, it is what they call Tex-Mex cuisine, but good nonetheless.  We also had margaritas, agua de jamaica and calabazitas (eggplant).

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calabazitas

FnQvZaKEKyQ76d2ZuIodbw.text: This place has great customer service. You must try their deep fried quesadilla and all the salsa they have in their salsa bar. They also serve pretty tasty margaritas and chips and salsa. I will definitely be coming back for more.

AM8G68qrBpjZSh0Bg3NFbA.text: Best. Vegan. Tacos. Ever. Also, the salsa bar is to die for and they have a Keto friendly option for cheese shells instead of tortillas. 6 stars.

FpIV87lV6TU8lA9TFaw9Dw.text: Awesome unique twist on the quesadilla, light airy and crispy. Very flavorful, I had the cochinita pibil and it was very good. Wife and daughter had tacos which were good too. Ridiculous tasting guacamole, Soo awesome. Salsa bar had lots of variety and all very good from mild to hot. Half the place was ice cold, other side was burning hot, obviously needs some work on the HVAC. Service was great. We'll be back.

LrB1Kh56UeG8_F5UfxF6aw.text: Ugh. Walking in. Got seated. Waited. Waited. No service. Waiter came and took presets from 3 tables that arrived after us. We walked out.

m-eCBoIv2fuzBik3v40zQQ.text: Best tacos and horchata ever. The variety of salsa is incredible. All delish. Definitely worth a stop.

5qPGjQ9IecYtNTKLhXMZqA.text: I grew up in Arizona and this is the best horchata I have ever had. Salsa bar is fun and free. Artwork is gorgeous.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mahi taco
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Filet Mignon taco
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Help yourself Salsa Bar

P_8bBM3FpBXl485bqoJ-0A.text: I have been here many times! The food is great and I haven't ever had a complaint. Today I came in for just a side of guac and was surprised by a 7 dollar charge. Of course being $7 I thought it was going to be big, right? I'm given the tiniest scoop! I asked for a refund and they told me they could not and refused to do anything about it l: won't be coming back sadly!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2oxB7UH4xSmCSeXkmJP0Mw.text: There are some restaruants we need to try right? But this restaurant is a MUST-Go place. Why? cuz they have best salsa in AZ. They have about 10 different kidns of salsa which are amazing.

v8H8XooxY5fNYCMRGBgTmA.text: This place was fantastic! I had street tacos...chicken and tacos al pastor. Both were pretty amazing, not to mention the rice and beans are the most flavorful I have ever had. We also had the baby shark taco which was juicy and well flavored. The service was good and it wasn't busy for a Sunday afternoon. The cocktails were "weak", they seemed watered down but that was the only down side. They had a good variety of salsas that were really great as well. Definitely  would come again and absolutely recommend it.

Gs7tIKSBhza9d6wntg_S2g.text: The atmosphere was nice, the decor was cute and interesting. However, the food is just decent for the price. The tortillas were not warm at all. The tortillas tasted like they just got pulled out of the package and put on the plate before serving. The carne Asada had no flavor, and they were very shy with the portion of beans. Me and my guest had one app, one plate each, and one drink each. Bill was $67. But the horchata was very good it had walnuts and fruit in it and it was a great size !

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IvFrSNq_HMQysq2p--RrbA.text: If you love tacos. I mean gourmet best ever most creative and flavorful tacos you'll ever find, then run don't walk, get the taco plate of whatever they tell you...close your eyes, open your mouth and imagine you're in heaven. It will be an easy thing to do after your first bite.

kE9iiAECeqz2nHR5a92GVg.text: This place has really good food and the staff is super friendly. The only downside of the place is that the tables are beat up and cracking. Also a fair amount of flies in the restaurant gives it a dirty feel. Hopefully this place will work on its cleanliness before I return so I can give them one more star.

8H8HJaepg3zf6dvA8seZdw.text: When you're server is excited about the food, you get excited about the food! Couldn't try everything, but damn near tried! Will definitely be back before then end of vaca:)

hZaStZktp22KiZxfq7zNdg.text: There's a reason they have so many reviews. I've been here multiple times and my favorite thing is "la santisima veggie taco" so good! My husband gets the "traditional quesa" and that is also delicious. Not to mention their music is fitting and fun ;) I'm definitely a foodie and 99% of the time I look at reviews before eating somewhere, sometimes I go back to places & sometimes I do not. But La Santisima has a special little place in my heart. If you're looking for a fun, colorful, comfortable place with super good food this is a must.

tVVMSYjNtsOS3cu9W-ueZg.text: This is a "go to" spot with friends during lunch and where we take those visiting. They use fresh ingredients in all of their dishes and the salsa bar has the most unique salsas with food parings I would never have thought of...it makes it worth your trip. The owners have added additional seating area which is a great investment as it is always packed and the artwork on display adds to the cultural ambiance of the establishment. Every person that I have shared the establishment with has thanked me for sharing this wonderful, cultural gem.  Things to keep in mind: the parking is off street which gets tricky during lunch rush 11-1, service is good but they don't check back on you and having to stand in line first thing coming through the door to order your food seems a bit backwards for most sit down food establishments so that is why I give it the four stars.

R_IhlgrU25TCPhGapgMA5Q.text: I went multiple times during my time in Phoenix and luckily did not have to wait too long each time. The streets tacos are hearty and well seasoned. The best part are all the salsa options you get to choose from and the included chips that come with your order. It is really fun trying all the salsas and they go great with the food. The margaritas are also pretty delicious based on the sips I had from others. The horchata is pretty unique with the added fruit and is not as creamy as other preparations but is still refreshing!  A nice spot for lunch or dinner!

0ELptZOgSnf-M7NjdVaj_A.text: With it being a long wait, that might have been what boosted this from 4 to a 5 star.  That said, the salsa bar and the gourmet tacos were spot on.  Oh yeah, if you are a man and see a bathroom door open next to the salsa bar, that is not for you.  The men's room is hidden over by the bar and kitchen.  Its great food.  I tried not to waste any salsa so I just got small cups and kept going back and trying new stuff.  Most of which were good, but one of the chili ones tasted kind of fishy for some reason.  As for my entree I went with 3 tacos with beans and rice.  I ate the fried shrimp tacos first as I didn't want the batter to get soggy.  The mole taco was spot on as well as the especial.  I don't live in the southwest, so I can't really compare to much, but I thought it was a great meal for not too much money.

n7qQGL2vt64ysdR4xrnHIQ.text: Great place for delicious Mexican. Had the 3 tacos plate and half order of guacamole and was all really fresh and authentic. Salsa bar is great and the salsa verde is some of the best I've had in years ( Shout out to Dos Coyotes in Davis, CA). Love that it's a small off the beaten path location and even though I was interested because of Guy I was not disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 tacos
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IvbyVyKpBHEfrT7BXf6Tkg.text: Amazing selection of tacos and salsas. Reasonable prices and great service. I have to come back and try all of these options and have a margarita.

YM5qMb7OsSQrsgDGQDtVMA.text: Mexican food that's as good as everyone makes it out to be. The tiger shrimp tacos are the best I've had and I'd highly recommend them. Salsa tasting is also a fun and unique experience, though you quickly realize that there's really only 1 or 2 that you really enjoy. Be ready for a wait cuz this place is poppin'

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp (so good), mayan, and al pastor
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Over a dozen types of salsa to go with free chips

CodN5KDvxYDmGro51-nnWQ.text: I came for business and looked for a good Mexican food restaurant. Wow did I find one. The Oaxaca taco is superb, the sauces are great and so many flavors, even the beans are made from scratch. I highly recommend this place.

At_US6G6RW-0aICo0e6wdQ.text: Wen there on a Friday night at almost 9 PM and had a 5 minute wait for a single seat. Service was very welcoming and fast. Upon being seated, I was given a basket of complementary chips, (1st basket is free), I sat there waiting for salsa and forgot that there is a salsa bar with numbers of salsa to try out. I've decided to order just tacos and all were delicious. In order of best to least favorite was shrimp taco, fish taco, Aztec tinga taco (chicken), and finally a Sonoran carne asada. I highly recommend this place for anyone who enjoy tacos. I've seen neighboring tables had huge burritos and decent sized serving of margaritas, which I would love to try on the next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Clockwise from 1 o&#39;clock- carne asada, fish, shrimp, and chicken (Aztec tinga) tacos. So good!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The double tortilla let me create two tacos off of one. The total after eating halved tacos. Well worth it!!

a6-MhgtDAmLIQyec5UPRHA.text: Amazing food! Horrible service. Called in 4x to try to get a pick up order. No answer. Went in and informed the hostess who just brushed it off and handed me a menu. Took them 10 mins to take my order, which I already had in mind since it had be 20 mins after my first phone call which gave me plenty of time to make my food selection.   After finally taking my order, the gentleman hands me back partial change and tells me that I have to wait for the rest of my change ($5). I was surprised because they were busy and as a professional establishment you should definitely have $5 change readily available. Gentleman said it would be 10-15 mins for my food to be ready. Took them 5 mins to get me the rest of my change. I filled salsas, brung them to my car and went back inside to wait for my food. There were 4 different couples waiting to be seated, looking extremely uncomfortable.  After overhearing one of them ask their partner "Is this a bad joke?" , I asked them how long they had been waiting...20 mins! There were plenty of tables open where these people could have been seated and had drinks at the least.  Finally got my food 35 mins later. If I was the owner, I would fire the hostess. Everyone else seemed to be TRYING to do their job. Seemed as though maybe she was trying to get fired with the way she was treating customers.   Again; food is amazing...but this is my 3rd bad experience with customer service here.

NKQx2JCqSB2mFy8Q0jos6w.text: Sometimes, Yelp is right on.  I was looking for a great Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood to take my wife to (it was date night).  This place had far more stars than most, so we gave it a go.  Upon entering (we visited on First Friday last month) it was so loud that it was like bombs going off.  The decor was unusual and had an interesting botanica vibe going on.  Service was a bit slow but they were so packed that I wasn't surprised.  Their salsa bar had more flavors than I've ever seen at a restaurant anywhere--and I've been to a lot of Mexican Restaurants.  As for the food itself, there was nothing "traditional" about it, but everything was so bursting with incredible flavor that I was savoring every bite.  Holy sh*t, that was good.  My burrito was loaded with CHUNKS of marinated steak--not ground, not shredded, but chunks.  I was blown away.  Next time, there's a SHARK burrito on the menu that I can't wait to taste.  If you're in the mood for something "traditional", I still point people to Mi Patio in Phoenix.  However, if you're looking for something other than the same old Mexican taste, may I recommend this landmark.  It's just a few blocks north of McDowell on your right hand side.  You won't regret it.  The place is small and can sometimes be packed with noisy gringos, but the taste is unforgettable.

FNqDUiHwnTyOdLCVxOTTzg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix!  LOVE the protein-style tacos and yummy salsa bar.  I love condiments, so the salsa bar is a definite highlight for me.  Also, they recently expanded the restaurant so it is about double the size of what it used to be. I will be back again soon!

HE-T-dBJsLdYqQqTC7ypaA.text: Really good Mexican food. Very friendly service. Couple of things you should know. 1- you don't just sit down and wait for order. You need to go to cashier and place it then it will be brought to you. 2- park on the side of the building, easier to get in and out. 3- make use of the salsa bar. Very good and probably different from what you've had in the past. Food was very good and had great flavor. I did order a drink that took a long time to come out but the manager gave it to me on the house. Can't complain. No big deal and the mint drink was delicious. We enjoyed this restaurant

vmo3ayLHCZB3VeSRoDxcDQ.text: I found this jewel recently. From the Dia de los muertes theme to the salsa bar. To the people to the amazing food. You can't beat this place. One of the best experiences I have had. Go! You'll thank me

uYHOoblrjqjrEVSGpHN8XA.text: Probably not much I can say that hasn't already been said....La Santisima has delicious food and a killer salsa bar. I really enjoyed the chicken asado taco. I also had a fish taco that I wasn't the biggest fan of, but I could see how others might like it. In my opinion, it had too much breading on the fish.  Oh, and the margaritas...yummy!   Will definitely be back.

r2w5FJOpx0--p4rw02Tjtw.text: Looking for a great variety and exceptionally fresh Mexican food, this is the place. Also has an excellent array of vegan and vegetarian options.

g4ABCeCkkW9mIgnr1k8crA.text: I so wanted to love this place. I was in the area to get a haircut with fave barber but told he was on break. So I decided to venture out in the area for lunch. The beautiful entrance door caught my attention and decided to try it.  Since I broke my foot, I'm crutchin' along with the dang boot on my left foot. I must have arrived minutes before the lunch rush. I sat at a little table in a corner. Waitress took my order.  Because the tables are so close to one another and filled, I couldn't go to the Salsa bar to try a few sauces.   I ordered the guacamole which was yummy -- love guaca guaca! When I ordered two chicken tacos, I expected two nice size tacos. Instead I felt as though I ordered two tacos off the menu section for kids.  Waitress never returned to refill my glass of tea. I may return and give this place a try when I'm no longer in need of crutches. Nothing grand here...now run along kids...  PS...They do not accept AMEX!

BhkMlPnYdVLhizFH69I9Ig.text: This location is on a dark corner bit excited to see the crowded restaurant. We had to wait (15 minutes for someone to clear the one  table that was not being used. The Bar tender was the waiter bus boy and he said "we all do everthing

QIZ5MmIwjEo-3Thw6IVSfg.text: WOW, DELICIOUS FOOD!!!!!   Sauces were okay...didn't come across any I loved, but then again I only tried about 5 different flavors. Well, the cilantro sauce would be the best out of the 5 I had tasted.  Their quesadilla was indeed their own signature style, It was very appetizing, with their golden brown crunchy exterior layer all around, I give it 5 stars!!!   The Fish tacos were delectable, and they were not scarce on the portions either! small & crowded interior, so we ordered to-go! but next time, if we decide to dine in, I'll be sure to sample all their sauces!! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos $9
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadilla corn tortilla

DRaqL63GHXRJ4zrxPXHS4Q.text: I stumbled across La Santisima as I was street art hunting nearby. I had read some reviews so I decided to drop in. The salsa bar is a lot of fun with a ton of options. I had 4 tacos. The grilled shark, delicious. The specialties, fully loaded. Mole, rich chocolaty goodness. And Gaucho, Argentina steak with a vinegar twist. Everything was a delight and modern. The tortillas were excellent and I ate way too many chips. I highly recommend going.

UL9hLqCsD6N_uzo9UAqs3w.text: Hour wait to get food served! Yes it's gourmet , but way to long of a wait! Appetizer Arrived with meal. Had to flag someone  Just to ask for check... maybe they were short on staff. I don't know ,we only had service contact  when ordering.

l_JZvDrpSFdjaNNaZbnqRA.text: Amazing! I go here weekly. Love tue cilantro salsa and the steak tacos my fav! The paintings are a great addition to the local culture.

fdtPQttTF84grTE4VWaVOw.text: Love this cute little place, love the food, servers are nice and helpful, and OMG, the salsa bar just makes me so happy, how many kinds of salsa do they leave out for everyone to taste?  10? 20?  I don't know, but I get excited thinking about it.  Now I'm just never going to suffer ambiance without the tastiest of food, because I do go to restaurants for the food, primarily.  I like one-of-a-kind, personal restaurants, because you know you are in the kitchen of someone who fed people they loved first, and then spread it out.  But I've taken a date there because its a fun slightly chaotic festive-feeling place while still feeling like its neighborhood,  it's not particularly quiet, but not at all too loud to hear, tables kind of close together, which kind of forces everyone to smile at and speak to strangers more than your average dining experience.  We love to bring a crowd from out of town, as it feels really homey, and is colorful, tasty, friendly, can be hard to get a table because its small and they do get busy, but just wait.  Worth the wait. Their Al Pastor makes my mouth really happy.

_5RwZCa6Yx6N86oeOPaTiQ.text: Loved the salsa bar. The food was good. I got the quesadilla and it was delicious.   However, the customer service was horrible. The server took forever on our order, refilling our drinks, getting our checks etc. The place had flies flying everywhere we had to shoo the flies away from our food. The restaurant was dirty.

zQ7fIEx-zSo7u54iZlBFDQ.text: Offers a style of authentic Mexican food that varies from the northern regions of Mexico (Sonoran Mexican food) to the food that is found in deeper Mexico like mole, peanut salsa, etc. they have a very good vegan/vegetarian menu. Very authentic and very unique. Great art pieces to look at as well.
