lrzy17Pz3oAuSmzUr1ZFzA.text: Wow. Incredible menu of unique tacos and excellent margaritas. One extra secret - a wide array of unique salsa choices to boot!  A no frills environment where you really feel you are in a local's place. Fantastic!!

LGFaYNGxc2tkwAGKbG1cNA.text: Why can't I give this place zero stars?  This place was honestly horrible.  Our lyft driver recommended this place, because we were visiting Phoenix.  The service was slow & not friendly. The food came cold & was overpriced.  They don't even have tostadas?!...That was crazy to me.

S1DoQTMT9pePyEpzEemsbQ.text: Amazing tacos! Seriously, they're some of the best I've had anywhere the valley. They don't slop a mountain of cheese on them or drown them in sauce like some other Mexican food joints. Just flavourful filings with a small amount of garnish; simple and delicious.  Rice and beans are OK. Skip the rice and beans and just order 3 or 4 tacos. Space is very small and seating can be an issue but the food comes out pretty fast.

yML8AOvFq5Fc0Dl6KztOXw.text: I love the food here, ans their salsa bar is always kept stocked and clean.  Every time I have visited the restaurant there is a bit of a wait time, but it is worth it.  Portions are pretty well for price of food (which is reasonable).   I live closer to their location in Glendale but will rather drive to this location due to better service, food and cleanliness.

Tk8qvVnYYx5Z8Jpus0NcKw.text: The best Mexican gourmet restaurant in Phoenix. It used to be really small but they took over the party store near door so now its not crowded at all. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere with beautiful handmade Mexican paintings. The best part is their huge salsa bar. Extra orders of chips are not extra though by the way.

Xbf9pSTYOCKDMI1aFWVWRQ.text: First off, the service was lacking. Our waitress didn't seem very attentive or happy towards us. She could have checked on us every once in a while...and maybe smile?   HOWEVER, the food was delicious (which is why I had to give a least four stars). We ordered their carne asada tacos and they didn't disappoint. Their salsa bar has a lot of choices and yes, the horchata is good.

5sP7xk1iCj0yp1GOC1dZJA.text: Don't blink because you can easily miss this place when you drive by! It is certainly not the place to go if you are looking wear a shirt and tie (but who wants that?).  Very vibrant spuper casual atmosphere.  They have a salsa bar that has so many choices, I was pretty full just trying them all.  I personally liked the strawberry salsa...it was sweet AND spicy.  Had a couple of regular margaritas...be careful, they sneak up on you but were tasty and went very well with the various salsas.  When we first walked in and were waiting (very small waiting area) they gave us some type of orange margarita which reminded me of something you would expect on the beach somewhere.  It was good but I like the traditional ones.  My guest and I both had the fried quesadilla (one pork and one beef)...WONDERFUL!  I recommend this place if you are in the area.  I am not sure I would drive down from the North valley specifically for La Santisima but it is reasonably close to work so I will be back!

AL5jSrSAe21nbRU-iZHpmg.text: While I wouldn't recommend every pretentious hipster foodie come running to Phoenix (not that I would wish that horror on the lovely city of Phoenix- maybe a plague of locusts would be easier to deal with)- there are some great places to eat there. I say "there" because I am from NY and I am here now so there is there. Anyway- I loved it here (there) and went twice in my 6 days in Phoenix. Fantastic tacos- shark, smoked marlin, steak, slow-cooked pork, chicken with mole- most at $3.99 some near $5 but all nicely sized and overflowing with ingredients and deliciousness. The horchata was damned fine also. Love the decor, reminds me of Baby Bo's Cantina in NYC except obviously the food at La Santisima is much better.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RN2LqASwW5usNjXXe_slFA.text: Was craving some tacos and saw the reviews here so decided to give it a try. Place is a total dive, but in a charming way. Got the chicken mole tacos and they were outstandingly good. Also got a La Condesa Taco w/ chicken and thought it was just okay. I asked to make them really spicy and they definitely had a bit of a kick to it. The tacos are huge so I was full. The salsa bar is pretty interesting and has a diverse selection of salsas (try the peanut one, it's very good). Service was friendly and the prices are really fair.

BGYHxXecjYQlHQSCfL5I2g.text: Cravings during pregnancy is no joke. So when my pregnant self wanted some Horchata and Mexican food, yelp offered this restaurant as an option. I was half way out the door when I saw a picture of their Horchata. Although this establishment is almost 30 min away from where I live, I will go to great lengths to satisfy my cravings.   The restaurant was small - fits like 25-30 people small. But it was cozy and vibrantly decorated in Dia de Los Muertos theme. My friend and I had a hard time figuring out whether we were to seat ourselves or if we were to wait for a host/hostess to seat us. There was no hostess stand and the staff looked to consist of about 4 people (all extremely busy). After much confusion and waiting time the man who we can only assume was the owner sat us (we walked up to the register to ask).   The Horchata was excellent; and the food was even better. I will say my most favorite was the Pacific White Fish taco but the Black Mole Shrimp taco was just as delicious. My friend ordered the Maria Sabina Quesa which consisted of Oaxaca cheese and sauteed mushrooms deep fried in a corn quesadilla topped with Mexican sour cream and queso cotija. I am not used to eating a quesadilla this way but I don't think I can go back to the flat, boring quesadillas that I used to know.   I love that this restaurant is authentic to Mexico and incorporates flavors from all regions of the country. I believe the reputation of the food is True to other yelpers' reviews however I have to comment on the under par service we received. I realized at one point that the service took a hit probably because the owner and sister/gf/wife (???) were noticeably feuding. I hope it was just an off day and am most definitely looking forward to my return.

r1BpgaYW2TaiGL-7RIEBYQ.text: Great divey burrito joint. I had la santisima burrito and it was fantastic! it looks a little sketchy from the outside but once you step inside this place is adorable and intimate. They have a great salsa bar where you help yourself. I am very excited to go back again and try more.

zitNX7t3ZwGpNvnEUXBRUg.text: We had a few hours before heading to the PHX airport so we stopped by La Santisima for lunch. Being Mexican from SoCal I know good tacos. This place does not disappoint, everything we tried was good. Plenty of taco options and an awesome salsa selection (strawberry salsa my favorite). The only disappointment was that they didn't have any horchata when we arrived. Had the following.    - Sonoran Carne Asada Taco - Aztec Tinga Taco - La Condesa Veggie Taco - Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco  I'd definitely go back and recommend it to anyone looking to get a local meal near the airport (about 5 mins away)

JJFqBzVpFu7EkKzIQeVefg.text: Wow. I was in Tempe for 4 days - aside from hitting up the usual faves like In-N-Out since I made the mistake of living in a state that doesn't have one, this was my other highlight.  Space is limited, but going early (i.e. 4:30 pm on a Sat) seemed to beat the rush, we left past 5pm and it still wasn't packed yet, but did hear it fills up quickly.  My only complaint was that I wish I had a bigger stomach to try all the different tacos. The friend that took me said they never has ordered off the first page (Taco Page) because its so good, and now I can see why.   Tip: Once you get your table, make your way straight to the salsa bar and start filling up your little cups. They'll bring chips to your table ASAP.  Don't waste time sitting there waiting for your server, go get your salsa!   Also, I'm not a huge Horchata fan, but the Horchata there was super tasty. It's also 32oz, so share, or go pee a lot.

0o6h9-k6dWA2_RrJyIv7oQ.text: This was me and my wife's first time to the Gourmet taco shop. We absolutely loved it. Great salsa bar, best horchata ever and classic take on Mexican food. Definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We love this place. Best horchata ever!

piKf9m7cBSf0oQyvp6USuA.text: I like a lot. Good selection of food... spotty service, rough but ambient location. A little grungy, but I will be back.

dXWn1KeFCgU-Dak9K_wS1Q.text: Wow wow wow wow wow Best Mexican around. Only reason I tried this place was because of all the reviews. Doesn't look like much from the outside but it was amazing. Awesome salsa bar! The guacamole is different but awesome! The street tacos with great too. I'll be coming back to try more stuff!

D40Bv4Fo0HTVmmGlB2M17g.text: EXCELLENT!! Regular sized tortillas, really authentic and tasty! $3.99/taco. 2 Taco Plate  w/rice & beans $8.97 plate.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baja Sur Shark Taco, mole and Sonoran taco

ZLrgmkJ4vNU8FNGvjc2VnA.text: Chips and salsa before your meal: Yes Self serve salsa bar: Yes If you are looking for some daytime tacos this is the place to go. Tica tacos, carne asada, cochinita pibil, shrimp and even shark tacos. Vegetarian choices also available. If you love real horchata you'll love it even more here. They have the best horchata ever with fruit and crushed walnuts. This place is perfect because you can walk off the calories at Papago Park, Indian Steele Park or check out the sites downtown which are all within 10 minutes or less away.

1KBYXRqrEpvNt5--KmZS1w.text: I know most people just love this place...I can't get into it...tried it a few times...always a stuffy vibe with a staff that stopped caring who showed up a long time ago. Great tacos are a dime a dozen in Phoenix...if you want to experience a better vibe w/o wondering why you are sitting on top of the table next to you there are several other great options.

oCCZz04E8ItJPcvNCVJ_XA.text: La Condessa is muy Bueno in many ways. The tacos are always fresh, from shark to carne asada you really can't go wrong. (Although I heard it is bad karma to eat shark).  They carry Mexican beers that I have never heard of before, last time I had an Estrella and it was delicious. They have a full bar with tons of exotic tequilas and they are generous on the pours.  The servers are attentive and sweet and the set up is old style cool.   What really keeps me coming back is the salsa bar (oh the salsa bar)! Pecan salsa, 7 pepper, chipotle, sesame... They carry over a dozen and you will have to come many times to experience the perfect salsa/taco combination. It is worth every delectable trip!

1o73rWizMKaSuWqjHTeqFQ.text: Overall great food with a good selection of items. Both tacos I ordered were very good and extremely fresh. The chips were good and the salsa bar was the best I have seen.  I would for sure go back and recommend this place to anyone having a taco craving.  The only negative and reason for 4 stars instead of 5 was that parking was not good and it is a little hard to locate, even though it is right on 16th street.   Again, overall great food with reasonable prices and makes for a great lunch.

Wi1kqhV_AQAt90NNa321qw.text: Small dining room and no waiting area, so hard to get in at peak times, but worth trying more than once to get in.  The meat is deliciously flavored and the salsa bar makes every meal fun and personalized.  Inexpensive, high quality food.

aEn_4ODhPZ0tWTF544sAFg.text: Very good Mexican food, would advise anyone in the area to try this.  We make it a point to go to Triple D restaurants and decided to give this a try and it did not disappoint.  It is a small venue with not much seating, but it is well worth the little wait that we had.

FkIuGPjouBempJ7DcooR8w.text: We came here because of the great yelp review the restaurant have but I think I may have visited this place at a wrong time. First of, we weren't acknowledged when my family and I came in. We wasn't sure if we were supposed to choose our own seating or someone would assign one. Took about 5-10 mins for the server to ask if we wanted something to drink. She the brought the chips and most of the salsa are out and not being replenished at the salsa bar. All three women servers are walking around and passing us like we have not been waiting for 40 minutes for one order. I had to really wave at the server to get her attention. The order finally came in after waiting for 1 hour and to top it off, the server handed us our food without any apologies for the long wait and not even an eye contact. I'm all about customer service and if I was to based my rating on their service that night, it would be a 1 star. The food was great tho, but definitely not worth waiting an hour especially when the restaurant is not even pack.

aIwBSTL0zKt2VR-z0V3aZg.text: The wife and I were visiting from Georgia. Saw great Yelp reviews for this restaurant. Food was fantastic wife had the the margarita that won many awards it was the best margarita we ever had. We had excellent guacamole as well as tacos first time I ever had a filet mignon Taco it was outstanding. Would highly recommend this restaurant if you're looking for authentic Mexican food.

eKQhX0CtHNe_cOY6BUn1UA.text: Was very excited to come here after all the good reviews.   Overall, our experience was quite "meh".  The menu was inspired.  I loved the idea of having a taco to represent the cuisine of so many different latin american places.  I also loved the salsa bar with its dozen or so unlimited salsas.  However, the food its self was nothing to write home about.  We tried six different tacos, and none of it seemed particularly fresh or interesting.  Had to rely heavily on the salsas to revive the tired tacos.  Doubt I'll be coming back.

cREJqTA-rY3NSuKwHxA8JQ.text: Really awesome tacos here. I ordered the black mole and the conchinita pibil tacos. One of each and a steak queso. I didn't expect everything to be so big so I really over did myself. The queso I figured was like a quesadilla but it really isn't anything like that. Closest description is a calzone sized gordita. And not the taco bell version. The cheese was gooey and the undercooked parts of the masa were delicious. It was awesome. I broke out the plastic utensils and went to town. Daunting none the less. But I managed to put down half of it before the coma kicked in   The mole taco was delicious. The chicken was sliced and covered in red onion. The sauce was spicy and not sweet at all. And the whole thing melted in my mouth. The corn taco shells are soft and made to order. The conchinita pibil taco was full of flavor and dripped juices all over the basket. Delicious.   The horchata is unbelievable. Full of fruit and pecans as well as cinnimon and nutmeg.  the salsa bar is epic. there was at least 12 different salsas to try. the cilantro was really good. and i normally hate raw cilantro because i burp it. but this was excellent and really brought out the flavor of my food. also the strawberry salsa was hot with a hint of sweet and freshness. and the salsa peanut was very tasty. very. very.  I'm buying a bike just to ride here.  A lowerider bike with two 20's in a trailer. So I can rock all the way there.  for now condesa....you are in my top 10.

d3-NiRQwiEHM7N5VoMNkFg.text: Not sure how to follow Julie P.'s epic review, but I thought I'd show some support.  La Condesa is a fantastic addition to Central Phoenix. Casual, nice people, amazing food.  Like other reviewers, I'm partial to the Oaxaca black mole chicken and the cochinita pibil. Everything is delicious in any delivery system -- taco, burro, or (gooey and vaguely depraved) quesa.  The salsa bar really gets me, though. Experiencing it is to suffer total cognitive arrest and disorganization; it's like love at first sight or stumbling upon a work of great art. Peanut, cilantro, de arbol... bring a sharpie so you can mark the little plastic cups and remember your favorites.  Bonus points: The server remembered that I'd asked for strawberry salsa (they were out) on my last visit eight days prior, and offered a totally above-and-beyond apology. Must be something in the mole that sharpens the memory.   Great place -- a gem.

COyHmDrCK784WFq-yhBNGw.text: Best Horchata EVER!  The Tacos and salsa were also some of the best I have ever had.  Try the mole taco.

GBI89I2yim2bJbFCsRd4jw.text: Been searching for good quality authentic Mexican food? Well, look no further. This place is the best in the state of AZ.  They use good quality freeh ingredients to prepare the food. Everything from the tacos, burritos and quesadillas are superb. They have a salsa bar with many different salsas that are to die for!!! Oh and don't forget to try the horchata. You won't be dissapointed after eating at this place!

s_UQFswJWzGrxoHTEMxygg.text: My mouth salivates when I drive by. This place is soooo yummy. Their un-traditional quesadillas are amazing!

10LOR9CHn9-DzOu-IJNQ4w.text: Third visit to La Condesa and that's enough to give it a review. I like the flavors, which are largely guided by your personalized salsa choices, but find it to be a bit heavy in portions.  La Condesa is really ALL about the salsa... not just for the chips but utilizing the bar during the whole visit to create your own perfect balance of flavors. Dishes are dialed into a low volume in order to let the salsa sing.  If your meal's not right, it may be that you're putting peanut salsa on charred beef rather than chicken or vegetables.  PORTIONS + VALUE Two Condesa tacos are way too generous, while three truly street-sized tacos at Gallo Blanco are just perfect for this gal (one reviewer noted the lack of a "sampler" style plate, which is True). However my brother in law, the bottomless pit, packed away one queso and two tacos in a single sitting. So if you're a big eater and looking for value, its very fair and you'll get plenty of protein.  THE BEANS Smooth, smoky, with just a little chunk. Thin enough for dipping, which is crucial for the doughy ends of your fried queso tortilla. I'm impressed at how consistent the beans have tasted across three visits. Portion size has been reviewed as small but when you have that much taco to eat, who has room for beans other than as a condimento?  THE RICE Nothing to write home about. Pale, underseasoned. On one visit it was sticky. Not what we local eaters expect as "Mexican Rice".  THE SALSAS This is what you come for: salsa on demand. There is an avocado cruda salsa that disappears quickly but is consistently green and fresh, never gray. Chile de arbol salsa has a faint nutty taste. Green tomatillo is delicious. Purple cabbagy condimento is great paired with cochinita as suggested. Salsa Mexicana is not mundane. Cilantro drizzle is a welcome accent.   TACOS Taco plates are generously portioned with meat, almost too much in my book but who's complaining? Whisper of selected vegetable garnish included. Tortillas are average quality and may not be steam-fluffed enough. I'll give them this: they don't break.   BURRITOS Messy but good. Thin wax paper can't withstand much contact with a knife and fork. The Bullet is a mild no-brainer favorite for kids.   QUESOS Decadent! Sinful! Beckoning! The fried dough is pastry-like. Paired with the cohinita pibil it was like having dessert for supper. The extra doughy bits on the seam are particularly yummy dunked in beans. Being a fan of the doughy huarache concept in general, the Queso takes corncake-ness up to eleven.  MOLE NEGRO A True mole negro, not the sweeter raisin-y ancho-packed type we often get here in town. It's not smoky, but actually charred and a little bitter, with aromatic undertones. Chocolate tones not easily discernable. Different that what you may be used to, but good.  AZTEC CHICKEN TINGA Adequately wet and seasoned. Tender and easy to pull apart without a knife. Mild on the seasoning, but easily remedied with that ample salsa bar everyone is raving about. This makes Mexican food accessible to all tolerances of heat, in a way.  COHINITA PIBIL Delicate shreds of well braised pork. Low key on the seasoning but not flavorless. Nice paired with the purple salsa and anything acidic they have out that day.  SEAFOOD Our bottomless pit had the Ahi and the Dogfish shark and said both were good.  CARNE ASADA Crunchy but missing the smoke and sizzle I'd expect from a mesquite grilled specialty. It was adequate but lacked a bit of citrus acidity and kick. Competent, and even tasty.  Again, nothing not easily remedied by salsa.  VEGETABLES How refreshing to have vegetables available for all dishes as entree or add-ons. I added spinach to my Queso in a meager attempt to satisfy a vegetable serving for my meal. It delivered beautifully and added crunch.  BEVERAGES Horchata and Jaimaica live up to their previous reviews here. Horchata is way too huge for a child. Would love to see a pint-sized version. The full size is a commitment.  THE WAIT Yes, you might wait. Even if the restaurant is empty. I went for take-out after the lunch rush and waited 20 minutes even though there was only one order ahead of me and there was no line at the counter.  If I had known they were going to pack me a mini-stash of chips in the to-go bag I'd have asked for it in advance to pass the time at the salsa bar while I waited. Post-lunch rush also showed some empty salsa bins but with 12 choices, it just means some of your favorites are in the process of being refilled. We're spoiled here at La Condesa. Most of my favorite True-mex restaurants only offer two, maybe three at the table.  THE ENVIRONMENT Rustic contemporary/ironic and clean on the surface but not tidy to the  glance when abandoned baskets stack up. They need a self-service trash can like Baja Fresh or Chipotle so the baskets don't accumulate in public view. Would appreciate a commitment to wash cheap silverware. No indication if they recycle the consumables.

eu7hf3SMlCU1NCZUCiFWBQ.text: Aargh - the two reasons I come are the two reasons I can't give this place what could be it's due worth.  I came specifically to try their salsas and their horchata.  Unfortunately I never really got to try either b/c they had run out pretty much out of all of it.  Probably a good sign that they are busy and popular but at the same time, a big disappointment.  I tried their two taco plate.  The cochinita pibil and veggie tacos.  Both were ok.  The beans were ok but not nearly as good as America's homemade beans.  The rice was like everyone said - not your typical mexican rice.  Not bad though.  Apparently they were so busy they could barely keep up with "supply".  The salsa bar was pretty dismal.  They had just a little of the cilantro and peanut one.  Horchata was all out.   I'm disappointed that I missed out but at least it's a good sign that they are the place to go.  Will definitely be back to hopefully try again.  TIP: If you are coming at night, be very careful.  It was really dark and there weren't any real lighted signs.  I could barely see it so it's easy to pass it.

bZ-o1tsNDIXflywWhw7xsg.text: The best tacos in Phoenix! This place is fast, consistent, clean, and they have beer and a huge fresh salsa selection!

9ep5TeuJu9GNP2wcak3Biw.text: Great place for salsa, tacos and quesadillas. I had street tacos, very good, different and fresh. My friend had a quesadilla that looked more like a calzone. It was superb. Tried about 10 salsas, fun to try then all. Loved the cilantro salsa. Small place and lots of people so try to go outside of the noon hour.

RTphicKrqRd33TpJRxCLug.text: Luckily, Kevin H. put this place on my radar and actually took me there a few weeks ago.  I've been back a couple times now as it is dangerously close to home and so delicious.    The cilantro salsa is perfectly awesome.  Your taste buds will love you.  The veggie tacos are everything I could ever ask for- I don't miss meat when I eat them and that is awesome sauce.  The beans are probably loaded up with things a vegetarian shouldn't be eating, but lets pretend that isn't the case and just enjoy them.  Service is kind of odd, but I really don't care because the food is amazing.  Go- go, now.

oBpTGA3pY1PKPDZOuSYk3g.text: We came here on December 23rd, after failing to find a local kebab store that was open.  I remembered the amazing mosaic sculpture and told my buddy, let's try the place with the big Dia de los Muertos lady on the front....and we did.  The Mayan taco was ....well...to use the term orgasmic would be both an understatement and a poor use of the word.  I took my parents there 4 days later and had a similar experience. My dream dinner there is to have many friends, many hours, many many tacos, and many beers or margaritas.  I am impressed with the food quality, but haven't had the beans or rice, I figure why?  They have tacos.  Also, impressive salsa bar with a pink radish salsa that I wanted to drink out of the bowl.  Yes, this is a hedonistic review, but I had a hedonistic time.  Go eat here.  They must never go out of business.

X2hSAtV9o-rw78UxlToAqw.text: I love La Santisima!  I've been here a million times and never been disappointed.   The veggie tacos have so much flavor,  some of the best I've ever had.  The Puebla Quesa is amazing with the cashew salsa from their crazy huge salsa bar.  Their homemade jamaica and horchata are great.  Honestly there's not a bad thing I can say about this place.

lBMX-7vDo0_1T8iLGFgVSQ.text: This place is blowin' up on Yelp and for good reason!  I have a strong desire to knock one star off every review I have for other Mexican spots after eating here.  The salsa bar is fantastic, and with so many choices (upwards around 10!) it was really hard to stick with four or five little cups.  I decided to go kind of random with my taco selections and picked the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco and the Cochinita Pibil - marinated pork.  I seriously think the Cochinita Pibil was the best taco I've ever had, at least north of the border anyway.  The Dogfish Shark taco was very good as well.  I think my search for the best tacos in Phoenix has come to a close!  It's going to be really tough to justify going to another place after this experience.

1ZBegRHLqYunUKZFL-_7bg.text: Oh. My. Goodness.  I realize that I just reviewed this little-slice-of-Heaven last week, but our latest visit deserves an update.    We brought my visiting mother-in-law to La Condesa, so we could share the Mexican-food love with her.  For the last two days, I've heard her on the phone to at least 3 different people, raving about the "amazing" Mexican food she had on Saturday.    On this visit, they had the Carne Asada (they were out last time).  My husband liked it, but actually thought the Tinga chicken was even better.  He swears there isn't a better chicken taco in town, and I think I'd have to agree.  My MIL had the chicken mole tacos and loved them.  She orders mole whenever she gets the chance, and rated it way up with Barrio's dish.  I was blown away by the deliciousness of the mahi-mahi burro.  Oh, goodness... I'm having a flashback of it's amazingness...  luscious chunks of fish, smokey bacon, mushrooms (which I normally pass on, but they were fantastic!), and their velvety cilantro-cream sauce.  Ahhhhh.... so good!    Another 5-star visit!

_pHQFbibEltuwY7itDA-vg.text: Drop what you're doing and drive here. After I ate here I had to go back the next day for more.  The food is that good.  This cute little green building may have gone competely unoticed if I hadn't been driving down Palm Rd to avoid construction.  While waiting to turn onto 16th Street the "Grand Opening" sign caught my eye and my little yelping soul leaped for joy!  A new place to try!  It looked desolate from the outside but when I opened the door I was put at easy by the decor, smell and cleanliness inside.  I ordered dinner for two, to go.  The menu was awesome.  I loved seeing all the variety: poblano peppers, mole, mahi mahi, mushrooms...something wrapped in banana leaves.  It made it difficult to choose something.  Here's what I've had so far: La Condesa Shrimp Burro and Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco.  They are both were very delicious meals but the shrimp burro stole the show.  So much flavor.  I snagged some bites from my hubbys mole and mahi mahi burros- mmmm such a delight.  The salsa bar is endless.  I really stocked up.  I was excited to try the strawberry salsa but it was too hot, in fact it all was, but I'm a big wimp when it comes to hot peppers. The horchata is handmade and delicious.  They throw pecans and some fruit in there too which is a yummy bonus!  As if the good food wasn't enough to win me over the art in this restaurant sho did!  I'm a sucker for Mexican folk art and Frida Kahlo is my Oprah.  There's a painting of her and Diego hanging over the salsa bar, it's amazing.  All the paintings are great, love the artist.

oupg4j8npkDncE0q4nWTQw.text: Best Mexican food I've had in a long time. Good atmosphere.

AhRmDqygEKYJUz0ShCmOvg.text: Probably the best tacos in town. Please don't move!!! Also, being Hispanic I've had my fair share of Horchata's in my life...this one tops them all, it's more like an Horchata Salad, just brilliant!

hRugJ_zmg9LMiVwf31nZbg.text: I read about this place in New Times and saw two words that always speak to me like they are some alluring foreign language.... COCHINITA PIBIL! I've made this dish at home a couple of times, and it takes me a couple of days, so when I get to eat it it is a real treat.   Went into La Condesa around 7:30 on Thursday night and went straight to the counter and ordered the glorious achiote and orange maranated pig, along with rice and beans and a homemade horchata. Chips were included. While I was waiting for food, the people running the place were over the top nice. The man told me about some tips to making cochinita pibil including using cinnamon, which I'd never done. The girl actually introduced herself, shook my hand, and asked my name. I've never had anyone do that in a restaurant. She proceeded to explain the salsa bar, which had about a dozen different salsas though they plan to have 20 in total eventually.   The chips were fresh, all 5 of the salsas I tasted were delicoius, especially the green cream and the watermelon. My Horchata was amazing, just perfect. They topped it with crushed nuts, and there were strawberry chunks and whatnot in it. Very unique but amazing. My tacos came, and I was quick to pick off the raw onion and replace it with the proper pickled onion slices as it should have come in the first place. No problem, they have the pickled ones at the salsa bar along with all the other veggies. The tacos were full of meat bursting at the seams... large portions were great for me as I'm used to such small tacos. Their refried beans were creamy and well cooked with a nice cheese garnish, and the buttery smooth rice was delicious as well.   For the fact that this place is nice, decorated with dia de los muertos style art, mexican wrestling posters, the niceness of people, and the excellent food, this place gets five stars as easily as any restaurant I've been to in Arizona. It reminded me of Mama Testa, which has grown to be one of the best known taco shops in San Diego. Phoenix has never seen anything like this. They asked if I want to come back, and I assured them, it will be soon. Very soon.

Gqh8206SXa1BeZW-NbNGcw.text: te encontre!  I've been reading yelp reviews of this for a good two weeks and was dying to go here.  After a long day of not eating, I forced myself to go here. It's completely out of my way but boy was it worth it.  I ordered two things: Carne asada tacos combo plate and a Tinga quesadilla.  The fact that they have tinga makes me very happy. It wasn't as "tingaish" as I would have liked it, but then again, no one has ever made me tinga like my Tia guty.   The bad: - teeny tiny parking. I came here at 4pm on a friday and was the only person there for a good ten minutes. I can't imagine finding a parking spot when there are more people around.  - The tortillas weren't great. They're not bad, but they aren't anything special. A taco should have a good tortilla in case the meat sucks (not that it sucked here). - The rice and beans portion is small. WAY small. I get that a restaurant needs to make some profit, but these are tiny.   The good-  - The quesadilla is huge. By huge, I mean I ate half of it and had to save some for later because of how filling the doughy tortilla is. This is not your average quesadilla. Not only do they use the right cheese (not your Americanized mozzarella and monterey jack or even, god forbid, chihuahua cheese), but the tortilla is flaky AND flavorful. That's a quality tortilla. This tortilla is nothing like the one used for the tacos, you can tell they make these themselves.  -The variety of salsas is pretty damn good. They will have everything from the most unoffensively bland salsa for gueros to a chile de arbol salsa that could make my daddy sweat.   - La horchata. Now this is what horchata should taste like. Other restaurants take note because people may come here solely for this. The fruit is a cute side trick, but the horchata really is good.  I give it five stars because it reeks of unpretentiousness and we all know how much I loathe pretentiousness. The artwork is simple but quirkily Mexican, there is nothing fancy about the decor (which I like) and the cook looks like my Tio Memo (except he can cook whereas my Tio cannot).   Overall, I hope they don't change a damn thing here. Let it become as popular as they can but please, please, don't change what you have! Finally, some authentic (and I hate using that word) tacos in Phoenix.

-2OK8k2SgpuP2mi1qi5MQA.text: I absolutely cannot describe the amazingness that is La Condesa Gourmet Taco Shop. Gourmet it is. From the top to the bottom. Service, Style, Food, the whole 9. Do not be fouled by the neighborhood... this place SHINES like a diamond in the rough.   I am SOOO bummed that we were only in Phoenix for the night, cause I would have set up shop here every night. THE SALSA BAR!!! AHHH! We tried EVERY ONE. AMAZING.   Our amazing bartender/server was David. He killed it. He even made me a Skinny Margarita. They make their own juices there for the Margs...mmmmm. Yep.   They are authentic. The fish is fresh. They put up with me wanting no oil and after ordering 1 taco... he put up with me ordering 2 more, after the place should have been closed. This was all done with a smile and kindness that is unfortunately rare these days.   Even just thinking about that taco... Grilled Mahi w/ a ton of veggies, spinach, onions,  wrapped in a homemade tortilla, guac, TONS of dipping sauces... literally melted in my mouth.  If you are EVER in the Phoenix area--- YOU MUST STOP BY. If I am even an hour with-in it's radius I will be running back.  Not. To. Be. Missed.

rlOPpAQtEtsuFDUdsR80dg.text: A happy series of events led me here when I had initially planned to go somewhere else and I am so glad that I did. The tacos are amazing, of course. My personal favorite was the mole taco but it's hard to pick just one because everything I had was so good. Wonderful interior decor and a very relaxed and intimate atmosphere. I fully intend to come here as often as I can. Oh, and the horchata was phenomenal. All in all, easily the best taco place I have been to.

7zwzVzqGlBNn0zkYxmt1WA.text: If there is anything I'd miss if I were to leave Phoenix, it would have to be the Mexican food.  That's what we're good for (and to think we're trying to get rid of the Mexicans!).  There's awesome greasy hole-in-the-wall, everybody-speaks-Spanish places like El Tlacoyo and Moreno's in Mesa; there's a variety of fast food places like Filiberto's and Someburros; you have you generic family restaurant Mexican like Macayo's, Garcia's, and Tia Rosa's; and then you have your niche places.  La Condesa is one of those niche places, and one of my favorites.  Here, their niche is a slightly fancy take on really simple items like tacos, salsa, and quesadillas.    The tacos come in several varieties, with meats including chicken, beef, pork, whitefish, and even dogfish shark, and different spices and toppings on each one.  My favorites are, of course, the shark, as well as the black mole, and one of the beef ones (not the Sonoran).  The salsas are also a big draw: prepare to be blown away as you dip your chips in peanut salsa, strawberry salsa, cilantro salsa, or even my personal favorite, pecan salsa.  There are typically about 20 choices, so if you want to try them all, come with a few friends (it does get crowded, though).  The quesadillas are also delicious; they're a southern Mexican fried style.  They're quite heavy, so don't plan on being able to eat two or three tacos *and* a quesadilla.  Oh...and GET THE HORCHATA.  You won't regret it.  I won't describe it, just because I don't want to ruin the surprise.  But it will blow your mind.  Whenever I get it, which is always, someone always asks me what that delicious-looking beverage is.

LposWNvagIDs7BqmfOBvRg.text: My wife and I were walking around in downtown phoenix, hungry as can be.  When out of nowhere, I saw this place.  We went in and sat down, and it was great.  The burritos were cooked to perfection, and the service was great too.  the only problem was that it is in a less than likeable location.  Once they fix up their place, they will get the 5 stars.

TLW1gTSQje_VEc_uHZ5OQA.text: Everything here is exceptional. Full bar with a decent beer selection of domestics and Mexican. Huge salsa bar. My favorite was the strawberry salsa. The salsa Mexicana was good, a little on the spicy side for me but I couldn't stop eat it!  I had the white pacific fish tacos with rice and beans.  The tacos were delicious with lightly fried fish, cabbage, cilantro salsa, and a delicious creamy sauce.  Everything was so good, I wish I leaved in the area or could take this restaurant home with me so I could try everything on the menu!  We arrived around 1130am on a Friday and around noon the place was packed, and it's a small place with limited seating.  Definitely worth it.

pjcTgntJqnR5Yms8mBDtDA.text: Best gourmet tacos around with really interesting flavors. Salsa bar is so good. I crave the pecan salsa!!

uN4rm7czgEMAn2Yv2K8UuQ.text: Dayyyum! I'm not Mexican so you could cook a cat in mole and call it authentic and I'd believe it so if this place is authentic, good for them. It's not your run of the mill taco truck kind of food. Fancy tacos that are worth the price. I'm sad I don't live closer :( but I'd travel for another of their shrimp taco. Also, I'd recommend the mole taco...everything was really good. Beware about the guacamole at the salsa bar!!! It's beyond spicy! My tongue is still recovering from the scorch. The horchata is really something you've got to try too. Prepare to spend a weeks worth of groceries kind of money...but enjoy :)

p1oXwQPRkwkCvSPT6-j6LQ.text: BOMB! LIFE CHANGING! DELICIOUS! A lot of my visits to restaurants happen just by chance. I googled, "Restaurants near me" as my husband and I were driving up 7th St. This came up and I thought the name was interesting so we decided to give it a try. MAN! This was a good pick!  The food was so delicious and freshly made. They had a salsa bar with many different salsas. All were delicious and none too spicy. I should knock it off a star because the service was not great (they were slow, but it was because they are busy)  but I can't because their food was that great. I got the 3 taco combo with rice and beans (1 taco barbacoa and 2 shrimp), my son a traditional quesadilla, and my husband the Mazatlan burrito with shrimp. All of it was amazing! The beans were not out of a can, the rice was do tasty and...man! Honestly, greatness!  We are from out of state and I joked with my husband about coming back before heading back home, but honestly, I was not joking. I would definitely go there again, and again, and again, whenever I see my way back to AZ.

pHIRMIY9cZNak-unyZnGRw.text: My husband and I ate here for lunch this afternoon after reading the "Eating 16th Street" blog in the New Times :http://blogs.phoenixnewtimes.com/bella/2012/08/la_condessa.php#more  We went for a late Friday afternoon lunch and though the place is on the small side had no problem finding a seat. The decor is great, and the food truly was delicious. I tried three different "street tacos" and they were all wonderful - particularly the Al Carbon. My husband had the Azteca Tinga Burro and he also said it was very tasty. We also indulged in some "we earned it" margaritas and they came complete with grapefruit, lime, orange and lemon slices. I've never had it that way before and it was delicious. We will definitely be going back for more soon!

T4fQPxFpUKXBTQdAxXGhbA.text: This place is so small and always packed. The first time we tried to go they only accepted cash. The second time it was so packed that we couldn't even get out of our seats to check out the salsa bar. Food was delicious but the place was uncomfortable and too overcrowded to enjoy.

gFZ69icXOwJ58t53kZuRkg.text: You would miss this place if you drive by it in a random small strip mall on the side of 16th st, but the muerte that is so beautifully decorated outside will catch you! My first trip to La Condesa was great, the music is very authentic, almost like Latino pop. But the FOOD- lets talk about it... First you get chips and you wonder, where is the salsa lady?! But then you realize that amazing salsa bar at the back of the restaurant is where you get to pick out your salsa! My favorite was the strawberry salsa it was so unique, I've never had something like that before- and it was fresh fresh fresh! Then there's other usual salsas and more fun ones, probably about 12 or 14 to choose from and lots of lemons and limes.  I had the tinga chicken tacos and they were very spicy, but I like spicy! But if you don't like spicy do not order them, they have an after burn and don't require salsa. The amount of chicken on the two taco plate was amazing for $6.99!   TIPS-  Try the strawberry salsa $2.00 Modelo Sat&Sun Happy hour M to F 3 to 6 looks great

6W1tVJKnphjnN1Xj9wYa3w.text: Their salsa bar is the best I've seen in Phoenix... I love them ALL. The Al Pastor burrito is my favorite... The burritos are HUGE here. I've tried almost every type of taco they have here and they are all great. Be prepared for a LONG wait if you're not going at an off time because they only have a few tables but it is seriously worth the wait. The prices here are unbeatable, too. They only have 2 servers usually who double as bartenders so you have to kind of grab their attention sometimes but like I said, there are only a few tables and it's very small inside so they can always see you.

e6VpzHxWTOY53NAE15cDvw.text: This place is just amazing. Good prices, consistently excellent food and friendly/helpful staff.   First off, you pick your own salsas, whaaa!? the salsa bar - strawberry salsa! pecan salsa! cilantro salsa! so so so many to choose from and always fresh.   My favorite burrito is the Mahi mahi specialty, but the Mole, and veggie are also a hit.   I have been going to this restaurant since I moved out here over 1 year ago and continually recommend it.  Make sure you get a Horchata if you are in the mood for a sweet drink. It has melon, strawberries and pecans in it! Delicious and worth trying!  Now go and tell all your friends about this place.

H40DYtndGj_bJHOYB7pm3Q.text: We were in the mood for Mexican food while in the Phoenix area- so we decided to head on over to this place. It's located in a crusty part of town...just FYI. We went in on a Thurs night and the extremely small restaurant was packed. There really is nowhere to stand if you're waiting for a table. The place is so tightly packed that you kind of awkwardly stand with your butt in a diners face while waiting for someone to seat you. There were only TWO people working the entire floor that night. From seating, to serving, to bartending. TWO PEOPLE. It was an extremely long, awkward wait and we kind of ended up seating ourselves at the bar once it cleared out because no one else offered us a seat anywhere. I felt bad for anyone who came in after us because they all had the same look of awkward confusion on their faces as they stood by the door for 20 minutes waiting for SOMEONE to let them know what to do, where to go.... We got margaritas, which weren't very strong- and we're extremely expensive ($8 ea???). And even though the service was the worst I've ever seen in my LIFE- the food completely made up for it. I wanted to hate the place, but my burrito was so good- I never wanted it to end. I got the La Santisima Specialties Burro with arrachera  . Heaven on a PLATE. So flavorful, filling, delicious....i'm like...daydreaming of it now....... The final bill was pretty pricey for only 2 burritos and 2 drinks- $50?? If I were to visit this location again (which I will)- I'd most likely just get my food to go. The inattentive lack of service makes you feel more like a bother than an appreciated customer.  *edit* Moved to Phoenix, been here twice since then. Food is still super amazing. I mean seriously...that La Santisima Specialties burro dipped in pecan "salsa".......to die for. Service hasn't changed. If it's busy, goooood luck. Your service will be horrendous. We went today and it was FINALLY slower...we actually got a table and not the bar stools for once. And we were served a lot faster...much more pleasant. Wish they'd expand. But whatever. Awesome place, just go.

fhVNYNQIJdLn4WDkOMC6RA.text: Had a late lunch here. The mole chicken tacos were easily the best I've had north or south of the border. The food quality and flavors are second to none. A welcome departure from the standard tex-mex. The salsas were so fresh and interested four immediately jumped onto my plate. A cels toro, peanut, strawberry , and chipotle. Can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Highly recommend experimenting with some of their 15 fresh salsas.

m26HxvJWyjuNH3wXJ7hPvQ.text: Cochinito tacos are so tender and tasty!!  Not your run of the mill Mexican.  This pleasures the palate!! Unique and fantastic.  I will be making the drive to La Condesa again!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bomb diggity!

GFMyhIR4Ijt69hODZ1WUfg.text: I loved the food! It has great authentic food and it is all fresh. My only downside for not giving it 5 stars is the size of the place. It can fit probably around 20 people max. I think they need to move to a bigger location. Service was ok as well, give them a past because of the busyness.

8OiAlKmRJ1KHHP60H9O81A.text: Amazing food. Everything we tried was good.  Had the best horchata of my life, which has fruit bits and deliciousness in it. Great salsa bar. All around goodness.

Vwnt-iNVJ9MhpBrAprqbrA.text: Worst service u can ever imagine and what type of Mexican restaurant can't make guacamole because they ran out of tomatos?!?

2Cx4YgnYjebNO2F0Um6dzA.text: Ok, I finally got a chance to come back with some coworkers. They changed their format. The first time I was there, it was go to the counter order and they give you a number. They have waiter service this time. I got the Sonora Arrachera Quesa (Oaxaca cheese & char-broiled Arrachera steak). It was so good and too much for me to finish. I looks at my fellow lunchers and their tacos looked so GOOD. The salsa bar is filled with all sorts of varieties. I tried the strawberry salsa, too sweet for my taste... but more to favors to try!

wGfTg7rplA1wAlb8so49tw.text: Their horchata is delicious and has fresh fruit and pecans at the bottom. My husband loves their salsa bar and we both enjoy their quesas. Great vegetarian menu options too!

aMKCfhR4jmGtcMDT5j--9A.text: This place is worth the lunch rush, the line always moves quickly & you can't beat the food. I've ordered the street tacos & El mariachi burrito enchilada style. Love the Jamaica.

jvjparNmZZCKTVmJxHXGVg.text: I ate here a while ago but want to leave a raving review as I've told more people about this place than any other restaurant. My boyfriend and I ate here and we both can't wait to go back. Although the wait was long, and I almost died of hunger, I would go back any minute. The food was amazing and hands down the best Mexican food I've ever eaten. I hope they stay tiny, don't expand and ruin it so I can go back and eat here for years.

-1za5cwcLu_gyqMxVjt82A.text: I often judge a Mexican food restaurant by the beans, and let's say this comes close to my nanas beans. The rice is good too! Simple white rice with lime, cilantro and green chili. The tacos where good and full of flavor but the michada toped it off! Probably one of the best I've had; and I make my own.   The only issue is it's small so you might have to wait to get a table. But it's well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fruit, horchata and toddlers are the best!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Letter to the customers about the improvement and kitchen issue.
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Just one of the beautiful artwork that is displayed at Santisma.

Htiq5LUfYl1n6IoVmnS7Hg.text: Best fish taco in Phoenix by far! I have ordered other things on the menu but the best thing is definitely the fish taco. Chips and salsa bar are great as well.   Also, one of the best horchatas I have ever had. The restaurant is pretty small though so sometimes its hard to get a seat if it's busy.

-fgVnCuUfPKNFUyEuzqTcg.text: Great spot, the food is amazing, try the horchata it's delicious!!  Friendly staff and cool decor.  Also excellent options for vegetarians.  I will be back!

ZrbSPvPDyCG9ECHQei1rAg.text: I love the different kinds of tacos here. You can get fancy tacos or simple street tacos. The al pastor street tacos are delicious. The salsa bar is very fun! I am glad they expanded because there was always a wait.

einLJTGynNbfkGlHu4YR_Q.text: I died and went to taco heaven! This place elevates tacos to another level. The meats (I had pork, mani and steak), were seasoned and cooked to perfection. The chips are the real deal and compliment the amazing selection of salsas at the salsa bar! Decor is welcoming and has beautiful art. Service is friendly and prompt. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2LtbJnNiueK7FbMtEEjmmg.text: A unique taco place set in downtown Phoenix. The menu is diverse and they use fresh ingredients. I can't stress enough how much our city has needed a special place like this. It features something for everyone!!! The salsa bar alone will have your taste buds wanting more!!!  The veggie quesadilla is to die for!!!! The fried touch they give to it adds something you can't get anyplace else. Oh and before you leave you have to try their Horchata!!! If you like Horchata then you haven't tasted anything like this one!!!! It could win awards, seriously!! I was a little nervous when I heard they add fruit and nuts to it, but then I tried it....it was gone in minutes!!!!  Anything you order here is going to be fabulous and fresh. You don't leave feeling heavy like when you eat Mexican food sometimes. I can't rave enough about this place!!! Try and enjoy!!!

5TL8sBOAVbg4jjq8miETwQ.text: Pros Great salsas at the all you can eat salsa bar! Loved the guacamole salsa and the peanut salsa. Good tacos and horchata!  Cons The guacamole is not that great. Avocado was minimal and not worth 10 bucks.

ejuV3rGNY-JM4E2hgjbrYQ.text: This is one of those places that have lots of potential but are not managed well. My boyfriend's dad was in town and he wanted to have some authentic Mexican food and since we were starving we ended up coming to La Santisima since the reviews seemed good and it was closed to where we were.  When we got there the place was fairly busy, they only had 4 chairs in he waiting And my first impression of the place was not great. There was water spilled in the floor and food crumbs all over the place. Anyways, there were several people standing waiting to be acknowledged. When the host finally came she didn't greet us and we had to ask her if she wanted to take our name. We waited about 10 minutes for a table and then were seated in a booth.   The room where we were seated was decorated very nicely with paintings of "La Santisima Muerte" but none of the lights in the roof were working, so they had a light in the corner of the room that was very bright and poorly placed. We then met our waiter who was very nice but quiet (It seemed like he has whispering the whole time), we asked for a drink menu and guacamole and sadly we were told they didn't have any Guac. Anyways, at this point we were just "meh" about the place and we just ordered our food. I had carne asada tacos, my boyfriend had a mole burrito and his dad had a burrito as well. They brought our food and I had to ask for utensils since there were none at the table. My tacos were tasty, the beans and rice were well cooked and delicious. I asked for a lime (since I'm Mexican and I can't really eat my tacos without lime) and I never got it :( so I stole my boyfriend's lime from the margarita he ordered (without a drink menu by the way cause he was never given one) we finished our food, we payed and left.  Pros: Food seemed authentic and tasty. The artwork in the place is beautiful. The salsa bar is great.  Cons:  Poor customer service  The place looks like it needs better maintenance  NO GUAC?!   Customer advice:  This place has great potential. I think that if they had more waiters the customer service would improve since everything seems quite disorganized.  -Greet your clients when they come in. -Clean the floors constantly.  -Fix the lighting. -Go to the store and buy some Avocados for God's sake. -Have utensils at the table.  -Expand your waiting area.  Honestly, I'm a little bummed cause the food was good but I don't think I'll come back to this place.

P2Q43sRpab1UD-UAnZ2RGg.text: Very Disappointed.  We have been patrons since long before the triple D guy showed up. Last night was the last straw. They expanded the dining room without expanding the kitchen or staff. 2 cooks in the kitchen cannot keep up- according to staff they were both "new". No soap in bathroom, floors are dirty, chairs are dirty & stained all because they don't have enough staff. Customers were trying to help make drinks because the 45min wait for our food was just too much. We left and will not be back.

tfrxpJMVVh-8VCCt8V279Q.text: There were 4 empty tables open......and plenty of people waiting to be seated......this lasted for over 20 minutes. The staff just kept staring at us, leaving dirty empty tables.   We finally Sat down after an hour of waiting. No water for 20 minutes. They finally come by to give us 1 glass of water and chips (80% crumbs) and they didn't come back to take our meal order for 17 more minutes.   Over 2 hours of being in the restaurant, they tell me they have no more horchata. Wtf.  8pm on a Saturday???? No sorry but we ran out of what you already ordered and have been waiting on.....nothing. Everyone around us had one. Even people who showed up after us.   Finally gave us our food---which ended up tasting pretty good.....but NO UTENSILS. I had to get up, go to the front and ask for some. Duh.   Then our bill came and they charged us for the horchatas that we didn't even get.   Absolutely horrible. They were so rude. I will not be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Empty tables...people waiting....20 minutes. Service is horrible!

gReSJ-ZZ6diJzIGNmXj31w.text: This is the first time I have tried horchata, and it was delicious. I love the cinnamon taste of it. They serve the drink in a plastic cup, so you can conveniently take it togo.   Before the main course, they give out complimentary chips you can munch on. The chips are quality chips - they're not the thin ones like from Rubio's. The best part is the salsa bar! They have a wide selection. Watch out for the extra spicy ones. I'm definitely returning to this cute hole in the wall place for good tacos and horchata.    A heads up that parking in front of the restaurant is limited.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips &amp; Salsa!
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata!!!

HDfkQqUeqBNQ_nTQvlXxhg.text: Before we came to this restaurant we were very hungry. When we first walked in it was very welcoming and traditional. They have a salsa bar which is a first for me. 8 different types and All u can eat Guacamole was chunky and flavorful. As with most flavorful food, the ingredients were fresh. Hey 2000 reviewers can be wrong. Great place for real Mexican food

AHu9n-jCn6J6oHH8tmL81A.text: Terrific food -- and very creative! Loved the peanut based salsa and chicken tinga taco! Service was a bit slow, but we did arrive right as a rush began. Also def recommend the Margarita Santisima! Yum!

PuJWCXJzjqk9nZIt7Czi1Q.text: Any trip to Phoenix is incomplete without a stop to La Santisima.  Their salsa bar is epic, and I don't use words as such lightly. Great, original veggie entrees as well. Well worth the short wait.

8MGtDj-Mi1BXJbeLpJMh2A.text: Wow!  What a gem!! Food is great and the staff very accommodating.  We had lunch here and got in a little ahead of the crowd.

EC6Ls6Efm1ZsBPCIBt5lhQ.text: Vegan options, best salsa bar, best rice n beans. I just wish they let you sit at the bar top instead of use it as an expo.

5d0VQswKwdNkaDTpZ0tN8w.text: The salsa bar here is unlike any I've ever seen.. there are probably 20 different ones to choose from and you serve yourself. They even make a strawberry salsa!! My table always has about 8 different little salsa cups all over it for all the different mixings and options.   Also, I've only ever eaten their tacos and there are two pages to choose from so I will probably continue as they are all completely different and unique.   The interior is comfy and really artsy. I love this spot!!

rGGfTDDX1o-xf5jq9GRRdw.text: It's a small location but HUGE in flavor.  Make sure you try the quesadillas with carne asada.  The wait can vary due to its small size. I have waited for almost an hour. It was definitely worth it.

pUBVvIT6-ie5h4uLCRrcRg.text: La Santisima is on the top of my list for tacos in AZ.  It's not in the best part of town and the parking situation is a little tough if it's busy, but the food is out of this world!  My hubby and I came once, and decided to bring my parents here for an early Mother's Day lunch.    I go weak in the knees for restaurants with salsa bars, but this place has a salsa bar on steroids.  They cater to all tastes and all heat levels.  I am in love with at least 5 of their salsas, including the pico de gallo that is so lime-y and delicious that it's the first one that ran out during both of our lunch visits.    My hubby ordered the Norteno burrito both times and I got a variety of street tacos.  The carne asada is soft and juicy and not the least bit tough like you'll find at most Mexican places.  The beans remind me of the ones that my BFF's mom makes in Nogales.  Delicious!!

kHMXeGEpGpOA49K-JTYTEQ.text: This place has some great tacos that are on par with some of the best that I've ever had in Mexico. I order a slow roasted pork shoulder taco and the veggie taco. As great as the pork was, the Santisima veggie taco was out of this world. I will probably order one every time I go back. The ambiance and were awesome as well. 5 stars all around!

On8O5Di4JG_YxsR2m6sS7g.text: HOLD THE TACO! This place is legit! The restaurant is small, and cramped, but I get it... the food was carefully made with a genuine love of feeding people and they want to feed as many as they can in their small space.   The tacos were legit, the fish tacos were amazeballs, and the veggie options were ridiculous. I had a shrimp taco, and a veggie taco, both were outstanding. The fresh salsa bar was ridiculous too, in a good way :)  Go here, eat tacos, thank me later.  Note, lots of pescie and veggie options! #veggie4life #veggielife #pescielife

ptzZCRrAx4Fcirc9vcm5uQ.text: Great food.  Only negative is the seating space. Very little, and what exists is very cramped, particularly the seating adjacent to the fixings bar area. Get theire early for lunch or wait until after the lunch crowd has come and gone.

7_ACQk53gK7SpGXr2eF4Kw.text: The day we went it was so hot inside the building you could literally see sweat on people's faces. It took 15 minutes to get someone to ask what we wanted to drink. And then it took 10 more minutes to get our food order in. Overall service was slow and the heat made us all so hot we didn't want to stay. But the food was good, just had to take it to go cause it was just so hot inside.

-SC0A9TWNXPjXAsGwBC1bw.text: Small place but good authentic Mexican food. The tacos r bomb and different salsas at the salsa bar. Moderate price.

ZU9OFDYIO24QSmZh4bptEQ.text: Delicioso!   This is a neighborhood hole in the wall that serves some pretty great mole. I am a mole fiend. Love the stuff. Can't get enough. Their's is dark, rich, spicy, and the right amount of sweet. (Also how I like my men, hey-o).   (Just kidding.)   Also, who doesn't love a salsa bar? I've never even heard of most of them: pecan salsa? peanut salsa? Um, why are you only giving me 4 lids for the to-go cups? Like I'm not going to try them all ...

wWj6R4XWnIsBKLpziQe9fA.text: This place has great reviews with good reason. This place is really small, so either be prepared to wait, or go during an off time. But oh man is it worth the wait!! The food isn't what you get at the usual Sonoran style Mexican joints in Phoenix, it's got a variety of food from all over Mexico. I've tried about half the tacos, and I couldn't even decide on a favorite!! They are all soooo good! And no trip to La Santisima would be complete without a glass of the infamous horchata

n3gUHFHN-f3e-qrt2P3B1A.text: Busy hole in the wall restaurant that exceeds expectations in several areas. Salsa Bar is quite impressive w array of choices especially the 7 chile salsa which stood out. The Shark Taco & Ghandi were fine, nothing special in my opinion. Shredded pork my friend ordered was seasoned out standingly, will try that next time. Salsa bar lived up & exceeded reviews as the well decorated & tasty Horchata

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shark Taco &amp; Ghandi Taco
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata

Qa4iKcsJzo0ZF5Qu7SrvPg.text: This was such a great find! The tacos were amazing and the horchata was absolutely delicious (never have seen it made that way!). The rice and beans were flavorful without being overpowering considering all of the ingredients in the tacos. We went around 2-3 pm and we're immediately seated. You must try the entire salsa bar - they're all SO different. Plus, the first bowl of chips is on the House. The service was great too!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tXXhW9ADDXf2e05MX4H5xQ.text: The best in PHX. My favorite place to go to get food and eat a dope ass meal is here. Let me start off by saying that I fudging love salsa and this place has a salsa bar... case closed. You might have to wait like 30-45 mins but it's well worth it in the end. Trust me.

xEu9ZnVleMMm8oBqNj4wZw.text: This has to be one of the best places my wife and I have ate at. I definitely recommend people to check it out . The agua frescas were so taste and the salsa bar had so many options. Definitely check it out if you are a local or just visiting the city.

VbyCRemjJEEIl2tAcsSHRA.text: Perhaps the most exquisite selection of Mexican food I have ever seen. Quality ingredients, prepared quickly, and with great presentation. Server was very amicable. Very pleased that I was fortunate enough to try this place.

1JcU5SX1DeEIWk_MFkWsQg.text: Love this place. Been coming for years and they don't loose the touch. Love the array of salsas everything from traditional pico to strawberry salsa and definitely my favorite is the "jicama" Obviously the food is amazing. Love the shark tacos, the gaucho and the fillet mignon burro being my favorite. For sure you'll have to try their guacamole. It's so tasty and refreshing with diced mango it will surly stimulate your taste buds. All in all my favorite places to go for gourmet Mexican food.

Uu91uTvm2wHtGK515nxChg.text: It worse than what I thought. La agua de horchata is way too much. Trying so hard to change it and add more to the original receipt it just makes it messy. Food wasn't good enough to recommend and the service was the worst. Dennys employees are way friendlier and way more professional. This place looks cool but the parking, service and food is not worth it.

n_dy8i73kAabZcCcbksJ6Q.text: This place is fantastic - amazing tacos and eclectic decor.  We tried one of the quesos and while delicious, found it to have a bit too much pastry to it.  The flavors were all excellent though, and the salsa bar had a number of excellent options.  Next time we're gonna try a burrito.

8RWD7T9mPcjWQFn32jzyrg.text: OMG. This place is killer!  They have a great salsa bar but be careful my friends - don't fill up on the chips. Save room for the gourmet tacos!  For about $15 you can select 3 gourmet tacos + rice and beans. They have authentic tacos and several interesting vegetarian options. The taco plate will fill you up for sure - lots of food (and very yummy).

L5gBeRBG1N0o4kB-RQeV3A.text: Best quesadilla I have ever had and hands down best margarita! Staff was super friendly. Will come back if ever in Phoenix again

lxZibIPihejJ55veHLTglw.text: This is a unique place. Your first impression is "sketchy".  Type of place you would only go in with a recommendation or if you were local. I'm glad we got a recommendation because this was a good eat. I had the burrito norteno with green chilli; very good. Shark and shrimp tacos for the rest of the table and it all looked good with good comments.   This is a small place with only ten tables and a small bar. The service is quick despite obvious take out orders and a full dining room. Salsa is homemade and presented in Tupperware on an ice bar, with a ton of different choices.   Ambiance is interesting, True to its name.   Tip o the hat - coke served in glass bottles   Wage of the finger - find a better presentation for your awesome salsas.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front door

v_LVlPByg1fIh6-cMg_EUA.text: WOW! Visiting in Phoenix so visited Yelp for a restaurant recommendation. La Santisima was the winner and I couldn't be moe pleased with my meal! You MUST try the Shrimp Taco! It is fabulous!! I will definitely be back for more!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Gd1x4dsNsUwoOhba2jOOZA.text: There is the salsa bar with around a dozen house made salsas.  I am truly amazed by this place. It is small so not recommended for big groups.  Maybe a second date if you notice a parking spot open as you are approaching.  Horchata with chopped nuts, fruit, and cinnamon for the win.

AlFFIdx3UBeJRIKyfA0Z3w.text: I was totally blown away with La Santisima.   The salsa bar was top notch. Over a dozen to choose from, each delicious. The pico de gallo was some of the best I've had. A creamy guacamole and a cilantro sauce were highlights as well.   The tacos were phenomenal. Each topped with salsa and garnish that complimented perfectly. Even the beans and rice were incredible. So much flavor in such traditionally simple sides.   The interior is fun and quirky, decorated with luchadors, sugar skulls and other interesting Mexican art.

U73xkoEvM3E1sRNNtnY3Lg.text: A coworker introduced me to this place.I went to their Glendale location. There are a lot of different types of tacos with very different types of fish and meats you just don't find anywhere else. The salsa bar has a wide variety of salsa's with varying amounts of heat. My only con and I took away a star for it was service. It was sooo slow. Even to pay the bill I eventually had to get up and find someone to get the bill. Overall I really like this place and would recommend it.

RACIb3uPGbiQ2o2alWngwQ.text: Try every salsa. Try the Horchata. Try the Black Mole. Try the zucchini slices (I'm forgetting what they're called).  This place is great!

-uyB8GA3fRELdFMlAhQ4PA.text: Ok. This place was great. But I had some issues with my girlfriend here. She's an executive chef and is madly in love with Guy Fieri. When she saw the autographed poster she instinctively tried to climb on the table and smell it. I think she even tried to lick it. After the manager had to threaten to call the cops she settled down and after the shakes and sweats stopped, we were able to enjoy the best damn tacos we have had in a loooong time. The salsa bar kicks ass and we mixed a few together to get even better sauces. I do recommend this place to everyone, but not Guy Fieri. He's a dick and almost ruined our vacation.

5mpa1xxo0MXUHmHkabyygw.text: Great food and service. Huge salsa bar with so many options. Will definitely be back many times!

MbQ81N7ypyEiKAqFEhHL0w.text: This is the greatest Mexican restaurant I've ever been to.  The salsa bar offers more choices than I've ever seen.  The meat was perfect.  Even the rice was filled with flavor--which was a real surprise since I don't remember ever having rice I could actually taste.  And the margarita was much better than anything I can remember.  Outstanding food at reasonable prices  in a non-pretentious atmosphere.  What more could someobody want?  I'll certainly come here again the  next time I'm in the area.

Fr7ysIVXpUXqtLaUYXl7Fw.text: If you are looking for a hidden gem of Phoenix, La Santisima is definitely one of those places!!  The decor and vibe of the place is top notch. Even though it is a bit small, it has a bit feel on the inside. The decor is not over the top and for being a taco shop, has the ability to seem a bit classy.  The biggest thing that would sell anyone on this place is the salsa bar. Every type of salsa you can think of. Some ranging from really hot to super mild. Some specialty salsa as well made form guacamole, cashews, and fruit. You can definitely chow down a few baskets of tortilla chips trying all the different types of salsa.  I ordered the Azteca Tinga Burrito. It came out really quick and was huge. The burrito itself had an amazing flavor on its own, but I added some of their salsas to spice it up a bit and it made it even more amazing. The chicken was cooked very well and was very flavorful. Even the beans and veggies in the burrito had their own flavor to it.  I am looking forward to visiting this place more and more and trying as many different items on their menu as possible. Not to mention all the salsas!!

eEhU8lGvyKjQOefHkcvizQ.text: Absolutely amazing tacos. This place has the best tacos in town. Great value great quality. Very very impressed. Can't wait to go there again.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing

gG28QmAO0K4PqizcjgLXVQ.text: What a lovely spot for a lunch consisting of Mexican fare of quesa, tacos, salsa bar, strong sangria. Superb flavors and I greatly enjoyed the paintings by Manuel Gilavalos y Garcia and Ricardo Ramirez.   I finally had a chance to try horchata garnished with pecans, berries, cinnamon. I couldn't help but think about the tune by Vampire Weekend teehee  Baja Sur Dogfish Shark taco of corn tortilla stuffed with beer battered dogfish shark - nice and soft. Maria Sabina Quesadilla of Oaxaca cheese with sauteed wild mushroom melange - crunchy and cheesy yummy! I'm glad my friend took me here while I was visiting!

Pe4T62Q9eEBu5-gwbroCBA.text: I really enjoyed the food at this restaurant! It was very authentic, delicious, and the menu had an abundance of vegan/vegetarian options. I would eat here if I lived in Phoenix! However the seating is pretty limited for bigger parties and the hostess is not very accommodating.

pRhsP1qWFpvMV_WNMuCO5A.text: Best Mexican restaurant in Phoenix manos down. Be patient with the service since it's soooo small but their food is the best. Their take on a quesadilla is delicious. Their salsa bar keeps my wife and I coming back time and time again. Just be careful not to get too full on chips before the meal comes out.

4OQgH7nwlE-vuSMgOX-A8g.text: The bakery sells traditional Mexican pastries which are excellent. The baked goods in the window are self-serve, to be placed on a tray, while the ones on the counter are not. There are a few tables in the front; I didn't see the back area. They sell a variety of coffee and tea. I suggest the guava pastries and the concha. I'll return to try other sweets.

JHzzR0UzNaGRRBq1Y5aSyw.text: Hmmm ... well it was good, just not great.   I had the shrimp taco and it came super hot but relativity tasteless. My girl Jacquid had the same thing (two shrimp tacos) and the total came to $25... not exactly a bargain in my book.  That said the interior is small but beautiful (lot of art on the walls).

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very cool paintings from the inside

WQT6cnhoDTFYPdJQ6P9FGQ.text: Well I went to GOAZMOTORCYCLES and purchased another bike from these guys. you absolutely cannot go wrong dealing with these Guys and Gals. Best deal in the valley and I would not even waste a day going any were else. Total pros and awesome deals. I think they have a dealer to sell and service any make and model. I purchased a new 2016 Kawasaki Vaquero.(GREAT BIKE) And if you know you want a bike but not quite sure if its the right bike for you thay have lots of experience and WILL LET YOU TEST RIDE.

fWgvWDEc83pIky8e8xsxAw.text: I'd give it zero stars but that's not an option. The food was mediocre and lukewarm. Service was relatively slow. I have no idea how they have 1500 reviews and are graded at four and a half stars out of 5.

FJQw20oeQHzFUdrIaiAXNA.text: I normally do not like Mexican food in restaurants because I am used to having my friend's mom's cooking at home. This place was great, the food is fresh and made when ordered. The salsa bar is also great. Highly recommend it to people who wants Mexican food that tastes great. Thank you guys for the wonderful experience

vOBKkAniwmDkEid5IYfJBw.text: Lunch at the bar on Sunday.  Best Salsa: Chipotle and Tomatillo - the traditional ones are the best. I also liked the cabbage and jicama varieties. Peanut, pecan and others were more like dressing than salsa. Pico was tasty too.  Tacos: Chicken Mole was great, sauce was not spicy, but this taco sticks to your ribs.               Carne Asada - had fatty pieces and chunks. Picked through this one.  Beans/Rice - Did enjoy the beans, free chips and rice wasn't really Mexican, but more white with veggies.   Horchata - Glorious beverage here. First horchata I had to use a spoon for to get all the fruit and nuts out from the murky cinnamon depths.  Price: Two tacos platter for almost $10. wanted crispy shells, but only corn here. Horchata is 4 bucks so price can be $20 for one person almost.

photos.caption: Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crazy horchata
Photo of La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two tacos

UpHZIB7VLaMkQt3tgs_Xyg.text: OMG, we had NO idea this place was so freaking tiny!  Had to wait outside no more than 10-15 minutes on an early Saturday evening (many more people were waiting when we left).  Didn't have anyone at our table for quite some time (he apologized and we noticed they don't have a large staff at all).  HOWEVER...  The food was EXCELLENT!  The house special tacos, my husband's Mayan pork tacos, the rice was flavorful, the MANY salsas at the salsa bar were great, the horchata was bliss, and the bill was pretty darn spot on!  We will return....just during an off time OR via a delivery service!

nBsnn8aSiZATcEPA7Du6sw.text: I went here at about 11:15 today for lunch. There was a line. that had already formed. Its a very small venue, no bathroom, so make sure to wash your hands and do your business before you get there. Only about a dozen or so tables on the floor, and the cashier is also your waitress delivering food to your table. If your expecting great service, forget about it, you focus strictly on the food here. Their is barely any parking. Everyone that seemed to come in was new to this place checking out other patrons food and asking them what it is and how they like it. Im sure they were all fellow yelpers as well considering where this place is and how everyone appeared to be new to this place.  The address is a little confusing with the map being shown on their website. Its off 16th street as the address implies, and the crossroad is Palm and 16th. There is a sign for another business there that says FAT PAD which is easily visible. Blink and you will miss this restaurant. The inside has a lot of cool mexican art. They also have a fresh salsa bar.  Wow this has some very flavorful food. Its not greasy or fatty at all. You can really taste all the ingrediants. I ordered the Dog Fish Tacos, the mahi mahi burrito, and the Carne Asada Taco. Everything was absolutely delish with lots of flavor! I liked the Dog Fish taco best.   Make sure to get there before noon. They do take a while to make it, so be sure you have the time, especially if they are busy. You can call ahead or fax your order in as well.

gxf35O4yBqDdZVLXRvkJwA.text: My husband's choice. He loved it.  I, on the other hand, thought it was just ok. For a taco shop, it's a bit overpriced.  I think our total meal came out $40-$50 and we didn't have any alcoholic beverages.  I've had better in Phoenix for the prices (Barrio Cafe) and would rather visit a real taco shop and eat for $10 than go back.  That being said, the staff is very nice and the food was good.  Their salsa bar is very enticing.

LfoJqlPhSXEN4C5juPKapQ.text: Everything here is delicious...  from the salsa bar to the quesa to the horchata to the street tacos...  I don't think you can go wrong.

nzYy3S7TkkMS-uCCjp8jRw.text: I have never loved tacos. This place changed my mind... The quality and size of their tacos surpasses that of America's (Sorry America's Taco Shop lovers) and it adds a strong local cultural vice that other taco shops lack with its Dia de los Muertos themed paintings. The meat is well-marinated (especially the carne asada) and the dozen-plus salsas are each different by tasty and made to perfection. You can spend ten-to-fifteen minutes just sorting through the salsa bar. I am lucky enough to live nearby and I take advantage of the shark tacos on most days :) I am so glad that it's caught on!
